reviews.review: Very Pretty. The weather was warm. It was lovely walking through the park. We saw the ducks, birds, squirrels and beautiful flowers along this walk.

Beautiful park with something for everyone. So many people head to Buckingham Palace - and this adjacent beautiful park lies almost empty. There are beautiful flower beds, a lake with wildlife, a children's playground, Marlborough Gate, and the Diana Princess of Wales Memorial Walk.
Entrance is free.
There are pay toilets located just off the Mall behind Marlborough Gate.

Squirrels in the park are impertinent, but lovely.. The park is easily accessible and the animals there are very- sometimes even too- friendly. Feeding the squirrels is an unforgettable experience for kids. Take peanuts with you and do not feed other animals with it. Pigeons are less nice:(

Restful and Relaxing. We were planning to go to Kew Gardens on our last day in England. The problem was that we were very tired and I was having back/hip pain. We chose St. James's Park instead. It was so beautiful and hard to believe so much nature is surrounded by such historical places, like Buckingham Palace, St.Paul's Cathedral and Big Ben. We will return again next year for sure!

Serenity amongst the bustle. There's perhaps only so much you can say about a public park but it has pleasant views of and across it's ponds - one view back to Horseguards and it is from here that we used the park as a walkway to Buckingham Palace.With Pelicans and Green Parakeets in residence amongst the longer-term indigenous species it offers interest for children and photographers alike.

Nice green spot in the hart of London-City. We reached the park by walking along the Horse Guards Road and saw a cute little (very well maintained) house: 'The Ducks Keeper House' is as beautiful as a fairy tale cottage. Later on we seat on a bank overlooking the pond, swimming pool for a great variety of water birds and ideal place for a couple love making swans. By continuing our walk we reached 'Buckingham Palace'.

One Of London's Prettiest Parks. We entered the park from The Mall and walked along the lake down to Horseguards Parade. It was a lovely afternoon and even in autumn the floral arrangements were quite splendid. The fountain was working and the entire experience was like being in an oasis in the middle of the city. I think this is a very underated park and one that is often overlooked in favour of others

Peaceful break from site seeing.. Between visiting the usual sites we diverted into the park and spent a couple of hours chilling. It was a fine day and the squirrels and birds were out in force. Many people were passing through and enjoying the park in countless ways. Sitting people watching and taking in the water foul and wildlife is very pleasant and this park was a great place to wind down and recharge for the coming tourist sites. A bit of the country in the middle of the city and to be honest you see more wildlife in an hour that you would on a country walk.
Gorgeous park to sit in during a lunch break or have a 20 min jog around. Lots of lovely spots to sit. The geese and squirrels are friendly. AN interesting smaller London park to wander around.

One of the best parks in London. To me, this is my absolute favourite park in London, if you enjoy amazing sights, gardens, if you enjoy feeding the animals and looking them from afar, that is the park for you, it's big and bright, and clean. Worth a visit.

Loved this park. We took a walk through here on our way to Buckingham palace and I'm glad we did, lots of space if you fancy a picnic or to get away from the hustle and bustle of the busy London streets. Lots of wildlife and the squirrels and ducks are not afraid to come and say hello..
Lovely park. This park is located around the corner from Buckingham palace, you can do some walking in the área or just chilll in the park. Excellent location on a Sunny day.

One of the great features of London. Small enough to feel part of London and big enough to find space. The bridge in the centre offers a fabulous view both ways whatever the weather. If visiting Buckingham Palace, Horseguards Parade, or other parts of Royal London don't miss spending some time in St James Park. Then visit Green and Hyde Park as well.

Great to stroll in the fall. We walked the park in mid-afternoon and found it to be delightful. Was beautiful open spaces and seating along with just wonderful paths. At one end opposite Churchill War Room is a wonderful english garden.
Beautiful Gardens!. Enjoyed our stroll through this beautiful Park. Walked from Buckingham Palace down to the Royal Horse Guards. Highly recommend!
Nice place. A nice quiet park with lots of nice birds, perfect to relax a bit after is busy day in London city. On top of the park is also Buckingham palace which is a nice place to have been.

Relaxing green space full of urban wildlife. What an amazing patch of green right in the middle of central London. Very close to Buckingham Palace. A great place to walk, sit at a bench and read a book. The park is full of birdlife - most of whom are quite tame and beg fro scraps.

Beautiful. Instead of tramping your way along The Mall to visit Buckingham Palace, drift through St James's Park and make your arrival at Buckingham Palace beautiful. You will see the Horseguards, beautiful gardens and lake, plenty of peaceful greenery in the middle of London. Recommended.

Beautiful place . We visited the park in the evening and it looked really nicely at late time. It was full of many birds, flowers and wild animals. It is a great romantic place, in the heart of urban London and I would recommend this place to everybody to visit in any time and any season. It was one of the best impression and warm memories from London.
Lovely!. What a lovely and peaceful park. Tranquil walks with people just lying out in the sun. Did you know there are pelicans in the lake? And the Duck Cottage is so photogenic!

Historical beauty. St. James's Park is near Buckingham Palace, the Horse Guards, has the Victoria Memorial at its center with St. James's Palace also near by. This is a beautiful Park, like all the Parks in and around London. Definately worth the visit and very close to other must see attractions! Always best in Summer. :-)

A relaxing time in nature. During a busy holiday we took some time and visited St James. We had a peaceful time walking along the paths and water's edge just enjoying the surroundings.
Sat on one of many benches and later had some tea and something sweet to eat along the way. We had a very relaxing time.

Beautiful scenic walk . Right in the heart of the city is still James Park which is a very pretty park indeed. Full of cherry blossom trees and lakes, it's almost like being in a different country. You can wonder over the foot bridge and look out across the water and see the palaces either side. There are several ducks and other species of water loving birds including the famous pelicans of london. They are all really close to a certain border of the waters edge so take some bread or a camera and be prepared to get up close and personal

Very relaxing and beautiful park. St James's Park is amazingly relaxing and quiet considering it is in the middle of London. The park is about 23 hectares in area and contains several gardens and plenty of wildlife including squirrels, moor hens, ducks, geese and the famous pelicans. We walked along The Mall and back around the lake to Horse Guards. The park is beautiful and the walk is very easy. At the time of our visit the weather was very hot and there were a large number of families and tourists making the most of it. I have walked in St James's Park many times and never fail enjoy it. I think it a must for those wanting a break from their hectic day.
Relaxing. Beautiful relaxing park. Enjoy seeing all the different birds specially the swans and pelicans. The view from the bridge is amazing.
Beautiful Park. Nice place to go for a long walk or picnic. Lots of wildlife and coffee spots to enjoy along your way.

Free, central, and historic. What's not to like?. It was built originally for hunting, and then there was a menagerie as foreign kings gave animals to British kings and queens. The amazing pelicans and all the very many birds are a reminder of this. You can imagine Charles II walking around chatting to people here (his palace, Whitehall was next door) and you can almost imagine his Dad, Charles I, walking through on his way to get his head chopped off (he had to wear two shirts as he didn't want people to think he was a shivvering coward when he was just shivvering from the cold). There's a great cafe that looks like the Teletubbies, and loos, and fantastic gardens which it's worth stopping and looking at. There's English history all around you (Whitehall, Buckingham Palace, The Mall where state visitors come down the red road, St James's Palace -after which the park was named, Soldiers marching up and down for the changing of the guard.....) and it's all free. Ice creams too. A Princess Diana walk begins here. What's not to like?
Lovely park. Very nice park. Like most English parks, there are gardens, paths, fountains, and ponds. We found ourselves cutting through the park to get from one neighborhood to the next.

Stunning park. We headed to this park to fill some time.It is a stunning park with beautiful views. There is lots o wild life like squirrels, pelicans, swans and moor hens. the flowers and grass were impeccable. But the cafe is expensive and poor quality.

Our favorite park in London. The park is absolutely lovely, with a beautiful, glistening lake overlooking Buckingham Palace. When you get to the bridge and face the opposite direction, you get a beautiful view of the London Eye peaking out from the lush vegetation and buildings lining the park. A must see!
Lovely place. A lovely park very pleasant. Very peaceful too we had a nice leasurely walk through looking at all the wildlife near the lake.
beautiful place to visit. Went there at Christmas time-it was very good weather in December 2015. A must see tourist spot! Great walking, nice and relaxing for families.

Lovely... for a nice romantic walk. We stayed at St. Ermins so we were very close to this park. We wandered into it not knowing what it was but was absolutely pleasantly surprised. It's a beautiful quiant little park that's perfect for a sunny day stroll.
For a nice walk. A beautiful park to stroll around in the centre of London. There's a bridge in the middle of it where Buckingham Palace can be pictured.

D of E Gold award day. Brilliant day out while my son and wife went in to St James palace, i walked around the park and the palace talking in the views watching all the tourist while eating my ice cream. It's all within walking distance from Victoria station but remember to wear walking shows.

Great place for a morning run. What a fantastic setting if you're in the area for a bit of running. Lots of paths, great scenery but watch you don't run over the squirrels or water fowl
Easy access to Green Park and Hyde Park so you can tailor your rub distance to suit

On a beautiful day, this park is a gem to walk through. Don't miss all the ducks, geese, swans and many other animals... I love walking along this park on a nice day. It is so different from Kensington and Hyde. It has a totally different charm with the lake in the middle and all the animals... this would be my favorite park to see if I had limited time in London.
Park walk. Nice walk from Buckingham Palace to Westminster. A few good Pokemon characters were cought and a bit of green energy after a long day of shopping.
Excellent for a Picnic. Located very close to the Buckingham Palace and the Westminster Area, this is an excellent location to have a picnic with your loved ones.

Best park in London. Parks in London are almost all really nice, free and enjoyable, but this one is special to me. It has a pond, a fountain and a lot of animals, like ducks and squirrels. Nice for solo travelers, pairs, friends and familys.

a beautiful park to go. a nice and beautiful park to go and enjoy on a lovely day
the location is close to churchill war museum and the buckingham palace
if you are in that vicinity go otherwise no need to take an extra trip there
go to Regent park which is bigger and better
Lovely park with great playground. Squirrels, geese, ducks and several other birds to see. Nice flowers and trees, beautiful playground and space enough to enjoy a sunny day in the city

Great Wildlife!. This park is right by my work, so I frequent in when eating lunch on sunny days. The amount of different birds at the park is spectacular, in particular the pelicans which are always fun to watch. They have a great restaurant/cafe (Inn the Park) which is often bustling. There are also great views from the lake to the palace, so definitely worth swinging by if you're heading to Buckingham palace for the day.

The Best Park in Central. This is the best park to walk through in my opinion in London. You have Buckingham on one side, you have the horse guard on the other. The water features are great to sit next to and look at the beautiful birds. If you are looking to go through Hyde Park, Green Park, or St James, try St James as it is the most beautiful of the three. It is also easy to walk through if you are doing a loop to see the sites.

An Island of peace in a city of hustle bustle. Right in the middle of the city's hustle bustle you find this quiet island of peace to sit and soak in the nature. Good for a day picnic with your loved one's

Lots of squirrels :). The most squirrels I ever saw in one place :)Lots of other water birds.The lawns and other plants perfectly groomed.Relaxed atmosphere and not at all loud, considering the location.

Nice strolling and duck watching. We visited on the day that no traffic was allowed on the road. This made for an awesome walk in the park. Families, babies, joggers, bikers, tourists...we were all there to enjoy the view.

Beautiful and relaxing. I had several hours to kill after checking into my hotel mid-September, so caught the Tube down to this part of town. It was the day that tied a 105 year old record for heat in September, was 93F. The park was packed with people enjoying the day, watching the ducks and other birds, kids playing, young folks stepping out for their lunch, etc. Very relaxing to let the jet lag overtake me while sitting on a park bench in the shade!

A must see!. This is where I proposed to my fiancé. Absolutely beautiful park even in the winter! A must see when in London. It's right on the way to Buckingham Palace as well so it's a good start to the day. We went in the morning and the way the sun was coming through the trees was magical. Certainly a place I'll never forget!
Summer Day. Great for a stroll in the park, not full of tourists. much more relaxed than other parks. get a blanket or something with you, as they charge you for using the chairs.

Beautiful park. Gorgeous grounds, love the swans and ducks.
An oasis for the Londoners and the tourists as well.
We wish we had more time to spend walkin through it.

Nice lunch spot. Had a nice time walking through the park (even though we were dead tired from walking all day) and finding a cafe to have some much needed lunch. Worth taking a stroll through if you are in London for a few days.
Beautiful gardens. Absolutely beautiful. So many flowers and wide trails. Has great convenient kiosks for treats & coffee/tea. Bathrooms seem to be in reasonably accessible distances apart.

Great views. We had a great time getting lost in this park. We have found some very interesting places and loves stumbling onto hidden treasures. Lots of wildlife and a great place to spend a warm afternoon.

Beautiful green space. Beautiful green space in the middle of London historically known for being location of the city's Leper hospital also names St James. Buckingham Palace is on the western edge and the park is the most easterly of a near-continuous chain of parks that comprises (moving westward) Green Park, Hyde Park, and Kensington Gardens. Great Sunday afternoon strolling. The closest London Underground stations are St James's Park, Green Park, Victoria, and Westminster.
Sunny Morning. St. James´s Park is a quiet and peaceful place close to Buckingham Palace. Beautiful lawns, flowers, birds and squirrels.There are also numerous cafés to enjoy the moment.

Autumn day. Lovely sunny autumnal day in London on Friday 30th Sept and where better to spend part of it than walking around St James' Park. Escape the hustle & bustle of the city, take in all the wildlife; ducks, geese and swans, and the squirrels, of which there are lots at the moment that WILL climb onto you even when you're not prepared! Beautiful well kept park, lots of places to sit & a mix of places to get food; thoroughly recommend particularly if the sun's out :)

Where Else?. Where else could you watch them feeding pelicans in the centre of London? And for free! This is London's oldest and possibly most beautiful Royal park. Gorgeous to wander through on a sunny autumn day and still teeming with wildlife. It's difficult to conceive that you're so close to the centre of the capital.It's almost 500 years since Henry the Eighth acquired the land to create a deer park. Improved by successive monarchs, it's existed in its current form for close on 200 years having been extensively remodelled by the famed landscape architect John Nash.Whether it's a romantic stroll or somewhere to entertain the kids, this is worth at least an hour of anyone's time.
Excellent for a romantic stroll. A tranquil space within the busy city of London for a romantic stroll of time out with the children.
Very relaxing. Not too crowded and many and varied water fowl. Plenty of benches to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. Several cafes/ice cream vendors for the children.

Lovely to wander through. It's always a surprise to find just how much peace and quiet can be found in a city like London. Squirrels running about, clean and tidy & the water, marvelous. If I lived in London I'm sure I would visit every week or more. It is also one of the places that proves that a visit to the capital doesn't have to be expensive.

Great Park, for an anytime stroll. Lots of birds, pigeons, and squirrels, an oasis in the midst of a busy city center. I love this time of the year, when the leaves started to falling, its quiet, not crowded, and good place to bring a book.

Peace in the heart of it all. This park is so tranquil. I love all of the weeping willow trees and pond wildlife. It's a great place for pictures. Depending on where you stand in the park, you can capture multiple landmarks in the background. Don't go to Buckingham Palace without enjoying a stroll through this beautiful park.
Beautiful . Such a beautiful location in the middle of a busy city. It's charming and beautiful all at the same time. Squirrels eat out of your hands amazing.

Nice, but Historical more than Anything. Walked through the park a couple of times while going from several of London's attractions. It is nice, nothing to rave about but maybe since the busy city surrounds it it is probably a good respite for locals during busy days.
Beautiful wild birds. This is nice to walk around on a sunny day and maybe even a wet or cold one. The lake had lots of beautiful wild birds with many photo opportunities.
Beautiful London park. The park is located between Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar square. It's a great place to walk through, with many ducks, swans and squirrels.

Beautiful park, lots of ducks and squirells around. This is a really great place to have a picnic, or eat lunch, or let your little one run around. It's a great place to take pictures. There is a beautiful pond with a fountain, it is quite lovely.

Surprising diversity . Loved the variety of ducks, geese and birds at St James. The information panels quickly help identify the wildlife and the planting is surprisingly lush and varied - Gladiolas, platanillo, cycas, alocacia then succulents and lavender. A rich palette to enjoy and kiosks for coffee and ice cream seal the deal. A fine park. Sun chairs available for rent.
Lovely London Park. A lovely park with a band and bandstand on a Sunday. A glorious view of Buckingham Palace from the bridge.A restuarant for snacks and beverages.

Lovely scenic park. Lovely park- lots of wild birds on the water and squirrels which are very tame. Also wild parrakeets flying around which is good to see and hear. Refreshments are expensive (but it is in central London). Good place to have a picnic and rest your weary feet.

An oasis of peace tucked away in the heart of London. We discovered St. James's Park quite by accident, but what a happy discovery it was! If birds and butterflies could design a perfect setting, this would be it. We saw many varieties of birds (several were unfamiliar to us), in optimum habitats. There was even a large, flat boulder in the lake, which several grebes found to be an excellent spot for flapping (drying?) their wings. The park was enjoyed by young people, families, and retired folks; strolling, reading, or laying in the sun. It was an absolute delight of a place!

Incredible, intimate park in Central London. Beautiful park nestled in between Downing Street and Buckingham Palace with incredible nature to help you forget the hustle and bustle of LondonEven though Hyde and Green Parks are also in Central London, St James' Park is by far my most favourite due to its tranquility, seclusion from busy main thoroughfares, incredible views from the London Eye to Victoria Memorial, and verdant nature along the banks of the lake. Although there is a great variety of wildlife which lives in the park, I really don't like it when people feed the animals. They're not meant to be eating things like bread, popcorn or whatever other garbage people keep offering them. If you can refrain, please don't feed the animals.Otherwise, grab a meal at the Inn in the Park, or bring a sandwich to have a picnic on the grass. Take note: if you sit in one of those stripey chairs, someone might come by and ask you to pay up!
Pigeons and squirrels in the park. Just stunning views of Buckingham Palace and the London Eye this is a perfect place for a little R&R when taking a break from the Tourist Trail

Beautiful oasis in heart of city . Loved this park! It's very busy but still peaceful even though it's so close to all the main attractions. Birds, ducks, swans and squirrels everywhere. A few place to stop and have some ice cream. Definitely walk through while visiting the area.

Great walk to Buckingham Palace. It is a great walk from Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, Churchils War Rooms then onto Horse Guards parade all in close proximity then have a stroll through St. James Park looking at the water fowls and squirrels on your way to Buckingham Palace on arrival you will find this magnificent building and surrounding gardens a great walk on a fine day.

Relax and beautiful. St. James's Park is the park that near the Buckingham Palace. My hubby and I travel here via the underground, we were on the way to check out the Buckingham Palace, but since St. James's Park is on the way, we decided to make a small detour and have ourselves some nice walk in this beautiful park. The funny thing is most of the time, I just some small peek from the movie, I got the change to know this park better was from the game Assassin's Creed Syndicate. Which the location of the game happened to be in London. Although the timeline was in the past, but it is almost precise. It was quite a interesting experience for me to see many locations after the game. The park was so different with what I see in the game. Of course, there got some new coffee around, and buildings as well. There's a small bridge in the park that cross the lake, in the middle of that people could have a small peek of the Buckingham Palace.

Best park in London. This park doesn't tend to be as busy as Hyde Park or Regent's park because it is smaller but it's definitely worth a visit. I'd recommend walking from the Buckingham palace end of the park to the other side and then walking up by the riverside. There's a nice lake in the centre with loads of local wildlife to watch too.

My Favourite London Park. I make a point to visit this park on all my trips to London. It has great photo opportunities, the bird life, Spring flowers and scenic views of Buckingham Palace and the London Eye. There is a good café overlooking the lake that serves good food, even beer!

Plenty of space.. Walking in the sunshine with people sitting on the grass was most relaxing. There is plenty of space so you should never feel crowded. Ice creams and drinks were available from vendors spread throughout the park.
Wonderful Walk. Just a stroll thru here is awesome watching the ducks, swans and nature in all its glory. Makes you feel you are out in the country!

Beautiful location to stop and rest. Situated next to St James palace. You will see the mounted guards heading to the palace in readiness for the changing of the guards. Great spot to sit, plenty of local fauna.

Perfect for couple hours & nice picnic. Fell across this by accident & had lovely hour or so having picnic. Watch out for the cheeky pigeons & eagle eyed geese if you sit on grass though as they have eyes in the back of their heads when you rustle a picnic wrapper lol! Nice leisurely stroll from Buckingham Palace to Household Cavalry museum, lots of unusual ducks & geese, even pelicans which is strange to see in middle of London. If you have kids there's plenty for them too & snack kiosk near toilets very reasonably priced for London. Recommended free entertainment for all.
Lovely park!. This is a beautiful park with lots of interesting wildlife, including lovely swans in the pond! It's very peaceful and a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Nice place. Nice place for rest. In park is toilet for 0,20pound and fast food. James´s Park is near Buckingham palace and trafalgar sqare and westminster . In James's Park are squirrels that are fed with nuts.

Beautiful Park!. St James's Park is next to Buckingham Palace and opposite Green Park. What I love most about this park is that it is so big, once you are in the middle, you can almost believe that you are not in a huge city environment. A beautiful lake, fairly tame squirrels, a variety of geese, swans, herons and beautiful plants make this place a nature lover's paradise. There are grassy areas for picnics and plenty of benches for those who wish to just relax. A bridge and water fountain are also lovely features. A favourite feature of mine is a tree which has become so warped over the years, it is practical spiral shaped! A cafe is also available along with ice cream and drink carts for those who wish to purchase food or drinks. One of my favourite places in London.

Beautiful park in the city. A really lovey park, flowers, plants, wildlife and even squirrels that pose for photographs. Near the Guards barracks you can often see them practising and catch the Royal coach passing by. I pass through on way to work, a pleasure no matter the weather.
Weekend Pokemon hunting. Lovely scenery and walk through the park. Even caught a rare pokemon. Not as big as hyde park but still nice to go and see.
Great park - Also good for Pokemon Go. I don't play the Pokemon Go, but my wife and son do. They could stay there all day. It really helps that it is such a pretty park.
Morning walk. There are many parks in london... This one not the biggest but beautiful park... Small lake... Lovely place for morning walk... Snacks available
Perfection. A relief from the busy city. We went to this park several times while in London. Loved the wildlife, the beauty, and the people. Excellent place for photography.
Beautiful. Great walk in the park, so much wildlife right in the center of London. A must see in London! Loved it

Best park in London. This is by far, for me the best park in London. Its in the most beautiful area of london and a stone throw away from major attractions. If you have the walking legs, from St James's Park past Buckingham Palace through Green Park to Hyde park (Highly recommended too) Takes about 20 minutes.

Tranquil and close to many attractions. We strolled through the park on a couple of occasions when we were by attractions which border it. We enjoyed the opportunity for quiet in the middle of busy crowds and the chance to see local families enjoying this very nice park.
Night walk. A rather beautiful place for a very safe night walk before bed. Plenty of benches and we'll lit. The Swansea are delightful to see.

A Regular Dog Walker. The most beautiful park in the City. For meeting all fellow dog walkers, it's a must. It is an oasis and carefully tended and loved by the most dedicated Royal Park Staff. The best time to go is around 7.30 a.m., especiallyy in Autumn when there is a mist over the lake and the park is empty. (Apart from the dog walkers).Walk by the lake, amaze at the pelicans and take it all in, then head over to Inn The Park when it opens for a good cup of coffee.

Lovely Park to Picnic In. My Mum and I decided to have lunch in St. James's Park while exploring the city. The landscaping is lovely and the amount of wildlife makes for some great photos. I will say though that the park could either use increased signage or stronger penalties for feeding the birds as plenty of tourists didn't follow these rules which caused some noisy fighting between the animals. Overall though our picnic was very nice.

Must see park in London. I visited twice cos we loved it so much. The park is massive and filled with lovely greenery and flowers. The cute squirrels add to the wonder of this place. Coupled with the cool air and clear skies we had, it made it a wonderful place for a walk. There are many locals on a Sunday and Monday.

Lovely Park. What a lovely serene park to visit! It is well maintained and flowers always look well tended. They have an appropriate numbers of stalls serving drinks and snacks. They also have a well maintained toilet facility on one end.

Very pleasant on a sunny day!. I enjoyed more than hour in St James's Park walking through it to Buckingham Palace and, later, taking a rest to eat lunch on the grass. I'd just visited the Churchill War Rooms, which are just across the street from this park. There's plenty of bird life to see, as well as lots of lovely trees and flowers. The signage to surrounding locations is clear. Some more seats would be an improvement.

So Beautiful!. I will forever appreciate how people will post up in parks in London to have a picnic and enjoy the sunshine. This park is absolutely beautiful and has some of the most stunning grounds. I really enjoyed my walk through it even though it was boiling and it made me wish I had a picnic blanket and a basket of nibbles so I could sit around and join the people who were already doing those things.

Beautiful Park. Just a very nice park to walk through after you've been to Buckingham Palace or are coming back from Westminster Pier. Get a ice cream cone and enjoy all the wonderful trees and people watch- very relaxing place.

Sight for sore eyes. Spent my Birthday just walking around in St James park, people watching and the flowers were at their best. the views up the pond to the palace were nostalgic. Had a picnic on the well manicured lawns and shared my fare with the resident squirrels LOVELY day to remember
Full of colour. We enjoyed our stroll through the park, amazing amount of colour in the borders for the time of year. Good signage and enjoyed seeing the number & variety of birds on the water.

One of the most beautiful parks in London. Everyone who visits London visits Buckingham Palace anyway. That is the chance to enjoy St. James Parks for sitting down, having a tea or coffee or a snack and just enjoy this beautiful Oasis of nature. The little lakes, plants, trees and the animals are just amazing. Very good for picture hunters to get an unforgettable shot.
Gorgeous park. Lovely to walk through. Paths are well laid and firm. Deck chairs available to rent (if someone ever turns up to take your money).

A Nice Park. While I prefer Kensington Gardens and Regent's Park, this park also has a lot to offer. It is in a handy location right next to Buckingham Palace, and worth a walk through for anyone visiting.

Green oark in a big city. We stopped here many times while walking around London it's very central to all the attractions, Westminster, Buckingham palace, Trafalgar square, big ben, and a beautiful bit of greenery to take a picnic in. The amount of wildlife in the park is amazing considering your in a capital city. There's squirrels, green parrots, swans, herons, pelicans. The animals are so used to humans they actually come up to you and if offered gently take the food out of your hand it's quite a site.
Summer beauty. Adjacent Buckingham Palace St. James's Park is gorgeous in the summer and an ideal spot for a picnic. Plenty of bird life and the odd squirrel too.
Lovely park. Must to see. Very close to Buckingham Palace. In Spring and Summer time full of colors from the flowers. Free entry. Take with you...u can feed squirrels, they are everywhere.
not a must see. although a welcome relief from the London hustle the gardens themselves are really not worth a special visit.good for a while to rest and see the rest of the Westminster sights.

St James park. A haven in busy London.
Whether as a walk through or specific visit st James' park restores well being.
Bird life great. Efficient bin emptying. Shade on hot days.
Beautiful day in London. Landscaping, maintenance and weather combined to give the wife and I a gorgeous day. It was crowded but we sort of expected it.
One of My Favorites. Still one of my favorite parks to visit; beautifully maintained and views of Buckingham Palace and Victoria Monument breathtaking from the park.
Pleasant and Relaxing. Very pleasant and popular park close to Buckingham palace. Check out the quaint 1841 bird-keepers cottage.

Green oasis in the middle of it all. If you get the chance to visit St. Jame's Park, it is a walking tour must. Includes a lake, two small islands, wild birds; including Pelicans which were a result of a donation in 1664, open green spaces, folding chairs ( to rent ), toilets, and Cafe.

What a nice surprise!. I was genuinely surprised by this large park right in the middle of London. It was clean, beautiful, and full of birds. We were there around Easter and beautiful daffodils were everywhere. It was quite chilly and there was a nice little sandwich shop in the park where you could get a snack, warm up a little, and use the restroom. If you want to see the Changing of the Guard, be sure and walk through St. James Park as well while you're there.
My Favorite Park. St. James's Park is hands down my favorite London park. I loved to stroll through it during the early evening. So lovely.
Lovely. Saw this as part of a full day tour, just quickly, but it was lovely. Wish we could have spent more time here.

A place to rest after a lot of walking through London. Sat overlooking Horse Guard Parade lovely location `near to Trafalgar Square can hire deck chairs if you want great place to watch the world go round

Portulant birds. What a wonderful, pristine park! The birds were many breeds all looking very well fed. Walkways travelled in and out and there were people sitting around enjoying the anbiance of the morning, and the sun! Three swans did an almost ballet like pose which I am sure was not rehearsed. I would recommend this to anyone as the area is very flat and easy walking.

It's not Regent's but it is great. Lovely park - and for a bonus this summer, there were three Red-breasted Geese in the park - a rare vagrant to these lands. Lots of shady chill out spots, walking distance from some of the most-visited and well-renowned spots in London - and less full on busy than Hyde Park. Still not as good as my local Regent's Park though...

Super pretty, great place to take a break. This park is very pretty with lots of benches and grass space to rest and relax. We stopped here after exploring London for a picnic lunch. The ponds with the birds are also very pretty. It was nice to just sit and watch all the different kinds of birds do their thing. We also walked through here to get to Buckingham Palace.
Nice for rest. After a long walk through London it´s nice to see some green places righ in the centre. Lovely fontain, water with ducks and some fresh air.

Lovely to walk to and from Buckinham Palace!. Lovely to walk to and from Buckinham Palace!The park is very busy and has lots to see. There are ducks and squirrels everywhere and the plants and flowers are gorgeous. Definitely worth a walk around!
Lovely walk. Deck chairs at the ready and relax in the park. Lovely on a summer day and ice cream sold in the little hut

Romantic picnic by the lake. It was just bread, Italian meats and cheeses, but the ambience made it feel like much more. Watching the waterfowl along with other birds alongside the lake made for one of the most romantic moments in our visit to London. Truly peaceful.

A peace detour form Piccadilly and Trafalgar Square. To view the lake and bird species is always an unwinding tool. Interesting vistas of Buckingham Palace and the grand buildings of the Mall and Horse Guards set the scene. A charming park, well landscaped and always reasonably busy.Be advised to eat sandwiches carefully; the pigeons are relentless.

An oasis in the heat. On a scorching September day this was an escape to cooler climes to wander under the trees - visit the lakes etc after wandering around the front of Buckingham Palace, having earlier toured the Palace and later the grounds.

Beautiful. Such a beautiful park and well kept for locals and visitors; you can walk around or through the part to various spots of interest from Churchill Museum to Parliament. Book on line before you arrive and book early...massive crowds!
Sunday stroll. This park is so nice to wander through on you way to Buckingham and a must for any traveller. Loved it so a must in London for anyone.
Beautiful park. St Jame's is a great park to go to as a family or with a partner for a day out,it has a lovely lake,food and drink stands,toilets and a playground for children.

Too crowded to enjoy. The grounds are beautiful and would probably be a nice place to stroll or relax on a sunny day, but we were there in high season (August) and it was just too much of a madhouse to enjoy.

City park you want to go back to.. During our short stay in London there were some places we wanted to revisit. St James Park is one of them. We came here to have lunch in park's restaurant Inn in the Park. We enjoyed our stroll along St James's Park Lake. This park is the best for a short rest and a dose of people watching.

A short walk in the September drizzle. We cut through the Park from the CWR heading up to Soho.
This park never ceases to impress me. Well stocked and super tidy. I could wander throigh it for hours.

Relax Strolling through the Gardens. This is a great park close to the downtown area. There are gorgeous gardens and nice walkways. We strolled through the park on our way to Buckingham Palace from the Westminster part of London. Walking through the park is a great way to relax in what is usually a hectic travel schedule. They also have public restrooms.
Lovely! Like Central Park - just smaller!. What a wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of London! We wondered through the park and enjoyed the calm and quiet green space.

On the Way to the Palace. Came through this park on the way to see the changing of the guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace. Nice enough place and worth a look when headed in that direction. There is a nice lake and many folks will go in and out before or after the guard ceremony.
Tourism. If ur heading to Buckingham palace u will indeed pass through this park! Great place! Astonishing view

Amazing. I walk through St James Park on my way to work. Beautifully maintained, gorgeous plants and flowers along with the water birds, song birds and Squirrels!
A real oasis in central London away from the hussle and bussel. You are so close to Buckingham palace but you can also just enjoy a rest, a coffee and and icecream too.

Great spot for a picnic. We were in London to see a show but had plenty of time to spare before hand so we stopped for a picnic in the park. It's lovely on the grass under the trees with beautiful views of the lake and lots of friendly wildlife to watch. Walking over the bridge also gives some lovely views of London.
Beautiful. A lovely park full of birds and other wildlife. It was very relaxing to walk through and see the lake and the flowers.
Just a beautiful place. We drove around it during a double decker bus tour and then we walked through when we were taking pictures...what a beautiful place. Loved it!
Beautiful . Had the pleasure of a an impromptu picnic on the warmest day of this year. It's relaxing to sit here and chat with friends.
Beautiful on a summer day. What a treasure this park is. On a scorching hot day it was so nice to find a piece of shade and relax. Everything was very clean and the gardens were lovely.

Enjoyable stroll. Enjoyable stroll through on way from Buckingham Palace to Parliament Square. One of my favourite parks in London. Much more pleasant than walking along pavements! Good for Pokemon Go too according to the friend that was with me.

Strolled through this park en route to Churchill's War rooms. Walked to Churchill's War rooms via St James Park and on the way back we stopped for tea and cake in the café which is run by Peyton and Byrne. A well used but peaceful park which is great for people watching

Beautiful Park. This park is enormous. The Princess Diana memorial walkway runs through here, that was a very unique experience. The views are beautiful. It provides a beautiful backdrop for pictures.

Just great. Beside the fact that it's sitting right next to Buckingham Palace, it's just a very beautiful park - the trees, the lake, the flower beds, the fresh air :) and the squirrels DO come up to you if you offer them something worthwhile. Coming from a place where it's dry and deprived of foliage and squirrels, I quite enjoyed my walk there.
Pleasant park . Small pleasant park Not many seats Plenty of rubbish bins and refreshment carts. Nice try walk through

a relaxing afternoon. wonderful park good views the white pelicans were amazing the ducks charming. The walk through the park to horse guards parade is worth it and if the time is right you will the changing off the gard at horse guards

Just a lovely stroll. On our way to anywhere in central London, we make it a point to stroll through this massive park. They provide chairs to lounge in for one pound fifty and quite respite from the hustle and noise of the city.
Good morning. My friends and I stayed in a hotel nearby, we took a walk before we had our breakfast....the experience is so refreshing

Great bike ride!. I took my relatives from New York on a bike ride in and around the park and I was really impressed by the scenery and the accessibility for cyclists! Great place to visit and have a walk/cycle around when the weather is nice.

Peaceful park. I really like St James's Park. It's interesting to see all the different birds around. And especially entertaining to see people feed the squirrels from their hands. Be sure to check out the cottage on the east side of the park - just picturesque!

A lovely walk in the park. Walk through St James Park from the Horse Guards Parade down to Buckingham palace. You can almost imagine the lords hunting stag in the day. Huge London Plane trees along the walkways and a beautiful pond area. Close to St James UG station.

Breakfast in the park. Thus was amazing! We had American pancakes with blueberries and also maple syrup. The coffee was strong and tasty. The fresh fruit platter was delicious. The service was very friendly. It's a great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Lovely. It is free to sit in this lovely part of London and watch people walking by, soldiers marching and listen to bands playing. See if you can see the Queen - see if the flag is at full mast! No worries if you fancy a beer -bring some with you cos you can! Lovely part of the World.
Huge park. Great for a family picnic. You can easily see the change of guards at the wellington barracks. Small childrens play area too.
An oasis in the middle of this busy city. This park offers some rest bite from the noise of this busy city, plenty to see, seats for the weary walker, but near enough for some excellent sight seeing.

Love walking here. I lived next to the park, and walked around here a lot. The bridge with views over buckingham palace and the army castle are really stunning. Only problem is tons of tourists in summer.
Lovely. Take a stroll or pack a light meal and take advantage of the beautiful green space. No lack of nature or friendly squirrels. We took our tea and sat on a park bench.

Lovely park. We walked through St James Park whilst visiting London. Like all the other parks in London it is full of greenery . A lovely place especially on a dry day to sit on a bench or on the grass and watch the world go by.
Beautiful place to spend an afternoon.. Relaxing and beautiful place to while away a few hours. Great place for a picnic. There is a lovely pond with ducks and other birds.

Beautiful Landscape!. Such beautiful landscape, be sure not to miss it. We were there in August and lucked out, weather-wise. We really enjoyed walking the path to watch the changing of the guards while admiring the beautiful landscape.

My favorite park. Just a lovely stroll to be done anytime in spring summer or fall. In the summertime you can lounge on a beach chair, or simply lay on the grass. Thankfully there are not an excess of pigeons in recent years but the geese, duck and swans are lovely. A great walk from Horse Guard Palace to Buckingham.
Pretty Park in the heart of London. It's always worth walking through the Park to visit Westminster/Whitehall from Buckinham Palace. Very nice and exceptionally well looked after! A must!

Excellent place for a stroll. Nice and pleasant park for a stroll and a sitout
Love the lake aside. Walk through this park from Buckingham Palace to reach the Big Ben and London eye
Beautiful park. Shortage of toilets - only two (as far as I found). And be careful if you feed the squirrels because they bite.
heart of tourist. Come here to relax, it's close to the town center. Lovely park in in London to spend time with family and friends.

A beautiful park in the centre of London and free with somewhere to eat. Next to Buckingham Palace a lovely park to walk in and take a picnic. With toilets and a cafe it has all you need and you can feed the birds on the lake as well.

Always a lovely park to walk through. Make this part of your walk through to the Mall and Buckingham Palace and then onto Green Park up to Hyde Park corner and Hyde Park. A beautiful summer walk, especially on a weekend when the Mall is shut to traffic.
St. James Park. A very nice park in back of the Churchill War Room. It is a beautiful green area in the middle of London
Charming corner. A very pleasant place to walk or chill after a visit of Buckingham Palace. Lovely wildlife anywhere - squirrels, geese, swans and so many more. Quite amusing to watch and follow.
Lovely park. Lovely park in the heart of tourist London with many other places to visit nearby, great base for a picnic with friends.

As good as any other park. Sure, green areas are always nice. But St James's Park is no attraction that you HAVE to visit, when you are in London. Come here to relax, it's close to the town center... but that's it. If you are closer to another park.. go there.

ST.James Park. Beautiful park not far from Buckingham Palace. Certainly worth a stroll with your wife/hubby/girlfriend etc. Take a sandwich or two and feed the squirrels. Surprising who you'll meet on a lovely sunny day!!!!!!

Beautiful. We visited on a sunny day and enjoyed the park a lot.The park was beautifully green with first touches of autumn colors.The squirrels and a variety of birds were fun to watch.The view from the bridge is magical.There are few spots at which you can enjoy some ice cream and other snacks.The restrooms (50 pence) are very clean and easy to find.Perfect spot to enjoy some nature while still being minutes away from Westminster area.

Escape the hustle and bustle. St James's Park is one of the smaller London parks, but definitely one of the prettiest. The bridge over the large lake in the centre provides wonderful views of Buckingham Palace in one direction and the London Eye in the other. It is known for it's wildlife and there were certainly plenty of birds and very tame grey squirrels when we were there.It's great to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a while
Excellent. You can stroll around for hours and look at the wild life, lovely place and you get away from the traffic.
day out sunny. quality time, relaxing and we were lucky to have sunny weather...place recommended by the hotel concierge to relax on a sunday afternoon! i do not regret it

A bit of peace and quite. Visited on a lovely sunny Sunday in September. Plenty of free benches although deckchairs were also available for hire (approx £1 hr). No traffic on the Mall (Sunday) so it was quiet with good pedestrian and cycle access. Large lake area with plenty of visible wildlife - pelicans, geese, large koi carp and ducks. Several small outlets offering foodstuff - drinks/hot dogs etc.

Lovely. I enjoyed the short walk in this park during a grey November day. There were lots of squirrels which you could feed, they jumped at you if you came closer! if the weather was nice id stay there for a longer time...for kids its also a beautiful place to explore.
Park Life. One of the most enjoyable free things to do in London. One of my favourite parks - great for people watching
Best Park in London. Between the views and the location- this is the best park in London (though can be crowded at times).

Beautiful!. One of my favourite places in London. Beautiful park and amazing is that all birds and squirrels are so friendly and they are not scared of people at all. Must visit everytime im in capital, just to feed those little squirrels!

A little piece of heaven in the middle of a city. A short walk from the bustle of Oxford Street and you are in a little piece of heaven . Perfectly manicured gardens, sparkling waters and an abundance of wildlife including the famous Pelicans

Great walk on summers day. A beautiful Park in the middle of the big city. Plenty of ducks squirrels Swan and Kingfishers to see. The gardens are kept to a high standard and leads the way to Buckingham Palace.

A really nice park.... If the weather is nice then this is a really nice and quiet (noisewise) park to walk through despite a lot of people being there.There are plenty of birds around the water and if you are lucky you will see and hear parrots which are now living successfully in the wild.

Take a relaxing stroll through this lovely park. This is a lovely park with lots of birds and wild life. Great place to get some exercise or just sit and read a book. After lots of sight-seeing throughout the city I needed a refreshing break to just kick back and relax. This was the perfect place to spend a relaxing afternoon.

A wonderful but crowded royal park. This is probably the best kept park in central London plus you have views of Buckingham Palace especially from the bridge. You can also see Pelicans at the East end if you are lucky. The cafe is good but pricey.

Beautiful park in the city center. If you are walking by Picadilly Circus or the Big Ben area you should visit St. James's Park. It's a charming place. The gardens look amazing, and you will have the chance to see some animals.
My favourite London Park. Combine a trip to see the palace with a relaxing stroll or lunch in this beautiful park. It's like an oasis in central London.
Nice for sunny days. Great in summer, couple of drinks, take some food and get an ice cream. Relaxing atmosphere, right next to Buckingham palace which is also nice to go see.
Prettiest London Park. Prettiest Central London park .make sure you enjoy a walk here when you visit London ,good in all seasons .

Beautiful and relaxing. I try to walk through this wonderful park whenever I can during my stay in London. It is a perfect place for relaxing and enjoying the peaceful atmosphere while walking among its many plants and admiring some great sights along the way.

Beautiful stroll in the park en route to Buckingham Palace. A very nice stroll as an alternative to Birdcage Walk. The water fowl are beautiful and the squirrels are quite eager to eat from your hands
Beautiful park in the heart of London. Lovely grounds, fountains, and places to just sit and enjoy the outdoors. It's a great place for a picnic.
A lovely stroll. Go to this park especially in summer and enjoy a pick nick here. Lovely to walk around in and very easy to reach

Pleasant ewalk or for picnics. I visited this park more than once as so close to other attractions. It's a pleasant stroll and plenty of shade under the trees. Of course the nearby attractions such as Buckingham palace or a good place to see start of changing of guards etc is a bonus

Lovely Park!. One of my favourite spots in London. I always comes here during my months of stay in London. The park is so lovely to visit. A lot of people hang out here. This is the nearest park near in Buckingham Palace. A must visit park in London.
if you on a short visit, don't bother. ok , nothing great to see except for a few ducks and a lake; also very crowded, may be beceause it was a saturday

A real oasis. Last time I was in London myself and then girlfriend walked down the mall to see Buckingham Palace and totally missed this real oasis. As well as some fantastic wildlife and beautiful parkland hithere is plenty of refreshment stops and more importantly for those with children good toilet facilities. Next time we visit the capital will definitely revisit and have a picnic there.

Beautiful park . The design of the park is well layout with some lovely plants and flowers . Clean and tidy with some park bench provided for people to relax. Also, there are some shops for easy snack and coffee. This another park that I have visited recently that is beautiful ...... I love it. I will definitely go back for more exploration of the park

Pleasant stroll. Walked through the park twice on recent visits to the palace and the theatre. Beautiful flower beds and different varieties of wildfowl around the lake. Reasonable cup of tea from the kiosk.
St James Park. Lovely park beautiful views next to Buckingham Palace.Very busy in summer,but cafe and park clears in Autumn

Walking back to the station.. What a lovely little park? I've often travelled up from Hastings just to sit and have a picnic. The park itself is well maintained and very clean. Lots of different species of Ducks and Geese, with some Herons and Pelicans thrown in for good measure. The friendly squirrels will help with your food so be warned - they aren't dangerous lol but will snatch food from your hands. Perfect to stroll through, sit and have a picnic or just contemplate life. Recommend anyone to have a look.

Great place for rest. After going through the crowded city, it's really nice to take a sit and have a rest. You can enjoy a short walk around the water pond, rest on the grass or have a lunch on one of the benches. It's a good place to catch your breath after lond day in London.
Beautiful park. Always worth a visit on a walk up to Buckingham palace. Great facilities, restaurants ice cream vans, deck chair hire and toilets. Love to see the birds and other wildlife on the lake
beutiful place. Beautiful place with amazing trees , birds and ducks.A good place to relax and connect to nature :)i really didn't want leaving this place
Beautiful Park. We walked from one end to the other, beautiful gardens and grounds. There is lots of trees for shaded areas too.

Tranquility in Central London. A wonderful park, in a historical centre of London. The history of the park alone is worth reading up on. Sandwiched in the middle of famous sites, this is how parks should be, a place of relaxation, in the middle of a hectic capital.

What a view!. A good London park, where you can walk round the lake, sit in the sun on a deckchair or stop off in the cafeteria for a coffee. But best of all is the view from the bridge, Houses of Parliament on one side, Buckingham Palace on the other, and grass and water all round.
afternoon. Tired of long walking ? why not to grab sandwiches or some take away food and sit down in the park? St James is great place to relax and re charge energy
Gorgeous greenery. This is a stunning parkland right in the heart of London. I loved the way you could stand on the bridge and look back at Buckingham Palace. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy.

BEAUTIFUL PARK, BEAUTIFUL DAY. We had a lovely afternoon strolling through this park on our way to Buckingham Palace. We stopped here for lunch, but cant say the same for the restaurant, meal wasnt good. The park is situated between central london area of Leicester & Trafalgar Squares and heads west towards Buckingham Palace. So if I can suggest, if your staying in the central area as mentioned, allow the time to walk through this park on your way to the palace, its very peaceful and a lovely place just to stroll.

Prettiest park in London . Beautifully laid out and full of flowers. Very friendly squirrels. Almost feels like it is a film set (think Mary Poppins). Located between so many great sights of course as well.

Well Maintained. St. James Park is just outside the Buckingham Palace. While you wait for the change in guard time, you can spend a nice 1 hour around the park. The squirrels and pigeons are very very friendly. Though it is prohibited to feed them, you still can carry some thing and feed them which will make them come close to you. There are awesome swans and ducks around the water. Awesome place
Review . Nice park. Loved the squarels there. Good for familes too. You can have a nice walk ir running here.
Nice walk. A lovely way to walk to Buckingham palace well maintained with lots of wild life on the lake a pleasant way to pass a couple of hours

Relaxing. Just a lovely park which is relaxing and nice to just soak in some sun. The big pond is beautiful and from the middle of the park you will get a great view of the palace. Just watch out for the squirrels if you have food near you !!
Fantastic. Stunning park. We were delighted to see the pelicans. The whole park was a lovely haven. It wasn't too busy when we visited and we sat and watched the very friendly squirrels.

Beautiful park with amazing assortment of water birds!. We had a bit of free time during our trip to London, and me and my husband headed off to St. James's Park to kill time. The park was wonderful, with birds and squirrels so tame I took photos of them by my feet!! It's great that there are signs everywhere on how to treat the animals and how and what not to feed them. It was very well-maintained. I loved it!!

Beautiful park and garden. Across from Buckingham Palace, nice garden with pond to walk through. It was a hot day (by British standards) and tons of people out there trying to get a tan, having a picnic with family and friends
Idyllic . The wildlife here is absolutely great. Also there's no litter on the ground. The benches are clean and comfortable. Furthermore this is a very scenic site.

Full of people, safe and just beautiful!. There are so many people enjoying the park with beautiful, large trees. You can rent chairs to relax or just stroll. It is pretty big, yet it is quick to get from one end to the other. The parks in London are wonderful! Enjoy as so many do!!!
Beautiful. What a beautiful park this is! Only a short walk from Buckingham palace. Grab an icecream in the summer months and enjoy!

Quiet Time in the Middle of London. Found this little gem by accident...thought we would take a short cut to get to Buckingham Palace...found a heaven of quite time in the middle of London. This 'park' (however quite huge) is full of lovely shady walks, open spaces for children to stretch their legs, free deck chairs for oldies to rest theirs...little cafes selling icecream and coffee and a brilliant restuarant - Inn The Park.
ST JAMES'S PARK. Amazing park in the centre of London. Plenty of wee kiosks and public toilets. Well kept and clean. Deck chairs also available to hire.

A true British park. A great place to visit.Hiring a deck chair was great fun with squirrels running around.Very few rest rooms.. Note public rest rooms require payment so make sure you carry twenty and fifty pence with you at all times.Given its size ( very big) there are very few toilets.A nice place to just get out of the manic rush but there are still many people and a lot of smokers everywhere.. Seems to be a London thing.
Quiet and beautiful park. Pleasant place to have a stroll. Well-maintenaned and not oversized ( as Hyde park). Plenty of charming ducks ( different species)
clean and lots of areas to spend the afternoon. if you are in the are and want a nice place to relax, this is it, lots of stuff to see, all areas are well kept.

A nice respit from the city streets. Found the park while walking the city - A very nice spot to sit and relax. Beautiful water fowl - some, I didnt recognize. They probably didnt recognize me either though :)
Pleasant and attractive. Ideal for a 2 hour stroll. Lots of seating and lively interest near the lake. Good for people watching as well.
Birthday Catchup. Great central location for our family catchup and birthday picnic n the park. Easy tube access and so close to Buckingham palace. Could here Big Ben chime. Kids loved it.

Quaint and peaceful spot to get out of the city. Great and quaint park and well worth a wander. Well-liked with the office workers in the area especially if it’s sunny. St James Park or Hyde Park are equally good spots to escape the hustle and bustle of London.

Lovely park appalling Restaurant. Visited last Saturday with my husband and 12 yr old grand daughter, Lovely park though limited seating not ideal for senior citizens. Appalling restaurant, limited seating tables not cleaned food on the seats and floor. Food very poor and very expensive staff not very helpful. My husband had a sandwich which was stale when he took it back he was told " it's ok sell by date is not until tomorrow" it was eventually changed. I had a small piece of quiche which was taste less and cold even though it was from the hot food counter and a small bowel of what looked like tomatoes but still not sure what they where, our grand daughter had a small sausage roll which she ate only because she was hungry and 3 small bottles of fruit juice for which I paid the princely sum of £31.00 Toilets were an utter disgrace, smelly and dirty only 4 cubicles sanitary bins full and over flowing on to the floor, poor hand washing facilities.As I said the park is well worth a visit but I suggest you eat before you go or take a picnic and a packet of hand wipes.
Sightseeing. Nice walk from Whitehall through Horse Guards Parade, St James's Park down to Buckingham Palace, back up the Mall past Clarence House down Pall Mall back to the West End.
Tanktroop. Lovely park nice cafeteria good for feeding ducks rRe breeds at horse guards end were the little cottage is this park is great any time of year

Lovely afternoon. This is one of the nicest parks. The lake, the size, the foliage, the facilities - all nice and compact surrounded by the palaces and lovely architecture. Great if you have a couple of hours to kill and just want to relax and let the children play.

Great to just relax. There is so much space around here to just spread a blanket and enjoy a picnic. It seemed like everyone has the same idea with just hanging out and enjoying the company of others. You are also able to rent the chairs too for a couple of Euros.

Delightful Park. We were staying in London for 3 days, and our hotel was quite close to St James Park and Buckingham Palace. I have to say what a beautiful park it was. Green, spacious, lovely blooms and deckchairs out. The lake was beautiful and many diff. birds were swimming , nesting there, Lovely place for a stroll, or to walk through when going from one place to another on the tourist trail. We were blessed with a warm sunny August day, which is a lovely treat for the UK, and everyone in the park was relaxed and enjoying the weather.

The London parks!. I love spending casual afternoons strolling through the London parks, particularly St. James's Park but including Hyde park and Victoria park! It gets quite busy but this doesn't phase our strong willed birds - they're not scared of people!

Lovely on a sunny day. We enjoyed walking through the park on our way back from the Palace and were amazed by the number of different birds here. The flowers in the borders were also stunning and the squirrels were eager for nuts! A great view from the little blue bridge towards the eye too.

Stunning!. I walked through St James's Park from Westminster through to Trafalgar Square. Whoever decides on plant varieties to give such an extraordinary colourful display deserves recognition. The summer display had all the colours of the rainbow and blended marvellously - truly spectacular.The signage really interested me - how this space was originally marshland and over time, from the reign of Elizabeth I, and subsequent monarchs, was transformed into what it is today. Fascinating, too, that Charles II, after he returned from exile, used the park for exercise - swimming in the summer and iceskating in the winter. Of interest as well, was the Ornithological Society's association with the park, although, given the number of birds seen during my short visit, hardly surprising. Duck Island was a joy to behold with the gardens and the small Swiss Chalet located there. Again, a picture perfect postcard photographic opportunity.No surprise with the number of people on a summer’s day in London enjoying the park as I was certainly doing, simply using it as a thoroughfare but really appreciating its use both now and in the past, those having picnics, playing games etc,A wonderful London gem.
Perfect for a picnic. Had a lovely time with friends, beautiful and peaceful place. I would recommend the lounge chairs, the price is very cheap.

Nice but flooded with tourists taking selfies. I walk through the park on my way to work. Whilst it is a great place, it suffers, as many places do in London, from the hordes of tourists. They stretch themselves across the width of the paths and move at a snails pace making it difficult to get round them. The most popular spot is the bridge over the lake. This is where they mass and take selfies. Getting across this bridge can take a while as you zig zag among them.
Peacefull. We had a lovely picnic here and watched the ducks, beautiful park, very clean and spacious, cost of the toilets are 20p and they are very clean,
I walked through St James Park. A very very nice Park in the middle of London.. very nice scenery and relaxing. I will take a picnic next time. very clean, lovely for an afternoon out.

Great park in the heart of London. This is a great park to stop for a picnic or a coffee after seen the change of guards in the Buckingham Palace. In the park you can also see pelicans, ducks, swans and squirrels. You can even hand feed the squirrels. Great relaxing and beautiful park
Great location . Nice park with a lake and small bridge. Lots of flowers and a nice small house. While in there you can see London eye. It is so close to Buckingham palace.

A park of royalty.. The park is very clean and has facilities such as a toilet which costs 20p to use.
Perfect for getting a sun tan or, you could go to the shade to play park games. There's something for everyone to enjoy.

Great Wildlife in Cetral London. Visited St James Park a few days ago with my wife and 2 children aged 6 and 8. Whilst walking through the park we was lucky to see a variety of wildlife including Squirrels, Pelicans and Mallard among many more and is a great place to see wildlife in central London.St James's Park is the oldest Royal Park in London and is surrounded by three palaces. The most ancient is Westminster, which has now become the Houses of Parliament, St James's Palace and of course the best known Buckingham Palace all can be seen walking around the park. Also in the park is Horse Guards Parade Ground the ceremonial parade ground where the Trooping the Colour take place on the Queen's official birthday each year.There is much more to see and do and all at no cost!!

Sunny summer day. Wonderful place for a picnic lunch on a sunny day. Just between Whitehall and Buckingham Palace, it is busy but not hectic. If you are at Westminster and Houses of Parliament, this is about 3 minutes away and well worth a look.

A park fit for royalty. A beautiful park close to Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey. Deck chairs are available for lounging and there are a number of cafes to choose from. The park has toilets. The highlight is the pond with the romantic bridge crossing it. The water has a number of resident geese and other interesting birds.Overall, the park is ideal for a stroll anytime of year or lounging during the warmer months.

Lovely way to the palace. Took this park on way to the palace, let me tell you it's an awesome way to venture before getting to n from the palace, even if Buckingham palace disappoints I promise you this won't, birds, ducks, squirrels fountains people watchers, it's beautiful.. Why not go n see for yourself. Café, ice cream on the way also..
Such a nice park! . First we walked through the park and enjoyed the trees, the lake and the ducks. Later we came back and just sat on the lawn and relaxed.
squirrels, ducks, shade on a hot day. friendly squirrels, ample shade, good for a wander or a seat to relax. A haven adjacent to horseguards parade and Buck Palace.
Lovely place to wander around. It doesn't matter what time of year you go this is a beautiful place to visit in central London with some wonderful views.

A place to relax !!. This was London's first royal park created by Henry VIII in 1532 and for many, the nicest of the royal parks. The centerpiece is the lake that attracts many water birds, plus owls, woodpeckers and bats. The pelicans are fed every day at 14:30. There's a children’s playground, deckchairs, toilet facilities and refreshment kiosks. There is a contemporary British restaurant café open from breakfast through to dinner at the eastern end by the lakeside if you need to have a nice dinner in very peaceful place. For more information about London visit thetravelingroom.com
Relaxing Stroll. A great place to have a Sunday stroll, watching the ducks and observing the beautiful shrubs and flowers.
Great park. A beautiful park for a wander around, even in the drizzly summer rain. The gardens are lovely and the views around are great.
One of the best views in london. Go to the lake bridge and look towards horse guards parade one of the best views in london. Very nice park to relax in
Fabulous!. If you are travelling to London, make sure to pencil a trip to St James's park. Great for picnics or other activities. Lovely open spaces and gardens as well!
Fantastic stroll. We enjoyed strolling through this park after watching the changing of the guard at Buckingham palace. It is absolutely gorgeous. Do not miss!
Brilliant. Superb place for a picnic, snooze or just for a walk. Must visit on your trip to the Buckingham Palace

Nice big park good for tourists . Nice parks and picnics
Lots of fun to go with family and eat food then get ice cream from the sellers
Close walk to the queens house also

One of the many delightful parks in central London, right next to Buckingham Palace.. Enjoy the many walking paths, plus the stunning views from the central bridge looking to Buckingham Palace. Beware the deck chairs on the lawns are only for hire.

I love this park!. One of the best things to do in London is spend a day with your feet in the grass in one of her many fabulous parks.St James's Park is located between Buckingham Palace and Westminster, includes The Mall and is a part of some of London's most traditional and spectacular ceremonies.But it's more than that - in summer, there is nothing better than to sit among beautiful gardens in dappled sunlight in a deckchair and watch the world go past.

Walk in an oasis of greenery and colour with an impressive lake. We walk frequently through St James' Park and is popular with tourists too. We enter at the Buck House end of the Mall by the pedestrian crossing, and stroll along the side of the lake, where you will see swans, moorhens, lots of wild birds. The flower borders are immaculately kept, and full of colour in spring and summer. The pathways can get really busy, but there are good facilities, including a cafeteria, outside and inside seating, and clean toilets. Sometimes, one can find Pelicans, but these tend to congregate at the other end of the lake and are very used to people, but you must not feed or touch them ! The Park ends near Horseguards Parade, and one can stroll across quite easily. There was an exhibition last year in the park on images of the first world war and worked really well. We have seen black swans on the lake at times. Lots to see and so easy to get back to the Mall from the park to see the soldiers and guards marching, or a procession. The floral borders near Horseguards Parade are full of colour during spring and summer season. A really well kept park, but then it is a Royal Park ! A good walk is from Green Park Station, through Green Park, across the mall, and through St James's Park through to Horseguards parade. There is some seating along the way if you become tired.

London at its best. Have a rest. Enjoy flora and fauna. Play on the grass. Make a picnic.
Plan before, in the middle or after visits of other places in the neighborhood.
If I am in London, I am in St. James's Park.
Nice park. This park was a large park with lots of small lakes and birds of all kinds to see. I cut through the park from Parliament Square towards Buckingham Palace. It was a nice walk.

Pleasant break from the hustle and bustle . Lovely park in the centre of London.
Ice creams were delicious from
The Italian cart.
My daughter enjoyed feeding the birds from her hand

Beautiful St. James Park!! . After a busy day of touring London, stopping at St. James Park was a welcome oasis. Lovely, relaxing, and simply a fabulous park. The grounds are expertly manicured it's so beautiful and peaceful. A needed retreat in the heart of hectic London.
Good for morning run. This place is really good for a morning run. Much smaller than Hyde Park but cozy and inspiring (and you can run to Hyde Park from here anyway).

Walk . Lovely park in the centre of London.
A nice lake with a vast amount of birds and pelicans. Great views of Buckingham palace and the London eye.
Lovely park in heart of London. On a few visits to London have enjoyed a lovely picnic lunch in the park. Well used by families. Good place to see birds and squirrels. Plenty of seats near the lake.

I'm laying on the grass. A quite place to take a breath in the city.
Had my very berry lovely sunny weekend afternoon lazy picnic memory with my beloved person there.
Delightful. Surely the prettiest of the big London parks even if the leaves are beginning to fall from the trees! A tranquil oasis In which to unwind.

A walk in the patk. So many people - mostly not English - too crowded to enjoy a stroll.
Deck chairs on the grass we're inviting and the gardens were lovely to look at.
Would be best out of school holiday on a not so sunny day when it's a bit quieter.

The Best Royal Park in London. I have been going to St James Park for years. There is everything you could want in a Park. My grand children have voted it there favourite out of all the Royal Parks . You have the nice grassed area's where you can sit or play games, the big lake with all the different ducks, heron's etc. The childrens play area with a sandpit,swings slides and many other play things. and the beautiful flower beds.There are places to get food, drinks and ice creams. We always take a picnic and just buy a drink but the children never want to leave even after spending a day there. It is also very central for the big attractions, one end is Buckingham Palace and the other end is Horse Guards Parade, London Eye, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament.
Wonderful scenery. You feel like you're in a movie set in this very well kept place. Either you walk through it or you go there for a picnic or a rest it is woth a visit.

" Beautiful and Lustful Green Park ". There's no wonder why on Earth this place is well visited. Because of its Lustful green scenery and so closed to Buckingham and Household Cavalry museum.A good place for picnic and social gathering, open for public and thru and thru to other nice spots around.
Beautiful setting. I had a lovely stroll from Horseguards to Buckingham Palace and then back down the Mall. I was surprised to see three Pelicans gliding down the waters. Beautiful setting

Beautiful Park..... St James Park is nice to get away from the traffic, enjoy a rest, people watch, watch the ducks on the pond and enjoy beautiful flowers. Strolled through from Buckingham Palace to the back of Whitehall for changing of the guard.
Stunning!. Couldn't believe this beautiful park was hidden within busy London. It is so beautifully looked after and well-managed.
Lovely park. A lovely place to walk though, sit and have lunch and just enjoy the peace.Love how London has so much green space.

Love it!!!. A stroll in the park. What is more charming than a stroll in the park. Nice history, wide areas and cool. The city of London is crazy busy, but this is an oasis. Just sit and people watch.
lovely relaxing park. nice to walk through away from the hustle and bustle !! lovely relaxing place, ice cream and a bit of sun bathing !

Give yourself that "green bonus", your heart will thank you :). Beautiful & elegant park, peaceful and quiet.Forget your watch, forget your schedule, just sit on a bench ,look around and relax.The park is clean and well maintained , every leaf "knows" it's place :)Perfect for a stroll.Enjoy the trees, flowers, lake, birds, squirrels and more...To complete the picture ,we enjoyed an ice cream.Don't miss that park !we love it.
Stunning park. To walk through this park was amazing and so beautiful. So many photo moments for people to share. The scenery and history was extremely interesting.

Peaceful and beautiful surrounding:-). We really enjoy walking around the park, watching people going by, seeing the birds swimming and with their young. If you have time, it is also a must do in London:-)

WOW. What a beautiful place.
It is a definite must see.
The Brits sure know how to do it in style...gardens were lovely and everything was so well laid out.
Its a great way to spend a quiet day.

Beautiful. We loved walking through St James Park,it really is a beautiful place very relaxed atmosphere,lots of ducks and birds.
Plenty of areas to sit and relax.
We even enjoyed an ice cream on a beautiful sunny day.
