Beautiful park. Lovely park but you may miss this if you're new in London and I almost think I like this park better than hyde park

What a lot of wildlife. Walked through St James Park on our way from Buckingham Palace to the tube station.It was a very hot day, although quite cloudy, which may have been while there was a lot of wildlife in and out the water. It was great for the grandchildren to view all the water birds up close.This is a great place to sit under the shade of the large trees to have a picnic and watch the world go by.We walked over the bridge to get to the tube station which took us round about 5 mins.

Great Park. We visited in August on what was then the hottest day of the year. The ground was scorching, the ducks and pidgins were sleeping on the grass. The flowers were making a brave show in the heat in the boarders and the cottage garden. Amazing green in the middle of the town.
Peaceful spot in the city. Great little park - well worth a stroll. Popular with the office workers in the area if its sunny, great for some people watching and a rest from the hustle and bustle

Beautiful & relaxing. I used to work at Piccadilly Circus many years ago and this park will always be my peace and tranquillity part of London that I could escape to in my lunch hour or on my way back to the train station.It's big enough to not be crowded but busy enough to people watch. Plenty of trees for shade, the flower beds are always beautiful and well kept. Lots of wildlife to see and you can get refreshments easily.It's a wonderful escape from busy London but right next to so many things to see and do. It's great being so close to the beautiful buildings and especially walking through and seeing Buckingham Palace appear through the trees.
Lovely park . So nice to walk through before getting to Buckingham Palace. Lots of shady areas, very relaxing and didn't feel like you were in the centre of a city.

Summer walk. Had a nice stroll through St James's Park, it was a very hot day there weren't as many ducks out I think everything was flaked out. Even the squirrels which are usually intent on getting nuts were spread out on the tree branches not moving and pigeons were not as fanatical about crumbs ect.I think this is the friendliest and prettiest of all the parks in London but the drink and food stands are very overpriced so beware!
Lovely . Great place for a walk love the squirrels the gardens look brilliant bùckingham palace at the end of the park nice looking cafe

Peaceful at the odd hour, find a bench and sit. Park can be crowded. Good for people watching. Lots of birds. Take pics from the bridge if you can find a space. Restrooms cost 30p, not free, not very clean. But if you are nearby, the only choice.

Excellent park and lots of greenery . This park is really beautiful tons of greenery to enjoy there's some ice cream stands that you can enjoy as well. Just a place to relax and sit down and enjoy London
Chilled out couple of hrs. Lovely free Park nice grassed areas kids Park, along with a lovely lake with fish ducks geese and pallicans there...and all is free

An oasis of peace in central London. If you need a break after visiting Westminster Abbey, the Houses of Parliament and Horseguards, this is the ideal spot. Much more intimate than Hyde Park with lots of greenery and peace and quiet. Just relax and gather your strength for visiting the next tourist spots

Lovely walk in the park. Lovely small park between the Mall and Downing Street well worth a walk around and through.Great weather makes a massive difference bring a picnic and spend some time just chilling out.Or use as a pleasent walk way through to Whitehall or Westminster Abbey.

Best park in London. We had great weather while visiting London so a walk in the park is always nice. Walked through Hyde Park too but liked this one better. It is smaller but the atmosphere here is nice. Makes you feel you are back in the times the park was created.

It's just a park. A historic park but still just a park.. Big deal. You can walk through this large park, sit on benches and have a picnic. It's just a park. At one end you do encounter Buckingham Palace.

Birds, Squirrels, View of Buckingham Palace - beautiful. We walked through St James park by accident on our way to Buckingham Palace. Everything so close together in London you accidently walk through all the main places without realising half of the time. I’m pretty much reiterating the same as the other reviews, this really is a beautiful great park. The river running through it, and the view of Buckingham palace in the background is stunning. We were lucky to be walking through it on a nice sunny day , not too hot, so it was perfect weather for a stroll. There was an ice-cream van in the middle, and plenty of people sitting on blankets, under trees. There a lot of birds around the river, but there is a little fence , and weirdly they seem to be quite happy behind it, although they can quite easily fly over. The squirrels are very friendly, and I watched a girl feeding one nuts, and it was a bit nervous, but kept repeatedly coming over to her and taking one out of her hand.It’s quite a large park, and there a few different path ways, so you can walk different ways around if you wanted to.
Relaxing escape from the craziness of London in high season!. Grab a paper and an M&S sandwich and take yourself down to St James park for a quick chill in the sun.
Beatifull park with a fabullus lake. You have to experience the peasfull walk in this beatifull park , you can even spend one morning seeing all the trees and flowers.
A beautiful stroll. I wish we could have spent more time in this lovely park. St James is beautiful, well maintained and a treasure for Londoners and visitors alike.
I beautiful park. It was very nice to see a beautiful park in the middle of wall to wall people, just getting away from people made you feel like you are in another world

Nice green space. Nice place to relax and unwind from the manic pace of the city.
Bring a blanket or something to sit on as you have to pay for the deck chairs. Nice walk along the river with pleanty of wildlife
Lovely Park. St. Jame's is a lovely park right in the center of London. It's georgeous, especially on a sunny day. An apt location for an outing/picnic with your loved ones.
Great park . This park wasn't that far from where we were staying so we had a walk through as it was a lovely day , not as big as Hyde park but great park though.

Tranquility in the heart of London. Well kept park in central London. Brilliant for kids to have a run around and break from general sight seeing. Small play area for young children. Pleasant pond/lake with various ducks & geese. Quaint little cottage situated at edge of park next to where pelicans situated.

Nice park. I go here often when I can to relax here and it is a very nice park with a good view of Buckingham Palace
Just watch out for the swans as they can cause a bit of chaos at times

perfect walk and stay in a sunny day.. You can come to the park after you've seen the Guards shift change at Buckingham Palace.
The park is beautiful, with flowers grasses and trees.
Perfect sunny day. You can make it a picnic to watch the birds and squirrels lake.
From which to proceed towards Horse Guards or towards Big Ben
Perfect for jogging . It's right next to Hyde Park but much less crowded with tourists. Yes it's smaller but it also has lakes and beautiful greenery and gardens.

Magical. We aren't an outdoorsy family, but we all truly enjoyed walking through this amazing park. It's free and always open, which is convenient, and there are usually food stalls and pay-restrooms open to address all calls of nature. We had a special afternoon by collecting a few different bakery treats, finding a great shady spot, and having an impromptu tea time. The paths throughout are wide and paved smooth, so would be easy for walkers of all abilities. There are dozens of types of fancy birds to watch, plus squirrels and pigeons being fed by friendly local folks. My 13 and 16 year olds were begging to come back to the park for a second and third visit.
Lovely place for a stroll. Wonderfully laid out park with lots of natural attractions. The blossoms were fantastic. Right near the horse guards too

Beautiful . We walked around St James park for around an hour on our visit to London. What a beautiful, clean and welcoming environment. The lake and bird life was amazing to see. Also the cheeky little squirrels coming with inches of us was amazing.
Great place to meet friends and picnic. Met up with friends for a picnic. The park is kept clean and tidy and there are refreshment facilities too

A Delightful Surprise. Beautiful park with well taken care of plants, lively children's playground suitable for babies and toddlers and a lake with stunning view of London. Always a delightful walk. Plenty of benches, exactly what you need after watching changing guards in Buckingham Palace.

Great park - but expensive warm water!. Walking around St James park is good - fantastic plants and flower beds. Good for a summer walk.Spoilt somewhat by many kids on scooters - an accident waiting to happen - not sure if any parents with the kids? Also - water - all that was on offer were bottles of ward water that cost a fortune for a bottle of water and were served by staff in a hut .... who appeared totally fed up!Loved the birds on the lakes.

Beautiful . Love this park. It's a little oasis and if you can find a quiet spot away from all the loud tourists it's bliss, best time to go is dusk on a sunny day and just sit by the water and watch the squirrels.
Beautiful park ! . beautiful park with lots of places to relax. We dont have this parks in Slovakia. We really enjoyed it ! Hat down :)
A hidden gem . A beautiful park with resident Pelicans. Lovely views of Buckingham Palace, great walks & right in heart of central London

Trafalgar Square to Victoria Station via St James Park & Buckingham Palace. . Following a river trip to Grenwich and a visit to Trafalgar Sq I walked my 2 Grandchildren, Son, Daughter and my Partner back to get our home train via the Park. This is a route I walked many times with my Grandfather whom taught me a considerable amount about London, it's locations and its history. Being born and bred in Pimlico (London SW1), this was my playground in the 60's & 70's. I now feel it a bit of a tradition passing these places onto my Grandchildren as I did to my Children before them. It also evokes great memories of Grandad and my Childhood.
A lovely walk. We had a lovely walk through here with an ice cream with the children. Lots of places to sit. Plenty of places for a cool drink and a nice way to spend some time in the city.

Lovely for a walk on a sunny day. Beautiful park in the middle of London, between Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square. Well maintained. Pelicans are fed every afternoon. Toilets 20p per person. Kiosks are a bit expensive but that is normal for London. Cyclists have to walk which is great as the paths are busy. Children's play area at the opposite end to the Pelicans. Close to other attractions so worth spending a day in the area. Best for a dry day.

Beautiful Gardens in Central London. Love St James Park. We often visit on a Sunday morning when we're in the city as it's nice for some tranquility, especially when we're usually in London for boozy/foodie/shopping trips. This is a nice place to stroll around and enjoy the fresh air and the fantastic gardening which is very well maintained and it is so central and easy to get to.

Vacation. This is a beautiful beautiful park starting at Buckingham Palace and goes to horse barrack for guard from Palace. At 10 am you can see changing of the guard!!!!Churchill's bunker right there too ! Beautiful walk from the Taj hotel
Lovely walk. This park is a lovely walk to do, its clean and well looked after. Its busy and a nice walk. We seen the ducks and squirrels.

Beautiful. This really is a must visit can spend all day or visited every day through out your hoilday you never get bored it's beautiful flowers and pound life also the views one for all the family from kids to grand parents some thing for ever one
One of London's peaceful oasis. We enjoyed a lovely picnic and a chance to rest our feet! Deckchairs are available. there is a bar/restaurant within the park and a cool drink was very welcome.
Nice walk in the park . Nice walk on the park on the way to Buckingham palace if you don't get mobbed by pigeons . Lovely gardens deck chairs nice to relax

surrounded by history.. Stand on the small bridge in the middle of this park and you see Buckingham Palace one way and Whitehall the other. Lots of birds trees and flowere gardens. Early in the morning there are few people and you might be lucky enough to see the horse guards practising their drill plus water fowl the band pm and the Mall. What more could one ask.
Beautiful part. This was a beautiful park and nice place to wander. Ponds with lots of water fowl and a few of the London eye in the distance.
Lovely London park. This park was a lovely treat in the middle of all the traffic and bustle of London. There is a lake and lots of flowers, a very pleasant spot to take a break.

Always a Pleasure. This is my favorite London park. Sure there are bigger with a plethora of varying activities, but this one is only a couple of blocks from Trafalgar Square making it a relaxing oasis away from the mobs of map wielding tourists. The gardens are beautiful, the wildlife incredible (I've even seen Pelicans on occasions) and the waterways and memorizing. Buckingham Palace serves as a splendid backdrop. Definitely a must see when one wants to get away from the madding crowd.

Nothing like a stroll in this park.. Spent two afternoons walking through different sections of the park and it is a little paradise in the city. Watch out for the birds flying overhead. They left an impression with us.

Great escape from the attractions. Situated somewhere between Piccadilly Circus and the London Eye sits St James Park. It's great to pass through and catch a glimpse of Buckingham Palace. The park itself has plenty of places to sit, lots of wildlife such as squirrels, plenty of birds and ducks. The squirrels are particularly accustomed to receiving food. It's a great stop off point if you're heading from Piccadilly Circus/Leicester Square/Oxford Circus towards Big Ben/Westminster/London Eye and can easily be squeezed in to a full day out.
Calm and beautiful. Lovely park near Buckingham Palace for a picnic - plenty of space and trees for shade. Had a lovely time away from the hustle and bustle.

Breathtaking. Simply put, this park is absolutely stunning. The water features and vast array of birds are lovely to gaze upon whilst you stroll leisurely through the area. Great place to have lunch or an ice cream after a visit to Buckingham palace as it is in such close proximity.Peaceful.

Take a little while to stroll and breathe.... Love this place... It is easily overlooked, but one of the best open spaces in the centre of town. On a hot day there are few places better to walk around. Far better than Hyde Park.
Stunning. This is by far my favourite Royal Park- it is beautiful. The water and the trees marry perfectly to create a serene atmosphere.

Give your feet a break, and soak in some atmosphere. Near Westminster and Buckinham palace, this is a good place to stop to rest your feet. Most of the park is for pedestrians only, so park you city bike to enjoy the park.

A Moment of Peace in a Busy City. If it's not raining then this is the place to sit for a while and eat your lunch. Absolutely beautiful park with iconic sights on all sides. Horse Guards and Churchills War Rooms on one side and Buckingham Palace on the the other.

Wonderful beuty. Nice park in the center of London to relax, have awseme pictures from one of the ends and enjoy looking and feeding the different animals liveing in the area (squarrels, ducks, goos...)

Lovely place to relax in the sun. We visited here on a gorgeous sunny day and chilled out in the park for a good few hours. The only thing that let it down was the toilet attendants, who wouldn't let my daughter use the Child ones. Except for this I would definitely recommend.

Top notch grass. It's a park, it has grass that you can stand on and wild life and a lake. 5/5Ok you want more? Fine: unlike MANY other parks in London (looking at you, Hyde Park), St. Jame's actually has a dense presence of trees. On a sunny day, it's the ideal place to relax. (and you will need to relax, since the park is surrounded by tourist attractions and, as such, reaching it is like navigating a maze that aggressively takes photos).
A good for a walk but untidy. It is good o a walk toward Trafalgar Square as alternative to the mall but the upkeep is not great . Shame really . Great for wild life and cute bird keeper cottage
Gorgeous Park. This is a stunning park in the heart of London. There is fantastic collection of birds and other wild life, kiosks, toilets and deck chair hire. The squirrels are the star of the show.
Beautiful . St James's Park is wonderful as are all the royal parks in London. Lovely to take a stroll. Definitely worth a visit.

Lovely stroll away from the hustle. This is a great place to walk to from Westminster. There are paid toilets and a couple of cafes. My boys loved the birds. Lots of duck and some pelicans. The gardens were lovely. Lots of interesting plants. We let our boys loose with a camera and they found some pineapples growing. Plenty of benches for a rest and you could hire deckchairs. We saw signs to a playpark but didnt make it that far.

A walk in the park. Had a lovely walk in the park to try and walk off a huge breakfast...lots of places to sit down including deck chairs...don't know if you have to hire them though...the weather was great and throughly enjoyed the walk...didn't see any littler walking through the park.... Highly recommend it if your Pokemon hunting..
A must see. I reached it through underground on St. James station. Nice park , not so big but it was beautiful you can spend an hour or so and walk toward queen palace or the nearby Green park.

beautiful. we stayed at a hotel nearby and enjoyed strolls down this park on a few days and loved it! our hotel was near Buckingham Palace and having proximity to the main attractions plus this was an added bonus. to fall in love with london

Nice and quiet. This park was really calm which I liked, as well as having so many birds and water around to wonder. Nice for walking and spotting birds and flowers. Slightly dull in terms of the way the park looks like. There's really nothing in the green areas, like in many other parks (statues, modern art, galleries, restaurants, cafés..) or maybe I was just in a "boring" part of the park. Like I said, I really did enjoy the quietness though.
Really nice park. Liked St James's Park - beautifully looked after. Really friendly squirrels and pigeons too, living in harmony side by side - an example to us all.
Relaxing. The park is situated right in the middle of busy parts of London. Great place for a picnic and a long stroll.
VERY HOT DAY. Went to St James's Park on a recent visit to London. Very hot day, pleasant to sit in the park in the shade.

Favourite park in london. We visited on an overcast day and so crowds were low, no deck chair possibilities really but still a lovely stroll in this oasis. Take a few bits of bread for the ducks and seed for the sparrows. A few cheeky squirrels are amusing. Balls etc all okay, but other parks better for this type of activity.
Lovely park. A great place to have a rest in between visits to various attractions. There is more than one cafe, a good place to relax and paid toilets are available

Amongst the top 5 most beautiful parks i have been to!. St James park is extremely peaceful and a great way to spend an afternoon. My favorite part was the view from one of the bridges where u can see the London eye on the right and the Cavalry museum on the left, both in front of you. There are a ton of birds in the ponds and also walking around on the grass. Pigeons often come sit on shoulders and heads if u are eating something, and that can be so much fun! There are also some extremely beautiful flowers and foliage. This was definitely amongst the top 5 most beautiful and peaceful parks I have been to
Nice surprise when walking in the neighborhood.. This is a really nice park and nice to see locals and tourist enjoying themselves. Plus lots of swans to admire
Peaceful place. A peaceful place right in the heart of London. Great ice cream from a place at the front of the park.
lovely park and gardens. Visited with my family, it is a lovely park with gardens, a lake and children's area. Great views of Buckingham Palace and Whitehall from the bridge.

Beautiful water views. This park has beautiful views of the water. It is long and narrow so you can hardly walk around without seeing a view of the water and bridge. Great running trail around the perimeter as well.

Between 10 Downing St / Westminster and Buckingham Palace. You probably cross this park when going when walking from Westminster to the Buckingham Palace or vice versa anyway. Not worth getting there separately but you get some nice views of the Palace. Overall nice, there's a variety for birds and offers a couple of photography spots, particularly when the sun goes down.

Beautiful park. Walked through this park on the way to visit Buckingham Palace. Beautiful place for a morning stroll. Quite a few picture opportunities with the trees, the lake, and the waterfowl. Many food stands to pick up a drink or a snack.

Enjoyed the ambience and crowd 😎. Had a perfect evening after a very busy day at office . Grabbed few bottles of chilled beer and cider from a nearby M&S shop ( my friend )and some snacks from Sainburys ( myself). A very pleasant environment and good crowd . Vey next to bus stops and connected to underground tube station .

Feels like you are a few centuries back. The most stately of the London parks, and hence my favorite. It is really easily accessible if and when you are visiting the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, or Westminster Abbey.
Large and beautiful park. With plenty of places to sit back and relax it has a lovely atmosphere. A few nice stops to get drinks!

Nice but gets busy. A nice piece of greenery right next to the Buckingham Palace and other central attractions. Lots of wildlife (specially birds). It does tend to get over-crowded with tourists, specially in the summer months.

Lovely Park. My daughter and I spent hours walking around the park one afternoon, watching & photographing the surrounds, birds and squirrels. The squirrels were a treat to watch as they searched for nuts. Thoroughly enjoyed the memories with my daughter that we had here, was a lovely afternoon.
Beautifull. Simply beautifull...lovely park with many diferent kinds of birds..amazing nature! I would surerly visit again
Beautiful. Lovely place to walk around especially in the summer sun. It's better than in the pictures and the surrounding areas are worth a visit also.

Went to see the Pelicans being fed. . But missed it. The lake and floracious Nash inspired flower beds were a treat. Go if your fed up of shopping and nearby visiting Buckingham palace. It's lovely!!!

Peaceful escape from London rush. We went through St. Jame's Park after watching the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace and it was a refreshing break from the crowds. There's a few lunch stands to grab a bite and relax.

Beautiful park in summer!. Lively to have a stroll around this park on a lovely summers day. Nice park and sand pit area for little ones and toilets, all really clean. Take a picnic, hire a deck chair, people watch or set up a games area. Really relaxed atmosphere from the bustle of London.

Gorgeous Photo Opportunities. St. James's Park is very pleasant and provides stunning views. If you stand on the bridge you get a beautiful building at the end of a serene lake with geese and a fountain. Bonus--you can spot the London Eye with a clear sky.

Natural Beauty in the City. This park offers a relaxing way to commune with nature in one of the most crowded cities in Europe. It is easy to forget that you are in the heart of London. The British sure love their nature. Of course, it is a Victorian view of nature with sculptured lawns and gardens and carefully tended wildlife. A great place to relax from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful Day. We were lucky enough to be here for the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. We walked through Horseguards Parade and on through St James Park to Bucking Palace. It was a really beautiful day and we walked right through the park from Horseguards to Buckingham Palace. Amazing.
such a lovely park. such a lovely park and peaceful atmosphere the park is kept in good condition and love walking around it
Beautiful park . My husband and I spent an hour or so reading and sunbathing during a recent trip to London. Lovely park and interesting to read about the history and the various wildlife habitats.
Great place. It is a really great place to spend some time on sunny day in LondonThe lake and the birds are beatifullSometimes too much crowd.. .
Great afternoon stroll. I think it really is the best park in London. We go there quite often. It takes a different character depending on the season so every visit seems like the first.
Wonderful central London oasis to relax in. St James' Park is a great spot to get away from the congestion of central London and just relax with a book, music or your own thoughts.

Beautiful, clean park. St James's Park is a beautiful park in the centre of London, not far the River Thames, the Big Ben and Buckingham Palace. I often visit this park on sunny days and at night to have a quiet walk in the busy London centre.The park itself is beautifully kept and you can even access some chairs to sit on when visiting. There is also a small restaurant so if you get hungry while walking around, you can grab a bite to eat. I have personally not done this, yet.I recommend this to people visiting with friends, family and small children. It is fun for children because there are a lot of animals you can see, especially by the water. There are also squirrels running around so it is nice to spot those running up and down the trees.Although it can be quite busy during the day, at night it quiets down and it's amazingly calm and relaxing. I could just sit here all day!
Beautiful open space. You could forget you were in London in this park. Clean, well maintained, beautiful flora, good facilities. Well worth a stroll, picnic or chilling in.
Beautiful and ideal for a rest . Loved it here, was busy but peaceful at same time, had a cocktail at restaurant place and loved realxing on the grass watching world go by
An isle of green in the centre of life. Plenty of flowers and birds of different species. Tasty dishes in the confortable self service "Inn the Park".
Beautiful City Park. This is a lovely Park leading from Westminster right up to Buckingham Palace. Inspite of it being quite busy, it had a lovely air of calmness about it.

Beautiful gardens near Buckingham Palace. . Beautiful gardens to walk through to / from Buckingham Palace. Refreshments available: coffee, waffles, ice cream plus plenty of space on the grass to just sit. Lovely colourful scenery & some good photo opportunities with the London Eye in the background.
Lazy dayz. really lovely walk from Buckingham Palace to horse guards parade and Westminster, great spot to reflect and relax before rejoining the hustle and bustle
A great place for a stroll. A really nice bit of our green and pleasant land. You get to see a wide range of life both human and animal.
Good park close to Buckingham. Good park close to Buckingham with nice paths to walk around and to share with the animals living in there. Good experience

Stunning. This park, though one of the smaller ones in London, is quite wonderful and spectacular to visit. you can get great views of the impressive buildings that surround the park.... there's a lot of history here too, plus it's a great place to get some peace and quiet in the middle of this hectic city. Really lovely.

Always a refreshing place to spend awhile.. The gardens in St. James Park are impeccably maintained and bring bright colors into this richly green park. It always seems to be filled with walkers and those stopping to rest a bit, and it's become my favorite park in a city that is richly-blessed with lovely green spaces. If you need a few moments to collect your thoughts, this is a great place to do it.
Such a wonderful place. Just go there for a break, a walk or picnic o rfor any reason and you'll feel quiet and restful , enjoy sitting on a bench or on the lawn, animals etc...
My favourite park. This was my favourite park back in the day. Quiet and peaceful. In beautiful surroundings. I haven't been back since 2001. Hopefully one day I will take my family there.

Lovely Park. Another Jewel in London's crown this is a lovely park right next to Buckingham Palace. We are blessed in this country to have so much heritage and lovely places to visit and this park is yet another example, lovely.
Wildfowl in central London. This was a lovely place to find on our visit to Buckingham Palace. It was great to have a stroll and see the birds and it was very well kept.
Really lovely in the sunshine. . We walked through St James' Park today and were pleased how many people were there enjoying the facility and the weather in central London. Well kept park.
Nice park. That's nice well-kept park. Great point to have a break and to feed the birds and squirrels. It was funny!

Relaxing. Its the best place to relax after a busy walk and sightseeing in the city . There are nearby shops in the park where you could buy water and food , but its 10x the price compare to the grocery store shop , so prepare . The shop accepts card or cash .The park is well maintained and clean .

Beautiful little park. We wandered through here after seeing the changing of the guards. It's a beautiful little park right in front of Buckingham palace, with a great place on the bridge in the middle of the park to take photos

Nice bit of piece in a hectic city. This park is always well kept and has the most amazingly friendly animals, especially the squirrels.
It's a great short cut between Buckingham palace and Westminster. It always seems peaceful even if it is surrounded by busy roads

Pretty park, we watched the squirrels running up the trees, across the grass and nibbling their pickings.. Lovely park to wander around in , some wildlife and also a play area for children and a coffee stop with seating. Some great views of the eye and skyline as well as the lark itself and water.

Sit on the grass and watch the sights. Having picked up a picnic at Borough Market we made our way down to St. James Park. Cafe stop for a coffee and then found a spot on the grass to watch the world go by - tip! - find a spot in front of Horseguards as that is the path for the handovers of the Guards during the day and the horses and riders are always a lovely sight to see. In the hubbub of London this is a lovely spot to just sit and be !

Lovely oasis in the middle of the city. St. James Park is a lovely green space that runs into Buckingham Palace at one end. It has a main path running around the perimeter and several that run across the park. A central large pond is home to a variety of waterfowl, including swans, and beautiful flowers abound. Large expanses of grass provide space for picnicking or lounging, with plenty of trees for shade. It makes a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the city streets.
Family park trip. Cane here with family and kids . . Beautiful surroundings deck chairs available for ok price close to toilets they are 20p a visit which is quite annoying when you have little kids

Perfect for a wander & for wildlife. Probably one of my favourite green parks in London, it's simply perfect for picnics and walks, kids and adults alike. Enjoy the beautiful water fowl and river, grab an ice cream, watch the world go by, watch out for the cheeky squirrels who like to steal your sandwiches!! Spring is probably my favourite time for going, I really enjoy all the daffodils and exquisite flowers amongst all the wildlife. So nice :)
nice walk through the park. very good walk through the park very clean and tidy loads of people walking around on a great sunny day

Quintessentially British and proud!. A beautiful example of Britains' natural beauty, manicured to perfection and royally look after. Walk through the park and imagine yourself as one of the priveleged few! St James's Park is the oldest Royal Park in London and is surrounded by three palaces so a fantastic place to absorb all of Englands' rich (some would say horrible) history. You can see the most ancient Westminster, which has now become the Houses of Parliament, St James's Palace and of course, the most famous, Buckingham Palace. Great photo opportunities to be had here in this beautiful park.
Peaceful in the Heart of London. This park is so pretty and well kept. It is great for couples or families and the wildlife is amazing. It is a really peaceful place right in the centre of the city.
Nice place for a stroll!. Great place for a stroll! Spend an afternoon..eat great food...feed the birds and stop to see Buckingham Palace!

Nice place for a peaceful stroll. This is one of London's havens of tranquility. When you are crossing the bridge over the lake there is a nice view of the London eye to one side and of Buckingham Palace on the other side.
Wonderful sight. We enjoyed walking over the bridge it was a wonderful sight...a must see! We enjoyed the views from the bridge and just kept on walking from there.
Beautiful Grounds. We visited London and mostly walked everywhere from our the Hampton by Hilton in Waterloo, we loved the walk in St. James park to Buckingham Palace. Very nice afternoon stroll

lovely park. Lovely park to go for a walk or relax in, it does get quite bust in the summer months though and can feel a little crowded, but then your in a city of 8 million people so what do you expect.

Joy in the middle of London. Even with the thunder of joggers pounding past you, sometimes thoughtlessly two abreast, this is still a lovely park for a gentle walk. Watch the pelicans and any number of exotic ducks. Sniff the flowers. Watch small children and Japanese tourists marvel at squirrels. Admire the way in which the park has put places to buy ice cream and lunch in elegant wood cabins which blend with the park. Sit on a bench and reflect on how lucky we are to have it.

Beautiful park that to walk and relax!. One of the beauties of London is being in a large capital city that is filled with green, lush parks! During a busy day of sightseeing at Buckingham Palace and other tourist sights, we walked through St. James' Park. Just sit down on the grass and people watch; grab lunch or a snack at one of the numerous deli's (Pret a Manger was our favorite!) and dine al fresco! Very relaxing and this will give you an energy boost to continue your sightseeing!

Mad for it. I am simply mad about St James Park and always try to walk through it when in central London, each season so different, each season always beautiful.On this occasion my friend and I had lunch at Inn in Park. Small plates of Smoked haddock, cauliflower, curry & lime (£6.50) and Charred octopus & jersey royals (£ 8.00) and a glass of wine each, were more than sufficient and perfect for a break in the day. It is busy there but seems to flow along well. I recommend it.

Nice Park but have to pay to use toilets! . This is a nice Park in central London close to Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square and other famous London landmarks. It's a nice place to relax amongst the hustle and bustle of London. There are places to buy snacks and ice creams. There are also deck chairs but you have to pay to hire them. One of the main downsides was that you have to pay 20p to use the toilet.Overall a very nice park in Central London that's worth visiting.
Pleasant place for a walk. I went for a walk in the park after a meeting in London. It is clean, well maintained and gave a good chance to get some air after a day in a meeting room.
Beautiful. Our hotel was close by and we walked through here at least once every day of our stay. I found it relaxing and beautiful.

Just beautiful. Having a day in London, we took our picnic with us and had it in the park. The park is so well kept. Because we wanted to see other things whilst in London, we didn't spend too much time here which was a shame.

My most beautiful walk in the world.. This is the most beautiful park to walk through inn London. I walk through every day on the way to work. It changes every day. Something new to see. If I was a visitor to London I most certainly visit this park every day.

Walked through the park after lunch. Fed a squirrel, Very peaceful.. After lunch at Cay Tre, We walked through Gerrard street and onto Leicester square and onto the park. Stopped by for a coffee at the small kiosk at the entrance and sat on a bench for an hour in front of the pond. Walked through and fed a squirrel and an angry goose or duck that grabbed the acorn from my hand. Lovely experience and would go again.

Lovely Gardens and ponds with plenty of wild birds. An exciting walk through these great park, peaceful and picturesque.This is fun for all the family, stretches from Buckingham palace all the way down to Horseferry Parade
Beautiful Walk. This is a very pretty place to take a leisurely walk. The swans in the water are so elegant and pretty to see. The gardens are beautiful.

Breathtaking park in London. St James's park is lovely, very tranquil, and has so much to offer. It's a great option for an afternoon walk, rain or shine. The animals, the flowers, and trees are beautiful.

Lovely place. Beautiful park, Lots of squirrels & ducks about and the pelicans. Lovely place to walk around anytime of the time, especially first thing in the morning as the city comes alive. Only wish we lived closer to London, Would definitely be a regular visitor to this park. One of my favourite places in London
Pretty to find green park space in the city. We walked through on the way to somewhere else and it was an oasis of green in the city. Hard to believe London used to be so green.

One of my favourite parks. This tiny park always makes me dream while I am awake, every time that I am there. It is just beautiful. And it is located in front of Buckingham palace. Lord Byron used to go to St James's park and write, when he was in London.
Very nice walk. Very nice and relaxing walk in central London. Get away from the hustle and bustle. Great way to travel between some of london's sights.

Stunning Park. We stumbled across this beautiful park while walking from Buckingham Palace to the Thames. This is a true natural beauty with gorgeous gardens and tons of friendly wildlife! There are lots of different varieties of ducks, geese and birds. There are even pelicans and huge swans. You may also see squirrels come right up to people! This is a very safe environment with families picnicking and playing sports on the lawn. It's nice to spend some time relaxing in the park, but a quick stroll through between main London attractions will suffice.

Very attractive park and views. Very attractive park and views close to Buckingham palace. People are stationed outside the park to give directions to lost travellers.There is a pay toilet for 20p if you need facilities.A very pretty little water way and park with a bridge crossing it views are stunning.

Beware of the pelican!. I work just down the road and often come here for lunch with friends. This park is beautiful and a lovely place to be in the summer. Down side is there is a lot of wildlife that want to join you for your picnic and steal your food. Although its pretty funny
Lovely walk in the sun . Many pigeons which make picnics less relaxing Many different ducks and geese Fabulous Pelicans ( very unexpected ) It's good to walk around the lake

A nice casual walk. We enjoyed walking through St. James's Park and Green Park between our hotel and the Churchill War Rooms. It has a couple of really good views, it is quite pretty, and my husband thought the coffee from the coffee stand was pretty good.

A lovely open area to relax, and also close to important London sights. St James's is a fantastic park, not just because you can relax for a few hours (if it's not raining!), but also that it is near so many important and fascinating historical sites.
Beautiful Gardens. worth a visit to the gardens all the wildlife that is there, you wouldnt quite believe it was in the centre of london
Nicest park in London. Beautiful park to relax in and watch the world go by, feed the ducks, admire the fountains and smell the flowers. Great views of Buckingham Palace too.

The Best in London. London boasts a lot of green space however this park is my favorite. I find myself able to relax, just enjoying the children and the swans in the lake. I come here at least once on every visit, weather it's business or holiday. I've found this to be a respite from the hustle and bustle of my day.
Relaxing times. Atmosphere is very relaxing and welcoming. There is also a place where you can eat and drink. There is a lot of birds you can feed, you can also find cute little squirrels.

very tranquil and nice. a great place to stroll around or to sit back and enjoy people watching and a picnic PLEASE as always KEEP LONDON TIDY there are plenty of trashbins around so dont litter the park and let others enjoy it as well nice place to play with the little ones if you have them and lots of beautiful plantings to see and enjoy

So Beautiful and Inviting on a Sunny Summer Day. We walked through this park more than once on our stay in London! It is free and a must see! Lovely in every way, especially at the end of a summer day. There are many people in there having picnics and drinks and was fun to see all the locals enjoying life!

A beautiful park down the palace.. It was an amazing experience walking in the park and around it. It's very green, having a lot of squirrels and trees. There is a small pond with ducks too. You are able to lay down and have a small nap if you like. There are small convenient stores around the park where you can get water or something cool to drink. There are not a lot of trash cans around the area so you need to keep your trash and throw them away when you find one. I was smoking and thankfully I had a can with me to throw inside the cigarettes.

Used to be my favorite place in London. During the beginning of 2000 it was no-question for our family where to spend nice sunny day. The park is gorgeous and all the birds there, and squirrels and the lake- my son was happy to be there. This years I prefer Regent park or Kensington gardens. Unfortunately St. James park is overcrowded nowadays and I feel pity for the birds there,
Beautiful location and well maintained. A real pleasure to visit--great playground for the kids and a beautiful pond that kept my young boys happy for hours and hours!

Beautiful and great band!. This is one of my favourite parks. The lake is beautiful with lots of different birds on and off the water. There is lots of open space so great for kids to have a run around. You can hire a deckchair or just sit on the grass by the bandstand and listen to the music. Fabulous on a sunny day :-)

Beautiful Place to visit. Beautiful surroundings with lovely floral arrangements & lake, a perfect setting for a place to sit & relax or just a family picnic all within walking distance of the main attractions. However make sure you have a few 20p Coins to operate the Toilet Turnstiles !!

Lovely park. Really pretty, well maintained park near Buckingham Palace. Lots of mature shade trees and a pretty bridge over the water. Water bids and swans were there, raising their young. It was a lovely place to visit.
Beautiful Park Experience. On a pleasant weekend afternoon, you'll see the Brits do "park" like we've forgotten how in the U.S.!

Nice. Took out little girl here, she loved it just watching squirrels n ducks,we went on a hot Saturday afternoon so it was very busy but still easy to walk around.long que for the ladies toilet n It cost 20 pence. It's a nice walk to or from Buckingham palace.

Pokemon Go. Took my son to St James Park so he could do some walking and play Pokemon Go (eyes rolling here from the mother!) as you'd expect from a park in central London it's beautifully cared for and a sanctuary from the busy roads. Loved the Diana Memorial Gardens and more importantly that adults HAD to be accompanied by a child. I really felt my son was safe in there. He had a great time on Pokemon, I enjoyed the people watching and beautiful surroundings to read a book.
Beautiful breathing spot in the city. The air feels so fresh in the park compared to the city. A good spot for a break or a picnic. It's a nice park.
Delightful park near the palace. The park is huge and took me a good amount of time to cover it. If you are with your partner, it is definitely worth spending a couple of hrs.

Beautiful Park. We wandered through here after we saw the changing of the guard. It's right in front of Buckingham palace and is just beautiful. The animals are incredibly tame in there you can walk past people having squirrels eating out of the palm of their hands.

Beautiful walk. Had a lovely sunny day to walk through the park and it was beautiful. Not too crowded. Lots of seating. Interesting birds. We were returning from Buckingham Palace and the public toilets and places to buy drinks were handy after the waiting around.
Relaxing. This is the place to relax and have a lush ice cream, there are deck chairs to hire or just lay on the grass, great view of Buckingham palace,

Sun and St. James. Don't miss an opportunity to walk around this beautiful park, especially on a sunny day. See its monuments, its rivers, its greenery and the many species of birds and other animals that call this park their home.

Let time drift by.. This is a great park with the lake and lots of wildlife. Situated between Parliament and Buckingham Palace it is an ideal rest-stop for anyone wanting to see both. There are number of benches and plenty of trees to give shade from the sun if you want to sit on the grass. There are swans, geese, ducks and squirrels for children to watch and feed. If you want to relax, find a seat and watch the world walk by.
Fantastic relaxing parl. I love walking around St James Park. Usually pretty busy with tourists due to its location, but one can still find a nice spot to sit and have a think!!

Rus in urbe.. A chance to get away from (most) of the crowds and enjoy some peace and (fairly) quiet. Lots of birdlife, plenty of shady trees, just about impossible to get lost and with Buck House at one end and Horseguards at the other, excellent. Oh and it is FREE.

A beautiful peaceful retreat right in the heart of London. A beautiful, peaceful park to walk around and see the wildlife or just sit and catch your breath during a busy day. I took my grandson to London as a 7th birthday treat and we had a picnic in St James' s Park. He loved seeing and feeding the squirrels and birds and it was a nice break from our full day of sight seeing.

Lovely park in the heart of the city. Very pretty with lovely views. Relaxing and quiet with lots of seating and open spaces to walk around. Perfect for a picnic.Fantastic way to unwind after sightseeing. Never tire of walking in St James's Park. It has a special feel to it.

Heaven on earth. I spent a good amount of time in London for work several years ago. My favorite place on the planet that I have experienced thus far is St. James Park. I don't know why it is so special. The beauty, the fascinating and sometimes funny variety of waterfowl - who love to be fed and whom I love to feed - the sense of peace in the midst of a great city...perhaps the greatest ever on earth. From the bridge over the waterway, it is a sublime juxtaposition of old, new, and post-modern London. Green, gold, and blue parkland and waterway in the foreground, the historic architecture in the middle view, and - rising above it all - the London Eye, with its message of an ever-evolving and adapting city. I am visiting in October for the first time in years and am so excited be staying close to the park. I plan to be there as often as possible.

Excellent retreat. Even though it's located close to Big Ben, I was glad it wasn't overcrowded even during nicest summer days. It's not too big, it's cosy and just beautiful. Every time I'm not too far I try to pop in and enjoy it.
Place to chill. Despite being very busy with people it is easy to find a spot to relax on the grass in this Royal park, and watch the birds and occasional squirrel.
Nice place to do nothing. Wonderful park to lay about or go for a walk, Plenty of joggers and runners. No bikes are allowed though,
Lovely park in London . Walked around lake and strolled through the park. Excellent flower borders and lots of wildlife. Very busy summers day but nice to see people enjoying themselves.

Just ok.. We walked the park from end to end. It is big but not really impressive. Maybe we walked too fast and were in a hurry. Maybe our experience would have been better if we had more time to just rest and sit in the park.

Lovely place to walk relax or have a nap on the grass!!. We had an awesome afternoon walking around and resting on the grass at st James park while we waited for our hotel room to get ready!! It was a god send given we were so tired from travel.

calm, quiet and very relaxing. We had an hour in St James' Park to relax after a busy day sightseeing and it was a lovely way to unwind before the journey back to our hotel. The park has stunning views of Buckingham Palace and the London Eye. It is teeming with wildlife, including heron and pelicans. Great place for a coffee and a squirrel count :)

Very pretty park with lots of wild life and plently of seating and open spaces.. Great for wandering, enjoying the wild life and plenty of space for games and picnics. Lots of seating too which was lovley for people watching!

Nice walk to the palace. Walked through this park on our way from Parliament to Buckingham Palace. In my opinion this is just an average, well kept park but the entrance/exit view puts this park into a different category. There was a little place we purchased refreshments next to a child's play area which was a nice area on the water to take a break.
Yes, yes and yes!!. I enjoy very much this place! It's great, beautiful and very cool to have a break walking hours in the city or just having lunch!

Lovely park, but very busy and a bit dirty due to abundance of wildlife. Took a walk through and stopped for a coffee. Lovely place, but the paths, seats and grass are very dirty due to abundance of birds and wildlife...could do with a clean up considering its prominent place.

Lovely . Well kept...nice summer evenings stroll. Lovely , a sit down with a nice cup of tea watching the ducks, the swans and the people. Toilets were clean too. One small gripe. The girl's serving the teas were more interested in chatting to their friends than serving and unfortunately it wasn't service with a smile...more about case of " I'd rather be chatting than serving you tea"! Other than that it was a lovely end to a busy day sightseeing.

Amazing park, feels like a countryside retreat in a city.. This is an amazing place to relax and grab a picnic spot between tourist spots. Its clean and has enough space for shade or sunbathing in the British Summer Sun. Wonderful.
Nice one. Maybe not the best park in London in my opinion but still really nice, with a lot of ducks, squirrels, (and people unfortunately !!)

Fabulous . What a beautiful Park this is. Plenty of places to get snacks,drinks and ice cream. The vans generally take cards too, so you can still get a coffee if you don't have any cash!The playground is well sign posted,and kids can easily spend a couple of hours there. Beautiful place in the heart of the city, we are very lucky.

Walk through this magical place on my daily commute. I walk through this park twice a day to/from work and I find it one of the most magical places in London. If you have one park you want to visit in London, St James has much to offer and is extremely near central locations.

Trooping of the Colour. We go every year no matter what the weather. Always get a good view of all the Royal Family and the wonderful horses and guardsmen. Makes you proud to be British! We take our lunch and after the flyover sit under a tree in the lovely park.

Beautiful park. . If you have time to just meander through this park you really should. Ideal place to have a picnic lunch when the weather is good. Lots of shade for when it's very hot...like when I was there! The lake is idyllic. Close to Downing Street one end and Buckingham Palace the other so it's ideal to slot in with sight seeing.

big park. Crossed St James Park on our way to Hyde Park and Kensington Garden. Beautiful park and no squirrels in sight. Hay fever flaired up a little but manageable. Walked leisurely on the path, keeping an eye out for the speedy bicyclists zooming by. Park is maintained well. Feels fresh amongst the trees.
A great way to enjoy a sunny day. Fantastic place, wonderful for sunny days to relax and enjoy the leafy surroundings, great with the kids to unwind, and rest.

This was perfect. Just perfect.. We stopped here on our way to the changing of the guards and then after as well. The weather was beautiful so that helped obviously but it was just enchanting. From the little family of ducks at the pond to the lounge chairs and food vendors that were readily available, it was perfect for an afternoon or even just a few minutes to sit and catch your breath. Little tip though, some of the restrooms require change to enter.

Lovely park, quite and peaceful lots of wildlife. Really great park, feels safe, clean quite and with plenty of tame wildlife using its lake, its kept in good shape its a real oasis in London and is a great cut through to Westminster, The palace, the mall, and st james street onto the west end.

Picturesque Views. After a delightful day touring and walking around London, we ended our day at the St. James Park and found ourselves some shade. Almost any angle gave us beautiful views of many famous London landmarks. It was so calm and peaceful to relax in the park, watch some ducks float by, and recline on the grass. After the hustle and bustle of a busy London day it was just what I needed.
Amazing park... Amazing park and green space right in front of Buckingham Palace which is a must do with a meander at your leisure. Whole family will enjoy and its free and fresh air.
Tranquail. There is no better place in London to unwind, brink a picnic basket and spend the day at St James Park
Just beautiful!. Beautiful park! So green and so many flowers! A lovely trail between the Horse Guards and Buckingham Palace.

Love this place!. This is by far my most favorite park in London. The variety of birds is incredible and the squirrels are so cute and friendly. All the animals will eat out of your hand.
The view of Buckingham Palace is gorgeous from the bridge. The park is extremely clean and all people seem polite; both locals and visitors :)
Beautiful . This a lovely Park for a stroll, site seeing, picnic etc. If you are in the are take a stroll and some pictures.

Love it!. Every time when I visit London I go to St James's Park to have a rest and see the squarrels. They are great :) This time we just came and one of them came to me, she (or he) thought I have peanuts.
Nice place for a walk or to have a rest
Little gem. Loved walking through this green oasis looking at the gardens. The cottage with it's fruit and veg show what can be done in a very small place.

One of the best parks in London. St James's park is amazing. It has various landmark attractions closely. You are moments from Buckingham Palace, The Mall, Trafalgar Square, Horse Guards Parade, Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey and Palace and Downing Street. the park is beautiful in the summer months and gets busy especially when the sun shines over London. The bridge in the middle of the park has views to Buckingham palace to the West and the London Eye and Horse Guards Parade in the East. The bridge gets busy but the views are picture postcard perfect. At the moment there is some jars around London for the BFG film and a charity and there is always one or two dotted around the park Piccadilly is not that far from the park its a ten minute walk away.
Lovely park. Nice walk through to Buckingham palace. Well maintained, food stalls to buy a lunch from and sit in the park to eat. Lovely views.
Nice London Park. This is a very nice London park. It has a lot of nature and is a nice place to walk through at least once during your London visit.

Relaxing yet vibrant park. The park is a beautiful place to sit and relax. It is very busy in the summer on the walking paths but take a few steps off and find a piece of grass to relax in. Watching the birds and also doing some people can be quite relaxing. It is close by too a few big attractions and a much cheaper spot to have a picnic than the restaurants or pubs nearby.

Beautiful all year round. As this park sits in front of the palace they take really good care of it. I was working 5 minutes away from it for over a year so had the facility to visit it at all the different times of year. In the summer it's packed with tourists but the best time by far is in spring when they do the flower beds with tulips. The colours are quite breathtaking.

Have a picnic or a lunchbreak. St. James's Park is ideal for a refreshing walk or to find a spot on the grass to enjoy your day meal and relax in case of sunny weather. Also don't be surprised to see the squirrels around you! :)
so many birds to see.. A relaxing corner away from the bustle of London. Lots of birds, squirrels to see and people watching.

Great walk to the Buckingham Palace. St. James Park is a beautiful park situated in front of the Buckingham Palace. It is a really nice place to relax and observe the several birds that once formed a zoo.

Beautiful park. This is clearly a park for everyone in the city, tourists and residents alike. Always restful to walk along the water, see the spectacular flowers and enjoy the company of other families.
Beautiful spot for a wander. I come through here a lot. It is a beautiful park, and great for practicing photography. It is also a great spot to see the NYE fireworks

Beautiful Park in the Centre of London. Great to relax and people watch with major attractions a short distance away. Ice cream and snacks available throughout the park. For good photographs go to the bridge in the center of the park with views of the Palace and London Eye.

Must see. Its just like Central park in NYC, a great walk especially on a nice day. Great views of Buckingham Palace and the Great Wheel. You can feed the birds. It’s of Like most places in Europe the bathrooms in the park aren't free.

A beautiful walk on a gorgeous summer day.. After taking in the changing of the guard at the Horse Guards Palace we strolled through St James's Park to Buckingham Palace. The gardens were in full bloom. The ice cream sold by the vendor's was tasty and the leisurely stroll made for a nice interlude in our quest to see the sights of London.

Another's Great Park from England. If there's anything I love about England, it's its parks. This park is definitely a great area to wander if you visit London and need a breather for a bit while enjoying a nice scenery filled with flower of different kinds, birds, and a beautiful pond.
Long relaxing walking! . We had a lovely relaxing walking across Hyde Park and St James Park to reach the Big Ben! It's a beautiful place where you can spend a nice Saturday afternoon walking around!

Just a great park in London.. Always having a nice time when relaxing in the park. Central location, wildlife is blooming. Kids having fun feeding squirrels and ducks. Just an oasis in the middle of the city.

Wow! The gardens are amazing. We took so many photos here. There are numerous gardens, swans, birds and a cute café with the friendliest staff. Food was good and is probably the only bathroom in the area by the way. Bathrooms are a commodity in London

a breathtaking park. St Jame's Park is truly breathtaking, whether you want to sit and catch up with friends, feed the ducks or go for a walk this park is ideal for all. There is a long walk round the pond and near Buckingham palace which is ideal on a hot day, if you don't feel like walking that far though there is a cafe where you can get a coffee and watch the world go by or just sit on the grass and take in your surroundings. The good thing about this park is how well maintained this park is and when your walking there are sign posts round everywhere telling you how many minutes it would take to walk to certain places which I personally think is a good idea. Overall this park suits all peoples needs and is worth a visit.

Another great park. This is another great park, of course not as big as Hyde Park but surely one of the more cute pars. Lots of wildlife and a great place for a picnic. It leads out to Buckingham Palace if you are interested in looking out for the Queen.

A nice oasis. While walking to Buckingham Palace, took a pause to explore St. James's Park. As with the many other parks in London, it was a wonderful retreat - especially on the sunny summer day that we were able to enjoy.

Relaxing. It was nice ending the day walking around. Seeing the sites without all the crowds. If you listen when the time is right, you can hear Big Ben chime, so you can get lost in the moment without losing track of time.

View from the park. Walking through the St. James's Park is beautiful. We saw Buckingham Palace from afar, with white swans and ducks in the water. And also lots of squirrels. So in the park you can watch real animals and do Pokémon go too. ;-)
Pleasent park. Great to walk around and lots of ice cream vans/coffee etc if you need a snack. Buckingham Palace is on the north end of the park as well
Great for a Picnic. Another one of London's great parks and wonderful for a picnic or just a relaxing walk. There is just so much to see.

Beautiful park, definitely worth strolling through.. Walked through St James Park on our way between Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey and I'm so glad we did! Beautiful peaceful park with lots of birds to watch such as swans and ducks. Would highly recommend to others looking to experience London's green spaces.

Just beautiful!. We were lucky to have fine weather whilst in London and it was wonderful to walk around this park in such beautiful weather. There were plenty of birds to see and wonderful large trees. Loved the little house which belonged to the original bird watcher so many years ago. Quite close to lots of tourist places. Stumbled on it by accident and so glad we did.
Nice greenery. Nice greenery away from the crowd. You will enjoy nature in the middle of a big city. Not overly crowded.
My teenagers loved it!. We wandered around and enjoyed the beautiful gardens, birds and scenery. The gate house was extraordinary and reminded us of a fairy tale house!

People and Swan watching. Favorite park in London - full of waterbirds, flowers and in the summer lots of tourists like me. You can start on the palace end and work your way towards the Horseguards. Stop for an ice cream and take your ease on a bench or recline on the grass.

one of the best parks in London but full of tourists. It is a very nice park to walk, full of flowers, trees, river with ducks and other birds, but it is near the palace, so it has a lot of tourists. This is the only problem if you want to walk in the nature feeling calm.
The Most Beautiful Park in London. In my opinion this is the most beautiful park in Londos, despite is not the biggest. Also it does not seem to be crowded as others.
Pleasant. Very nice park where you can relax after entire touring day. Unfortunately, beach chairs you can fin din there are not free of charge!
Splendid . A lovely park indeed lots to see and explore. Perfect for couples aswell as families. Can have great picnics or strolls in the park.

Breath of Oxygen. A mouthful of oxygen in the midst of a chaotic London and plenty of traffic. At the foot of the most magnificent monuments, there is this piece of paradise with lake trees, fountains and animals to admire. Beautiful meetings with the squirrels who come without fear of man. small but lovely gardens.

Beautiful and full of history. St James park has the amazing mix of office workers from the government and private offices, local families and the never ending tourists moving down pall mall and the park from Trafalgar or from the Palace ends. The guide books list the many historic features as there are very many to see but to me it is the fascinating mix of peoples I find truly wonderful. Just saw yesterday a juggler practicing, next to a family picnic with their two children and office worker trying to get a tan, what an eclectic mix in the middle of London!
Gorgeous. Fabulous place to chill and relax. A bit of peace and tranquility in a very busy city. Love watching the pelicans and admiring the flower beds.

Relaxing.. A real oasis in all the hustle and bustle of the West End. Have a relaxing stroll through the park after watching the changing of the guard. Watch and listen to the birds while having a relaxing cup of tea or coffee, and then carry on with your stroll.
Beautiful. Beautiful park, usually quiet. Neautiful flowers and wildlife. Wonderul for a stroll for fresh air or great pictures!
Relax in central London. This park connects Parliament and buckingham palace. Walk through the park to get a bit of relaxation. Sit by the lake and enjoy an ice cream

Small but perfectly formed. This spring the cherry blossom in St James' Park was wonderful and, although more crowded at this time of year, I enjoyed a leisurely summer walk. I love the location of the park, so close to the Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace and Whitehall. St James' park is full of birds in the trees and on the river. I just stretched my legs and had an ice cream. Half an hour is all you need or an hour if you walk at a leisurely pace from Parliament Square to Buckingham Palace.
buitiful park. good walk lots of different plants to see plus people riding on skates and kids playing in great big trees

Favourite park. This park is a must if you like all the swans. There always seems to be more bird life and squirrels here than at Hyde park. There isn't a lot of facilities but just enough to to be able to relax on the grass with a cold drink.
Nice park. Walk through on the way to Buckingham Palace. See the Pelicans and geese.Alternatively you may wish to walk up the Mall to BP and see St James on your way back to Big Ben
Lovely park. Very beautiful relaxed park full with flowers . It was nice to walk through and beside the lake and let your soul free .Do not forget to pass the memorial of the second war .

Great Park for an Afternoon Stroll. Between Westminster Abbey and Buckingham Palace, this beautiful park is a wonderful walk to keep the fussy baby entertained. First giggle we had all day was watching the ducklings dive under the water. The parks playgrounds and cafe's are very nice and everyone is friendly there. The playground is a great place for the adults to rest their feet while the kids run off their excess energy. The food is pricy but not surprising since it is the equivalent of amusement park fare (and the food looks a bit tastier than what you'd expect at Six Flags). It's also a great place for a picnic and people watching if you'd like to save a few bucks on feeding the brood, I know I will be remembering that for next time.

Just Beautiful. This is my favourite park in London. It's just beautiful. the lake, the ducks all over the place and the tree shadows make it so peaceful. Love going for a stroll or just relax under a tree enjoying the breeze.

London in a jewel box. If you only have an afternoon in London come here and stand on the bridge in the middle of it. This is a small but perfectly formed park with views of Buckingham palace to west, and Horseguards and Whitehall to the east. The fine palaces along the Mall make St James's the most elegant and historic walk in London.
Beautiful walk. One of the most beautiful parks in London, very nice for walks, or sport, or just to relax. Nice place to spend you time with family or friends.

The oldest park in London a treat to walk round!. The oldest park in London, aquired by Henry VIII in 1532. It is a lovely easy park to walk round with varied shrubs and flowers together with a large cross section of birds and some animals in and around the water features. Also it is centrally placed and was originally bounded by 3 palaces: Buckingham Palace, St Jame's Palace and Westminster Palace (now the Houses of Parliment). Also provides easy close walking access to Westminster Abbey, New Scotland Yard, HM Treasury, 10 Downing Street, Pall Mall, Saville Row, The Strand and a whole host of other interesting iconic London locations. I used to work close by and would often walk through the park during my lunch break.
Beautiful oasis!. Beautiful park and nice place to rest between stops or just to enjoy a rest or picnic lunch. Lots of shade if it is a particularly hot day as well!
Our favourite park. St James Park is our favourite park in London. Pretty views towards Buckingham palace and of London eye when on bridge.

A Royal Park. A London visit is not complete without visiting a Royal Park. St James's Park is a lovely place to sit and chat on a sunny day, take a picnic and listen to the bands playing, usually on rotation in the summer months.

Peaceful, restful, beautiful place to chill. Absolutely love this park. It's big, but has a layout that means you can usually find a quiet spot to have lunch or read a book etc without too much interruption. Well kept and the ducks will keep you amused if you just want to watch the world go by. Probably my favourite London park.
Magnificent. The day was beautiful, the scent from the flowers was incredible. Everything was perfection, take some nuts to feed the squirrels who will come to eat from your hands.

Lovely park. You must walk through this lovely park and take pictures on the bridge of Buckingham Palace at the end of the gorgeous lake with swans and all sorts of birds in the foreground. This is a lovely green space in busy London to hire a deck chair and watch the world go by.
Beautiful. Great for a walk with family, friends, and loved ones. There's a lot of people daily and the ice cream is absolutely delicious.

Absolutely gorgeous park!. One of the most beautiful parks in the world. Don't miss it! Many outstanding photo ops, especially the lake with ducks and swans. Some benches, although most people sit on grass.

A perfect evening . This park is very beautiful. We spent a lovely evening here. By the water and watching the ducks. Lots of squirrels around and there were people feeding them. We had nothing on us. But you can spend an hour or so here to relax a bit. There are lounge chairs available for a price. Toilets are also present

Stroll in the partk. Really nice park to walk and spend the afternoon after a hectic day at the city in London. Very close to all major moinumets and attractions and full of vibrant people and scenery. Very recommendable also is the cafeteria at the park.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful place to relax. There are a lot of different paths within the park and it's a shortcut to a lot of place.
Everyone has fun. It's pretty, the guard might come by, birds, flowers--just pleasant and surrounded by important interesting landmarks--
Amazing trip with kids. One of the best places i enjoyed in london with my kids, i would advise to offer some foods and parks shopping center.

A Lovely Park to Rest. After a tiring fast walk to catch up the Changing the Guard ceremony, taking a leisure walk along this beautiful park in the fall is very relaxing. If you are visiting the Royal London, don't forget to breathe in the Royal Park before continuing the journey!

Perfect place for a pic-nic in the heat!. Sat on the grass, under one of the many trees, to enjoy our packed lunch. Despite the huge number of other people there during the summer holidays there was still plenty of space to enjoy with children. Great children's park (with tiny toilets) up the Buckingham Palace end of the park - perfect!

Good place to walk and to relax as you are going from Buckingham to somewhere else.. It's just like most parks in major cities. Some sections with people lounging around and other sections with birds and fountains.

A Royal Gem of a park. A tranquil green space in the centre of the city You can stroll by the lakeside and watch the ducks geese, swans and general fowl, as well as relax in a deck chair and watch the world go by, it's a Perfect lazy Sunday! Feeding of the Pelicans as they on the rocks is between 2 and 3pm, a little gem of a park
Cygnets. July is perfect time to stroll along St James's Park and see the wonderful young cygnets. There are also numerous young cygnets in nearby Hyde Park. I have attached a photo.

Walk through park. Just walked through to avoid crowds around BP watching changing of the guards. Good coffee stations friendly staff but not keen on paying 20 p for spending a penny, had no change and change machine out of order so spent 50p for the service which was a woman rushing ladies through a turnstile 'quick, quick quick go ,go ,go .Not that clean either.

Lovely stroll through the parks in the heart of London. Enjoy St James Park in the heart of London, its great to stop for a short stroll or to soak up some sun on a hot day. There's lots of wildlife to see on the river, and plenty of trees to go under for shade.
A lovely walk. If a nature lover, you will love the greenery, the bridges, the water birds and a good collection of London dogs in the Park. It is a beautiful park to spend some time.
Nice!. First time we went escorted by Angus of Sandeman's tours. It was time well spent and we recommend going there.

Lovely little park in the middle of the chaos !. Having lived and worked in London for a couple of years a long while back, I remembered how you are able to grab a little piece of tranquillity just yards from all the hustle and bustle of the Mall, Horse Guards etc so when we went for a trip last month we spent a lovely hour wandering around the park. Great place to find some shade and relative peace whilst you have a sandwich or just sit and enjoy the wildlife.

A great park. A great parkwe had a picnic in this park with one of my friend from London. A very big park with trees, grasses and a large lake having many birds on. The most interesting part was having sightseeing boat of 2 people. £18/person

Sunday stroll with the Grandparents. For a few sundays in a row we have enjoyed a lazy sunday stroll through the park with a couple of overly excited pre-schoolers. There is so much to see and do here all for free. It makes for a perfect outing with the little ones. You could also make this an educational trip by naming the buildings and the wildlife. It is also a perfect place to walk off a sunday lunch and let the little ones burn off all that energy. We love coming here. I remember frequenting this park as a child and i am very glad to share this experience with my children. It is quite literally a perfect family day out. Next time i think we shall bring a picnic and make a day of it.

A Beautiful Place for a Stroll. Just in case your travelling shoes have a few more steps in them, I would high suggest a stroll through St. James Park... the grounds are lovely and, if you are lucky, you might get a peek at a black swan.
Nice park. We cut across St. James park on our way to Buckingham Palace, and were pleased with an afternoon in the park as the sun was going down and the day was cooling off.

What a place to have a stroll in a quite area w. It's great there. I went on a Sunday morning they were practising for some Royal occasion author the horses etc. Sitting by the water reading the Sunday paper just brilliant.

Beautiful!. Working hard to stay awake our first day, I was very tempted to lie down in the park! It looked so inviting but I knew I would fall asleep! The walk kept me awake and filled my senses with beauty and tranquility.

Stunning park in the centre of London. This is an incredible gem of a park in London, very close to Buckingham Palace, this park offers some world class views. Recommend anyone who wants to witness beauty in the manic and rushed world of London to go here to feel you entered a different magical world.

Beautiful . Never been to this park before - my 1st visit here & what a beautiful park it is. It's perfect for a walk, run, picnic, dog walking or just people watching...... Definitely a must when in London!
Nice little hidden gem!. Chilled out here on the way back from having a look at Buckingham Palace. Nice little play area for kids, with a café to one side., Sweet!

Absolutely delightful!!!. Just the perfect location to have a lunch and laze around.Beautiful scenery and delightful sight of the ducks in the pond. Just a stone's throw from Buckingham Palace, Parliament square, Westminster etc. Just like a dream on a summer's day.

Relaxing in the shadow. Weather in London in July can be very hot, in such days St James's Park represents an oasis whre to sit on a bench whatching the birds on the lake. Very relaxing, it is my favourite Park in London
Pretty park.. We walked through this and we liked it - very busy , lots of pigeons. Nice place to kick you shoes off, have an ice cream and people watch.
Lovely park. Amazing natural park in the middle of london. Lots of feathered friends and cute little squirrels. Despite plenty do not feed the ducks or pigeon signs posted, people are not obeying.
Beautiful Park. A place not to miss. Exceptional walk through this park. Do yourself a favor and be sure a make this a destination on your trip to London. More beautiful the second time around.

Very pretty park - full of beautiful birds and flowers.. Lovely shaded trees, beautiful little ponds and fountains - wild life everywhere and around the corner from Buckingham palace. A nice place for a stroll, to people watch, to read or to eat your ice cream.

Lovely Park.. My Wife and I enjoyed visiting this park between venues in London.
Think we had as much fun tracking the Wild Animals as we did the events we were to see!

Great walk from Buckingham Palace to Churchill War Rooms. If the weather is nice and you are going to the Churchill War Rooms, consider leaving early and walking to Buckingham Palace and then through St. James's Park to the War Rooms. St. James's Park station is the closest. However, you could to from either Hyde Park Corner or Green Park. It really gives you the feeling that you are in London.
Beautiful park at the heart of London . Have visited this park a lot this summer and it is just beautiful. Close to the centre of London and all of the historic buildings too...it is a gem of a park!
