Everywhere Beauty. The park is a nice quaint place in the heart of the city to have a picnic lunch. I love London and places such as this always reaffirm the admiration.

Very nice park and walk from Park Lane to Buckingham Palace. Very nice park, very nice walk from up Park Lane, by Picadilly, towards Buckingham Palace, nice area and surroundings, once there you can have a nice walk to Westminster Abbey area
Nice stroll. We could walk here from our Hotel in Kensington and continue wakling to other attractions. Like the muse

Escape the hustle and bustle of central London. A perfect location to enjoy a picnic, a leisurely drink/coffee and some summer sunshine.The gardens are attractive and being adjacent to Horse Guards Parade and The Mall the location offers a tranquil place for foot weary tourists and residents of London

Beautiful, but packed. a very beautiful park, I enjoyed taking the kids and picnicking and we all were very excited by seeing Buckingham Palace. we did visit on the hottest day of the year which did put a dampener on it a little bit. and spending £10 on 3 ice creams and a can of coke seemed a bit much but hay ho.
Tourist walks. A very nice walk through the park on the way to Buckingham Palce. Well laid out and very clean and tidy.

Lovely to walk through. Make time to walk through the lovely London Parks, especially if visiting in spring/summer. While busy there are places to find peaceful moments away from the hustle and bustle of tourist filled London.

Lovely green area in central London. You can visit this to sit somewhere and rest, look at birds and/or squirrels, or you can walk around in the green and pleasant environment - either is good.
The queue to get a snack, a lunch or an icecream is surprisingly short, given there are so many people around!
Such a stunning park. St. James Park is gorgeous! So pretty with a lot of greenery and nature. My husband and I truly enjoyed strolling through.

Nice park to walk through. We made a leisurely walk from Buckingham Palace back to the Horse Guards parade ground. The park is full of trees and grass and has a long pond full of all sorts of wildlife. It is a nice respite from all of the London traffic.

Beautiful. Wonderful day walking around Londonderry parks with st James park among the best. Leading to the Diana memorial fountain which was magical with all the children and adults enjoying the fun.

A quiet walk in the St James Park!. St James Park is a beautiful park from The Queen's Gate and Trafalgar Square to Buckingham Palace. The flowers were beautiful in late May and the park clean and inviting. So much better than walking down the street!
lovely day out in the sun. This area is fantastic for picnics but if the guards are changing it will quickly become packed. It is close to Victoria and Oxford street.

London Trips. Well what a lovely palace gardens, the public areas are well tended. For a picnic excellent location. There toilets and a cafe near the horse guards parade. There some days bands playing, the walk round the lake is lovely and worth it. Enjoy a time out.
Nice & relaxing. Very nice place to stroll through to escape the hustle and bustle of London. A great place to have a picnic.

The place to go for free wildlife enjoyment.. St James's Park is great if you crave access to wildlife while visiting one of the biggest urban centres of the world. Right in the middle of tourist central, it's nevertheless a quiet oasis of happy birdlife and cheeky squirrels. There were cygnets and fluffy little moorhen chicks when we were there, along with a huge variety of other water fowl. And the gardens are quite nice too.

Squirrels! And a lovely park. Lovely park for a walk, rest and play. Nice ice cream stands at all exits. Enjoy the green scene by the palace. And bring some nuts for the squirrels, they are shy, but do come to feed in the quiet mornings.

A park with a view!. Very nice park with a magical view over Whitehall! it looks like a fairytale!
Many birds and squirrels!!
Eat an icecream and enjoy!

Serene and Beautiful!. Serene, beautiful... you can spend hours sitting here or just walking inside it. Absolutely clean. Full of royal swans, varieties of ducks, storks and pelicans and they are all so relaxing to watch. Squirrels also in plenty!
I have been here plenty of times and still would love to go again. :)
A must visit!

Beautiful park in central location. This is without doubt a beautiful park with a lake and beautiful flower beds, benches, trees and lawns. There are an abundance of wildfowl on the lake, swans, geese, ducks, coots etc. all of which are very tame because of their exposure to people. The day in question was very hot, so every bench and most of the green space was taken up by people trying to cool off in the shade and that is the only downside, that it can be very crowded. If you are coming or going from looking at Big Ben or the Palace, this is a lovely stroll through Horse Guards gate to connect you to them both. Gets you away from the traffic and into some nature.
Not to be missed. St. James's Park is a lovely place to stroll. On weekends you can catch a free concert on the lawn or just relax a moment watching the lake or enjoying the gardens.

Beautiful oasis in Westminister. This is definitely a must see place on a sunny day. The park is beautiful and calming to walk through. It's a lovely oasis in the middle of the big city and perfect for a lunchbreak. A short walk and you're at Buckingham Palace. We were fortunate enough to arrive in the middle of the changing of the guard. Even if the park itself may not really be an attraction it's still worth the visit.
Wonderful. Always a wonderful relaxing place. Especially enjoyable this July in the heatwave London is experiencing. Excellent photographic angles of Buckingham Palace or city skylines.
Lovely place to visit. Great place to cool down with a walk amongst the trees, very picturesque and extremely close to Buckingham Palace
Beautiful park. After mingling with the masses at the Changing of the Guard, escape to the lovely peace of the park. It seems to be a nature preserve of sorts, and I saw numerous interesting birds.
Take food for squirrels. Park is amazing. Also you can feed animals there. Just take some nuts with you and squirrels will take them from your hands. Buy uncooked nuts (not salty).
Awesome.. Walking or sitting in peace with a coffee. This is one of the best places in London. A perfect spot in the middle of it all to rest your feet.

Prettiest park in London. In my view the prettiest park in London. A photograph from the bridge over the lake is a must if you are a visitor to London. Bordered by The Mall, where you can sometimes see the household cavelery making their way from st James's Palace to Buckingham Palace it is a classic bit of London.

Just lovely. I've been here before but my girlfriend hasn't and she just couldn't stop smiling. My stepson loved it also. The peaceful feel of the place, the beautiful flowers, the birds and especially feeding the squirrels who take food out of your hand. I like Hyde Park, but I prefer St James' Park is better
Beautiful view on the bridge crossing the river. I loved crossing this park to and from our hotel around dawn and dusk when there were only a few people.

Nice break from the hustle and bustle. St James's park is close to Buckingham Palace and other major attractions such as Westminster, the Big Ben, Horse Guards. Despite this, it is a relaxing spot, where you can sit, drink some coffee and have a look at the beautiful surroundings and the lovely lake; squirrels, wild ducks, mallards and other birds seem not to be bothered and are always available for pictures :)

Surprisingly quiet and relaxing even on a sunny weekend. We took shelter here from some unusually warm British summer weather, parking ourselves in the shade of a tree just a stone's throw from Pall Mall. Despite the crowds surging towards Buckingham Palace and heading for Piccadilly Circus, and the large numbers of people in and wandering through the park itself, it seemed a little oasis of calm and a great spot for an hour's time out in the city centre.

Lovelier than Hyde PArk. St James Park is close to Buckingham Palace....walking distance. Easy to do both in the same day. It is a gorgeous park in the city....and even lovelier than Hyde Park however smaller.

Lovely park. This is a lovely park to walk around, and to sit and relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of sightseeing, and to recharge your batteries. Plenty of lakeside seats. Lovely views of both the Palace and surrounding area from the bridge over the lake. Would most certainly recommend,
Beautiful walk and a break from the city. Great peaceful walk and a nice break from the city. Highly recommend this park. Great picture opportunity too :)
Quiet and calm.... already the same, but it is so... a beautiful area to rest - and waiting for the 101 dalmatins?! Wasn't this here? Lovely place London has to watch on it...
Beautiful evening walk to Buckingham Palace. Lovely walk to Buckingham Palace, Well kept and Cyclist free, mostly people enjoying an evening stroll.
Lovely place in warm weather. Well worth a walk in warm weather as a contrast to the city stuff. Used as everday green space by people who live in the area so great for people watching too.

Green respite from playing tourist. St. Jame's Park is right there next to so many tourist attractions. An excellent place to take a timeout in the shade, next to the water, admiring the palaces that surround it.
Great place for a stroll. Beautiful grounds with fabulous history… On a nice day or a rainy day… That's a lovely walk lots of wildlife ...Lakes... And history

Interesting. I would love to have gone around the whole park, but this was a short visit via the Horse Guards entrance. Was delightful watching geese, cranes and squirrels near the pond while resting!

Excellent royal park in centre of London. Beautifully maintained lawns and flower beds (at least in the summer). Sometimes free music performances on the bandstand. Quiet place to relax in central London near the main tourist attractions.

Great Place To Enjoy the Sun. St. James's Park is a great place to enjoy the sun and watch other people. It is incredible crowded on the weekends, but you can see people from all over the world. Also, there are ducks, geese, pelicans, swans, and pidgeons to watch (and feed). The flower arrangements are really great and very colorful.

Treat yourself to a walk through this huge and beautiful park in the middle of London!. I had friends recommend this park to me for my London visit, and I'm so glad they did. Beautiful green expanses of lawn, many water birds, beautiful trees...so refreshing...and right in the middle of London!

Beautiful park with a lovely view of the London Eye. We had a walking tour through the park and it is a wonderful park and well worth the visit. Lovely gardens and water features and a lovely view. Can highly recommend it.
Lovely park close to city. This is an ideal park to spend some time away from the crowds. Great place for photography, easy walking or resting on the grass.

Stroll thru the park. Hired a deck chair for £1.60 per hour. Worth every penny to have a snooze and watch the world go by.
Every bin was overflowing with litter but that was the only negative. A great park with ice cream/ coffee stops scattered around.

The most beautiful park. St James's Park is in my opinion the most beautiful park in London. Green grass, amazing trees and small lakes make this a wonderful place to walk, run, picnic or just send some quality time. Love it!

Brilliant and beautiful. This is an absolutely brilliant place to waste a few hours roaming around the park. Loads of things to look at with the odd couple of cafe's dotted around to prolong your visit.

Most Beautiful Park I've ever seen. The flowers were all beautiful, gardens well maintained (weed-free) very clean ( so many waterfowl around, don't know how they kept it so clean!) Charge to use toilet facilities, which we hate!

Peaceful in the middle of busy London. Great for walking, picnic and combining visits to several attractions and places in London - Big Ben, Westminster, Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace. Offers great views of Buckingham Palace from the footbridge over the lake.

Lovely Park. Lovely park so close to Buckingham palace it could be the queens garden. Bought some snacks and sat all day having a picnic lots to see and great for people watching. The grounds are immaculate and dining here is free

A lovely stroll. Great to walk through if you're on the way to the palace, or just for a quaint stroll.
Very large park with a beautiful lake and lots of wildlife.

Beautiful. Tranquility away from the business of the city. Beautiful lake and little squirrels around the trees. Lovely playground for the young children and a big bonus was the toilet facilities for boys and girls only.

Visited last year. I visited Horse Guards last year because it was raining and I needed to shelter, its a fantastic exhibit and I really enjoyed it ...its probably off the beaten track of exhibits but never the less most enioyable the museum gives a wonderful insight into the life of the horse guards off and on parade good tip they have a lovely shop the rain had stopped by then
Big park. Quite a big and well maintained place. Visited this place on our trip to London. Lot of trees and greenery around. There r lakes with ducks and swans.

Amazing wildlife and views of Buckingham Palace. The lake in the centre of the park is a must for the wealth of wildlife to be seen. Absolutely amazing and somewhat surprising bearing in mind the location of the park. Additionally, there are great views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge. On the downside it is a shame that the toilets have a 20p entry charge!

Awesome Park!. When you are heading to Buckingham Palace, Why not stop at this fine park, and see the ducks and all of the beautiful flowers!
It has toilets and places that you could buy drinks.
Relaxing surroundings. Great park for some chilling and relaxing. Also now a good play park for the kids which went down a treat.

Nice park, wouldn't call it a destination. Park is beautiful, nice place to picnic or rest like many of the other review suggest, but I wouldn't tell anyone it's a "must-see." It's a park you'll probably pass by or through if you're near Trafalgar Square, Buckingham, and you'll think it's pleasant. Wouldn't put it on a to-do list though.
Sunny summer. Lovely to wander through the wild flowers and wild life in the centre of the city. Just a nice oasis of calm in the middle of the city.

Simply Beautiful. We couldn't get enough of the beautiful parks. Fortunately, we got to see most of the park on bicycle with our Fat Tire Tour group. We had a lot of opportunities to stop for pictures and enjoy the scenery. Great place to bring a picnic and a date :)

Such a beautiful area. We were walking from Westminster Abbey towards Buckingham Palace and decided to stroll through the park; so glad we did!
The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Tons of birds around; well signed so it's easy to navigate. Definitely worth the stroll.
Lovely park. What a lovely park with ducks and other birds. Plenty of space to sit down for a piknick. The lakes are great but not for swimmimg.

Quiet park.. Pleasant break by the Thames, clean, kiosk for drinks, etc, good place to eat a sandwich lunch and watch the ducks and squirrels.
Good to take time out from walking around the City of London and close to many famous sites including Buckingham Palace, Piccadilly Circus, Scotland Yard,

serene. its just serene. and green. the ducks on the lake the trees and the lawns andthe whole charm of it all makes you want to just sit and watch.... no talking. just grab a good book and some coffee andyou are set.

Nice Park. Our tour group walked through this park from the bus drop-off point to Buckingham Palace to watch the Changing of the Guards. Nice, peaceful and clean park. I wish we were not rushing to catch the Changing of the Guard to enjoy this place fully.

Lovely place to spend the afternoon. Grab a picnic lunch and spend a few hours relaxing in this gorgeous park. The landscape is spectacular. It's an easy walk to many of London's top attractions from the park, thus keeping you on schedule.

Great time with the swans,ducks and geese...and squirrels too :). We were there last January, and had happy meetings with fowl. They come right up to you for a treat. Immersive if short experience... and also the only park we visited this January where the squirrels were in evidence at all!As far as human refreshments - though - try to avoid café near palace grounds - unwelcoming staff and unreasonable prices - even for London.

Lovely. . It's a beautiful place and with a nice breeze, it's perfect for a romantic stroll, but I can imagine a great place for families also. We were there in September and it was even a bit chilly.

Peace in the middle of London. St. James Park is a great, green stop in the middle of London city.If you have just come up from the Trafalgar square underground station and need a peaceful moment to figure out where you are going next, this park is a great spot for that!Sit under a tree and enjoy the view of people strolling around, walking their dogs or simply enjoying a city break.It is in central London, so there will be a lot of people, but it is still less than on the streets.
to visit. I think it's the best park in London. A perfect mix of water and green, very clean and you can see a lot of animals

One of the most beautiful parks in London. We were here for the Queen's Patron's Lunch and the park was green, leafy and resplendant, even in the rain. The water features are part of its charm and make it so pleasant to walk and wander around.

Quiet with lots of ducks!. We had a stroll through the park on the way back to our hotel. The landscaping is really pretty and there were tons of ducks. Great spots to stop and read a book or meet a friend to catch up.

Beautiful Park Tranquil. Wanted time to unwind from the hustle and bustle of London so took a walk in St James' s Park it was a lovely park some rare birds swans with their signets lots of secluded off the path picnic tables and grass to sit and admire the surroundings and feed the squirrels if you want, just minutes walk from Buckingham Palace and tube stations with cafes pub etc worth a visit.

One of my favourite places. I visit St James's Park every time I go to London. I love the setting, the lake, the ducks and geese, the squirrels. Take a picnic, find a bench and spend some time people-watching. Great fun.
Beautiful!. It is a peaceful place in the midle of London. I strongly recomend it. Maravilloso paseo donde puedes contemplar pelícanos y ardillas.

A must see...have a walk just around 11h30 !. The park is beautiful : trees, birds, flowers... typically English.
Just have a walk and try to be in the center around 11h30 for the Guard !

Nice park. Great location right near Buckingham but too many people(Greenwich park is less crowded).
It's on the way to the Big Ben but no need to stay there too much.

Lovely park. Lots of different birds and plants to see. Also very near to Buckingham Palace and Houses of Parliament.
Best on a dry day.
Pelicans and horseriders. Had a nice stroll through the park, saw pelicans and a lot of horsemen (guards) train in the park. It was relatively quiet (for the city) and we really enjoyed it.
Go for it. Beautiful park and good place to spend your freetime outside. Don't forget to bring your camera with you and of course your football.

Lovely park. The park is lovely flowers were in bloom only problem I had was 20p to use the toilet . It's not that I didn't want to pay just that it's in a public park I didn't expect to pay. Toilets were clean though

Beautiful route to the Palace. We had just watched the changing of Horseguards with hundreds of like minded interested individuals and made our way up through the park to Buckingham Palace but felt the need for a refreshment break at a marvellous little coffee shop overlooking a lake full of all sorts of bird life, so peaceful and tranquil even though the park was full of people.

Beautiful Park. Beautiful peaceful park. The birds and squirrels are quite accustomed to people and are very friendly. However there are signs that ask you do not feed them. They will land on you if they see you have food or crawl up your hand. There are benches and ice cream spots and coffee. I loved this park.

A leafy oasis in the middle of London. Well worth a visit. I lovely space to spend time on a hot summer's day. The cafe by the lake has excellent fresh food at reasonable prices. Stroll all the paths to see various vistas.

A leafy oasis in the middle of London. Well worth a visit. I lovely space to spend time on a hot summer's day. The cafe by the lake has excellent fresh food at reasonable prices. Stroll all the paths to see various vistas.
Beautiful Walk. This park is filled with delightful vistas. The walkway is easy and flat and the park is clean. Beware the swans, they will bite.
You don't feel like your in the city. You can properly visit the park by walking to Buckingham Palace. There are multiple different types of animal so it is good for animal lovers

Lovely place. Love the park and the atmosphere! Mustvisit if you're a nature fan in London.
Tip - Bring a umbrella or rain coat as the London weather is unpredictable!

St James's Park. London is so lucky in having many squares and parks to add green to all the built up areas. Even the City has tiny patches tucked away up alleys or hidden in between skyscrapers but my favourite is the smallest park - St James's. It is always well looked after and well planted and the views to both ends (Buckingham Palace and Whitehall) make it a 'must' even if you only have one day to spend in the capital.

A must for runners. Look its the middle of summer, but London is usually in the low 60s most days. This a an easy flat run, but try and go first thing in the morning since by 10 am the crowds will be gathering for the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace.

My Favourite Park. Simply love this park. Not too large but very enjoyable in terms of wildlife, cafes, flowers, and people watching. Very tame squirrels which will sit on your knee if they think you have food. Lots of notices saying not to feed the wildlife. We were lucky to encounter 2 pelicans strolling along the footpath. There are wonderful views across the lake to Buckingham Palace. Good photo opportunities.

A beautiful oasis in the middle of London. We were so pleased with our visit to St James's Park - at this time of year, there were lots of ducklings and goslings and cygnets to see, a wide variety of water birds to enjoy. The park is well used with paved walkways but there is still the opportunity to find a space for yourself to be still and reflect on your adventures in London and what to do next.

St James's Park. This beautiful park which is over seen by Buckingham Palace is well worth a visit. When in London we always take a stroll around the park after the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. Its so good to see everyone out, having a light lunch or picnic with their families on a beautiful day in London. Watching the birds stealing a snack or two adds to the pleasure and of course feeding the bird life on the pond. Definitely a must to see while in London
Beautiful place to wander about. Took our time after Buckingham palace and just explored all the gardens. Also a good cut through point as we were heading back to Victoria. Can be crowded.

Beautiful London Park. The park was near our hotel, so we opted to walk through it one morning on our way to Westminster. I enjoyed strolling through it in the winter and spring, but in the summer, it's glorious! We had our two teenage nieces with us, and they both described it as being one of the highlights of their trip (several photos and selfies were taken). We loved how bits of the city would poke through, but for the most part, how it served as its own oasis in the midst of the city. Definitely worth the stroll.

Very nice and chilled out place. To say this is just off Buck palace and the Royal Mile once you are in it is a very chilled out and quiet area of London. There are lots of wildlife to see including a variety of birds and of course our fave the squirrel. There are deckchairs dotted around that you can hire out or you can just lie back on the grass and take in the sunshine. The fact that it takes you from Buck Palace down to horse guards and then onto places like Number 10, Big Ben and the houses of parliament is just a bonus

Lovely park. St Jame's Park isn't the biggest of London's parks and, in fact, it's pretty small. The park is, however, lovely! It's one of my favourite London parks - small but perfectly formed.What's it got going for it? It's right smack bang in tourist central London. It's a very short walk from Charing Cross Station. You have Trafalgar Square, leicester square, Buckingham Palace, Westminster, Westminster Abbey, The London Eye, Big Ben, London aquarium and london dungeons, Piccadilly Circus, and more all in short walking distance!What else does it have going for it? It's compact so there isn't any wasted space. There are no massive areas of just green grass. It's just very pleasant to be in. It's certainly worth a walk around or a great spot to go sit and have your lunch in the park.
Beautiful Gardens. London has some beautiful parks,St.James park and areas around is beautiful,lovely walk with fantastic rose gardens and fountains.

Peace Amdist The Crowds. One of my favorite places to be in London is St. James's Park. It is such a restful place to walk and enjoy the beauty of wildlife on the small lakes and to sit under the shade of the beautiful trees. I have been there in the spring, summer, and fall. All those seasons are wonderful for different flowers and foliage. It is a great place to sit and read a book for awhile, sit on a bench and watch people, or have a cooling ice cream.

Lovely morning strole. Had a few hours to spare during our weekend visit so went for a walk around the park. Was busy but didn't take away from the beauty of the park and the amount of wildlife. Lots of different geese and nice to see the pelicans!

We walked the park. After the changing of the guard we walked through the park to get to Whitehall. The shade was wonderful and it was fun to see the St James Palace, former home of the Queen Mother, as well as the other official buildings along the park.We were looking for a place to have lunch and there was none in the park.

I LOVED this park.. This park is so beautiful that you can't help but to keep walking in anticipation of what else you may find. I can't think of a place in London where I snapped so many pictures. It's really beautiful and a great place for a walk.
Beautiful!. Great place to visit and hang out! We just sat on a bench for a couple of hours to read on our kindles.

Lovely Park. We like to visit city parks throughout our travels--Madrid, Barcelona, Milan, NYC--and this park was certainly one of the most pleasant and beautiful. It's essentially linked to three other parks too--Green Park, Hyde Park, and Kensington Gardens, making for an excellent weekend walk.
beautiful park. I love people watching and bird watching. What a lovely park. The water features attract many different types of birds. Very relaxing.
Magnificent Old Park. Formerly hunting grounds, now a stately garden in the center of London between the big palaces. Charming place to walk or bike.
Wonderful park. Great fun for all ages, beautiful park to visit. A very calming atmosphere with a range of different birds to see. Great for kids

Beautiful park. We walked through on our way from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey. It was a beautiful trek. It is a peaceful park with gorgeous landscaping. We saw many people on blankets enjoying lunch.

Possibly London's nicest park. A favourite place to take a stroll, spend an hour or two watching the wild fowl on the lake and then enjoy afternoon tea at the Pavilion Café.
Being so close to both Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square it is popular with Londoners and visitors alike.
An oasis of peace in the heart of a busy city.

Large park near the Buckingham palace - relaxing place. The big park is just opposite to Buckingham palace and a great place to relax in the mid of the busy city. The park is so green with life all around. Lots of water birds and small pond makes it very nice. One has to go through this park connecting Buckingham palace and Westminster side of the city.

Delightful. Smashing park and well planted out. Walk through on your way to Westminster or Buckingham Palace or just sit on the grass on a fine day and rest.
A peaceful spot right in the heart of the city.
Quiet place for a break. We took an ice cream brake here on a busy sighseeing day. Lovely park and a great way to walk from Westminister to Buckingham Palace.

Very pleasant park in the heart of london.. Wandered back to town through the park after visiting the Palace.
Well kept although when we where there it was used by many rough sleepers so in the mornings there is quite a bit of litter about. Still a nice place for a picnic on the odd days the sun shines.
Beautiful . Gorgeous, well looked after park. Would recommend a picnic in the park or a stroll through it before going to visit the palace.
beautiful. Great end of day walk back to your hotel. beautiful quiet with people enjoying the great weather. Kids love to chase the squirrels and pigeons or watch the ducks in the water

Most favorite Park in London. beautiful view from the park looking towards the London Eye and Whitehall area. Close walking distance to Big Ben/ Parliament/ Westminster Abbey. Everyone of course knows Hyde Park, but St. James' Park is my personal favorite in all of London
Beautiful park. Relaxing park to stroll in. Some of the best views in London from Buckingham Palace to the Arch. Musical bands to sit by and listen, swans and ducks to watch.

A very relaxing spot. Perfect for a relaxing walk, especially with kids. Very good maintained, a lot of domestic and exotic birds and friendly squirrels. From the bridge up on the central lagoon a very nice view on Buckingham Palace toward North and the Horse Guard building toward South. The perfect place to wait the Buckingham Palace Changing Guard parade or the Horse parade of the cadets at the Horse Guard building. Even a pleasant fast-track from Buckingham Palace area to Trafalgar Square.

My Favourite Central London Park. This has long been my favourite Central London park, it's a focal point for the best London attractions with a fabulous view of Buckingham Palace and a splendid lake running the whole length.

A beautiful place to spend time. St James Park is a beautiful part of London. Well worth a visit when visiting London. There are places to grab an ice cream or coffee. The park allows some solitude in a very busy city.
A gem in the middle of London. Whenever I am in London a visit here is needed, it also the perfect place to go for a jog. You can also get decent pictures here.
take a walk on the wild side. much more of a natural setting than Hyde Park with some rather wild areas. but a park if great beauty. don't miss it
just a lovely park. A park. You can walk around or sit and read, or lie on the grass. I mean it's just a nice, relaxing, outdoorsy place in central London. What's to review here?
Beautiful park. Gorgeous park with lovely views. Perfect for long walks and picnics. We've seen a lot of "urban parks" and this is one of the prettiest we've been in.

Top Place on a Summer's Afternoon. If you work in Whitehall you should not neglect this great green resource. After a stressful meeting it is good to take a detour through the park and remember that there is more to life than the so called corridors of power. I ended up sitting up against a tree trunk on a sunny day, taking part in a teleconference and feeling sorry for all the other people sitting at their desks, wondering where the sound of birdsong was coming from. Hooray for, just a little, freedom.

Beautiful, good for kids. A beautiful park on a sunny day, some great cafes and kids play areas, so it's great for literally everyone. There are toilets available (although the ones in the kids play area are for children only), as well as a picnic area. The lakes are lovely, and there are all sorts of ducks, swans and herons. A lovely place to walk and eat lunch.
A pleasant green oasis in a busy city. A great little park between Buckingham Place and Horse Guards Parade. A nice place to have a picnic and a relax.
Perfect park. Gorgeous green space in the middle of London, with seating, sun and shade for everyone. Never feels crowded. Exotic wild birds to feed or photograph. Great eating place.

An oasis in central London. I have been to London many times, but for some reason had never been to St. James's Park until recently. It's a magical oasis of mature and complex English gardens, water features, many varieties of water fowl, and quiet, meandering paths. The Birdkeeper's Cottage is especially lovely in summer, with both a spectacular cottage garden and vegetable garden.

beautiful park - buzzing atmosphere. Lovely place to visit on a sunny day! Lots of tourists around, so a very busy atmosphere. Plenty of ducks expecting to be fed, so careful with your lunch! Fantastic place to relax and people watch.
My favourite!. This has to be one of the top places that I visited whilst in London, it's clean, quiet and just amazing to walk around after visiting the palace.
Beautiful and relaxing. Beautiful park to throw into some hardcore sightseeing. Take a breath and relax...you're in LONDON!!!
St James's Park. Quiet, serene walking, lively bird watching, beautiful gardens. Trace the walking path of Princess Diana!
Lovely park!. Great park to take a stroll in. Clean and accessible. Loved the history behind the park too. Would recommend to all visitors who come to London
Nice. It's a nice park, and worth a stroll. We enjoyed Hyde Park more, but this is still a very nice park.

Great location for relaxation. If you're walking around London, visiting the tourist spots - as tourists tend to do - this is a great spot to relax in. It's located right off of the Mall, between the Palace and Trafalgar Square, adjacent to the Horse Guard parade and a stone's throw away from Downing Street. My wife and I went here to relax with our kids (ages 7 and 5) as we were in between sightseeing spots. The kids played for about an hour, we all had some ice cream, and we went on our way. There were loads of people there playing football and cricket or simply relaxing on the grass.The view is spectacular, and the lake is beautiful. This park is definitely worth spending a couple of hours to unwind at.

Gorgeous, Relaxing, great loacation for people watching!. Grab some take away lunch and enjoy it sitting in this gorgeous park right in the hear of London. Beware of cheeky birds, however! They are nothing but persistent.
St James Park. It's very beautiful, I went to see the Diana Memorial, I found it a bit disappointing, also because it started to rain, and this an attraction that should be done on a sunny day

In my opinion London's best park. This park is situated in the heart of London and just a stones throw from Trafalgar Sq through Admiralty Arch and down towards Buckingham Palace on the left of The Mall. My wife and I spent a couple of hours here on Sunday in the Sun watching the world go by on a couple of deckchairs we hired for £1.60 an hour listening to the band on the band stand. The park was busy but you don't feel crammed in and is lovely to walk along by the large pond as we did towards Horse Guards parade and through the arches and onto 10 Downing Street. If you are in London on a nice day then choose this park.

Gorgeous park with great views. We wandered through here after visiting The Churchill War Rooms. Lovely park, and it was full of baby ducks and swans. There are some great views of the city back across the park, and it's right across the street from Buckingham Palace. Beautiful place to relax for a bit.
Beautiful location. Walked through the park on a Sunday morning at 8 am. It was very quiet and lovely to sit and watch the ducks on the lake. Was one of my highlights of the weekend.

Great views!. I always make a point of walking through St. James's Park (ideally straight through the middle, between Marlborough Road and Queen Anne's Gates). That route takes you right across the bridge that spans the park's lake, from which one can get some of the best shots of historic London (with a peek in from the Eye).

One of our favorites, loved Duck Island Cottage!. Be sure to visit Duck Island cottage along with St. James Park! St. James Park was so beautiful - just the respite from busy London. We took our coffee and snacks in and sat on the bench. My son spent probably 30 minutes making a study of the birds in the park. Duck Island Cottage is NOT to be missed!

Relaxing oasis in central LOndon. Lovely and peaceful area to relax and walk in, in the centre of London. Close to some of the main sights such as Piccadilly, Buckingham Palace, and near Green park Underground. A great place to unwind from the hustle of central London.
Prettiest London park.. Between Buckingham palace and horse guard's parade the first royal park given to the public by Charles II. The views from the bridge crossing the lake are very photogenic.
Great New Year's Eve of 2016!!!. Wonderful place to have a great time with family, specially if there's sun despite the winter cold!! Love the squirrels!

Beautiful!!!. Located between Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards Parade this is a wonderful park to sit, relax and watch the world go by. Ideal for watching Changing of The Guard at the palace or at the horse guards parade ground, and with an in park restaurant this is London at it's best!!!

Lovely park. My favourite park in London! It's close to the Buckingham Palace and it has a nice view towards the Eye of London. Great place to have picnic! And it's interesting to watch many different kind of birds in the park.

Tranquility in the middle of London. This park---a smaller version of Central Park in many ways, runs from Whitehall to Buckingham Palace and is a great place to stop and catch you breath during a busy day of sightseeing. The lake is very tranquil, with many different kinds of birds, and may benches. Beautiful flowers and a nice restaurant make this a welcome respite during a long day.
Very nice public park. Had a lovely walk through the park on Saturday morning and a sit down on a bench eating bacon sandwiches for breakfast!

Take a picnic on a sunny day.. This is a lovely park with a great view of Buckingham Palace. There are plenty of places to sit and people watch. Be sure to see the pelicans which live on the lake. A beautiful peaceful place in the middle of town. Well worth a visit.
Excellent to sit and watch the world go by.. Extremely clean, well looked after with lots of places to sit, also food and drink stalls are at each corner of the park. Very convienent.
pastorally park. Gorgeous park.so nice'. the trees and the plants + flowers are so beutiful that give as fill in haven/so quaiet 'calm

Perfect to relax with a picnic. Grab a sandwich from M&S or Waitross and enjoy a picnic in the park. At dusk you'll see the little squirrels running around as well as ducks, swans and geese. A clean and tidy park, and lovely for a walk, or to sit down and decide on your next tourist destination. Its right next to Buckingham palace so great location

Beautiful, walkable park. Great view from Buckingham Palace. One of my favorite photos of our trip. We walked through it several times passing through various areas of London. It's very clean, manicured, and relaxing.
A Must to do in London. We had a beautiful day to take in this breathtaking place. It is so big you must see St James Park, definitely one for the bucket list

Peaceful surrounds. Not many people know this, but St James is patron saint of lepers, among other things. The land was used for a leper colony some king went "Wah wah wah, this is prime kinging land. Lets boot these lepers out." But he kept the saint's name, because it sounded nice, and doubtless better than "Leperland."A peaceful park, surrounded by lively shopping districts on one side, and a whopping great big palace on the other.

Beautiful Park. Lovely park in front of Buckingham Palace. Great views of the Palace and the London eye. You can feed the ducks, enjoy the lovely gardens and have a coffee. The tube station is not far from there either. A lovely relaxing experience!

Nice garden, well kept place.. Nice garden with lots of open places. Been taking my family and friends who vist us to this place, see bukinghum palace and activities have lunch and then leave for other areas nearby. Toilet at one end can be improved in terms of hygiene and service.

Birds. This is a lovely place for a stroll. There are plenty of birds to see some are obvious in their species like Pelicans geese moorhens ducks but others left us baffled ! There is a long lake which we walked around over a bridge where we spotted a swan family. Also there are more common birds in the trees and park sparrows etc then we spotted squirrels! Close to St. James' park underground station at 55 Broadway.
Natural Beauty. Enjoy a nice walk here. There are restrooms (for a small fee) and some good concession stands. Try the waffle with nutella!!

Nice walk. St James's Park is one of the oldest Royal Park in London. It is surrounded by the Houses of Parliament, St James's Palace and Buckingham Palace. If you walk from Trafalgar Squire towards The Buckingham Palace, you first have to cross Horse Guards Field and then pass through St. James Park. There is a beautiful lake full of water birds. Flowers bloom all around in it. Walking here refreshes you. A must see park. Entry is free.
The Inn in the Park. The Inn in the Park is well worth a visit. The squirrels in the park are quite tame and friendly. They are quite characters and fun to watch.

Must See!. The parks in London are absolutely gorgeous. The views are spectacular and the grounds are impeccably maintained. Taking a peek back toward Trafalgar and the Thames is such a beautiful scene.

Very Beautiful Park and Nice Walk. This Park is located near the Buckingham Palace. It is a very ideal place to walk and relax after or before you visit the palace. Plenty of trees, flowers, swans, ducks and birds. Nice ponds and waterfowls.
Beautiful. A lovely park. If you are there around 11:00 a.m. You may see the Queen's cavalry cross. Many families picnicking and relaxing in the park.
Peace. A great piece of greenary in the centre of london. Very peacefull but only minutes from the bristle of the West End.

Good way to kill time. I had a couple of hours in London before heading to airport and this was really a good choice for killing time. Strolling in Greenpark for a while and i reached into the touristy Buckingham Palace, and St James Park became the next destination close by. The royal is really gorgeous in this summer with lots of beautiful flowers which i could not name them. The whole scenary was really photogenic and lots of families and tourists are just taking photos non-stop. This place was indeed a natural magnet for tourists.The British Restaurant in the park serves good food (which was unexpected) and i enjoyed its curry chicken pie so much.

Gorgeous Park. This park is beautiful. If I live in London, I'd go there every weekend. It is such a nice and relaxing place to be after trying to get through crowd of tourists wandering around the palace.

Awesome wildlife. Visited St James P:ark with my daughter and her 7 month old baby last week and it was a highlight of our trip to London. Baby seemed to be ready to sleep when she spotted 6 cygnets with their mother walking across the path where she was being pushed in her buggy - just gorgeous - but kept baby awake for some time!

Stunning. The St. James's Park is extremely beautiful. It is set between some very busy places but you would never know. The waterfowl variety was a huge surprise. Flowers of wide a varied species too.
Beautiful Park. This was a lovely park to walk through after seeing Buckingham Palace. There were lots of ducks and birds all around, and it was overall it was a very nice stroll.
Gorgeous!. The views here are beautiful! Take a stroll and see many waterbirds. A great place to stroll and rest after Buckingham Palace.

Great park. Very nice park, really enjoyed the swiss cottage but would like that we could visit. Would be a great place for a coffee near the lake. My advice would be to have a nice walk into the park in the morning and if intended watch the guard exchange at the Buckingham Palace (at 11:30). If you're lucky you can have a look at a friendly squirl like we did.

Beautiful park. Been to St James Park twice now and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The water, the bridge, the tres and other vegetation together with the animals and birds makes this park a real delight. Watching the squirrels is enjoyable and in one place I counted about six - England supposedly has many squirrels but you only seem to come across one of them occasionally. St James Park seems to be a very reliable place to see them and they are quite friendly, coming up and staring intently in the hope of you giving them something to eat. Hope to be able to go back there again.

Best views in London. Stand on the bridge in centre; also walk around towards Parliament Square and see the Bird Keepers Cottage and fountain (see photo). Toilets are (a) in the large wooden restaurant, also (b) in line with the bridge, on the upper slope towards the Mall.Buy some unsalted nuts elsewhere before you arrive, so you can feed the pigeons and squirrels. Some of the most memorable fun for the children!

We didn't want to stay in the office. Talking in the park was friendlier. Working in the park is a big fun. . The only problem in London that it is raining very often. My kids loved the birds and the flowers in park. For those people who like the nature it's a good program!

Beautiful Park to relax. We headed to St. James Park after we stop at Buckingham. This park is relaxing and you can see the little ducks and beautiful trees. the colors of the leaves is pretty. and we encountered two guards riding horses. A nice place to visit after a long walked.

Just another park?. Lush green grass, big old trees, a garden surrounds the lake full of cottage style flowers, a lot of shade, so what's the secret?Walk around the lake and you will find a quaint original cottage to view, a coffee shop that's more re the locale than good coffee.It's a nice change of scenery from the buildings and streets of London.

Nice walk around the park. Took a stroll from Green Park Underground station South and around St, James Park. Past Buckingham Palace (too late for the Guard changing). Very popular, quite peaceful. Had lunch in the central restaurant

Beautiful Park in Central London. St James's Park is a 'must' for all visitors to London. It's a hive of activity, full of people and wildlife.It runs next to the Mall and links Buckingham Palace to Horseguards Parade and on to Trafalgar Square.Watch out for the over-friendly squirrels which will crawl up your legs!
Beautiful. This park is amazing and great for families. My kids loved around looking and exploring. Make sure that you go to the bathroom first, not too many toilets around here...

Lakes and swans. An oasis of green in a bustling city on the route between parliament square/Whitehall and Buckingham Palace/the Mall.It's not exactly quiet though. On a sunny day, it seems like the world descends on it. Lovely to visit though.
Beautiful stroll on a sunny day. What a beautiful park in a very scenic setting, was a grat day in the sunshine. Looking at the sights and people watching.
Best park in London . I love the squirrels as they have no fear and will climb all over you for food as will the pigeons. It's a real oasis of calm in central London

Lovely. We walked through St James Park on the way to Buckingham Palace, a nice place to sit and people watch, eat an ice cream, relax, we saw the Guards walking through the park after changing at the Palace, Squirrels running around or up the trees a lovely blue bridge you can stand on and see the palace or a nice photo shot. A nice place to relax

Beautiful Park. The landscape is beautiful throughout this park! There's a play area for children as well as affordable food. I saw two areas that offered sandwiches, drinks, pastries, and ice cream. Nice clean toilet area also.

Beautiful park with lots to see.. This is our favourite park to stroll around. On our last visit we saw lots of swans with signets which were outshining the rather sleepy pelicans. There are plenty of benches on which to just enjoy the atmosphere. We even enjoyed plane spotting as the heathrow flightpath is nearby. A must see is the gardeners house & garden - with all its lovely veggies.
St James Park. Had a great meal and a lovely afternoon in the park, take the kids on a sunny day and feed the ducks on other lake and take out a paddle boat

Peaceful walk. We stayed at the Conrad just outside of the park. It was a pleasure being able to walk through the park everyday. Perfect spot for a picnic or just to relax and watch all the different birds.

A not too big, but beautiful and peaceful park. St. James's Park is in the City of Westminster in Central London and is the city's oldest of 8 royal parks. It is bounded by Buckingham Palace to the west, The Mall to the north, Horse Guards to the east, and Birdcage Walk to the south.This 23 hectares park has a small lake with 2 islands; West Island and Duck island.The Blue Bridge that crosses the lake offers a beautiful view west towards Buckingham Palace, and east towards Horse Guards & the London Eye.It's very peaceful to walk in this park. You will find beautiful plants, flowers and trees and you can even meet some squirrels, who are not afraid to come close to you.
A little gem....... Walked through here on our way from Victoria to the London Eye.....was a lovely morning and it's always great walking through the park away from the noisy busy roads.
Nice park. Very nice park with nice scenery and places to rest/sit beside the lake, watch the ducks and ducklings and animals.

Ducks and squirrels!. When visiting Buckingham museum, don't forget to pass by this park. Enjoy the beautiful view with a lake full of ducks, have a coffee and try to feed the squirrels. They are adorable!

One of my favourite parks in London. Great views from anywhere surrounding the central ponds, water fountains, plenty of well manicured gardens, lots of leafy trees to protect you on a sunny day. That plus very friendly squirrels made a great trip with my then 2 year old son.Beware not to show off too much when giving food (nuts) to the squirrels as the geese and ducks may decide it's theirs for the taking. :)

So beautiful and peaceful - reminds me of Mary Poppins!. We walked through St. James Park to and from other attractions and it is truly an amazing, beautiful break from the sidewalks next to the London streets. Fountains were so nice, lots of places to grab a bite to eat or a quick drink (water, etc.). Benches strategically placed to take in a water view or lovely garden view. Walking through reminded me of the Mary Poppins scene where the characters are doing sidewalk chalk pictures - just lovely.

Beautiful walk on your way to the Palace. This is a lovely way to walk to Buckingham Palace from the downtown London area. It has beautiful gardens and water ways. You'll see many visitors and locals enjoying the outdoors. It is safe and clean.
St. James's Park. This is a lovely park to stroll through. Gardens and ponds with active fowl and a fun cafe in the middle. It was a nice cut through for us on our way to Buckingham Palace.

Green and relaxing. St. James's park is more than just a place to check off of your to-do list when you’re in London. Full of wildlife, friendly squirrels, ducks and geese with stunning views of Buckingham palace from the bridge crossing the pond.

Beautiful and peaceful spot in the city. The front lawn of Buckingham Palace with ponds, wildlife and great walking. It has a great restaurant which I recommend taking advantage of while there. Sit down or carry out with alcoholic beverages or barista coffee. Fab meals , salads, sandwiches and desserts. Good value and indoor or outdoor seating. Walk the park between the palace and the guards barracks after seeing the changing of the guards and have lunch.

Loved the water fowl and beautiful gardens!. We walked this beautiful park twice in two days. The swans had their little cygnets and all of the birds were great to see. It was so close to our hotel and such a charming walk.
Peaceful in the City. St. James' Park is one of the best places to get away from the hustle and bustle of London. It is a beautiful place to take a stroll or have a picnic.

St. James Park. Lovely park in the center of London. Great place to take lunch and sit for a time to enjoy the lake, the ducks and people watching. The day we were there was sunny and this park has many large shade trees and is close to everything a visitor to London wants to see. A great place for a little break from sightseeing.
Nice park. Nice Park by Buckingham palace. Kids playground and lots of grass to lounge on. Worth it if you are in the area. :)
Peaceful sanctuary. This is a great place to visit when you are in London and you need a bit of peace and quiet. So tranquil

Busy but beautiful park. This is a really busy park which has great views of central London form Buckingham Palace to the London Eye. The centre of the park is the lake, which has many different water birds. There are also pelicans in this park, which are just great to watch. The plants are lovely and it is well looked after. It's great fro a walk around the lake and is buggy and wheelchair friendly. The only downside is because if it's great central location is is very busy especially with lots of school trips also coming to the park.
Stunning, relaxing and beautiful!. We had a relaxed picnic lunch here for my birthday and it was just perfect! A really gorgeous park with chairs you can hire if you prefer not to sit on the grass!
Good Walk. After a big meal this is a place to work out the extra calories. nice place for a walk , lovely nooks

The waterbirds are amazing. It is a great place to have a casual stroll through on your way from westminster abby/big ben on your way to Buckingham palace so there is no reason not to go. Check out the Queens amazing swan, maybe see the pelican. When the weather is nice it is beautiful sit on the grass bring a picnic. Weather a little too cold, its a great place to take a relaxing brief stroll in the city.

Nice break from the streets. We stopped in at the park between our visit to the Churchill War Rooms and our viewing of the dismount of the horse guards. It's a lovely park, with water features, flowers, and lots of lawn. We stopped in the cafe to buy some beverages and then sat on a bench to rest our legs and enjoy the scenery.
Good to relax. If you need a little break, than go to the park. It's a quiet oasis in a busy city! Ideal for a walk and run.
Lovely park. . What a lovely walk through the park it was. Shame we couldn't see any Pelicans. It was packed but clean and tidy. It's the sort of park you could sit and have a picnic in.
One of the great London parks. Take the subway to Westminster, visit the sites there and then walk to the park, which is 500 meters from Westminster Abbey. Beautiful park.

Lovely place. Whenever we go to London, we always end up having a stroll through St James's Park. I love the lake with its miriad of birds, I love the flowers an I love the squirrels. We usually walk from The Mall, through the park to Horseguards Parade. There's always something new and interesting.
May 2016. I could live there. Impeccably kept grounds. Healy wildlife. Strolled around for hours. Nice break from the inner city just a block away.

Lovely afternoon walk. A Lovely afternoon walk in the park. Lots of bike riders, and families walking around or picnicking. Along the bus route. Beautiful open spaces. Monuments and statues. Castles... What more could you be looking for in London.

Lovely Park. We chose to have a picnic in park with family (15 of us) to celebrate a family occasion. We took games, food and drink and stayed all afternoon. Luckily the weather held out!
It is very well maintained and is in a great position next to Buckingham Palace

A memorable and romantic stroll for us . Loved taking a stroll through here after visiting Buckingham..lots of families and couples, it was very crowded when we went but I'm sure it's always that way during the summer. Regardless, it's a very beautiful park and we highly recommend to anyone coming to London as its not only free, but the scenery is lovely!

Beautiful park!!. Love a good park, to escape from the hustle and bustle of the city, and st James park is definitely one of them! Beautiful even on a rainy day, I come here every time I visit London!! Would highly recommend!

Green strolling . Always an enjoyable stroll through the park and close enough to Piccadilly to pass by in a minute. Get there early for a quiet morning run or picnic in the afternoon. Even on a wet day there are sights all around it's something fun to do wrapped up in a scarf and hoodie. Coming from HK with no grass to be seen, St. James' has a charm to it with its proximity to the city shopping streets and Buckingham Palace, and those English rows of trees marking the pavement. Love!!

Another wonderful green space in the city.. There are some of the loveliest views of the Palace statues from different spots in this park. It is one of the prettiest green spaces around and allows for a peaceful stroll between different neighborhoods rather than taking the tube or bus.

Small but a beautiful park. Lots and lots of Ducks. Usually crowded even during a decent weather. It is a nice small park with a lot of chirping around, good fountains, small lake and some flowers. Nice to relax in the greens after a visit to Buckingham Palace or Churchill War Rooms.

Absolutely beautiful!. The nature is amazing. When you go into this park, you do not feel like you are in the city.It is full of wildlife; they are all quite happy to have humans around too. I had squirrels walk up to me instead of having to edge towards them.The water had white and black swans, lots of varieties of ducks, geese, herons, and pelicans!!! Highly recommend if you are a nature person and animal lover.

Fantastic Royal Park!. I visited the park on a June weekday lunchtime, with some work colleagues. It was a bright day and the park was bathed in a pleasant light.The park is essentially a large pond surrounded by lawns and flower beds, with a bridge crossing the pond. The pond is home to fish and countless types of birds, including pelicans that sometimes strut down the paths. There is a cafe and there are various ice cream and waffle vans dotted around. It lies between Whitehall and Buckingham Palace and is an oasis of calm in Central London.Nearest tube is St James's Park.Highly recommended.
Lovely oasis. Lovely small park, very peaceful although to my experience there are a lot of people almost always. Birds, trees and flowers.
The most beautiful place in the center. Such a beauty place with a lot of squirrels and different types of birds. A lot of places to seat on the grass and enjoy the views.

Extensive stretch of calm in the heart of the city. The park is a mass of well cared for garden beds resplendent in their spring glory. The park is well paved for easy access and provides a great deal of shady seating surrounding the lake that dominates the centre of the park. Check out the Swiss cottage that used to house the game keeper. Watch for geese, swans, pigeons and squirrels, not to mention the Pelicans. Take a picnic as food is expensive. there are toilets near the Marlborough Gate for 20p.
Beautiful Escape from the Noisy City. St. Jame's Park is a beautiful and peaceful reprieve from the city's congestion. The flowers and trees are beautiful, and the fountains and lakes were stunning.

An oasis in the middle of a mad and hectic city. Instead of taking the tube, I chose to walk through the park on my way home from a meeting. As soon as I walked into the green expanses of park, I could feel myself relaxing and letting the sunshine and quiet wash over me. People enjoying the spaces, romantics and tourists alike looking at the flowers and plantings which makes this park stand out in a city with amazing green spaces. Open to all, no locked gates to keep people out and only allow key holders access to quiet spaces with places to stop and enjoy the moment.
Beautiful Park. We walked through this park from Buckingham Palace to Big Ben. Many birds to view in the clean clear ponds.

Beautiful tranquil setting. Well maintained and so peaceful to just sit or stroll around this area , hard to believe you are still in centra London we were lucky Enough to see a squirrel and watch the ducks

Picnic in the park. Fabulous British London Park. Vast greenery and beautiful flowers.. lake with water feature. Wonderful wildlife, friendly squirrels and beautiful birds. Relaxing park with lovely cafetieres. Plenty to see and do ideal meeting please great place to relax and gave a picnic

A place to be while visiting the Palace. The St. James's Park is located along the street heading to the Buckingham Palace (the street is called "The Mall"). It stretches from in front of Palace to the Household Cavalry. The park is beautifully designed with green space, water, flower garden, and walking path. If you plan to visit this area (Big Ben, the Palace, the Museum), keep this place in mind for relaxing during your busy schedule to see a lot of places. It is located not far from the famous "Hyde Park". There are bathroom (toilets), coffee shop, restaurants. In many package tour, this place is not included but a quick visit from the front of the Palace is possible.

A big open space. Somewhere to walk, sit, watch the birdlife on the lake and generally breathe in London. Easy to access, not too difficult to navigate round, good views. A good antidote to some of the more crowded London attractions

Beautiful, quiet park. This park is a quiet haven in the hustle and bustle of the city. On a nice day you'll likely see the locals out eating lunch on the grass-it's not a bad idea to do the same. I wouldn't go out of my way to just see this park, but if you go to see Buckingham Palace you'll be right there so be sure to walk through.
Beautiful Park. Lovely little piece of green in a busy city. Defiantly worth having a wander through whilst your in London.

Lovely Park. We had a nice walk in the park enjoyed the lake and birds. Sat down to have a sandwich and it was like a scene from Alfred Hitchcocks The Birds. They know the sound of a crisp bag opening. The pigeons were all over us, and the crows watched menacingly. We gave and ate our lunch elsewhere. It did make us laugh!
Big park with man-eating pelicans. Lovely flowers, grassy areas and water fowl. Bring your lunch or tour group over. It is near many attractions and worth a stroll.

Stunning . History nature lakes and lovely views right in the centre of London. Picnics a must. Wild life and birds. Easy for Buck House St James Palace Downing Street and not far from the Thames. A pleasurable respite from the hurley burley of London life xxxx
A magic place to stay.. It is one of the most beautiful parks I have ever visited in a city center. You feel how the nature respects and loves you.

Lovely park, crowded anytime the weather is nice. St Jame's Park is one of London's lovely green spaces. If you are looking for a quite spot to sit or have a stroll it's a a good spot. However, if you want to do anything taking up a bit more space or involving any privacy, you're better off going on overcast days as the moment the sun peaks out from behind the clouds the people flock to the green.
Families all over. We lucked into this and it was well worth the atmosphere and view up the water to the grand buildings at the end.

Stunning!. This was a beautiful park and does the Royal Park's justice! We walked through it on our way to the Eye, but I wish we stayed longer. It was lush with flowers and birds in the spring when we went and is somewhere I definitely want to return! If you enjoy sitting in parks and relaxing I recommend this one!

Beautiful respite in the city. Let's face it -- London is a big, busy city. But nestled amidst the hustle and bustle is this beautiful park. I highly recommend a stroll through the grounds to find a little inner peace.

Lovely Park. We walked through here when we were visiting London, its quite unexpected, one minute you are in the thick of it, central London, Parliament, Buckingham Palace, Constitution Hill, cars and people everywhere and very noisy... then suddenly within 10 steps of entering the park, it's suddenly very quiet, tranquil and as far removed from London as you can get! Its a HUGE park, with people picnicking on the grass, kids playing, skaters... there are also free open air concerts here on a fairly regular basis. Would definitely come again with a small picnic to enjoy the experience.
Heaven on earth. It is a very big and great park in front of Buckingham. Ducks, geese, squirrels and birds are really beautiful in the park. They are also friendly :)
A nice spot. A beautiful park close to Buckingham Palace. Had a nice time near St. James lake and carried on walking to Westminster, Waterloo and St. Pauls.

Perfect place to relax. Calm and serene in the middle of London. Amazing birds, views, and greenery! Could spend the whole day there. We ended up going through St. James Park after Piccadilly Circus and it was a much needed calm after the noise and bustle of Soho.

A beautiful park do not forget war rooms. A beautiful park to wonder in if. You are visiting bucking ham palace or West minister abbeyChurchill war rooms are on west minister abbey dude and are fantastic. The park U.S. Beautiful and relaxing while you are there can visit royal horse guards as well

Lovely park. Went to this park on 2 different occasions with walking groups. Lots of people during the day and well cared for and I loved looking at the birds. Of an evening the light was fantastic and I took some really nice photos on a bridge looking towards Buckingham Palace. I think this park would appeal to a lot of people.

Beautiful gardens in Central London. St. James's Park is a 23 hectares park in the City of Westminster, central London. The park lies at the southernmost tip of the St James's area, which was named after a leper hospital .it is Established 1603,The closest London Underground stations are St. James's Park, Green Park, Victoria, and Westminster.In my view it is nice Beautiful gardens, lawns, treesl& lakes in london alsoyou will enjoy in squirrels & birdlife .it is not far from Buckingham Palace.

I love this park. It's a great walk from this park up to Trafalgar Square, or maybe just relaxing with a snack on a nice day. The locals seem to get their bodies or legs out if the sun is only slightly visible! For me, it's a lovely place to stroll through while enjoying the gardens, all provided the weather is good.

You can't visit Buckingham Palace without a walk through this!. Beautiful gardens, lawns, trees, lakes, squirrels, birdlife nestled not too far away from Buckingham Palace. Great place for a stroll or people-watching as many of them are either coming or going to BP. The ideal spot to rest just minutes away from the hub of London.

Well Maintained. After Standing for ages during the Change of guards, it was so welcoming to just sit on the green grass of St James park. Beautiful Flowers. I thought maybe the place could have more places to sit.
Beautiful gardens in Central London. Great place for a jog or a stroll - full of people walking to work, visiting or feeding the swans - so British!

Stunning scenery. This is a park in the middle of a busy city but is still absolutely fabulous. You get to see a beautiful pond, crazy little animals and walk through an amazing park. It is one of my favorite parts of London.
From Big Ben talk the long walk through this park to the palace. A nice way to walk to buckingham palace. Peaceful nature scenes and plenty of locals eating picnic items in the park.
Beautiful. Beautifully kept gardens, clean and tidy. Lovely walk round the lake whilst watching the birds/ducks etc. Very friendly squirrels too!

Beautiful Stroll. Very pleasant space to relax and rewind in busy London, especially after seeing the Changing of the Guards at Buckingham Palace with the busy tourist crowds.
Smaller version of Hyde Park with a view of the London Eye over 'The Blue Bridge'. There's also daily feeding of the Pelicans around 2:30-3pm if interested.

A reprieve in the middle of London. This park is definitely the best place to stop in the middle of a busy day and take a deep breath. The park is big, full of birds living a completely free and unafraid life. It reminded me of the dialog from Hunger Games where Katniss remarks about a deer who is not afraid of her that "it's so unfair". It is kind of, with these birds. They're stubborn and beautiful!! The park will connect you from the Parade ground to Buckingham Palace and if you're planning a day walk, stop here for lunch.
Lovely stroll through the park. Walked through St James Park on my way to Horse Guard Museum , lovely peaceful park to have a rest in.

My favorite place in London. Do not leave London without passing through St. James Park. If it's a nice day, you may find it irresistible not to linger. Great for watching graceful, exotic waterfowl and people watching. It is peaceful and beautiful. Get a sandwich and have a luncheon in this lovely place. It's the best place to take a break from the bustle of the city.
A real oasis in the heart of London.. Beautiful park retreat with stunning views of Buckingham palace and horse guards. A real oasis from the rat race of London, an hours picnic was time well spent.

Best park especially in autumn. St. James Park is probably my favoutite park in London. It has this lovely atmosphere that I just cant help to love. I like to walk from Reagent street to the park, its so relaxing especially after work !Full of squirrels and swans but still so close to everything.Perfect place to enjoy the outdoors.

Great spot for a picnic. Had a picnic here the day before the Queen's 90th birthday celebrations began.Although there were 10s of thousands of people around it was easy to find a comfortable spot for an M&S picnic.
Perfect for birdwatching. Lovely place to walk around. Set just opposite Buckingham palace it's located close to Westminister. Lot of variety in birds it someone finds bird watching their cup of tea
GORGEOUS PARK IN THE CITY CENTRE. Loved strolling around the Park. Takes you away from the hustle and bustle for an hour or so. Leads you right up to Buckingham Palace.

Stroll . A beautiful park to get some fresh air and take in how hard the people work to keep the park clean and to see the beautiful flowers loads of squirrels and ducks lovely to see wildlife and children enjoying feeding them ,beautiful peaceful and pleasant place
Lovely parc. I love this small parc near Buckingham Palace. Together with St. James's Park and Hyde Park it is one of the green lungs of this enormous city. It invites to make a rest.

A lovely bit of green in the city. Love St. James Park as it's a piece of green tranquillity in a chaotic city. Lots of wildlife, which always makes me laugh with foreigners feeding the squirrels (rats with tails lol) It's the main route from Horse guards to Buckingham Palace. Don't get scammed into paying £3 for a £1 ice cream!

The Heart of London!. We visit this park every time we are in London, as it such a magical place. After walking around Westminster we cut through Horse Guard parade and into St James. In the winter you can hand feed the squirrels if you take a few peanuts with you, as they are so tame. There is usually a pelican or three, just casually standing around, unbothered by the general public and a few swans on the lake. We were lucky enough to be there last week for the Queen's birthday celebrations. As we were walking on up towards the palace we witnessed the RAF fly over, with the Red Arrows at the end, blazing trails of red, white and blue, to a huge cheer from the crowd. Once again - Magic!
Great park to relax in. Super central London Park. Lots of green space to relax in and plenty to enjoy - trees, pond, wildlife. A nice retreat from the busy city.
Family outing . Walked through here on the 18th was very busy and pelicans come very close to you it was lovely and all the ducks come and greet you the park is a lovely walk

Countryside in the City of London. A stroll through St. James park gives a hint of the relaxed nature of British gardening. It is a lovely relief from the bustle of traffic. A welcome spot of green in which to relax before the next surge of art and history viewing!

Best park in London. Although Hyde Park is much larger, St. James Park is much smaller and more quaint. The views are excellent, and a quick stroll will lead you to Buckingham Palace. There are ducks aplenty, with water and bridges for a wonderful calming environment.The park is centrally located. To go from Parliament to Buckingham palace you will likely pass by the park. Just stroll through the park on your way to or from many of the great attractions surrounding this area.

Green spot in the city!. Such a great place to go to with a picnic on a summer's day in the city! Make sure you check the weather! So lovely to see families, dog walkers and joggers make use of this fantastic space.

One of the best parks in London.. We had an absolutely amazing time visiting this park. The ducks, birds, swans and pelicans are quite friendly and will want to come up to you for some food! A great, tranquil and peaceful place to walk while your surrounded by the concrete of the city!

My favorite place in London :). Lovely Park next to Buckingham Palace. Few steps from Green Park (another favorite parks of mine in London). Early morning and late afternoon are great time to watch the birds, ducks, and swan. My favorite is the black swan with red eyes :)
Always something happening. It was the Trooping of the Colour so plenty of people around, some in posh frocks and hats. The flowers beds are looking splendid. The birds on the lake are fascinating.
Definately worth a visit. A perfect place to relax and unwind the busy city London. Sit and watch the wildlife and a perfect place to people watch.
Beautiful walk in the park!. Thoroughly enjoyed walking around the park during a recent visit to London! Absolutely beautiful through and through.

Gorgeous!. The park is just dreamy. Absolutely beautiful to walk around. We saw some great wildlife while there and they are absolutely fearless of humans. They will walk right up for a snack if they think you have something. We ate in the little cafe there and the food was decent but the service was horrendous.
Hot Saturday. Great place to hangout during the warm days with great views and lots of green spaces to relax. Little cafe provides cold drinks and coffee too.

Don't feed the animals!!. Common people, tempting as it to have them animals close to us, it is a public park where toddlers and young children come for walks and play. Let's prevent *ahem* animal "attacks" from happening :)

A real gem. Been going to London for years but never really spent the time to look at these type of places, St James's Park is a real gem, on a nice sunny day its full of people chilling on the grass and walking around the grounds, we had a really nice time here and you can get an Ice cream or soft drink from the little cafe.

Garden chairs for relax. The park will be visited more than once if you are a London guest visiting the main siteseeing items, so you'll discover the place is rich with amenities for visitors: ice cream, toilets (GBP 0,20), garden chairs, and benches are all around.

Beautiful natural oark. Got lunch at Ottolenghi cafe and went to the park for a leisurely lunch. Walked around and explored Serpentine Gallery, Albert memorial and Kensington Palace. Very nice views across serpentine lake including large Henry Moore marble sculpture.

Perfect green space. We viewed the Trooping of the Colour, and then wandered through the park. It is a perfect example of an english garden. It was so peaceful, yet active. Lots of green lawn and flower borders. The pond with the ducks and swans. We enjoyed the stroll very much.
Beautiful green area. We walked through st james park after watching changing of the guard. Its a nice retreat after the hustle and bustle of buckingham palace. Beautiful flowers and lots of wildlife

Best part of our London Trip. It is important to see the obligatory things while in London (Buckingham, Tower of London........). Take the time to stroll through St James Park. They have a wonderful playground for small children. We brought some bread with us (been there before) to feed the swans and ducks with our children which was a huge success. When you get to the other side of the park check out the Horse Guards. Very fun. If you get there around 11ish you can even see the changing of the guard (I think these times may change).
Must see. Beautiful park always with people walking or just having a relaxing time in the grass. Squirrels running around, birds and some other animals.

A beautiful park that we can spend a whole day. . It's a beautiful park filled with many different species of birds and cute little squirrels. Kids will love this park. The Swan's family are the center of attraction for now. There's a children playground that keep the kids busy if they need a more active play.

Relaxing. London has a lot of parks because the livings places have no grass. Some like this one are very large This one has several parts to visit with things to admire. Great place to slow down and relax after running around to to see all the historical sights. There is a pond with lots of different birds and fish. There is also a place to get food, snack, or drink (it is expensive) to eat there or take away to eat in park. There are some benches you can usually find one to sit on because it seems that the people that live in London seem to like to lay on the grass rather than sit on bench.
A wonderful park for relaxing and taking in the sights. A wonderful park for relaxing and taking in the sights. Lots of choices for snack food and drink. Great for locals and tourist.

St. James's Park. I always pass by as my daily walks and really love the time spend at the Park ....The nature in the park is really nice and calm ...all the birds,squirrels ,ducks swans are the attraction of tourists .
I am sure everyone enjoy the time at Park .
