A rather pleasant place to visit.. With Buckingham Palace at one end and Horse guards parade ground at the other. This charming bit of green space in London is enveloped by lots of British history and serves as a place to lie back and relax after walking around all day soaking up the atmosphere.

Incredible walk on sunny afternoon. Loved the birds.. We walked through the park going from the Houses of Parliament to Buckingham Palace. The bird keeper was feeding the pelicans fish and was a lot of fun to see. There are a few ice cream stands in the park.

Not an ugly duckling in sight.. One of London's Royal Parks and well worth a visit. There are plenty of places to buy drinks, ice-creams and food - and for children to play (a playground is near the Buckingham Palace entrance). The bridge across the lake is one of the best spots to take photos of Buckingham Palace in one direction and the buildings of Whitehall and the London Eye in the other - and if you look down, some rather beautiful swans and their sygnets swimming by.

Love the London Parks. St James's Park is well kept and provides a peaceful place for reflection, picnics and walks with family and friends. I really love Duck Island Cottage with its well kept vegetable and flower gardens - such a quaint little cottage! My recent visit was during the Trooping the Colour so the park was busy. My partner watched the parade whilst I found a quiet spot to relax. Despite this being a busy day there was still plenty of room for those of us that wanted a little piece and quiet away from the crowds. There are some great views too - Buckingham Palace at one end of the lake and Horseguards at the other. Both magnificent sights. 20p to spend a penny. There is a café and a refreshment hut. There are plenty of birds on the lake, including pelicans! St James's was the first of the Royal parks to open to the public and is steeped in history. You can even hire a deck chair - prices start at £1.60 each for up to one hour. Take your camera!
Nice place to walk and relax. An amazing park, next to Buckingham and Green Park, not far from Big Ben. It has an amazing number of plants and trees and is a relaxing place.

Beautiful and Serene. This park is lovely. We enjoyed seeing all the different water birds, including geese to white pelicans, swans with their babies, and coots building stick nests right on the water.

A beautiful retreat. We strolled through St James Gardens after an afternoon that included high tea and shopping. The gardens were absolutely beautiful and conducive to relaxing and people watching! A perfect retreat from the city.

Very nice park, close to Buckingham Palace. Great day for a walk from our apartment in Westminster area. Over to see Buckingham Palace, then on to St. James park. Lovely area, lots of people watching was available. Very relaxing
Nice walk through the park. we walked through the park on the way to buckingham palace on a beautiful day. People were out and about everywhere but everyone kept to themselves.

Beauty . It was a rainy afternoon but it not detract an iota from the beautiful park. The central lake is alive with swans,ducks and geese. In No many other places in Europe the squirrels are so friendly. The air is fresh and invigorating. And you are steps from Buckingham palace

Lovely. Beautiful Park. Was a very hot day (for London) and families everywhere. You wouldn't think it is right there at Buckingham Palace. Worth the stroll through.
Water - Flowers - Park - Birds - Nice
Nice park to walk through. We walked through this park multiple times during the week that we were in London. We felt it was very safe.

Beautiful, relaxing park. Perfect place to stroll on a nice day. There are many folding chairs lined up throughout the park available to use. Great place to have a picnic and watch the swans. Flowers were in bloom and the weather was perfect

Amazing park !. Best park in London! Beautiful and interesting!
Very close to the Zoo.
Lots of people playing different types of games on the grass.

Simply stunning!. If you enjoy a nice walk in the gardens then this is the place for you. We were welcomed by a swan family. The duckkeepers cottage was so cute too. Very pleasant evening stroll. Perfect for a picnic!
Beautiful park to stroll through. We enjoyed walking through St. James Park, it was beautiful, ending at Buckingham Palace. Nice break from the city.
Nice Visit. Before the Queens birthday celebrations we walked through St James which early in the morning was very peaceful, we got us ready for a long day on the Mall

A walk in the park. St James Park is one of my favourites in London. I love the lakes and all the animals that you can see. I specially like the Pelicans, in what other park can you see Pelicans? You can have a nice walk around the park, you can sit in one of the many available benches or in the grass enjoying the sun! There's toilets available for p20, there's kiosks selling sandwiches and beverages,a bit overpriced tough, but you can always take your own food.

Don't miss this park!. Beautiful park! If you are standing in front of Buckingham Palace looking down The Mall - St. James Park is on the right. Green Park is on the left. Walk thru St. James park to the Horse Guards parade field. See the London Eye in the distance. Lot's of opportunities for great pics!

Lovely. We visited London in April 2015, weather was just nice. Not too hot but not too cold. Since spring was coming, flowers started to bloom and it was so pretty seeing all the very colorful tulips and cherry blossoms as well. Since its just beside the Buckingham Palace, its advisable to go and take a look at the park was well.

What a wonderful park nearby the Buchingham palace. I wish I could have share more pictures of that paradise at the heart of the city. All green and ducts and pigeons were every where. Go and have your experience there, don't forget your kids as well and relax....

Relax in the park. Conveniently located near the heart of London, it's a great place to rest between stops on a tour of downtown and have a picnic (bring your own food). The park tends to attract a lot of people when the weather is nice, so while you won't ever be alone you can easily find a quieter patch of grass to relax and enjoy the colourfull gardens.

Nice Park to visit between Buckingham Palace and Horses Guard Road. I strolled through St. James Park after the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. What a nice area, particularly on a warm sunny afternoon. Plenty of room for families to enjoy greenery right in the midst of metro London, playscapes for children, and convenience stands with cold drinks, ice cream, etc. Just perfect. And this can be enjoyed while walking from Buckingham Palace to the Horses Guard Road area where many prime tourist attractions are located. Absolutely beautiful views of the Palace and the Government Building areas looking both ways from the bridge in the park which crosses over the lake at about it's midpoint.
Amazing,. lovely park , just as good as hyde park but less crowded. great for a picnic but take care of the weather.

A Lovely Little Park. This park was such a beautiful park to walk through. Although when my friends and I walked through it we ran into a lot of birds. My advice is do not feed the birds unless you are prepared to get swarmed. Also do not be surprised if they chase other birds away. Otherwise the park is very well maintained and I had no issues otherwise.
can get lost very easy. we got lost and took us over an hour to find our way around to wear we actually needed to get to but overall was a good day out

Surprising wildlife. A visit to London would not be complete without a stroll through the park to see the surprising wildlife. Squirrels come right up and eat out your hand, pigeons landing on children's head and shoulders (for food) what a great photograph to remember your day. Surprising amount of beautiful geese and ducks,some I've never seen before. All used to people. Lots of space and lots to see including lovely trees and unusual plants. A good place to take children, don't forget 20p for toilets
Sunny days. Lovely place for a picnic or summer lunch. I tend to pass by whenever I can during my journeys. Difficult to not be taken by the nature around it.

great place to walk, rest, study - very peaceful setting in a hectic place. situtated directly across from Buckingham Palace, St. James Park is a great place for a morning walk or a place to spend a sunny afternoon on the grass. As the palace gets extremely crowded, especially when the changing of the guards occurs, the park is a great escape.

An oasis on a hot day. I have to start by admitting that I am somewhat biased towards St. James's Park as this holds very fond memories of visiting as a young child with my aunt. I remember stretching through the railings to feed the ducks and it's so good to see children still doing the same thing and being thrilled when the birds almost feed from their hands. The railings are now knee height to me but it is still a relaxing and delightful place to wander through or stop off for a picnic.

Mother duck says..quack quack quack. This is a quite calm place. All green and beautiful. The James park has got a pond surrounded by a park and with all big trees. There will be ducks all around. Perfect place for a peaceful, leisure day.
Beautiful . We went for a wander through this park on a number of occasions and absolutely loved it.The squirrels had us entertained for ages

It's a Park. A beautiful park. With beautiful views. With plenty of open space to just sit down and take I. London. Not too far from Buckingham Palace, so if you get to see the hour long production of the Changing of the Guards, this would be a nice place to relax and have a picnic afterwards!

A great escape for a few hours. Fresh air in the middle of London, with a chance to sit and relax. Very busy with tourists at weekends, but not too bad, crowd wise, during the week. The grounds are well tended. Good views of Buckingham Palace. Lots of wildlife, especially swans on the river.

Beautiful. Beautiful park bang in the centre of London. Unbelievable wildlife considering. Just avoid the 'Inn the Park' cafe as it is shocking. Such a shame and if anyone with business acumen owned it it would be an absolute gem.

Prelude to the Queen's home.. We chose to wander through the park as we made our way to Buckingham Palace. The setting is beautiful. It is a large, well used and well kept park. Though there were thousands of people, the place is large enough to accommodate them all and still no have you bumping into each other.There are places to picnic and stroll, sit in the sun or explore. Go with your besty or family and enjoy.

Great place for a picnic and a chill. Such a lovely park with swans on the lake, squirrels that must be the friendliest in the world, and plenty of places to sit in the sun or a shade of a tree. The view from the bridge is pretty magical and with Buck Pal just across the road its an ideal spot

Clean, beautiful, gardens and ducks . Many types of ducks and birds to watch. Early morning--like sunrise early, is gorgeous. I went early and it was clean, only a few joggers and a nice way to look at a city skyline and back at the palace.

Bliss. We have just come back from a family holiday in London and on our first night we ended up in this wonderfull oasis. We saw a man feeding Squirels out of his hand and he kindly gave us a nut each to feed them and it was such a treat being the animal and nature lovers we are. We decided we were going to come back with monkey nuts before we left to feed them. On our last day we went back armed with a bag of nuts and found a lovely place to sit and as soon as the squirrels heard the rusteling of the packet they came over but were then inundated with pidgeons and found ourselves giving in and feeding them instead they were all over us and we loved it it was so much fun and I believe they are a misunderstood and under valued birds, they have amazing shimmering colours to their necks.  We walked around the park taking in all the joys of the surroundings and were delighted to be a foot away from Herons and Pelicans. It was by far our most favourite park.
Pretty Park. Just behind the Victoria Statue this park is very nice, we waited here to see the changing of guards at the Buckingham Palace.

Lovely site. I've not been to London since I was a little girl so a little bit naive in the location of attractions - Buckingham Palace being just at the end of the park.My kids loved the park grounds, the freedom to run ahead along the paths was lovely as we could see them. The lake is stunning, with lots of ducks, ducklings, and pelicans. The youngest day was made by finding the fabulous play area, she particularly loved the musical dancing board. We heard a band practising and were lucky enough to catch the run thru for Changing Of the Guard for the Queens birthday. We got lots of fabulous photos from the park of Buckingham Palace and The Mall.You can spend quite a few hours in the park, there are toilets, refreshments, and seating areas.
Peaceful. London is a very busy place and if you want a bit of peace and quiet, St James' Park is a good place to go. The walk down and around the park is lovely with good views.
Nice for a stroll.. Lovely park at the palace.You can have a little rest and relaxation in this lovely park after walking around town.
Lovely gardens. Beautiful well tendered gardens. Cafe nice but it ŵas busy and too much of a queue. Swans put on a dance for us, which was lovely.

Lovely greenery in London. My friend guided me through this park after we walked by Buckingham Palace. I found it more exciting than the palace, frankly. If you like birds, you will see plenty of them especially waterfowl, including herons and ducks. I didn't get to see any of the pelicans, but they are fed daily at 2:30 PM so that would be your best bet to catch them. The cafe on the grounds ("Inn the Park") has a clean free restroom and some delectable-looking desserts which I failed to partake in.With attractive grounds and plenty of people-watching opportunities, St.James's Park makes for a pleasant environment for making your way to such attractions as the London Eye and Big Ben.
A.R.. If the weather is nice it's a good place to spend your day or at list few hours of walk. Wild birds, squirrels and a fresh air.

What you would expect of a public park. It's a park. Grass, trees, a lake, places to sit, places to eat. It was a busy weekend when we went but it is less so midweek. That said, you will get loads of tourists on just about any day. There were people having pic-nicks and B-B-Qs but there were a number of food outlets too. The toilets were clean but not free (only 20p for goodness sake!) Friendly squirrels will take nuts from your hand and the pelicans will take your hand so heed the signs and don't attempt to feed them. Nice views across the lake. Not a tranquil place but worth walking through instead of walking down the Mall.

A quiet oasis in the middle of London!. This is a beautiful park with beautiful trees, paths and lake in the middle,of London. A very tranquil place and you get glimpses of Buckingham palace for photo shoot! You can sit on the grass or on the benches Nd enjoy the sun. Toilets were awful and they charge 20p. A nice little escape!
Some great views . Some great views to see as you can see the war offices and the Buckingham palace nut also feed the some cute squirel whom will eat out of your hands if you don't be silly.

Nice park. Central park that you will cross from Westminster to st James and Buckingham palace. On sunny days the locals like to relax here rather than the nearby green park.
Chipmunks,.pelicans and other animals are great for small children.
Many tourist attractions nearby.

It's a spectacular place to visit and even more spectacular during a nice summer day. . Go there on one of the London Bikes, my favourite route is from Notting Hill through z Kensington Gardens. They are so easy to use and a cheap way to see the London with your own eyes instead of the stuffy underground.

See the guards training or watch the ducks or both!. We wandered through St. James Park on the way to Churchill's War Museum and what luck we did! We watched the Scots Guards (that's what a Bobby on a Bicycle thought they were), in training for an event the next month. Our short cut, took a lot longer than expected as we took our time to watch the ducks, take in the scenery and marvel at the fact that even though London is a city, it is very much a green city.

Pleasant walk. It's a very scenic green park. Great view with Buckingham palace and Horse Guard on each end.Lots of birds and white swans on the river. It could be a nice place for a picnic in a sunny day.My friend recommended it to me. I had a great pleasure to stroll along.

My favourite Royal Park. This park has a beautiful lake with fountain, large expanses of grass to sit under the trees and relax, with views of Buckingham Palace and horse guards parade . Small restaurant with other food and drink outlets, Wildlife and interesting planting make this park perfect for any time of year
A Wonderful Park. The once royal garden is a lovely place for a stroll or a lunchtime chill. There is a fabulous array of bird life on the pond.

Lovely park - facilities could be improved. Loved our trip to this park whilst walking from Buckingham palace to the London eye. Nice sand pit and music steps / sunken playpark for kids. However dry sand and large slippery rocks don't mix with 3yr olds and our holiday was nearly ruined by a very sore spilt lip!! Then unhelpful staff at kiosk had no first aid kid, paper towel or ice they could offer a screaming toddler with blood everywhere. We had to buy a ice lolly which was fine but any decent service would have offered more compassion. I'd hate to think of their response if the situation had been any worse!! Also adults are not allowed to use the toilet facilities - so your options are to drag your kids away from the park miles away for the loo or take your kids into the toilet and use it anyways which we did but saw dozens of frustrated adults being told they couldn't use empty facilities. That's a rule book went wrong!!! There is a guy stained in the toilets doing absolutely nothing all day - ohh and he didn't have a first aid kit either! Signage of where to go to get to where could be improved too. Otherwise park itself lovely .
Wonderful park. Green, fresh air and chairs to relax. People walking, jogging, playing or having family pivknick. Nice feeling all in all.
Biodiversity. From all the parks in London I think this is the one where you'll find more biodiversity. Lots of squirrels, ducks, different plants and flowers, etc... Worth a visit on a sunny day!
Quiet inner city park. We were surprised to find this tranquil gem in busy London where we stopped for a short break on our bike tour. Snap a picture on the bridge for a very pretty backdrop.

Lovely park. We wondered through the park a few times. One sunny afternoon after too much time in museums we spotted beach chairs for rent. They made for a relaxing hour in the park. Other days we walked around for the views and that was great too.

Most Beautiful Park of All. St James's Park was so beautiful. It has all the garden of Regents Park, with the open green space of Hyde Park, all in a condensed and tailored setting. Not as many dogs running around. More crowded with people enjoying a lunch break, and the grounds were clear and clean, ready for you to lay right down.
Nice place to relax . Such a lovely park. Kids love it as well as adults. Lots of things to see. The walk is absolutely great. Feeding squirrels n ducks. Cheap outing

St James Park. Beautiful park, big and clean, great place for mornings run and you can cross it directly to hyde park.
Few lakes and a lot of birds and ducks, green grass and beautiful trees.
One of the loveliest parks in London. We have visited London number of occasions and always return to this park. Great day out for the family!
Wonderful park. This Park is just what you would expect from London. A huge park with a lake, fountains and lots of animals freely roaming around.
Beautiful and spacious greens. Perfect for walking, exercise, reading, picnic -- whatever! Plenty of little garden areas, and close to a great tea house.

Lovely park in middle of London. Lovely public park in the middle of London. We were there on a lovely sunny day. There were people every where enjoying the park, the lakes, flowers and water birds. Delightful place for walking and running, or just to relax from the busy life in London.

St James Park. What a beautiful park! Plenty of oak trees for shade; lots of wildlife to amuse and admire; a wonderful lake to have a plesant stroll around and the stunning flower beds with their own perfume and structure. Of all the parks, I think this is my favourite,
Stunning . Beautiful free fun , amazing views and wildlife , visit very often . The park is lovely , playground for little ones and the stunning ponds has a wide variety of wildlife

Great place for a picnic. What an unexpected find! My husband and I grabbed a quick lunch from a mobile foodtruck and had an impromptu picnic in the park before touring the Churchill War rooms. It was one of our favorite things that we did while in London. The park is absolutely beautiful.
taking a short cut. Nice sunny day decided to take a walk from Victoria to Green Park. lots of people strolling and maybe just a few spooks exchanging notes - uplifting experience
A Nice Park. Not much to say. It's a nice enough park in the middle of London. Lots of animals and lots of tourists.

Walk around Town. Pretty spectacular park and walk across the lakes and through the woods, not too crowded, and perfect balance of water, trees, open areas. Easy access from the bustle of Victoria to the peace of Constitution Hill and back through Horse Guards Parade all decked out ready for the upcoming Queens birthday review of the troops. Just top tourist agenda in London!
Beautiful on a sunny day. Simply stunning.... The flora fauna, cackling geese, ducks, squirrels ..... Toooooo good n a must visit for old n young alike!

Amazing Experience. Second time I visited St James Park. It is truly amazing. Close to so many sights and it is basically the front yard of Buckinham Palace. There are also some places to eat through the park.
A Royal Park. Located in a very strategic position close to Westmister, Trafalgar Square and Buckingam Palace, it's a very nice park
So refreshing . We had to walk thru this park to get to Buckingham Palace and it was so refreshing. So many beautiful flowers, luscious plants, and active animals along the way

London gem. It's perhaps not as well known as Hyde park but St. James park is much prettier and smaller. The flowers are beautiful. You can see wildlife such as ducks, geese and squirrels and sometimes Pelicans. In the summer it gets busy. Buckingham palace is within a stones throw as is horse guards and the guards museum.
Beautiful park. A lovely family day out, especially for a picnic on a sunny day. Good amenities for a park and located well for other London attractions.

Bring nuts and bread!. Very beautiful and well maintained park right next to Buckingham palace. Remember to take some bread for the birds and nuts for the squirrels - they'll eat from your hand - and climb up your leg if you hesitate with treats!
lovely peaceful walk. good way to wander about on a Sunday morning and admire the wildlife. Might get lucky and see the pelicans
Beautiful park!. Love this park so much! What a wonderful place to spend a beautiful Summer's day. Recommended to anyone looking to have a picnic or a relaxing walk.

A gem in the centre of London.. As so often, it is always too easy to take something for granted if one uses it frequently: when staying in London my route to the District Line takes me across the Park. Some years ago I crossed it every day for several months while attending a Public Inquiry in Westminster Central Hall.Whatever time of day, in whatever weather, it is never less than fascinating, with brief views to Buckingham Palace in one direction and Horse Guards in the other, or of Wellington Barracks and the back of Queen Anne Gate if walking in a different direction.Whatever reason one has for visiting the Park, it is a great privilege to be able to do so.

Fabulous Park - nice and relaxing. We visited on a cool, sunny day and the park was rather busy. We walked to the park through Horse Guards Parade. Plenty of benches for picnics. We went to the playground close to Buckingham Palace, it was small but good fun. We took photographs on the bridge over the lake, good view of Buckingham Palace in one direction and London Eye in the other. Lots of ducks and greedy squirrels.

A beautiful surprise in the heart of London. This is one of the most beautiful parks in town. Fantastic vistas of world famous buildings, immaculate flower beds - and pelicans!The only problem is the hoards of tourist packs.

A.ways lovely. Most walking trips through central, royal London lead you thru here, and it is always a delight. the prettiest of the main parks, and esp nice in the spring with lots of color and birds.
Great walk. This park is epic, great walk with beautiful ponds and flowers, and conveniently located to all the other London attractions.
Extremely busy. Over packed with tourists which is a shame because it is a lovely park with all the birds. Could be extremely tranquil.
Beautiful!. St James's Park is between Buckingham Palace and Big Ben. It provides lovely shaded paths and quiet beauty in the midst of the city.

wonderful few hours. This is a lovely way to spend a few hours and watch the world go by. You wouldn't know you were in The Capital.
Worth a visit and a lovely chill out

London's not just pigeons!. Never thought to see wild herons in the centre of London! All manner of waterfowl on the lake. What's more they're so used to people you can get really close - no need for a telephoto lens. And the squirrels are almost tame.

Beautiful. Loved walking around St James Park, it was a fabulous sunny day and a beautiful walk. We also stopped for a coffee and bun in the Inn the Park restraunt and so much as it was expensive it was worth the money. Thoroughly enjoyed

Perhaps my favourite park in London. Smaller than nearby Hyde Park, Kensington Gardens and Green Park, but this one has an added, unidentifiable charm. There are lovely views around each turn of the paths. Beautiful gardens

Beautiful Park . We took a walk through the Park after our visit to Churchill War Rooms. Was definitely a beautiful spot to enjoy a little bit of nature in a bustling city. Lots of birds and flowers to add to its ambience.

Beauiful Park. My wife and I were looking for a place in London to leave some of my mom's ashes (London was her favorite city). A few blocks from our hotel we come across this wonderful park. The flower arrangements were wonderful and the animals were free to roam. Plenty of places just to sit on a bench or lay in the grass.

Lovely stroll to get from Buckingham to Westminster Tube Station. My daughter and I enjoyed a leisurely stroll through St. James's Park on a recent Sunday. We caught some nice photographs of Buckingham Palace from the bridge. There was a food vendor or two (hot dogs, ice cream, etc.), but we did not partake.

One of the nicest parks in London.. St James' Park is a must for all visitors to London. Starting at Buckingham Palace it meanders along the Mall to the Horse Guards Parade. It was particularly good during late May as the bird life was full of newly hatched chicks, beautiful flowers and, for good measure, lovely sunshine.

Lovely walk. We walked through this park to Buckingham palace was very peaceful and beautiful scenery loved the Dec chairs in the park too as well as seeing the pelican my sons loved all the different ducks

Relax and Enjoy. Take a walk from Downey Street through the park to Buckingham Palace. Stop sit relax and enjoy the park and people. Make sure you see the Duck Keeper's Cottage and view the length of the lake to see the Palace from the distance.
St james park. Beautiful park lovely cafe its a big park lovely flowers .nice for a afternoon trip and its free worth a visit.
Lovely place to stroll. Lucky enough to on london on a beautiful spring day. Enjoyed thewalk, the ducks, squirrels ., good place to take a breather fromvthe hectic london streets
Kind of charm. The first thing that I do in London : go throught the park and admire the nature, and feel it spread into your bones, really enjoying!
A Gem. London has many great parks, and St. James certainly isn't the biggest, but it may be the prettiest. Well worth a walk around.

Great, feel sorry that was in hurry. I will change that next time! Get something to sit and spend there at least few hours.
Intresting that children spend there some kind of school break.
Beautiful park . This is definitely a place to visit while in London. Right across from Buckingham Palace. Lots of flowers, swans, ducks, etc for the photo enthusiasts. Love it.

Lovely park for a stroll in a busy city. We toured this park as part of our walking tour. It is a beautiful park and was probably the highlight of our tour. If you are in London, take the time to visit this treasure in the city.

Pearl of the city. St. James Park was my greatest thing I have seen in London. Beautiful lake, lot of colorfull birds, great restaurant on the bank of river. I like this place lot. For the couples is this place most romantic from my point of view. I really recoment to visit this pearl of London.

Picturesque park. Taking a stroll here is a must-do. Great place for people watching and picnics. Plants and animals make for a lively and colorful park. Buckingham Palace is at one end of the park too which makes it convenient to visit them both.

Hard to believe you are in London. I find St James park really relaxing and a beautiful green space in the middle of a concrete jungle. The Pelicans are fantastic to watch and there is plenty of space to sit. The playground looked very good and new. Plenty of places to grab a snack or drink.

Lovely place to walk and take in the sights. I enjoyed this park more than the palace it sits next to, mostly as it had no cost to stroll through and had such nicely designed paths populated with various plants and a real plethora of waterfowl. There were geese so large I felt sure they would attempt to eat me, though I saw a tiny mandarin duck harassing one of these gargantuan birds with no fear.
Nice park. Same as everywhere else . Every city generally has nice gardens somewhere. Lucky it was a nice sunny day

The most beautiful landscape park in London. A great place to have an al-fresco picnic in central London. I've been to parks all over the world and I can't remember many more beautiful than St James's. I used to work around here and in the summer eating my lunch here would be an extraordinary treat.It's worth seeing the pelicans, which were apparently gifted to the Royal family by the Russian ambassador many years ago.
beautiful. You must take a walk through this park after visiting the Buckingham palace such a beautiful park and so peaceful
Wonderful walk. Love to take a walk in all the wonderful parks of London especially at spring time. This time we were very lucky with the weather also.

Another London landmark. Had a walk around this park, it is beautiful and peaceful, you can feed the birds on the lakes or just relax. There was a charity fun run on while we were there so very busy, still good to see.

A beautiful place for a peaceful stroll. ... London is blessed with so many quiet green spaces and this is a premier spot to rest the body & soul. Enjoy the wide variety of wildlife in this very important sanctuary.

Beautiful escape from the city. The park is a beautiful escape from the city. It offers much to see including the wonder wild fowl lake, manicured garden and an abundant variety of tress. The is wide open spaces and many trails to follow. You can walk between here Green Park and Hyde Park quite easily.

Lovely views. This is an ideal place to have a picnic, a coffee or just a well earned rest. Such a lovely place to just watch the world go by. Don't forget to take some biscuits or peanuts for the squirrels, they are so funny - they will take the food gently from your hand and then try to hide it in the grass for later
Beautiful . A beautiful park with lots of birds and squirrels :) they have chairs standing in the grass so you can borrow and sit down in the grass. Really recommend a walk here!
Visited here for a picnic. Lovely park, 101 Dalmatians was filmed here also. Nice to feed the swan, ducks and squirrels. Very pretty

Lovely park. This is a lovely setting for a nice walk with views of Buckingham Palace and as far as the London Eye. A few small but beautiful flower beds. Tons of tour groups so one has to be a bit patient.
Makes for a good combination with the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace.

Urban oasis. This is a lovely park away from the hustle and bustle. When we visited in March they were cygnets and birds nesti in the middle of the lake. It's a pleasant route to stroll from Buckingham Palace to Big Ben and other local attractions.

A green lung in a busy city. Lively setting with a good display of flowers. Plenty of space to sit either on the grass or on seats around the lakes. The cost of acuppa at the small restaurant is extortionate!

Beautiful Gardens Leading To Buckingham Palace. The gardens are extensive, well maintained and in the right season quite beautiful. With the back drop of Buckingham Palace and the Mall this is a must if you visit the Palace. Walk to the Household Cavalry and if you time it right you can see the Changing of the Guard ceremony. At weekends it can get very busy.

A mini oasis. Absolutely love this place.
It is a mini oasis for me in the busy-ness of London. Though the park can be busy in itself you can still find a corner patch of grass to tuck yourself away and read a book. Great to spend a sunny afternoon here without spending a tonne of money.
Special summer. Went there to have a walk on Thursday as it was bright and sunny. But won't regret it as I really enjoyed the time there...would love to go there again
Great Park!. Great area for spending an afternoon. Throw down a blanket, crack a bottle of wine, and watch London walk by.

Must visit. Those who like to see ducks and water birds must visit this park. In the early spring morning, a walk in this park was exhilarating. It is just small enough to enjoy without tiring oneself. The only disappointment was not to see squirrels which was one of the reasons to visit the park.
Centrally located and a very pleasant experience.
Good for picnic. Enjoy a day out and have nice picnic here.In the middle of London this is an oasis to roam and have good times.
Beautiful park. lovely gardens, but not a very quiet place because of the hoards of tourists. Since it is close to Buckingham Palace, lots of people cut through it. Pretty, but crowded

Time to spare. My friend and I found this lovely park while we were strolling around, it was so tranquil, all of the birds were lovely in the lake and river, great views from the bridge of Buckingham Palace.
Glorious in the sunshine. A great park made even better when the sun is shining in the spring. So many chicks with the swans and ducks.

Another royal park that doesn't disappoint. St. Jame's Park is another in the grouping of royal parks that is full of gardens and water and wildlife. It is absolutely beautiful as are all of the parks we walked around in London. This city knows how to do parks and do them well.

Feeding the ducks with my daughter was a once in a lifetime experience. The park is clean, safe, interesting, wonderfully located, and the ability to feed the ducks/birds at will in the approved places is a special treat as well. It's become my and my daughter's "go to" place here in London on this trip. No bikes in the park is nice as well. Bikes are great but not allowing them in the park makes a good experience for pedestrians even better

Sunlight, fresh air and beautiful landscapes. This park is a great outdoor attraction when sightseeing in central London. We sent after visiting the Churchill War Rooms and it was a welcome break to get sunlight and fresh air for a few hours. If your planning your visit, this is a great way to get from the Whitehall area to Buckingham Palace. Stop for refreshments at Inn the Park.
The best park in London. Very nice park with many animals (squirrels and birds). Usually there are many people and is a bit crowded.
nice natural place in the centre of megapole. Very nice and cal place with natural lake, thousand birds and animals, trees, flowers,.... good for relaxing in the city centre
Rest in the sun !. If you feel tired of walking around, take a break at St James Park. Chairs are offered at 1,6 pound and you can sleep and enjoy the good weather !
Beautifal. Very clean and amazing location. Right beside Buckingham Palace and there is an underground station as well. We went on a Sunday and it was very busy!

Beautiful park...Bees were out in full force!. I'd put this as one of the top public parks to visit in the world...it's so beautiful with great views of Buckingham palace. You'll see tons of people lounging around the park having lunch and just enjoying the atmosphere when it's not raining. The cherry blossom trees were just blooming on our last trip.
A nice walk!. When it is not raining, it is really nice to walk or sit and relax here with the company of squirrels, ducks and other birds.

Busy and crowded . Walking through St James Park is one way of getting Buckingham Palace. The park is full of tourists but a pretty and lovely place to see. In spring the flowers are lovely and you'll see some of the local squirrels. If you have some for them to eat, they'll climb up your leg to get it.

Splendid Central London parrk. The Central London parks are a joy to behold. They are the "lungs" of the city. You leave the hustle and bustle of the city, and within a short distance, can hear nothing but birds singing. There are marvelous places to walk or jog, or just sit on a lovely bench. We are park lovers, and St. James is certainly "near the top of the list! "
St. James Park. Took a lovely walk down from the hustle and bustle. Lots of lovely buildings and statues to look at. Had a coffee and sat in the park watching the world go by.
Beautiful. Lovely place to relax after seeing the palace Have a coffee and watch the world go by.Views of London eye and the place beside the river

The prettiest park in London. Beautifully maintained park. Gorgeous flowers and trees in a range of colours. A short walk away from buckingham palace and the horse guards. There are lots of squirrels that are quite tame and not afraid to come up to you. As in most London parks there are deck chairs free for the public to sit on dotted around the park. You no longer have to spend ages looking for a free bench when you can just open a deck chair, relax and look at the ducks floating in the beautiful pond.

Absolutely beautiful. Clean, charming and a real rest from the busy streets of London. This park hosts a variety of fowl. Incredible landscaping with a whole host of shrubbery. Smelled incredible. Bring bread crumbs. Squirrels eat out of your hands.

Just for sunny day . If you and your buddies have time and it a lot, grab so bottles and get you shads on and a mini link sound with a power bank head here, find a good spot drink listen to some good cool sound and enjoy the lake and people and animals

Calm green oasis. We took a walk through this wonderful park and was pleasantly surprised by how beautiful it was. The lake is stunning with the fountain, great photo opportunity but the highlight were the squirrels which may be considered a pest but make the whole experiencequite amusing as they are very friendly, took some fantastic photos. Definitely going back when I have a little more time to just sit and enjoy

an easy walk, enjoy the squirrels and gardens. A much valued greenspace in London; visit seasonally to enjoy the range of flowers and trees. The squirrels are always there fore extra entertainment as are the ducks/swans.
Nice park. Stayed there for a little trip. I love nature, love the animals, love the relax you can find in it. Not so far to the buckingam palace, it's worth to be drop in it just for relaxing too.

THE ALL SEASONS PARK. No visit to London can be complete without a leisurely stroll...and if the weather is good...a relaxation and even a picnic lunch in St James Park.It is easy to assume it is the Official Park for the Royal Family and the parliamentarians because it is located in the middle...easy walking distance.... between Palace of Westminster Parliament/Downing Street areas and Buckingham Palace/Victoria.Bring your camera to capture either the array of bird life, public events or the Royal Horse Guards Parade.
What a Beautiful Time of Year!. The flowers look fabulous, the birds are plentiful and many have babies. This is a real gem to wander around and enjoy nature.

Nice park. When you are tires from city sightseeing, you can have a rest in the park. Full of flowers and different birds, ducks are there in the water. At midday you can see a lot of young people who have their lunch there.
Beautiful park for a stroll. The gardens are very well maintained, and the park is pretty large. Overall, a nice experience to get some fresh air.
visit the pelicans. love this grand old park and went for a quick walk with friends around the pond on a Sunday afternoon. Delighted the pelicans are still in residence.
Island of peace. Lovely London park with relaxing places to sit and absorb the sun and of course an unbeatable view of Buckingham Palace.
Such a beautiful place. Ohhhh, such a beautiful place and right next to the Horse Guards! If you are lucky, you might even see the changing of the guards!
Beautiful Park. We took a tour bike ride through most of this park. Huge park and simply beautiful. The park abuts great views of many city landmarks.
Just an enjoyable afternoon. Yes, St. James Park is the place to spend an enjoyable afternoon. Nice and quiet environment, friendly squirrels, nothing to trouble your walk. Do it!

My favourite park in London. Loved wandering around this park - take some nuts or fruit, some of the squirrels are friendly and are happy to take food out of your hand! (Or there are lots of birds to feed!)
It's beautifully kept, with nice flower beds, ponds, etc.
Afternoon walk. We have always wanted to visit this famous royal park. Been seeing it from bus window before. Not disappointed, great scenery.

Awesome in Spring. Visited the St. James Park only to see the beautiful flowers in bloom - they were gorgeous. Visited in the first week of May. Other times the flowers are not see as its not the correct season. If you wanna see these gorgeous flowers you gotta go April end - may beginning only! The bonus to visit this is the ice cream in really pleasant weather.

Great walk in the evening. Took a wonderful stroll in this park during the early evening. It was quiet in the middle of London. Ducks, cranes and squirrels were frolicking around. Just a few minutes from the Horse Guards Parade, The Mall, 10 Downing Street and Churchill's War Rooms.
Lovely park. What a lovely park to walk through, so clean and tidy. Little coffee shops along the way taking to to different ends.
Runners joy. Lovely mix of people, water, grass, trees, flowers - go run it and don't forget to rubber neck the glorious embassies along the side.

Beautiful. Located very near both Buckingham Palace and Westminster, this park is surprisingly very peacful and beautiful. Bird, and other wildlife survive with ease amongst the centre of one of the busiest cities in the world. A 15 - 20 minute walk through sets you up for more busy site seeing.
Great park to wander through. A great park to stroll through and/or sit and enjoy. Lovely to see the birds and animals as well as the specimen trees and plants.
Beautiful park in the middle of the city. Beautiful park and gardens. Lovely for a mid-day stroll after lunch to relax and enjoy a different perspective in London!

Nice strolling grounds . This was one of my top 5 places to see while in England and I was not disappointed in the least. Even though there were many visitors, it still had a beautiful quiet to it.
Spent hours there walking, sitting and contemplating.
I felt very peaceful when leaving.
I recommend St. James park to everyone!

Love This Park!. If you're a "101 Dalmatians" fan, this is the park where Pongo and Perdito met. For anyone, it's a beautifully maintained park offering lovely strolling paths in beautiful surroundings right up to Buckingham Palace. It's free. It's pretty. Go stretch your legs!

Beautiful park. Lovely place for a relaxing picnic, stroll with a partner or solo. There's a pub where you can have a glass of wine or beer and just enjoy the beautiful lawns, flowers and scenery. Squirrels and many different birds for the kids to see. Deck chairs are available to sit where you can read or people-watch when the sun's out.

A favourite walk in London. This is a great place to get away from things for a bit. The walks are lovely, and just off the street enough to allow a bit of quiet. My daughter and I found a bend to sit for a bit and watch the birds, and just rest our legs, which is well-advised on a busy day in London.

Perfect little park for a stroll. Perfect little park with a good variety of wildlife to enjoy. There are some restaurants in the area also. We happened to go on a nice sunny day and thoroughly enjoyed it.

always nice for a stroll in beautiful green. always worth a walk when the sun is out and you don't feel like spending money on a nice activity for an afternoon - just like all the nice parks London has to offer. Sometimes you might even see a pelican eat a pidgeon as I have heard...

First time I ever saw a Swan take flight. We were wlaking through St James Park on our way to the chaning of the guard at Buckingham palace. Like many city parks, they are nice because getting green space and tranquil surroundings in the heart of the city can be refreshing. My favorite thing while walking through was seeing and hearing a Swan take flight was terrific. Hearing the sound of its wings flapping while trying to generate enough force to get airboune drew my attention. Seeing its wing span and watching it get airbourne I had never witnessed, so it was pretty enjoyable. It circled and landed. That is about what I remember of the park.
pretty as a picture. This beautiful park is one of the best maintained parks (of course its right in front of the Buckingham palace so you know who's watching)

Whenever I walk in the London street.... I want to see the gardens. Thank you to the hard working staff who keep the park filled with color. We did not do anything but stroll through. But that was enjoyable.

A bit of peace in the City. You can approach this park from many directions, Horse Guards Parade, Buckingham Palace or the Mall it has many sign posts throughout directing you with a walking time but there are so many seats around especially by the lake that you will stop several times and watch the world go by.Lots of baby ducks & geese around a lovely place to be.
Nice park to stroll around. We walked along this park on our way to Buckingham Palace. The weather was perfect and it was so nice being outdoors. Wish we had more time to spent there.
Beautiful setting . A lovely park with beautiful views. I would be nicer if some time was but into plants and flowers, but it was clean and well kept.

Such a variety of wildlife!. A lovely relaxing stroll through the park allows you to almost forget you're walking through an incredibly busy city. The lake is home to Pelicans, cormorants, herons and many other beautiful birds (as well as some very friendly squirrels!), and is a lovely place to just chill and forget the stress of the city!
Beautiful park . Beautiful park. Enjoyed watching all the wildlife and loved the little Swiss Cottage and mini garden. Was surprised at how friendly the squirrels were!

Love this park. The park has something for everyone - kids play area is really good, nice water with ducks, great views of London eye and Buckingham palace, lots of places to sits. Loads of grass, very peaceful. Been going here for 10 years and love it. Easily can spend and hour or two.

Lovely for picnics, a walk in the sun or shade. Gorgeous park with loads of birds on the water and in the trees. Very peaceful and a great place to get away from the traffic noise and pollution.Useful huts selling drinks, ice cream and snacks. A little on the expensive side, probably better getting your own before you get in the park. Summary: A really nice place to walk in central London

Great place to take in the life of a Londoner. We had a beautiful sunny Sunday in London and it was Mother's Day (not celebrated in England). After mass at the Abbey Cathedral we walked into St James park to on our way to see Buckingham and it was busy with families, couples, friends- all enjoying the beautiful weather in the park. My husband and son decided to go to the Churchill War Room located next to the park- so the girls and I found a spot under a tree and took in the scenery. Beautiful flowers, ducks and fun people watching. A must do on a gorgeous London Day!
Great relaxing chill out place in middle of busy london. Loads of great restaurants near byBut this is great place to walk and chill outMake a stop here whilst working your way around london
London best park. Lovely park with lots of ducks and squirrels. Perfect to go with friends and take beautiful photos, relax and have fun. Can wait moment to come back.
Beautiful and tranquil. Marvellous park, calm and tranquil contrasting to the bustle of Whitehall and Buckingham Palace. Deckchairs available to soak up the sun.
Beautiful park. Right near Buckingham Palace and a shirt walk to Trafalgar Square. Lovely squirrels running around and places to eat and drink, also public toilets are located inside the park.

Always lovely . Fortunate to work next to the park and always enjoy a walk through here. Calming and also full of life.
Place of so many birds. The pelicans always fun to watch as they strut and preen.

Grand and magnificent. You have to be there to breathe in the fresh air in the park. You almost can taste the air is so sweet. The enviroment is so joyful. Green grass blue sky happy birds and natrual haibitats are yours to enjoy reflex in and lost yourself in.

Nice park . We had a lovely stroll around this park. Loads of people doing the same and just enjoying themselves. Plenty of benches for a little sit down along the way or plenty of grass for same think.

BEAUTIFUL!. Visiting this park in the Spring was so memorable. It's well kept and is filled with great picture spots. With all of the flowering trees and plants, it smelled amazing! There are also lots of different types of friendly birds that you can feed.
Place to relax. Good walk after crowded streets. When I got tired, it was good to take a seat on a bench and to watch ducks and gooses swimming in a pond or fed by other visitors.

Water and Grass, birds and sunworshippers. A beautiful lawn park in the centre of London, not far from Buckingham Palace along the Mall. The sun was out and the park was full of sun worshippers. Blankets were spread and locals were were down for the afternoon. The park was packed with merry people, popping sparkling beverages, wine glasses appeared from baskets.F un had by all!
One of my favorite stops. Beautiful, clean, a nice place to stop and people watch. Lots of ducks, swans, and geese to keep you company...do not touch or feed please.

Don't miss this park!. London has so many wonderful parks that it is sometimes difficult to visit them all but St James Park is particularly lovely this time of year and when the sun shone as it has been doing recently, I just love walking round. I highly recommend a visit
Oasis of calm and beauty. A lovely spot to get away from the hustle and bustle of London and take in the beautiful gardens, lake, watch the wildlife or just sit and think somewhere quiet.

The country in the heart of London. Amidst all the tourist craziness that is London, the park present an amazing opportunity for a peaceful walk looking at wildlife and flowers rather than famous places and building. The perfect respite between Buckingham Palace and Parliament.

Brilliant for runs and long walks.. Went here with my girlfriend for the second time, this time to see if we could feed any squirrels. And we sure could! Brought peanuts and they were like crazy about it. Climbed all over me like if they were my pets. Fun if you like it. Creepy if you dont. Also perfect because its next to Buckingham Palace, so a beautiful day in London touristing you dont want to miss this!

Black taxis tours. We are from the USA & booked a Tour with Black Taxis Tours & wanted to see some American History in LondonOur driver was Dave Beach who had lived in The States & also has American relativesOur first stop was Grosvenor Square where apart from Number 9 which was the residence for 2 years leading to becoming American President Fantastic statues of Eisenhower & ReaganThe whole 3 hour tour was amazing apart from everything else Dave was very funny & hands on Ask for Dave!!!!!!

Beautiful especially in the Spring, complete with Pelicans!. Lovely spot in the spring sunshine; the lake has many bird species including pelicans, ducks and geese. Always busy but never crowded, a lovely place to stroll or eat lunch

hard to believe your in central london. an oasis to relax in on a nice sunny day. its a nice walk between buck palace and horse guards/Trafalgar square. To see the different ducks on the water.there are some places to get food

Getting away from it all. Fed up of annoying tourists bustling around Parliament Square and Buckingham Palace? Just spend a couple of minutes walking away, sit on a bench and eat your sandwiches - or give them to the ducks. Nice little bit of history about the place and well worth a stroll through between the two attractions mentioned above. Don't forget the duck house and a picnic. Mmmm, picnics.

GORGEOUS PARK! The Pond Has Geese, the Flowers Gorgeous and Great Walks! . You do not want to miss St. James's Park. It is right near Buckingham Palace, so I would recommend a nice walk around the Park and wait for the Changing of the Guard! The Park is Smaller then Hyde Park, but Gorgeous. Love all the flowers and seeing the Geese in the Pond. Nice, short walks or if a really nice day, great for a picnic. This is London, so do bring your umbrella. You are in the park 1 minute and it's warm and sunny, the next 'It's Raining Cats and Dogs' per London speak. Then in 10 minutes the rain is over and the sun back out. So don't let a few clouds deter you. I could never pick between Hyde Park and St. James's Park and would not. You could chill all day at either park or spend 1/2 hour, so walk through and stay for as long as suits you.

"When I, who still take care to see, Weent out into St. James's Park To cool my head" Wilmot. St James' Park is a gem of centuries' use. Nestled between Horse Guards and Buckingham Palace, the Mall and Birdcage Walk, its a short walk from anywhere central and a perfect place to relax for a while. Exquisitely maintained, St James' bursts with colour, floral and squawking avians. There is a simple wandering loop around which you can promenade, trees below which you can rest on deck-chairs, or picnic, a stunning lake with backdrop views of Horseguards' Parade, the London Eye and the Palace from the central Blue Bridge (definitely one of the best and most iconic views in London). If you wanted, you could walk on grass almost the whole route to Kensington Palace, via parks Green and Hyde.There is too much to describe here, except to say you MUST visit, as every stroll reveals more delights: pelicans (resident since 1644), Duck Island Cottage, the two islands, the veritable plethora of 'tourist tick list' sights that you can cover in one peaceful and restful afternoon's meander....

Beautiful all year 'round. Take some time from your hectic site tours to sit in the beauty of this incredible park and stop to smell the roses (and all the other beautiful flowers). You can't help but catch a glimpse of the park when you are at the Churchill War Rooms or Buckingham Palace. Maybe stop off at the Cornish Pastry (our favorite place to grab some lunch) and go sit in the park and unwind from the day or regroup and plan your next tourist stop!

laying in the sunshine. this park, looks so nice in every season. The park looks neat and tidy. The plants always look nice. And for the summer the dekchairs are out. Its nice ,busy and you will see many tourists. They work hard on it, that is for sure

AWESOME CITY PARK. We accidentally strolled in to St James park as we walked toward Buckingham Palace and were delighted that we found it! It was a beautiful, sunny day and the park was filled with green trees, blooming flowers, a nice lake, picnics, ice cream stands and pathways. Many Londoners and tourists were enjoying the day. It could easily have been a scene from a movie! Worth the visit!
Changing of Guards. Great place to watch the changing of the guards. No gate to block your view. The park is very nice as well and beautiful flowers and a nice stroll.
Avoid the crowd. Across from Buckingham Palace and a nice break from the crowds. The bridge is the best place for pictures of the palace
Lovely Park. Enjoy a coffee and walk through this beautiful park. Well worth a visit and though it gets very busy in the sunshine very enjoyable.
history and flowers. Walk frm Buckingham Palace thru to Westminster, timing your visit for the daily feeding of the Pelicans around 3pm.

The gardens are great. Not far from Big Ben, Westminster Abbey and Parliament is St. James Park. We had a beautiful day to just wander around the park looking at the beautiful gardens and ponds. Then we wandered over to the Buckingham Palace to have a look see.

Fantastic walk. So beautiful and calm... specially in the spring when even the trees are blooming. We had a nice weather that day so we could enjoy the walk and the nature surrounding us in the middle of London. The lake with its animals, the children closed play ground (with toilet specified for children), picnic tables etc.It is a joyful site for both families and couples.

wonderful and relaxing. We only passed through this park, but we noticed the extreme attention to detail and continuous workers who renew plants and flowers. Never dry or damaged things, beautiful fauna and accustomed to people.

Gorgeous Park. Loved it here. We visited on a Sunday and there were a couple of processions. Lots of activity up and down the Mall.Deck chairs to hire. £1.60 pp ph. Reasonable for London. Toilets are 20p and you need a 20p coin so take plenty! Ice creams stands around and a cafe/inn place too. Ice creams are like the ice cream vans, whippey or similar. £2.50 with a flake.Beautiful park with plenty to look at.

Must visit . All the Royal Parks are worth visiting, but this park is just outside Buckingham Palace and is beautiful. Beautiful manicured gardens set along side a pond/lake. Very easy stroll around the water. Must visit when in the area.
Love this Park. St James Park is well worth a visit. It's such an oasis in the middle of London. I love the quaintness and grand feel of this beautiful Park.

Beautiful on a sunny day. It was a relaxing stroll through the park for my husband and I when we were exploring London for the very first time. Pros: Recommend to go on a sunny day. There are a few activities available depending on your preference- e.g. Water activities, bike riding, roller blading/skating. Most of all, I enjoyed walking on the wide paths between the trees and admiring all the fun everyone was having on a sunny afternoon - both locals and tourists. Cons: Nothing really.

Always beautiful, whatever the season or weather.. I walk through the park every day on my way to work. Always lovely, well-cared for and beautiful in every season.I like it best early and late when there are fewer people about. In spring is best with flowering hawthorns and cherries...and now they're leaving more 'natural' areas, it's even better. The water birds add to the interest. And plenty of tourist watching to be done as every new person exclaims at the squirrels and takes a selfie on the bridge!
Walk through the park. This was a lovely park with interesting and attractive plants in the flower beds. Nice to relax and people-watch.

great location. This is one of the best thing with London, you are never very far from a great park so can always dip into one for a break from the sightseeing and a chance to relax and catch your breath.

My favourite London Park ...... St James's Park is my favourite park in London. It is central and a great place to relax whilst sightseeing, the lake and wildlife, including the pelicans, adding to its beauty. Beware of the squirrels though - the tourists feed them and they are now so tame that it is impossible to eat your lunch without a squirrel jumping on your shoulder!!

A Place To Relax. The park looks like it is a place from a fairytale. Very beautiful and must visit place if you have little kids who love to run around. Kids will enjoy watching nature that is abundant in the park
Home . Always a great place to take my friends that come from the US or Canada. Very lucky to have such a gem like this in our beautiful home.

Lovely spot of green. On a sunny day, St. James Park is very charming. However, this garden gets most crowded right after the change of guards. Located right across Buckingham palace, this is an ideal place for some picnic lunch.

Beautiful Park. This is a beautiful park and a nice escape from the crazy crowds around this touristy part of London. Yes, this park is more crowded than say Hyde park or Greenwich (which are both huge), but it's a nice place to take a break and perhaps eat a picnic lunch before continuing on with your busy day.

Beautiful Park to Relax/Lunch. We stayed very close to St. James's Park and loved taking our lunch to eat in the park. Schools, runners, people - lots of people watching. Located right across from Buckingham Palace, it is a great place to watch the birds and the water and just relax for a bit.
Very nice. So this is a huge park were locals hangout, not Hyde Park. It's absolutely beautiful and not crowded.

Beautiful in Spring. Walking through St. James Park is a must for anyone visiting London. We walked through on a Sunday and it was buzzing with families and couples enjoying the Spring air and sunshine.
really beautiful. this park and surrounds are really beautiful. The wild life and the amount of people using the space is very impressive
beautiful park and views. I loved this park. Nice walk and very beautiful, with plants and birds, as well as views of the castle.

Beautiful and Peaceful. walked through here over the weekend you just wouldn't think you were in the centre of London its so peaceful and well kept . love the lake , the views , the little food and coffee shops on the way through and the wildlife is excellent

Beautiful park!. Located right across from Buckingham Palace and very close to Big Ben, the Thames River, London Eye and many more attractions. This medium size park is full of colorful flowers, a nice pond/small lake and has a very good feel to it. We enjoyed relaxing there

Nice place to enjoy lunch. On an unusually warm day, we stopped at Tesco express store on the way from Trafalgar Square and strolled up to the park. We ate on a bench facing the lake and watched the birds- and people. Nice relaxing break from sight seeing.

london bridge is falling down...falling down. London bridge is falling down...falling down. I played the game with my wife and 2 boys when I saw the London bridge...we have great time on the river side and we are lucky to see the bridge lifted up for a cruise to sail pass.

A Little Flora A Lot of Fauna. Visited this park twice while I was in London, mostly to photograph the birds. The park is located directly across from Buckingham Palace so it's hard to miss. Always crowded, even on cold and dreary days. There are benches placed strategically near the water so you can sit (if they're not taken) and watch the geese and ducks. You can also rent chairs in hour increments.I was mostly there to photograph the wildlife and you can definitely get some good shots. The birds and squirrels are so tame that they'll approach you and I even had a couple of gray geese pose for me. This park is a nice place to visit to decompress from the craziness that is London.

Picture perfect. For the perfect "Madeleine" moment, St James's Park will offer its visitors the perfect back drop for a London portrait, with cues of Buckingham Palace at one end and Whitehall at the other - take a picture!
Beautiful park and ducks.. Park with a special beauty for its ducks , squirrels and roads. It is typical of there. As well as commemorating.

One of the prettiest parks. A pretty park, stumbled upon it by chance.
It was a sunny day to walk around and enjoy the view, less crowded than hyde park.

Beautiful. We enjoyed a lovely walk around and through the park. Plenty of places to get a drink or ice cream and plenty of things to see on all sides of the park. Really hard to imagine that you are in central London whilst in the park.

So beautiful!. Directly opposite Buckingham palace, this wonderful park leads to Horse-guards parade. A vast park. Which is laden with beautiful fauna & wildlife. We spent a few hours here. Just sitting on the grass & absorbing the London atmosphere.

London's prettiest park. Possible one of London's prettiest parks. I love it. I've been here many times and in different seasons. It's even worth going here in Winter as walking through the park in February and seeing the crocus in bloom is a sight to behold.

Lovely park. It was a beautiful on a Sunday with sunshine out and lots of people enjoying the park. Nice to see wildlife in middle of London. Lovely walk with good views and leads onto other areas. Worth a visit as it's free
nice park. One of the best next to the hyde park, but less crowded, with a nice water body and great areas to relax
Great part for running too. The views throughout this epic part are wonderful especially for runners. Very safe and majestic. Near Buckingham Palace too.

Best park. When I lived in London(10 years ago) I walked through St James's park most days and am glad to see its still as pretty and interesting as ever. On a sunny day it can't be beaten by any other London park.

A Green Lung in a Busy City. Although there were busy pockets of tourists wandering through the park - (near the cafe and toilet facilities),we managed to enjoy a little peace and tranquility away from the hustle and bustle around us. By sitting on a park bench, enjoying the sunshine and watching the birds on the lake and the occasional jogger passing by, we could escape the traffic and breathe in the beauty and ambience of this place.

A green space in the centre of London. You can access St James Park from many entrances, the main entrance being from the front of Buckingham Palace. A great place to chill before heading for some more sightseeing.

Beautiful green space in the heart of London. We were lucky to walk through the park on a beautiful sunny day. Yes, there were people aplenty (well it was London, after all) but the feeling of space in our capital city...it feels wonderful!Scenic, restful - a joy to walk in the park. There are refreshments available which we didn't try out, maybe next time. It was time well spent and worth walking to.

Gorgeous. Like many of London's open spaces this park is well done. If your into exercise I recommend heading over to enjoy the park. If looking to just take a stroll then head over. Plenty of birds, squirrels to see enjoying themselves
lovely place to walk. Great place to take a break from the noise and hubbub of daily London. Enjoy the scenery and talk a walk.

Beautiful park in centre of a metropolitan city. We went there last week on a sunny day (Tip: Avoid to visit on a gloomy day). The park is small but really good. So many people were laid down on the grass (in groups or individuals). However you can get a easy chair available in park for visitors(which costs around 1 pound or so per hour). One can see variety of tulips, and other colourful flowers. Also the park has various types of birds.Everything is very well maintained.One can spend whole day there. Its proximity to green park, hyde park and Buckingham palace make it a easy and perfect for visiting place.
ideal for picnics!. best place for a lunch break with a lovely view on Buckingham Palace, with many attractions around and facilities too
Nice place to go on a sunny day. Love the park and the pond is good.You can go to eat your lunch or sit there for a few hours.Very easy to travel from a few different tube stations.

The most beuatiful park in London. You can walking on the path in the James'sark. It is very beautiiful whenever it is raining or sunshing day.St.James Palace only open August and September from 10am to 16:30 pm.
Great stroll in the heart of London. On the way to Buckingham Palace you walk through this part. So beautiful, many water fowl, and great flowering trees and plants.

Beauty in the city. St James's park is such a beautiful green space. The flowers are amazing and the grass so green. It's wonderful to sit and watch the ducks. swans and pelicans near the water or you may see a squirrel after some food too. The park is beautifully maintained and the colours of the flowers - wow! You can follow the Princess Diana memorial walk or stop at a café and watch the world go by. A lovely way to spend a few hours especially if the sun's shining.
lovely place. We had a wonderful walk to Buckingham palace through the park. The trees and flowers were blooming. It's lovely and typical of England.

Perfect day for the park!. After 2 gloomy rainy days, Our final day in London was sunny and 70 deg! We walked thorough St James Park between Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace. And I am so glad we did!! A beautiful spring day, flowers abounding, cherry blossoms drifting from trees, ducks and geese swimming happily in the pond. Just a beautiful leisurely stroll. The highlight of our day!
Great walk for a sunny day. A beautiful park right across Buckingham Palace. Beautiful flowers and trees and of course the ducks, gees, and other wild life.

Visit in the spring. The beautiful weather and the season definitely made a stroll through St. Jame's Park a perfect afternoon activity. You will walk by it if you are anywhere near Buckingham Palace, so no need to plan a special trip.
Beautiful when it's sunny. This is a nice park to e.g. have lunch or a picnic in when it's warm and sunny. It's very popular and the location is conveniently central.
Absolutely beautiful Park in London. Walking from the Horse Guards to Buckingham Palace on a beautiful spring day is worth the small effort. Scent of the flowers is amazing.

Lovely park to wander around. Take a stroll through nature walking along the lovely pond and watching the ducks. You can pick up snacks and drinks at stands in the park, find a nice shady spot, and have a little picnic (or get sandwiches and drinks from Tesco or Pret). Plaques around the park will give insight into the history, and you'll see statues around the outside. You can even go through the park to Buckingham Palace.
Beautiful and Relaxing. Wonderful place to have a chilled stroll during lunch time while sipping on a caramel latte from Pret A Manger...

Of course, when the sun is our companion, everything is baded in a golden glow.... We always walk through St. James's Park to reach Buckingham Palace. And why shoudn't we. The park is heaven to relax, to stroll, to eat your packed lunch, to see the squirrels.... So nice to have so much green in the centre of London. We adore it!

So relaxing. We visited the park following changing of the guard. We enjoyed it so much we went back the next day with a picnic as we knew the weather was going to be glorious. It was a delightful way to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The deckchairs cost £1.60 for an hour we just sat on a blanket for free.

Hosts one of my favourite views in London!. Although small this park packs a big punch; from the pelicans (yes, real and huge pelicans), to sun-loungers under the trees, and some of the most beautiful views of London landmarks.From the bridge across the middle of the lake you can see a lovely view of Horseguards Parade and the London Eye on one side and Buckingham Palace on the otherside. Early in the morning or late in the afternoon the sun makes the two palaces shine!

Lovely park. Small and tidy, it's a lovely park for a general stroll if you are visiting Buckingham Palace or want a place to take a rest and enjoy the sun. Watch out for the pelicans on the lake and overly friendly swans. Plenty of places to grab refreshments.

Beautiful on a warm day. Great place to visit and so well located. You can travel to here via tube to green park, Piccadilly circus or westminster and a little walk then your at the park. There is plenty of space to have a picnic or just a walk from the horse guards parade all the way to Buckingham palace. There is a bar called in the park which is very pricey so id advise brining own food and drink as 4 small glasses of wine £27! . There are ice cream sellers and its just very relaxing. Very safe for children as the water areas are all fenced off. This location is good to walk to big ben, london eye , trafalgar square. We use this all the time .
So Pretty!. We walked through this park and it was lovely. Beautiful flowers and geese. Great place to visit on a nice day.

Beautiful park. We went down with the kids for a picnic and even though it was very busy due to the hot day there was plenty of place to relax and enjoy a spot of lunch. There is a kids play area which the kids had fun and a toilet only for the kids which was very handy. The kids enjoyed seeing the swans and eating ice cream. One of the best parks in London for sure

Nice morning . We went to the park for the changing of the guard. It was crowed and warm but a beautiful morning. The flowers in the beds were near the end but still lovely. After the changing of the guard we walked in the park for an hour. It was lovely . It you are near by a wonderful place for a walk .
Pretty Park for a stroll. This was a nice break from the hustle bustle of London. An excellent location for a picnic or to let the kids run between sights.

Beautiful Sunday Stroll. A lovely, although windy, Sunday and the locals and tourists commingled all through the park. Some stretched out catching the sun while others were fascinated with the pelicans and other birds who inhabit the park. The young and old alike frolicked in the sun. The flowers were simply gorgeous .
Beautiful location. We had a lovely walk through the park, stunning views of the palace and also good views of Big Ben, beautiful location.

Nature at it's Best in the City Centre. Just actoss the Churchill War rooms is St. James' Park. Our's was a chance visit. We walked into it getting attracted to the cherry blossoms and the ducks in the pond.There are many benches to sit and relax and chill out or you could even lie down on the soft grass and view the beautiful sky above you.Better carry some snacks for munching. A lovely place for the photography lovers or the Selfie - experts, should I say.The closest station is the westminster station. Very walkable from there.
Lovely park, great facilities. Beautiful park, great facilities including toilets, deckchairs for hire and a cafe serving food & drinks (including alcohol) and amazing ice cream
Nice and calm. Loved the new playground near the Palace. Beautiful flowers, lots of birds and great views. Lovely strall on a sunny day.
Beautiful. A really beautiful park with lots of birds and squirrels. A must for any traveller. Was beautiful in the springtime.

Beautiful oasis. Tucked away right next to Buckingham Palace, this is the perfect spot to go before you watch the Changing of the Guards. Walk over the bridges and meander past all the beautiful flowers in bloom. Enjoy the escape from the city.
Beautiful park near Buckingham Palace and Big Ben. Loved this little park tucked away near Buckingham palace and only a short walk to Big Ben and Trafalgar Square.
great walk for families. Beautiful walk through the park. Tons of different birds and nice views of the palace and of Big Ben. Take a half hour to stroll from one end to the other.

Beautiful gardens and great for birdwatching. These are some of the most beautiful gardens I've ever seen. The way they mix the flowers is very different than anything I've seen elsewhere. I love the way they have tulips popping up in the middle of other flowers, rather than grouped together. The birdwatching was wonderful, too. We saw a black swan, a white swan, pelicans, coots, ducks. In one of the pictures you can see the swans on their nests. We went back a second time, because it was just so enjoyable to stroll through the park. There's also a nice little spot to stop for a drink and a bite to eat.
Lovely park. Lovely well kept peaceful Park in the middle of the bustling city. Fabulous place really enjoyed a few minutes watching the world fo by.

Gorgeous Place!. This is a lovely park to walk through to get to the Palace. You will see people walking their dogs, families out for the afternoon, beautiful beds of flowers, ducks being fed, and many more delightful scenes.

Nice place. It is a good place to lie and read a book on a nice, warm sunny day.
The waffle from one of the food stands was nice too.
Heaven on a pleasant day. Great walks, calm atmosphere, beautiful flora and water bodies. It can be a romantic place if you are a couple or a calming place if you are looking for peace.

Wonderful park. A wonderful park ideally situated to escape the hustle and bustle for a while. Beautiful flowers and lots of wildlife to see. Ideal for children to feed the ducks and squirrels (the squirrels take nuts gently from your hand). There is a great café with good toilet facilities.
The best park anywhere. . Such a beautiful day in the St. James's Park. I wish my photos did it any kind of justice. A bit hot in the morning, but a day for families and for all.

the most central of Royal Parks in London. To the northern end of the royal park saddles Green park station, alternatively a popular walk is fromVictoria station to Buckinham palace on the eastern end..nations will frequenlty visit form the Admiralty Arch / Trafalgar square or via st james park tuvbe as a last resortTthe Lake dominstaes this park as aslo the obvious landmarks on tis circumfrence Large though ti is the lack fo decent food options nearby isn't great
Romantic park. Located between the Trafalgars Square and the Palace, this park is a truly nice colourful and romantic spot with a lake. Worthy to spend time with your near one.
