Beautiful park with lots to do. St James' Park has an array of great cafes , boating and wide paths to accomodate walkers and cyclists. Well located.

If you fancy a stroll do it here. Bags of atmosphere as you stroll through this park and you can often see the guards regiments passing either side making there way to Buckingham Palace or other London locations.No finer place on a nice day.
Beautiful grounds. Spring time, lots of people, but din't feel crowded, loved the walk. It really was nice in Spring with the blooming trees
Watch the birds. Nice place to take a walk. Grab a bench by the water & watch the ducks & birds as well as the people flowing by. Not too far from Horse Guards or Trafalgar Sq

Oasis in the city. Looooovvve this park! Our favourite place to visit whenever we are in the city. Beautiful flowers, beautiful ducks and landscapes. Great restaurant and also a lovely childrens play area with massive sandpit. Worth a visit

Beautiful Walk. When we visited the ducks & other birds were busy building their nests on the water & the gardens were colourful. I can recommend a lovely walk up the Mall from Trafalgar Square through the Park up to Buckingham Palace. Lovely!

A beautiful place within a busy city. St Jame's Park is in the northern direction of London where you will find the London Zoo and Camden Town.This is a large park and there is lovely things to see and be near. I, when time allows, walk from Camden Town to Paddington (about 3 miles) past places like Sherlock Holmes museum (Baker street).There are lots of people who use this area but you do not meet many unless you want to.
Go on a nice day. a lovely park to walk around with all sorts of different birds around. There is descriptions along the water about each area and each bird to be found, a really nice walk.

Magical place :). This park is amazing, particularly in a sunny day. Every detail is cured with care, so it is possible to enjoy an amazing atmosphere surrounded by nature, flowers and animals. The lake is full of beautiful creatures and lovely gardens, it is a peaceful and stunning place.
Beautiful. A must visit. Quiet, civilised and colourful. A beautiful lay-by on your walk from Trafalgar Square to Buckingham Palace.

Quick lunch stop in one of London's prettiest parks. I worked close to St James's Park for years in the 90s, so got a sandwich between meetings recently and stopped on a bench in St James's Park. This is still one of London's prettiest parks. It is cornered by Trafalgar Square, Horseguards Parade & Buckingham Palace, and 2 mins from the Houses of Parliament, so a good place to stop if you are seeing the sights. And the view from the bridge towards Buckingham Place is iconic.
Beautiful. Take time to stroll and visit St James Park. It is a beautiful place. Animals, flower, and families playing in the park.

So lovely on a spring day. We spent a wonderful afternoon in the park in late April when the sun was shining, the blossom trees were beautiful and tulips were in flower. I'm sure we saw the park at its best but it is well worth strolling though at any time of year. The wildlife is tremendous and it has a really peaceful atmosphere in the midst of one of the busiest areas of the city. Ducks, swans and waterfowl of many varieties enjoy their life on the lake. One gets excellent views of Buckingham Palace and other attractions from here. Definitely to be recommended for visitors.

Beautiful in Full Bloom!. The flowers at St. James Park were in full bloom when we strolled through it. I love this park. It's easy to walk through, with little burst of surprise--such as the white Pelicans, flower patches, bridges, and ponds. A special place!

Lovely Park. I prefer St. James Park instead of Hyde Park, it has more nature and it is absolutely beautiful to just sit down in the grass and watching the animals or finding squirrels. Also family-friendly.

Lovely park in the city. St james park is a beautiful place to walk near Buckingham palace. Flowers were still in bloom in December and there is a picturesque lake with lots of wildlife. The park provides a bautiful nature break from city streets.

Spring time in the Park!!. walked through the park recently and saw all the daffodils. Just wonderful. you dont even know you are in the middle of one of the greatest cities in the world. Spring and summer will be great.
must see. Absolutely beautiful! Its one of must see places. Definitely recommend if you like nature and parks.

Always great to visit. Beautiful flower displays in the spring. If you're going to Buckingham Palace a stroll through St James's Park is a must. Also close to Horseguards Parade and Houses of Parliament.

Beautiful London Park . Take sometime to soak this park in. Beautiful gardens, lakes and lawns. Great for people watching, gelato and coffee. Links in well with a walking or cycle trip to Buckingham Palace.

Beautiful park. Always lots of lovely flowers, squirrels, ducks on the lake, posh cafe and they are just setting up the ice cream stalls for summer!
Great place to enjoy the sun and people watch.

St. Jame's Park Visual Zone. I do need to mention, if you visit this park, please pay attention to any signs about feeding and not feeding its animal residents ? A stroll through this area will give you a chance to spot ducks, geese, swans, and the park's famous colony of pelicans. And that's on top of its tree-dwelling birds, not to mention the numerous squirrels and other little mammals! So while it's a small park, it's definitely a must-visit for animal and bird lovers. My mother and I spent a couple of hours just enjoying the sights and sounds of the park's feathered residents. Since we visited in the fall the birds were the biggest thing to see, but I can only imagine how beautiful it must be here in the spring when things are blooming for the first time!

English Gardens at their Finest. I love English Gardens, and this park is no exception. The English just know how to grow flowers and maintain beautiful parks for the public (so much better than our parks in the US). There is a lot of waterfowl to see as well. Nature in the middle of the city. A lovely afternoon stroll.
Beautiful spring. The park is just beautiful at the moment with the spring flowers - definitely worth a visit to see the cherry trees in blossom

Great park near our hotel. It amazes me how this park can retain its beauty with all the traffic that it encounters. Obviously near Buckingham Palace, but a very nice green park in the heart of London.

Very nice park in an excellent location. It's a wonderful park if you need to rest your legs and enjoy the squirrels or swans. Surrounded by Buckingham, Whitehall, Churchill's War Rooms, Westminster etc etc.
Lovely Setting by Buckingham Palace. Lots of ducks and geese and swans here. All owned by the Queen presumably. The children love it here as there are always squirels to feed.
My favourite park in London!. It is for sure my favourite park in London. Right in the middle of the city, just below Picadilly. Love!

Great park with relaxing views. We went for a walk around here with my husband's cousin and throughly enjoyed it. The sun was shining and there was a heap of bird life around.
The park is well suited for families too and picnics and is very relaxing although so close to a majpr tourist attraction in Buckingham Palace. I definitely recommend it.

Favorite London stop. Tulips blooming, birds tweeting and fountains flowing with Buckingham Palace close by ... this remains my favorite part of London after several trips. We went on a sunny day which helps but even in the rain it's wonderful.
Very nice. Very nice quiet park with a lot squirrels and other small animals. It is something different in the busy streets of London.

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful parks in the city but the homeless situation is a bit out of control. It's hard to not feel uncomfortable. The church is a beautiful place to go for a quiet day time sit, as is the flower garden.

PARK. the park is good to go for a stroll when its anice day ....there is so much green aroungd and its a nice long walk especially the sqirrels that come up to you for food but dont let them feed of your hand as it is dangerous
Beautiful, clean and well manicured. . Very picturesque and on the route to and from Piccadilly Square/Buckingham Palace. Don't forget your camera and maybe wine and cheese picnic is in order.

One of many beautiful London Parks. For a city of 8.5 Million people, London has an amazing number of parks. Green Park is off Picadilly close to Buckingham Palace. It is a nice venue for just walking, bur may be crowded on weekends.

The Queen's Park. Randomly picked St. James Park from the many in London and was thrilled. The park itself is a delight. Beautifully kept easy to walk through and lots of interesting water fowl and birds to watch and it was good for people watching. It's adjacent to Buckingham Palace so was able to see the Changing of the Guards ceremony. Stopped for a nice lunch nearby and then own to Westminster. Great area to explore. It was a sunny day.

Not to be missed, especially in the spring. Beautiful, well kept park near Buckingham Palace. Especially nice in spring with flowers in bloom. Also enjoyed the variety of birds, including pelicans and ducks.

Imagine this park in the old days. I'd fit St. James's Park in my London itinerary in the way connecting Buckingham and Big Ben/Westminster, it is the perfect way to do it, specially if it is a sunny day.The park is big and pleasant to walk by. It has a lake with a big variety of ducks that are very used to tourists and free bread. Also you may find pelicans and other birds. Very sympathetic squirrels will approach you with no fear, they are very funny and interested in everything you have to offer them, once more bread would be perfect... or cookies. They are so used to it that when they have many people at the same time giving them food, they choose the biggest piece :-)It's easy to photograph those little creatures here. In the park you also have a coffee house that serves breakfast all morning. It is near the lake and it has always a full house so you may have to wait a little bit for a table.Here you may also make a picnic and you'll find near the The Mall entrance some garden chair that are for rental so you may enjoy the sun. While wondering you can imagine this park in the old days when ladies and sirs, kings and queens used to take walks and enjoy their mornings and afternoons.From here you may see above the tree line London's Eye and Big Ben that is almost around the corner.Some pavilions exist along the park, I loved the thai style of the pavilion in front of Churchill War Rooms.

Like NYC Central Park. I enjoyed a stroll through the park. There were many animals like birds and squirrels that parade around the park. It's beautiful and serene and very safe. I enjoyed this for a nice relaxing afternoon and a quick stroll to other attractions in London.

Nice. This park is always busy with tourists, I lived and worked around here and the ignorance of others shines through here. Walk into you and not a care in the world. This is year round and its a real shame as its a lovely park.
gorgeous, always. my favourite london park of them all. perfect for wasting a day in the sunshine, even better in the autumn.

Must View To London Eye. There is just so much going on (though if thats your kind of park, you'll love it here lol). There are tourists, people chatting everywhere, kids running around after all the ducks and birds, etc. Though I gotta say the view of the London eye from here is beautiful and also the architecture and landscaping. Def swing by if your going to Buckingham palace though expect it to be packed of people. Beautiful park next to Buckingham palace, though I would say way too tourist packed and kind of ruins the relaxing peacefulness a park like this should have.
Beautiful. I always enjoy walking through this park and enjoy nature with its nice gardens, birds and squirels.

Changing of the Guard. I have been to London several times but never visited this park. It is very pretty with all the trees in bloom. It's a nice place to walk after seeing the Changing of the Guard. They also have public toilets. Beautiful place!

One of the most beautiful parks in London. I am sure if the weather had been better and it had been a month later, it would get a higher rank! But even on a rainy April day the lovely flowers, birds, squirrels, the whole ambiance gave an uplifting feeling and I tried to use my your imagination what it would be like on a day with sunshine!

Super Park. Lots going on here alongside the river. Just watching the birds and the wildlife is a delight. Walk alongside the river and stop at the Cafe or one of the little booths for refreshments. Sit on one of the available benches and watch the world go by...

Must see when near Buckingham Palace. I took a long walk in this park right after seeing the change of guard at Buckingham Palace and it was lovely. A great place to relax in after seeing Buckingham and heading into the Horse Guards Museum and then to Picadilly. You can see a variety of lovely birds on the small lake (as well as the famous Duck Island Cottage) and catch a glimpse of London Eye, the Shell Tower, or the the Shard.

Sanctuary. My favourite park in London, love the trees the lake the birds. Been to this park many times over the years been going to London. You only have to ask where I was at lunch time and they would be able to tell you the park. My special place.

I love this park! People, ducks, flowers and awesome green space. This immaculate park is relatively small compared to Hyde Park, but is worth a stroll before and after the Changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace and/or the changing of the guard at Whitehall. In April, the daffodils will razzle dazzle.

Beautiful oasis in the city. Love to see the plants and the water birds. A very relaxing spot -- chairs available for rent to sit and enjoy the outdoors -- great for people watching, nice restaurant available.
Nice relax. A very nice park for walking, some rest, picnic, birds, and nice views for the family. Squirrels eat from your hand. Connects Buckingham Palace with Trafalgar Square.

A lovely oasis in the middle of london,close to major attractions. So close to all major attractions like Horseguards Parade,Downing St.,Trafalgar Sq and Buckingham Palace. Selection of Wildlife to be seen and an excellent snack bar/restaurant.

Lovely and Peaceful. Lovely to walk through the park - beautiful views. Look out for the pelicans. Our little boy loved feeding birds and grey squirrels which eat from your hand. Ideal to stroll through for some peace while seeing sights such as Buckingham Palace, soldiers and horse guard parade. Building playground which will be great for those with children. Worth doing while in London especially in the mornings.
Lovely Park with funny birds.. I love to have a wonder around in this park, so beautiful with all the different birds and flowers. Nice to have a coffee and sit in the park and turist watch.

Great walk around the park. Spend an hour walking around the park. If you have kids its great to take them along. one can also feed the pigeons who will eat it from your hands. This experience would be awesome for you as well as the kids.
Great park. Lovely park nice place to relax. Great park for children with the large variety of ducks to see which are fenced off.

Splendid. This splendid park is so well maintained very pretty and relaxing. This is just one of the beautiful green areas around Buckingham palace and quite amazing that so much tranquillity can exist amongst the hustle and bustle of this busy metropolis.

Lovely park. We walked through this park after watching some of the london marathon runners come in, it was very cold this day but didn't deter us, it's a lovely park and it's nice seeing the wildlife at the lake, pelicans ducks and squirrels.

Wonderful park. This is a beautiful park and (I live in London) I visit it frequently. It's just a short walk through but it has a lovely playground which children find very enjoyable. The scenery is fantastic and I would recommend a camera. It's in an easily accessible area and has plenty of places to buy food and drink, plus places to just sit. The food can be a bit expensive for what it is though. There is a lot of wildlife, birds...,and beautifully arranged flower beds.
Beautiful. Stunning grounds to walk through, all sorts of birds and even squirrels being hand fed biscuits by people. Beautiful place if you are out with family or just on your own

Beautiful Park. What an amazing and beautiful park right in the center of London. Walking thru the park admiring the large trees and the lake with Swan's and Pelican's one would never think they were in the heart of one of the World's largest city's with Buckingham Palace just at the end of the park. Well worth a stroll through it.

Great for a picnic. St James park is great for a picnic or walk in London, being full of life it's ideal for a break from the other attractions. Centred around the lake which has incredible amount birdlife, there are also some greedy squirrels which will climb your leg if food is on offer! Recommended

Green heart near Buck. Palace. James's park is place for wallking from Buck.Palace to Churchill war room and horse guard place.My wallk was in cold weather and some ducks and some birids stayed on walk and they were cold like me,I think.Many trees grow there,the fig tree too.
Peaceful Retreat. A great place for a quiet walk in the middle of a big city. The park is beautiful, with fountains, ponds, birds, and flowers every way you turn.

St. Magic Jame's Park Place. The showstoppers are really the countless species of waterfowl from coots up to the pelicans which can often be out for a photocall some way from the lake at high tourist season. Neither can you walk far along the paths without seeing the squirrels. Great way to relax a little after taking in Buckingham Palace. Plenty of kiosks for drinks and icecream. You can get some great views of the London Eye from the ground, or Buckingham Palace across the pond. Spring, Summer & Autumn is total eyecandy thanks especially to the Royal Parks staff who always seem to be busy in here.This park is a great place to walk through and relax your mind. On hot summer days there's plenty of shade.

Quaint little park central right off Buckingham Palace. We stayed steps away from this park and crossed through it several times on our trip. Always pleasant and peaceful. Bikes are not allowed, so its all foot traffic, which makes it all seem less hectic. A nice respite from the hurley burley of the city. Spring flowers just starting to bloom. Saw the crazy squirrels, but stayed away. Horse Guards at one end, Buckingham Palace at the other. St. James's park Tube Station is the closest.
On the way from the Buckingham Palace to Big Ben. We passed through the park on the way to Big Ben. It was quite nice, but for me Hyde Park is much more beautiful.

A lovely walk to and from Buckingham palace.. Visited in April probably little too early in the year, but a welcome relief from the bustle of the city. A great way to travel between Westminster to the palace.Lots of birds, even Pelicans for some reason. London has many attractions and its parks are no exception.Use them!

Nice park with squirls. We walked through the park, during our city tour. It was really nice and we saw a lot of animals. Specially quite there were squirls, which they can eat from your hands and a family of ducks. Since it was quite cold and raining, we just went through.

Wonderful park near Buckingham Palace and Westminster . I walked through this Park daily while staying at the 2 hotels St Ermins and the Conrad both conveniently located nearby. This park has Horseguards Parade at one end and Buckingham Palace at the other. It can get very busy when the changing of the guards ceremony is taking place, other than this it's a calm beautiful oasis in a busy city. It has white Pelicans nestling on an island in the large lake. If you like nature this is for you.
Fabulous. Excrllent place to take a stroll and relax, admire the scenery. Personally I enjoy jogging, but you have to be careful picking the time of day as it is pretty crowded.
The most beautiful park!. This is the most amazing park with gorgeous flora and fauna - perfect for spending a sunny day in to relax!

A gem!. We discovered it on our way to the hotel. Why do people keep this place a secret? You hear about Hyde Park but not much about St. James. The best park in London, clean, manicured, beautiful views.

Great Park to stroll through enjoy a beverage, snack, or just the beauty;. Great way to relax a little after taking in Buckingham Palace! You can get some great views of the London Eye from the ground, or Buckingham Palace across the pond.
Beautiful Park. A beautiful park in the centre of London currently full of spring flowers. A delightful place for a lunchtime walk

A Delight To The Eye, Regardless of Season.. This park is a great place to walk through and relax your mind.Spring, Summer & Autumn is total eyecandy thanks especially to the Royal Parks staff who always seem to be busy in here.On hot summer days there's plenty of shade. The showstoppersare really the countless species of waterfowl from coots up to the pelicans which can often be out for a photocall some way from the lake at high tourist season. Neither can you walk far along the paths without seeing the squirrels. Plenty of kiosksfor drinks and icecream.

A magical park in the centre of London. I walked there today. Both Lush green grass and trees with the remains of blossom, or with fresh young leaves provide a background to vivid formal flower beds. Blackbirds and tits perch above borders tinged with yellow/green euphobias and sky blue forget-me-nots. Wilder areas, wildfowl-only areas sway with tall grass and bluebells, that sparkle blue and pink. The lake is the centre. Cross by a blue bridge, or walk around the circumference, taking in Buckingham Palace and Horseguards Parade. Two little islands covered with trees and blossom sit near the edges. There are fountains too. You will see an interesting assortment of wildfowl here, from swans to pelicans, ducks to geese. And several heron. There are [at least] two families of Egyptian geese who walk proudly beside their new goslings. Coots build arks of nests on water made of collected twigs and leaves. Their young appear later. A swan is also nesting, in a safe corner....Don't miss the views from the bridge!You may also see and hear the guards as they march up the Mall. The resturant here is a great place for coffee, or, a meal. I like to sit with a coffee on the roof sitting area; what a view from here too![Or, go to Struuton Ground before you come and get something from Ecco or Le Pain Du Jour there. Great food and reasonably priced] This is [one of ] my very favourite London Parks. And it's possible to walk to Green Park to go to the tube or to Piccadilly, or to walk on to Hyde Park and the museums in South Kensington, or even Trafalgar Square, just around the corner. .
my favourite park. st james park is my favorite park in London.its beautiful and it is not chaotic like the other parks.the best think you can do is to fid the squirrels with nuts.

A place of peace in the heart of the city. Do take a while to stroll through St. James Park. Infact, if planning on visiting Buckingham Palace from Westminster, a walk through St. James Park is by far the best way to do it. Peaceful and beautiful, it has lovely views of the surrounding landmarks, and easy access to Westminster, Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace, And if you have time, don't forget the Churchill War Rooms on the edge of the Park...

Beautiful Park. This beautiful park is really a gem in the middle of the city. There are so many different birds to see and everything was so green! Walk through this park before/after visiting the guards at Buckingham Palace.

A beautiful park and great for running. St James Park is a beautifully park to walk or indeed run around! Lots of grassy areas to take in the scenery and also a restaurant/bar. Views of the Palace, Big Ben, The Royal Horseguards etc...every direction you look!
An fairytale oasis. Escape here. The cafe is ideal unwinding on long warm summer evenings. Wonder the lake and cross the bridge. Forget the palace.

a beautiful park. Beautiful park, especially as it is early spring and all the spring flowers are out. also has a great restaurant with a window overlooking the fountain. Very easy to walk around and was a super waiting point for the marathon finish.

Beautiful!. The flowers were all in bloom during my visit to St. James's Park, making it absolutely beautiful. It's a great park for walking and enjoying the flowers and birds who frequent the park. Well worth a stop when in London!

I never miss it. Whenever we are in London, we visit St. James's Park. Not only the location is so ideally suited to allow a visitor to have a rest and escape from the hustle and bustle of central London, but watching the resident wildlife is an attraction in itself. There is also a beautiful view of Buckingham Palace from the park.

You could never tire of walking through this central sanctuary.. Space in central London is at a premium and St James is a perfect location to find a little peace and solitude during the day. Close to Westminster a perfect stroll up to The Stafford's American Bar or Dukes.

Beautiful park. Ducks on water, attractive sights all over & plenty of places to sit BUT it's full of pigeons, they are a real nuisance, especially if you take a picnic. Also don't feed the ducks, apparently bread is bad for them

Easter school holidays. Travelled up by train with my son. We went to see the planes on horse guard and then went into the park. I love this park. To think that it us in central London and free. There is so much to see and do. We walked along the lake, up to Buckingham Palace, the guards were changing, so we watched them, listen to the marching band go back to the barracks opposite the park. Then we went into the Guards museum. Once finished, we walked back into the park, saw the Pelicans, herons and other birds. Park is well kept and does have a play area, but it was closed due to refurbishment.
Nice park not for kids. A big park with nothing for kids good thing i took a ball, nice flowers and ducks and squirrels was nice toilets were too far
Plenty to see.. The variety of birds there is great. Plenty of space for children to run about. You can either picnic or visit the on site cafe
Beautiful. very beautiful park with lots of birds and flowers. Its a great place to jog early (opens 5am) but definitely a must see
london marathon 2016. Lovely place. very central to where it's all happening! An excellent place to have the finish of the Marathon. Easy to find and easy access to various london undergrounds.

Peace in the city. I wish I could have stayed longer, but it was a busy day. There is a sense of tranquility here with the lake, and the birds, and the trees. It was possible to forget, for a moment, that I was in the centre of one of the world's busiest cities. It was also a great place to see the passing pageantry, with the Horse Guards at one end of the park and the royal family at the other.
lovely park. i liked the park, it was clean, with free animals and water everywere. we had a nice walking there and its close to metro station
Fun, lots of birds. Hadn't walked though here in years but it was fun. Tons of birds around, Including some Pelicans (I think).

Beautiful!. What a beautiful park! Very clean and well maintained. I enjoyed strolling along the river and looking at all the birds - a lot of different species I hadn't seen before! There were also plenty of squirrels to keep me entertained. A very leisurely walk from Buckingham Palace to Trafalgar Square.
Wander in the Park. This is a quiet park that is surrounded by the London Goverment. Nearly everything is reachable by a short walk. Visit, walk about and bad inspired

Terrific!. The park is beautiful - a great place to just sit and reflect, people watch, or view the beautiful swans. Unknown to most, Whitehall on the far end has a changing of the horse guards daily and because it is not well known you can get up close to see

Great gardens. This park is one of the best I've seen. It has a variety of animals to watch, and many angles for a photograph!
Great spot for an ice cream during summer.

The blue bridge is nice. This park is very nice , well supported , from the bluebridgevyou can see buckingham palace and the horsequard buildings. In the direction of Regent park ,
The street had british flags , look very special.
Nice. Buy a cup of coffee and go for a walk in St. James Park. This park is very nice and just next to Buckingham Palace.
Pleasant walk. It's the perfect place to relax. I love going for a walk with my dog on weekends. There's a lot of people with their pets, exercising or simply walking. It's a park full of life...

Wonderful surprise in the middle of the city. This park is a bakm for sore eyes! Always so beautiful and so well cared for, with lovely flowers and a breathtaking lake. When I am around, I always manage to walk more than I need to just to make my path meet the way to the park and I never regret it.

Great way to spend an hour. My 6 year old cousin came to visit & we went to the park to kill an hour before the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. Plethora of birds around as well as beautiful gardens.

Pelicans and a lovely park !. We walked through St. Jame's Park after the Churchill War Rooms, it's right across and on to Buckingham Palace. There is no better way to start the day than to have a look at the Pelicans with the Daffs. in bloom and take in all the beauty of this park in the heart of London.
Beautiful. Beautiful park, lots of places to sit, great views, very relaxing, on a sunny day its a great picnic location you forget you are in London.

Great place to walk and enjoy!!. One of the most beautiful parks in London, considering that there are so many!! Gret for walking, observe nature, read, have lunch quietly, etc. Very well located, middle of the town.

Gorgeous views. A regular destination for my family. Beautiful all year round, especially the view from the bridge in the middle, with horseguards and surrouding buildings in one dirction (looking like a fairytale castle) and Buckingham Palace the other. A good place to catch some of the action during the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace or Horseguards.
Pelican Alert!. There is a Pelican in the lake, he is not always there but you should take a look - absolutely fascinating!
Pleasant Place to Visit. Visited park when viewing parade and changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. Very pretty and great place to walk and relax

Natural beauty on the way to Buckhingam Palace. Big park next to the Buckingham Palace, it worth the time to walk around the park if the weather is nice. There are a lots of friendly squirrels. Take some nut with you to feed them.

The Best Of the Royal Parks. I typically stay at a hotel that requires me to walk through St James Park on my to and from Central London and it is such a beautiful walk to look to your left towards the Palace and to your right towards Westminster ABbey and Parliament. The lake and the views are beautiful The gardens are lovely and the birds and geese complete an idyllic picture on a nice day. The park does become crowded with tourists in peak season but it is a fantastic space and I love walking here.

Fabulous park; an oasis in a busy city. The city is a mad house of traffic and crowds so this park is a nice break from the asphalt and concrete. It's close to Buckingham palace. It can be crowded at times, especially after the Changing of the Guard (around noon) but it's still a beautiful spot to walk or to relax.

Lovely walk if you get some sunny day. Very relaxing walking area if you can catch a warmish sunny day. Takes you away from the hub bub of London for a little peace. There are lots of benches and garden chairs to break up your walk if you need it. Close to big attractions like the Cabinet War Rooms etc. so nice interlude to sit here for awhile after a museum visit.

So nice on a sunny day (or a rainy one). St. James's park is a wonderful place to sit and read or take a little nap in the sun. It's beautiful gardens and multitude of different birds are wonderful to observe. It's also very near many of the big attractions in London, example: Buckingham Palace. I had the good fortune to encounter beautifully sunny weather, if you can get to the park on a sunny day, it would certainly be worth your while!
A not so well known gem. Plenty of wild life (even squirrels), history, lakes and gardens. Stop for a snack or lunch at the cafe/restaurant.

Pleasant walk. We visited this park by accident whilst waiting for our time slot to visit the Houses of Parliament. It is based around a lake and offers easy access to a number of surrounding attractions including Buckingham Palace and Whitehall. There is a cafe which we didn't visit. We enjoyed a pleasant circular walk.

A beautiful park. A beautiful park within the city of London that is free of people in the early morning. This park also includes a restaurants that offers the most delicious English Breakfast in the area.

Obama is here. We went for a strole to look at Buckingham Castle, a lot of people , police, helicopters so St. James' Park was a relieve , flowers and fantastic surroundings , we will be back when it's all not so noisy.
Pleasant walk. After viewing Changing of the Guard, it is a nice walk through the park to get to the London Eye. It might be a little crowded, but that is all part of the London experience.
st James's Park. A wonderful place to relax after a day in the bustle of the city. Or you can enjoy a sandwich while sitting on a bench and feed the ducks.

A lovely London stroll. A generally well kept park. Strolled through up to buckingham palace on a nice sunny day and it was beautiful. A peaceful area with a lovely atmosphere. Lots of different birds to see, plenty squirrels.

Lovely spot for a sunny day. This tranquil park in the heart of London is a gem, the pond and it's pelicans at one end (near Horse Guards Parade) and Buckingham Palace at the other. Plenty of space to sit and enjoy a warm Summer's day in London, ice cream and cold drinks available from the vendors and Inn the Park for something more filling. You'll understand why so many of the local workers flock here on their lunch breaks.

A Beautiful Park near Buckingham Palace. We strolled up to the palace but since QEII had not invited us in for tea, we ambled into the park, which is adjacent. It is a lovely park, with many places to sit and to relax. There are tons of interesting birds on the water and surrounding. We had warm, dry weather and found the park the perfect place to relax before heading out to a pre-theatre dinner and play. Just Lovely.

Beautiful park!. Nice to walk trough all four parks; St. James, Green park, Hyde park and Kensington Gardens. If you have the time, rent a seat at St. James to enjoy the weather. Combine the the best of all by walking and/or renting a bike at one of the many docking stations!

Stunning. The best of the royal parks, free and beautiful
Take some break, cross the bridge and feed the birds

Lovely Park. When we are in London we always go to St James Park Lovely to walk through, friendly squirrels fantastic flower beads
Impressive lake and amazing fountains.
Park is in the middle of city and near to Buckingham Palace and Free, take a walk.

A GENTLE OASIS. No London Park disappoints, really, but this one really does offer a real break in amongst all the hustle of the centre of town. You can sit and dawdle, stroll and watch the world go by - or simply stare at the hypnotic water from a nearby bench. Quite ordered and somehow 'organised' than, say, Regent's Park - but none the worse for that!
A lovely bird sanctuary in London. We were in a peaceful and beautiful location observing many unusual birds including resident pelicans.
This park is amazing. I walk through here most mornings on my way to work and also at lunchtimes. It's always busy and popular with tourists but so peaceful and beautiful.
Lovely park in the heart of government. A beautiful park around a picturesque lake surrounded by all the buildings of Central Government. Spectacular peace in the heart of London.

A pleasant place in downtown London. You can take a pleasant stroll through St. Jame's Park on the return from Buckingham Palace to the general sightseeing area of Downtown London. The London parks are very impressive and well maintained--as is all of London.

Lovely park.. A nice green and open place in London! At one end you have horse guards parade and the other brings you up near Buckingham palace. Lovely lake and a really nice play park for the kids. There is a café and you can hire deck chairs in the summer.

Gorgeous gardens. We loved this park, it was beautiful! We often walked around to enjoy the scenery and relax before heading off to bed as it was close to our hotel. Kept beautiful, nice flowers and wildlife!
A beautiful park. The park is an oasis of green right in the middle of the city. You can stroll through the park, go jogging, or just sit on one of the many benches and enjoy the view.
Nice walk. Just went through on a mission while playing Ingress - Resistance. There are a lot of birds and squirrels there.
Seriously Gorgeous. This a such a pretty place especially the bride overlooking the lake, even on the rainy day we visited we have such beautiful pictures.

Amazing break from sightseeing. If you're tired of the streets, cars and noise than make your way to St. James Park where you can watch great variety of birds, flowers and even take nice lunch with view of the pond.
Or just switch off and walk. It's a little paradise in the heart of the city.
My Favourite Park in London. St. James's Park is smaller than other famous parks in London, but we love it because it is less busy, more intimate and all around nice

A great walk. Love to walk through St. James's Park any time I'm in London! It's a beautiful park with lots of wildlife and amazing water fountains, a fab little tranquil park right in the middle of the bustling city (I'm still waiting to see the Pelicans that the signs warn about though)

Beautiful Central London Oasis. Delightful, well maintained, colourful park with lovely lake and play area opposite Buckingham Palace. Can get very busy on sunny days and is a great favourite with tourists to London but it is the most enjoyable way to get from Victoria Station to Trafalgar Square with lovely views from the bridge over the lake.
Gorgeous and free of course. It's a park. It's gorgeous. It's free. No brainer to go see and better yet, take some food and eat on the benches.
Lovely park by Buckingham palace. They have parrots in the trees and Pelicans on the water, lovely park to walk through from Westminster to Buckingham palace.

beautiful oasis. beautiful greens, flowers, river/pond, birds, ducks.
peaceful stroll or sitting on a bench and good for people watching
Wonderful stay. This was third time we have stayed at this hotel and it was as wonderful as previous visits. Staff, service and accommodation were absolutely fantastic

Beautiful, lovely and cosy city park . St. James Park is a beautiful, lovely, cozy and enjoyable park located near Buckingham Palace. A must see for everyone going to London. Lots of green space to lay arround. Also there is lots of wildlife. I love the fluffy squirrels running around there. Tip: do not accept the flowers from the ladies at the bridge, they will charge money and are scammers. Also don't buy from the snack stand near Buckingham as they are obviously insanely overpriced.
Beaultiful park with great views of the Palace. if it is warm or just sunny, stop by the park. Beautiful birds and flowers and views of the palace...walk from end to end.

Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful, I could of walked round there for hours. There's was lots of people sitting and having picnics as it was sunny, I felt jealous that we didn't have the time to enjoy it more.
Relaxing stroll!. It was a lovely walk after walking from Buckingham Palace. Was lovely to see all the different species of birds and ducks in the pond on a sunny day :)
Walk by it on way to work. Great diversity in birdsThe sounds of the city fade away towards the centerGreat cafe in the centerClean and nice crowd

Gem in the centre of London . We were in London for the day and found ourselves at a loose end for a couple of hours. We were interested in looking at Buckingham Palace and took a walk through St James Park to get there.The weather made a big difference as it was glorious, but the park is brilliant. Only minutes away from Piccadilly Circus who'd have thought that you could find the fantastic gardens, lake and grass areas of St James Park. The flowers at the moment are unbelievable, as was everything else. There were a lot of people around but it definitely didn't feel crowded.If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city for a while then try St James Park.
The Best Attractions. What a nice place very cool and relaxing to stayed here for a short period of time. You can feel some fresh air and have a great ambiance.
Lovely stroll. Beautiful park, in the heart of the city, green, clean and gorgeous. Loved it. And next to the queen's palace, the Big Ben and more.

An attractive public space . Following watching the changing of the guard at Buckingham palace we strolled down The Mall and enjoyed seeing the soldiers march down there too. We then headed through part of the park and enjoyed the birds and waterfowl and blossom on the trees. Certainly worth a stroll on our next visit so we can discover more of it.

Great Open Space near the Palace. Just a few steps away from the mall is this wonderful park, right in the centre of London, with so many waterfowl to see and even feed bread to should you so wishThere are plenty of seats to rest here and grass to just have a picnicThe gents toilets were clean but you had to pay 20 pence for the 'visit'There is also a large cafe although haven't tried this
Decent park. Positives:Nice park, some good scenery. Nice pond in the middle.Good to have some greenspace in Central LondonNegatives:Quite busy with touristsCharges for toilets
Love this park. Great park surrounded by Londons TOP ATTRACTIONS such as Buckingham Palace and the Big Ben. Great spot in summer when on Lunch break.

An extremely pretty park; much better than walking along the street and definitely worth a detour!. We decided to walk through the park to reach \horseguards Parade; it was an excellent idea and we strolled happily, admiring the flowers, fountain in the pond, the pelicans and the house where the "parkie" - superintendant - used to live and which is now, apparently, offices and has interesting flower beds and a "tiled piece of art" in the garden. Lovely to wander; later in the season it will be a super place for a picnic and/or to visit the building we could see off across the pond, which would no doubt sell assorted goodies ... on this occasion we were making for Horseguards; next time we'll just enjoy a visit to the beautiful park!!!

Ducks for those of you looking to add some life birds to your list. I saw some birds I had never seen before. There is even a painting of different birds with their names... a beautiful park as well....
Beautiful and Peaceful . One of the prettiest parks in London. Take a slow walk and enjoy the beauty of this place with the palace in the near corner, and lots of other sights near by.
A very pleasant stroll. St James Park is a delightful walk,So close to nature in a very busy city.It is easily accessible from the main attractions. Try and see the resident pelicans in the lake
Beautiful Park. Canada Memorial is here - definitely worth visiting, the Maple Leaves inset into the memorial were stunning. The park is beautiful and very tranquil.

Beautiful. Take a 20p. One of my favourite parks in London. Only downside is there is no change machine at the toilets and the coffee kiosk next door won't give you change for the 20p toilet fee. That aside its a stunning park to walk around with lots of different wildlife to see
Gorgeous. This is a lovely haven right in the middle of London. Lots of wildlife along the lake,fountains-trees and open space-which is very welcome in the busy hustle and bustle of London.

Beautiful any time of year. This is one of London's smaller parks and located beside the Mall. You can walk around the circumference of the park in 30-45 minutes quite easily. The flower beds are lovely and its well worth tagging on to a visit of Buckingham Palace and Green Park. If you want a less busy park with more open space, Hyde Park or Green Park are better.

Royal Park. One of London's beautiful Royal parks. It was lovely just wandering around this wide open space. You can easily forget you are in the heart of London. It has beautiful gardens and the lakes have all different species of birds. Not forgetting its home to pelicans which are really lovely if you are lucky enough to see them up close and personal. Or just sit and have a coffee and relax.
Just beautiful. On a sunny day u can't beat a nice chill out arvo in the park. Lots of tourists around here but the park is huge so plenty of room for everyone :)

Walking in the sunshine. Had a walk around St James Park, as the sun was shining on this beautiful spring day. Had an opportunity to take some nice photos too. This park is great for the family of all ages

A Breath of Air in the Heart of London. A walk through St. James park goes hand in hand with a visit to Buckingham Palace because of the proximity to one another. Go see the daily changing of the guard at the palace at 11:30am and then walk through the park and see the swans and ducks. The bridge in the middle of the park is the perfect place for an iconic London picture with The London Eye in the background.

Nice. A lovely place to walk round. Lots of wildlife and birds to see. On a sunny day you can sit for hours and watch the world go by, then a few minute walk and you are back in the hustle and bustle of central London
Well done, great walk and well maintained.. Worth the visit, a beautiful walk. It will take you to Buckingham Place and just another short walk to Tralfager Square

A nice park to walk through or just rest a while.. We walked through St James’s Park in between visiting some of the main London attractions – it is quite close to Trafalgar Square.It is a very clean, well maintained park with immaculate flower beds and a beautiful lake with many different species of birds, including pelicans.There are deck chairs available to hire and there is also a café in the middle of the park, although we did not make use of it.If you need to use the toilets it will cost you 30p.

Stunningly beautiful park!. Absolutely stunningly beautiful park and definitely a must see on the way to Buckingham Palace. You could spend hours walking through the park...sitting on a bench or on a blanket under the shade of the trees watching the squirrels running around...Definitely a must see!!!
A LOVELY WALK. What a lovely walk ,even though it was drizzling, it was most enjoyable to see all all the varieties of birds/ducks/swans etc,plenty of seating and places for a drink etc.

Beautiful park. Beautiful park with trees a pond and wildlife I have the opportunity to visit in the spring as the trees and flowers started to bloom. looking forward to coming back in the summer time to enjoy the park some more.
Relaxing park to eat lunch.. Relaxing park just beside t hussle and bussle of city life. A place to chill out and watch t wildlife.

Nice park. This is a lovely green area in central London. Runs along side the Mall. Lots of Squirrels that will take food out of your hand.
Lots of waterfowl.

Relax and enjoy. On two occasions whilst in London, we strolled through St James's Park. The flower beds and just brilliant with planted young spring flowers as well as the many daffodils and trees with blossom and young leaves. The bird life is enormous and even the squirrels are friendly (although they bite). A heron paid us a visit. Opportunities for photography are great too with Buckingham Palace in the background. You MUST go to this place!
lovely flowers and a must for visitors , amazing views. This really is a must for everyone visiting London on holiday, open space, lake, animals , birds and amazing views.
Beautiful. On a sunny day this is definitely worth a visit!!! So picturesque, peaceful and relaxing. Would highly recommend a visit!!

Beautiful in spring. I guess this review can really cover all of the parks in the London area, but I must say the flowering trees and the daffodils in this park are just gorgeous. If you can get go London midapril or may, this site is well worth it.

Lovely park for a stroll away from the traffic and noise of the city. Spent a lovely afternoon walking from Buckingham Palace to Horse Guards Parade. The atmosphere is so calming as you walk past the lake. A nice café in the centre for light refreshments too.
a really lovely place. this is a cool place to relax + enjoy time taking in the sights + the people. the weather was kind to us it was great

Loved the nature on the park lake. Spend almost one hour walking near the lake. What a nice wild life.. Interesting birds nesting. The weather was perfect. Neither cold or hot.Trees with flours around..I really do recommend spend some time there. Stay near the lake.Go before 11 am, then you can watch the 11:30 guards changing parade on the palace that is near by.

One of my favourite parks. A gem.. Everything about it is nice. The view, the birds, the size of the park, that it is between Buckinghma Castle, and the changeover of the guards, that it's a short walk to Westminster Abbey, Big Ben and Trafalgar Square. One of the best parks in London. I recommend the cafe, near the Changing of the guards. The squirrels are very used to people, and so are the crows. Loved the crows. To get some bird coming towards you etc, bring some bread crumbs :)
Huge variety of birds. I like to visit here throughout the year for nice relaxing walks and there are so many different types of birds to look at.

Great Place to Walk. I have walked through the park on many occasions but not for a few years. It was a bleak, cold Winter's morning so I saw the park at it's worst and it was still spectacular. The views are of the picture postcard variety, the swans were there in force and even though the weather was bitter there were numerous people walking around the park. Wonderful.

Always a great pleasure. It's early spring in London and Saint James is a wonderful respite from the crowds of Soho, Westminster, and Trafalgar. It's fun people, duck, geese, and squirrel watching. Flower beds gorgeous, trees budding, lovers hand in hand, kids tugging/running about. Lovely, very civilized.

Lovely for a stroll in the sun . I visited this park with two of my nephews 8 and 11 years of age they enjoyed themselves without any slides or swings just the views flowers, pond etc with swans it was so lovely and peaceful

Restful oasis in the centre of town. Not only a place of history, but a living testimony of what the UK does well. Also a place to slow down and catch up if you are 'Doing' London - also a good place to start that spy novel you've always been meaning to write.

Our favourite London park. We love a stroll through here when visiting London. Peaceful and tranquil yet only 5 mins from the hub of the city centre. Great views of buckingham palace, lovely nature trails, ponds, ducks, and cafes and ice creams in summer.

Beautiful and romantic all year round. St. James's Park is beautiful and romantic all year round, with wonderful views of Buckingham palace, big Ben and the London eye, full of ducks and other birds, and more importantly beautiful flowers throughout the year. The lake and the flowers complement each other perfect, and is awesome for a romantic stroll any time of year as it is not too small, yet not too large, a trip around the perimeter will take no longer than an hour. My fav time of year to come is in spring when the cherry blossom trees are in full bloom, of which there are quite a few, but also, because of the beautiful flower beds which are maintained with lots of love and tender care.

My Favourite London Park.. I have been coming here since I was a child. Great place for a picnic. Beautiful weeping willows dip into the water, lots of ducks, swans, geese. Incredible gardens with beautiful flowers. A real riot of colour in Spring/Summer. A great cafe, has a bandstand and deckchairs too.

Wonderful park in the center of the city. St James's park is busy with commuters, tourists, and all sorts however its still manages to hold a sense of calm and peacefulness in the center of one of the busiest cities in the world. From the lake to the flowers and the views up to Buckingham palace, this is a must just to unwind and relax your legs from all the sightseeing

Beautiful, even in the rain. We walked through the park, and even though it was raining and cold, it was beautiful experience in the middle of London. If you are visiting Westminster Abbey, and want to see Buckingham Palace, take in the park as you walk over!

Beautiful park with lots of photo opportunities;). A beautiful park with lots of photo opportunities 📷 I especially loved the black swan... And the Pelicans but couldn't get close enough to the Pelicans to get a decent photo. Overall a really lovely park with super friendly squirrels and whether visiting alone, with children or with friends it's well worth a visit :)
April daffodils. beautiful in Spring when the daffodils, magnolias, and cherry trees are in bloom. many benches on which to sit and enjoy the park. at numerous bus stops and the underground.
Short break. This is a lovely park for a stroll and people watching. Squrals and pegions are very tame and will feed from your hand. Only down side was the Pelicans were missing.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful, well-kept park. My husband I walked through here on our way to Buckingham palace and enjoyed the well-manicured landscaping and cleanliness.
Must see in London.. Don´t miss the Park, it is the nicest way of approaching Buckingham Palace. Downtown London one can sit and relax in the middle of the city in a real Royal Ambience.

Summertime - and the relaxing is easy..... Although Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens are bigger and more open spaces, St. James's Park is the perfect choice for anybody looking to stretch their legs and bodies on the nice greenery. Surrounded by Horseguard's Parade and The Mall, with Westminster and the South Bank nearby, it is a convenient stop point during the summer when the sun is at it's hottest. Although there are food vendors nearby, you can get cheap eats from the local Tesco's and Sainsburys which are situated near Westminster and Trafalgar Square, which are both within walking distance.The Horseguard's Parade side was used recently for second-unit filming of the James Bond blockbuster SPECTRE on a couple of evenings. The Mall was where hundreds of thousands of people camped out in April 2011 as Prince William and Kate Middleton got married, before being led by duty police officers towards Buckingham Palace to witness their two kisses, as well as them driving from the Palace to St. James's Palace in their car with JUST MARRIED on it.There is a lot of pond wildlife to be witnessed and a few squirrels scurrying around on the grass and up the trees, so all in all, a worthwhile place to camp down if you want a breather from the pace of the West End....

One of my favourite parks in the world. St James Park is wonderful for a walk on a dry day, which we were lucky to get. The whole area is worthy of a day as there is so much to see and do. The buildings are so beautiful and the history comes alive.

Scenic route in the city. I walk through St. James' Park most days after work and especially during the longer daylight hours, it is a beautiful place in the middle of the city. Always amusing to see squirrels scuttling about and the ducks and swans being fed.When the weather gets warmer, it is a pleasure to sit by the lake and just take in nature at its best.
I love this park. Very tranquil space in the heart of London. Lots of people picnicking or running or commuting. The flamingoes are stunning.

Visited on way to Buckingham Palace. Walked up the Mall towards the palace, didn't even realise for a while we were in St James' Park. Lovely park, nice lake, lots of ducks and squirrels. Very green. A few food stalls offering waffles, ice cream, drinks etc. Even had half decent public loos (20p entry for loo). Lots of entrances in and out. Makes a walk to the palace more interesting. Recommend a visit.
Flower meadows . The place was really peaceful and the view was amazing; the park has a lake and there was lots of flowers which made the place amazing and interesting.

One of the Best Spots in London for Can’t Miss Great Photos. This review is for travelers who like to photograph landscapes, flowers, horses, birds and/or cute squirrels. If you fall into this category, plan on taking a stroll through London’s St. James Park. Our fellow travelers’ photos offer many examples of the photographic possibilities this readily accessible and beautiful park has to offer. When you go, make sure you walk on the footbridge that crosses the center of the lake and take in the view to the east toward the Thames and London Eye. From this point you are guaranteed a great London landscape photo. Two of our March 2016 photos of the view are attached. We image the view is even more spectacular when the park is in full bloom. Bottom line, if you are always on the lookout for a great photo or your kids for cute squirrels, add this park to your London itinerary.If you found this review helpful and/or our photos, we hope you will click the “helpful” button; those of us who write reviews really appreciate the feedback and it motivates us to write more. Thank you.

Spring bursting into life!. Beautiful to stroll around watching the wildlife and plants bursting into spring life or for a run around the perimeter if you are able to avoid the bimbleing tourists. Bring a flash of coffee and a packed lunch!
Good walk before the Palace. Great Walk before going to the Buckingham Palace.Very beautiful flora and fauna, nice places to sit, take pictures, and also to have something hot in the winter.

Nice park. . This is a nice park to walk through. One side has the palace and the cool guards and the other side has the bustle of the city. There are duck and squirrels and several refreshment stands. It appears very clean and well managed. Very nice.

Favourite place on Earth. The title says it for me. AMAZING beautiful romantic scenery, quiet and peaceful. Ducks and squirrels lounging about. Great location for resting after a day of sightseeing.I would probably want to get married in a place like that. Don't know if it is possible though - worth finding out.

The best in London. A walk through St James Park is a must when in London and is a natural follow on from viewing Buckingham Palace. A delightful park at all times of the year with a variety of bird life on the water. Easy to walk with plenty of resting places along the way. Cut through to Whitehall or Horseguards Parade, or simply follow the park along side the Mall.
Beautiful park, very touristy! Choose your timings!. A park I frequently jog around and is stunning with fantastic views of the nearby sights/attractions.
Lovely place to visit!. We loved St. James Park. This is a wonderful place to gather and stroll or enjoy a cup of coffee or tea. A true gem.
Great Park to Walk Through. This is a great park that goes from the horse guards to Buckingham palace. There are a lot of fun birds and good photo opportunities in the park.
A must. As a large city it is always a surprise that London has so many parks and green spaces. My favourite by a mile is St James wander around and look at the views down to the Palace

Stunning in the Spring. Flowers blooming, swans swimming, the sun setting... We enjoyed a nice stroll through the park on our way from Buckingham Palace. Be sure to snap some sunset photos on the bridge! We also saw a lot of people feeding the squirrels so I guess that's the thing to do too!

One of my favorite parks in London. One of my favorite parks in London, small but well designed, I love the lake and the late afternoon light, perfect for a romantic stroll or for a walk alone or with friends.

5 stars is not enough!. After a less than glamorous start to our trip, we found this gem. We decided to walk through the park on our trek through the city, instead of go down the main streets. What a perfect arrangement! The park is extremely well maintained, with so many different types of plants and trees. Some of these trees are so large and old, they look ancient! Living there are as many species of duck and goose as you can imagine, pelicans, squirrels, etc. The water was clean, covered in feathered friends, and surrounded by the most breathtaking plants I've ever seen. There was a willow tree there that was just stunning! If you like nature, and need to get away from the bustle of the city, this is the place to go. I could spend all day just walking the trail over and over.

Always something interesting to watch in this breathing space.. We stopped here to eat our picnic lunch during a day visit to London. The Mall has an open, pleasant feel to it and this increases once you step into the Park. Pigeons can be a nuisance but they stayed away from us while we ere eating. We found a bench opposite a place where Westminster Abbey appears through the far trees and were entertained by a constant stream of tourist couples taking selfies against this background in front of us.
Best park in London. So I love this park. There is a cafe inside. LOVE it. Lovely to walk around. Beautiful flowers. Lovely place to have a walk.

Nice walk. From Buckingham Palace use this route to walk further. You will find a lot of squirrels and pigeons who would come near you and eat from your hand, I am not sure though if you are allowed to feed them. However, every time I have been here I see people feed them. Take this route and walk out, take a right after you cross the road and turn left at the first traffic light and you will see the Big Ben, a real surprise.
St James's Park. Beautiful and often overlooked park, has views of Whitehall Spires reflected in the lake at the East end and the Palace at the West end, always beautifully maintained. A gem
BEAUTIFUL PARK!!. The park is perfect for a short or long walk, very green and very beautiful one of my favorite parks in London
Nice stroll through the park. Near Buckingham Palace. St-Jame's Park is nice for a stroll. There are so many ducks and squirrels and the scenery is quite lovely so it's a nice park for photographers!
A green oasis in the centre of the city. Walking to a training day from trafalgar to Westminster past st James park. A welcome park in the city centre. Fantastic
Beautiful walk. from Buckingham Palace toward Trafalgar square through this park. There are lots of pretty birds to gaze at during the walk.

Beautiful walk through from Horseguards to Buckingham Palace. We loved the fact that we saw the horse change take place. Then we walked through this lovely park, taking, our time and admiring all the different ducks waddling and swimming about. We strolled at our leisure though the park until we came out at Buckingham Palace. Lots of people there especially families with youngsters and the not so young, all together enjoying his lovely open space. A good place to be, away fro the hustle and bustle.
Beautiful Walk. Easy to get to from St James Underground. Near Buckingham Palace. Beautiful bits of nature. Lots of birds.
Nice and relaxing. Walk around, have a coffee/tea, feed the ducks. Great way to relax and see wildlife in the heart of London.
Beautiful. Lovely walk and perfect photography with the squirrels. Daughter loved how close they came up to her and was playing round a tree with it.
Beautiful. What a beautiful park for a stroll or a picnic. Right by the Buckingham Palace, you must go check it out.

Favourite London park. Lovely park with amazing vistas through the trees of Buckingham Palace and Horseguards. Cafes serve very good quality food and drinks - a little pricey but not extortionate for the quality.

Great park. After seeing the Changing the Guard at Buckingham Palace, me and my family went for a walk through St James's Park towards the Admiralty Arch. Nice, very nice. Lots of people standing on the grass, fathers playing football with their kids, very clean and nice to walk. Great park in the hear oh London.

Tranquil setting. Took a stroll whilst waiting for the changing of the guards. I have been to London many times but never spent much time here. We were with our two year old who enjoyed seeing all the ducks and geese and having an ice cream (or two) there are plenty of kiosks as well as toilets (which charge). There are lots of beautiful flowers and areas to enjoy them and it appears they are creating or updating a playground. We had a lovely hour or so there.
So beautiful!. The garden is located near buckingham palace. We visit there to have running trip with my boyfriend. It was very happy walk.

Beautiful amd peaceful. I was there in the end of the afternoon and it was not busy.It's a beautiful park, with ducks, pelikans, squirels, gooze... A charming bridge...Loved it! Right oposit buckingham palace
A Gem. A lovely park in the city, views of horse guards parade, they have Pelicans and lovely flowers, full of colour.

Beautiful in the Spring. We weren't actually planning to visit the gardens but happened to stroll through it on our way to lunch and really enjoyed it all. We did manage to make our lunch date but it was late as we could not help but stop and take in all that St James Park has to offer

Downloaded the walk London Royal Gardens maps, what a fantastic way to spend a day. Walked all royal parks, the elfin oak, the parrots, fountains and lakes... just an amazing way to spend a day in the city
A Place to Relax. This park is a marvelous place to avoid the crowd of the city. Very relaxing atmosphere, we loved to see the pelicans too.
Commuter walks thro Park. While working in the city I used the park on a number of occasions to make may way from one meeting to another. Very pleasant.

A really lovely place. Despite this park being so close to all of the tourist sites, it is a beautiful park. The spring flowers and the blossom on the trees was really lovely, together with all the lovely birds.

Glorious open parkland in centre of London. A beautiful park ideal to while away an hr or 2 from hectic london a great walk round the lake make sure u see the resident pelicans. Plenty of wildlife to see ducks, squirrels. Take a picnic and enjoy the outdoors

Chilling out and relaxing for a while!. We were on a visit to London to see some of the interesting sites and have dinner. After walking around for a 3-4 hours, we ended up in St. James's Park and sat a while to take in the wonderful gardens and just watch the world go by.Good Friday was a warm, sunny day and the park was fairly crowded, but somehow it was also quiet and relaxing. People were enjoying their day off work with friends an family.After a while, we wandered off towards Buckingham Palace and continued our walk around London, site-seeing.Its a great place in a great city to stop and just relax for a while.

A Break From The Hustle & Bustle. We wandered through St James's Park during our recent visit to the capital. Squirrels dashed around and the plentiful numbers and varieties of birds were prominent. The only fault I could find was that some of the grassed areas were looking rather threadbare and could use some attention. All-in-all it's a nice way to relax for half an hour amidst the day's sightseeing.
Relaxing . My favorite park in London! Squirrels, ducks, flowers...you name it! On a sunny day this and Hyde park would the best locations to spend your day in London.

Love these Gardens. all you need to know is they have Pelicans!!!!great park, great walks, all well kept and clean,near Buckingham palace, near the centre and all in all a great afternoon. if sunny of course its better. been many a time and see some great things, had some great laughs and always enjoyed it. also FREE

Pelicans and a palace. Lots of crows and pigeons, plus bare earth patches cordoned off by plastic mesh fences. Not impressive. Then I saw pelicans on the far side of a lake. OK, don’t see those every day! A gift from Russia in 1664, according to a sign. Seeing a squirrel or two was fun. We had a bit of a view of Buckingham Palace over the trees. More fun happened when we heard a band from that direction, and got there in time to see some military bands on the march.
Stunning Park. St James's Park is absolutely stunning and perfect on a sunny day in London. I personally enjoy standing on the bridge and looking out over the pond and towards Westminster
Great green space. Great park to stroll around in with family and friends or even going on your own. This time of the year, the daffodils are still around, so you get a splash of colour.

One of the nicest spots in London in my opinion. I honestly feel like the bridge across the lake is one of my favorite spots in London to just stand and contemplate. Its a lovely view, definitely worth a photo as a tourist.

Lovely. Spent a lovely time strolling around the park, and then relaxing on the deck chairs watching the ducks. However please note you will have to pay to use the toilets and to sit on the deckchairs.

Gorgeous park! . This was the second time I had been to St. James's park and it was even more beautiful! In springtime the daffodils and so lovely! Seeing all the ducks, coots, and pelicans was a treat too! I especially appreciated the public toilets, as you don't always find those in a park. I think they cost 30 p. Worth it!
Very pretty. Lovely place to walk and see Buck Palace. Greta place to get away from the noise of London and walk with your family.

Lovely stroll on a sunny day. A little secret - go on the bridge - and avoiding the selfie sticks get a great picture with Buckingham Palace or Horseguards in the background.
Be careful not to ruin the shot of Horseguards with the London Eye

Great walk. This is a fantastic place for a walk or to eat some lunch on any day (although not so nice if it's raining). The tree are beautiful, the ducks and birds gorgeous and the view across the bridges are fantastic. The perfect spot to stop on the way to Buckingham Palace and a nice piece of tranquility in busy London if you don't want to walk across Hyde Park - the size of St. James's Park is much more manageable for those who have difficulty walking and the paths are largely well managed.

Best Park in world. Any time of year this park is a delight but in spring so special with London parks coming alive.In the middle of London with views of Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards Parade plus Whitehall.The wildlife of ducks and other birds is fantastic and places to eat or picnic are good.Watch changing of the guard then sit in park for perfect morning.

Beautiful city Park centrally located for all activities and great for families.. What an amazing city park this is. We spent a lot of time here with the kids both going to and coming back from attractions. The park is beautifully laid out with lots of green space for the kids to run around. Of all the activities we did the one thing the kids wanted to do most of all was got to the park and just run around (13 yr old and 10 yr old). Recommend in conjunction with changing of the guards at any locale.

Tranquil. This is probably the most beautiful park in London. It is full of birds and ducks including Pelicans and Herons. You can walk around the pond and see so many different species. When the sun is shining it is such a magnificent site. There is a restaurant situated in the middle where you can sit in or take away. It also sells cakes and coffee. They are a bit pricey, however it is a nice treat!

Good views and plenty of wildlife. We had a relaxing walk through the park, enjoying displays of daffodils with Buckingham Palace in the background. There were great views down the lake, towards Westminster and the London Eye.Plenty of different birds and animals were out and about, although the Pelicans weren't in residence.We combined our visit with the changing of the guard at the palace, which was a great way to spend a sunny morning on an early spring morning.
Beautiful. Visited in August 2012 not 15. This is a very beautiful park with a lovely sized pond. Also has the Princess Diana memorial walk.

Changing the guard. Just in time to see the changing of the guards here in St James Park.lots of people gathered around to see the guards on horseback with their helmets and breastplates shining in the sunlight. A lovely sight to see these horses who are trained to stand in one place for such a long time

national holidays 3 day trip with london eye. really good a bit of fresh air from the hussle and the bussle of the city nice just to have a stroll round feeding the ducks and having an icecream , and a sit down rest from all the walking about.

A Hidden Gem --Better than the Changing of the Guard. We attended the Horse Guards changing because on Sunday it is at 10 and the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace is at 11:30 and it is close by. It was easy to get great photos and we had a terrific view.

Great views of classic london sights. Stunning green haven in central london - I recommend walking over the bridge to get views of the palace in one direction and the london eye in the other. There are information and map boards around the park and some interesting local wildlife. A must on a day out sightseeing in london.

Best park in London!. I know that's a big call, but it really is the most beautiful park I have ever had the pleasure to wander in. It's compact size makes it easy to see all it's attractions, and the fact it is surrounded by Buckingham Palace, the suburb of Westminster (Westminster Abbey is a few blocks away), Churchill War Rooms, 10 Downing Street, Horse Guards Parade, Trafalgar Square, St James's Palace and Clarence House, means that it is easy to access. Gently sloping lawns dotted with deckchairs; trees blocking out most of the buildings; weeping willows lining the Lake; ducks, swans, and other waterfowl swimming in the lake or sleeping on the banks; stunning flowerbeds; amazing views of Buckingham Palace from the blue bridge; the beautiful fountains; the King George VI and Queen Mother memorial; Admiralty Arch; and above all - peace and quiet. Inn the Park is a restaurant located inside the park, and there are also various food stands throughout the park. There's public toilets at the eastern end of the Park, near Horse Guards Rd. Wheelchair accessible. Absolutely unmissable!!!

Perfect for a quiet walk. I walk around here every Sunday and we see the park through the seasons and it never fails to impress. The gardens are meticulous and the lawns are well kept. This is a real oasis in the middle of The Smoke. If you are a twitcher there are lots of birds to admire (feathered type) including the resident Pelicans. If you take a stroll down The Mall you'll get the views of Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square. Other notable places are Horse Guards Parade, Downing Street, The Churchill War Rooms and other famous locations. The park also connects Piccadilly via Green Park. Start at the corner of Birdcage Walk and walk clockwise around the park. Take some nibbles for the tame squirrels and they'll feed out of your hand. Also go near the south end of the small bridge and you can feed the Starlings and Blue Tits ala Mary Poppins"! If you are lucky you might see a royal (they really do walk around the park). Don't take a dog off a lead as you will be fined.
Not bad. Quiet a nice park down the rd from Buckingham palace nice for a walk with the family if you look you can see Pelicans there living happily with the ducks and swans

Hello Queen Elizabeth. From around the Trafalgar Sq. area, there is an entrance way to this park. Summer and Spring walks feature beautiful flowers, birds & ducks. At the end of the walk, Buckingham Palace.

Lush, gorgeous park!. This park is gorgeous. It is just a very serene place. Lots of ducks, squirrels and such, I'm a sucker for cute ducks! We had a nice walk through here after seeing Buckingham palace, then continued on to see Big Ben!

Beautiful!. One of the many glorious 'green spaces' in London. With Pelicans residing on the pool giving it a different feel. Great views of the London Eye from the bridge. It's always busy, but I think it's great to see the park being used. The grounds are well tended and the area is kept tidy. A great 'chill' place right in the centre of London.

A great spot to relax and people watch. If you're doing the traditional tourist spots of Buckingham Palace, Houses of Parliament etc and want somewhere for a break head here for a coffee, snack or picnic. Watch out for overly friendly squirrels though - they'll happily eat out of your hand!

Beautiful park. This park is so pretty to look at, there is so much wildlife and lovely flowers/plants.Would be perfect for a picnic in the summer, there isn't any shelter so as with most outdoor places wouldn't be great in the typical British rainy weather - unless you don your wellies and go puddle jumping of course!
one of the most beautiful park. close to buckingham and westminster it is my favorite park in London. Good for a walk, pictures or picnic

Must see. One of the MUST SEE in London. Same as HYDE PARK and RICHMOND PARK.
Huge and beautifull. Great for a walk and cold beer with friends
Kinda average. Lovely park, but rather boring area and full of tourists. It's nice enough to take your packed lunch during the day of it's sunny, or for a little walk at lunch time :)
Beautiful Daffodils!. very nice park leading from Buckingham Palace. The daffodils were in bloom everywhere! also enjoyed seeing the swans in the lake.

Relaxing Place. When the sun shines in the London's sky, this park is a must!You can walk, run, take a nap, get tanned, etc. fully immersed in a wonderful area. The grass is perfect, the trees (many) well managed: every thing is perfectly kept very very clean. The place is a "safe area" for children: so you can relax without worrying of "overlooking" your children with fear or being anxious. I will go again.

Good park to walk through after seeing Buckingham Palace. Good park to walk through after seeing Buckingham Palace. This park is right next to Buckingham Palace and is worth a little walk through. It is a lot smaller than Hyde Park, but worth a walkthrough.
The great outdoors in a city. A pleasant are of green in the middle of the city, close to major attractions and with Tourist friendly squirrels.

Great area. The park itself is vast, clean and beautiful. Plenty of places to sit. Nice if not a bit pricey coffee and icecream huts dotted around.
