The only fault is the toilets, 20 pence to use toilets that wouldn't look out of place in a farmers field, there was an attendant taking money but the toilets didn't look like they'd had a clean in a few hours and many were blocked, causing for a smoothering of anti-bac gel everywhere when we came out, so I think for the amount of visitors this area gets this should be improved.

beautifully landscaped park in the heart of London. The park sits next to Buckingham palace. It is always full of tourists and joggers. Entrance is free. Plenty of pathways for running and walking. It also has a small lake. It was established in 1603 on an area of 57 acres.

Nature int he heart of London. Late March and a beautiful spring morning as we wandered around the lake. Pelicans resting on their rocky island. Ducks paddling along the lake-side looking for food; all this and only 5 to 10 minutes' walk from central London. Lots of grey squirrels running around. Further along habitat for a variety of different bird life. In the distance a band strikes up as the Guard changes at Buckingham Palace. The park is surrounded by famous landmarks.Having visited the park many times we did not bother about the band. If you want to see Changing the Guard, and it is well worth the effort, be aware it is on alternative days and subject to change. The ceremony lasts about 45 minutes and you need to be outside Buckingham Palace by 11.15 AM. Best to check on twitter first.Peter M.

Great place for a walk . Whilst on a trip to London we visited this park. It is near many attractions including the palace. Whilst there we happened across the changing of the guard which was a real treat and unexpected. The park itself is a real change from the urban hustle.

Relaxing. Great park to walk around and just take in the surroundings. Welcome break from the more hectic bits of London. Great to visit on a warm sunny day, spend time walking the gardens and lying in the grass
Lovely park. We loved this park. It was beautiful, and we went there for a walk many times. I'll definitely go again.

A beautiful park in the middle of London. This is not an enormous park but it is central, easily accessible and very attractive. Many local business people in London go there to eat their lunches on a nice day. There is a lake, flower beds, water birds, beautiful trees and lots of places to sit and read a book or chat and admire the beauty around you. It's hard to imagine that you are in the centre of the city.

The place for spymasters. Every spymaster worth his salt takes a stroll through St. James's park with the spy he runs - or at least that what happens in the movies. If you like green vistas, flowers, lakes, birds, chipmunks and people - you should do as they do. Small, beautiful and central.
Relaxing . Walked all around here on a a sunny and warm good Friday had a coffee at one of the stalls very nice and cheap latte sat overlooking the lake drinking coffee very nice.
Lovely walk at any time of the year. Easy access, plenty to see, reasonably-wide footpaths weaving under the trees. A restful oasis within earshot of the London traffic.

Squirrels. This park is well worth a visit. The tranqulility in the center of London is worth a lot. buy some nuts in advance and feed the squirrels! Thera are meny oportunities to take photos which will not be recognized as London pictures at all.

A favorite for a early morning stroll. In my last 2 visits to London, I took a Saturday early morning stroll in this lovely London park, once in Jan (Winter) and once in February (early Spring). The air is crisp and just refreshing to relax after a busy business schedule. Squirrels were scampering about in the park, birds chirping among the trees and the ducks, swans and pelicans were frolicking in the lake. Visitors are well advised not to feed the wild life. Recommend a walk around the lake (about 45 minutes) and enjoy the sights, the air and the sounds.

ducks and squirrels. it is a very interesting attraction to see how the human kind is so stunned by ducks and squirrels. It seems that they think that the St. James Park is the only place on earth left to photograph ducks. The park is not big but still big enough to fit hundreds of people.It is a great place to study the human species.

A Great Place for an Afternoon Stroll. We went through St. Jame's Park after seeing the changing of the Horse Guards, on our way to Buckingham Palace. The grounds and flower beds are immaculate, and we greatly enjoyed taking our time watching people, as well as the birds and other wildlife along the pond.

London's Most Beautiful Park?. This is probably London's most beautiful park. Nestled between St James Palace and Buckingham Palace. Look out for the squirrels and Pelicans. Give it plenty of time. If you are going to see Buckingham Palace or the Churchill Cabinet War Rooms then take this in on the way. Compact and beautiful.

a dining area for schools. along the main path there were hundreds of school kids all having their lunch, however as we got closer to the horse guards they thinned out and the area became much more peaceful. Beautiful landscaping and many many daffodils give a wonderful atmosphere to this park.
Full with animals :). If you like the animals, don't miss this park....it is just simple amazing :) But don't forget to brig food with you for the pigeons :D

Windy and nice walk!. It was windy and cold, but it was worth it! I enjoyed the long walk and enjoyed the atmosphere, the ambience and all kids playing and dogs playing all around. Even the sound of the wind was a bonus during the walk. It was one of my last walks during the winter season. Now I look forward to seeing all the blossoming flowers... Enjoy your tour!

Nice park in the thick of historic sites. Nice park with interesting bird life. Not many activities in this park- it is adjacent to Buckingham Palace and the guards facilities. We had a nice stroll through on a Sunday after the Changing of the Guards. It is a pretty place. Well maintained. People watching may be the number one thing to do here. Also, bring 30 pence to use the public washrooms in this park.
Nice walk through . Just had the time to walk by the park. Its amazing how friendly the squirrels are. If had more time and had known would had taken some nuts to feed them
23 hectares in the heart of London. The park is bounded by Buckingham Palace to the west, The Mall to the north, Horse Guards to the east. Beautiful place in summer.

Cute little park ... bring something to feed the squirrels .... We just walked through the park after visiting the "Changing of the guards" but my 7 year old fell in love with the squirrels. Luckily a kind elderly man gave him some nuts and he got to feed one. After we showed him all the important attractions of London he still claimed that this was the best part of his visit. At times it is the small things ...
One of the places to visit. This is a very nice park for evening walks. The park is well maintained . You can spend good time near the pond

A great little relaxer for the tired travellor. Right in the middle of the main attractions of Buckingham Palace, Westminster, Horse Guards and a lovely oasis where the squirrels will run up your arm if you offer them a little sustenance. When you get your breath back - carry on with your tour

Beauty in the Heart of the city. St James Park, is a beautiful Royal Park in the centre of the city. There is so much to see and do, you will forget where you are. Plenty of nature, gardens and culture to look at. Nice to chill out and relax for a while.

Lovely place to meander around. This is a great outdoors to enjoy in the centre of one of the busiest cities in the world. You can spend as much or as little time as you want walking around. It's a good way to get to places rather than just follow the main roads.
Lush Park". Amazing views, with amazing buildings that makes you feel like you are in Italy with all the domed buildings surrounding the park! Take a pack lunch and sit down by the lake!

A tranquil oasis in the heart of the city. London can get quite busy and manic, so it's nice to have somewhere nice to go for a bit of peace and tranquility. The park itself is well maintained, and there are plenty of nice walks around it if you are feeling inclined. Alternatively, just sit on one of the many benches and watch the world go by, (or squirrels!). There is plenty of wildlife in the shape of birds and the like, so if you like sitting and chilling with your sandwiches or picnic, it's a lovely place to go.

Nice walk in central London. This park is a great place to have a nice walk in central london. It is a great place to take your family for a picnic or just to feed the birds and the squirrels. There are actually a few pelicans (which you are not allowed to feed).

Beautiful park to relax and enjoy nature in the centre of London. What a beautiful haven away from the hustle and bustle of London but just a short walk away from many great attractions from Buckinham Palace to Big Ben. Beautiful lakes, squirrels running around eating from your palm, geese and duck sin the lakes and playgrounds and grassy areas for the kids to play. Truly magical and definitely a fair day attraction
Lovely walk. Great place to take a stroll. Lovely now in spring. Clean, pretty and a great place to picnic (once the weather picks up!)
Beautiful. Great park, best time to visit is summer, great fun for kids with all the birds and squirrels, flowers etc.

Escape from the noise. I love walking through this park to go from Buckingham Palace to Westminster/Parliament. The scenery is gorgeous and you definitely feel as though you've escaped the city for a while.

Ducks and Mother Goose.... The park itself is vast and beautiful. I suppose, it is where New York got the idea of it's famous park and Toronto it's High Park layout and landscape. The most amazing thing to me was watching the Geese and ducks nibble of food.
Lovely park.. Really enjoyed walking around this park before travelling back home later that morning. Enjoyed seeing horses exercising on the gallops.

Hidden Gem. This is a Park with a lake. Super place to unwind in Central London.
It has great views and very nice atmosfere

Beautiful Park in the Heart of London. seeing the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Place take a stroll through St. James's Park, It is beautiful with flowers & fountains. Abundant wild life, (ducks, geese & swans) great place for younger children.

Lovely Lunch. For those that always easy the same thing everyday, why not improve it instantly with a stroll in the park. A few places to rest up and finish the meal deals. And plenty of wildlife around that will want to eat anything you leave.

Great activity for families, especially in summer time. I visited this park in March, 2016. We had a nice and relaxing walk enjoying the surroundings and beautiful nature of this park. It's a perfect place to have a nice walk, especially in summer time when everything is green, for couples and families with small kids.

Pet the squirrels. If you ever find yourself close to Buckingham Palace make sure to stop by this park with the disturbingly friendly squirrels. I went on a walking tour and it was fun hearing some of the stories that go along with it as well.
Lovely walk. A nice park for a walk after looking at Buckingham Palace. Wander through looking at the wildlife. Go on a nice day.

Go and see the swans. This is a lovely park with gorgeous areas to picnic and lots of birds of all sorts. Meticulously maintained, it also has a public restaurant and restrooms. In summer there are daily concerts in the bandstand on one of the great lawns. And it all leads to Buckingham Palace

A wonderful place ever e for a visit.. It's the sort of park that so enchanting, and a stones throw from Horse Guards. It is so peaceful, and calming. A lovely lake and a nearby cafe. It's so hard to believe that you are right in the centre of London. Also Buckingham Palace is a short distance, and is picturesque standing from one of two bridges. A highly recommended place, especially in the summer months.
a walk to the palace. in the way to Buckingham palace and a nice place to relax and enjoy the nature , birds , lake and squirrels

Bird lovers welcome. I am a bird lover and this park has birds! A great place to bring children and the view of Buckingham is great. Even on rainy days there are benches under trees to help with the wet.

Lovely very large park . A good place to chill, walk or even jog!!We chilled and really enjoyed some time away from the city noise and hustle and bustle, you can buy refreshments within the park and again is a great place to take pics this park would be enjoyed by all ages, does not matter how long you spend here as within the first few minutes you would of chilled

Perfect walk between Big Ben and Buckingham Palace.. It's still early in Spring but you can already see flowers and hundreds of animals in the park. They are not afraid of visitors at all apparently and are very at ease if you take a picture at them.

Great to relax and stop for a break.. Worth a walk through to admire the beauty and peace within a very busy london city... waters lovely but shame that the lawns and grass do not get as much attention.

A stroll through the park. Our second day in London we decided to have a walk through the park. It was beautiful, the sun was shining, and the daffodils were in bloom. Lots of interesting wildfowl to look at also. We had a coffee in the cafe there and sat outside overlooking the lake. One of the waitresses asked me if I wanted a blanket to keep warm. I declined but it was nice to be thought of. Will definitely revisit on our next trip.

Take a relaxing stroll through this Royal park. Always calm and relaxing. These royal parks are some of the finest in the world. Lots of beautiful flowers (bulbs) blooming in March. The wildlife..ducks, geese, squirrels, etc....all will come up to you. Watch out for the squirrels, if they think you have food, they will jump right up on your shoulder...very funny things!

The perfect refugee in the middle of the city. This park is enjoyable for a walk and where you can interact with the famous squirels and ducks. By the time we visit the water was frozen so it's was funny to see the birds slide on the ice.
Experience spring in the park!. As coming from Sweden, it is fantastic to experience early spring in London in St. James's Park. Daffodils everywhere..so pretty.
Great to check out gefore the changing of the guards. There are so many Beautiful ducks and swans floating around. Beautiful landscaping. A paradise for birdwatchers.

Beautiful park near Westminster, Buckingham Palace and Picadilly.. A great little (well, compared to Hyde Park) little spot. One of the many wonderful green spaces in London. Walking through St James is my favorite way to get from Westminster to Piccadilly.

regulr visitor. this is an oasis of calm in the centre of the city. It is beautifully laid out and contains a lovely lake with abundant bird life and also a decent restaurant and plenty of seating areas to watch the world go by. All tis within walking distance of Buckingham Palace and Westminster

Not just a walk in the park. Lovely walking or picnic area. A true green space in the city. The Horse Guards changing of the Guard is wonderful with the costumes and pageantry the British do so well. (I can say this with pride as my family is British).

Gorgeous Park with lovely birds. Perfect break for a day of touristing in Westminster. My sister said you had to take a picture of a squirrel? We did, still don't know why. The park is beautiful and peaceful. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the ducks, swans, pelican. Lovely!

Don't Miss if You are in the Neighborhood. If you visit the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, Westminster Abbey or Buckingham Palace carve out time to walk through the park. The park is usually full of lovely seasonal flowers and birds, and it is great for people watching.

If I Had a Botle of Wine, Two Folding Chairs, a Folding Table, and Someone Special to Share It With. No lie here people. Middle of the bridge, middle of the park, after dark, look away from the Palace. Dark...but trust me.

Fit for a Queen. London is a city of parks, some enormous, some tiny. St James is near the smaller end but towards the top, I might go as far as at the top. It lies in front of Buckingham Palace and is quintessentially English. Exactly the sort of picture postcard park I'd want outside my throne. Even the ducks on the pond are particularly pretty. Go on a sunny day, sit in a deck chair, eat an ice cream and you will be in a heaven as seen by a Brit.

Do not feet pelicans. Than we noticed this statement, we spend some time to find birds, we should not feed and finally there they are - but at that time we were completely out of bread, because there are hundreds of other birds.
Nice and calm place. Very nice and calm place to visit. Can spend a whole day if you have time. Very good park and its a must see place in London.

A nice park.. A very nice park espescially in the spring. A very nice lake in the Middle with some different birds. There is a lot of squirrels that is not so afraid of you, they are very interested If you have anything to eat. Very nice park.

A nice park at the heart of london. The park is teeming with wildlife like birds and squirrels. You can take a rest here after visiting the other tourist hotspots nearby like The Buckingham Palace and Big Ben.

I've enjoyed it very much. I did like it, but I prefer Hyde park.
I was here the whole day and didn't saw even one flamingo.
If you're a flamingo-lover like myself, I would recommend you skipping this one and just going to Hyde Park.
nice walks. nice walks . lots to see . stop and feed a squirrel , but remember that they do bite if you annoy them ..
Lovely London Park. Another lovely park in London, nearby and connecting Westminster and Buckingham palace, has a small pond full of aquatic birds and really nice grass to relax during the summer

My favourite London Park. There is nothing more I live in my days off than getting the tube into town and wondering through St James's Park. It's a tranquil getaway from the hustle and bustle of busy London. Plus it's the only place that I've ever been to in the world where you can hand feed the wild Squirrels. Handy tip - Take some nuts, seeds or Berries with you.
Lovely!. Such a nice park, right nearby Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square. Lovely pond, makes a great summer walk. (Though the deck chairs cost money so be wary!)

Lovely Park in a Convenient Location. This adorable park is located between two very important locations for the tourists: The Buckingham Palace and The Horse Guards Parade. It means there's no excuses to miss it. You can seat here to relax a little during a day walking by the city. There are a lot of ducks, birds and squirrels that are very friendly and used to the humans, it's so adorable! There are a lot of spots to make beautiful pictures and enjoy the view.
Lovely Place. Always lovely to stroll through St, James's Park in a good weather.Sit down to watch the birds in the ponds and relax.
Lovely place in the heart of London. I love coming here with friends or solo it's a great place to just hang in the summer or walk around the beautiful gardens. Also the pelican show is a touch.
Perfect for a strool. Perfect to go for a stroll if the weather is nice.even better if you have some kids with you.lots of birds to watch and you feel calm in the middel of the city buzz
Just beautiful!. It´s an amazing park, with beautiful trees, lake, etc. You can enjoy a nice walk or just relax sitting on the grass and appreciating the view.

Lovely all year round. love this park, Spring. summer autumn and Winter.
Lovely picturesque views, gets busy in Summer, in Spring you can see all the ducks with their little ducklings swimming up the pond. Beware of the Geese!!! lovely for a picnic weather permitting
Tranquility in the city. Take the time to wonder through this beautiful garden so tranquil one cannot believe you are in the city

Wonderful park in Central London. Such a picturesque park in the centre of London. Stand on the petite bridge and get a fabulous view of Bucdkingham Palace many then turn around to see the wonderful view of Horseguards Parade and the back drop of central London including at its best There's a great variety of birds including the famous Pelicans! I also love the versitity of people there. 'Suited and booted' working people along with families and tourist alike. It's worth visiting the cafe there also where there is a variety of food available.

All time favorite park in London. Favorite park for so many reasons: the VIEW, the cafe in the middle, the proximity to other landmarks, the animals and everything! Very close to Buckingham Palace, Big Ben/Westminster Abbey. Makes very a very nice walk

Tranquility. One thing is true about London's parks - they are all beautiful and well maintained. This is especially true for St. Jame's Park.I would recommend this to anyone visiting London. Take some left-over bread from home (or hotel) and feed the ducks.A nice way to wind down one's day after a busy sightseeing schedule.

Perfect place to walk around with all the animals. We didnt plan to go there but Google Map led us there as we were going to the Buckingham Palace. Although, we didnt get to the Buckingham palace on the expected time as we enjoyed St. James Park a lot. At first, didnt plan to walk in but saw swans, duck and squirrels so yeh just wanted to stop by couple minutes. The squirrels were very friendly (or maybe greedy) as they not afraid of human at all and tried to asked for food. They claimed up my leg as I offered them a piece of bread. They were so cute. There are other animals as well, so if you like animals and nature, should not miss it.
feeding the pelicans. Feeding the pelicans 2.30, have amazing are they. Went with family children and grandchildren, feed the ducks, sit and take in the fun had by them.
Worth a walk. A beautiful park with a wide range of wildlife in a central location. Go here before or after the Changing of the Guards
Beautiful . One of my favourite parks in a city of parks. Lots of cool shady areas to relax in the sun or enjoy feeding the geese. Well looked after and only 2 mins from trafalgar square.

A good place for a break while touring the area attactions. It is just a park with ponds and locals come to feed the birds, ducks, and what have you. Good place to take a break if you are in the area, and keep on walking after doing so :)

Spring time stroll. Took a stroll through the park on our way to an event. So lucky with the weather, daffodils and all the lovely coloured Spring blooms on show, ducks, geese and swans larking about and everyone in such good spirits.

Very nice park with a great variety of plant and animal life. This was very pretty, even in mid-March, before the leaves are out on the trees. Lots of blooming flowers, nice landscaping, and a great quantity of birds.

One the lesser known London parks. The majority of friends that come to London, especially those from overseas don't know about St James's Park, which is surprising considering its position - opposite Buckingham Palace.It's a lovely park, albeit on the smaller size of London parks, but has a very pretty pond in the centre of it and some lovely views up to the Palace.I would highly recommend everyone have a walk through it on their way back into the centre, or on their way to the Palace, especially in the Summer months.

A very lively park. I love walking through here. Its a great connection between Big Ben/Parliment area to Buckingham Palace. Every time I come through I see a different animal. There are an abundance of swans and ducks. The Pelicans are quite big. There's black swans and once I saw a fox run through.

Beautiful park. I visited London in November 2015 and had a chance to swing by St James Park. It is full of wildlife, but beware that the squirrels are much braver than they are in NYC and will come right up to you begging for food.
Amazing.... I sometimes get off the tube just to have a morning stroll through this park! It is a great walk from the embankment station. Lovely and enjoyable space in central London.

A real gem!. Had the sun shining so everything of course looks better, but even so, this park is quite stunning. It's simple and tranquil, well maintained and very relaxing.The views, contrasts, wildlife, layout and just the fact that it's right in the centre of London!Let down was the cafe, which I felt was messy looking and uninviting. But perhaps another time, just to get the balcony views if nothing else!

Be aware for the Pelican. In the early hours of the morning, just after sunrise, the park was a glorious place to sit down, observing the birds as you through some breadcrumbs between them. The public restroom costed me 20 pence, to my suprise it was relatively clean and heated. Which was nice as it was around 5 degrees Celsius outside. Walking around the park I noticed a, what I first thought, a swan on steroids. It turned out to be a Pelican. A bizarre thing to witness but certainly interesting. The park as a whole is nicely appointed and layer out. A good place to relaxe and unwind from the hustle and bustle of the metropole.

Little gem!. It's one of the most beautiful and cozy parks in central London. Minutes walk for buzzing Piccadilly it is a quiet, peaceful, green space to relax with a cup of coffee (there's a cafe right in the park) or feed the birds. Amazing!
Unique architecture. Worth walking over , even if you don't visit the engine room. Distinctive iconic structure of London

Lovely and quiet. I was on the way from Baker street to King's Cross station and found this amazing park. It's quiet and beautiful, has a lovely lake with an amazing view. And everything is blossoming out there - so inspiring. Perfect for walking, reading, relaxing, sport...

The birds!. I love this park, i often go walking here i my lunch break. good for kids, or for a date. The wildlife is really plentiful. I see squirrels, geese and ducks pretty much every time. There are also massive and i mean MASSIVE pelicans and herons. Saw the Pelicans last week. There is a lovely sit in cafe as well as outside pitstops for food and toilets.

Beautiful. For me London was just a concrete jungle but after this awesome 10 days in London I was happy to see the natural beauty is still preserved along with historic places.St James park is one of the beautiful place to spend some time relaxing in hot summer afternoon.We passed this place while moving around some attractions and felt St James park itself is very beautiful with many tourist and local people stroll around and enjoy.Highly recommended if you are walking around to explore London
lovely walk. we walked throught the park to get to the next attraction, a very nice park and nature, liked the little lake. lovely for a walk
Stunning. Such a beautiful park to stroll through on a sunny day. Always something going and lovely to have a picnic and people watch.
Good park to relax. As the other parks in London, this is very nice to relaxed little and may be, enjoy a good lunch under the sun... if you get lucky as I was...

Park with views. The daffodils are out and gives the park some colour. Nice walks at your leisure drinks are in the park .Look out for the cheeky squirrels always after food .Nice views of Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards .

stunning oasis in the middle of the city. one of my all time favorite park come rain or shine its so beautiful in the summer but if we get snow it is just stunning.one of the must visit places when you are in London,

A Delightful City Respite. Managed to stroll through the park by accident, walking back from the Army and Navy Club to the hotel I was staying in. What a wonderful oasis in the city! Look forward to walking thru the park on a future visit.
A great place to stroll and enjoy the scenery. London has many great parks all worth visiting for the plants, scenery, wildlife and serenity. St James Park is one of the many worth visiting.

Worth a visit. A nice walk with an incredible collection of wildlife. I never thought I was interested in birds but found myself taking pictures of all kinds. They were beautiful! It's a good walk up to Buckingham Palace and is better than walking along the street.
Peace in the city. Whenever we visit London we always walk through this lovely park. At this time of year it is wonderful to see the spring bulbs in flower.
Very Unique. We were crossing the park to go to covent Garden and loved it ,we stayed there for quite some time . we sat down and watched the ducks and swans and its very calming

Unbelievable array of wildlife especially birds. Loved the park, so many different birds who aren't particularly concerned with humans being close to them, loads of friendly squirrels begging for food, and nice grounds to walk through.

Out for a long walk in London. Want a quiet area in London for a walk and you might even see a giraffe as it runs alongside London Zoo. It also takes you from Baker Street area over to Camden both nice areas.

Lovely oasis in London.. Took a short but pleasant stroll around this Park Today. It is busy but people tend not to be in such a hurry as the rest of the City. Well kept with wildfowl to look at and flowers. Worth a visit when in the area.
Nice. Nothing to sat really,one of many london parks , all immaculate and perfect for a walk on a wintery day .park is adjacent to Buckingham palace and has a pond with some wildlife
Lovely and peaceful. On a lovely day this park is gorgeous. Lakes with swans etc. Places to have coffee and food as well. Very central. Acces to West End. Within reach of central London on foot

Nice stroll around. There isa big contrast to St James park and neighbouring Green Park both have their charm. St James has the lake with many large birds including pelicans living there.Entering from The MallBy Buckingham Palace a gentle pace takes you down to Horseguards and Westminster for further Exploring. The Gardens always have seasonal Flowers so always colourful.

Relaxing gem of park in Central London. I have known and loved this park since I was in my 20's and now retired I still am drawn to coming back. It holds many memories for me, especially of the former park keeper who in the 1970's was in charge of the famous Pelicans, Paul being his favourite, and the star of the lake. I loved to watch him feed them with raw fish. Today it is a much busier park than it used to ever be, but it still has charm and is worth a visit, especially as you can easily get to many of the capital's attractions in no time from strolling through it, and on a bright morning it will set you up for the day ahead.
Lovely at any time of year. Beautiful and peaceful park for a lunchtime walk. The best attraction from my point of view is the views if many well known buildings fro a different side.Lovely lake
just beautiful. walk, run, sit or combine - one can enjoy them all. beautifully maintained - nature in the middle of a busy city.

A walk on the wildside. We walked through the park several times during our stay in London. It was wonderful to see Pelicans, swans, several different species of geese and ducks, rook, crows and many other birds as well as squirrels all next to were you are walking..The crocuses and daffodils were delightful and seeing the trees coming into bud made you think of Spring. A great way to walk in London.
Serene and Gorgeous. My favorite park in London. Its quiet and serene. With lots greenery, fancy flowers, old trees and running water its a piece of paradise in central city of London.

My favourite park. I live 20 mins walk from this park and I love to go every day. I try to go before all the tourists arrive (after 9pm) with their massive groups of French and Italian school children, this place is an oasis. The gardeners are superb. Money is no object hereThe ducks, swans, moor hens, herons, flamingos, coots, etc are wonderfulThe planting is amazingThe facilities are food and Inn the Park is wonderfulI could not love this park more

Our favorite spot in London. Were in London for two days and spend time at St. James's park on both days. We love watching the huge variety of water-fowl, even in February, and seeing all types of people interacting with nature in the middle of a wonderful city.
Beautiful. We walked through the park on the way to Buckingham Palace and it was beautiful. Highly recommend for a daily outing or family trip.

Love observing the English in their parks. I always remember being somewhat scandalised when I saw workers in the City making for the nearest park in summer and virtually stripping off and lying face up worshipping the sun. When lunch hour was over, they would put on their shirts, do up their trousers and go back to work all sweaty. It is no different in this park. So always something to look at in St James at any time of year and in the different seasons. Londoners are very lucky to have so many well tended parks - I hope they really appreciate them.
Like an oasis in the middle of the city. I feel relaxed whenever I visit this park. It is like an oasis in the middle of the city. The environment is really great.
I walk by it every day . I live next door and I have to walk across to go to work, such a beautiful place, very nice, very clean, quiet as well.

One of my favourite parks... . An often overlooked Park compared to Hyde and Regents Park, but just a lovely feel and setting. Worth a visit just to see the pelicans which look bizarre in a London Park. In summer, get a deck chair or lie on the grass and relax in between your sightseeing.
Magical. This park is out of a storybook! There are so many animals and plant life! We lived walking through there!! Don't miss it!

Pretty park - super friendly squirrels. Although from an adult perspective this is a fairly normal pretty London park. I took some children here whilst I was a nanny and they really enjoyed it. After seeing the 'Queen's house' we wandered through the park and found a nice children's playground with a cafe attached to it. Also the children loved how friendly the squirrels are (the kids were three and six years) and some of the squirrels will let you hand feed them which they found exciting. If with small children I would take them again!

Very Relaxing. In London there are many parks that are very peaceful and a good break from the bustle. There are lots of waterfowl who are not afraid to come up to you and the largest fig trees I have ever seen.
Best Park. What a great park to visit in the middle of London with so much wild life you even see the odd Guardsman cutting threw the park from Wellington Barracks to St James Palace
Beautiful park!. Walked from the changing of the guard towards Churchill war rooms. What a delight to walk this scenic park with friends!

Beautiful animals. A lovely place to visit when you want to chill or hang out with someone. It's a nice park to get away from the rural environment and to forget that you are actually in one of the biggest, busiest cities in the world.
Nice relaxing day. Enjoyed nice walk through park. Birds and ducks were fun to watch. Beautiful landscape. Pleasant couple hours.
Memorial Walk. Clean clear and memorable. Everything me up through the park and remember.... Reflect. Great route to/from Buck Pal, nicer than the road route!

Where my heart is.... I love this part so much so I can talk about it for hours and won't stop. It's the most calming place on Earth. So beautiful, so nice, so pleasant to walk in. I love the flowers and the squirrels! Couples kissing at the pond, children playing with the birds ... All you need is this place and some good music. The latter is not necessary though because you will feel the music of your soul out there. It can't be otherwise. I want to go back. A thousand times more.

Fantastic at the moment. Do not walk on the bulbs please!. The park will soon be looking at its Spring best with masses of daffodils and crocuses. The bridge across the lake is the favourite spot for photos and there are usually pelicans at the east end of the lake though maybe only when the weather is warmer?When walking through the other day I saw children playing football with their mother on the crocuses. This is very foolish and selfish so please allow the flowers to survive so other people can see them and the hours spent by the gardening staff are not wasted.

An oasis of calm in the heart of London. the Park is midway between our home and the nespresso shop. So that we can point out the Pelicans as we go to top up on our capsules. Avoid the summer when the place is packed but amble in the middle of winter: as the sun sets behind Buck House around mid afternoon, catch a glimpse of calm and rest in the middle of the hubbub of London Town.
Charming park. Very beautiful park inside London, with wonderful colors even in a rainy day. We took pictures of lovely flowers and waterfowl.

See the Pelicans. As you walk into St James Park you will find all paths lead on to Serpentine lake with loads of waterfowl and people feeding them, as you continue around the lake you will see the Pelicans.A very nice Park and a good day out for the family and kids.

Lovely. Spending my lunch hour here, fantastic in the summer, football and friends. Can't drink alcohol due to bylaws. Great Lake, with Pelicans that WILL show you that they own the path haha.Fantastic view from the bridge over the water of Buckingham place and behind you Horseguards Parade.

Romantic . St James park is so relaxing on a sunny afternoon.It's tranquil, romantic and everything you would ever want from a park.Lots of people having picnics together or strolling hand in hand.Lovely afternoon

Great open space. Go for a leisurely stroll around this park when the sun is shining and you will be really impressed. It is a great green space in between Buckingham Palace and Horseguards Parade. Walk around the lake to see an amazing amount of wildlife.

Beautiful park! . Start at Westminster Abbey and then walk to Buckingham Palace through the park. The park was beautiful and there is a little bridge/Boardwalk that you can see the London Eye at your back and Buckingham Palace directly in front. It's a magnificent scene!

One of the most beautiful parks. As it is just around the corner from the Buckingham palace, it is not a surprise, that at every time of the year it looks stunning. One of the most beautiful parks in London.It is not very big, so on sunny days gets extremely busy with tourists, so if you are seeking for peace and relax.. Maybe better to get to the Kensington Gardens or move a bit to a Green Park
Beautiful. Great place to relax and walk. We traveled through the park after visiting the Churchill War Rooms and finished our walk at Buckingham a Palace. Beautiful day in London. May, 2015.

Wonderful Place!. I love St Jame's Park. There is so much around it, such as Buckingham Palace, Horseguards, Wellington barracks - to name just a few, and yet, it is a haven of wildlife. The water fowl are great to see - everything from mallards to pelicans!
Autumn Visit. A beautiful park with friendly squirrels who will hand feed. A lovely walk through landscaped grounds with a lake and wildlife. Very enjoyable way to escape the city for a while.
Great free open space. Wonderful green space in London great for walking round or through. Ducks to feed in the large pond. Horse riders passing through and even horse guards

Beautiful areas. We walked several paths through this park and each area is as beautiful as the next. We visited London in February, so I can only imagine how spectacular the park must be in the summer.

Peaceful. Even on a cold January day,it is so much enjoyable to walk in this park and enjoy the fresh air. When you need to have some rest,you can sit in one of the banks and feed the ducks there. It's a walking distance from Piccadilly Circus, Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square.

A Hidden Gem. Situated just close to the Buckingham Palace , wow what a beautiful park . Very peaceful to stroll around or relax in the garden. there are many birds, duck in the park which are a joy to watch. Very beautiful place to take pictures.

Beautiful and free!. London can be so incredibly expensive, even with a strong US Dollar. But a walk through St James is a wonderful exception to an otherwise exceedingly expensive tourist destination. Close to Buckingham, Parliament, Big Ben, etc.

Beautiful park away from the hustle and bustle. We walked through St James's Park on a recent visit to London. It was a beautiful break from the busy City, yet within walking distance of the City and Buckingham Palace. The daffodils were in full bloom and stunning. There are many different species of ducks and water fowl, plenty of squirrels and the whole area has a relaxed feel. Well worth a visit.

Lovely park. This is one of the most beautiful parks in London. There are sol many different types of birds and ducks. And the squirrels are so cute. Take with u some peanuts and feed them. You will enjoy the experience. It's very relaxing park.

An oasis in the city. We love St. James Park because it's a pleasure to spend some quiet peaceful time in the heart of the busy city. Located on the Mall very near Buckingham Palace, it's easy to get to from the area where we usually stay. With the lovely gardens, the pond, the wildlife and the walkways it's a great place to visit. We often get a lunch at a nearby restaurant or take out and enjoy a little picnic.

Birdcage Walk and St. James's Park. Often walk from Victoria to Trafalgar Square via St. James's Park. This last visit as often before via Birdcage Walk which has the Guards Museum and Center on it. It was a beautiful day and the park was well kept. It was half term so there were children enjoying it along with office worker and tourists. Apart from having to dodge a few selfy mad tourists all seamed as it should be. The ducks are always quite impressive; living up to the surroundings.
Serenity now. I've always liked this one, very tranquil in the middle of the bust city ending at Buck House. It can be a bit crowded at times but it always seems restful and elegant.
A Beautiful Park. Another iconic and stunning park in London. Beautiful views and scenery throughout the park, with wonderful views and wildlife . Highly recommended .

Picnic . Amazing take the kids it doesn't feel like your in London at all it beautiful and you never know what famous faces you will see ice creams are very expensive but worth the price I'd advise take a blanket let the kids run around and enjoy
Park . One of londons historic royal parks is the official entrance to Buckingham palace has a lovely pond and surrounded by beautiful historical buildings
Relaxing stroll in the park. to get a little break from the busy London Streets... sit and have a snack and watch the birdies....

Green Walk. Lovely green walk right in between The Houses of Parliament and Buckingham Palace. Pleasant away from the hustle and bustle of the city and with lots of wildlife including Squirrels, pigeons, and Velociraptors.
Beautiful park in the heart of the city. Very beautiful park and the lake inside. Kids will like it. Very neat and well maintained. Easy access from tube stations.

Nice park in front of Buckingham palace.. We strolled thru this park on our last day in London to take in the scenic grounds. English garden style landscaping, ponds, and a variety of birds were abundant. A nice place to get in touch with nature in the middle of one of the world's great cities.

Beautiful view from the bridge in the middle!. A lot of tourists, but great park.
Beautiful photo pop from the bridge in the middle.
Lots of cute benches to sit and read or watch the world go by

One of my favorite place in London. It is really a nice park! The first day I ever visited London, I went there with my friend and a squirrel ran between my legs! It is clean and full of cute animals which makes people happy and nicer. The only thing that is a bit bad is that there's no light at night (but I think it's normal in London since there's no light in Hyde Park aswell)
Great relaxing place very special. Take a picnic and a ball or just relax in a deckchair this is a fantastic place right next to the palace.
Evening Walk. We walked through the park in early evening. It was a beautiful walk, with lots of cyclist and families walking together. I felt safe and comfortable throughout!
squirrels everywere. The park itself is just a park, norhing special. What makes it special ?Location and the squirrels. Very cute

Excellent. Great day out. Good value for ticket price. Need to go through security first. Great, friendly guide, very informative. Would definitely recommend. Took teenage children who also enjoyed this attraction very much.
Beautiful park. We visited for the Ride London event so the park was bustling and lively. It is a beautiful park with a variety of landscapes and great to watch people go by.

Beautiful & Safe park. It is by far the most beautiful and safest park I have come across. It is lush green with water fountains and shops to eat. It is spacious and has a variety of species for flora. What's more is that it is in walking vicinity of Buckingham palace, Westminster Abbey, Big Ben and London Eye. It is also just one station away from the coach/bus station. Nearest tube stations include Westminster and James street.Ideal for short/medium/long term travellers, children and peopel travelling to Victoria coach station or from the same.

Wonderful to find a bit of peace while Changing of the Guard had a lull in the proceedings. If you're going to Changing of the Guard, don't rush up to the palace gates, you won't see anything. Instead, stand on the mall opposite Buckingham Palace right by the footpath into St James' park. Once the band etc have marched past, at around 11.30 you can take yourselves down into the cool quiet of St James' park , get yourself a tea/coffee and feed the birds. If you've got any energy left in your legs take a stroll over the footbridge and you'll get wonderful views towards Horseguards and Buckingham Palace. Then, just before midday, go back to your spot opposite the palace and see the bands etc leave. You'll be perfectly placed to march along with them back to the barracks if you like.

Lovely park with lots of wildlife.. Lots of birds here, including pelicans and a heron, as well as various ducks and geese. Toilets do cost 20p though so make sure you have some change! Looked beautiful with the early spring and all the dafodils out.

A Lovely Walk!. We did a lovely walk through Horse Guards Parade over to St James's Park. The walk through the park is great, lots of wild life around the ponds and Spring creeping in everywhere. Walked through the park up to Buckingham Palace and then up through Green Park. All thoroughly enjoyable as it was a lovely day weather-wise.
Green. Wonderful with the daffodils in bloom. The park offers a moment to relax in a very lively city. Great

Beautiful tranquil park. This park is centrally located, it's not too big and it has a small lake with a variety of wildlife including a big pelican. It's well kept and on my last visit I saw the most beautiful colourful daffodils!

Chilly winter day. Even in the winter it is fun to stroll through the park and look back on the treasury building and the city. The swans are still there and people feed them but watch out for your fingers getting nipped!

Great stop to rest, take in nature, or eat a picnic lunch while sightseeing. We enjoyed walking through this lovely park on our way to Buckingham Palace. It was a peaceful respite from the hustle and bustle of Piccadilly and White Hall. We also enjoyed a picnic lunch here. Great for the kids to run off some energy, watch the ducks and eat some sandwiches. Loved seeing the spring blooms in February, knowing back home was covered in snow!
Beautiful. Lovely to walk around an oasis in the middle of a bustling city. On the way there we were lucky to see the red soldiers on horses. Very fitting with the surroundings.
water and gardens an tranquility. enjoy a stroll by the lake and stop and smell the roses. Lovely gardens to walk around or just hire a dick chair and watch the world go by

Lovely afternoons spent here. Love St James Park. Beautiful views of the palace. Great to sit for a picnic. There is a lovely kids playground which kept my two occupied for a good 2 hours. Would recommend.
Summer time bliss in the capital . I love this park have visited many times and it's so beautiful. A haven from the busy streets of London. I love the water features too.

I love a visit to St James park.. Ever since I was a child I've loved St James park and we were there yestday in the February sunshine looking at the daffodils flowering in the borders as we walked along towards Buckingham Palace.There is plenty of wildlife about and some very tame squirrels !It's a lovely park and it's free.
Amazing view. Here is another excellent site. It is a must during your visit to London. Everything is so clean and pristine. So very impressed with everyone and their hospitality.

One of London`s Best Parks. This has to be one of London`s best parks its just so lovely and just so well kept to, there are so fantastic great views of Buckingham Place great for photos. As you walk around there`s plenty of wild life on the water and there are plenty of seating to.

St Jame's Park- Blessed with fantastic January Weather. On a weekend trip to London it was nice to relax, explore and walk in such beautiful open spaces. We were blessed with fantastic weather for January and enjoyed the well maintained gardens and birds in the park.

The most beautiful park in London. I have loved wandering through St James' Park since I studied in London in the late 1970s. It is atmospheric and takes you on a wonderful walk along The Mall to Buckingham Palace and then along Bird Cage Walk to Horseguards Parade at the other end. In the centre of London it offers an oasis of peace and I never tire of it.

Great Park to Stroll Through. I went during a time when the Buckingham Palace was not open to the public so I decided to enjoy my time in this nearby park instead. It was gorgeous and green and if I had thought ahead I would have grabbed a blanket and food to really enjoy the rare sunny day out there.
Brilliant. Have a wander, jump between world famous attractions be the other parks.Wildlife amazing, especially the Pelicans and all the other birds.

Peacefully and beautiful . St Jame's Park is a pleasant change from the hustle and bustle of my London streets. It's a beautiful place to get a coffee from one of the refreshment stands and sit watching the world go by - this kind of thing may not be for everyone but is certainly a lovely place to walk though on your way around London.
Relax from the City. Walking around the St Jame's Park make you forget that you are in the middle of a big city like London.Relax and enjoy the walk around the park.

Great walk to kill some spare time. If you have some time when you are in London take a stroll aroung St James Park, and enjoy Horseguards Parade and Buckingham Palace as part of that. It's a level walk in beautiful surroundings. You could be forgiven for forgetting that you are in the middle of London. There are lots of animals that will gladly accompany you such as Squirrels, Ducks, Swans & Geese. Take some bread and give them a treat too

Bring some nuts with you !!. This is my favourite park because of blue bridge known to MI6 spies. Apparently here is where they meed to exchange files :-)The park has plenty of cheeky squirrels that will eat from your hand if you tempt them with nuts. There are also swans and other fauna. It is stunning.
Squirrels!. I saw my first ever wild squirrel in this beautiful park. It's just another nice green spot of London tucked away near Buckingham Palace

Nature in the city. What a lovely one level park to wonder through there is a river with a bridge lots of ducks,swans ,geese and squirrels who are so friendly and love you to feed them . Giving the perfect opportunity for wildlife photos . The Mall runs alongside so Buckingham Palace is also accessible another good place for photos . We had a crisp bright sunny morning and the daffodils were spectacular .

Animals are too confident its great!. Squirrels will climb your leg for food, love how they are so confident and friendly. Which then makes people even more friendly & willing to chat. I always make so many new friends when I go there.
Great park!. st james's park is just beautiful.Take your friends and a family for a nice sunday out.You can enjoy the nature, the water and rent a deck chair hourly to relax

Beautiful spring afternoon. We walked through St. James' Park on a lovely April afternoon enjoying the spring daffodils. Apparently the squirrels are very tame and a gentlemen gave my children peanuts to feed the squirrels. This was something a lot of other folks were doing so we enjoyed ourselves and watched the squirrels eat the nuts. The park was exceptionally crowded since it was Easter weekend and the park lent itself to great people-watching. It was a great place for the kids to run off some steam and plenty to keep them occupied. There is also a very nice children's playground across from Buckingham Palace that the kids loved. They were able to play and make friends easily in the short time they were there. A really nice location for parents to rest and let kids enjoy themselves.

Hidden Oasis. Not nearly as well known as the other London parks and tucked away behind Horseguard's Parade, this is definitely worth a visit. It's small enough to easily be able to walk round it's entirety or as a stop-off on your way to visit one of London's tourist attractions such as Buckingham Palace or Horseguard's Parade. The restaurant and cafe have a good choice of food and drinks and in the Summer they even have bean bags on the lawn, so you can sit and enjoy your drinks in comfort or you can sit up on the roof terrace and admire the views. The gardens are beautiful and well-maintained, as you would expect.
Picnic heaven . Great place to visit in good weather, however, gets very busy with both tourists and office workers, best avoid lunch times if possible

Lovely. St Jame's Park is a great place to come out of the bustle of London and enjoy a bit of quiet and some birds. The waterfowl there were super impressive and I enjoyed the whole experience. Getting to the end and arriving at Buckingham Palace is super fun as well, this is a place I recommend.

a peaceful oasis in central London. Wether its the daffodils in spring or lunch at the cafe in summer, this really is a lovely place to escape from shopping, sightseeing and the general hustle and bustle.
Walking around the London parks. London parks are so special, green areas in a buzzing city. So close to the sights and amazing scenery. Only a stones throw from Buckingham palace and Westminster.

Lovely setting in the centre of London.. Definitely worth straying round corner from Houses of Parliament, St Stephens Tower (Big Ben), Whitehall and Westminster Abbey. Lovely walk around pond with ducks, swans, herons and pelicans with views of Horse Guards and Buckingham Palace. Nice walk up to Palace then along The Mall to Trafalgar Square. Stop for a coffee and cake in the centre of park.

Beautiful. This really is a beautiful park to walk around and can be accessed via varying parts of the area.
It has a lovely cafe where you can pick up a coffee or a snack and plenty of benches to take in the various views.
On hot summer days there are deck chairs that can be rented too.
A Nice Walk. It an enjoyable park in the heart of London. The only drawback is the large crowds. It gets you away from the traffic and is close to the major attractions.
Lovely Park. Well spread out park within access to all top London places of interest from Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square, Big Ben, Westminster, Parliament, Chinatown (Leicester Sq).
Quite and clean. A quiet and healthy place to visit the heart of London. Squirrels, ducks and other birds, a pleasure to watch all in their natural environment.

So relaxing. The hugest squirrels I ever saw. Simply beautiful.
Spawns, ducks and a lot of differents animals....
Wonderful park. We visit it during a rainy day but not even that spoils the experience. It's a nice park and the squirrels are always ready to welcome you.
Lovey . Nice we Park to take a walk throw. Plenty of benches walking throw if you need a five min rest in this fast city.

beautiful but freezing cold in winter!. Would've loved to sit at the park benches to take in the atmosphere, away from the bustling city, but it was 2 degrees and drizzling and way too cold. Reckon it would be amazing in spring!

A quiet place in London!. St. James' Park is great to go for a picnic or just take a break from the London chaos in its surroundings. During all my visits, I have found the park surprisingly serene.
In a couple occasions I have taken my 7 year old niece who was thrilled about the animals and overall scenery. She enjoyed the park too.

lovely. A nice place to have a peaceful afternoon stroll or a good morning jog. We went to this place unexpectedly. I was not aware of this place hehe but my kind cousin led us there to enjoy the scenery. This place is lovely.
Beautiful park. We were lucky to have sunny part of the day in this beautiful park.Green and beautiful, got special energy. Love it!
Do you like birds?. I was fascinated with this lovely and lively garden, but my friend was freaked out because she is a bird-phobic.
Nice for a stroll. Popular with locals and well placed next to Buckingham Palace the park is the perfect place for a stroll around its central lake or a picnic in summer.
On the way to Buckingham Palace. Its good to have a walk there before you go to Buckingham Palace for the Guard Changing. Very peaceful and comfortable.

Simply Beautiful. Simply beautiful
Go and have a wander or even better enjoy a run around the park (best to go late in the day to avoid the crowds)
Amazing to think such beauty is inside such a busy and manic city like London

sooo pretty. St James's park alway revives my soul
the lake and water streams are calming the trees are old and full of life the architecture surrounding the par are gorgeous
I just love London and its beauties

St James's Park. I love this park. On a sunny Thursday afternoon in February Mid-winter??) the park was packed with visitors from all over the world, many of them just strolling through. The lake was well populated with many different species of birds. Other attractions nearby such as Horse Guards Parade, Whitehall and the Houses of Parliament are but a short walk away.On a dry day St James Park really should not be missed AND of course it's free!

Squirrels. My children love to stroll through St. Jame´s Park on the way to or from Buckingham Palace. We try to remember to bring peanuts and feed the squirrels (this is the highlight for them). Its a lovely place to sit down with your take away lunch in the warmer months
Great walk. I came here for a walk in the winter. I really liked people watching and the atmosphere of the park . Ill be back to walk again!

Peace & quiet. Inside the park you just would not believe you were in the middle of London. So peaceful, tranquil and relaxing, perfect for a stroll, picnic or chilling with friends & family. Love it.
LOVELY PARK NEXT TO BUCKINGHAM PALACE. If you're going to Buckiungham Palace, it's worth a stroll through this park. Lots of swans, ducks, and geese on the pond.
Relax in the nature. Amazing park, with a lot of walking paths to go with your family, your friends or your lover! Take some bread with you to feed the animals, and get pictures with them :]]
Surprising. cIty wildlife more interesting than a London zoo. Love that the park is there, unfortunately it is not peacefull as crowds are everywhere.

A lovely place in the centre of London. This is a lovely walk when you are heading to Buckingham Palace from Big Ben, House of Parliament etc. Past the Duck Island Cottage with its beautiful little garden then on to the Horse Guards and then Buck Palace. Lots of pigeons in the park as well.
Lovely walk. . The walk through St. James's Park was lovely. There was lots to see and was a beautiful day. Would be very lovely for families with children as well to visit.

Well tended park. Visited on a Saturday. Weather wasn't great but there were still lots of tourists walking through the park. There are good views from the central bridge (the Blue Bridge) to the east, towards Horse Guards Parade - and to the west towards Buckingham Palace. Walking through the park you can see swans and pelicans - and if you are lucky you may see the the guards riding their horses.
Enjoy the stroll. On a nice sunny day or even on a cold crisp day there can be fewer things which are better to do than just to stroll through this great park.
Beautiful at all the times!. My favourite park in London. It is beautiful at all seasons. Great spirit and extremely pleasant for walking all year around or reading a book on a bench in the summer.

Peaceful. It was a lovely morning so we decided to walk through the park, mindful of the numerous joggers and tours that are in the park. The wildlife was plentiful and used to tourists, an extremely bold squirrel was virtually at my feet waiting for a treat. The scenery and lake just adds to the splendour of this park. A nice retreat in a bustling city...and free as well

Super sweet spot. This is a great park. I enjoyed it a lot even on the super rainy, cold day I was there. Filled with cute animals such as ducks, squirrels, birds, swans just roaming around freely. Bring some food for the animals. Great view of London Eye and the palace.
Beautiful. So pretty. Never been before and i loved it. So well kept and looked after. Will defo visit again :)

An awesome experience. Went to St James park with a loaf of bread and a bag of peanuts in the shell. Enjoyed it tremendously teasing the squirrels to come for their peanuts. Its amazing how attracted to peanuts they are. And the bread .... Feed the ducks and birds. You will be inundated with feathery animals as soon as you bring the bread out of the bag. Lovely experience. Try it.
very quiet. A quiet park, lots of trees and playful squirrels, very nice for a walk, clean, nice place for jogging
Beautiful!. We walked through the park starting at Horse Guard Parade and ending at Buckingham Palace. If you like birds, this is a must see.
One of the most beautiful park ever. Many different flowers and trees to see and not to mentioned the animals, the great scenes of the lakes and great palaces around
A great wee walk. Fab place for a stroll around with great opportunities for photographs. Wildlife is full here and is easy walking distance to underground station.
Pleasant and restful park. For a bit of quiet during hectic London days this is ideal. Very pleasant to wander about. Wildlife can be a nuisance if you are trying to have a picnic so pick your spot.

Walk, Run, Read and Have Fun. Lovely park and breathtaking, you can see there all nationalities and don't forget to have coffee in one of the restaurants near the lake.. Also cross the bridge and take amazing pictures with fortresses behind, extraordinary scenery..
Weekend in London. We walked through this park as we visited places around Westminster.Nice to sit down & watch the squirrels who are very tame.Very pleasant park.

Nice birds, animals and beautiful scenery. I had a lovely walk through this park while going from Trafalgar Square to the Buckingham Palace. It has nice seats for public, you are not allowed to feed the ducks and squirrels, but you can see people do that all the time here.

What a stunning park.. While in London you must visit St. James' Park. It is so beautiful. There is a lake with all manner of birds. The trees are lovely and there is plenty of grass to sit or have lunch. It is a huge park so don't plan on walking the entire park, but a few hours is plenty of time to have a great time and see so much. It is very relaxing and the locals are lovely.
Delightful. Loved seeing the variety of wildlife such as squirrels.The park is in a lovely setting, it was a very delightful day.

Stunning views of london. A beautiful peaceful park in London. It's hard to get your head around that you are In the middle of London, as its so peaceful. You get an amazing view of London from the bridge that crosses the lake, it looks like little Venice. Lots of places to sit and relax and watch the world go by

Perfect greenery & relaxation . Strolled through this park after visiting Buckingham Palace. It was a lovely leisurely relaxing walk. The large spacious park with its green grass stood out in the middle of the city. We saw some friendly squirrels coming down trees and being fed by people. Unique experience. Wish we had more time to spend relaxing there. A must visit!

Pelicans!. My friends and I had a walk through this park on a sunny winter's day with a hot drink each. The park was clean and not too busy. We really enjoyed the walk and there were pelicans at the far end of the park which made for a nice surprise.

Beautiful park. Beautiful park with lots of greenery and animals.Perfect location too..u can simply take a walk from Westminster through the park to reach the Buckingham palace entrance.We were travelling with young kids and they enjoyed the chance to run around freely and see the birds too.

Another side of London. We're so delighted that we took several hours to spend just roaming around St. James and Green park; It's such a relaxing way to see another side to London and enjoy the lucky weather. Plus, you see all the young people and children enjoying themselves!
Lovely park, very clean. Had a walk through this park in February 2016, it is very clean and a nice walk in combination with the famous Buckingham palace of course.

Course of rest from Westminster to Buckingham Palace. If finish seeing the sights of the westminster temple, is foot from there; St. I go to Buckingham Palace through James Park.This course will be a course of the comfortable rest naturally.Opening free let alone a park. It is the feeling that there is a wild squirrel, and is really good.If turn to the west if appear on the big street across Lake, see Buckingham Palace in the distance (^^)

My favorite park in the world!. Incredible park! Abundant wildlife and beautiful flowers make strolling along in St. James Park a relaxing experience. It was a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of London! I highly recommend visiting!

Great for people watching!. Although this was a typical London day - cold and drizzly, we rather enjoyed the walk thru this green space in Central London. Much flora and fauna. Squirrels, ducks, and swans abound.

Walk in St James park. Love this park , special squirrels are tame feed them many a time lovely lake Relaxing in heart of London if you cross the road Opposite Westminster Abby you will see the Methodist hall church. Go down the spiral staircase there is the cafe in basement it used to be I be live an old dance hall in the war a very cafe jacket potato and salad very reasonable Very welcome place for young and old alike , amazing Building too . Once you have had a snak just turn left as you come out dead ahead is the park St James Feel humbles walking along the road as such big grand buildings I was lucky enough to have lived in Pimlico another great place as well as the movie (passport to Pimlico ) with Margaret Rutherford if want see England old time watch this film it's great . On DVD .to see big bens proud flag blowing in the wind With father Thames weaving its way through London is what is great about England Thank god for our wonderful buildings in London museums , gallery's , theatres , ballet , the west end .london has it all ,and some long may she reign . And of course the grandest building of all next to St James park Buckingham palace. And long may she reign too .

London's gem. St James's Park is a gem of tranquillity in the middle of London's hustle and bustle. Perfectly situated near Buckingham Palace, Westminster and Victoria, it is a great place to retreat to during lunch break.A draw for tourists is the variety of birds - how many other parks in capital cities have pelicans?!

Beautiful. One of my favorite places in London. It may be one of the smaller Parks, but for me the best one. With the variety of animals, the lake surrounded by trees and the view, it`s just stunning.

Park in center of London. Last week of January I visited StJames Park, It is such a nice feeling to be able to walk in a park in the center of London. The squirrels were so cute, if you go there you need some peanuts to give to them. They will climb on you to get them. Lovely experience
One of the prettiest places in London. St James' is one of the best green spaces in London. Loads of great scenery, but I think what makes it awesome are the pelicans who live in the park!!
Perfect London . Wedged between iconic Big Ben and Buckingham Palace, St James Park offer a picturesque setting, ideal for the perfect tourist picture saying you've been to London.
What a lovely park . Beautiful park nice and big for a nice stroll around, Nice to go and feed the ducks, Nice views around the park
My favourite park for a walk. Great place to talk a stroll or walk, my favourite London park, pretty lakes and squirrels that eat out of your hand

A beautiful park close to the Palace. I love walking through St James's Park, it is small enough to explore all of it and large enough to be enjoyable. The lake has a good selection of water birds with signage to help you identify them.

Extremely relaxing area to visit. This was one of our favorite places to visit due to all the people relaxing out on the grass and enjoying the day. If you like to walk then this is the place to visit. There are plenty of areas to stop and rest and enjoy the ducks along the waters edge or take in some of the historical views around the area. My mother has had previous back surgery and this was a bit too much walking for her but is easily accessible with a wheel chair, scooter, etc.

Beautiful Park!. A great surprise! Close to Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey. A lovely park to stroll through after seeing the Changing of the Guards. Has public washrooms (for a fee), which are a must after standing for a few hours watching the ceremony.
Lovely Park. Lovely park in the heart of Westminster. Great views of the Palace. Lots of birds and squirrels that will eat bread from anyone offering. Beautiful on a nice sunny day.

A beautiful park. Right adjacent to the Buckingham palace is the st.James park. A beautiful park with bright green grass, a river full of swans & ducks. They swim upto you if you feed them. There are also large squirrels here. They will take a nut off your fingers and eat them before scurrying away. It is between Buckingham palace & the House of guards.

Peace and colour. Even on a bleak, grey winters day in London this park looked beautiful. The colours were amazing and it was so peaceful. If you can get 5 minutes away from the hustle and bustle of city life it is just perfect

Nice walk. The park is beautiful and holds a ton of history. Overall it is a nice place to visit if your a tourist or a local. I would recommend the park to whoever wants to take a second and get away from the huddle and bustle of the city.

Super Central. This park is a nice park, but what really makes it great is its location. The park serves as a great meeting ground, as well as an opportunity for numerous photo ops, like in front of the Buckingham Palace, the Horse Guards Parade, and The Mall. Also, you can see Westminster Abbey, the London Eye, and St. James Palace. It is next to many historical places as well, such as Her Majesty's Theatre, 10 Downing Street, Churchill War Rooms, the National Gallery, and many Museums. Tons of transportation options like bikes, taxi and bus stops, at least 4 metros within a block, and of course walking, because everything is so close.

Everytime I go to London it's a must-see. Lovely park with squirrels, ducks,swans in the middle of London! Spending an hour in this park is regenerating! The best period to go is in March, when trees bloom!

Lovely park close to tourist attractions. Lovely park within easy walk of Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace and Houses of Parliament. It tends to be very busy at weekends.The park is centred around the lake. There is a good collection of wildfowl. But the pelicans are the stars. Apparently they are fed between 2.30 and 3pm daily at Duck Island.

Very Big Park. Its a very big park to walk around and full of different types of beautiful birds. Its completely quiet and peaceful from the city rush. Its just surrounded by Horse Gaurds Road and Buckingham Place.

Had fun with the ducks. We first went to the Buckingham Palace and then walked to the St James Park. It was almost dark and reaaaallyyyy cold, but we did have some fun with the ducks and enjoyed the view.
There was something being filmed at the "entrance" of the park. That was nice to watch...

An Oasis in the heart of London. A beautiful place to escape in the centre of the city (one of my favourites, in fact). Whether you're looking to while away some time with a book in the Summer, or to go for a stroll in the colder months, it's the perfect place to retreat to.

Amazing peaceful walk in the heart of London. We had a wonderful walk in this park, in late November. It surely is a wonderful experience in any season! It's incredible that just near the buzz of London one can find this amazing peaceful area, vibrant of life! We enjoyed welcoming from squirrels, swans, ducks, and I don't know how many other friendly birds.

Visited Lindin. 19 - 24 January 2016. Wow. Full of birds such as white Swan, pigeons, scarecrows and small birds. Beautiful scenario. Full of people and tourists. Kids enjoyed watching the birds on the ground and flying. We saw some squirrels on the ground and jumped to the trees. Beautiful flowers.

Lovely in Spring with all the daffodils and tulips out.. One of central London's nicer green oases. Very pleasant for a lunchtime stroll or a picnic. Plenty of interesting water fowl to watch, including pigeon swallowing pelicans.

Relaxing . Walking around London and we took the time to take in St James's Park. Away from the hustle and bustle of the busy central areas the park allowed for a period of relaxation before commencing more sightseeing. We noticed cafes within the park although didn't try any of them; they looked respectable enough though. Certainly would recommend a walk though if only to escape the busy streets for a while.
BEST PARK IN LONDON. Beautiful park, very clean and lovely ducks. Very nice views and lovely time to spend with the girlfriend or wife. Or husband or boyfriend.Pete
Gorgeous Gorgeous Gorgeous. Absolutely beautiful park to walk through. A must during your stay in London. We had perfect weather.
A duck bit my finger when I offered it bread!!. Other than that, it was cool. The park is pretty and if you are wary of the birds you should be fine :)

Well kept peaceful park. We crossed Horseguards Parade into the Park in order to walk to Buckingham Palace. It was a beautiful sunny, but very cold day and not too many visitors. Couldn't believe that the daffodils were in bloom which gave a nice colour to the surroundings.
Silence. If you want to visit the Buckingham Palace, go trough the St. James's Park. Nice and silent place in the heart of London.

Great way to relax. Love this park! Not as big as Hyde Park, but it's a very nice place to relax after a visit to the Buckingham Palace.
Every time I go to London, I come here with a bag of peanuts and feed the squirrels ;they are very friendly and used to people.

Beautiful !. St. James' Park is such a relaxing walk with lots of beautiful flowers and wildlife to include swans, ducks, pelicans and of course the squirrels! Great views of The Eye, Buckingham Palace and the Horse Guards. Take your camera!

Nice walk in the park. Great for a stroll and viewing some nature. Birds, ducks and squirrels, super relaxing park, just minutes away from all the hustle and bustle of the city streets near by, it even has a lake with lots of wildlife in and around it- good for the whole family, fun and interesting for the kids. Close to Buckingham palace, Parliament and the river.
Fabulous london park. whenever I lead my groups of students who visit London and after visiting Backingham Palace we relax in this spacious awesome park , so many sweet memories

Green park. This is a scenic park in the city of Westminster with greenery around. The park has a small lake, St. James's Park Lake. You will find pelicans here. Couples can enjoy a romantic walk in the park.

A nice small park. Enticed by YouTube videos showing squirrels and pelicans interacting with people, I set out to the park. It was a very cold day, so not many wildlife around.One warning - beware of the restaurant at the edge of the lake. Even as a tourist trap it is pathetic. A high fence keeps you from enjoying the view; attitude of staff + décor off-putting. Having sat many times at the Serpentine Bar and Grill I know that it could have been different.
Great Park to walk in the morning. Park is anchored by the Horse Guards and Buckingham Palace. Great place for an early morning walk, especially on weekends.
beautiful. St james park is beautiful definitely worth a visit . stunning scenery and lovely animals . a very romantic walk .
Beautiful. Beautiful place. Great for walking, running. I practised my marathon training here; 3 1/2 hours of running in loops and didn't get bored of the scenery :D

Visited as part of a trip to London. A beautiful Royal Park. Lovely garden and a lovely walk with the family. Had fun feeding the duck. Lovely sport photos and a view of the London Eye and Buckingham Palace. Refreshments sold as well. Worth a visit.

OASIS OF PEACE IN THE CITY. Enjoyed a lovely walk through the park to Buckingham Palace on a bright frosty morning. Was so beautiful seeing all the wildlife and the greenery. So peaceful considering we were right in the middle of London. Could hear the bands at the Palace as well as they finished Changing the Guard.
passing by. every time I'm around st. James's Park, I need to pass through and walk around. It's such a tranquil place in the heart of London, which is one of the must see.

It's Beautiful. I went on a sunny day and it was glorious. Swans on one side and little squirrels on the other. You can walk from Buckingham palace to Trafalgar Square through this park, and it is so worth it.

One of the best views of London. From the bridge in St. James's Park.
Turn around and it's Buckingham Palace.
Make sure you find the Pelicans. Feeding time is around 2pm.
One of my favourite parks of London

A lovely park even in the winter.. This is a lovely park to escape the hustle and bustle of London. We entered the park after visiting Buckingham Palace. The park has loads of wildlife from very tame squirrels , foxes to a variety of ducks, geese and other birds. There are lots of little coffee stalls that serve a variety of drinks and hot and cold snacks. This is a great place to people watch whilst relaxing on a park bench.
