Indeed even though it was a rather chilly January morning we were astounded to see a yoga group practising on the grass and a nearby Tai chi group too. We enjoyed the fountains and the proximity to Westminster too. This park would be an ideal picnic place.

Just a really beautiful walk. If you're wanting to head outdoors for the day, a stroll in this park is well worth it. During spring, the grass is covered with tulips, it's just the most gorgeous thing. It does tend to get very busy, especially on a hot day. Try and go early to avoid the mass amounts of people. But still, a beautiful walk and a great view. Bring nuts, feed the squirrels, even though you're not supposed to!

A beautiful walk in Central London. Definitely worth a visit! St. James' Park is a lovely walk running up alongside The Mall to Buckingham Palace from Horseguard's Parade. There is so much wildlife to see, so many species of birds and Pelicans! We finished our walk by passing through Horseguards and visiting the iconic Horseguards on duty in Whitehall.
relax. a beautiful walk,lovly for jogging, relax With the birds, eat and drink. its Perfect. take a book bring som bred or nuts.

Beautiful Park in the Centre of London. How can one imagine such a beautiful park be missed by so many locals and tourists. right in front of Buckingham Palace. a park which has many memories of Kings and Queens walking during the Spring and enjoy the flowers that are abundant as well as ducks and swans.. As well as politicans and many spies during the cold war. dont forget to see the War Rooms which aare at the opposite end of the Palace

Beautiful park even in winter. We had a walk through the park as we were making our way to The Houses of Parliament and it is a lovely quiet place just off some of the busiest parts of the city. Even it winter it is an attractive wildlife filled resource.

Nicely curated park opposite to Buckingham Palace. I visited this park last spring while I went there to visit Buckingham Palace. It is a nicely curated park just opposite to Buckingham Palace. In this park, you will be able to spot lot of birds (mainly various species of ducks).

Lovely place to walk. It was wonderful walking in this park after visiting the Buckingham Palace. It's beautiful, particularly in spring. Don't bother taking a book....people-watching is more fun in this park!
many animals. I love all the preservation..the variety of so many animals...some places to eat (but very expensive) near of the Buckingham Palace.
Lovely at any time of the year. I've visited in mid-summer previously and loved it. This visit in winter after a heavy frost and no leaves on the trees was a different type of pretty.

Beautiful little park. Tourists love this park because it is close to so many attractions. The views are both pretty and iconic, especially from the bridge. Indeed, I don't think it is possible to cross the bridge without accidental photo bombing!St James's Park is also well used by Londoners as a lunch spot or just somewhere in the middle of the city to take a stroll. Green Park is so close by it is easy to keep on walking, and from there to Hyde Park for a longer park walk. It can get very crowded with tourists, - its relatively small size means it fills up quickly. It has a nice sheltered playground and kiosks to buy coffee, as well as the very pleasant restaurant. In the summer, tourists and Westminster lunchers compete for picnic space. Particularly pleasant on a crisp winter morning when it is quieter.

Bare in winter, but full of animals. We visited in January, so it can be expected that the trees would be bare, and the weather dreary. However, the park is full of animals which kids would love, such as squirrels, swans, pigeons, pelicans, ducks and seagulls. The park is nothing much different to any other park really.
Lovely park with great views to snap. Took a walk around this park and was amazed at the variety of birds there. Had some great photo opportunities.

Beautiful walks . This is a gorgeous place to visit near the centre of London. The fountains in the centre are spectacular. I can imagine being here for a picnic in the summer is a great way to relax. The park is close to horse guards square, Buckingham palace and most other city centre sights and shops.

Wildlife and Calm in the City. If you're visiting Westminster or Buckingham Palace -- take a moment to walk through St. Jame's Park. The park offers a wide variety of birds (including four great white pelicans, which are a traditional gift from Russia) and a quiet stroll through the city. A great way to travel between Buckingham Palace and the other attractions at Westminster.

Lovely walk in the middle of London. Good facilities available to eat and drink and toilets.
Great to lie on the grass in the summertime.

Daffodils out in January ...... Haven't walked through St. James's Park for many years. It's as beautiful as I remember, with well manicured gardens, lots of little coffee bars dotted around and hundreds of squirrels! A lovely place to take a stroll whilst in central London.

Perfect beauty in the centre of London. lovely place to walk and enjoy beautiful countryside.Sometimes a bit busy but there is plenty to see and sufficient information boards around to tell you what you are looking for or at. Missed the Pelicans though!!

A beautiful park. St. James's Park is a favourite of ours. We go often especially in the summer months. It's always bustling but it's not hard to find a quite spot to sit and watch the world go by. There's a great park for the children so in the summer we spend many days picnicking here after watching changing of the guards.

Beautiful!!. Best during summer coz of the vibe the sun brings and the cheer of just the surrounding. In winter the food kiosks by the road side are brilliant for hot chocolate. Just a walk away from Buckingham palace and trafalgar square.

Great nature setting. In a concrete jungle such as London, its a nice to have a stroll through this picture-esque park set right next to buckingham palace. If your waiting for your time slot on your palace tour, its a not a bad place to spend a 1/2 hour. There are food vendors in the park if you care for a snack

The most beautiful park in London. Start from Green Park, through Buckingham Palace and get into this colourful park. Lots of birds varieties and friendly squirrels... don't forget to bring some nuts with you Recommended to everyone, adults and kids!
Peaceful retreat. I offer walk through here on the way to the tube. Peaceful , attractive and always something different to see people doing,

Takes you out of the city.... A lovely quiet park (when we went on January mornings) with a good sized lake which seems to add to the tranquility, our favourite pastime was feeding the squirrels, which will even climb a leg to get a peanut, a great place to charge the batteries.

Nice park. Big park in London city, the park is near the Buckingham palace.
It would be nice to have a relax time after visiting the palace.

Wonderful stroll through the city.. We like this more than Hyde Park, just a bit different --and Hyde Park is wonderful, but the trees, multiple walkways, pond with swans, ducks, manicured gardens is wonderful even on a gray day. Tea, coffee light food in kiosks are great. Especially a hot tea to warm the hands for a winter stroll. Alternative place to view the new year fireworks, lots of families and an international gathering. Across from Buckingham Palace.

One of the best park in London. If you are a tourist looking for the change of guards in Buckingham Palace, you cannot miss a walk in St James' Park. Bring some food along for the ducks and you will have a great time. Children will love it. Close to Victoria, Trafalgar Square and Green park.

Peaceful and serene in the heart of the city. One of my favorite places to go for a walk mid-day. This is a hidden gem in the heart of the city, steps away from Buckingham Palace. The gardens are immaculately maintained and are lovely to enjoy, regardless of the weather.
Peace and views. Great view of Buckingham Palace from the gardens and should be incorporated as part of a visit to see changing of the guard, Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, Trafalgar Square etc
Wonderful park with many great views. Stroll along the lakes, have a picnic, enjoy cafes and look at fellow visitors. This park in central London is romantic and offers many great viewpoints.
Tranquility. Something about swans, and a river, even in the heart of the city... it's quiet and beautiful, and it feels like you're far away from the masses.
Wonderfull place. A really lovely place to walk though in every season, a couple of places to have a hot drink and sit back and people watch

Birds!. And more birds. A beautiful city park with charming spots to sit and rest. Wonderful views of Buckingham Palace and great photo ops abound. A great way to transition away from the crowds around Big Ben into the ease and quiet of an urban oasis.
Park. This is a good park in the city.This is next to the Buckingham palace after visiting the palace you can go for a quick walk or relax before your next attraction

Relaxing place away from the crowds. It is a pretty relaxing park which is walking distance from Buckingham Palace and also Oxford shopping area. There are a variety of birds and little animals that will come running to you when you have food in hand.

Amazing place. Between Big Ben and the Buckingham Palace this is a huge park which is quiet and serene
Can spend hours in silence here or somply walk through for some beautiful picturesque points inside
A beautiful park. A very beautiful park to take a walk through. It's very big and it seems to be quite a popular place for the locals.
Relax here.. After sightseeing this is a nice green area to sit and relax. Right near many main attractions in the centre of London.Watch out for the pigeons and lunch.
A beautiful place to walk, rain or shine.. But beware the birds! They'll try and take your hard earned lunch in hordes if you give them the chance.

One of the most amusing parks in Europe!. Are you fond of ducks, squirrels and birds? Do you like to feel the wind in your hair or to lay down looking at clouds? Well, this might be the place you are looking for. It sure is amazing for a walk, spending some time in the morning or in the afternoon, having a picnic, jogging or running or whatever you feel like doing alone or with friends.

Beautiful central London Park. The bird life in this park is extraordinary, from pelicans and swans to Canada geese and moorhens. Sadly, many people were taking no notice of the instruction not to feed the birds - one lady with her toddler was even crouched by a 'do not feed' sign whilst feeding the wildlife. Squirrels ran around everywhere, and on a pleasant afternoon in London, there is no-where better to be.

beautiful garden to relax. It is a beautiful park with gardens, lakes, ducks and trees. The location is great. It is in the center of palaces, museums and other sight seeing places. A very relaxing place to take a break.

Lovely park, full of people having a stroll and loads of cheecky squirrels. We strolled through the park from Buckingham Palace on our way to Westminster. We loved the laid back atmosphere and the locals hanging out there too.
Beautiful. Beautiful park but not much to see. The park is full of tourists. The park is in between of Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards.
Perfect Park. A great park which leads up to Buckingham Palace on one end and has Horse Guards Parade on the other. A must visit for tourists to London.
Wonderful park. Nice relaxing park with plenty of wildlife to enjoy and centrally situated and easy to find. Could do with shelters for when raining though
Love this park. So beautiful, clean and you can see lots of different birds and animals there. In particular the squirrels playing around you!

Over run by pigeons and tourists. Pigeons everywhere and the worst toilet facilities in London under the shadow of Buckingham Palace. You have to pay 20p to pee in the dirtiest facility and most everywhere in the city where there was no charge you found neat and clean facilities. Go figure! What a shame that such a mess is across from her majesty's prime residence.
Green and Picturesque. We happened by the park from Horse Guards Road and found a lovely view of Buckingham Palace over the lake. Happily we watched the Pelicans being fed by the Duck Island Cottage.

Nice place to sit. Really nice place to sit, after hours of walking around well appreciated the sit down at 12.00 at night, was very peaceful and had a chance to arrange a hostal with out the rush of people
Very beautiful. Very beautiful park right in the center of the city! Loved the contact with the animal and it's wide space

Lovely Place, Worth Taking the Scenic Route. I happened upon this lovely park on my way back to my hotel when I was looking for a scenic route. I'm so glad I was able to cut through the park, its a beautiful place. Loved the bridge crossing the water and the Princess Diana path. Even on a gray day, which is what I had, it was gorgeous. Go for a stroll!

Squirrel alert. Walking past after Buckingham Palace stopped off for a look as there was a large crowd. On the side of park closer to big Ben and Churchill war rooms are loads of squirrel you can hand feed or if you have no food they just run up ya leg and freak you out haha. What a laugh
great time. very interesting gardens. Little chinese ornamental gardens. great way to spend a day out. Loads of photographs to be had.

Perfectly Positioned, Idyllic & Picturesque. Really, well and truly enjoyed meandering my way through St. James Park. Within easy walking distance of Buck House, the Royal Mews, the Queen's Gallery & Westminster, it is in the most perfect position for Central London. My partner and I chose not to hire the bikes available and instead sauntered about for about an hour and a half. So many swans and other fauna and flora about. Just a welcome retreat from the busy pace of the city: a little natural utopia!
Black Swans. This lovely park is part of London's botanical charm. The swans were everywhere and the rare black swans were a real treat. It's a peaceful retreat.

Romantic, with fantastic views on attractions. St James is best to enter when you come from Parliament Square, after visiting Big Ben and Westminster Abbey.The park leads right to Buckingham Palace, with spectacular views on London Eye and Big Ben.

Excellent park.. We love st.james's park it's right near Buckingham palace and a short walk to Big Ben. You can choose to walk or hire some bikes. Toilets are 20p so make sure you have one or two spare. This is one of my favourite parks with so many different birds and lots of squirrels. If you like squirrels I recommend you bring some monkey nuts they love them and eat them right out of your hand.
Don't miss St James Park. It's a beautiful oasis in the heart of the centre. You can people from all walks of life and families there.

relaxing place in the city. If you love animals, they're everywhere. Don't feed the squirrels though, they tend to follow you everywhere. Lots of benches to rest if you get tired and if you want to lay out on a blanket, help yourself.

Far more fun than Westminster Bridge + 500,000 tourists. Go up Whitehall a little from Westminster Station, then turn left down what looks like a private road - it leads to the Foreign and Commonwealth Office at the end - and beyond that are steps leading to the Parks wonderful duck pond, with pelicans and squirrels and lots of ducks and geese. Keep walking in vaguely the same direction to the left of the pond and you will eventually reach a lovely bridge from which you get a great view of Buckingham Palace to the left and what looks like a Russian skyline to your right. Continue on through the Park, and in due course you will reach Buckingham Palace, and nearby is the smaller "Green" Park and the larger Hyde Park. If you want to walk the latter, do, and check out the Serpentine. Also look on web for the Royal Parks and do some digging, they have .pdfs with maps of the Royal Parks. Certainly needed for the larger ones like Hyde, Bushy and Richmond!

Amazing Park... Walk & Relax. What a beautiful park with plenty of different kinds of birds. Families, kids, friends and couples can enjoy their time with the beauty of nature. Just have a walk in the park and you will get relaxed so much. It is nearby Buckingham Palace and minutes from Big Ben. Put it in your list to walk away from the crowds and have some memorable moments :)

Take a Rest from Your Vacation. This park runs along The Mall from Horseguards Parade to Buckingham Palace, moments from Westminster Abbey, the Churchill War Rooms and Big Ben. When you are tired of the crowds, head here. Any season there is something to see. In the winter we enjoyed the birds, especially the pelicans, and walking away from the crowds. There are restrooms and snacks available along with park benches for a quick rest.

Tranquil place in a busy city. Enjoyable walk through the park. There are many many different types of birds with descriptions readily available on the side roads. There were lots of families with small kids but even for adults it can be very amusing to look at the birds. It's not allowed to feed the birds but many still do and create "crowds" of birds trying to get something. There are many benches if you want to rest. Bathrooms are also available but you need to pay for them (20 pence).
Lovely stroll to downtown London. Even in wintertime this park is fantastically well kept and a joy to walk through on your way to London city.
BEAUTIFUL PARK !!!!!!!!. A must on a nice day, you can choose to walk or use the hire bikes around London allowing you to see even more.
The best. We love St. James's Park. It doesn't matter the weather is vet or dry. It is an amazing park. I love the black swans.

A walk in the Park. After visiting Buckingham Palace we took a walk in the park. It is a typical park that offers an escape from the City Streets.
The flora & fauna is indigenous and the squirrels extremely friendly, some even venturing to eat out of your hand.
A tranquil and pleasant setting to relax after a day's sightseeing.
Went for a walk. Lovely park for bird watching. Spent a few hours walking around with friends. The garden keepers cottage is cute and a good spot to watch birds
Lovely. There are many beautiful parks in London but this one is one of my favourites; beautiful and very pleasant on warm summer days with its shade and pond. Take romantic pictures on the bridge!
Stunning place. Great to spend an afternoon at. A lot of movement, but quiet at the same time. Recommend to others, amazing park.

Pigeons, ducks, squirrels, and of course Buckingham Palace. A beautiful and much needed open space in the middle of built up London. The paths are of good quality, the wildlife incredibly friendly, and the view of Buckingham Palace fabulous.
Not great in poor weather, but on a reasonable just gorgeous. Just remember some bread for the duck, pigeons and squirrels :)
Amazing. Big and beautiful park, amazing to walk on. It has a brilliant view to London Eye. I really recommend it!

A Wonderful Place for a Stroll. St James's Park has to be one of the best in the world for a stroll on a sunny day, even in mid December. The great variety of birds adds a great deal to the beautiful grounds. Well worth a visit.
Nice walk. Nice relaxing walk in the middle of all of the hustle and bustle. Be sure to look for the pelicans which were a gift from Russia.

Beautiful place for a walk or picnic. A lovely area to stroll through after visiting one of the palaces. Easily accessible by underground and a good central location to lots of other London attractions. Don't miss out on a walk in the park during your time in the city.
Beautiful. Absolutely wonderful park to take a stroll in any weather. Lots of birds and squirrels to watch or feed.
My Favorite Part of London. Absolutely adored walking this park feeding the ducks, swans and squirrels and getting a feel of the London Wildlife!
A walk through the park. The scenery is lovely. Looks like a lot of people but the quietness is very good. A lot of different animals walk through the park. Especially the squirrels were a favourite.
Beautiful park. This is a beautiful park and a place that you can relax and enjoy the quiet right in the centre of London.

PARK LIFE. Spacious, not cluttered with flora and fauna, big huge tall trees good for photography, by a pond that's overlooked by an Inn where you can have a beverage or a meal. For the first time I could get near squirrels and the ducks, pigeon and birds add a wildlife feel by Westminster's historical buildings and streets. No season seem to deter the number of visitors and it's a great place for quiet relaxation too.

Lovely to wander through. I took friends through here as we walked from Buckingham Palace to Westminster. My friend loved the photo opportunities and her kids loved the ducks and squirrels. It is quite a good sized park and nice to have a bit of quiet and space within the city.

Most beautiful Park in London . St James park from admiralty arch to the palace . Beautiful park. Proper park and links two amazing london sight see- ers places- admiralty arch and the palace !!!! Great photo opportunity and place for refuge in the hub of London.

WONDERFUL PUBLIC PARK. A wonderful time was spent walking through this delightful public park on a beautiful Summers day. People were enjoying the weather and were all over the park sunning themselves.

Love the squirrels!. Lovely park for a walk with little squirrels going about their business. Well maintained, beautiful trees and great photo opportunities. Stop by Buckingham Palace during your walk. Bathrooms and food carts are provided. Very romantic!
I would recommend this for couples nd families.

Duck Island is the highlight. in Zone 1 just behind Buckingham Palace. I visit this on Christmas Day. Since there was no public transport due to Christmas Holiday - I decided to take bicycle ride to the park. The cycle booth is just across the road so it was easy to park the cycle and walk to the park. The park has some amazing photography locations, such as Guard Museum in the backdrop, But the highlight of this park is Duck Island. I have never seen such beautiful ducks / swans in my life. It has over 20+ styles of ducks swimming across.I was astonished to see so many different styles of ducks / swans in one place. Black Swan / White swan swimming across look amazing.
Tranquility in the city. With the hustle and bustle of Getting around the attractions of London,it is a pleasant and tranquil experience to spend some time in this peaceful and picturesque park.

Cut through from P SQ to Buck Palace . Sneak out the far corner of P SQ towards the Churchill war rooms , wander through this iconic London park Check out the Pelicans yes !!! Pelicans wander around the small lake lots of bird life and friendly Squirrels Fifteen minute walk see"s you right in front of Buck Palace lovely way to get from A to B ,,,,,,,
Nice place to walk through. It's a place to get away from the maddening crowd. A lovely place that is filled with gardens. Not a specific destination, but nice just the same.
Sunday walk. A nice easy walk; good signage & way finding; easy access walking paths. Plenty to see although some sections were a bit crowded, perhaps due to it being Sunday after Christmas.

Beautiful park to visit. Whilst it is a very beautiful and picturesque park to visit, the highlight of our walk was the kids feeding the squirrels. Take some nuts and you will have furry friends for life!

Lovely!. Lovely park next to Buckingham. I fell in love with the animals in the park! There are beautiful birds and very bold little squirrels that will eat out of your hand if let them (we didn't). Worth the stroll through!
Peaceful. Lots of birds. A nice walk. Easily accessible by public transportation. DIfferent things to do nearby

One of many places to visit using your "Underground" pass. The first thing I did after arriving in the UK was buy a pass to the London Underground that lasted for my entire visit. With this pass, I was easily able to visit many scenic and beautiful destinations. I loved walking around St. James's Park. It was beautiful, and the other people who were enjoying the beautiful day I was there were friendly and outgoing.Do plan parks as part of your enjoyment of London when you visit England. They are fantastic.

My Favorite Place in London. I have only visited this park twice, both times in the dead of winter. If a park can impress me on both visits, when there's not much in the way of blossoms and blooms, then it's a special place!If I had half a day to sit on one of their glorious benches to observe the vast array of waterfowl that inhabits the park, it would be pure bliss (in a warmer month). This place exudes peace and tranquility, and that's what makes it special. The fact that it is literally across the street from Buckingham Palace and can accomplish this makes it worthy of a gold star. I can't wait to visit in a warmer season, sit on a bench, and take it all in.

Better than the other parks. For me-as a person living in London is St. James's Park much more beautiful than for example Hyde Park or Green Park for one simple reason- all the tourists prefer to see Hyde Park. So you can just relax without all the rush.

Wonderful park. We pass by the park on our way to buckingham palace after Westminster abbey. Though we have big bus tour, we prefer to walk on our way to buckingham to see this park. A lovely place to stay a few minutes.

One of the most beautiful parks in London. St.James park streaches from buckingham palace all the way to Trafalgar square.It is a must place to visit for every visitor to London.It has many beautiful lakes all over its lengh which are full of wild life ranging from birds of all kinds to large swans who are used to humans feeding them.The park is very clean and well looked after. There are many deckchairs all over the park which many people use during the summer months.It is truly a delightful place to visit, and enjoy.

Simply beautiful. We were staying near the London eye and walked through this park to get to Winter Wonderland. It was peaceful, clean, tidy and a very relaxing break from the busy city. The squirrels were bouncing around and weren't shy. This is a lovely place to escape to.
Beautiful park, shame you have to pay for a seat!. A great place to lounge, relax and stroll! Slightly tainted by the officious man who demands that you pay for the use of a chair!

Few steps away from Piccadilly. The most central city's Park, few minutes walking from Piccadilly Circus and the Buckingham Palace, a quite big park completely surrounded by greenery of all kind, trees, ponds, squirrels, geese and tranquility really strange to be in the heart of the City. Really nice to walk here during the day. During the night I tried it, the park is poorly lit and I would not trust a lot.

Wild life , spot on!. Giving nuts to the squirrels, giving bread to the more than 20 diferent kinds of ducks, feeding this huge fishes in the lake...Laying down on the grass, having a romantic walk with your partner, smelling the freshness...What else can i say? Been there over 20 times..its one of my favourite places to be in this crazy city.

Beautiful, peaceful and romantic. This is one of my favourite parks in London. It's location is wonderful as it is right next to Buckingham Palace and near Victoria Station. It is quiet, peaceful and the pond is beautiful.
Lovely Park in central london. Obviously at it's best in Spring / Summer season. Attracts visitors all year round. Nice retreat in busy area.

My favourite London park. St James's Park has 'class'. It is a relatively small park, between Buckingham Palace and Whitehall with a lake with ducks. I love the backdrop of Buckingham Palace at one end and the London skyline seen through the trees at the other.

Good for Wildfowl. A well landscaped park in the classical mode right in the centre of London surrounded by palaces and stately buildings. Good for slow walking you can admire the many species of geese, swans, pelicans, and ducks (some quite rare) as you perambulate. A park which has something to offer in the way of plants and fauna all the year round, I prefer to go in the winter months as it's much less crowded than the other seasons.
Say hi to the Pelicans. A romantic walk through the park spotting hte ducks and even some pelicans, was quiet when we walked through was a nice break from the hussle and bussle.
Nice little park nearby by Buckingam Palace. A nice and enjoyable walk between Westminster and Buckingam Palace ready for the 11:30 am guard switch... at the Queen`s Palace
Calm in the city. Well presented tidy park welcoming runners, dog walkers and LOADS of tourists! Conveniently close to underground station, pathways to Horse Guards Parade, Buckingham Palace.
Gorgeous Park. Stunning park that is well worth a visit on route to/from Buckingham Palace. Take bread for the friendly animals and your camera for gorgeous shots from every location!
very nice!. very clean park for a jog or even a walk.. nearby to tourist attraction places and perhaps one of the places to come and visit while you're here!

For Relax Times. The second time I have visited the park. The times I visited in the spring. I saw a squirrel climb a tree, fence and ran to ask for food from people passing by. The birds And the flowers start to bloom The second time I came in the summer. Tree leaves dark green A shady place to relax with a picnic at most it is a moment that I let time progresses more leisurely and relaxed. When I was tired from the trip sightseeing in the day.
A lovely stroll!. One of my favorite parks in Europe. Pay close attention to your food as the critters are not shy! Clean, safe park. Even enjoyable and safe to walk through during the evening hours.

So pretty, you cannot believe you are in a huge city. This is a lovely place to rest for a while in your visit to London. It is close to Buckingham Palace and if you cross it it will take you close to Trafalgar Square. There are ponds with ducks, people exercising, it is very pretty and preserved

Lovely. A very grand park running across London reaching the edges of a few tourist hot spots. This park is very enjoyable on a summers day. If your eating ice-cream, sun bathing, checking wildlife or just going for a stroll you can't really go wrong. After the park your options are limitless as your in the centre of London and have travel links to almost every inch of the city.
One of the nicest parks. Great location between the palace and other iconic stuff.Nice walkways and bridges.Plenty of wildlife.Easy on foot.

A Great European Park!. Saint James Park is simply a wonderful park especially on a nice day! It is a great gathering place for locals, and fun to view the many water fowl. The park is also a great place to people watch an is a piece of tranquility and a lush escape from the hustle and bustle of London. I say this is a must see when in London!

Lovely park for ducks. This is my favourite of the royal parks, it is a lovely walk from horseguards to Buckingham palace. The park has lots of trees, benches and good ducks. There is sometimes a pelican too

Not too big, not too small-just nice. Visiting St James's park again after more than 30 years brought back fond memories of London parks such as Hyde, Regent, Green park etc.St James's remains a favorite as it is neither too small nor too big but just nice in size with a central lake and plenty of wildlife. It is in an excellent location in central London. We took a leisurely stroll through the park after visiting the Churchill war rooms on the way to Buckingham palace.

A lovely walk and so many birds!. We took our time walking through this park on an unnatural sunny and cold day. There were many people strolling in the sun, speaking different languages, enjoying the landscape and looking at the birds!! Any bird lover needs to go here, it was very cool to see winged animals in the wild I normally would have to see in a zoo.

The most beatuful park.... Have been there again and again...It's never enough....The lake, the trees, the water birds....It's the garden of the palace...A paradise in the middle of London!I can't imagine someone who would not like it!

My favorite park in all of London!. This park is stunning! What an amazing park in the middle of the city! Stop and people watch, or stroll a little to work up an appetite and stop for a bite to eat inside the parks restaurant.
Nice walk through. Nice and relaxed, have a coffee and sit and watch the world go by. Good walk through from Green Park to Victoria as well.
Cute park . Had a nice walk around this park! Nice weather, very busy.Stalls were expensive for food. And deck chairs were a few quid to sit on for an hour.Overall, very cute.

A place to relax!!!!!. Its a beautiful garden to relax and rest your legs especially in the morning before the guards changing ceremony.Its located just 5 minutes or less from Buckingham Palace.Its also very near to Trafalgar Sqr,Westminster Area and Piccadilly Circus.Nice to watch the beautiful birds and squirrels besides the lake.Enjoy it!!!!
Little heaven. This park is on the heart of London, but when u are there is very quiet and pieceful, beautil in the summer lots of flowers, animals around. Is very nice for jogging

Beautiful Park!. This little park is much lovelier than the raved-over Hyde Park (which has nothing on NYC's Central Park).
It would be a nice place for a picnic and is the perfect size for a city park.

Lovely park with ponds, wildlife and little areas separate with different places to sit and relax .. Lovely clean park. Plenty of benches to sit and ponds with ducks etc . Don't think you are allowed to feed them though . Lovely walk on a nice day.
Wonderful place... ..for a nice walk in a green environment and for taking some relax in the city centre. Recommended!! :)
Lovely park. A lovely quiet peaceful park. Beautiful ducks / birds around. Well kept and a great escape from busy London for a while. A must see.. bring a picnic / get a coffee.

Beautiful park in the middle of the city. After visiting Westminster we walked through st James Park to visit the Buckingham palace. The park is a jem right in the heart of the city with its greenery and ponds with ducks and swans....it is a beautiful walk with plenty of picture postcard spots.
Great park. Nice Park to walk around. It's London so it might be crowded sometimes, but in general it's OK. Defeated worth visiting while in London
Beauty. i prefer hyde park due to the more lively nature however if your just lookin got unwind thi is the place to be

Beautiful and peaceful place if there are no tourists. Just happened that we were in the park when the weather was not sunny, and by coincidence were not so many tourists here. If don't pay attention to the people around, the place is very beautiful and peaceful. I wish to take a walk here when there is no one :)

A Nice Retreat!. A wonderful way to spend an afternoon to just relax after a busy morning of sightseeing. It a step away from Buckingham Palace and Churchill War Museum. If these are on your list to visit, definitely use the St. James Park path, it's a fabulous retreat! Also an amazing place to do birdwatching.

a good view in all directions. From St James' tube station, cut through Queen Anne's Gate (pretty town houses) and head for the bridge across the lake. To your left you will get the nicest view of Buckingham Palace, not in itself a pretty building but made more so by distance, water and willows. To your right, the spires of Whitehall give you the only baroque view in London; you could almost be in Prague. The park itself is cosy and sociable, pleasant to walk down or across to get to Horse Guards', the Duke of York Steps, Admiralty Arch or St James's Palace.

Historic Garden in Royal London. This is one of London's most ornamental parks and is situated along The Mall between Whitehall and Buckingham Palace. Originally a marsh, it was Henry VIII who drained the area and made it his Royal Hunting grounds. In the 17th century, Charles II had the park redesigned to be pedestrian friendly with a large aviary(thus the Birdcage Walk where the aviary was located). In the 18th century the famous landscape architect, Capability Brown laid out the park that we see today. Colorful herbaceous borders, stretches of grass and large stands of trees fill the park.There is a pleasant cafe, a lake with over 40 species of waterfowl and a bandstand for concerts. Views toward the palace across the lake provide good sites for photos. St. James' park tube station is a block south of the park.

Peaceful oasis. Pretty busy with tourists but still a peaceful oasis to wander through between Westminster and Buckingham Palace etc. I often go there to sit on a bench to have lunch and watch people rushing past, taking pictures etc. One of the best views is from the bridge looking towards Horse Guards across the water - seek it out.

It's Not All About the Park.. The Park is nice and pleasant but it's more about all the adjacent attractions. Buckingham Palace, St Janes Palace, Churchill War Rooms and 10 Downing Street. A skip away is Big Ben, Parliament Buildings and Westminster Abbey. The Park is still a good sojourn and worth a visit and a break from hectic touring.

Best park in London. I think this is the best park in London. It is central and close to many of the main places of interest. Some lovely walks in all seasons, and a great place for a picnic. You can hire deck chairs in the summer.

Blow off steam in this beautiful park. We needed a place for my sons to unwind after all of the museums and history tours. Each day they would run around and kick the ball in beautiful St. James Park. We were there in November so the leaves were falling and the flowers were gone but I can imagine it must be stunning in the Spring and Summer. The geese were so silly, they would walk right up to people to be fed. The squirrels took nuts right out of my hand.

Nice little park. Not amazingly large but quite cute place, probably the best stop point in London sightseeing. Close to major tourist attractions and Buckingham Palace makes it unmissable place to relax, spatially in lunch time during summer
Beautiful grounds. This park is set in a fantastic location. It is brimming with wildlife, especially birds, ducks and squirrels. Bring a picnic and enjoy!
My favourite London Park. Beautiful park in the middle of amazing London. Lots of wildlife, great views of the historical buildings, you forget where you are in this amazing park

Very relaxing. What a lovely well kept park in the centre of London. Very nice to walk through and very relaxing. Great and safe for children. After walking around the busy streets of London the park was a very welcome break.

The great view!!!. There I took the most amazing pictures around the lake, the swans and the view at the end for the parliament and other landmarks, I took a pics session there with a photographer and myself and the result was fantastic.
Lovely Park - so relaxing.. I loved walking therough this park during a late afternoon: beautiful old trees, lakes with swans, relaxing environment.I strongly suggest visiting this park.

Lovely park, perfect for a walk. Great variety of birds on the lake, and rather tame too, also squirrels that came very close to us without fear at all. We walked from Buckingham Palace to Big Ben and Westminster Abbey.

Beautiful place for a romantic honeymoon stroll. We were staying at a hotel near Buckingham Palace,so decided to walk from there through this beautiful park, then onto Horseguards Parade, Downing Street, Big Ben and House of Parliament. It was a crisp, frosty morning which meant the warm drinks from the cafe were most welcome! It would be ideal for picnics and lazy afternoons in the summer and you can hire bikes to cycle your way around the park.An absolute gem in the heart of the city

My screen saver.. St James Park is always a must visit for me in London. I have a photo that i took there several years ago as my screen saver and each time I go back I stand in the same spot and try to recapture that shot. This year the weather was not conclusive to photography but the scenery was still stunning. Views of Buckingham Palace across the water through the trees, the fountains,huge amount of bird life and families enjoying picnics, ice-creams and feeding the squirrels make St James park a place I feel compelled to go

A beautiful place to walk. We walked from Westminster Abby to Buckingham Palace in the morning around 9 AM...after rush hour and before the tour groups. This is as beautiful a park as you will find anywhere. The lake, the flowers, the magnificent old trees, the green lawns, and magnificent vistas were wonderful. While this can be a place you go to for a long visit/picnic, it is also nicely located on your way to other London attractions. Check a map and you can see that it is easy to include in any London itinerary.

Beautiful Spot in a big city. Lovely place to walk through and look up the lake to see the Palace. Spend a day with a picnic or just enjoy the green as you walk through to get to the next attraction. Beautifully landscaped and plenty of birds and squirrels to spot.

Squirrels!. This is the park if you want to meet the squirrels. Good location as you can walk in front of the Buckingham Palace too. Therefore there are so many people here since it's in the main tourist attraction area.

A nice walk through a beautiful park to the Palace.. We had travelled via the tube to St. James Park station, heading to see the Changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. It was necessary for us walk through St. James’s Park and then up the Mall, to reach the Palace.The stroll through St. James’s Park was very enjoyable. The combination of the charming mature trees, the beautiful flower beds, the pleasant lawn areas and the nice lake made for lovely environment, in which to walk.The lake was full of a variety of birdlife, whilst some visitors encouraged the pigeons on the pathways and footbridges, by feeding them. There were plenty of park benches provided where, if you desired, you could take a rest and enjoy your beautiful surroundings. The park also has kiosks where you can purchase takeaway food, ice-creams, cool drinks, tea and coffee. However, the prices charged by these outlets for their food and drinks are not cheap! There were also public toilets.From our experience, the park is a lovely place for a stroll in the sunshine. It would also be a very nice place for a picnic, as long as you bring your food and drink with you, rather than purchasing it there.
Saw the Queen. We went when the Chinese head of state visited and saw them all along with the other thousands lined up.

A tranquil beautiful place to visit. A stroll through St James park and along Horse Guards Rd is not to be missed. Irrespective of the weather, this is a beautiful tranquil place close to the heart of London. It doesn't get any better than this.

Peace from the hustle and bustle. Everytime i have visited London i have escaped to St James's park for a bit of space away from the maddening crowd lol, we all know how crazy it can be! Feeding the squirrels is always a hilight for me, its rare to find these little fellows so people friendly, a bag of nuts and you have some company for the afternoon lol. Just find a tree, park your back side and watch the world go by.

Refreshing stroll in the city. The squirrels are always a favourite for people but the colours in autumn cannot be beaten. Lots of birds on the lake for the enthusiasts of bird watching, view of the London Eye and generally a relaxing place to be.

A Beautiful Park. This park is one of the most beautiful open spaces in London. Even if you only have a short amount of time, it is great for a nice walk. There are many historic properties bordering the park that should not be missed. If you have some time in London, take along a map and visit this park.
Lovely park for a stroll. This park provides an excellent escape from the bustle of London. There is a lake with water birds and the walks provide views of Buckingham Palace. Well worth a visit.
I love it. is a magical place where you can see a lots of massive gardens and lakes, my children love to watch the ducks in the lakes and fis them all the way we want to comeback the next summer
St. James's Park. The park is very clean and beautiful. It is incredibly busy all the time - it is so big that everyone fits in well! It is well kept

Beautiful park. The most beautiful park in central London in my opinion. Its serene and peaceful with the most beautiful views. In addition the wildlife in this park can be very very tame. Literally I saw squirrels eating from the hand!!

A very pleasant walk.. I visit St. James's Park quite often.
Whatever the time of year, the gardens are spectacular.
The lake is always interesting with many varieties of birds and on hot summer days it's nice to relax with a picnic on the well kept lawns especially after visiting the local attractions.
Nothing amazing but ok for a stroll. its small , and ok , but nothing amazing. We went on a Sunday so lots of people and lots of traffic all around this small park.

A Beautiful Urban Oasis. St. James' Park is a beautiful green urban oasis tucked in between Horseguards Parade and Buckingham Palace. Lots of big trees, shady paths and places to stroll or stop and rest and contemplate nature. Just watch out for the sometimes aggressive pelicans! The Inn in the Park is a nice place for coffee and croissants, a sandwich or something similar, especially on a usually-less crowded Sunday morning.
Lovely Walk. Beautiful surroundings, lovely features. One could spend quite a long time here especially when the weather is right.

Stunning place to have a walk in. The park is very clean and beautiful. It is incredibly busy all the time- so be prepared. Having said that- it is so big that everyone fits in well! It is well kept and has everything for children, adults and dogs. A real London gem.

A Busy pathway from Palace to Westminster. A tiny respite on your way between tourist sites. So much better than walking on the busy thoroughfares, and even better than walking on "The Mall" again (especially if you have already done that before)A pleasant park with wildlife, waterfowl and LOTS of people. I find that the Western Path is quieter walking path.

Nice stroll through St. James Park. We enjoyed a nice stroll through St. James Park after leaving the Churchill War Rooms, making our way over to Buckingham Palace. We missed the changing of the guards but enjoyed the leisurely stroll.

Very charming with great history. I often walk thru this park on my way to meetings. It has a sense of history and peace that is marred only by too much traffic on both side but not bad enough to inhibit a quiet conversation.

Charming park, friendly wildlife. Great for strolling from Pall Mall to Buckingham Palace and good for joggers. The ducks have learned to look cute so you feed them and the squirrels are used to being hand-fed too. The bridge seems to be the spot to have your photo taken, but the park is really a lovely place to relax for an hour or two.
pleasant afternoon stroll. Had time to kill so went for a walk in the park. Lots to see including rampaging squirrels and Buckingham Palace. Lots of autumn colour.

Nice. Really lovely park. That s why i am writing to here 1st review after join to trip advisor. I visited here with my husband. Very suitable place for lovers There have lot of outstanding views. Love there most.

Very nice. We walked through the park to get to Buckingham palace,it is not far from big Ben. it is avery pleasant walk, many birds a lot of trees. We were lucky the weather was fine it only rained one day in two weeks.

One of the nicest walks in London!. Enter via the Horse Guards Parade gate and then walk through the magnificent park and see the huge variety of birds by the lake. See the very friendly squirrels and sit on one of the many deck chairs and just relax before continuing your walk towards Buckingham Palace. Wonderful.
Beautiful views. Absolutely loved this park. My husband and i visited with our 3 children and we walked for ages and loved the outstanding views. We will definitely be back!
Time to relax. I visit the park because it was near the Horse Guard place. It is relaxing and there is a little place to eat. Not a full restaurant.

The best royal park in central London. This is the oldest and arguably the nicest royal park in London. It boasts the friendliest - and fattest - squirrels in London, so accustomed to tourists that they need no encouragement to come close and pose for a photo. The flower-beds here are always gorgeous and the park's shape and amenities add variety to the landscape and endless photo opportunities. Children go wild at the sight of so many ducks, swans, birds and there are even pelicans! You can relax in the deck-chairs - but you have to pay for them - and listen to the marching band when the Changing of the Guard is on. Lovely.
Beautiful walk throug the park. Take the beautiful walk through the park to the Buckingham palace. You can do some birdwatching on the way.

Oasis. I love the willows water and birds with great views to either end of the park towards Buckingham palace or Horseguards. The park is always busy but somehow is a sanctuary of peace as children watch the very varied waterfall or play on the grass whilst city workers grab a lunch or hurry through and tourists get snaps for their albums to provet they were here. So close to so much the park is a sanctuary to reflect and watch person kind.

Best park in London . Has everything you need....a lake, ducks and swans, nice restaurant, Buckingham palace on one side, horse guards parade on the other, easy to get to and walk around.....and when youve had enough, youre still in the middle of town. A park for all occasions

A piece of heaven on earth. It's a great place to have a picnic and enjoy the beautiful weather. It's quite big so it takes about an hour to take a walking tour around it all. It has small ponds inside it and ducks and squirrels.

Huge park with many benches to stop and relax. This park is very huge. we walked down through the park to Buckingham Palace from the Green Park bus stop. There are many paved paths and benches along the way. Some people had blankets and were just relaxing in the sun. After touring the inside of Buckingham Palace, you had to walk through part of this park to exit.

Lovely park with views of Buckingham Palace at one end and Horse Guards at the other. I went for a stroll through the park on a Friday afternoon. There were plenty of people around but it was easy to move about freely. I walked across the bridge, down to Buckingham Palace and back again down to the Horse Guards. It was really lovely seeing the autumn colours.
The water fowl are lovely. We came here after watching the Royal Guard changing ceremony and it's a very tranquil spot in the city to chill and watch the water fowl floating around.

Grab and ice cream or a coffee and walk this beautiful park. Dogs, geese, ducks, pigeons, swans and my personal favourite the fat friendly squirrels. its basically a zoo without the walls. loved it, it was first thing I did in London. recommend it to all. (bring some bread for the animals)

Relax. Nice park to spend a little time away from the hustle and bustle, squirrels galore,various birds, lake with fountains and bridge, cafe/restaurant to take the weight off your feet for half an hour, deep breath then back to the hustle and bustle.

Lovely to relax. The park is surprisingly quite and calm despite it's proximity to the city center and Buckingham Palace. I walked here to escape the madness of the changing of the guard and it's a beautiful retreat.

Wonderful park just in front of Buckingham Palace. I love walking in this park and looking at all the birds you can find in the lake. If you are lucky you may have the chance to see the big white pelicans that live in the park!Definetely a must see and just on the other side of the rode to Green Park.

Relaxing park with lots of wildlife. We were looking for a quiet spot to sit after the crowded walk on Regent street. We paid about 3 pounds for two deck chairs in a beautiful sunny spot in the park. Birds and squirrels circled around looking for treats. The lake is nice with lots of beautiful geese, ducks and swans. Great place to take kids and stroll on the trails.
Easy access, nice views. St. James Park is in the middle of tourist attractions. It's nice park that you should take a walk when going from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey or vice versa.

Allways nice to enjoy the view from the Blue Bridge. Ther is already a lot of information on St. James Park which describes it well.The one thing I am recommending is to cross The Blue Bridge over the St. James Park Lake in the evening and enjoy the view to Buckingham Place on one side and Horse Garde Parada (with London Eye) on the other side. Spectacular views.

Relaxing place near Palace. We stopped here for a break while sightseeing in London. It was a lovely green oasis with park benches, or deck chairs to rest our aching feet. Lots of places to put down a blanket and enjoy the scenery. A lot of birdlife in the pond, which was enjoyed by many watching on. Squirrels in the shade of tall trees, a beautiful place and very close to Buckingham Palace.
enjoy sitting on grass. Walk around the park, you may see little animal assortment. Enjoy walking on nice paths. At some points sit on grass and enjoy.

Grab a snack and enjoy the walk. I came upon this park by accident and I am so glad I did. You can see many interesting things inside. My fiance loves birds and we just sat on a bench watching all the different wildlife we don't usually see.
Beautiful place to walk. Stop by Buckingham Palace just to say you've been there, and then enjoy a lovely stroll through this park.
beautiful park!. nice location and beautifully maintained. easily accessible from any attraction in the centre of london.
A good place to relax. A green oasis right in the centre of town, a good place to cool your heel after a couple of hours sight seeing

Lovely Walk on a Sunny day. We had a beautiful sunny day that made it pleasant place to walk through to escape the bustling city. We were walking to Buckingham palace from Parliament. When we were there the squirrels were out in force burying acorns for winter.
Peaceful. This is a great walk around this park and watch the beautiful wildlife as they swim and fly around like there was no one present
Un havre de paix. Don' hesitate to go and have a walk in the park. Take something to eat for the scurrels who have elected a home. They are cute and not at all unfriendly.

Beautiful Park.. We had such a nice, leisurely walk through St. James's Park. The gardens, the pond, the paths, all of it was beautiful. We had a nice, sunny afternoon stroll. What a great walk through London!

Nice park, with cafe. Had a stroll through St. James's Park with the wife whilst in London.Had a nice cuppa from the cafe, albeit a little expensive.But this was London :)The pigeons are nice and tame, hold out your hand and they will happily jump on. (Fed them some nuts haha, was like being a kid again.)Lots of wildlife there considering, swans, squirrels (tame) birds and all sorts.Worth a visit.

lovely park in central London. it is an oasis of peace and tranquillity right in the centre of London. In front of Buckingham Palace. A good place where to have a break from the busy roads. A great variety of birds live and nest here, with the lakes and the various type of trees and plants make it worth visiting it.

The peaceful park in the centre of the city!. I love walking through St James' Park, it's amazing! The peaceful lake, trees and flower beds envelope you and you feel you're in a really peaceful place - which you are! This is after you've enjoyed the bustle of Whitehall and Trafalgar Square. You emerge feeling re-energised and ready to enjoy The Mall or continuing on right up to the Victoria Monument and Buckingham Palace!! Do not fear though - when you need another time-out, Green Park is just across the road! I love the London Parks!

Beautiful park. We walked through this beautiful park from Buckingham Palace through to Downing Street & churchhill war museaum and on to Tate Museum. This park is kept immaculate and very well maintained.

Picturesque park that's worth the visit. After seeing Big Ben or Westminster Abbey, this is a great park to wander through and relax. There is a nice little lake in the middle with a fountain. There is also a cafe that serves really good hot meals and excellent lattes.

Great public space. You can go early in the day and see the Queen's guard as they prepare to go over to Buckingham palace. Go over by the duck keeper's cottage and across the way you will see the horses getting ready for their trek. Happens about 11 am.

Nice Walk. A great park for a nice stroll, lots of seats or grass to sit on and people watch. There are a lot of different varieties of birds on the water as well. We had a picnic lunch on the grass slope as it was a nice warm day. Nice to take a load off your feet and sit a spell with views. and not much noise.
Nice walk!. Perfect place to walk, jog. Beatiful seens, peacefull, a place to enjoy in summer and warm winter days.

Take a deep breath and relax in this lovely park. London is a truly wonderous and lively city. There is so much to offer in this metropolis, and one of the great things about London, is its beautiful and historic green spaces. St. Jame's Park is such a place. Take some time and stroll through this environment and admire all the bird inhabitants!
Beautiful park. A great place to escape the hustle and bustle and just a stones trow away from Trafalgar Square, Horse Guards and Buckingham Palace.

Nice park near many other downtown attractions. I went for a short run (a little less than 2 miles all the way around the park) to get some exercise. Nice pond with a variety of bird life. People everywhere on a nice fall afternoon. This is a large urban square with lots of greenery. It's not a National Park by USA standards!
Beautiful Park. Lovely area to walk, took pictures with guards and horses. Nice afternoon to stroll around and enjoy the fresh area and eat our lunch outside.

Natural Beauty. A truly wonderful and peaceful haven set in the heart of central London . There are animals to watch and feed if you are that way inclined .There are tea shops scattered throughout the park so you can buy a drink .It is a lovely setting for a picnic and suitable for any age group .Easily accesible by public transport .A must to visit .

Nice park in the heart of London. The park is located next to Buckingham Palace. There's a lake with many geese and other birds. You can also get a coffee or snacks at a kiosk. It's not spectacular but nice for taking a walk on a sunny afternoon.

Great place to visit after Buckingham Palace. I went to Buckingham Palace to see change of guard, it was very crowded, I advise you to go earlier, then I visited to St James Park, it has lovely ponds, you can also see squirrels, beautiful nature, great for picnic too, it is just next to palace
beautiful park. i enjoyed my walk through the park.took lots of pics the weather was amazing.one must try to see the places at one go .it is worth it

Walking in London.. This is an interesting and varied area to walk through. On a sunny day it would be lovely to picnic there.It was an interesting walk with the traditional tourist attractions as well as attractive bird life on the water and on land. There are plenty of photo opportunities.
spectacular park. We were floored by the beauty of this park! Amazing. Take a stroll through and enjoy the birds. Grab a snack at the cafe overlooking one of the ponds. Highly recommend.
Great to walk around!. St James's Park was beautiful to walk around! Really enjoyed the lake and animals. Make time for this while in London!
Always love this!. Probably our 4 time to see & it only gets better! This time of course it was in the rain, but fun to see everyone coming with their brolly's
Gorgeous . I love a bit of nature so spots like this on London are a welcome break from city noise and cars. Lots of runners AND swans :)

Pack a sandwich with coffee along!. Was there in early November. Weather was cooling leaves were falling. Great place to stroll or just to sit down and have a chat at the many benches or maybe on the green. There is a pond where you will find lots of ducks and birds hanging around. Beautiful!

Welcome Rest Place. We welcomed the green serenity of St James' Park on a sunny, busy Sunday when I think everyone in London was enjoying the autumn sunshine. A pleasure to sit and watch then walk and enjoy an ice-cream. Families of all generations were there enjoying picnics and feeding the ducks. Some footy being played but mostly just lazing in the sunshine. The next day it rained!

Worth a walk around.. Don't expect to be there on your own. Hundreds of people - especially if the sun is shinning. Great place to relax in eat your lunch. Grab a bike and go for a ride if you have time. St James Park is centre to some of London's major attractions. Enjoy.

A favorite. St James Park runs from Buckingham Palace to within a few blocks of Big Ben. It can be thought of as the Palace's front garden. There are paths running under large shade trees and down the center, a lake with ducks and other water fowl.From the bridge across the lake, there is a fine view of Buckingham Palace in one direction and of Whitehall in the other direction. There are always people being photographed on the bridge.You can relax on the lawn. There are stands, which sell refreshments. Bands play occasionally in the gazebo just as in Victorian times.The Park also acts as a convenient access route, an alternative to the city streets. As mentioned earlier, it runs most of the way from the Palace to Big Ben. However, it runs all of the way from the Palace to the Churchill War Rooms and Horse Guards Parade. The Mall, the large ceremonial avenue that runs along the north side of the Park connects Trafalgar Square to the Palace. (By the way, from the Palace, it is a pleasant stroll through the Green Park to Mayfair, Piccadilly and Hyde Park.
Lovely area of London. I love walking through this park. For me its better than Hyde park. I could sit in the park and totally relax.
Beauty right in the heart of London. This is a beautiful park and a favourite for runners and strollers alike. Close to the Palace and easy to find. An ideal spot for a picnic on a hot day.

Busy but serene and beautiful. My Son and I travelled to London in the summer and visited many sites. We also walked through St James,s Park as I wanted to show him where I used to work, which was next to the Park. We spent about 2 hours walking around as it was a beautiful day and showed the Park off really well. There are plenty of places to sit down and you can get food if required. The lake areas are wonderful and you will usually see the armed forces as they are stationed around that area. If going to London and the Sun is shining there is not a better place to sit down relax and have lunch. Enjoy.
Wonderful Park. We visited here in Fall. As you can imagine the trees were beautiful, the birds were lively and not just the pigeons. The Swans and Cootes were plentiful and fun to observe.
a great park in the middle of town,. very ease to access from undergroundd. Its a fab park for picnics as you have supermarkets in close proximity also.

Another park in London. Though we enjoyed St James Park we had the same complaint as in most London parks: designed for little kids. There wasn't much for the older children unless you took your own bike or rollerblades/skateboard.The park was lush and green and pretty well kept. Ice cream for sale, as in most of London. You can pop over to the palace or check out the stable guards.
A nice walk following the squirrels. The children enjoyed the walk following the squirrels around, we enjoyed the quietness. Nice stroll towards Buckingham Palace.
beautful view. It was such a lovely day and i walked by the river watching the ducks and seeing the sun shining it was such a lovely view to see
Relaxing. This is one of my favorite parks. I come here once in a while to relax by reading or watching people pass me by.

Summer Day in St James' Park. What a glorious day spent in St James' Park! Here you will find two of the most beautiful views in London. In one direction a breathtaking vista of Buckingham Palace reflected in the lake. and in the other a magical scene of towers, fountains and willow trees fit for any Disney fairytale.Flower's in full bloom and swans and ducks swimming on the lake complete the idyllic scene.Grab yourself an ice cream and relax on a deckchair in the sunshine and it's hard to believe you are in the centre of a capital city.There are often events on in this area. The day we visited the finish line for Ride London cycle race was on The Mall right beside St James' Park so we had an excellent view.Don't forget your camera for some lovely captures when you visit the Royal Park!

Storybook peaceful park in London City Center. By far my favorite park, we were just a couple blocks away taking a side street and some almost secret stairs. The end of this park with it's charming storybook cottages faces Churchill War Rooms and the back side of White Hall. In the middle of a busy city the streets are less congested and it lends to a quiet, pretty location for a walk or run. City wildlife; ducks, swans and squirrels abound.

a fantastic park in the heart of London. This park has everything! It has lots of wildlife, wandering around freely. Lots of squirrels without fear of humans! There is a play area for children, discreetly placed food kiosks, and plenty of seating. An excellent place to take "time out" from the busyness that is touring London.

Lovely bit of London. I spent a day running London from park to park, and although St. James' is small compared to Hyde and Regent, it's a lovely spot. In fact, it's small enough to people-watch (and maybe catch a glimpse of Prince Charles as he motors past to the palace.) Great spot for a picnic, too.

birds everywhere. There are birds basically everywhere you look (and squirrels, too, unfortunately)... many types of geese and seagulls and swans. Great opportunity for taking photos without leaving the city.
any weather, any time. take an umbrella and coffee or bottle of water, sunblock and sandwich and go for a walk. No matter the weather it is always great to free the mind from daily buzz.

Nice walk . Walked through one side of this as an alternative to walking along the Mall. It was quite nice to see squirrels eating food from people although I'm not sure if this is safe. There were a lot of pigeons about too when we were eating lunch by the pond.

The best of the Royal Parks. A huge, green oasis filled with pleasant walks and waterside views right in the busy beating heart of London.
Flowers and lawns are maintained to the highest standards, it's only the overflowing rubbish bins that detract from the perfection of the scene.
Just charming.
A lovely stroll. A lovely park for an afternoon walk. It is popular and full with people but is still relaxing. There are many birds and squirrels and if you're lucky you can see pelicans sometimes

Beautiful park. Well-maintained and gorgeous, the park is centrally located to provide an escape from the city. It's quiet and peaceful, a great place for a stroll or to take a break from running around town.

A place to relax near the Royal Stops. Lined by The Mall leading to Buckingham Palace, this is a great park to breathe in some serenity amidst a very busy area of London due to all the attractions surrounding it. You can duck through it to catch the different vantage spots to see the Changing of the Guards as well. It's also where we saw our first squirrel...yes, a highlight for Australians :-) Some beautiful photo spots throughout the park as well with views to Buckingham Palace in one direction and London Eye & Westminster the other as you cross the bridge.
Nice place for a good relax. Nice place for a good relax in the center of London. Near the main attraction. You can feed the squirrels that come up to you and are not afraid .
Beautiful . Wow! This park is super beautiful. Visitors it in October, just as the leaves were beginning to change color. A nice place for a relaxing stroll or picnic. A must see if you're in London!
nice play area and entertaining birds. The park has a clean play area with free to use toilets and snack kiosk. Birds and squirrels are fun to watch and very eager for contact with people.

simply beautiful way to access Buckingham / war rooms and Parliment. it was our first day. we arrived to early to get into any sites. the hotel bell man suggested we walk to the war rooms via the park. it was lovely and we might not have tried it...he provided a map that he used to indicate the path. such a pleasant surprise and a good thing to do when just off an overseas flight.

In England's Green and Pleasant Land.. This Park is in the middle of ceremonial London. On the way to Buckingham Palace one can either walk along the Mall or walk through this most delightful Park which is the oldest one in London. If the weather is clement one can take a seat in a deckchair and enjoy some people watching. From here one is in easy reach of The Horse Guards Parade and Trafalgar Square and numerous other sights. It is always a joy to be able to switch off in this little green paradise

Beautiful park on the heart of London. This is a beautiful park which connects Horse Guards Parade on one side and The Mall on the other plus Buckingham Palace is at the end. Great place to sit and have a picnic or just relax. Very close to Trafalgar Square and Parliament Square too.
Park Paradise. In a big polluted city this is its lungs that you need to experience. If you are lucky to walk it on a sunny day enjoy it as much as its dogs,ducks and swans do.
Not to miss . St. James's Park is a super cute and lovely Park, offering a nice view and many beautiful birds and plants. There is also a bistro where there is brunch available almost all day long.
Beautiful park. We like to walk in London, and St. James's Park is a nice park to spend an hour or two or just walk through.

Dont get lost in your peaceful thoughts. This place is the definition of serenity. Located just barely off the busy roads of London, this is a great place to recharge before you head back into town to check out some more sights!

Peace and beauty in London. London's parks are some of its best attractions.. St. James Park, just east of Buckingham Palace, is an excellent example of their park system. A tribute to them for maintaining a legacy over the ages.

Beautiful walk through the park and lots of wildlife.. A lovely park to walk through, starting at Buckingham Palace. There are loads of cute squirrels and various forms of bird life, making it a really interesting walk,

A beautiful park. We walked through here on the way to the rainforest cafe On reflection I wish we had just had a picnic here we only walked through a side of the park up horses guard RoadBut the area we walked was beautiful Past the edge of the lake We saw ducks swans geese herons Squirrels It was very clean and tidy you could almost forget you were in the middle of a huge cityAlso past the bird keepers cottage which again is beautiful

lovely walk. If you have the time take a stroll through St James's Park. You can easily plan to walk it going from the palace to westminster or vice versa. Lots of interesting water fowl to view, including Pelicans if you are lucky!

Beautiful Royal Park in the heart of London. Running alongside The Mall, St James Park is a tranquil green oasis in the heart of London. Home to dozens of squirrels, wild birds and the famous Pelicans, it's a popular spot with Londoners and tourists. Great place for a stroll or a picnic.
My favourite park in London!. Really nice park in London especially with family. Perhaps a bit crowded in the holidays but a must see for anyone visiting Londom.

Lovely place to meander. We just happened upon St. James Park and found it to be a lovely refreshing place to stroll. In between all the site seeing and rushing around, its nice to take a break and just sit on the grass, have a snack and watch the water fowl float around on the pond. It made for a relaxing hour of just doing nothing.

Beautiful Park. The park is super amazing. There were a lot of interesting squirelles and it's a nice 10 minute walk to the Buckingham palace. There were so many squirelles and pigeons. One of the squirelles even walked across my legs. It's really convinient for a nice walk as it's really central. I would recommond to not bring any food as the squirelles and pigeons are looking for that. We saw one woman that was feeding the pigeons and they wouldn't stop following her and constantly sat on her shoulders.
Cool!. We hadn't even planned on going here, but it was on the way from the Abbey to Piccadilly Square, so we walked through it and it was beautiful. Looks nice and well taken care of.
Quiet surroundings. Just the place to chill out after tourists attractions. We had a splendid cup of thee and a nice sandwich while just enjoying the peace all around

Peaceful. It might sound strange but in busy London and with all the people around. It does not feel overcrowded or stressful, in fact it is the total opposite. It a great park to walk through from Buckingham Palace to the other museums. There are always squirrels running around, some of them are even posers. There are ducks and other birds in the river. The lawns are looked after.
What a quiet place !. Even the changing of the Guards in Buckingham Palace, St James's Park is a very pleasant and quiet place in center London.Just for a walk or for running..
Beautiful Park in downtown London. Walked through this park and it was so nice, huge old trees, flowers and lots of open space, a great spot to have a lunch and rest from site seeing.

London's best royal park. St James's park is my personal favourite of the royal parks. Located right in the centre of Westminster, SJP is an oasis of calm in the chaos of central London. Don't miss the pelicans who live on pelican island in the lake at the Horse guards Parade end of the park.
Nice stroll. A great park to have a morning stroll and enjoy a little breathing space after being in the city for a while.

Lovely Walk in the Park. We walked the length of the park, from the National Gallery to Buckingham Palace. After the hustle and bustle of Trafalgar Square, it was a delightful walk. We took a look at Buckingham Palace, then continued through Green Park to Hyde Park--all quite enjoyable.

Take time to smell the roses. We were told to make sure we spent some time in the parks around London. All the locals do and we were not disappointed we rested and people watched. The duck pond is adorable.
lovely park. Lovely well kept park, great for sitting having a bite to eat or taking a lazy stroll. Reat place for taking photos

Great park near piccadilly and political centre of old blighty. Great park near piccadilly and political centre of old blighty.
St James Park is just a lovely park to relax in, walk around and observe the sights, also a great start to undertake a green walk through the centre of London.

Enchanting. Chilling and enchanting park in the heart of London, with all sorts of spectacular birds. Had a nice time enjoying my morning coffee in the company of crows, wildfowls, swans and squirrels.
lovely park in central london. great place to wonder round and close to Buckingham palace, worth detouring and having a slow paced stroll through on a nice day

St. James Park. With it's central location we crossed thru St James Park several times during our last visit. It's clean, well maintained. St James Park subtly sits on the frings of many of London's most famnous landmarks. Buckingham Palace, Parliament, Trafalgar Square

Not what it was.................... Maybe I look back with rose tinted glasses but I found St James Park to have become rather tatty and downbeat from what I remember from years gone by. Perhaps its all down to austerity and council cutbacks but this area of London should be a showpiece to its many visitors from around the world. Too much litter, not enough benches and gardens and flower beds which Victorian gardeners would have been ashamed of in earlier times.
One of the wonderful parks of London. Beautiful. Stay aware of runners, cyclists and walkers all converging on this jewel of central London. Worth a walk through.

beauty and quiet in downtown london. With it's central location we crossed thru St James Park several times during our last visit. It's clean, well maintained and very nice for a stroll away from London traffic

Overlooked? Shouldn't be. St James Park subtly sits on the frings of many of London's most famnous landmarks. Buckingham Palace, Parliament, Trafalgar Square, Horse Guard's parade to name but a few. Perhaps this is why it gets less press from other Royal Parks. Maybe tourists see it as a thoroughfare between photo shoots and workers as a quiet break spot away from the pressures of the corridors of power.Yet it is so much more. St James boasts some of the finest landscaping and thus views of all the London parks. The stunning lightshow it enjoys each sunrise and sunset is amazing. It is a beautifully manicured space with delightful walkways, water features and bridges.Highlights are the bandstand shows and the deck-chairs which one can hire to relax in the tranquility as thousnads of visitors have done so before.Justwatch out for the pigeopn guzzling stork!
See the Pelicans. A lovely park with scrupulous maintenance. Teaming with birdlife. Full of tourist photographing squirills for some reason.
A lovely London Park in Autumn. The gardens are lovely, the lake has pelicans as well as the normal water birds and you can walk to see Buckingham Palace.
One of the better royal gardens. Cleaner and quiter than the other royal parks. This is where brides often come to get pictures taken.
The other "green" park next to The Mall. Wonderful location. perfect place to view guards change along side, feel free to march next to the guards on the green grass!perfect spot to view state visit!

Nature's boon to London. It is a beautiful place. Amid huge buildings and traffic chaos it is a place where you can enjoy the tranquility of nature and soothe your eyes with little wonderful creatures, lovely plantation and blossoms. I really enjoyed being here. its indeed nature's boon to London.

perfect for watching the ducks. This park is surrounded by some of the best London landmarks - Buckingham Palace, Horseguards parade and Whitehall.There is a great lake that is home to ducks, geese, swans, coots, pelicans and moorhens. You could take a picnic and sit on the benches alongside the lake enjoying the sights of the birds taking off and landing. What could be better on a sunny afternoon.
