Great spot to be one with nature and self reflection!!. This park was part of a tour I took on a walk through near Buckingham Palace. It is worth a visit as to its vastness of walk through path, time spent with family or friends, or self-reflection. Experience nature and have a chance to relax!!

Great place. Excellent, well maintained. It is a very nice visit, very quietly, lot of birds, good directions, places to have some snacks, a good restaurant, close to everything. Ideal to have lunch in the park.
Peaceful- Beautiful Getaway. Love strolling down the parks and St James's is by far my favorite park in the city. Recommended to take a few pictures with a professional camera. Vibrant and clean!

A delightful park right in the middle of London. St James' Park is nicely located near to Whitehall and the Palace, so makes a very good stopping place for coffee or a snack. The little birds are pretty tame and'll eat crumbs from your hand, too!

Underrated gem. Take time to visit this park - it is peaceful, pretty and well designed.
Much cosier than the mainstream Hyde Park, it is perfect for a walk or a fancy photo session.

Another decent park. A nice park to stroll through between destinations however there are nicer out there in London if you are planing to go to a park specifically. For this I would recommend Regents or Hyde Park.
Squirrels and ducks!. Don't forget to take some food for squirrels and ducks when you go here. They are really funny and friendly.

London's most intimate central park!. This is a really beautiful park, with fairy-tale lake, pelicans, wonderful trees and flowers plus sight of 2 royal palaces! Lovely for a stroll, picnic or en route to the Changing of the Guard ceremony at 11.00am.

In the middle of London, a breath of fresh air!. ... and I really mean it. London is a fabulous Place, full of everything, but there are also a couple of large, well-maintained parks. And St. James`s park is, on my opinion, the best. A small heaven on earth, meaning London. Take an hour and visit it!

In and around is a day out, if you want it to be. Established in 1603 James's Park has an interesting history but you don't need to know it to enjoy the park. It is a pleasant park with a lake and two islands. One of which has Pelicans. It is about the size of 30 football pitches. There's views of Buckingham palace framed by trees - perhaps, the best view of the palace is there. The park is the most easterly of a virtually continuous strip of parks: Green Park, Hyde Park, and Kensington Gardens. Get there by tube and head for one of St. James's Park or Green Park. You could choose Victoria, or Westminster tube stations as alternatives. The park is bounded by Buckingham Palace to the west, The Mall to the north, Horse Guards to the east, and Birdcage Walk to the south. It meets Green Park at Queen's Gardens with the famous Victoria Memorial at its centre (opposite the entrance to Buckingham Palace). The smaller palace, St. James's Palace, is on the opposite side of The Mall. So you could easily have a day out looking in and around the park. If you're up to the walking a visit to Buckingham Palace is best done in this context I find. Somehow you see it better.

Past through on way to Changing of the Guards at Buckingham. The highlight of this park for me was the "Queens Swans," and the View of the Castle across the pond. Saint James Court where the Royal Guards Residence, Beefeaters, and Royal Band is across the street from the park. They all assemble outside the residence and the band starts playing. Escorted by the Royal Guards on horseback it was an amazing sight to see them come out of the residence line up with precision and march to Buckingham Palace to the changing of the guards.

lovely place to chill out. London is a very hectic city so it's always nice to chill out in St. James's park and sit on a bench and watch the people and the birds and rest your feet. There are also toilets in the park which are well maintained - 20p. This is a lovely area of peace and greenery right in the heart of the city and close to Buckingham Palace. Just sit and rest awhile and feel the heart of London beating around you.

Squirrels... Ahw!!!. After a day running around and visiting places with some friends who came over from Japan, we went to visit St James Park... we suddenly realised we were quite tired and decided to rest our feet and relax a bit. Amazingly 2 squirrels just stood in front of us, probably waiting for some food.. My friends couldn't believe their eyes, they had never seen such friendly squirrels before. We managed to relax and enjoyed the beautiful park just opposite Buckingham Palace
great walk. we took the queens walk from green park station to here. love people watching and looking at the nature full of life. If the weather is good grab a rental chair for a pound.

Nice park to escape the hustle and bustle. One of my favourite London Parks. Nice to escape the crowds and chill out on a park bench or grass and to feed the many birds. Nice to walk around too. Nice green space.

How can you sensibly "rate" such a lovely place?. The rating "excellent" bears no relationship to the type of place this is. How can such a lovely, historic piece of London be described simply as "excellent"? On a fine summer´s morning in Old London Town, what could be better than a stroll, perhaps with a love interest, through this lovely place?? Thought-provoking? Dreamlike? Excellent? Go figure.

A chilled afternoon watching the world go by after spring rain. After being caught in a shower we ended up wandering round the park on a lovely sunny sunday evening.A quick bite to eate and wander by the river was a nice way to relax before we headed home

Excellent for a run. Super nice park, next to Buckingham Palace, with a lake in middle, full of all sort of birds. Landscaping is also amazing, and if you need to for a run, the loop around the lake is 1 mile pretty much. IF you can navigate through the people! ;))

My Favourite park in London. A place to dream, relax, walk, kick back and breathe.The loveliest place and a must visit.Whether it be Spring, Summer, Autumn or winter this park has something to offer. Plus Pelicans hang out here.A absolute joy.
Love this park. I love this park - worth grabbing a blanket and having a picnic (with champagne of course!) on the grounds. In the summer it is world class but its beautiful year round.
Wish we had more time!. We were with a tour group so had a time limit. It would be great to spend several hours there. Great for people watching and relaxing.
Great Scenery!. The park had great scenery and a nice river flowing through will squirrels and birds (aquatic and air birds) and right next to Buckingham Palace which is good!
Beautiful gardens and water features. St. James Park is beautiful and a peaceful haven from the noise and bustle the city. It has several interesting water features as well as planted and open spaces
Beautiful. Bring nuts for squirells and bread for birds. Very nice park definately better and more worth to visit than Hide park
A Beautiful Walk. We enjoyed a delightful walk through St James' Park from Horse Guards' Parade to Buckingham Palace. It is very picturesque with lovely lakes and lovely shade in summer.

Relaxing park with many animals. This is a lovely park, close to Buckingham Palace and also to a tube station. There's a narrow lake with many types of animals around, mainly ducks, swans, doves and squirrels. There are benches to sit on, though these were almost all occupied on a Saturday afternoon when I visited. Nice relaxing atmosphere.

Beautiful Park! Even in Winter!. Love England's Parks. In a huge city like London - Green Space is so important. Even in Winter St. James's Park provided some excellent photo ops! Just a pretty park to stroll through no matter what season it is. And when viewing the Changing of the Guards at Buckingham Palace you are already right by St. James's Park!

Beautiful Park. Great clean and beautiful park. If you want to get to know the local squirrels bring some peanut's in the shell and they will climb right up your leg and grab it from you. Was a fun time and made a cool picture.
an excellant park. I went with my cousin who had never been and she enjoyed it enormously it is excellent for all ages and is lovely to just walk through if your in the area
Green lungs of London. St James's Park gives a welcome relief from the busy streets of London. Have a look at the Horse Guard and St James's Palace.

Lovely Park and Free. St James is nestled within some of the biggest attractions in London, Buckingham Palace, Palace of Westminster, Churchill War rooms, London Eye and Dungeons to name a name a few are all within easy walking distance of this park. Thus is a great place to meander about taking a break from the cultural excesses of the city. It abounds with very approachable wildlife and best of all is free.

Disney eat your heart out .... Class cannot be bought at any price.. I have always loved St James's Park, I have to have been there 10,000 times, love the water, the wildfowl and birds and as for the views, stunning, from the bridge, you get to see the Palace (Buck House) and the back of Whitehall, Big Ben and nowadays the Eye in the Sky (the wheel). Stunning flower arrangements too, playground, toilets and bars serving up an array of foods I personally would not wish to eat and cheap it is not. I remember Goldie the eagle escaping London Zoo and preying upon the ducks here 4 or 5 decades ago. I wonder how Goldie is doing these days :o)

Nice Park. St. James park is nestled between many of London's top attractions. We walked through St. James Park on our way to both Houses of Parliament and Buckingham Palace; also it was only a short walk to the Big Ben. Lots of benches or grass area to sit and relax. We saw some swans swimming in the pond when we strolled through.

Beautiful London Park. Beautiful park in central London.Plenty of ducks, swans, squirrels and geese and greenery dealing with locals and tourists.Nice walk and views during and day and walked thru at night and felt very safe.Bought and enjoyed an ice cream cone to complete the experience!
Colourful. Work near here and very pleasant and green. Lovely sitting on the lawn or on benches in the summer. The plants are well kept.
love love love. One of the most beautiful oasis in the middle of an amazing city.The best place to just take a moment if you're rushing between sights. One of my must-see when taking friends around.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park, with lovely flowers. Nice and relaxing atmosphere and nice to get away from traffic and the noise of London. Cute little squirrels and birds.
Great garden viewing. This area is one of the best in London as with the adjoining park being relatively compact but very accessible it has actual gardens rather than endless lawns..

Lovely Park. Really like this park, good size for a nice stroll and close to numerous attractions including Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey. Lovely lake and variety of wildlife to see in the park. It is the oldest of the 8 Royal Parks and worth the visit.

October walk around St James Park. If you are in the park go and see the pelicans. The bird life is amazing comprising ducks, geese, swans including a black swan, herons etc. Most of the wildlife can be seen up close.

One of London's beautiful green spaces. Beautiful park with interesting bird life, a nice place to go for a walk or a jog and a must-see if you're a visitor to London. Bang in the middle of all kinds of attractions (Buckingham Palace, Horse Guards Parade, Trafalgar Square and Hyde Park etc). Equally lovely on a sunny day or in the mist & rain.

Always walk through here. I always walk through ere whenever I'm up visiting central london. Throughout the year you can see all the changes that go with this park, the park staff are planting beds according to the season an they are beautiful to see when out in bloom. Plenty of water birds to look at and feed although you can't feed the Pelicans and I don't recommend feeding the squirrels they can and do bite. Use the park as a shortcut to trafalgar Square and there is plenty to see.
Relexing. A relaxing place for friends and family to share a moment during weekend. And it is so close to Sherlock Homes museum.
Wildlife . Makes for a really nice walk especially due to all the wildlife around the park. It makes for a nice time waster if u have to wait for a coach.

Nice Large Park near Buckingham Palace.. Very well manicured park and full of gorgeous flowers. We stopped here while visitng Buckingham Palace. Nice to see if you are close, otherwise - I would not travel here just to see the park.
Beautiful Park. beautiful....a great place to spend a nice stroll through a park. One of the nicer areas to take in. Beautiful gardens and ponds with a glimpse of Buckingham palace on one end.

A quiet oasis. This park reminds me a bit of New York's Central Park, although it's more manageable in size. It's located near other attractions as well, so it's a nice place to step away from some of the hustle and bustle.

One word: Squirrels. The first time I was in London I stumbled across this park and its very tame squirrels. Whenever I'm back I make sure to buy some nuts so I can feed them to the squirrels, who are so tame that they actually climbed onto my thighs :) adorable!

Great for a stroll while visiting Buck House!. It was an average sort of day but the place was alive with people and wildlife. Squirrels were looking quite tame and the ducks, geese and other waterfowl seemed oblivious to the tourists. Lots of places to get a coffee, ice cream or waffle.

Avoid weekends. St. James's Park is the prettiest of London's major parks. It has more trees, waters, and birds than the others. It is crowded on weekends with a lot of second hand smoke. If you time it right, you can see the guards returning from the Palace Changing of the Guards at Wellington Barracks across the street on Birdcage Walk. The little bridge between Queen Anne's Gate and Marlborough Gate offers a great photo op with the London Eye in the background, especially when the sun is low in the sky.
Not to be missed. What a beautiful park. Plenty of great views. Very friendly wild life. Wish I could have spent more time here

An enjoyable few hours. I loved St James's Park. Although very busy with tourists, it didn't feel too claustrophobic and we were able to find a bench to sit on relatively easily. My mum and I had a leisurely walk around, admiring all the ducks and different water foul. We especially loved the two white pelicans, which were much bigger than we had expected. Not forgetting the cheeky little squirrels which are in abundance and very daring by taking nuts from people's hands. There are plenty of information boards dotted around with pictures and explanations of the resident birds in the park, which you can read whilst enjoying a coffee from one of the food outlets in the park.

St. James Park - a feeling of tranquility. Well maintained and just outside of Buckingham Palace. The green space was very relaxing. Within walking distance of more interesting sites like Trafalgar Square, London Eye, Downing Street - great historical and educational area

Light flavored park. St James park is a nice walk. It's a nice sized park laying close to Buckingham palace and is frequented by tourists and locals alike all year. It's tree lined with several ice cream and coffee stands all along the way. The main area is a lake in the central part of the lake filled with ducks, geese and other migratory birds. There are squirrels being chased by asian children, and many spots for photographic opportunities especially a bridge in the mid point of the park which crosses the center of the lake. Mind you, you will have to wait for gourds of people to pass and quickly take your picture when you have a brief opening. It is that busy.Overall a nice relaxing walk where you can stop and sit on benches for a rest.

Easy stroll through the park on your way to so many attractions. We walked through St. James Park on our way to both Houses of Parliament one day and Buckingham Palace another. Some very good waterfowl birding. Don't miss the pelicans, but even if you do there are ducks, coots and we saw a great blue heron! Very pretty. St. James in nestled between many of London's top attractions, so why not walk through and enjoy?

A park amongst all the hustle and bustle. A very good place to take time off from all the sightseeing. Very central but very close to all the usual highlights of London. Beautiful trees and shade in an English summer.

Lovely Landscaping. The most central park and, in my opinion, the most beautiful. You must walk bikes through, but that gives you a chance to take in all of the gorgeous flowers, thick tree coverage, and pond full of ducks. The views from the bridge are great!
Perfect park to spend the day. A picturesque park with amazing wildlife; ducks, swans and tamed squirrels. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful park close to Big Ben. We were looking for a place to eat our lunch and found a bench in this park. Great nature and wildlife, they even have pelicans! Squirrels were adorable. After we finished our food we walked along the pond to Buckingham Palace.

Enjoy nature. A very refreshing way to have a pause in your way between the visit to Buckingham Palace and the visit to Westminster area (Parliament or Abbey).Enjoy the nature, grab a sandwich, take a time on a bench to see the birds and the area.Go then toward 10 Downing Street area through many buldings filled with history.

A beautiful place to sit down and relax in Royal London. Such a quiet and beautiful place to work and contemplate life in the very heart of Royal London. Look closely and you may event see the odd minor Royal out for a jog ..... St James's is a great place for a picnic lunch after watching the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. You can normally see the oncoming guard rehearsing through the railing of the adjacent Wellington (he of Duke fame) before about 10am.

Another lovely place to walk (or cut through!). Walking through St. James's and seeing all of the people sunning in the striped lawn chairs, looking down to one end to see Buckingham Palace, enjoying the beautiful plantings...fantastic!
Awesome views!. Beautiful English gardens with swans and cranes and ducks. A very nice walk from square to square. Very picturesque for photog.

Peace and quiet . A beautiful space close to Buckingham Palace. Paths to wander around, benches to relax on. Enjoy the ducks and geese. Watch the squirrels. Have something to eat and drink at the kiosks or restaurant.
Stunning.. Free and beautiful. Right next to Buckingham Palace. From the bridge you can get great photos of the Palace and London

Beautiful Park, with hundreds of squirrels!. Looking for something to do thats free and relaxing? Take a stroll around St James' Park. Very pretty, can usually find a quiet spot and close by to lots of other venues.

Great Park. What a beautiful park. You can visit Buckingham Palace and after walk for hours in the park. So many birds, ducks, swans on the water and many many flower beds. The trees are huge and it is a very clean park. Lots of benches to rest and beautiful views. Great spot for pictures.
Beautiful walk on way to Churchill War Rooms.... It was a beautiful day in London (lucky us) and we enjoyed our walk through St. James's Park. Lots of lively activity, very green and clean.

Great place right next to Buckingham Palace. You'll find St. James Park right next to the Buckingham Palace, and only a short walk from Big Ben.It is such a lovely park. Go for a walk and enjoy the lovely, calming scenery. There are animals and birds living along the riverside. Bring a bag of peanuts, and the squirrels will eat them right out of your hand.
Tranquil park in the middle of London. Great venue for a day with good weather. This park is well maintained and has good spots to relax or picnic
Lovely. One of the best parks I have ever been too. The most amazing thing there were the squirrels who love to communicate with people trying to get some food.

stopping for a break in a Fantastic place. one of the best places to go and relax after doing the London rounds , the squirrels come up to be fed , views are Beautiful and the walks most pleasant , after a rest a nice walk up the Mall to Horse guard Parade
Lovely tranquil stroll. We had a lovely walk through this park and our grand-daughters loved the amount of ducks, swans, geese and were really excited by pelicans.

Beautiful at any time of year. The park gardeners deserve an award: there are always flowers galore whatever time you visit. The daffodils in Spring are fabulous. The birdlife is wonderful. You can even get a season ticket on a deck chair if you fancy a bet on the English weather.

Beautiful. The scenery. The views. The water. The flowers. Beautiful. Be sure to at least walk through if not have a picnic in the park. The squirrels will walk right up to you and eat right out of your hand, so cute.
Time to relax. ... No words to describe this amazing park. A lot of green, beautiful trees ,squirrels...everything is so clean and peaceful. ..just sitting here and just enjoy the silence.

Park leads to everywhere!. All the parks in London are special, but this one is near the Portrait Museum and Horse's Parade area. The black swans in the small lakes are the highlight for me. Great for a jog of stroll.

Amazing park, great way to see British culture. St James' Park is a great place to visit. At one end you can see the changing of the guard, with the queen's guard and their horses. It's a definite place for tourists to get that typical London photo.
Idealic surroudings. Beautiful park in glorious surroudings ideal for all occaisions wether You need a walk or some quiet time
Loverly clean very pretty park. Beautiful park clean and the grandchildren loved the ducks and swans loverly park to sit and have a picnic will go again next time we in London.

Beware the friendly squirrels!!. I love coming to this park. Situated between Buckingham Palace and The Horse Guard Parade ground, it is something to enjoy and a pleasure to stroll through. As we were walking through the park a squirrel came running towards my girlfriend and I. I made the effort to move aside but it continued on it's straight path towards me. I stopped to assess what was going to happen- well this little squirrel put it's little foot on my foot looked up at me and then proceeded to climb up my leg. Of course my sudden movement made it jump off me but the surprise was well worth the laugh and I will always appreciate the kindness and trust of the English Squirrel!Don't use the Mall to get from point A to B- take advantage of this lovely park and enjoy the views!
PEACEFUL HAVEN. beautiful park - right next door to buckingham palace. perfectly maintained gardens and a peaceful haven fromm the hustle and bustle in the mall,

great place for a walk or to relax. Lovely place in the middle of London. Lovely park not to big but yet not to small.Close to the palace, horse guards parade and Trafalgar square.Easy to get to as buses are close by and they take you to stations and places to shop. Not far away you have places to eat and drink.Lots of benches or grass area to sit and chill. Nice pond to look at the nature and animals. Love it here defo place to go and visit and so nice in hot warm weather.

A good place to take a break and relax. We stopped here to take a break from the hustle and bustle of sightseeing. We were fortunate that hardly anyone else was there at the time so it was very peaceful and relaxing. Just a good place to unwind.

So serene and beautiful and close to all the major attractions of Westminster. Our hotel was adjacent to Westminster Bridge and so we went for a 15 minute walk up the road to Buckingham Palace, along the edge of St James Park. It was on the return trip that we ventured into the park and stumbled across gardens, lakes, an island with wildlife in the middle of the lake , a cottage, views across to the London Eye and Whitehall. What a treasure right in the middle of the tourist precinct. At the end you can walk back to Trafalgar Square.

A beautiful park in the heart of London. I last walked through St James's Park this summer. The gardens are so wonderfully tended and it is a joy to see the visitors to London mixing with the residents and everyone enjoying this beautiful space.
Go for a Stroll!. A lovely park perfect to wander through on your way to Buckingham Palace. Very pretty with a nice, open and inviting feel.
Take a Stroll in the Park. Worth taking the time for a leisurely stroll... It's a beautiful park - smaller and more intimate than Hyde Park.
Beautiful, easy walk.. Beautiful! Lots of birds and small wildlife. Great, easy walk from Buckingham Palace to Central London.
Beautiful . Fantastic in the summer.Had picnic and asleep.It is a very relaxing atmosphere but can be a bit noisy on a Saturday during the hot summer when tourists are around

A wonderful piece of tranquillity. Not a lot to say really, a lovely little park with plenty of places to relax right in the west end. A coffee shop to get a drink, beautiful walks & even a small kids play area.
Lovely. Lovely park definitely worth a visit loads of fab birds and nice place to eat your lunch on a sunny day
London half. Beautiful, even in October. Stayed near by, ran a half marathon through it. Lovely spot to view Buckingham Palace.

Beautiful Park near Buckingham Palace. This is a lovely park near Buckingham Palace with lots of waterfowl on the ponds. There is also a nice walking path and numerous benches. However if you sit in the striped canvas chairs, you will be asked to pay a fee.

Gorgeous park. Gorgeous park, filled with fabulous wildlife, including Pelicans and very tame squirrels, so be careful when picnicking as I'm sure the squirrels wouldn't think twice about stealing a sarnie. Gorgeous views of the palace whilst taking a breather from the bustle of the city.

A park for reflection after seeing the sights in Westminster. It's the nicest park in London with lake, gardens and plenty of wildlife. It's bordered by The Mall on one side and Birdcage Walk on the other with Horseguards Parade at one end and Buckingham Palace at the other. What better place to relax.
We were lucky to enjoy unusually warm sunshine in late September.

Great place to relax in the Centre of London. I took my 16 year old niece through there and she was very taken with the bird life on the pond and the friendly squirrels there too. If its a nice day it's a great place to stroll through on your way to Buckingham Palace.

One of the best free attractions in London.. Always pleasant to visit. One of the few things you can do for free. A stroll through from Horseguards across to the Park, through the gardens and to sit and watch the water fowl and squirrels is a lovely way to pass some time, especially if the weather is fine. There is a good view of the London Eye from the war memorial and many people photograph it rising out of the buildings along Whitehall.One of London's tradition attractions still relatively unchanged. It is also one of the few places you can find a "comfort station"/ Public Convenience locally.

Great, green, lush. Great park, as everyone else agrees, for a stroll near the bustling city centre. Get away from it all. Plenty of local squirrels and other wildlife, otherwise known as tourists! Go here, it's a beautiful stroll in autumn.
Birds. Water, paths birds, walk paths being close to the Buckingham Palace, it is always crowded. If you don't mind the crowd, than you are i heaven.
Lovely place to relax. Adjacent to the Buckingham Palace, one can see the House Guard Parade from here. This a nice place for a walk or spend a day in the greens. Kids would love this place
Beautiful place. Located right across Buckingham Palace, this is a beautiful park. Spent a lot of time near the water, looking at the gorgeous flowers everywhere.

Beautiful park close to Tourist Attractions. Walk down to St James's Park after visiting Buckingham Palace then visit the spectacular Horse Guards Parade ground in front of the park and take pictures with the guards and horses close to Downing Street. There are beautiful buildings all around and lots of interesting statues and monuments and Churchill's cabinet war rooms to see close by. There are pelicans in the island in the centre of the park. Perfect for a picnic lunch on a warm day or visit the cafe which has very good food.

Nice view. In the heart of london, the capital of gothic horror has also some beatiful parks on a sunny day.not too big but the view on the river is amazing. You can have a good time sitting on abench reading a book or playing with your phone. You may even feel like a victorian gentlman at times when there's not so many people and the view takes you back 150 years.

Take a walk in this park!. St. James is one of the most beautiful, people friendly parks in London. We visited there this past July. We walked amongst the trees and people watched. It is in one of the most convenient areas of town as there is a Tube station nearby, it is near Buckingham Palace and is surrounded by many pubs. It's one of the cheap things to do in London. It costs nothing to be there. It is a place for young and old, Londoners and foreigners alike to visit and relax. You can spend an hour or the whole day. I wish I were there right now!
Very picturesque. Very picturesque park. Full to the brim with wildlife, lots of birds especially. Not as big as the likes of regents park but lovely place.
Relaxing park. Really wanted to go there as everyone was saying that it is nice, and so I confirm that! Very central and I absolutely loved it!

Always nice to visit a park in the big city. A beautiful Park. Lots of geese, ducks, herons and very tame squirrels. The park is usually very busy, but as it's close to Buckingham palace that's understandable.
Sweet little garden. A good place to reset in a long walk thru London monuments..Even if it rains, ducks make up for everything
A nice park in the middle of the city. Lots of people, plenty of room. Relaxing little walk in the city. Lots of wild life to look at. and inspite of the crowds still feels calm.

Santa Monica Of London. great park in summer I would label it as London beach as the mood of people mimicked like Santa Monica beach atmosphere.couples, people from all across, fitness freak, the Beer lovers, kids with there parents, people in mood to enjoy warmth and sunlight also called as amphibian homo sapiens had ascended in thousands and the atmosphere was superb with temperature at 30 plus degree Celsius I think i enjoyed the park and people of london and some people like me called citizens of the world. recommend everyone to relax at his lovely park

Gorgeous Park in London. This is a stunning park I loved it. The walk toward Buckingham Palace with the manicured gardens will take your breath away. The bird keepers swiss chalet cottage is gorgeous, great picture opportunity.

Another wonderful park in London!. This park is gorgeous. If you love trees, grass and wildlife, it's all here. Look one way from the little bridge and you can see Buckingham Palace; look another way and you can see Pall Mall.

Must see - St James Park - right near Horseguards and Buckingham Palace. So peaceful - pretty and relaxing - away from the hustle & bustle. These are also the friendliest squirrels. Bring a healthy snack for them and they'll eat out of your hand.
great. great park. wish we had more time to enjoy. make sure you have time to stroll. wish we did. so close to the place.

one of the best aprks in London. Squeezed in between Picadilly and the Mall, St Jame's Park is a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the tourist centre of London. It also links up with Hyde Park, Buckingham Palace, the Houses of Parliament, Picadilly Circus and Trafalgar Square. Enjoy a stroll, enjoy the peace, use it to walk between the sights.
Lovely Park. Lovely park which is good for strolling through, looking at the wildfowl , nice plants, good location

Most beautiful park in London. I always visited this park in summer, and it is a beautiful place, full of flowers, birds, ducks, even swans and pelicans! The roads beside the lake are a lovely walk to do, even with a bit of rain. I really love this place.

Lovely place to spend a few hours.. One of the many great parks in London where you can spent a couple of hours with a picnic, book or just good company. There is also a lake running through the middle of it which often has birds in it.
Great park for a sunny day. This park is right next to Buckingham palace and is a great place to explore on a sunny day. Similar to Central park in Manhattan.
Great walk away from the roads. Great park well maintained wild life is also very good if your in London well worth a stroll through to The Palace or Horse Guards parade.
August!. Not as large as some of the other parks in London, it is lush and very well maintained. Has a small but nice water body in the center
Pleasent walk. Nice walk near Buckingham Palace. We watched the Beefeaters prepare for the changing of the guard near here.

Delightful Summer Walk. St. James's Park is one of our favorite places. The gardens are lovely. Water and waterfowl are easily accessible by beautiful paths. We particularly like eating at Inn the Park.
Amazing. What a beautiful park it was, my daughter enjoyed her visit so much. We bought ice cream and fed the birds and squirrels.there are benches were you can sit and relax.clean park.

"A stroll in the Park". Before or lunch meal we went for a walk around the park, the children liked the wide open spaces, they also liked the lake and couldn't understand the amount of people walking around it compared to our local park…
I did explain.
Nice park. Nice park with many banches between Buckingham palace and others Londons interesting places. If yoz have take a rest,this place is fine!
Beautiful park - nice 30-minute walk. This park is beautiful. There are many lanes to choose as you walk through it. Very peaceful. Amazing oasis in the middle of the city.

Relaxing walk. We walked through the park at dusk after visiting Buckingham Palace. It was a lovely way to spend an hour, meandering through the trails and watching the ducks and pelicans. Beautiful views of the palace and the London Eye from the bridge.

Beware of rogue squirrels. Otherwise beautiful park.. Beware the squirrels. The signs say don't feed them.. for good reason. Before we saw the signs was gave them some pistachio nuts. One squirrel came up to me and tried to climb my leg to get the bag!!

Place to relax. Swans, beautiful views, total silence in the middle of London. I could see in my imagenation how royal people have spend time here.
Nice way to relax after busy day

A walk in the park. A small oasis in the buzzing heart of London. The confident and freedom of the squirrels and birds creates a wonderful sense of calm. It can get incredibly busy, but on a warm spring day or autumns day, it can feel a little like a walk through the secret garden.
Great when there are Exhibits. There was a special exhibit when we went to the park. I think the park is nice, and very well kept. I like that it was close to the hotel.

Beautiful, perfect for a day out.. This is a wonderful thing to do whilst in London. The park is so pretty and you can see Buckingham palace from it. The lake and the fountains are stunning, perfect for a stroll.
Stunning little park. Stunning little park between Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards Parade. Such a nice place to walk to avoid the crush of the Mall at busy times

Wonderful. We always take a walk through here as it is always buzzing with lots of things to see.You have the choice of just sitting in the sunshine on the many benches or strolling and feeding the ducks and swans. The squirrels are a delight. There is no rush, rush. just open fresh air and relaxation. Even those jogging seem to be enjoying it all! A definite must ....
Relaxing. Lovely park, so nice to just relax or cross the city's green lung to get to the next point of interest.

Love the parks in London!. All of the parks and gardens in London are amazing and this one is no different. If you have time and the weather is nice, go for a wander and soak up the beautiful surroundings!

Scenic. We strolled around the park for hours it's very scenic and a lovely place to have a picnic. Very clean with plenty of rubbish bins the park is kept very well . A great place to chill out and enjoy nature.
Better organised than Hyde park. Nice walking place, a bit better organised than Hyde park - no muddy alleys and some more diversified greenery.

Nice park to travel through. This was the first park we walked through in London and it was lovely. The little lake was very pretty and it's a great walk before or after visiting the household Calvary museum.

Beautiful park, a break from a hectic London. It's gorgeous! We can be delighted with a walk in this park and it's a great path towards the Buckingham Palace. I went there on sunny day , which just helped with the amazing view I could enjoyed of the gardens and animal life. It's really refreshing. you can't miss it.

A must in Newcastle. This is an impressive stadium which hosts the FC Newcastle United. Most of the places are roof covered. We had the pleasure to attend the game against Watford and the atmosphere was wonderful even if Newcastle lost 1-2.the all thing is well organised and we enjoyed the game in complete security.
Great little park. St. James is a beautiful little park right behind the Ministry of Defense. It has everything youd want in a small park with every last detail accounted for.
Beautiful park!. Took a lazy afternoon walk after we had our awesome lunch! Park is very tranquil and you see all kinds of people in the park! With children with parents couple etc. Nice park!
A great walk on a sunny day. On a sunny day, the walk in this park is a must. Different flour type, people will be having sun tan, very nice atmosphere indeed.

take a snap? whynot. If you do not know to spare your time, go there.
If you are tired for your work, go there.
If you are tired on your trip, go there.

Beautiful Park. We enjoyed strolling around in this park, capturing the nature with our cameras. There were residence big bird (not sure what they were)... Both were huge!
As we came in March, it was end of winter so we could only see branches... It was a peaceful and lax park!

Great park with lots of birds and squirrels. Great park to walk in central London with kids. Good combination with the change of guards at Buckingham Palace (check the days on which they change), especially with kids. Look out for the Pelicans in the lake and the black swans. For the kids there is a nice play ground on the southwest side of the park (near Buckingham Palace), with a coffee stand next to it (and bathrooms for kids). Kids also love to feed some nuts to the cute little squirrels.

Beautifully manicured. Interesting History. If you have to walk from Buckingham Palace/Victoria Memorial to the Admiralty Arch/ Trafalgar Square or Horse Guards Rd, skip the Mall, take the park. It is a much more pleasant way to get to your destination. Paved pathways along a waterscape, with ample benches to sit and people watch or birdwatch. Stop along the way to have a "cuppa" at Inn the Park- a clean bistro with excellent views of Duck Island and the fountain. There is also a nice outside patio and free wifi.

A nice tranquil setting. A nicely kept park which was nice to walk through in the middle of the city. Well maintained and clean and an abundance of water birds and squirrels all very relaxed in their environment.

Beautiful Walkway in Central London. This is a beautiful walk in central London, and it leads right up to Buckingham Palace. My suggestion is to do what we did, watch the changing of the Horse Guards at their building early in the morning (10 am on Sunday), then tour the museum on-site. After this, walk up St. James's Park to Buckingham Palace. It's very picturesque.
Look for the Black Swans. We love this park, beautiful and always colorful with many different types of birds! In particular I liked the black swans
Great. Very nice place to walk around and enjoy the nature! The squirrels are super cute and friendly so dont forget to bring nuts for great picture :D
Tame birds and squirrels.. You can feed geese and other birds with seeds. You can also give some nuts for squirrels and see many interesting birds.

Lot's of birds and squirrels. very easy to access it, the park is on the road to Buckingham Palace, you can't miss it. This green oasis is special for the fact that there a lot of birds and squirrels in the area and all of them are waiting for you to feed them. It could be a good-relaxing break on a day of visiting.

Lovely park. This park is nice to walk through - I wouldn't make a special trip to see it, but if you are in the area (e.g. walking from Westminster to Buckingham Palace) it's worth deviating slightly to walk through it.

Bird watching in the park. This is a lovely park, plenty of wildlife to see. Beautiful flowers and plants along the lake. Take a look at the bird watchers cottage, at the opposite end of the lake to the palace. Spot the Pelicans.

An oasis of peacew and quiet in the hustle and bustle of the capital.. A lovely park in the centre of London to find peace and quiet and to enjoy sunshine in the capital. Where else in London will you find Pelicans?
Pleasant park. Very pleasant park close to the Mall and Buckingham palace and surrounded by some beautiful and historic buildings.

Favourite London park. Love this place! Such a peaceful haven in central London. Great place to chill after sightseeing. Just next to Horseguards Parade, and a short walk from Trafalgar Square. Love the view towards Buckingham Palace and the peace and grace of the geese on the ponds (I call them big ducks). It's a romantic park, perfect for lazing on the grass areas cloud watching. Holds many lovely memories for me.

Superb London park.. Its excellent location in the heart of the City of Westminster means that it is a great place to relax and take a break in a green space with nice gardens and a lake. There are refreshment facilities here or it is a good place for a picnic, and there are plenty of waterfowl, including pelicans which tend to stay on and around the end nearest to Whitehall.Even just to walk through it is a pleasure. It does get rather crowded with people when the weather is fine. Many other attractions are close by.

Sightseeing around London. A beautiful and well kept park. The deck chairs set out all round the park look lovely. We wish we had gone on a hot sunny day just to sit and enjoy being in the park a bit longer. Very nice to go have a walk round.

Park Sanctuary. Lovely place to be, peaceful away from the traffic. There's a large lake you could watch beautiful ducks of all species, geese and some swans. Kids sail their toy boats. Lots of benches around for you to sit and watch other people watching other people.

Beautiful and relaxing - any time of year. A beautiful garden to relax in and watch the squirrels run around. Perfect place to stroll through on way to Buckingham Palace. It was my 9 year old daughter's favourite place in London.
my favorite park!. this is one of the most comfortable and beautiful parks in London i guess. we were spending all our free time in there with a fine sandwich and soda))

a small jewel in the centre of London. It's worth reading up a bit of history before going to St James's Park, just to get a sense of the place, however if you don't it is still a welcome pocket handkerchief of green relaxation at the centre of one of London's most important historical areas. surrounded by Westminster, Buck House, Club land, Trafalgar Square and Whitehall it would be hard to be better placed as a haven for office workers and tourists alike. Small, by London park standards it offers a very good restaurant and café, a large area of deck chairs, a long lake full of an extraordinary variety of wild birds and, most importantly for my dog, lots of squirrels. If your visiting London and need a bit of a brake this is the ideal place to rest and recuperate your tired feet and hungry tummy.

St James park. Lovely park to walk through. Lots to see and enjoy. It's a short walk to Buckingham Palace. The Mall is on one side of the Park and Birdcage walk is on the other. Your well located to walk to Westminister Abbey, as well as The Houses of Parliament. Also close to Westminister Bridge to go on a cruise or go on the eye. Lots of places to eat on the south bank but beware of queues. Also

Forefront of Buckingham Palace. A Great Royal Park , well maintained, With The Mall running from Trafalgar Square through Admiralty Arch to the Queen Victoria monument and Buckingham PalaceChanging of the Guard can be seen on most days during the summer, and is one of the most outstanding ceremonies not to be missedBirdcage Walk runs parallel with the Mall by Wellington Barracksand the Mall joins the Constitutional Hill to Hyde Park Corner and number 1 London The Duke of Wellingtons official residence.Most of this area is closed to traffic on a Sundayaccessible by most public transport
Prettiest park in London. Really perfect park for a picnic or just to stroll. It is quite a small park but certainly the prettiest. :)
It feels like heaven. My favourite park in London, so peacefull and beautiful. Been there for hour, sitting on the grass, playing with squirrels.

Hire A Deck Chair And Take A Picnic. Go to the nearest Tesco or M&S buy some of their tasty sandwiches and drinks<salads etc and hire a deck chair and have a great afternoon watching the world go by. Next to Buckingham Palace< Horseguards Parade to name a few.
Peace in the city.. Worth a visit - very peaceful, with lots of bird-life. The restaurant is also good - good, well cooked food, with prompt, efficient service. take a break.

Beautiful walk. Beautiful green space in the city. Lots of nice views of the eye and Big Ben. It's not too long of a walk if you're not big on waking, but is away from roads enough that you can enjoy the quiet.
A beautiful park.. Beautiful Park. Chairs are placed out for any one to use. Look for the duck keepers cottage. Lovely flower gardens and lots of ducks, swans. pelicans and geese.

LOVELY AFTERNOON WALK WHILE IN THE CITY. What a great escape from the hustle and bustle. We loved the bird keepers house and the plants were amazing. Lovely walk & hopefully return soon, for another chilled out afternoon.

Great park. Great park for relaxing and more better for
Mind peace
Than the others
Best time fir me ti go there is afternoon
Before sun set

Visit the pelicans!. We came to St James park on a sunny summer afternoon. If you come at 2:30pm you can see the pelicans being fed on the eastern edge of the lake, you can get really close to them & they are pretty great.
Relax and enjoy!. On a beautiful day hire a deck chair and laze in the sun. Absolute pure bliss. Make sure you arrive early though.

A beautiful park in the heart of London. St. James Park is absolutely beautiful. The flowers, lawns, trees and water are exquisite. Everything is well-tended and the walking paths are terrific. Highly recommended.

The country in the middle. One of the most beautiful places in London.
I love the way you step into the country from the busy streets and see squirrels asking for a peanut and busily burying it under a leaf!

Time for quiet and nature. A park with lovely fountains and ducks pecking the ground and scaring away pigeons. Lots of people doing their daily quota of exercise. If you like greenery and quite, it would be your place of choice. Although not pure air as people don't stop smoking even there. It's a huge park, good to spend time with friends and family.

One of the most beautiful places in London. This is such a beautiful park that you need to stroll through it when visiting London. This is a great place to spend an afternoon people watching or having lunch in the park. There are vendors in the park selling snacks - if you can, try the hot dogs. They are wonderful! A trip to London is never complete without stopping by this beautiful park.

lovely family day out. We visit this park often. Its lovely to walk round and there are random huts to get a coffee from.We usually take bread and feed the ducks and swans in the lake, you can also take nuts and feed the squirrels, they will literally take them out of your hands.
great park. Lovely view of Buckingham Palace from the bridge. Loved the pelicans and lots of squirrels,ducks and swans. Nice to just wander around.

Lovely park and a wonderful place to relax. Tranquil and lovely. The park starts just outside Buckingham Palace and ends near the Palace of Whitehall beyond which is the Palace of Westminster. Good place to sit and relax after battling through the congestion and crowd while touring the many many tourist attractions in the City of Westminster.
Relaxed walk. The park is not enormous but you feel free in such a large city. Business people having lunch. Children playing. Wild birds relaxing and chilling. A small wilderness in central London

Stunning on a sunny day. We strolled through St James' Park on a sunny Sunday afternoon.It was an oasis in the middle of London madness with beautiful ponds and gardens. If you want some time out go there when the Mall is closed and the sun is shining. You will love it!
Passed through on a weekend. Beautiful walk through this park, smashing views with pelicans wondering around. Really beautiful. Great sights to see and maces to get a tea/coffee

Such a great escape. I could spend the whole day here! I ended up walking the whole length of the park toward Buckingham Palace, then down the Mall back toward the National Gallery. It's a fabulous park. It was a good break from the people, museums, and congestions that one can face as a tourist in London.
Beautiful. Lovely park, the flowers were still gorgeous. So interesting to see a park that you've always heard about.

Beautiful tranquility. The gardens and lakes are a real way to decompress while touring the Buckingham-Westminster area. The is an interesting variety of plantings and views. We were there during a rain shower and experienced a beautiful rainbow falling ito nearby trees.

Beautiful for a stroll, whatever the weather. The parks are so beautiful, a real green lung for the city. We always take nuts for the squirrels and the blue tits, and it is such a delight to have them come, take the nut and run/fly off....
Favorite London park. My favorite London park and right by the Queens house! Love wandering around the pond and walking over the bridge, reminds me of my youth!
Afternoon snack. Lovely gardens, afternoon snack before tour of Buckingham Palace reasonably priced. Ladies toilets nice and clean.
Lovely park. Worth a visit. Very nice park, lots of people using it. Can see local animals such as squirrels, ducks, pelicans, etc. You can enjoy a day in the sun on the grass.

Peace and Tranquility in a Manic City. St James' Park provides an excellent 'bolt hole' from the hustle and bustle of London's streets and contains enough space to ensure that everyone gets their own space. The walks are fresh and the monuments and buildings within are embedded into British history and folklore. Well worth a visit and highly recommended.
Beautiful summer stroll in the park. It's a beautiful park to walk and have a picnic on a warmer day. The pond is gorgeous and a quaint little house and pretty garden is just next to it.
Excellent for family day out on a sunny day. The pond and the Ducks were beautiful ,flowers were at their full bloom.wish I had more time to spend there
In and out Club next to Saint James. Nice big park right off picadilly circus. Stayed at the In and out Club. Small rooms but right in the center of london

Surprising oasis of quietitude. One of the must see places in London. Typically well groomed lawns, exceptionally quiet atmosphere in a busy megalopolis vibrating with life and not least beautiful views of famous landmarks.

Relaxing, beautiful place to walk. Relaxing pleasant place to walk along a pond from Buckingham Palace to Churchill War Rooms or to underground connection. Consider this route vs. the sidewalk if you want to slow down your pace for a few minutes.

Lovely Place to sit and relax. Visited as part of a long weekend in London.After walking from Westminster and through Horse Guards Parade we decided to have a walk around the park, so glad we did. The trees, gardens and flowers and extremely well kept and are a joy to be among. The park is huge so never really feels crowded even on a busy Saturday afternoon.Two downsides in my opinion;1) Having to pay to use a public restroom2) The so called 'restaurant' .. we decided to have lunch whilst in the park on Saturday afternoon, the food on offer at self service amounted to a chicken leg which looked like it has been sitting out for days, some chips which were the same and something I think was meant to a curry of some sort but was so odd looking in colour that it was hard to be sure.We decided to give this a miss, found a local supermarket, brought a couple of sandwiches and returned to the park to enjoy a small impromptu picnic, which was far more enjoyable than the restaurant experience.On the whole in my opinion, the park is well worth a visit but if you want to eat take you own food and avoid restaurant.

Bliss... sheer bliss. I almost wept here.. it was that wonderful for me.Maybe because I come from a city that doesnt have green spaces to boast of...but it was still a wonderful experience.The pond in the centre of the park has ducks fluttering in the water... its relatively less crowded, woody and shaded and is large enough for a decent morning workout as well.Also, the park is located right in the heart of the city and thus easily accessible.All in all, if you want a peaceful morning in green, head here.
Lovely and well kept. lovely park near tourist attractions. its an easy walk around the park and theres good spots for a picnic on a clear day.
An Oasis in a City of Millions. Lovely and peaceful. A great way to come along to Buckingham Palace. Take your time and enjoy this easy stroll through huge trees, gardens and flowers.

Don't miss a visit at St James Park. It is a typical touristic activity, but a suggest visiting it. Beautiful place. It is another well maintained park in London. You don't need to do anything. Just sit, enjoy and rest.
BEAUTY & PEACE in downtown London. Close to Buckingham Palace, one of the MOST BEAUTIFUL GARDENS in all of London, a MUST VISIT for flower lovers
Perfect. A must visit if you are in London. We had such a lovely time showing the kids around. Perfect if the sun is shining!

bright spot in city centre. Lovely way to walk to Buckingham Palace. Lots of squirrels and birds. Didn't see the pelicans - shame. Peaceful walk instead of by the noisy traffic. Lots of signage giving information about the park.

Cute!. This is a park like how I want it. It has a small playground, toilets, nice trees, grass and squirrels running arround. You can feed them and no one will say anything about it, but it's actually not allowed to feed them. I did feed them and they take the nuts out of your hand and then they run away again, to come back for a new nut of course. It's the park next to Buckingham palace and it's nice to walk through it before the famous changing of the guard. But I recommend to go here on other days or times, because it will be a busy place before and after the guard change. Unfortunately there is (not at this time of the year I guess, because there was a stand, but closed) food for sale here.

Oasis in near Parliment Square. Super park, with lovely paths. Check out the english cottage for some great photos. Within walking distance to the Mall where you can choose to go one way to Trafalgers Square, or another to Buckingham Palace. Lovely gardens. Well kept and peaceful as well as close to the Eye and Big Ben.
awasome park. best park in london, very fun to walk in it, and see the little animals sit and relax by the lake and enjoy the nature and the view.
Lovely. A gorgeous park, lovely gardens, wrought iron , ponds, birds. The walkways, fountains are lovely. Beautiful pictures and memories,

beautiful park in the heart of London. Things about St James Park: - it's easy to reach, in the center of main London famous attractions (Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, Whitehall, Trafalgar Sq. etc)- it has a beautiful lake in the middle and lots of birds, including pelicans- lots of flowers - it's big enough not to get bored and small enough not to get tired- nice photo opportunitiesNot to be missed when visiting London. If you like parks and walking, you can have a long stroll in Hyde Park, Green Park and St. James park, as they are located next to each other.

Never dull!. We love this park. It's great for people watching, picnics, watching wildfowl - including Pelicans! It is also wonderful for just relaxing with an ice cream on the grass, or amongst the trees. There are several refreshment kiosks and a restaurant. At one end is Downing Street, and at the other is Buckingham Palace. It is also very central for the West End. Recommend.
A great respite for the day!. So many things to see such as historical sites, statues and monuments of historical events. It is beautiful with the water and swans and ducks.
Peaceful place in London. Beautiful park near the Churchill War Room. Great photo opportunities and a nice place to escape the commotion which can be London.
Searching for calm ???. Just loved it !!! I took a walk there, it was so calm with the water, ducks and birds !!! I sat on a bench and listen to the silence.
Relax walking. Compared with those parks in Hong Kong, it is really big. I have been in SJP for many times and love walking there pleasingly while enjoying the whole spacious and green environment.
Lovely relaxed green space - take a pick nick. Lovely park for some rest bite while visiting the palace and horse guards parade. I prefer to walk though the park than to use the underground.
Just beautiful!. Great for a relaxing walk, a sure hit with children. The cafe near the lake is also very nice (and surprisingly enough, has reasonable prices).
Picturesque Gardens. Beautiful gardens, great photo opportunities, our entire group got several good pictures while we wandered in this park. Very picturesque!
Respite from walking. This is a welcome spot to relax if you are growing weary of touring. Many beautiful lawns and gardens.
A nice stroll. We had a good time walking around St. James Park. There were many different species of birds in the gardens. It was a beautiful park and nice stroll.

My favorite park in London. St. James Park is just across from St. James Palace and one of my favorite places to relax and just watch the world go by. The park and lake (pond really) are just a short walk from Westminster and Charing Cross and close to most of Central London
Beautiful quiet haven. Beautiful - so relaxing after the bustle of London - lovely little cafe inside to have lunch or just sit by the water and chill out.
Park next to Buckingham Palace. It was raining when I was there but it was a cute park with swans and lots of ducks and birds in a pond. Would be a cute place for a picnic weather permitting.

Relaxinggg...... Well we were there for the changing of gaurds and when we were coming back we all were so tired that we decided to just go in the park and it was lovely. Very relaxing place to be there. Beautiful.

Beautiful and Peaceful!. Even though you're in the middle of a super busy area, this is a nice place to just sit and people watch. Beautiful flowers and tons of ducks and geese to watch. Lovely green space right in the middle of the city.

Every time you have the change go and visit it!. Visiting Bucking palace you can't miss this lovely park! You can walk through the flora and fauna and be amazed from the environment. Definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful Park!. Beautiful Park! Gorgeous plants and flowers - the water foul are aplenty and very interesting to watch lots is space to relax and enjoy. Washrooms you have to pay for and very clean. Restaurant available if you want something to eat.
Fantastic way to approach Buckingham Palace. This is a lovely Royal Park with the Serpentine in the middle of it. A slow walk through and your greater by the Victoria Monument and Buckingham Palace.

Nice place!. One of the most beautiful park in London... in the city centre, you can easily reach it from Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Square, Hide Park corner... Another "must to see" in London. Enjoy a sunny afternoon!

Mesmerizing Park Try To Go Around Dusk For The Magic To Happen. One of the most beautiful parks I've ever been to in my life and I've been coming back to for over 20 years now and there's one word that comes to my mind when I think of St.James Park….Enchanting. I've been fortunate enough to be at St.James Park at dusk when the list rain danced on the statically lit water that made it so surreal…It became my secret garden.

Nice Park. Park is very big, but nice. There is a big pond and many benches, nice place to take a rest after strolling around London. This is in front of Buckingham Palace, maybe you can see the changing guards if it is time

Beautiful Park . St. James's Park is one of the most beautiful parks in London. Conveniently located right between the houses of parliament and Buckingham Palace I recommend raking the walk through the park instead of hopping on a bus.

An enchanting park with spectacular botany and views of Buckingham Palace. A walk through this park offers exceptional botany, little lakes and views of Buckingham Palace. The birds, squirrels, geese and swans roam around confidently amongst people with no fear whatsoever. Animals are respected the way they deserve. We loved this park

Green walking close to Buckingham Palace. This is a great stretch of grass, lakes and walkways between Marble Arch and Buckingham Palace. Plenty of cafes, places to sit and some paid to enter toilets. It's nice to walk through when coming back towards Victoria Station. The birds and squirrels are very domesticated but not like the seaside seagulls, no food snatching going on that I have ever seen.
quiet and charming. very pretty, a charming place in a huge city...wonderful history and a very nice place for a break from the busy

Absolutely adore this park.. My mum and I always like to visit this park as it is gorgeous. Plenty of benches, grass space and sitting areas going hand in hand with lovely little pop up food stalls selling Devine paninis and sandwiches. Definetely give it a visit, or two, or three , or four or more!!! Feel free to ask me any questions you may have and I will try to respond ASAP! Kind regards, Rachael.
Piece of tranquility. Beautiful, quiet park near Buckingham Palace. Imagine all the people who have taken time out of their day to stroll here over the years!! It reminds you of a gentler time.

A great walk to Buckingham Palace!. Green Park sits between Trafalgar Square and High Park. It‘s a lovely walk if you want to avoid traffic and walks through Parks. It’s lovely in any seasons. At weekends the Main Road to Buckingham Palace is closed for Traffic and it is lovely to cross on foot or by bike. It’s a little green heaven in a very busy part of the city.

Beautiful Park for Tour-Weary Children. I took my daughter there after a long morning at Westminster Abbey and Buckingham Palace while my husband and older daughter toured the Churchill War Rooms. It was just what she needed to cheer up and get a second wind, and it was a wonderful place for me to take candid pictures of her and the lovely surroundings. The Princess of Wales Memorial Walk goes through the park past a lovely waterway with dozens of different species of birds. The swans are photogenic, but standoffish, but the rest of the birds are quite friendly and will eat from your hand or off your jacket if you let them. (If you are not inclined to feed birds, don't worry; they will ignore you in favor of the other park goers). The bridges in the park are ideal for playing Poohsticks or for getting lovely photographs. The London Eye can be seen over the scenery in the park for a real picture perfect postcard view. There is also a cafe in the park which we visited for lunch one day and for afternoon tea on another. St. James Park is near the time station, but it is also near other attractions that you would likely be visiting anyway. This makes St. James Park ideally situated for taking a rest during a long day of touring London.
Great park. Lovely place for a break, picnic or just to spend some time outside. Don't forget to take some peanuts, squirrels love them.

THE BEST OF THE ROYAL PARKS. Not the biggest but surely the prettiest of the Royal Parks. Stand on the bridge across the central lake and view Horseguards in one direction and Buckingham Palace in the other. Great spot for the regular flypasts.

Sadly only average. We went today while walking from Mayfair to Victoria and were slightly disappointed as it was not as smart or well kept as you would expect !!!! As its in front of Buckingham Palace.We looked but could not find any Pelicans only a million pigeons !Just thought it could have been better

A must do . I always go for a stroll in this park when in London. It's a great wee oasis. There is a little play park up near Buckingham palace that is a welcome distraction if my daughter is with me, the squirrels are endless fun with their cheeky antics, the kiosks selling coffee and ice cream are great and a wee seat on a bench watching the birds with a coffee is a real pleasure. It is a great people watching location and is also god for a wee picnic.
Lovely park. Beautiful long walk to Buckingham Palace through this park. Lovely place filled with people enjoying the lawn and the gardens.
Stroll through the Park. Lovely setting. The stroll is so nice and ending up walking by Buckingham Palace. When the weather is right, this cannot be beat.

A beautiful reprieve in a busy city. Incredibly beautiful park. They have beautiful walks along ponds with ducks, geese and swans. A nice cafe at one end, with restrooms. Nice place to have lunch, or just hang outfor a few hours in the middle of this busy city

Beautiful park, not to be missed. A free attraction not to be missed by people not even tourists! There are some beautiful animals here such as very exotic ducks! Pelicans that have been made famous by YouTube how old is literally a stones throw away from Buckingham Palace.within the park there is a restaurant it is not necessary you can bring a pack a picnic. It can take a while to walk all the way around the park, there are also some lunch is available for rent however when the weather is lovely there is no need not to sit on the ground and be one with nature as the ducks and the crows a very of a confident I will come up to you and beg.it can be too popular during the summer but with the Brit weather right now where it is not too wet and not too cold, an enjoyable walk could be has.

A beautiful park to enjoy. A beautiful park to stroll through and enjoy those rare sunny London days. The birds are wonderful to see (swans, pelicans, ducks, and more) and the gardens are beautiful. If you are lucky, you can see the Guards go through the park to the palace, and hear them playing their bagpipes.
A wonderful green place. Wonderful green place with lots of squirrels, ducks and many other birds. A great place to spend time with family.
Amazing!!. Beautiful lawns, centuries-old towering trees, animals attending the lake, squirrels running around you. Probably the best Park in London.

Gorgeous retreat on the doorstep of Buckingham Palace, St James Palace etc.. A wonderful Oasis, beautifully kept, beautiful trees, shrubs and lots of wildlife - a beautiful place to escape the hubbub of the surrounding touristic masses either for a lovely picnic or just a lovely walk enroute to further attractions.

Beautiful morning stroll in London, UK. I would recommend going very early during the spring time. I was able to go through the park for about 7am as I was walking my friend to work. This was an incredible and beautiful park, well maintained and stunning scenery. As a painter I will be using some of the shots I grabbed from this excursion for another landscape exhibit as the park was virtually empty when I was able to see it.

A romantic walk. It is a beautiful place where people of all cultures are relaxing in the sun. They are just laying around, strolling, and napping in a gorgeous setting and extremely well groomed gardens. Worth walking through.

An oasis in busy London. Finding a place for peace in the hub bub that is now London is a real pleasure, and St. Jame's Park is just that. Great views from different points and in the heat of the June summer this year it felt wonderful to be off the beaten path and to enjoy green grass, small bridges, water, birds, flowers. Very nice respite.
Green haven. St James Park is a green gem in the area. It is well kept and the gardens are spotless. A lovely place to walk or enjoy a picnic

Pleasant walk. Lovely park to walk through and plenty of seats. The wildlife is also brilliant. We saw squirrels red and grey, pelican, stork and plenty other birds all enjoying getting fed from passers by.
An oasis in the City. What a lovely place o stop and relax while seeing the sights. Lots of green space located Very close to Westminster Abbey.
Beautiful Park. One of the most beautiful places anyone can visit at the heart of London! Ideal place to walk, run, relax or even have a picnic! It deserves a visit..

Beautiful relaxing park. My favourite park in London. Small, peaceful, well kept and great for photography. You can feed the ducks, swans and squirells too, who tend to be friendly as they are so used to people now.
Beautiful. Beautiful park with pretty scenery - I came here on a rainy day yet i sill had a very nice stroll around the park. Lovely place to have a picnic i would say.

Fabulous park in the midst of the city!. We arrived in London today, and we headed straight for the National Gallery. After enjoying ourselves there we walked back toward our hotel by way of St. James's Park. We were enthralled with the beautiful flowers and shrubs, so cleverly coordinated with the landscape surrounding the ponds in the park. There were numerous species of water fowl present, and they are so used to people that we were able to enjoy them up close. There were sling chairs located throughout the park and lots of benches lining the pathways.One reason this park is such a wonderful place to visit is that there are so many astounding architectural buildings visible through the trees, beyond the bridges, over the lakes, etc. If you take the time to take in all the beautiful vistas you will not be disappointed. I intend to spend a few more hours in St. James's Park before I leave, a pretty, pretty place.

Beautiful Park. We walked around the park on the way to Churchill's war room. Even though we did not have enough time to visit the park, but the park was extremely beautiful. I wish we had had more time to explore the park

Great bird world. When tired from shopping I usually escape to this park in the middle of Westend and stroll around the pond where hundreds of birds can be observed. It is not to overcrowded, quite safe to be, informative thanks to boards that give you the names of the various animals. Plants and trees are also carrying information. It is relatively quiet, has a nice warden's lodge where I usually find the pelicans. There are also shops that sell food and public toilets.
smoothing atmosphere. Excellent place to have a rest from everything. You can get out off the noisy areas and enjoy the silent and smoothing atmosphere of St. James's Park

An oasis of green in the heart of London. What an elegant place!The ultimate English garden,with hundreds of old trees,marvelous coloured flowers that make a fine contrast with the cloudy London sky,lots of birds and squirrels...and what a small lovely cottage !

Relaxing way to escape the congestion of central London.. The park is beautiful, or course. Wonderful to have a glass of wine from the cafe in the park and sit at the counter looking out over the pond. Fun to people watch from that vantage point.

Squirrels galore and exceptional views. Lovely views from the central bridge. Look right And left! Very relaxing place to be, makes a great walk from Westminster to the West End. Very lively with lots of food and drink stands during the day. Pity they were closed early evening though.

My favourite London Park. This is my favourite of the central London parks (nothing beats Richmond on a sunny day with all of the deer). Great views of the Palace and it is so conveniently placed for Downing Street, Horseguards', Buckingham Palace, Downing Street and Trafalgar Square (not to mention the Cabinet War Rooms). Take a photo of the Palace from the bridge over the water.
Green Peace. As beautiful as all the parks in London. similar but different, all that green is lovely. a calm and peaceful environment.

A great stroll even if it is raining. If you love a good walk, stroll through St. James Park. We walked on Pal Mall to Buckingham Palace and then walked through St. James's Park towards The houses of Parliament and Big Ben. Our teens were busy snapping pictures of swans, ducks and a very friendly squirrel who was eating out of a visitors hand. The view is spectacular. A little oasis in the middle of a bustling city.

Quiet refuge in a bustling city!. We stumbled upon St. James Park by accident, and didn't realize until the next day how close it was to Buckingham Palace. The gardens of the park are gorgeous, especially the ones near the small cottage.
Beautiful park in the middle of London. Lovely, quiet park near Buckingham Palace. If you sit in a deck chair you are charged 1.68 pounds for an hour, they actually aren't all that comfortable!
St. James Park, London, England. Beautiful, relaxing walk close to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abby, Parliament Bldgs, Big Ben, and the London Eye. A great place to rest your feet and relax.

Take a Stroll!. After admiring Buckingham Palace; if the flag is flying the Queen is in. Take a stroll through St. James's Park, very lovely walk and will take you to the Horse Parade and #10 Downing Street.

A beautiful place for a walk. A beautiful place for a walk. Close to Buckingham's, in front of the Churchill War Rooms and the cavalry museum is a very nice place to go especially on spring time, there is also the Duck Island Cottage the Bird Keeper's Lodge.

A restful time in St James park,. At the time of year I was there the garden was full of flowers, it was easy to fine my way around and very peaceful. And only a 5 minute walk to Trafalgar Square and so so much more.

One of my favourite London Parks. This is by far one of my favourite London Parks. You can take yourself away from the traffic and rush of the London streets, and escape for a while relaxing in this beautiful park. There are amenities there, and somewhere to buy a drink or snack. But best of all take a picnic and watch the world go by surrounded by nature. Lovely.

Nice park. St.James`s is a large, quiet park, perfect for a day of relaxation in the nature. Close to the Mall and Buckingham Palace, this park is definitely worth a visit if you happen to be in the area.

One of our most favourite places to visit in London. St James Park is such a lovely place to visit. The swans ducks Pelicans and squirrels are a delight. The lake and fountains are so tranquil you could forget that you you in the middle of very busy London. There is a well equipped park for younger children. There is a good cafe and ice cream vendor with lots to choose from. If you walk from one end to the other you can walk from Horse Guards Parade to Buckingham Palace.

Stunning St. James Park. Stunning St. James Park is a must do as right near Buckingham Palace and is a quiet reprieved from that area. Sit and watch the bird life or meander along the paths, it's picturesque.
Another little Green Oasis in Central London. Take a quiet time out strolling between Buckingham Palace and Parliament and Whitehall.Sit down, have a sandwich and feed the ducks and squirrels!

Great place. How fortunate are we to have such a beautiful park in such a fantastic location that we can use free of charge whenever we like? It's a great place, quiet and relaxing, and in such a wonderful central location. There's not much to do there apart from stroll along, talk, eat, admire the waterfowl and watch the world go by, but it's a wonderful place in which to do these things. If you're in the area, don't miss it.
Lovely Park. It is a beautiful park near both Buckingham Palace and Hyde Park. It is a great place for a romantic stroll. It is definitely worth a visit when visiting London.

Lovely even in the rain☔️☔️. We walked through the park on our whistle stop tour of London, waking from Buckingham palace to the Big Ben. The rain didn't dampen our spirits and the squirrels were as tame as ever.

A great place to make memories. Such a beautifully kept park just a short walk away from Buckingham Palace. The surroundings are a lovely haven away from the hustle bustle of London. Its a great place to feed the ducks with the children or on your own and great views from the pond with lots of wildlife. I have been coming here since I was a little girl with my mum to fed the ducks and now I take great pleasure in taking my children there also. A great place to make family or romantic memories.

Go in the spring!. You'll be inundated by crocuses, daffodils and other flowers. This park springs alive in the early spring and is located in a wonderful part of London. Definitely worth a nice pause on your sight seeing.
Lovely park. Lovely park to walk through, lots of wildlife and beautiful flowers to look at. Great to sit and eat lunch in.

A beautiful rest. If you are a bit tired of shopping or sightseeing in the middle of London, this park is situated perfectly. Just 10 minutes from everything. Walking around the park takes very little time, and the pelicans are definitely worth a view. Then go to the centre of the park, say hello to a couple of squirrels, rent a deckchair and just relax for a while.
Well dressed nature. Nice place to share one good moment trough well dressed nature and animals, some playing area for kids.

Don't miss this beautiful Park by Buckingham Palace. During the summer, the park is ablaze in colour, but is truly a beautiful place to visit anytime of year. Several species of birds reside here as well, finding sanctuary on an island in the middle of the pond. A must see when visiting Buckingham Palace. I recommend taking the tube to St James Park exit and walk through the park to visit either the Palace to the left or Horseguards Parade to the right. Who knows, maybe the Queen will watch YOU while walking the paths in the park!

Serenity Unbound. St. James Park offers a beautiful place to relax, refresh and rejuvenate amongst the nature of flora and fauna.
