With its proximity to Green Park and Buckingham Palace , you can stroll, or just relax and read and admire the nature. Plus a distant view of the magnificient ferris wheel- London Eye.....

Beautiful and perfect for a summer picnic. St James' Park is one of my favourite parks in London. With its stunning, open green spaces and beautiful wildlife, it is definitely a must-see destination in the heart of the city. Perfect for a summer picnic.

Gentle walk, perfect after a heavy lunch!. A very enjoyable place to walk around, and the perfect cut through between Trafalgar Square and Whitehall (Horse Guards Parade) and Buckingham Palace. See the back of Downing Street and the Bali Bomb memorial, and take in the lake in St James' Park. I normally buy the children ice creams to their minds of wanting to feed the ducks and swans. Spot the office workers as they rush their sandwiches before scurring back to work. Always a treat!
Lovely stroll. Beautiful park to walk around lots of ducks and squirrels we walked through here going to Buckingham palace
Lovely park with ponds!. Lovely park, came here on a sunny day, lovely to walk through, pretty ponds, ducks to feed. Well worth a visit!

Beautiful surroundings. People of all ages can enjoy a visit to St James's Park. The park is kept clean and tidy and the greenery and flowers are maintained to a high standard. There are many signs of wildlife including ducks, swans, pelicans. A wonderful place to site and relax. Food can be purchased from outlets within the park.
park. very nice and very clean park with very beautyfull trees and very nice flowers.also you need almost 6hourw to walk all throu but is lovely.

Beautiful park.. Me and my friend stumbled across this park while killing time before we saw a show, and i'm glad we did. It is a beautiful park, with lots of wildlife, fountains and ponds, and plenty of seating dotted around the park. It is a close wall to a lot of the main attractions, such as Big Ben, Westminster Abbey and the London Eye. Well worth a visit, especially on a lovely day.

Lovely Park for Sunday Walk.. Beautiful park for a stroll through on a nice day. I walked along the long lake from Horseguards parade to Buckingham palace via a nice couple of cafe bars and some nice wildlife on the lake.

Squirrels. The views over Westminster are the best, in this park there are also most friendly squirrels I've seen in my life. They come straight to you and eat food out of your hands. A bit crowded, but very close to Buckingham Palace, Westminster and Picadilly.

Especial day with perfect weather.. An excellent place to visit especially when the weather is perfect. You will find a very green land with water lake and you will find different type of birds. You can walk straight to guard house and even to London eye.

A good place to hangout on a lazy evening. Started my walk to the Buckingham Palace from Trafalgar Square and made my way into the St. James's Park.. A nice place to hangout with friends and to be make friends with the nature. A lot of birds and squirrels out there.. But be ready to make a long walk back to the tube station. Request to all travelers not to feed the animals with whatever you have, coz these food which you carry may not be the best for the birds. If you insist in feeding the birds or squirrels, please carry some food which is recommended for them. Also, please do not litter the beautiful garden. I see a lot of people not really caring about the environment. A little care will help our future generations enjoy these places as well.
Another favourite Park. Most Parks in London are beautiful and all unique. This Park is one of my favourites, the scenery it offers is gorgeous. Flowers in this park are beautiful.
A real treat to be there on VE day.. Though huge crowds, police and others remained friendly and helpful to the tourists mixed in with the people celebrating the holiday. Beautiful and spacious park.

A Great Place to Take a Break in the Day. After a crazy day of walking all over, what a pleasant place to sit and rest and watch the world go by. Beautiful birds and gardens. Once re-energized, Buckingham Palace was right there.

Park with lake close to seat of Government. Relaxing park close to Westminster, Buckingham Palace and several other attractions. Several seats and ample grass to sit and picnic on a sunny day. Cafes and restaurants in the park and close by.

Beautiful garden in the middle of the city!. Such a wonderful green space right in the middle of the city. For a Mumbaikar, it will be a shocker as we miss these kinds of places in our city. There is so much to see at this place. Variety of flowers, artifacts and water bodies makes up your mood. Wish we could have such places in our city!

Peace and Beauty. On a walking tour of London we walked through the park on the way from Buckingham Palace to Trafalgar Square and took some time to rest our feet in this tranquil setting. Despite it being the end of summer there were some magnificent colourful flower beds and the water features always make for a tranquil setting. If you remember to take some peanuts you will have the added joy of feeding the squirrels, some of whom are so tame that they will come and sit on your arm to take the food. A great place for a peaceful break during a tour of the city.

Beautiful escape. Nice escape from city living. I am always in London for work and although I adore the city, its so nice to take a deep breath & a nice stroll through the park. Ended up grabbing snacks and having a little picnic
Beautiful gardens. A gorgeous leisurely walk in sunny weather. I visited it as part of a walking tour and wish I had stayed a bit longer. Next time maybe :)

Very beautiful. This park is the nicest most relaxing park that I've ever been to. I nearly fell asleep after I sat down under a tree. It's beautiful and not very crowded, which is nice and there was not any trash laying around which was good. Go here!
Beautiful. St. James Park leads to Buckingham Palace, but is a travel stop that delights as it is well-kept with beautiful flowers, plants and trees.

Lovely views. in the summer the park is always busy, its our local park which I walk through every morning with my dog. It has public toilets and places to get snacks and a site down meal if you want it. Lovely views of Buckingham palace and the London Eye and horse guards parade, a lovely big pond with birds and a bandstand which is in use at the weekend.

Take a Seat. Spent the day on your feet going thru Buckingham Palace or Westminster Abbey? Take a moment to enjoy an ice cream sitting on the park bench watching the swans float by. Nowhere do I find a more peaceful setting in the midst of London's hustle and bustle.

Great part of a London experience. Beautiful views from every direction. Loved that you are in the center of a lot of attractions but once you wonder around you feel like you are in the wilderness. A great peaceful respite from the crowds and traffic and a good way to end or start your day. Just wish I had a bike to see more of it.
nice park. nice walk from westminster up to buckingham palace through the park lots of wildlife,birds mainly, coffee shop on the way, nice to get away from noise for a bit

Pretty park. I think St James's is one of London's best parks. It's very pretty and easy to get to if in Central London. Somewhere like Hyde Park would be better for children (more space and peddalos etc) but St James's is just nice.

Best in London.. Wonderful time spent in St. James's Park.
I think it is the best of London: you can find open spaces, but even and above all, lots of romantic and more intimate corners.
Great seating on the benches all along the river and see the wonderful squirrels which are all around!
I loved.
Beauty in bloom. This is one of the loveliest parks in central London. Try to get there early as it's stunning in the morning light. And quieter!

My favourite park in London. So relaxing to wander about, there are lots of nooks and crannies. Watch the squirrels or the ducks on the water. Stop on the bridge. Wander over to Buckingham Palace. Lie on the grass.
Open Green Space. It's not often I get time to walk around the open green space in London but when I do it amazes me what can be found in the heart of London.

Birds!. Just across the steer from the Churchill War Rooms and a nice break from the crowd. There was a little island with storks stretching out their wings and many other floating and flying birds. This park wasn't crowded and was really pretty. A nice break after the War Rooms.

Great place for a picnic after visiting Buckingham Palace. This is a lovely little park right by Buckingham Palace so a great place for a picnic after watching the changing of the guard ceremony at 11.30. It also makes for a nice walk from Westminster to Buckingham palace rather than walking down birdcage walk.

A London Oasis Central to Many Attractions. St. James Park is delightful oasis in the middle of the London crowds as well as being central to many key sights. On the walk from Big Ben and Westminster Abbey to Buckingham Palace on our first day in London, we strolled through St. James Park along the lake and enjoyed both the flowers and the many different birds on hand. It was a perfect way to enjoy a peaceful aspect of Central London for free and along the way to major attractions.

Plenty of wild life such as squirrels. Just about to go into the park when the Horse Guards came by all in their finery, which was a bonus. There is plenty of water fowl in the park and the illustrated boards showing the names of each fowl was a great help to identify them. Beautiful gardens
Worth the walk. Just passed through but can be tranquil and worth a walk around the park with Buckingham Palace at the end.

Walk in the country in the middle of London. If you need to escape the crowds at Buckingham palace or the mobs at Piccadilly , a stroll through the park should do the trick. Set between Pall Mall & Piccadilly rd.sits awell maintained park with wide paved paths a a large canopy of trees. Very relaxing........then, back to the mobs
A field of dreams. The oasis that is just England. The lawns were lush, the flowers were blooming and the sun was shining!!! yes it was warm 28 degrees C. Who would have thought it. Magnificent!!!
lots of birds. Lovely park ... Lots of birds and squirrels which will eat out of your hand (not that I would advise you do this )
Nice Park in Big City. What a nice park! It is right in front of the Buckingham Palace and it is a great place to take a walk.
Take a break.... Great relaxing park! Lots of people! Everything is well taken care of. A MUST for resting while visiting London.

Lovely park with a vast array of wild water fowl and beautiful flowers. We took a walk through this park to get to Buckingham Palace. It was full of beautiful well kept gardens and lots of interesting wild water fowl including red breasted Geese which are now endangered in the wild.
Picturesque and lovely. its scenic and is right in the heart of the city....the palace isn't too far away and its a great place to chill in the sun with some good friends and a lovely picnic :)
Beautiful Park. Very beautiful park with lots of places to sit and enjoy the sunshine. Nice refreshments and sandwiches from just outside the park.

Don't miss the views from the blue bridge 🏰🎡⛲🌳. Lovely park with colourful planted flower beds, mature trees and a lake with a variety of ducks, geese and pelicans. The pelicans are fed every day between 2.30 and 3pm on duck island (the Horse Guards end of the lake - the other end to Buckingham Palace).Toilets in the park are on the left hand side of the path leading up to Malborough gate on The Mall; 20p to p**! There is a water dispenser there too where you can fill your water bottle. More toilets are near the park office.Deck chairs are available for hire; someone comes round and sells you a ticket. The children's playground is at the top left hand side of the lake, the Buckingham Palace end. There are ice cream kiosks which also sell drinks and light snacks and the park restaurant Inn the Park is worth a visit but I find it pricey. Better to walk through the park than go along the road and do take time to stand on the blue bridge and admire the views. If you cycle, beware, there is a £60 fine for cycling in the park.

Cheeky squirrels, lovely park. The park is always full of tourists due to it's location. Benches all along, nice to sit down just watch the ducks, birds and peoples and have a little rest.We normally walk down on the Mall to the Buckingham Palace and walk back through the park to the Horse Guards. It is handy to know when is the guard change, worth to watch.

Beautiful park, amazing flowers. Loved our walk in this park. Beautifully kept with amazing flowers. There are Pelicans at bird island and they are fed at 2.30 each afternoon. A lovely place to spend a couple of hours.
Tea in the park. A lovely walk on a beautiful sunny day Great food and drinks in the cafe and brill for sitting people watching

Peaceful escape from the city. Love this Park, always come here when I am doing some sight seeing in London and need an hour out. Gorgeous lake with plenty of little animals just running around, I always try and bring nuts for the squirrels and they literally follow you the whole way up the park, I always feel sorry for the pigeons and give them some too so have a trail of squirrels following me on the ground and pigeon flying over me all the way up to the palace, really is a nice little walk and not just a boring green open space, it is visually very pretty.

Good for a relaxing walk on a bright day. Enjoyed a very relaxing stroll through the park after watching the guard change at the palace. It is well maintained with a good garden and nice water body with lot of birds.
Nature's beauty. A great place to stroll around and enjoy nature's beauty. In Autumn, the changing colours of the leaves make it quite magical.

Huge, beautiful and peaceful!. On our way via The Mall to Buckingham, we placed ourselves on the grass in St. James's Park for some peaceful time. Lot's of people, but everyone was really relaxed! Lovely place to sit down a bit!
Very nice place. So much green , so much quiet .Everybody will be happy . not far from the palace . bring some bread to the birds or even just bring a ball and play on the grass .

Lovely park .. London is full of them! . Visited this park on route to see Buckingham palace! Lovely place especially on the day we visited! 30 plus degrees! Lots of fountains and pretty areas to walk through. Worth a visit on a nice day.
Wonderful open space in the middle of the mayhem. Step away from the hustle and bustle of central London and Take a stroll through this wonderful park

Nice stroll. Situated off the Mall a lovey place for a stroll and a sit on the grass on a fine summers day. Eats pavilion in the park and the lakes sets off the atmosphere. Short walk from Piccadilly. Ideal for a walk to exercise for those that like flat ground.

Great place for a walk or run. This is a wonderful park for jogging, walking, picnicking or anything outdoors. Easy access from several hotels, not far from Westminster Underground and of course St Jame's Park underground.
Watch your step!. Be prepared for duck/goose/dog poop wherever you walk. I understand the ducks and geese but surprised that poop bags are not used. Very crowded park when we were there midday.
Pleasant. Busy but a pleasant area of greenery within the capital. Noticed deckchairs were available at a cost.

oh i love to go a squirreling. my fav place to feed the squirrels.
two sided park divided with lake in the middle and Buckingham palace and green park at the top, horse guards parade, Whitehall and Trafalgar sq at the bottom.
very over priced cabin cafes and the main park restaurant, but a great place to picnic and enjoy summer drinks with family and friends.
Beautiful park. The flower borders are really lovely. The park is beautifully clean and well maintained. There are clear signs to help you navigate to landmarks.

Worth going to. This is by far my favourite park in London. It offers fantastic views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge over the lake. Willow trees sound the lake making it very scenic and green. It's just a shame the crowds can sometimes get very big.
The Pelicans are always popular with tourists and floral beds. Always enjoy walking through this park anytime of the year. Floral displays fantastic. Love to see the Pelicans too.
Beautiful. Beautiful. Fun with kids. Great place to stroll around and relax. Lots of cute geese. Nice to see people sitting in the grass in the late afternoon.

Relaxing walk. Lovely park to walk through. Always a variety of wildlife to be seen. (ducks, geese, squirrels)
I always make time to walk through when I am in London
Lovely day :). Perfect place to have picnic or just visit for a walk :) Amazing gardens with nice chairs provided. Is definitely a nice place to relax :D
Love. It was beautiful with all the lush greenery around. The healthy ducks, swans, cranes, etc., added to the beauty of the park.
Needs some tlc. Tired looking, rather smelly area. What a shame, could be wondeerful. Should be wonderful. Grassy areas a really bare,
Packed and that's the best way. As part of our touristy day out in London we visited St. James Park. It was packed but still amazing place to visit. With the flamingos and all the wildlife.

Great place to relax for a bit. Very neat park. Saw it while on a walking tour with Sandeman's and made sure to come back later in the day. Lots of nice places to sit and enjoy the park (the chairs cost to rent, though...). Lots of people enjoying the birds, the river, and the scenery here. There's also a geocache that sounded interesting, but I had no time. Definitely take some time to relax here in this park.
A great way to relax. Perfect place to have a picnic, nice chairs provided, nice leisurely way to spend an afternoon. Pretty gardens and flowers

Lovely Stroll Near Buckingham Palace. St. James's Park is across the square from Buckingham Palace. You are free to leisurely stroll through well marked paths. Lots of ducks, swans and even pelicans living in the surrounding water. A must see!

Geese and flowers. The main attraction of this park, besides excellent landscape, trees, lake, bridge and fountain are geese and flowers. Many flowers of all possible colors and many geese flying back and forth but you cannot feed them! This is one of the places I liked the most in London.
Great place.. Beatiful park in Central London. Great day with the family.In the summer, this a must see in London.

Great outdoor green space. Huge green space and very clean! Signage could be bigger and more navigation maps would be helpful. Bring some food to feed the animals if that's your thing, you would find ducks and squirrels. Great for picnic or for a relaxing afternoon with a good book.

Beautiful gardens. We walked through St. James's Park on the way to see the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. Really peaceful park in the middle of bustling London. Our family was fascinated by all of the cool birds that we don't get to see in North America.
A peaceful oasis. A lovely green space to relax in. Walk, jog or cycle round the paths or sit on a bench and people watch. A popular spot for a picnic.

Beautiful oasis in the heart of London. Love St James park, it is an oasis right in the heart of London. I felt safe walking around the park. The park is very well maintained. Our favorite thing to do was buy break for the geese and peanuts for the squirrels. You can hand feed both as they are very used to human servants!

See the park on your way to Buckingham. Walk along the park after you visit Trafalgar Square. After enjoying the green area, and see all the families playing and eating together you're gonna reach the Buckingham Palace.
Nice play area for children. The park is nice and clean. The play area for children was also nice, but a bit limited. My daughter definitely wants to go back.
So clean. Great park to walk through and relax in. So clean and plenty of places to sit and just watch the world go by.

Idyllic. My friend and I stumbled upon St James park when wondering after visiting travalger square and were both stunned by the beauty and peacefulness so close to busy central London. My enjoyed learning about the birds and squirrels and photographing them.

Relax Here and Look for the Direction Signs. Lovely park for strolling and having a picnic. Helpful signs direct you to Buckingham Palace, Churchill War Rooms, and other venues in the nearby area. A wonderful place to relax and feel you are in London.

Must see sanctuary. This park is an oasis, there is a charming cafe and water features and you are close to the Cabinet War Rooms, Horseguards, Pall Mall and Trafalgar Square, one of the smallest but most civilised parks in London.

Quiet walk with beautiful surroundings. Very peaceful park with a beautiful scenery. The garden was in full bloom with countless types of flowers, bushes and trees. Even though it was well manicured, it gives the impression that it is just nature at work. The silence of the quiet pond with swans and ducks is only broken by groups of geese that come and go. You will never go wrong if you spend time in this free park.

Lovely large park. This is a lovely park in the heart of of the west end, near Buckingham Palace. Large in size, you could spend a day there walking and relaxing. If you are in the area going from one point to the other, it's a pleasant break to slow your pace and cut through the park.
Lovely park!. Lovely day for a walk through St James, lovely to see the birds out on the water! A different way to get to Buckingham Palace other than the Mall.

Wonderful birds and squirrels!. This is a wildlife lover's paradise!The huge pond area is home to so many bird species, from the familiar, such as Canada Geese and Mute Swans, to the more unusual, such as Bar-Headed Geese, a small flock of Pelicans, and many more. I have never seen so many coots in one place - there must have been around 50 all chasing after food thrown to them!The geese in particular are not shy, and will right come up to you as you sit and eat your picnic and stare at you, waiting for food! The pigeons too are extremely brave, and perch on the little fences so that you can photograph them close up! This park also has the friendliest Grey Squirrels I have ever seen! Again, you can get right up next to them and they are full of cheeky personality!It's easy to while away a long time strolling around just enjoying the animals and birds.There is a lovely natural play area for children, made out of carved logs, with a seesaw, swings, slide, climbing area, and most interestingly, a sand area set among rocks you can climb on. This isn't a standard sandpit in shape; instead it swirls naturally around the rocks. There is a food outlet next to this area, and also toilets, but these are strictly for children only, and adults need to use the ones a few minutes walk away instead.My only negative comment is that the proper toilets there were among the dirtiest I have encountered anywhere, which is awful given the prestigious location and the fact that there is an attendant there, and a small fee! They were clearly not being checked at all. Very disappointing. A coin change machine is available beside them.There are plenty of food and drink kiosks dotted around, selling ice creams, cakes, very nice flapjacks, hot dogs and so on, plus a restaurant/cafe.Despite the huge number of locals, workers and tourists using these gardens, it is easy to find a spot away from everyone to relax, and plenty of shade available for hot days.Good views of Buckingham Palace one way, and Horse Guards Parade overlooked by the London Eye the other, can be obtained from the Blue Bridge in the middle of the park.The Buckingham Palace end of the park is obviously a must to visit, but also worth a look is the Horse Guards Parade end. The pelicans are on their rock down this end. Cross the road and you will find a simple but beautiful memorial to those who died in the 2002 Bali bombings, and the unusual but effective memorial to police killed in the line of duty. A book lies open in this documenting those killed in recent years and how they died. Several other important memorials are also located in this area.A wonderful park in so many ways. Highly recommended!

The best park in London!. This is my all time favourite park in London. It's not the biggest or grandest but to me it is arguably one of the most beautiful. You stroll along from where trooping the colour takes place across the street with magical fountains (lit at night in white & colours) to the right. On the other side, you cross a little bridge overlooking the little lake/pond and behind you lies Buckingham Palace. It does get very busy with tourist traffic, but I love it anyway!
A lovely garden / park free to wander. Just a joy to walk around. Birds - pelicans etc. Old fashioned gardens and cottage. Well kept; neat walkways.

Make time to stop and watch the squirrels. This pleasant park links Westminster Abbey and Buckingham Palace and allows you to drift away from the crowded streets and relax in the gardens enjoying the birdlife on the water and squirrels entertaining people with their antics.

Lovely little Royal park. Didn't seem to be the largest of Royal Parks, which is good. Went here after giving up on Changing of the Guard, and is lovely. Great views on either side of the bridge across the lake of Buckingham Palace and the grand buildings opposite. There are also two ice cream vendors, one which also sells sandwiches, hotdogs, etc and a public toilet which costs 20p to use (mos around London, we found, charged 50p per use!).
Well kept garden/park. A pleasant morning spent wondering around the park taking in all the flowers and trees and sitting in the sunshine

The way to the Palace. Rather than walking down the Mall, a stroll through the park is a prettier an more relaxing way to get to Buckingham Palace. Some pretty flower beds and still waters give a feel of tranquillity in the middle of a busy city. The cafe in the park has toilets.

Great place for some fresh air. Another one of London's great parks. When standing on the bridge you can look one way and see Buckingham Place in the distance and the other the London Eye. As with most of the parks there are plenty of squirrels and birdlife to look out for.

Clematis. Probably the finest small park in central London, St James's Park exudes a certain English charm with its pelicans, litter bins and immensely walkable pathways. Not only are there tourists, but actual Londoners sometimes use the park to get from A to B, enjoying the relatively unpolluted air and pristine flower beds. Entirely free, the park provides superb value for money and is a 'must-see' feature for any self-regarding visitor.

visit to St. James's Park. This park is beautiful with lots to see. You can exercise, take a short walk or jog. You can have a picnic and enjoy the beauty of nature close to the business district of London. You can see birds and squirrels climbing the trees. It is very calm. Enjoy your visit. Buckingham's palace is next to the park. Do not forget to take your camera.
Lovely picnic stop. Lovely green area to have picnics and sunbath right next to buckingham palace. However the Ice cream in the park is overpriced! £2 minimum per cone with servings varying greatly.

Great space for a walk. This is a great park to go for a walk. Considering how busy the surrounding area is I found the park surprisingly quiet and traffic noise seemed to disappear. I also found a good kiosk for an ice-cream at the Buckingham Palace end. Loads of bench seats available and if weather is good there is always the grass to sit on. Definitely somewhere I will visit again.

Wonderful sightseeing morning for good weather day. Beautiful. After seeing buckingham palace, one can cross it to go to big Ben, parliament, 10 downing st. And Westminster abbey. Wonderful sightseeing morning for good weather.

Oasis of tranquility. Along with Green Park and Hyde Park these 'green oases of calm' set London apart from many other major cities. Although there are always plenty of people there all ways seems to be space. Our family group very much enjoyed the break from the London hubub

Nice Morning Walk on a Chilly day at St James !!. Wonderful walk through St James Park to the Buckimgham palace is worth it.Best time to visit is during the day.We visited it early morning on our way to the change of guards.

Great spot for a picnic. We really enjoyed picking up sandwiches at Pret A Manger near Trafalgar Square and walking to the park for a picnic. It was then just a quick stroll down to Buckingham Palace.

Beautiful park just a short distance from the hustle and bustle. We sat in this beautiful park and had a picnic. There were squirrels, ducks, even pelicans! A lovely lake and a gardeners cottage. It was very well tended with pretty flowers and no litter. There were also toilets, always a bonus, even if we did have to pay 20p!

Lovely Park to relax. Another great park right beside Buckingham Palace. This park has it all, beauty, nature, food, it’s just a nice get away from the city. We grabbed a few drinks and some food and just say and watched everyone walking about. There were a few squirrels that came right up to us and let us feed them, it really was extraordinary. Certainly worth a quick stroll through if you have never been, as it is right by several major tourist attractions such as Buckingham Palace and Big Ben.

Lovely Park to relax. Another great park right beside Buckingham Palace. This park has it all, beauty, nature, food, it’s just a nice get away from the city. We grabbed a few drinks and some food and just say and watched everyone walking about. There were a few squirrels that came right up to us and let us feed them, it really was extraordinary. Certainly worth a quick stroll through if you have never been, as it is right by several major tourist attractions such as Buckingham Palace and Big Ben.
A favourite. My favourite of the london parks. It's just a bit more buzzy and I love the watching the various birds around the water.

What a beautiful park, well worth a visit.. It was a sunny day and we thoroughly enjoyed exploring this beautiful park. I loved seeing the Princess Diana memories laid in stones throughout the park and would happily visit here again. Stop at the Inn the Park for the best coffee ever.

Beautiful, peaceful park. St.James' park is simply beautiful, very peaceful with some stunning views. It is so well looked after and is very spacious. The location is perfect as it is in central London and provided a moment of respite for me on a very busy day! There are also cafes and toilets here.Perfect for families, couples, anyone really!
Beautiful park. Beautiful park for a walk or to grab lunch in the warmer months if you work nearby. Also the place for the iconic photo of Buckingham Palace.
Lovely park. Beautiful park that is well maintained, lots of lovely areas to sit and watch the world go by. You can hire deck chairs or just spread out a blanket.
Beautiful. I love this park and used to walk through it in all seasons on the way to work. The pelicans get fed at 2pm

Charming and great place for watching people. A charming and typical London Park. Lots of space, lots of fun birds, nice place to sit and watch people. I was a bit surprised though that the lawns was so brown, I thought it always rain in London (except when I'm there).
Lovely place to walk. This is a great place to walk and see the casual side of London. We went through from our hotel to Piccadilly nearly every day and it felt safe and was a lovely place to stroll.
Urban retreat.. A small peaceful retreat from urban jungle aorund it, with picturesque pond, interesting plants and intriguing corners.

Lovely place to spend a little free time :-). I took the children here during our trip to London as we had some time to kill while my husband went to the Churchills War Rooms. What a lovely place to stroll through or sit on the benches and watch the world go by. I wish the weather had been better but luckily some of the benches were under enormous trees which kept the drizzle off us nicely! My 7 year old son enjoyed spotting the squirrels as they scampered freely around the park, there were loads of them, as well as all the different birds. We saw the pelicans on their island in the lake, lots of geese and ducks as well as the usual pigeons. We strolled up to Buckingham Palace for a look and if the rain had eased up we would have spent some time looking around but it was not to be, so back into the shelter of the trees we went. We did find a play area which my son enjoyed though my 11 year old daughter wasn't impressed. She was more impressed by the nutella covered waffle I bought her from the little van near the play area, I was not impressed by the price I paid for it!! I'd love to have been able to visit when the sun was shining, maybe another time :-)

Springtime is the best!. I've been to St. James Park a few times. I love going early in the Spring, when the daffodils are just blooming. On nice days, it's a great place to hang out with friends, and picnic. Very clean, peaceful, and just beautiful!
Nice tgo walk there. A place to walk,very relaxing.I cross the park ,after viewing the Buckingham palace ,and guard change

Beautiful park. Love this park especially this time of the year, the flowers are stunning....as are the views . Places to eat and public toilets available. Try to make this one of the places to go when visiting London
Break from congestion of the area. Lovely park. The road was closed on Sunday which made walking to Buckingham palace very pleasant. Nice paths, lake and a palace on one end.

Loved this park. A lovely place with incomparable gardening and an incredibly romantic and picturesque duck house. I didn't eat in the park but the soft serve ice cream is a must! It's delicious and not artificial tasting at all. Go for a "flake" or a chocolate log with a cone if your diet will permit. The park is small and manageable in contrast to Hyde Park- it's also located right across from the Churchill War Rooms so it can be a nice treat after going through that exhibit Don't miss the pelicans!

Great in Summer. Arguably the best place to escape the hustle & bustle on a sunny day. The park is very large, with a bar/restaurant by the 'lake'.Still lots of people, but if you get off the main path..it's relaxing enough.In great walking distance to Trafalgar Square & Buckingham Palace.Nice change from the touristic madness of the hot spots!

The loveliest park in London. Such a pretty park. You can't fail but feel relaxed in here and the best walking route to take to Buckingham Palace. An oasis of tranquillity in such a bustling part of our great city.
great. avery cute park lovely sandpit play area for kids so don't forget bucket and spade plenty of seating and food kiosks
Great park to relax!. After a day of site seeing, this place was perfect to sit down, relax and enjoy the so called 'heat wave'.@instabuilt

Nice relaxing park. Park is close to the Buckingham Palace with beautiful flower gardens and a river runs through the park with various spices of ducks/birds inhibited in the park. Food in the restaurant is great! we had an enjoyable walk through the park after visiting the Buckingham Palace!

ideal for westminster workers or tourists needing a break. St James's is a park I could never have spent enough time in, and regret not spending more... It's got pretty lakes, a cute little 'house' on an island (to look at), very tame squirrels, and the most actively maintained flower borders I've seen in any municipal park. And views to Buckingham Palace (so some good photo ops).Tourists or office workers needing to chill (doing both gets frenetic) would do well going there, perhaps not actively as a destination in its own right, but walking through from the chaos of the changing of the guards, emerging in Westminster near to the Abbey & Houses of Parliament, or Horseguards for the War Rooms- good use of time
Great spot for a picnic!. Very good place place for a picnic / time out & especially if you are exploring nearby Parliment Square / Buckingham Palace / Horse Guards Parade
Flower borders.. Enjoyed a really relaxing stroll through this park, the flower beds were amazing, a riot of colour, plenty of seating and good (FEE) toilets. The Inn in the Park is good also.

Loved the Scenery!. I was here in London in the summer of 2014 and we came here and loved it! I really loved all of the variations of plants. There were very vibrant flowers and in the pond the were I think were either geese or swans (can't remember) but very beautiful! I recommend bringing a camera, tennis shoes or hiking shoes, and water.
Great to relax. Arguably the prettiest of Central London's parks - a great place to relax in Central London. Just leave the royals alone and feel free to out the paparazzi in the bushes.

Pelicans!. I love this park out of all the parks in London, walking from Victoria station passing Buckingham Palace and through the park with the lake, watching the ducks and geese then you see the pelicans, which are alien to the UK. Lots to do including boating, roller skating and a great café.

Beautiful park in a busy city. Its a beautiful park that lets you relax, hide yourself from the hassle and bustle of London life. It's very green summer with nice lake, lots of birds and flowers. So if you are tired of busy London life, you can easily go there and relax your brain. There is a view of some of parts of Buckingham place from there too. Getting there is so easy. You can get off at St james Park, Charing Cross or even West Minister and walk. So many buses stop around too. so if you decide to visit this beautiful park, I wish you have a great time)
Just a wonderful place to relax. I adore this park. It's quiet, peaceful and it's in the middle of London. Just a lovely place to have a coffee.

Lovelly. The park is very well maintained, it is very plasant walking around in the gardens and admired the lakes populated by geese and ducks, great place for the family especially if you can find a day with some sunshine. Not to be missed
Nice on a hot day. We walked from Trafalgar Square, lots of seats around to eat our picnic. Only downside not enough litter bins, the parks men were doing their best to keep them clear.
Great for small breaks. Amazing place 2 steps from the centre with an amazing wild life nice cafe sunbeds and lots of green for the hot ish days in London.
nice walk. lot of differant birds to see very pleasant plenty of food places to have a snack and very pretty park
Great. Just a great oasis in central London, never get tired of visiting it. The cafe needs to open up more tables as the queue was huge.
besutiful park in the middle of a busy city. nice to walk through with pleasant surroundings peaceful and relaxing wouldnt think you were in the city the victorisns certainly got it right

Beautiful even in winter. Absolutely beautiful! My husband and I were here during December and still could not believe the amount of greenery throughout the park. We had a wonderful walk and enjoyed seeing the different birds and views of the city.
A must see. Clean, nice, quiet ... it is able to absorb a huge number of people without loosing its atmosphere. Good stop to power up.

Lovely park. Because the weather was so pleasant, we decided to grab some sandwiches from a shop and have a picnic sat on the grass in St. James`s Park and watch the world go by! Lovely place to spend some leisure time with great views of Buckingham Palace, a very well kept park.

Lovely tranquil park in the middle of London. We walked through this park to get to Buckingham Palace and it is just lovely. It's nice that they have signs along the walkways pointing the direction to the local attractions. And on the sunny day that we were there, lounge chairs were available on the grass (for a small fee). This is a truly enjoyable park to have a relaxing walk.

Beautiful place to enjoy . It's quite and clean park to visit and enjoy the green and small lake in the center. Also great place for exercise and walk around. It links you between Buckingham Palace and parliament Square and Trafalgar Square.

Nice park, too crowded. The park is really nice, with many squirrels, ducks and birds, and some nice flowers everywhere. You've got a nice view on Buckingham Palace. The only drawback is that it is often overcrowded, especially during the touristic season.

Oasis in the big city - children love it!. Our children love this park. Situated between Buckingham Palace and Horseguards Parade and bordered by The Mall and Birdcage Walk (well known London roads) this park has a peaceful feel as soon as you enter it. There are lots of areas to sit down and relax and many people use the park as a place to grab a drink and a snack and have a few minutes away from the city rush (numerous kiosks can provide refreshments from within the park.)The park has a numerous fine features within it. St James's Lake offers many a pretty backdrop for the tourist snap with a range of birds often seen on the lake. Indeed, at the East end of the lake is Duck Island, a mini nature reserve within the park. Here if lucky you might get a good snap of the pelicans.Other good photo opportunities come from the Blue bridge that spans the lake (and leads to both a refreshment kiosk and public conveniences - both essential with children I find!) From the bridge you can get excellent shots of both Buckingham Palace and the London Eye.None of this however would register as my childrens' favourite element of the park. For them it is the grey squirrels. Many of these are now tame and with little persuasion will eat a range of nuts and tit-bits from your hand. We tend to let others do that part but offer snacks close to them and watch as they come up and eat the offerings.The other good part about St James's Park is simply the location. Close to so many other iconic London buildings and settings, it really is a beautiful urban oasis of calm in the big city.

Tranquility in the centre of London. It's always nice to stroll through St James's Park that, although is in the center of London, it does provide a tranquil setting for the visitor to relax and perhaps ponder a while on the various sites already visited in their busy tourist schedule.

Relaxing and serene. Everyone goes to Hyde Park but we didn't, we chose St James's Park instead. Oh Wow! It is a beautifully maintained part of London that should not be missed. We were there in July so there were lots of flowers to see and even a pineapple. Cheeky little squirrels were playing on the lawns, ducks and other water birds were everywhere. Don't miss it, you won't be disappointed.
Great Park. Great park with some great views and wildlife around the lake. You get some great views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge crossing the lake.

Plush and Beautiful. We took some family photos in this park. It seemed much more plush and beautiful than Kensington park. Grab lunch and have it there. I am still dreaming of the beautiful breeze and flowers. Really nice!
Beautiful Park. beautiful park right in front of Buckingham Palace. The most amazing tulips I've ever seen! Large park with duck ponds and running paths. Great for a picnic
Peaceful walk from Buckingham Palace to Westminster. Peaceful walk from Buckingham Palace to Westminster. Its an easy walk and offers great views of the palace

Beautiful Park. St James Park is a perfect place to rest after all day visiting London or perfect place to go and relax after a log day at work or read a book, is full of people but at the same time have this relaxing feeling because of the ponds and the animals around, is worth it to go and spend half of the day there.
A Beautiful Quiet Retreat in the Heart of London. An absolutely beautiful and well maintained park to stroll through between Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abby/House of Parliament

Great place to relax. This park is really nice. Even the pelicans think so.
Its great to go for a walk and have a relaxing day out.

A beautiful setting in the heart of London.. This is a great park for a Sunday stroll. A long lakes divides the long park in half and you can walk from Buckingham Palace to Parliament or the Churchill War Rooms.Walking along the waters edge you will see ducks and geese at the waters edge. You might see pelicans as well. There are benches to sit on and trees to lay against and just relax.

Relaxed Place. Wow place and relaxed, if you are sad and you are in London just go there and relaxed under so many year old tree and no one will disturbed you. But make sure you have your own mat or chair.

Great little park.. Well maintained Park. Plenty of bridge life and water fowl to guess. There is a small play area for children and plenty of ice cream sellers about. The paths are well maintained making great access for wheelchair users.
Serene. Really beautiful and very relaxing, especially after busy crazy London streets. Take a stroll and literally stop and smell the roses!

Beautiful Park near Buckingham Palace.. What a wonderful place to go for a walk in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of London. I highly recommend taking a stroll through the park on your way to Buckingham Palace if you are coming from the direction of the Thames river. I did see some lounge chairs in the park, with notices for payment to use, but we were strolling through the park on our way to the palace and did not sit.

Beautiful Park. St James's Park is bordered by Buckingham Palace (west), Horseguards (east), The Mall (north) and Birdcage Walk (south).It is a beautiful park. It was a beautiful sunny day when my wife and I visited the park. We got off at Green Park tube station and walked down Green Park, passed Buckingham Palace and then got to the park. There is a small lake where swans swim lazily.There are a few pelicans and waterfowl too. From the bridge crossing the lake, you get an excellent view of Buckingham Palace. It is very picturesque indeed. There were many people in the park having their picnics, or just soaking up the sun. We had our picnic too. The warm sunshine made it very enjoyable. There was an ice cream seller, but I found their prices over the top. £2.50 for a basic ice cream cone, rising upwards to £3 and above for anything a bit more fanciful. I think its a rip off.On a sunny day, St James's Park is the place to be in Central London.

Relax just blocks from Piccadilly Circus. My favorite London park because it's close to my favorite London hotel (Haymarket). For literature buffs, read Lord Rochester to understand what a wild place this once was and where some of our most taboo words were once made popular in poetry. Today, it's a respite from the hustle and bustle of Piccadilly. Loved the variety of fowl in the water.
Away from the hustle and bustle !. Wonderful walk through the park a peaceful setting Hard to believe this is in the centre of LondonAw

Friendly birds and squirrels. Be prepare to be "attacked" with cuteness. Bring some nuts and stuff and enjoy the animals friendliness. The park looks very nice and we enjoyed the walk from Buckingham palace to Whitehall.
Stunning park. The park is absolutely stunning- really nice to walk around and a must do when visiting Buckingham Palace.

Wonderful escape from busy London. This is wonderful place. Clean, relaxing, and pleasant. For us it was a great place to picnic and get away from all the crowds and hustle and bustle of London. It was also one of the the most important areas to allow our one year old to run around and get out some energy. Near Buckingham, it is also a great spot to catch some of the changing of the guard as well. Take a break from your busy sightseeing and relax in St. James's Park.
well worth a visit. Well worth a visit and very well kept park and a walk through is must especially if there is something going on

Nice small Royal Park in a busy end of London.. Lovely park in this busy end of London, squashed between Whitehall, Buckingham palace etc. it offers some small peaceful spots, nice lake, a small park compared by its other Royal siblings.

Beauty Abounds Within the City. From Birdcage Walk looking towards either Buckingham Palace or looking towards St.James Palace towards the Changing of The Guard or looking into the lake with its fountain or the many people strolling or absorbing the summer sun(not guaranteed)-still a respite and retreat from the hustle and bustle and some might say madness of the surrounding pace and intensity of the City
Stunning. Simply stunning. Great place to chill and relax. Too bad i was there only for a short period of time, but like it a lot. Near Buckingham Palace too.

Come here for pictures of london eye and the palace. Very relaxed stroll, saw many kids feeding the ducks. The park is filled with people but not overcrowded on a weekday. You can take nice pictures of the London eye on one side and Buckingham Palace on the other side if you walk to the blue bridge.
Lovely gardens. Another of our favourite place to visit whenever we get the chance - the kids enjoys it very much as well ...
A nice peaceful walk.. Beautiful and peaceful and a lovely place to stroll to get away from some of the thousands of tourists on the streets.
Quiet Park. Lovely place to go and read your book or for a short stop while visiting the attraction near by (piccadilly, buckingham palace)

A pretty breath of fresh air!. A beautiful and picturesque part of the city! Really close to lots of attractions so its an easy one to find! Loads of birds, ducks and friendly squirrels!
Check out all the beautiful flowers!

Simply Beautiful. Perfect walk through this lovely well maintained park.
Tranquility personified with lovely views as you walk.

An oasis in the centre of London. As I often have meetings in London I am a regular visitor to this park to kill time. Generally I love to sit next to the lake and watch the wildlife, both human and animal. Nature is certainly red in tooth and claw here as I have seen ducklings and other baby birds eaten either by marauding gulls or the impressive pelicans. Also keep an eye on your coffee and snacks as the squirrels are totally fearless!

Walk in the sun.. After visiting Buckingham Palace, it was so hot, we went in search of an ice cream. We walked over to St James Park and found a lot more. The grounds are stunning. We spent quite a lot of time enjoying the beautiful displays of flowers, plants and walk ways. It was breath taking. Well worth a visit and an ice cream...

A Favourite. Walk down Piccadilly, buy a takeaway coffee and chocolate croissant at Pret. Head to St James' Park en find a bench. Sit and enjoy!The fowl keepers cottage has a lovely little English garden - don't miss it.
Unwind a little.. This is a great place to slow down and take a stroll in between sight seeing. Take a picnic, ride a bike.
Busy but nice!. A nice way to approach Buckingham Palace,nice cafe serving decent quality food at quite reasonable prices.
Great !!!!. Excellent green park, to walk along going from Hyde Park to Buckingham Palace. Nature in the middle of London !

Tranquility next to the hustle and bustle. Great place to just relax. Think that this place is all that is left of the huge back garden of the King of England! Nice spot in the middle of a busy town. Look for the Duck house which used to be lived in !

My Favourite Central London Park. A delightful place to chill out & rest your feet after hectic sightseeing; there are lovely flower beds to enjoy and masses of different birds to watch. It is lovely & green & pleasant amidst all the large office buildings of Whitehall.

Nice and Cool. Fantastic for a sit in the sun and watch the world go bye.
Lots of birds and many different geese and ducks and big fish in the lake great views to Buck Palace and cool under the trees

Very good........ ........ and spacious, well worth a visit if in London. Very close to Buckingham Palace, so if you're walking in & around the area it's worth a visit - ideal for a picnic if the weather is fine. There are kiosks to get something to eat and drink although they are not cheap, so best to take your own if you're on a budget.

Beautiful little park. The bird life in this little park is stunning. There are many types of geese ducks and waders. The park is well maintained as are the paths providing great use for wheelchair users. There is a sign that says don't feed the pelican. No I didn't find it but it was great fun with the kids looking for it.

The loveliest of the Royal Parks. My favourite royal park.I love the birdlife on the pond and could watch from the bridge over the pond for hours. There's a nice small children's playground, and a fab restaurant to envy any on the west end, except its has the advantage of being in this beautiful park too. Deck chairs for hire on sunny days and a drinks kiosk near the Bucking Palace end for those just wanting a light refreshment.I recommend you go - London at its best for free.

Beautiful park near Buckingham Palace. Nice to walk through this park after you have admired the palace and want to get to the other side to horse guards. Loved the ducks in the park. All colors and varieties :) I can go back there again and just sit under a tree and read a book for hours by the side of ducks, swans and pelicans. Also, one of the very few free attractions in London :D

Peaceful park for a rest in the summer. Smaller London park in SW1 with pond, handy for a summer picnic when visiting Buckingham Palace, Houses of Parliament etc. Close to the small, traditional shops in St James's and joining Green park to the north.

Calm oasis near many touristy sites. The beautiful lake and birds in this park are a destination to view in their own right, but we used this park as a wonderful (calm!) meeting point when our family separated to different attractions. It was a fantastic spot for our youngest to run out some energy and take a break from the museum/church circuit. My husband stayed here at the park with her while my teen and I went to Westminster Abbey a couple blocks away. We met back up and my husband then toured the Churchill War Rooms (across the street) while the kids and I made our way across the bridge to the London Eye. You could also visit Buckingham Palace, the Houses of Parliament, and several other sites from here in an easy walk. Lovely place to take a break or have lunch away from the crowds!
If in the area. Nice gardens. Nice atmosphere. Nice to walk along the small pond. Choose a nice day. Not the best garden you can see in London.
A walk in the park. Nothing like a stroll through the park and maybe an ice cream on a sunny day. Always well kept and is just one of those things to do when in the smoke.
Beautiful Park. We recently visited St James park, it was a sunny and warm day, a great place to walk around, have a lovely picnic and even an ice cream at a reasonable price.

Just beautiful. Spent an entire afternoon here exploring, having a cup of coffee and watching the ducks in the pond. So close to that tourist trap of Buckingham Palace that you'll be there anyway, so be sure to see this.
Beautiful Park Near the Palace. Quintessential London Gardens. I highly recommend strolling through the park as you make your way to the palace.
Where have the pelicans gone?. Lovely park with a lake, birdlife, ice cream... but the famous pelicans were nowhere to be seen. Close to Buckingham Palace, The Mall and Westminster.

A lovely park summer or winter. This is one of London's finest parks, in the summer there are different varieties of birds which the tourists love to see and lots of photos taken, the park isn't massive but there are always people attending to the bins being emptied and this makes for a pleasant stroll. Being so near to Buckingham Palace is also a bonus.I often come here as the place is so nice

A pleasant area to walk around. Visited the park after a visit to the Churchill War Rooms. There are maps in various places so you know where you are and where facilities are, cafes, toilets etc. We had a sandwich in the park and a drink and sat on the grass soaking up the sun and watching the planes and helicopters flying above. There are seats around the park and you can hire a deckchair by the hour sitting on the grass. The lake in the middle has ducks, swans and pelicans. You can walk up to Buckingham Palace walking through the park instead of walking up the Royal Mile if you would prefer. You could walk one way and return the other to get a view of both. A lovely place and popular for all ages.

Beautifull. Great place to just sit and rest after a manic day of sightseeing and shopping. Realy is a lovley place. To just sit and chill out. Can easiliy forget your in the middle of a massive and very busy city. Will be visiting again this weekend.

Super park!. We were walking around London when we came upon St. James Park. Then we were halted behind barriers because the Royal Horse guards were practicing for a parade to happen in a couple of days when the Queen speaks to the people on the opening of Parliament. That was a treat.

Right by Buckingham Palace. Great views and greenery. Great place to come for relaxation and views not only of Buckingham Palace but also the London Eye, Westminster, St James Palace and the Horse Guard. Lake has a lot of birdlife around.

A stroll with a view.. My wife and I strolled through St James Park on a Sunday morning. It was a beautiful sunny day and the park was quite busy but there was plenty of space for everyone. We saw various wildlife and the park itself was in full bloom which enhanced the lake and fountains. It was a relaxing and stress releasing walk.

tourist trail. Horse guards is a beautiful building and the guards look very impressive in their finery. We walked through here several times. Also walked and sat in St James Park by the fountain on a very warm afternoon. It was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle for a while.

Lovely!. If you need to rest up a bit so then you can visit more of London, this is the place to be. The atmosphere is so calm and quiet, you can actually rest a bit. This park links the Palace to the Horse Guards parade grounds, plus other attractions. The metro station is near and you can move in and out easily.

Worth a visit to spend an afternoon here as beautiful. What a fantastic park, beautiful and relaxing after the hustle and bustle of the shops. Really has a timeless beauty and nice to bring a picnic and just take it easy. The parks in London are some of the best have ever visited.
Lovely. A really pretty park with a beautiful lake and lots of elegant large trees. It's brilliant to walk though and spend time with friends and family.

Lovely park . Always enjoy visiting the park. St James Park is a lovely park with beautiful flower displays and a nice lake. Great place for a stroll, picnic, ice cream away from the hustle and bustle of the streets. Really nice play area at the Buckingham palace end where the kids were able to let off steam while the adults enjoyed a cuppa from the kiosk next door.

Great place to relax. London is an extremely walkable city; but there's a limit for our legs. London has plenty of parks with AMAZING views. If you are tired, want to read, think, relax this or Hyde Park are the best spots on London.

A slice of london parks thats not too vast and links attractions. A smaller park linking Buckingham Palace to Horse Guards Parade ground. A lovely lake with fountains and Pelicans (yes I'm not lying), ducks and squirrels. Nicely laid out gardens full of colour, places to relax on deck chairs and chill (chargeable) sometimes bands play at the band stand. By walking across horse guards parade you enter Whitehall via the arch and pass soldiers on horseback.
Beautiful. London has so many parks, this is just one of them. Perfect for a day time stroll or to just grab a beer and hang out for a while. Well located within walking distance of many sights.
Beautiful park. Beautiful Park to take a leisure walk and enjoy the environment. It's beautiful design and flowers is a good place to take a break and enjoy the scenery.
Beautiful and peaceful oasis of calm. This park in the middle of busting London is a wonderful place to just stop and regroup. We were lucky enough to have a beautiful day and the park was magical.
Lovely and peaceful!. Beautiful, stunning, peaceful, clean. Toilet attendant in the ladies was obnoxious, but coffee facilities good.
Nice on a sunny day. We enjoyed relaxing here under the trees whilst waiting for our tour time around the palace. The park is very clean and well looked after.
Fabulous but overwhelmed. . .. A beautiful, relaxing bit of green in the middle of the world's greatest city . . . but avoid the weekends when the hordes descend.

Nice place to escape from the chaos of this huge city before going back to one of the tourist destinations. Nice place to retreat and relax in between other attractions. Closely situated to Buckingham palaca, St. James palace, Horse guards parade, Churchill's bunker....

A haven in the middle of London . There is nothing better than sitting in a deckchair listening to the band in the bandstand on a Sunday afternoon. Beautiful park with a lake in the middle with amazing views of Horseguards and Buckingham Palace.
The best little park in london. Walk onto the blue bridge in the very early morning. before the throngs. look to the palace. look to the london eye. breath it in. wonderful

Beautiful park, especially on a sunny afternoon. Whether for a run, for a walk with ice-cream (a number of stands where you can get some) or simply an afternoon nap under the trees.For pictures: from the Blue Bridge looking East towards Horse Guards you have a nice view overlooking the lake and the London Eye in the background.In case the weather isn't great, Churchill's War Rooms is just a few mins walk and well worth a visit.
Nice park, refreashing after a long day in the city.. Peaceful lovely park in the heart of London. Just perfect for an afternoon stroll. Winding paths and lots of green and flowers.

Pristinely kept and perfect for a Sunday afternoon jaunt. St. James's Park is a lovely place to spend an afternoon. The geese were quite friendly in this park. They had no qualms about taking a breadcrumb straight out of my palm. If you stand on the bridge near the middle of the park, you can observe the London Eye. Its central location makes it an excellent place to rest after walking around the busy city.
Beautiful . We walked through here back in June to reach Buckingham palace and were very impressed by how well kept the gardens and surrounding areas were!

Most centrally located park. It is a good option to go to St. James park if you don't have much time, and want to experience the 'London parks feeling' a little bit, although this park is always full of tourists and ill-mannered children, so you will have less chance to peacefully admire the park and its beautiful wildlife. Still, take with you monkey nuts, which is the favourite food of both the squirrels and the geese!

Could be the best park in London. Beautiful park, a lovely place to walk, or rest for a while only a short distance form the bustling city. Lots of hungry ducks, and a nice playground, to let parents take a break while the kids burd off some energy

Serene Park. From across Buckingham Palace, wandered into this park. As I walked on small animals, birds were surrounding me. The beautiful lake, looking through the Horse Guard area at one end and the Palace at the other. It is a good place to relax from the buzzling of the city even though it is amongst the tourist attraction area.
Nice park for a stroll. Beautiful... Kids loved the pelicans! Nice view of the palace as you walk up the park, lots of space to sit with an ice cream. Lovely haven out of the madness of the city.

Beautiful Park. The Park is very large and leads up to the spectacular fountain and entrance to Buckingham Palace. The water lake with waterfoul and paths make it a great place to take a break from the City.
Lovely park. We walked through the park and were just amazed by the beauty of it. Spend five minutes or the whole day in it, but it will certainly improve your day.
The squirrels and the palace. Whenever I visit London with children, I love passing by St. James's Park to look at the squirrels and get a nice view of Buckingham Palace!

Peace and quiet in the city!. This is a great park in the city and a super place to chill out while watching amazing bird life. The birds look very healthy in spite of the visitors feeding them with the worst things they possible could i.e. white bread! The signs ask NOT to feed them. The grounds in this park are in very good shape and the park keepers should be proud of their hard work. Bring a chair or a rug and a good book and time will slip by. By night the park is different again with a lovely neon light within the fountains. Very pretty.
A lovely city park. Beautiful scenery in the city surroundings. The swans are beautiful to watch and the lake is lovely to walk around. Nice play area for the children and public toilets too.
A delight. Charming place with a lake and a lot of animals. One of my favourite parks in all UK, well-placed, not very big and so enjoyable.
Nice break from the bustling streets.. We stopped here for an ok lunch after tramping round the streets. A nice green oasis. Actually very busy because Ride London was on that day.

Great to Chill or picnic after a Buckingham Palace vitsit!. We walked from the Houses of Parliarment past Downing Street and onto Trafalgar Square. From there we walked to Buckingham palace to see the Queen. :)St. James's Park is a green oasis in an otherwise very busy part of central London. Go there to spend 20 penies if you need the loo or sit and relax for a while. It is what it is... A green space, with a more relaxed feeling. Why not hire a deck chair for an hour and re-charge your batteries? Enjoy...

Beautiful Park. We walked through this park on our way to and from Buckingham Palace. The park has a lovely relaxed feel to it. There are some wonderful plants and trees as you would expect. There is a lake with usual water fowl. There are also plenty of squirrels that appear very tame and several people were feeding them by hand. Well worth a visit if in this part of London.

St. James's Park - Particularly Nice Public Space. Lovely outdoor space with water features, mature trees and a bridge which affords great photo opportunities (Buckingham Palace in the background). Lots of wildlife here, interesting birds and lots of squirrels. This park connects Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Horse Guards Parade and the corner of Parliament Square.

Tranquility at its Best.. This is a lovely park that gives you a feeling of tranquility. The park has nice walking paths and has some nice flower assortments to see. While we were visiting the park it seemed to be enjoyed by many families and couples just out for a stroll. The park also has a small lake which contains numerous ducks, a few swans and we even saw one blue heron. Definitely a must see in London , especially with it being right next to Buckingham Palace.
Great place for a stroll. Nice park close to palace to walk around. You can get off at green park tube stop and go to Buckingham palace, the ritz or St james' park.
Lovely park. We walked through here to reach Buckingham Palace and were pleased to see how well kept it was. It was busy but fairly quiet as well

Great for picnics, cafe lunch and running around for the kids. We always walk through this park to get from Green Park to Buckingham Palace. It is a large open space to safely lets the kids run whilst you have a proper walk. There is a great restaurant and cafe and a sweet park that keeps the little ones entertained for hours. If I could live around here, I would be in this park everyday.
Lovely!!. Beautiful park, lovely walk around the park. Would love to come back in the Spring/Summer to enjoy the beautiful trees and flowers.

Great Place to Relax from City Life. The park is a great place to spend an hour to escape the hustle of city life, there is a great play park for the kids with a Coffee kiosk right beside. The park boosts lovely walks and a chance to relax on the grass on a warm sunny day. Well worth a visit with kids, also the park is right beside other tourist attractions such as Buckingham Palace, the Mall and Green Park. great place to relax and unwind.

A Nice Stroll to Buckingham Palace. We walked through this park on the way to and from Buckingham Palace. As it was the summer, it was pretty busy. Grounds were well kept...and relaxing. Bathroom were 20pence to use.A few stands to buy snacks. Nice to see the swans and geese.We stopped in the children's area to play for a bit--was a nice area. But, smelled faintly of urine on the warm day, so we left rather quickly.Not the loveliest park I have strolled through...but, it was a picturesque way to walk while seeing Buckingham Palace.

Delightful afternoon . Walked around the park, got a surprisingly reasonably priced ice cream and sat on the grass. Had ducks walking up to us and saw some squirrels. The park was well kept and felt calm despite a large number of tourists around.

BEAUTIFUL PARK. a beautiful park, close to several other tourist attractions. is to relax on the weekend, to play in the sun or simply to walk five minutes for him. I recommend a visit. There are many things to do there by region.
Beautiful city park. I walk through here most days to work and love it every morning. It is very well kept and the views of the Palace are exceptional.

Great for a nice break. It is a great park in London to take a walk (mostly suitable for couples or friends) since you walk around a very nice lake full of birds. Some squirrels can be watched sometimes.
Beatiful Garden. beautiful garden near queen palace, with nice benches for people, lake with duck, big one & flowers of different colour, especially tulips

Duck Island Cottage will catch your eye. I loved this park! When we were there in the spring the daffodils and primrose were blooming and it was just lovely! So many beautiful birds all about. The bird keeper's cottage on Duck Island within the park is too sweet for words - just wanted to move in, light a fire and cozy up with a cup of tea!
Time for a Picnic. Great place for a picnic to escape the city. London has wonderful parks tucked away in every part of the city. This is one of the larger ones.

Sunny Saturday Afternoon.. Great way to while away an hour on a Saturday afternoon. Sitting in a deck chair that cost £1.60 for an hour, watching the world go by with my wife nodding off by my side before shooting off to change for the Theatre.Even got a hello from a park squirrel on the lookout for any scraps.Well worth an hour of your life.
Lovely park, kids thougth it was grear. I have visited this park many times. This is first time with the family. Very nice and in much bloom at the moment.

An oasis of calm!. Today, Sunday, was maybe the worst day to visit Buck Palace. People everywhere, bikes everywhere. Thank heavens for St. James' Park! An oasis of calm and probably the best ice cream I've had this holiday. Definitely recommended!

A place like from a fairytale.. A feel-good and de-stress park.. The loveliest and most picturesque little park hidden right in the central London. A wonderful and peaceful place with loads of birds and squirrels everywhere. Its a hidden gem in the heart of the city. Go there to relax and unwind from the busy streets.

Run, run as fast as you can, St. James park is a bird wonderland.. I am a running enthusiast in California, addicted to running trails four to five times a week. My greatest fear leaving for London was that I would not find a quiet, place to let go of my excessive energy. Although not a mountain trail, St. Jame's Park offers the quiet and solitude a soul runner like myself needs. I must admit that my first try was disappointing as half of London must have been there. Then I switched to my regular American running time of 5:30am and presto !, no Brits, no Americans, no anyone... except the birds, the geese and squirrels. Loved it. Nice short run so I did it thrice and ran back to the hotel. Don't miss this lovely historic park. The lake is tranquil and the bird life active and plentiful.

Perfect escape in the city. Beautifully kept gardens. Safe and tranquil with brilliant views, loads of squirrels and birdlife. Lovely place for a romantic picnic or even a lunchtime nap away from the hustle and bustle.
A pleasant couple of hours. Thoroughly enjoyed the wander around.great to have such lovely spaces in the middle of a major city. A great mixture of trees
Relaxing. Wonderful place to spend your afternoon. Squirrels there are so much fun, they don't mind climbing up your leg to pick up a nut. Very exciting

Wonderful Walk between Whitehall and Buckingham Palace. We walked through St.James Park between the Royal Horseguards Museum and Buckingham Palace. It was a very peasant walk with a large pond with ducks, even herons.

Lovely for a stroll. St James's park is beautiful for a walk when you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. If you plan to visit buckingham palace and want a scenic route then a stroll through the park makes a welcome change from arriving by bus or tube. The grounds are beautiful. Well maintained and spotless. There is a wide variety of wildlife to see and a range of birds from pigeons to pelicans. There are also places to stop for an ice cream, snack, hot drink or complete hot meal, as well as deck chairs to rent by the hour. A lovely free activity in central London - has to be good!
Water Fowl Galore. Gorgeous grounds, multiple water fowl, a true haven in a very bustling city. This is a spectacular place for a picnic or stroll.
Great start to the day. What a magnificent way to start the day and what a magnificent setting. The custodians have done a great job!

So picturesque. We had lunch in St. James's Park. It was a partly cloudy/partly sunny day & we ate our lunch as we people watched & spotted various sites we had seen. It was very relaxing which was a welcome to us all.

Look for Pelicans. Sat down to watch "the world go by", saw a sign saying "do not feed the pelicans" - thought the signwriter had made a spelling mistake and mean't pigeons - next thing 3 pelicans came gliding by! Also saw a black swan, heron, stork etc., an oasis in a very hot London definitely worth a walk around didn't look for any facilities as on our way to Horseguards Parade.

Tranqil. With Horse Guard's Parade at one end and Buckingham Palace at the other, this is possibly the most elegant park in London. Relatively quiet and peaceful, it is an excellent option for a place to take some time out and reflect on the beauty of how nature and architecture can coexist.

Big, Beautiful Urban Escape. This is a beautiful park to spend time walking through on your trip to London. It is near many of the other popular attractions and will not cause hassle by being out of the way. If you're walking around the city, take a route through St. James's Park and be happy about your decision.
Beautiful place. Enjoyed taking scenic route through park to Buckingham Palace. Loads of different type of birds ducks, a heron, geeses and very tame squirrels. Very pretty and quaint park.

Can I just pop a tent up here? April 2014 visit. Absolutely beautiful and gorgeous park! My sister and I stumbled here on our way to the changing of the guards, and I'm so glad we did. There are cute and VERY friendly squirrels, beautiful black and white swans, creatures of all sorts, and the scenery is just absolutely gorgeous.

Buckingham's front yard. This park is situated right beside Buckingham Palace and it is beautiful for a short picnic of around 1 hour as it does not take more than 15 minutes to cover the park grounds. There are friendly duckling, squirrels, and swans in the lakes.Don't forget to bring some snacks for our little friends in the lake.The park is perfectly situated between many famous landmarks and all within 15-25 minutes walk including Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, and Hyde Park Corner

Spectacular. Beautiful park and well worth a visit. After a lovey stroll take time to rest on one of the many seats and watch the wildlife in the lake. The restaurant food is pretty average and expensive so visit a nearby cafe in town and bring a picnic lunch.
St. James' Park, London. Nice surroundings - lovely to see all the wild birds. Very close to Buckingham Palace and Westminster. Worth a visit.

Lovey area to walk. Lovely place to walk through to get between Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace and toilets that are easy to find and clean....but you do neet to pay to use them so have change on you. Also has a little kiosk for coffee etc.

Lovely green park that's a delight. This is a great place to wander around and take lovely breaks. Combined with a visit to Buckingham Pallace, it's a few hours' time pleasantly spent in the heart of London.

Oasis of calm. St James's Park is in the centre of the West End of London, close to Parliament, & close to regent St. There are numerous good eateries around. Regent St shopping is a short step away, as is Theatre land. The park has a large lake, numerous mature trees, loads of interesting plants, & enough aquatic wildlife to satisfy most. There are numerous benches around the park, & plenty of footpaths for those who prefer something more energetic than sitting to do their people watching. Space enough for ball games too.
Beautiful and peaceful. A really beautiful and peaceful park right in the centre of London. Plenty of birdlife, including the favour Pelicans

Green Oasis in Central London. If visiting London step aside from constant sightseeing and stroll through at least one park. This is close to lots of the major tourist sights and is a free way to relax. You can even hire a deck chair for a while. The food and ice cream at the kiosk is cheaper and better than the dire street vendors food in London

a pleasant walk. We started our walk at Oxford Street through Hyde Park and then continued down to Buckingham Palace through Green Park. We walked along the Mall for a bit and the continued our "park" walk through St James's Park. We then had a pleasant walk to Horse Guards Parade.We did attempt to have a snack at Inn on the Park but it was busy and expensive.P.S. toilets are available in the park but you need to pay.

St James Park. Very nice park in London just next to the Buckingham palace. There are few fast foods, benches, ducks and other water birds you can enjoy surrounded by a piece of nature in Central London.
A stroll through Saint James park. A nice walk through the park we saw squirrels, ducks and swans on the water and many picturesque views, we then saw horse guards arrive, very entertaining.

You never know whp you might see here. A lovely park, complete with ponds, ducks and other birdlife. A favourite location for movies and TV dramas. A stroll through the pathways often will calm after the buzz of the city nearby.
