Pretty park.. Tourists don't really linger in parks much, so you'll probably enjoy this park only as you cut through from the Horse Guards to Buckingham Palace. It's really a pretty park, with lots of shade and interesting things to look at.

Lovely time out of the hustle and bustle. Park is a nice change of pace for the busy and tired tourist. Had a lovely walk through the park and took time on a bench to people watch. Saw the most curious tree there. pic inc

Green and Pleasant London. Given the fact that the nearest neighbours are the Royal Family you would expect nothing less from this lovely park that runs parallel to the Mall.There are some stunning trees in here especially the large Weeping Willows by the lake . Great for a stroll in the evening as the sun sets a million miles away from the hectic city that surrounds it.

Incredible Park !. Arguably the most beautiful park with an incredible backdrop of Buckingham Palace. A great place for kids and nature lovers to get closer to the animals (squirrels, swans, etc...). Lovely place to spend a lovely morning/evening even during winter.

A little oasis in the bussle of London city. A wonderful and free place in central London. Anyone can stroll through these lovely gardens, take a little snack and sit on the grass and take time out from the hussles of London. The parks of London are an amazing green, relaxing space free for anyone to use. Enjoy them, they are wondrful

Beautiful park in the middle of a busy city. We walked through this Park almost every day we were in London. It has a great collection of birds...our children loved to feed them. It was on the way to the Palace and couple other places we visited and made the walk very pleasant.

beauitful park. i liked it very much everything was well maintained and very clean show how london takes care of everything for tourist and the people who live there i love london its beauitful and the rain is so fresh
summertime. London is perfect in the summer . Having time to enjoy nature is a grate experience . Sit on a bench , reed a book. Or have a great fun with your family
Beautiful park!. The park is big, many trees and next of the Buckingham palace. It has the lake with of the small bridge and many turists.

Lovely London park.. A haven of tranquility in the middle of the city. We are very lucky to have such lovely parks in London. If it's a nice day grab a sandwich and a drink and hire a deck chair to take a break from sightseeing or shopping here in the park. It's lovely.

Quiet park in the city. Lovely place to spend time walking round at your leisure,opposite horse guards parade and takes you up to Buckingham Palace without having to walk along The mall with all the traffic.

Stroll your worries away. Walking through the park was a pleasurable way to soak up half an hour while waiting to visit Buckingham palace. Cute little ducklings, good city views, colourful cottage garden and lots of relaxed tourists.

A nice breathe of fresh air in the bustling city.. This was a nice and large relaxing haven in a bustling city. You should try to walk through it and enjoy the greenery if you are walking between Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abby, and Big Ben.
Nice Park. Nice park to take a stroll through. Lots of birds in the lake to add to the ambience. Not too crowded. Nice place to take a rest or while away the time.

Nice break from the busy city. St. James's park has a great location, a short walk from a tube station, across the road from Churchill War Rooms, and directly adjacent to Buckingham palace. With so many major attractions nearby, St. James's park is a nice place to take a breather from the crowded, bustling city. The park is very green, and with all the animals and trees, you almost feel like you are taken out of the busy city for a few moments. There are park benches that you can sit on (if there are any spaces available), and have a snack between visits to attractions.
A relaxing walk in a mad city. Beautiful park, really busy but still felt relaxed. They could do with a few more public toilets as there were very long queues.

Nice peaceful park. The park is spacious with over 30 different variety of birds. It has a beautiful man made lake. The squirrels are very friendly. Its a beautiful clean park for walking and relaxing after the madness of tourists at Buckingham Palace and Horseguards parade. One of my favourite spots to go when visiting London

Nice Walk to Buckingham Palace. This park was near to our hotel so we walked through it to get to Buckingham Palace, the Canada Memorial, to the Mall to see the changing of the guard and to enjoy the peacefulness and tranquility in the middle of large city. When it is drizzling outside you don't feel the rain because of the thickness of the tree branches covering many of the pathways that are well maintained. There are plenty of benches to sit and relax or people watch.
Great Picnic Spot. Huge array of birds, very well looked after grass and flower beds and lively atmosphere againts great back drops of either Buckingham Palace or Horse Guards Parade!

Relaxing. A nice and relaxing park in central London. Lots of birds, including herons, also very friendly grey squirrels, so different from their continental cousins. Close to Buckingham Palace, Downing Street and Churchill War Rooms. Within walking distance to the Houses of Parliament and London Eye.
Beautiful trees. Lovely shady park alongside Buckingham Palace - a pleasant stroll through this lovely park after our Changing the Guard tour

Nice quiet park in Central London. It's a nice park to walk through with your significant other. It has a lot of geese and ducks that walks around and also some squirrels whom you might be able to come across. The park is ideal to sit and relax in, sipping on a takeaway coffee maybe.

Beautiful & Peaceful. Easy park to take in and very close to the palace. Quite a few places to sit and plenty of lawn to picnic on. Lots of park wildlife to enjoy. Plenty to photograph if that's your hobby.

Beautiful and Relaxing. If you enter this park from Buckingham Palace, you enter through gold gates and you feel like you are entering a piece of heaven. The grass is green, the flowers are stunning and the ducks and birds are amazing. We took bird seed in and had a blast feeding all the ducks and birds. You aren't allowed to feed the storks, however. Most of the big geese ate right from our hands. If you enjoy birds, there are many different breeds in the park and you can get excellent pictures. It rained the whole time we were there but still did not dampen the fun and the big, beautiful trees were excellent for keeping dry.

Amazing park, picturesque tranquility in Westminster. Love it - my favourite place to have a break and admire the luscious flowers and lakes. Gets pretty crowded on sunny days, and very touristy (understandable given the location).

Peaceful and quiet.... The toned down atmosphere of this lovely park, the bright sunlight falling upon trees creating soft dancing shadows and the baby ducks paddling in the calm waters of the lake creating feather shaped ripples is perfect for peace and nature lovers. Come here for some quiet thinking time with a bottle of cool lemonade and a snack to much on and this experience is guaranteed to be a memorable experience of your lives.

It's a Park.. I'm sorry, but if you've seen one park, you've seen them all. I really couldn't tell you if we were at St. James Park, or Hyde Park, or Vondelpark, or Central Park (just kidding), but after a few minutes they all seem to become one in my eyes. My wife hates it when I write stuff like this, but it's true! Go see Abbey Road, or take a run up to Camden Market and watch people! That's much more interesting!
Bring nuts for the squirrels!. A really nice "small" park in the middle of London, visit the old house of the bird keeper, and feed the squirrels with nuts is a must :)

beautiful park grounds. St James park is beautifully maintained a real pleasure to wander around or to just sit and watch the birds on the lake. The houses of parliament one end and Buckingham palace at the other with whitehall and Downing street near by. Convenient for the Churchill war rooms

Great for a Stroll. Look out for the Pelicans! We walked here from Regents Park past the very moving War Memorials & into St James Park. It's often very busy but well worth a visit. The cottage on the lake contains the best office space in London. I once had a an interview in there....Restaurant/cafe very pleasant & again pricey but good quality.( Wish they'd use less disposable materials in the royal parks cafes.) For anyone interested in waterfowl there's some fantastic breeds on the lake. Upto twenty, young male Red-creasted Pochcard when I visited earlier in the year. Glorious..
Pretty park. Handy location next to Buckingham Palace. A pleasant stop to sit on the grass and enjoy an ice-cream before walking around the Palace walls.

Stay awhile in this lovely park. St James Park is a beautiful park for sitting in on a sunny day the lake is spectacular with abundant wildlife including some Pelicans! Next to Buckingham Palace, the Houses of Paliment , 10 Downing Street , Horse Guards Parade, Whitehall and Trafalgar Square
beautiful park. We had lunch in this park. It was very busy. Grass was a bit dry. Lot's of tourists and a couple of runners trying to avoid them :-). Lovely park and a nice view of Buckingham palace.
Lovely, as always. Lovely bit of park space between Whitehall and Victoria. A bit crowded during peak holiday time, but well kept, green and flowery!

A great park in the heart of London. St James park is a larger beautiful and varied park in the heart if the city, off the mall or birdcage walk and very near Buckingham palace. There is art, wildlife, deck chairs, cafe, ice cream and more. Always worth a visit, a walk, a change to sit and chill and appreciate your surroundings when in the hustle and bustle of London
Simply Magic. Beautiful, photographic, relaxing, take your time to enjoy this magical garden and water feature. Simply magic.
A pleasant walk in Westminster. The Park is well kept and a delightful place to pass some relatively quiet time in the center of London.
Beautiful oasis in a busy city. It's hard to believe you are in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world. What a beautiful park!

Beautiful walk. First visit to this park. Not too big so was able to walk round the whole park. Busy with people but plenty room for everyone. Well kept and looked after. A beautiful well used green space in the middle of the city
Pleasant . A lovely pleasant walk back from Buckingham.palace and throngs of tourists ,very peaceful ,clean park

Not Just for Tourists. Family picnics, romantic strolls having a few Cheeky wines with the girls. If you want a cheap day out then St James's Park is a winner. Do take a picnic and some tasty treats maybe some games (Sometimes theres free music on a sunday in the bandstand) DO not expect to get a 99 for 99p this is LONDON and technically the Queens Front garden.
A real Jewel. A great place for a stroll, picnic- or just getting away from the hustle and bustle. Regardless of the season, a must when you are in London. One of the most beautiful parks.

Peace and quietness. I love going there quite early as it is when it is more calm. Although I also love other parks in London, this is my favorite. It has really lovely spots and it of a perfect size.
Lovely. If you want to get away a bit from the traffic and smog of London, this is a good place to take a stroll or have a little picnic. Swans etc on the lake. It was an idyllic oasis.
Picnic in the park. Great place for a romantic picnic in the Park, after watching the changing of the Guard. Plenty of space for like minded couples

Total relaxation..... if you decided to visit London and the palace, then a "walk" through St. James park is a must do....
It's that thing with London's parks... They are huge and soooo many... Really your kids gonna love it and you will have the opportunity to relax a bit watching them play in a small paradise....

Great for picnics with kids. St. James's Park is a stone's throw away from Buckingham Palace. We had a picnic there and even though there are many people in the park, we still had enough space to throw a frisbee.

Great little park. Fab park that you can take a wonder thou on the way to Buckingham palace from hoursgards like we did.
plenty of wildlife that kept our 2 year old happy. lots of bird life and squires (probably not sapoes to feed them but we did)
it can however get rally busy on a nice day

green oasis. Nice to go and sit for an hour and watch the world go by on a hot summers day, some good shady areas allow you to escape the heat of the sun. nice laid out gardens and a good way to walk down to the palace or across that part of london

Great for relaxing, and for kids.. This is a great place to walk to get away from the crowds of the city. It is nicely done and makes you feel as if you are in the countryside. It is also a great place to let the kids run around a bit.
Nice place!. Nice park to walk around and spend some time relaxing. Refreshing in the summer and relaxing all the year
Great little park. Nice park to stroll through , nice to see ducks n a lovely little play area for kids .. Plenty of drink stations n great views

So glad to have stumbled on this gem. We didn't mean to visit St James' Park, we kind of walked there by accident on the way back to our hotel. But once we walked in we wanted to stay all afternoon! What a beautiful park! We especially liked watching the ducks and swans, and the flower gardens were beautiful.

You can see pelicans and a great view of the Buckingham Palace. Although it is always packed, St James's Park is one of the best parks to have a stroll in London, rain or shine. You can see lots of different birds here and get an amazing view of the Buckingham Palace. It is also well connected to all other tourists attractions so if you don't feel like walking in the roads or taking the tube, you can walk through St James's Park to get to Green Park, Hyde Park and Picadilly Circus (and beyond). Try getting up early for a stroll there --- it is a whole new experience that includes peace and tranquility!
Beautiful. Beautiful park in Central London!!Many squirrels live there, so carry a bag of peanuts, they'll love it, some of them take from your hand, so cute!!
Must see!. Gorgeous site, incredible to find such a natural feel deep inside a huge city like London, gives you an undeniable sense of calm and peace, playing with the squirrels is a must do.

Relaxing. Very nice park with a large pond and well maintained gardens. Stopped here quickly for an ice lolly whilst walking from Buckingham palace to Big Ben and was surprised how quiet and relaxing the park was.
Nice fora summer stroll.. It's just a very beautiful park with lots of fairy tale views. Perfect for a quiet pick nic or Sunday stroll.

NOT THE BEST PARK!. The gardens from the entrance of Horse Guards Parade are really beautiful. Loved the little squirrels running around taking nuts from people! But the close you get to the pond and after the café the garden is in dire need of some TLC! Also one would imagine that there would be an irrigation system for the lawns which in mid-July were almost non-existent! It is a quick route though to get to Buckingham instead of going down the Mall. It was very busy when we visited. Pity the whole park isn't as well maintained and looked after as the entrance from Horse Guards!
So relaxing, feels close to nature. Very nice park with a pond and all the nature inside. You can spot swans, many different type of birds and squirrels, pelicans too!

Very nice English park. Near Buckingham Palace and on the way to the House of Commons, you can see the London Eye and Big Ben off in the distance. Nice stream with ducks. Good walk as an alternative to walking down the Mall. I used it as a path to the Cabinet War Room and Churchill Museum.

overrun by tourists. This is a lovely park which is overrun by tourists from all four corners of the world. If you're from Guangzhou, Daegu or Kitakyushu, it seems you must have your picture taken from the bridge over the with Buckingham Palace in the background. Avoid at peak hours unless you need to use the lavatory which is usually clean and even has warm water.

Escape from the office. Ideal place to escape from the office for lunch (so long as it's not raining too hard) - this is a well maintained and relatively safe place to munch your lunch on a bench or on the grass. Sometimes the school parties can get a bit rowdy - but this is London so what do you expect?
Nice walk, lots of duck and water birds. Beautiful walk from the palace to the horse guards, although very crowed with tours and student group on weekend
barefoot on grass. We were there to relax after visiting the Natural History Museum, and we fell asleep on the grass, in the shadow, just perfect!
From Buckingham to Westminster. Lovely walk between Westminster Abbey to Buckingham Palace, passing the Guards ont the way. A quiet haven, perfect place for a stroll after viewing the sites.

Best park in Central London. Located right next Green Park, St James's Park is an immaculate piece of greenery in the heart of Mayfair/ Piccadilly. Lots of lovely planting which is very well maintained, a large lake with it's own island (Duck Island), as well as an abundance of wild life. Plenty of space to sit and relax, and just watch the world go by. Very popular with picnickers of all ages, plus there is a very good restaurant located inside the park. There are also toilets available in case you need them. My tip: especially in late spring and summer, take a picnic hamper with you, some blankets for placing on the grass, and just enjoy this beautiful place. Don't forget to take some extra bread to feed the large assortment of ducks and wildlife, and maybe some nuts for the very tame squirrels. The park is free entry.
Perfect park. Perfect little park. Lots of benches for sitting and watching the world go by. Love all the weeping willows
lovely park. lovely park for a nice stroll, see the geese, ducks and swans, see the flowers and wonderful trees. lovely.
Quiet spot. A great place to just escape from the London hubbub. . in the heart of London, close to lots of major attractions
Amazing. Wow what a very beautiful park to get around you leave a very busy road to go into a very beautiful park take a break walk around feel the flowers amazing
Beautiful park short walk from London Big Ben and many tourist attractions.. This park was beautiful.It was a sort walk from our hotel.This park is a relaxing walk and in the center of the city.

A green pearl in the middle of Royal Palaces. One of the smallest and yet most charming park of London.A lot less crowded than neighbouring Green Park, it's the perfect place for a jog around the lake or showing squirrels and Chinese ducks to the kids.

Lovely leafy park near the horseguards. I love St. James's park and always end up here when we visit London. The park is well kept and popular with locals and tourists. It has plenty of squirrels on the ground and waterfowl in the lake. It is lovely to walk from Whitehall through Horse Guards Parade and across the park to end up outside Buckingham Palace. We sat for ages at the Buckingham palace end and watched the geese with their young ones in tow.
Oasis of calm. Lovely oasis of calm in the middle of the city. Squirrels and wildfowl galore, plenty of seats to rest.
What a beautiful place.. Amazing park. Lots of wildlife. Really well kept and clean. No rubbish lying around.A really nice place to go if your in london and perfect for a walk.
Calm and Peaceful. Great place to escape the buzz of the city. Nice to sit and relax or wander through. We used it to walk from Houses of Parliament up to Buckingham palace on a hot July day.
Relaxing, green and lush. After a great visit to Westminster Abbey, it was so relaxing to stroll in this lush park, with the London drizzle of rain and the ducks and birds all around us.

Tranquil and serene. It's a beautiful park! Wander through, look at giant trees, plants, flowers, swans and ducks, etc. Have a good time and take a breather from the hustle and bustle of London. Leave a few crumbs for the birds, (but don't get caught ;) after you've had a lovely picnic. Afterwards, when more rested, get up and wander over to the palace for a gander at Queen Liz's place. It's close by, and she won't mind !
Peaceful. Great place to get away from it all, yet you are right in the core of the city and most attractions. Make a point of savings a couple of hours to spend here !!

Great Place to Watch the Horse Parade for the Changing of the Guards. The Park itself is a very nice place in itself to sit and relax on one of the park benches. My wife and I were there mainly to see the horse review for the Changing of the Guards at Buckingham Palace. This was ideal as there was plenty of room and not the large crowds found at Buckingham Palace.
A little relaxation. Beautiful gardens. Great for a little down time from all the sightseeing. Easy to walk pathways and very clean park.

Disappointed. We were visiting London from the North-East of England and I was shocked by the park. The lake in the middle is beautiful and has some very nice views of the palace and the eye, however is cost 50p to use the toilet and there were chairs around that you had to pay to sit down on! One afternoon in St James Park and I felt like the city was mugging me!

Great park !!!. Chose to walk from the Westminster area to Buckingham palace through the park. Great experience. A lot of birds including swans as well as squirrels running around.
Great view from the bridge.

Relaxing. Away from the hustle and bustle. One of the smaller parks in London, but as with all of the London Parks there is space, time, relaxation and people watching time. I am not from England, but love London Parks

A beautiful park. This is a beautiful park between Whitehall Street and Buckingham Palace. It is one of the many "green spots" in the city and is delightful. We ate lunch at the restaurant in the middle of the park - it was OK; nothing special.

green haven in london. Such a beautiful park off the mall. Views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge over the lake. Really nice to chill on the grass for a moment, away from the hustle and bustle of London.

Don't eat the swans!. Always a pleasant stroll on a weekday in the city. Keep an eye out for the squirrels, they are pretty cheeky. It would be interesting to taste one of these royal squirrels, however don't eat the swans because if HRH sees you then it'll be 'off with your head'. Settle for an ice cream and a cuppa beside the lake.
relaxing walk. We catch a sunny day in may and we had a nice walk with our children in the park. It was gorgeous and relaxing
St. James Park Stroll. Of course since the weather was beautiful, the park was full. Didn't see trash, it was a very relaxing place to be, or a great avenue from one place to the other.

Take time to relax and enjoy it. St. James Park is absolutely stunning, the trees, the lake, flowers, and birds are fantastic. There are chairs to rent so you can sit and relax. I would recommend renting a chair and taking time to enjoy the view!

My favorite park!. I love this park, walking through beautiful flowers, swans, squirrels...close to Bukingam Palace!
good for a picnic in the grass, or just for walking in relax.

Best place to take a walk. I love St. James park, and the fact that they rent beach chairs in the summer, so you can sit on the lawn and think. Picturesque and a restful spot in the middle of London. Bring your camera!

Very tranquil. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this picturesque park situated beside Buckingham Palace. I brought along a picnic which I ate beside the lake whilst admiring the beautiful scenery and hungry ducks and swans scavenging for crumbs. Lots to see and in close proximity to underground services and famous tourist attractions. It gave me a chance to escape from the city lifestyle and to relax in tranquil surroundings.

Squirrels!. Love this park, go regularly. But take some walnuts and hold it at thigh height with your leg out at an angle. The squirrels will climb your leg and take the walnut from your hand. Do not miss this under known London quirk.

Vist b4 Thriller show, july 12,2015.. ok park with lakes full of various duck breeds, loads of coots and some cranes. Walked to Buckingham Palace and back. only average marks due to getting soaked in the rain with little shelter.

The horses are great.. We were there to chill and watch the changing of the guard at horse guards parade. Some poor Japanese lady got the fright of her life as she was so focused on taking a picture of the guards in formation she got a little close and a mounted policeman shouted at her. Please beware it is great to see but the horses stop for no man or woman. The thing about the changing of the guard at horse guards parade as opposed to buck palace is you get so much closer.

London 2015 Vacation. Our children loved it here! We came by daily to visit the many species of ducks and to have lunch. We also came out for evening walks after dinner. Excellent ice cream at the café, best to bring your own lunch if you can.

St, James Park.woth two visits!. We did our own walking tour of London, before we did our FREE Sandeman tour. So, we visited St. James Park twice! It was a very docile place to visit, even with hundreds of other visitors.
Quite and nice to walk through. Just walk through the park, it is never busy as it is just very large! Enjoy the quietness and sit down once a while.

Absolutely amazing. St James's Park is amazing. Once minute you are in the hustle and bustle of London and step inside to a peaceful park. The Park is huge. Plenty of space to relax and have a picnic. We saw squirrels and lots of birds. The playground was great - amazing how they have used natural wood and stones to blend into the park. We walked from one end to the other, can't wait to return.

One of the lungs of London. St. James's is one of the lesser-known great parks of London and yet it runs form near Buckingham Palace at one end to Whitehall, the centre of Britain's government, at the other. It is the perfect size with beautiful gardens and lakes and is beautiful in every season. Children will love it.

I LOVE IT. St James's Park, one of the best park in London, is so paceful and relaxing taking a sit here, be surrounded by this beautiful nature and flowers, the little nosy squirrels playing raound you looking for some food, the ducks etc, you should go there...
Morning stroll. Great location to get away from the bust streets of London and if with children a great place for them to run free and enjoy the nature.

I visit almost everyday. This park is wonderful, I love the parks in London but this one is quite lovely. There are so many animals and they are all very friendly but also keep to their own areas. Can spend hours there. The view from the bridge is amazing.

An Oasis of Tranquillity in a Bustling City. One of London's smaller parks, we are so lucky to have so many, visit - you will not believe you are still in the city, on a sunny day you can while away the hours here, lovely lake, stroll though, you will not fail to love this park

Great Walk in a Buiteful Park. This is a best park in central London, small animals and birds, beautiful lake, flowers, green areas, central location,....etc.
I would also recommend visiting Regent Park and Kew Gardens.
Beautiful flowers. Wonderful landscape. Beautiful flowers, a nice lake and a great place for a stroll. It is a must on any visit. I think it is by far nicer than Hyde Park.

Great for a stroll, a sit down..... Part of our London trip".......cut through the park to Buckingham place ....changing of the guard....stroll down mall to house guard sq. worth a stroll through one way otherwise you'd miss the wee gems off the mall.
Clean,a lot of runners and people walking. Loved the Canada WWI & II maple leaf and water feature. Close to transit and Buckingham Palace & Westminster Abby, Safe ballots of people about
wonderful gardens and pond. beautiful park, probably my favourite in London. The bird life is amazing, especially the pelicans, so make sure to wander around the large pond

My favorite park in the city. Loved walking around St. James Park. One of my favorite parks as it is more scenic than the others. The weather was amazing while we were there so there were lots of people out and about. Very well maintained.
Sunny Saturday Afternoon. Fantastic weather, and a lovely park to wander around with a group of work friends, park gardens are looking beautiful this time of year.

Nice stroll. Take a walk from the Trafalgar Square down to the Admiralty Arch or to the Horse Guards and through the St. James Park to the Buckingham Palace and on to the Hyde Park. Make sure you cross the little bridge and look back toward the Horse guards as you will get a great view of the London Eye.
Amazing time. I like St. James's Park. It looks perfect, the nature inside and the silence. It is a quiet, perfect place in a giant city.
A walk in the park. So peaceful and beautiful to walk by the pond--lots of different ducks around.Sat out and watched the world go by!!
Beautiful and Peaceful. This park is beautiful! Park was clean and in a very good location! Great place to sit and watch the world go by! Very impressed and will be returning soon :-)

Most beautiful and Picturesque. In London this the most enchanting park to visit . The location is easy access by the public transport .The beauty and the landscape of this park is breath taking .It just s joy to drink on the beauty of the English garden . A must visit place .

Have lunch in the park!. Beautiful place to just sit and watch the world go by....Grab a "to-go" snack or lunch and head to the park for a relaxing moment from the hectic London City pace! You can grab a snack from the Food Court at Harrods and then pick a bench in the park to sit, eat, relax.

Picnic spot. If you are going in July, particularly on a sunny day ,be prepared for crowds. Take a cap ,and a water bottle. Nice park to relax,see various plants and flowers and birds and fowls. Very good place particularly for young children. This park is close by to a number of London attractions which is very convenient.Take sandwiches and eatables and enjoy eating in the park benches. After seeing change o f guards, walk through the park and you can then go to Trafalgar Square by passing through a number of tourist attractions in London.

Beautiful, more fun to look at the Buckingham Palace.. We were there just as England was ramping up for Jubilee to celebrate the Queen's big Birthday. the palace and Parliament were not open, but the park was. It is beautiful and central to other attractions.

I absolutely LOVE this park. I could go on and on about it. In my opinion one of the best urban parks on the planet. If you are staying at the nearby St Ermin's hotel as I do, it's a short walk, but you need to cut by the St James Park tube station and go straight down and through a walk gate. There is a nice crossing right there.You must go here folks! Absolutely top notch!

Nice:). Nice place to relax with family or friends:)There is a pond and it's quite central.The positive side is that you can walk through it and it's adjusent to the Green Park , which leads further to the Hyde Park.
Beautiful location. One of the larger parks with beautiful flowers and a central London location. Kiosks for cool drinks are around as it was quite warm when we were there.
Nice relaxing place. Nice park, not so crowded, birds are used for feeding from people walking through the park. Nice place to sit as well.

Nice place to relax. It's a nice park for so many reasons. One of them is: it's close to many tourist attractions like Buckingham Palace, Churchill war room, 10 Downing Street, Trafalgar square etc. if you had enough of the city and want to sit under a tree and breathe it's the place to be.It's a great place to meet friends and have a picnic. I like to go there solo and read a book on one of the deck chairs. You have to pay for them unfortunately, but nothing's free these days anyway. I find it to have the perfect size in comparison with bigger parks in London that can take you ages to walk through. It's really worth a visit as a tourist or as a local.
One of busier parks. We went there for a stroll looking for Pelicans and we saw them from afar. We also saw hundreds of people enjoying the afternoon sun and squirrels and various birds.

Good place to relax near the hub. clean well presented green area just beside the hustle bussle of the Mall. plenty of room to find a spot to unwind to rest on your sigth seeing tour of the mall . Refreshments available and deck chairs at a charge available .In walking distance of many of the landmarks.If you visit use the bins.

Fantastic relaxing place. I found this park purely by accident and I have to say I love it ! For a summers day meet with friends this is perfect ! There are deck chairs and bean bags dotted around which makes it perfect to meet, grab a beer and chill in lovely surroundings :)
Parks at London. St. James is linked to Green park Tube station. You can walk down from the park to Buckingham palace grounds & have sun out there for long hours or jog around. No entry fee.
loved the park. Walked through the park while in town on business. Great location and wonderful place to take a "time out" from work.

Pelicans. This is my favourite London park, because of the amazing pelicans. Mostly they stay on the island, but once in a while you are lucky enough to see on close up. They are surprisingly massive close up. The squirrels are a joy to watch, and the foreign tourists delight at seeing them so close up is almost as much fun to watch.

Do go there. This is always a nice attraction, with its friendly squirrels, lots of birds (including pelicans), lots of green spaces, seats, and it is handy for lots of London sights. The food booths here are way too expensive. But at this time of year the excellent gardens are at their best.

Take this walk after seeing the Changing of the Guard. We took this nice walk down Birdcage Walk after watching the Changing of the Guard. There are little snack stands at the park, and we got a cup of tea and a little granola-type bar called a "flapjack" for a few pounds. It was delicious! Now, if you know your flowers, and you want a challenge, try to name the various species you see in the beds. They are all different; it's a botanist's dream!
Relaxing. Lovely to stroll through. Great views of Buckingham Palace. If you have time, take a picnic there. We saw lots of people laying on the grass and soaking up the sun.
Back to nature. To find places like this in the middle of London is fantastic, plenty of wildlife & room to do run around with the whole family

Lovely public park. We stayed close to St James Park, in Northumberland Avenue, and walked through this park on most days of our weekly stay in London. It is a beautiful clean park, obviously loved by families as you could often see children running and playing there. If you look through the park from Buckingham Palace side, it is an absolutely stunning view.

Excellent place for a walk. Like many others parks in london, this park is a big ( not so big like others I think ) where to take a walk and relax is a pleasure.If you like gardens like me, sincerelly I recommend it

Springtime in London. What a great little park. We walked thru a couple times to get to Buckingham Palace. Laid out very well, with tulips, water features and well landscaped. Made you want to kick your shoes off and have a picnic there.

A perfect way to relax. If you're looking for a place to relax, this is the right place. It's very quiet, but also very cosy. There are a lot of animals such as birds and squirrels around, and you might want to play a bit with them if they're in the mood. There are wonderful places where you can rest a bit or have a picnic and there are also some pathways so you can have a nice walk along the lakes.
great day out. Great day out with family . Kids enjoy walk and activities . Highly recommend it anyone travelling to London

Lovely small park in the middle of the Royals. As English as it can get: St. James is my favourite park in London (an I am a visitor to London and have been quite a number of times there): The castes, Westminster, everything is around the corner. In St. James I feel part of the bigger family of people who adhere the "old world" of kings and queens of England and all the tradition like the Horse Guards that are close. Escape the hectic London for a moment and relax in the green setting of the St. James Park.
The best park in Central London. With such a friendly squirrels in the park you have to walk it through! They like only nuts! Be aware! :)

Lovely park, full of tourists. Lovely park in the heart of London. Great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of some of the busier roads - though still full of tourists. Pop in for a walk if you're passing.

Leisurely summer's walk. If I visit in summer I always make time to take a leisurely stroll through St Jame's Park. You observe an excellent blend of English culture with thousands of tourists.
Highly recommended if you want to enjoy the park, and to be away from the city centre

St. James Pleasant for strolling. It was a nice stroll through St. James Park. Weather during April was quite chilly, but the park was quite well tended. Not too full, but pleasant. The Pelicans were interesting to observe, some going near people. There also saw a round marker/plaque on the walk dedicated to Princess Diana.
Beautiful. Very nice park to walk around, or sit and rest your aching feet ;) We just walked through on our way, didn't spend much time here, but enjoyed the walk

Peace in the city. Been going here since I'm a child,has Pelicans on the lake
Very beautiful park in the middle of london

TIME OUT!. We used to live in London. When our children were small, we would come here after watching the Changing of the Guard @ Buckingham Palace. They are all in high school now......and we still come here. Fabulous memories of them as little ones chasing the pigeons!

Beautiful Park - Very Peaceful Walk. Bird Keepers Cottage is like a flash from the past with gorgeous flower gardens. Watch out for the squirrels, a little too friendly. Pelican's are predators. They like to eat the pigeons, see youtube video...gross
King's Park. We walked all through this park. The vast grounds are colourful with flowers and lovely trees and shrubs. The swans were out and about. Beautiful creatures.

Beautiful!!. Go to this park! It's full of neat birds and beautiful flowers. There's a decent restaurant right in the middle if you need a break! Highlights were the old grounds keepers cabin and garden and the pond!
Wander through the gardens on a sunny day. Busy in places but plenty of gardens to pass the time in & shady areas to sit and have a relaxing picnic

Beautiful Park in the centre of the London. Went to St Jame's Park on the sunny day in June. The Park is just 10 minutes by walk from the Charing Cross Station and is a good place for picnic in the centre of London. It is another 10 minutes by walk to the Buckingham Palace. Recommend to have a leisure walk in the Park in the morning before proceeding to see the Changing of the Guard just outside the Buckingham Palace.
Amazing visit!. I love this park and everyone should visit it while being in London. At the end next is Buckingham Palace and views are amazing!!!

Lovely, small park. I have visited this park many times. It is one of the smaller of the major parks in central London however it is probably the prettiest. A lovely way to spend an afternoon with the family and the view from the bridge is superb.

My daily commute for 6 months.. Walking from Mayfair Holiday inn into St James park Tube. This is a lovely park well kept and not a busy as the other more tourist parks, the ponds and wildlife are great to experience. Nice to sit and have a sandwich at lunchtime and let the world go by. Worth a visit for a stroll, picnic or divert your normal route to take in a splendid place in the centre of grey buildings...

surprise in central London. Love spending time wandering round this park, plenty to see with all the birds, ducks and squirrels. There's a play park for the wee ones to play in or plenty open space to run or sit and eat a picnic and completely dog poo free.

Nicest park in London. St James's park is splendid!......it is right near the Mall and Buckingham Palace, and a short walk from Trafalgar Square, yet it is green and calm. You can relax after a long day as a tourist or have a short 'green' break while going from one tourist sight to another.

For a lovely summertime walk. This is the place if you are, like me, tired of shopping and looking at art galleries. St James Park is the perfect place to have a break and enjoy the sunshine in summer time.
Nice. A nice place to take a break from shopping, museums, etc. It's nice that there are so many parks to enjoy in London.

An Oasis in the City. I was amazed that once you were in the Park it was very easy to forget that you were in the centre of a major City. There were Deck Chairs to sit in and a lovely lake to walk around. Plenty of birdlife to watch and a generally very relaxing spot very close to Buckingham Palace.
Great people watching. I civets in summer and everyone was out walking around, kids playing, etc. The little restaurant is great for lunch, you can sit outside and people watch.

Yet another oasis in London.. Together with Kensington Gardens this park rates a close second... It is large with wonderful walks, woodlands, birdlife plenty of squirrels, shaded areas, grass for picnicking, a massive and pretty lake ,water features,boating area,tea rooms,it has everything you may wish for a most Pleasant relaxing afternoon. Never tire of I.
Our favourite Park in London. Easily accessible, better bird viewing than in some major zoos. Makes for an excellent visit on the way from Trafalgar square to Buckingham Palace
so nice!. With all the crowds around Big Ben & the bridge, a walk of a few blocks will get you into this lovely treed oasis. Not enough benches, but folks seem to settle down on the grass. Loved it.

Better than Hyde Park!. This is my favorite park in central London! The small pond and animals, the many squirrels, and the close proximity to Buckingham Palace. I like it more than Hyde Park as the smaller size makes it cozier.

Strolling through green London. This park is delightful. On a sunny afternoon it makes for a very pleasant stroll through the Capital with iconic buildings popping through the trees. This was not my first stroll through the park and certainly won't be my last!
Squirrels in Central London. A lovely place to catch up with nature. We found squirrels, which gave an Australian great pleasure to see.
Lots of shade. It was very hot when we were here and the shade trees saved us. A little litter but other than that, the gardens are lovely for a stroll

Lovely walk in the park. The park is green and lovely at the end of Spring and moving into early summer. Lots of park goers enjoying their afternoon at the park. Do spend some time at the park, to relax and enjoy the sun.

Beautiful Walk!. Beautiful park, great to wander through with lots of interesting locals to observe. Well maintained, plenty of shade and places to sit. Bring water because I couldn't find a drinking fountain anywhere.
Peaceful park. Relaxing, peaceful and clean park to walk on the way to Buckingham Palace. Good location. Many tourists and locals enjoying the warm weather.

Beautifully maintained park. The St. James's Park is located close to the Buckhingam Palace and is famous for its beautiful lake and the floral decorations. It's a very nice place to relax and to try to play with the many squirrels and birds.
There are a few refreshments points, but the prices are exagerrated.
Pretty as parks go. Very pretty park. Nice lake and area for families to go. What can I say, it's a park with nice scenery.
Lovely. My favourite place in London. Beautiful park, lovely lake, bridge. Go there every time I go up to London. Lovely in the summer but can get crowded.

Huge and one of the best parks. Huge beautiful park located at the very central place in London. One can spend entire day with family and friends here. Good place to get involved in photography.
Highly recommended!!!

Fancy Park for picnic. Fancy Park. This place, as well as other parks in London are perfect places for enjoy the afternoon with family or friends, doing a picnic. Also very suitable for running and biking lovers.

Beautiful grounds. All on the flat, easy to get to from the underground. The weather was lovely and plenty of places to sit and picnic. Well worth a visit on a nice day, a really special place to visit. It is always busy at St James's park.
Amazing park. A cozy break from the busy streets of London can be found in St. James' Park. The park is inhabited of lots of squirrels, and ducks which makes a stay in the park even more enjoyable.

Gorgeous place to take a break. St.Jame's Park is a lovely place to take a break and relax near Buckingham Palace and Westminster. We grabbed a drink and a snack at one of the little cafes in the park and spent some time recharging while people watching and seeing the swans. Definitely worth checking out while taking in the sights in the area.
Lovely Park. this is a Lovely park to walk through. - very green . It Always appears very crowded though so be alert in the crowds.
nice for an afternoon picnic. Located, just off of the hustle and bustle going on around it. A brief secluded place in central London.

Relaxing Park. St James's Park is a great place to get away from the crowds and just take a leisurely stroll or take a seat on the grassy hill and admire the many birds that call the park home. Enjoy the ponds and foliage and look out and you may spot a squirrel.
Beautiful place to relax. Nice little restaurant built into the side of the hill, but overall park was gorgeous, well maintained, and relaxing.

Cafe in the Park. St. James' Park is across the street from Buckingham Palace, and many people walk through it on their way to see the changing of the guard. It is a lovely park, where you can rent sling-like (beach) chairs for sitting in the sun. My family had lunch at a cafe in the corner of the park and pronounced it surprisingly good - one of their best meals on the trip. Enjoy!

Go see the Swans. Such a pretty park, and so close to Westminster and Buckingham Palace, it's a good place to escape the crowds.Having said that some paths are the main pedestrian thoroughfares from Green Park, St James and Picadilly to Westminster, so they can get very busy.My advice is to linger near the ponds and enjoy the swans.
Its a park. I could walk around this park for hours....so relaxing. Hope to see it in the summer one day. I have only been in the winter.

Haven for Birds. We saw first the huge white birds that looked like Trumpeter Swan. They were Pelicans. This park is a haven for birds near the Buckingham Palace. The caretaker lives in a cute English cottage near the water.

Peaceful piece of nature.. This park with its serene and quiet atmosphere was the peresect place to stop and relax. We had a picnic here at the small lake, saw many birds, ducks and swans mostly. They are very much used to people so I would keep a close eye on kids here- swans bite often. I imagine that in summer months it is packed with people and would not be the same , as it is very close to the palace.

Surprised by the Foot Guard. We wandered into St James Park as we had arrived a bit too early to gain entry into the Churchill War Room Museum. As we were enjoying this green haven in the middle of London, when we saw small groups of Foot Guard marching along the pathways making their way onto Horse Guard Parade Grounds to practice for the Queen's birthday celebration (held in mid-June).
deck chairs. it is great,when there is hot sunny day to hire a deck chair and watch the world go around.good fun!
Beautiful Park. This was a beautiful park to walk through... I wish I had more time to just sit and enjoy the view. It is a must see if it is your first time to visit London!

Lush greenery and all manner of water fowl... a wonderful stroll. St. James Park is well-positioned between Buckingham Palace, Churchill War Rooms, Horse Guards Parade, Green Park and Pall Mall. It makes for a wonderful, peaceful break amid all the sightseeing. Plan for lunch or afternoon tea at Inn the Park, a lovely little restaurant on the grounds. (I believe you can make reservations on-line.) Great for nature and people-watching. The Park is home to many species of water fowl, exotic and otherwise, and lush gardens. Don't miss the gardeners' cottage structure on the end of the lake with its beautiful flower plantings. For more of a big-open-spaces, throwing- a-frisbee kind of park, head to nearby Green Park.

Great surprise. We kept walking on one side of this park on our sight seeing of London. Finally cut through and found out what we have been missing. Beautiful parK with wildlife, fountains and views. Wished we had found it sooner
Nice bit of nature in the middle of the city. Lovely plantings. Saw my first moorhen and her chick. Adjacent to Buckingham Palace, but feels like you're in a quiet, serene park. Pond is pretty.

when a man is tired of London .... Get lost for a while and have a stroll in St James park. There are a lot of Londons within London and this is one of them. step off the hustle and bustle of main roads and wander around some green peace

Wonderful. In a lot of ways I like St. James more than Hyde Park. They both have a lot of great features but St.James feels a bit less touristy even though its filled with tourists. In a busy city in London it was nice to let the kids run a bit free, feeding birds, chasing squirrels, and meeting other children form around the world. It was rather busy with tourists (inlcuding us) on our most recent visit but there was still plenty of places to lay about in the grass, we grabbed lunch from a nearby take-away and had an impromtu picnic. A great place to spend a few hours in London.
Great Green Connector. Great green space for the kids to run around. We loved the ducks and the playgrounds. Nice way to connect between landmarks.

An Afternoon Well Spent. We had an afternoon to spend in London and decided to go to St James's Park. The gardens were looking beautiful, especially around the delightful little (gamekeepers?) cottage. We were surprised to see white pelicans and an interesting array of waterfowl there too. After visiting the park we walked by Horseguards Parade and Downing St, then returned to the park for a relax on the grass. Beautiful place to be on a lovely summer's day.

A fabourite park in London. In the summer heat, pack a picnic (grab delicious sandwiches, wraps and salads from Pret a Manger) and enjoy the outdoors at St James Park. Take along something to sit or lie on, so you can relax and enjoy the London sunshine amidst the greenery. Or you can rent a deck chair of one is available. Pose on the bridge - it has been featured in many movies, and you can get a good view of Buckingham Palace from there.

Nice park just in front of Buckingham palace. We strolled thru this city park on our way to Buckingham palace. The flowers and ponds were well kept and beautiful. Not a huge place, like Hyde park, it can be easily walked at a leisurely pace.
Another beautiful London park. London has so many beautiful parks. I walked through this one after visiting Buckingham Palace. There were a lot of locals out enjoying the warm weather.

Nice park to wander away from the traffic. Nice cafe 'Inn the park',bit pricey but welcome place to sit. Had a wander up both sides of lake,tame squirrels,parakeets and pelicans just two of the species of bird life. Well kept gardens. Rude toilet attendant,who shouted toilets were closed, near play area,and hygiene standards in food kiosk next door a bit suspect.
Oasis in the urban jungle. Top notch park with a lot of good history. Visit if you love parks and want to relax in the middle of busy London

Beautiful park. I met a fried for a drink and sat over-looking the lake watching the swans and squirrels.
You don't feel like you are sitting in the middle of London!!

Scenic & relaxing. The lake is scenic & has life! Teeming with ducks, swans, etc.
Serene & yet active. Lots of others enjoying.

Wow. What a gorgeous park in the middle of the city, lovely way to relax and reenergize.
Lots of trees fro shade.

Beautiful park. On our way to Buckingham Palace, me and my wife walked thru St. James Park. The park is beautiful full of bright colorful flowers and majestic green trees. It's a very big park so it's easy to just spend hours there enjoying the beaut.
beautiful. strolled through here for my birthday weekend with my boyfriend in May, beautiful park and lots of things to look at, would recommend if nearby :)

Great place to wander and people-watch. This is a lovely spot in central London, with many of the capital's most famous buildings either adjoining of very nearby. It also offers benches to sit and picnic or just watch the world go by. Delightful place in summer or good weather.

Well maintained and a must see. If you are on your way to Buckingham Palace or Trafalgar Square, it is well worth the extra time to take a stroll through this beautiful park. It is hard to believe this is in the centre of London, as it is peaceful and quiet. One of the nicest parks I have seen in London.
Stroll throiugh the park. Beautiful park,very well maintained. Lots of wildlife, saw swans and cygnets. Lovely views up and down the river.

An oasis between the great attractions.. Joining Buckingham Palace to Westminster is this lovely park, one of the smaller parks in Central London. Dominated by the long lake, full of a large variety of friendly waterfowl. Stand on the little bridge and you get a view one way of the Victoria Monument and the Palace and the other way to Whitehall and the London Eye.Take some peanuts and you will have a squirrel up your arm in no time (sadly a grey not a red though)If you are taking the tube to Westminster get off at St James's Park instead and walk through. Check your map as the streets can be confusing but it is only 6 minutes to Buckingham Palace once you know the way.
absolutely beautiful. short walk from Buckingham Palace...what could be more perfect? it even had a duck pond and grassy area for picnics and the walks were well-planned and maintained.
Wonderful garden. This garden is a must visit on a sunny day. Beautiful flowers, birdlife, lake and restaurants. Very relaxing.
A marvelous park in London. This is a very old park. Beautiful walking trails, mostly paved, Great Lake with ducks. Lots of grass to chill out on a hot summers day.
A Walk in the Park. Always nice for a relaxing walk in the park. I love the view of the Horse Guards Parade from the bridge and the Pelican lake, it even looks pretty at night time.

a great place to hide from the heat. a great place to hide from the heat. quit, peaceful, and yet, busy and full of people. We enjoyed staring at the human paraid of tourists from all over the world that were happy to find some shade and rest during the terrible heat wave...

Cherry blossoms beautifully!. No words can explain how much I enjoyed and loved the park as cherry blossoms are just everywhere, good thing I came during the Spring time and I have seen them. Great place to just sit down and relax and spend time with loved ones.
peaceful. Hired a deck hair, sat and relaxed after a busy morning shopping.There is a lovely lake, and very near to Horseguards parade.

Take a stroll and forget the hubbub around you.. There is something to look at and appreciate everywhere. The trees I particularly like and considering it's very central one can escape from the noise and traffic with a gentle stroll or picnic.

Tranquil haven. This park is amazing. It's so peaceful despite its location. Full of nature and wildlife, squirrels that dart about randomly, swans and ducks in the lake, lots of open grass spaces to lie or sit and watch the world go by. A great spot to catch your breath as you wander near Buckingham Palace.

Break in sightseeing. A warm sunny afternoon , very relaxing to sit with your packed lunch and enjoy the surroundings, especially when you find a nice bench. Situated convenient when much walking between city sights.
Attractive gardens .
nice place to have a picnik. bring you lunch ou buy a sandwich and have your lunch. you are right in the central London, everything is close by to visit and attack your next attraction

Unexpectedly nice. They birds and the views were wonderful. We saw a swan with eigth signets in tow, lots of exotic white pelicans, koots, diving ducks with babies. Pretty gardens that lead you right up to the Buckingham Palace gardens.

The grass.... Almost every time I visit London, I can't deprive myself of a walk through St. James's Park. This time though I was a little disappointed by how badly they let grass and weed overgrow. Looked like noone is taking care of the park anymore, which in my point of view is a shame.

Great place to visit while in London. Recently walked through the park on the way to Horseguards Parade. It was a Sunday and The Mall was closed to traffic which was rather good. The park is an excellent place for visitors to London to experience.
Pretty walk. Fun cut through on the way to Piccadilly area. You can see lots of locals hanging out. Great water and flowers
A restful place for a break. A very nice park with nice walking paths and places to sit and rest. A nice place to cool off and take a break.

Lovely park to stroll thru...... This is a wonderful park to stroll through after visiting Buckingham Palace. There is a lake in the centre of it, lots of birds and very peaceful in an otherwise very busy area. You may even feel inclined to rent one the many lawn chairs available to just relax and take it all in. We packed a lunch with us and sat in the park to enjoy it.

Close up wildlife. It's nice that they've fenced of where the birds graze and they're very used to humans, you can get inches away. Some are fascinating close up, like the swamp bird with the almost comical raptor feet.
lovely park in the middle of London. Close proximity to Buckingham palace for the changing of the guard. Lots of green open spaces to relax

A beautiful park with great views. One of my favourite parks - nearest tube is green park or st james. Its a beautifully kept park with stunning views of the horse guards parade, big ben and london eye to name a few. Not quite as hectic as green park whch is near by and perfect for a pic nic if ona tourist day out wt houses of parliament etc

Very good Park to relax of you have time. This part is next to Buckingham Palace. It is a nice park with a pond in between. We strolled through the park to see Queen's birthday Parade. Not a bad idea to spend an afternoon.

Very pretty and peaceful in middle of busy city. St James' Park is a beautiful haven amongst the busy city streets. Was just gorgeous on a sunny, spring day with beautiful views of Whitehall. One of my favourite London parks.
Good Garden. Located opposite Buckingham Palace. It also has the Princess Diana memorial walk route. Its very nice and peaceful.

Lovely park. This is a lovely long park with so many friendly creatures you can see from close. It has a charm of its own, very distinct from Hyde Park. The Queen's own creatures are housed here, mostly ducks and geese. And there are plenty of squirrels scurrying around. Its a lovely walk from one end to the other.Buckingham Palace and even Victoria Station are walking distance, so also the Churchill War Museum.
Don't go out of your way.... But do stroll through if you're in the neighborhood, which you probably will be. There are some nice flower beds and good nature photo opps of ducks and geese.

My favorite park in my favorite city.. London's parks are just the best. It is really very difficult to pick a favorite, but this is mine. Exit the park one way and you see the Horse Guards Parade, another way and you see Buckingham Palace, plus you get a lovely view of the London Eye over one of the ponds. It's a beautiful place to walk or sit and read a book.

Quiet Oasis. This is a lovely park and provides a quiet oasis in the midst of busy, noisy London. It is used by locals and tourists alike, and unlike some parks it is open and free to anyone. Beautiful place to spend 30 minutes restoring your soul after the hustle and bustle of the city.

really relaxing. taking in mind were you are you forget about the busyness of Trafalgar square and big ben as soon as you start walking in here. It's great and not always busy which helps. The squirrels feed straight out of your hands and the pigeons if your down with that ....
Lovely park. Very well maintained park and lovely setting. Close to Buckingham Palace. Good place to watch the tourists :-).

Very good for lazy afternoons.. or a break from busy life anytime. A bit of calmness and quietness right in the middle of the City!! A bit of bird watching.. sitting by the lake, watching the world go by during weekday lunchtime or just select a peaceful corner and be yours!

Best day to dress up and take photos. One of the most beautiful parks in the world. Dress up and and take some photos or dress down and play. The swans are beautiful. There are snacks available at a clean and friendly awning fronted shop inside the park. Bring the children and give them some time to run around and play. Use the park to cut through and give yourself some shade on a hot day. (I have never been in the park at night so I can not speak for night time safety)
Great stroll through park!. Loved this park. Get away from the hustle and bustle. Beautiful park and lots of wildlife. Delightful!
Very pretty.. Well kept, very pretty and absolutely mobbed by tourists, most of them school groups.Probably better to see when the touristscare less evident.

Great place for a stroll. After the changing of the guard and that mayhem, this was a lovely park to walk through. Such serenity and loveliness in the middle of London. We walked through the park and ended at Trafalgar Square which was a pleasant surprise. There are a lot of swans and other water fowl, and what appeared to be locals hanging out and relaxing. It would be an awesome place for a picnic, or just taking a break from the business of London. And it doesn't cost a single GBP.
Beautiful and Scenic. Lovely walk through St James Park - great place for a stroll, an ice cream (several stands throughout the park) or a picnic! Great picture taking spot!

Historic London Park.. Probably my favourite London Park, partly because. I have fond childhood memories of the old cafe with the tables swarming with sparrows. New cafe now & no sparrows but many of the old attractions remain the pelicans who are usually to be found near the picturesque old cottage that sits by the lake up at the Horse guards Parade end of the Park, also the excellent flower displays, shrub beds & the stunning mass of daffodils that flower under the trees alongside The Mall in Springtime. Of course, the whole Park is surrounded by Historic buildings & tourists abound, which is the only minus point as on occasions the Park is crammed. Fabulous views along the lake, many waterbirds to admire & feed, nice little mini cafe by Buckingham palace end, plenty of bold squirrels & pigeons to feed by hand. Not many cities where you can walk across 3 different Parks in a row as I do whenever I get the chance. Start in Hyde Park then into Green Park & finally into St. Name's Park. All the way from Bays water Rd to nearly the Houses Of Parliament!

Beautiful. Plenty of green, clean pathways, a calm and clean lake, ducks and gulls, quiet surroundings and only a few people when we went. Very centrally located (opposite Buckingham palace). I was there for less than an hour. I would have loved to spend the whole day there with my little ones if I could. As with all parks, not a "must do". But it's certainly a wonderful place for a little quiet time.
a pleasant walk. we sat for a while and walked. A lot of tourists. Squirrels very tame and eating out of peoples hands.
Lovely Walk. Suggest walking to Buckingham Palace through the park and then walking back to Trafalgar Square along the Mall.
Squirrels! And Birds!. Such a lovely strip of pure nature in the middle of a metropolitan. It's just one of many but the location is very central so access wise is the easiest.

Very nice park!. I visited this park in my way from big ben to Buckingham palace. I had my lunch there and it was so quiet and relaxing after a busy time at wesminster bridge taking pictures of big ben, the thames river and the London eye.
Peaceful. Lovely park, where many London folks relax on sunny afternoons. Walkway to the palace makes it a great place to take a break during your visit to London.
beautiful. well maintained and beautiful, nice place to chill and catch some sun. Nice place for picnic and for kids to run around

Great wee park for a walk and often an attraction maybe going on.. Great wee park for a walk and often an attraction maybe going on. Nice surroundings and never felt unsafe. Often there will be something on during the weekend or special events.

Wonderful visit passing through. Our daughters loved the ducks, pigeons, pelicans and even squirrels. We loved the gardens, trees, and open space. Granted we visited in beautiful weather but also the park is ideally located amongst other great places to visit so a welcome nature break. (Churchill war rooms, Guards museum, Cavalry house, Buckingham palace.)

Most beautiful park in London. I think this is the loveliest park in London. I love the huge lake, the views, and all the different birds. Nice place to just sit out for awhile and perhaps eat a picnic lunch.

Beautiful park. Such a lovely park to walk through, really really clean and just beautif. Even the animals are friendly and just come up to you.
Great to sit down under a tree with a picnic and watch the world go buy, theres even a little play park for the kids

Beautiful Park!. Lovely, beautifully maintained park and grounds, with views of Buckingham Palace and St James' Palace. The birds will eat right out of your hand! Lovely place for a leisurely stroll. Look for a tribute marker to Princess Diana on the bridge.

lovely piecefull park. This park is so lovely, theres an old english cottage, which is so adorable! too bad no one lives in it anymore. the park is piecefull, full off birds and squirrels. Its so cool, cause the squirrels are eating nuts out of your hands. for me this was a amazing experience, i love animals. I do hope that nobody hurts them and abuse the fact that they seem to trust people.It is a beautiful park to walk around and get away from the crowded shopping centers.
Sun Shine and Green In London. This park is a very good spot for picnic in the summer! Just sit down on the green grass, enjoy the sun shine and the fantastic view.

One of my favorite places in london.. Ah to be in the middle of a bustling city and then having a picnic surrounded by nature and little squirrels and swans and ducks etc. I like this park because it is smaller than hyde park. sitting by the lake even when it gets crowded in the summer is worth it. Just a Must See when visiting london.

Beautiful Park to Take a Stroll. St. James Park is located just south of Buckingham Palace. It is lush and green. The ponds are full of birds such as pelicans and cranes. Many of the locals were soaking up the rays on the green grass. I have decided that when I die and am reincarnated, I want to live in St. James Park as a bird.
Lovely Park. It's an amazing Park, I liked it a lot. Although there was a lot a tourists the place is peaceful and friendly.

Escape from the noise..... This is a lovely park in London with lots of places to sit and relax, walk around and enjoy the nature, lounge on the grass or just to go for some peace and quiet. The squirrels are entertaining and very tame. The lake has lots of colourful ducks and birds and if you are lucky you may see the pelicans which are great fun so see just wandering about! It does not feel like it is in the centre of such a major city; it is so quiet! Buckingham Palace is at one end and from there you get a great view of the London Eye in the distance.

THE MOST NICE PARK IN LONDON. It is very beautifull and there are many flowers and nice plants.It near bucknigham palace and in the park you can enjoy a pic nic under the trees.If you visit the park you should walk at the south part of it.Probably it is one of the most beautifull park in london.

So much to do in and around. This is such a lovely oasis in the heart of London, and from it you can take in the Mall Gallery, Churchill's War Office, Buckingham Palace and the changing of the guard, Horse Guards Parade and the cavalry museum, Whitehall, Westminster... it's all around you, as well as the trees, lawns and ducks.
Nice to walk around. No special or spectacular sites but worth a stroll to look around and people watch. If you have time, go.

A walk in the park! Where Royalty walked with me.??. I loved it. We walked and walked. We collected stones and leaves for our memories. We imagined ourselves setting up tea picnics and wearing lacy dresses with parasols. A must see!

Beautiful park full of birds and squirrels. It's an amazing park full of little animals. The squirrels are friendly and if you give them peanuts they're not afraid of you.Es un parque maravilloso lleno de animalitos! Las ardillas son super graciosas, si les das cacahuetes se acercan y hasta se te suben.
Greeeeen and clean.. Visited St James Park in may 2015. Its next to Buckingham Palace. Very clean and green. A great walk in the park. must visit.

beautiful & serene. we visited this park twice during our stay & every time found it very relaxing. Apart from well maintained, it's the beauty around which makes you visit it again & again. From the middle of the bridge, you can see the palace & london eye. Would surely like to visit it again.

Birds and Beauty. This is a wonderful park. Take a stroll and enjoy the day! There is a large bird population which includes Ducks, Geese, Heron, pidgeons, an escapted parakeet, and a contingent of baby swans! This was a wonderful respite.

Peace In The City. St. James Park is an excellent place to go for a walk right in downtown London. There are a number of beautiful water features, animals, waterfowl combined with beautiful landscapes and stately old trees. At each edge of the park you run straight into history...Buckingham Palace, St. James Palace and Churchill's War Rooms line the park.
Wow wow wow!. Stroll through this fabulous fabulous park....be prepared to see footmen exercising the queen's horses....her swans....beautiful and stunning gardens....Icannotstress more....Go Go Go!
Nice. Nice bit of greenery and peace in a busy area sadly a fair amount of litter but still nice to have a bit of a relax

Beautiful with awesome birds. We had a very brief time in London and the Parks were our only opportunities to birdwatch. St. James's was the best of the three we visited and I would have loved more time there. The plantings and ponds were lovely and it was fun to see black mute swans as well as many other species new to us.
London weekend vist. Lovely park to walk through lots of places to sit and enjoy the flowers and lakes would recommend people to go there if on a london vist

The standard for urban parks. St Jame's, in typical British fashion, sets the standard for how an urban park should be. The grounds are kept beautifully, There is abundant birdlife to provide entertainment, and people from all walks are enjoying themselves.

A charming and thoroughly British oasis.. Beautiful on a sunny day with great views of Buck Palace yet close to The Thames, Whitehall, etc. probably better in the winter when there are less tourists about.
Beautiful. Lovely park with lots of benches to sit and enjoy the birds and other wildlife. Lots of Flowers as well.

Beautiful park to watch the world go by. As with all the royal parks, this is beautifully kept, with flowers and lawns, perfect for passing the time. There are benches dotted around, as well as a couple of places to get food and drinks. Just perfect on a summers day.

Excellent Park. Lovely park with ducks and swans around.
Super to visit if you have the time and away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Pelicans are fun to see close up!. Very elegant park with the lake and gardens and of course the pelicans. Nice to walk round on a sunny day

Nice place to relax. Especially before or after you have high tea at the Ritz.
Lots of shade and people taking it easy. It is a huge park so remember to take some drinks and things if you just want to roam around for a couple of hours.

Saint James Park- Great place!. One of my favorite parks in London.
If you want to see Squirrels, take the lower path. There are plenty of them…
Our grandkid enjoyed it very much.
You can combine the visit at the park with the Buckingham Palace; Churchill cabinet rooms
(Do not miss it!) and the Horse Guards, Whitehall.
Beautiful park... We stumbled upon this walking around near Picadilly. I love all the flags leading into this wonderful green sanctuary.
Nice park for an afternoon walk. Enjoyed walking through this park over a long weekend in London. Great walk to get to many sites and you can grab a snack or an ice cream while enjoying the area.

Beautiful, peaceful and great views!. Definitely worth walking through St James's Park to get out of the London rat race and enjoy a little nature. Don't miss the great views from the bridge crossing the lake.

Beautiful Gardens. A place of peace and tranquilty in the heart of London. New to London or not this park is worth a wander round. The planting is just exquisite, and makes you proud to be a Londoner.

Close to nature in the heart of London. It was my favourite place in all of London. There were squirrels scampering around and locals feeding them with almonds and there were a whole array of different species of birds. The place was calm and serene. A real gem in central London.

A place to relax and be close to nature!. A favourite of mine Park situated in a strategic place.A stroll here is a nice way to appreciate nature in all its glory. If you are a nature lover like myself, I am sure you will love it.Sometimes though it gets very noisy due to school groups, but there are terrific walking paths where you can have a stroll in the gardens, see several birds, the swans in the pond and forget the hectic city life.

Green cover. That was beautiful place to walk around. In june there was rush of tourist groups. you can enjoy the green cover of London here. The eateries in the park are bit overpriced. However the one near Restroom area Exit is well priced.

Post Trooping the Colour. An outrageously expensive treat for a friend and his two children. The service was friendly and helpful, but unfortunately it got muddled so that our starters came with our main course? I have to say the waiter and the manager apologised immediately and corrected it. However one of the children's two fish & chip meals was cold. They again quickly corrected this, but it didn't exactly impress us. The manager gave us a dessert each at no charge, but even so the bill still came to £137.00. Granted we did pick the most expensive items on the menu - but the children only had kids portions of fish & chips so if we had paid for the desserts the bill for the adults would have been nearer £150. That is approaching Ritz Hotel prices and you get a better seat there!

Great Park in Spring - but. We walked through St James Park - enjoying the trees as they flowered. It was a great walk until the wind picked up. We quickly had to retreat, as the wind carried wind borne pollen around, and we all suffered rhinitis. A majestic park, but during Spring check pollen counts if you suffer from pollen allergies.

Lovely Park. Beautiful grounds near Buckingham. So pretty to walk through. I would recommend going here after you seeing the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace. It's also a good get away from the crazy crowds at the palace.

Great view, big park. From the bridges you can see London Eye and it offers a great view on other historical buildings. It huge, ofcourse, full of people, ofcourse, great spot for picnic. ;) They have a sand space for kids where they can play-pretty interesting.

Beautiful Park!. St. James's Park is beautiful! We entered the park at Buckingham Palace and walked from one end to the other. Lovely lakes and beautiful swans. You actually forget that you are in the middle of Central London. We walked, but many others rode bikes.

My favourite park. I have been to St. James park all my life - first being pushed in the pram by my brother. The bird life especially the pelicans & swans are so lovely & it is a pleasant stroll up to Buckingham Palace.

gret views and fantastic for photos.. very central so convenient for a quick picnic.loads of eateries around the station. great ice cream in the park. walk through and land straight in front of the palace.
Remembrance Day. Walked through the park from Buckingham Palace to Horse Guards parade - great park, well kept, lots of birds, squirrels etc

Lovely to stroll. Nice connection from Queen's palace to Churchill's war room and Westminster, lovely garden with squirrels that would approach and take food from your hand (try giving them peanuts in shell). Beautiful part with a lot of colorful tulips - if its their season!
Lovely Park. It is situated next to Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards on Mall .It has a lot of wildlife there including pelicans . Well worth a visit .

Walk to Buckingham Palace. This is a lovely park adjacent to the Palace. It's an easy walk to the Palace from say Waterloo sq via this park. Lovely setting to just sit and relax and observe the birds and squirrels. Toilets and kiosks are available.

A very beautiful park. A very beautiful park to spend time at with your kids, your camera or your bicycle. It's very spacious, and you can find a lot trees, flower and it has some wonderful birds like swans, pelicans and others.

Fab park in London. This is park i can relax and sit there for hours just reading my book or eating ice- cream and listening birds singing. This place is so green and nice seating areas and this little lake where swains ponds around and there is little squirrel running around. Every time i travel to London i visit my fav places and James Park one of them!
Lovely for a walk. Well Laid out.I went for a walk here early morning so it was really quiet and peaceful.Gardens are fairly well maintained

Nice tranquil area after Big Bend-Westminister.. We loved the geese and baby ducks. Surprisingly, also a group of pelicans. Peaceful break. Good view back towards central London from the bridge in the center of the park.

Take a turn around the garden. We took a turn around the garden, crossed the pond and saw that on either side there was a glorious view of either Buckingham palace or The bird keepers house.
