Two very different views, yet so lovely. Very nice to sit, relax with friends or get a picture of a funny squirrel.

Favorite Park in London. This Park is smaller in size and you don't feel you are lost. Nice peaceful park for sitting on a bench and having a cup of coffee. The flowers are beautiful and it is next to Buckingham Palace.
beautiful place. Reminded me of Central park. What a beautiful setting to go for a run or just stroll through. Picturesque lake in the middle with a view of the London Eye.
Very nice park with a lake. A beautiful green space to enjoy with family or disconnected if you go alone.A very nice lake where I love to go back there when I can
Beautiful. A beautiful park! We have really enjoyed walking and seeing the people of London. It is nice to see so many parks in central London for everyone to enjoy.

Early Summer. It was wonderful to stroll along the park. Lots of ducks, birds and squirrels to look at. The atmosphere was relaxing. At the park nearest to the underground station(i think Green Park), deck chairs were placed around the park for people to relax and enjoy the summer.
tea on the grass.. very pleasant sitting in the grass in this vast expanse of green in the middle of a bustling city. wildlife galore. nice to see people having picnics and playing games in the sun.

Great park. Great park with a lake and benches.
You can sit or go for a walk by the lake. The location of the park is not very far from Westminiter its like 10 mins walk. I went there with my friends for walk and it was a great experiemce.
Would love to go there again
Beautiful green space. A beautiful green space with historic background to escape busy London in its midst. You can enjoy as is or use it as a relaxing conduit to the next site in your visit.
St James Park. If in London with Children this is a wonderful walk away from the traffic and feels royal! Why not take a picnic!
Nice place to see. Interesting to know quarter philosophy and houses and the most Victorian part. You can walk around and experiment London live and people activities

London's beautiful place. I have adored this park in central London since i can remember. It has everything from peace and quiet to the noise of geese and the screech of happy excited children. To have such peace and beauty in a city is precious.

A great green space for everyone. This park is beautiful with workers walking through it on their way to work, people walking their dogs and on weekends a lot of people using the park. It is also a great connector between Big Ben and Buckingham Palace. They also have dedicated areas for water fowl. Loved seeing spring trees and flowers and ducks nesting.

St James Park is at the heart of London. London has hundreds of parks but this is probably the best. It attracts city workers, tourists and those who just love to wander. It is at it's best in Spring and the Summer where you can just lazily sit around and watch the world go by. Equally in the winter the contrasts of the plants and the shimmering water add something special to a brisk walk through the park. My favourite

Lovely oasis. I always look for a bit of nature wherever I go. St James has lovely gardens, ponds and birds. It is a good place to take a break from the city buses and cars. We ate at a delightful restaurant called Inn The Park.
Some calm in London. It's really good to stroll around this park. You can see the ducks, the burds and have some calm in the busy London.

A lovely park near the tourist attractions. A beautiful, well-maintained park! I was very impressed and pleasantly surprised. London certainly knows how to create and maintain gorgeous parks. It is a little touristy because it is near all the tourist attractions, which is both a good and bad thing. My boyfriend and I spent a number of hours here walking around and enjoying the peace and quiet, as a break from the bustling city! Recommend a visit especially because it is so close to everything!
Peaceful. Brilliant walks through this park. Plenty of wildlife and interesting little features. Go on a sunny day during the week and avoid the crowds

Beautiful Park. A green scene in the middle of the city. Surrounded by history, benches (free) or deck chairs (fee payable) for you to watch the world go by. Public toilets available, but again there is a charge. Lovely to walk through, rather than on the main road/pavement.
very pleasant walks. A lovely park with plenty of birds and squirrels, a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Best London stroll. This is the perfect park, the perfect size, the perfect number and variety of birds, and the location is exquisite while the flora are unfussy and pleasant. When I am in London, I find myself making up reasons why I have to "cut through the park" because the people-watching is also fairly good. If you are in the Buckingham Palace area or over by the Horse Guards (careful, the horses bite), find a reason to stroll into the heart of the park. Nothing glamorous, just a lovely, accessible park with great birds.

Rainy & cold, yet still lovely. Just a lovely park overall. We simply walked and wandered throughout. It is nice to walk up to Buckingham Palace out of the park and then retreat back into it away from the crowds.

Lovely Day. We were very lucky with a glorious weekend (weather wise)
Had a really nice day looking round enjoying all the scenery
St James Park with beautiful walks. It was a joy to find this beautiful, quiet and relaxing green area of space so close to the centre of London.

Perfect City Park. A park that suits many needs from the couple out for a stroll, to the families feeding the birds and the joggers escaping the crowded pavements. A pleasant café that does a nice hot chocolate that hits the spot in the colder months.Worth a detour to see another side of the city and step away from the hustle and bustle.
Beauty. This is an interesting, scenic park with multiple ponds, which are filled with wild life. The views beyond the lake of surrounding landmarks are striking.

Not Sure What the Fuss is?. Yes this is a Central London park but it isn't anything exceptional. Kensington gardens are nicer in my opinion but it can be a nice break to walk through after seeing Buckingham Palace if the tourists prove too much to bear. Since we are used to parks like Stanley Park in Vancouver we are spoilt and no city park can compare. It is nice in this park that there are benches to sit on since when walking around everywhere there are not many places to sit.
Tulips magnificent. Walked from the Eye to Buckingham palace through here in the rain- some shelter from the large trees. Truly beautiful flower borders and amazingly quiet in the center of London.
Love this park!. I love to walk through St. James across the bridge on to the Palace. What a beautiful and peaceful place. The flowers and the wildlife are wonderful.
Oasis in the city!. St. James's Park is very lovely and quite popular. Quite an accomplishment in the middle of today's fast-paced London scene. Worth a visit.
sunny days. it was a lovely sunny day and so nice to spend some time in a lovely green and pleasant and quiet land in the centre of the metropolis.

My preferred way to walk to Buckingham Palace. Whenever you approach Buckingham Palace, you know you will be surrounded by crowds. By walking to the Palace via this park, you have a bit more manoeuvring room and can have the wonderful experience of seeing this beautiful park.A marvellously evocative place to relax and reflect on the historic buildings and streets which surround the park.
Great Park. London has many parks and if the weather is right (and you have the time) it's always a great place to relax.

Lovely park. I always love this park. The cafeteria is not very organised. It is ak
Los very expensive hut loved the park

Walk in the Park. Children loved the ducks and other wild birds. Lovely to stroll through.
Disliked the rip off ice lolly prices, £2.00 for a very ordinary lolly that normally costs around 80p

One of our favorite places in London. My husband and I loved this park. It has a very peaceful ambiance and there are loads of friendly (and well-fed) birds to view and photograph. There are also some amenities in the park, including food and toilets. One of my favorite features was a charming little house that had originally been built for the groundskeeper. I kept calling it the "Hobbit house" because, although it was not built into the hillside, it just had that sort of quaint feeling about it. Just to say it again, we really enjoyed this park and made a point to stop by a couple of times during our week-long stay in London.

Such a lovely park. No visit to the Buckingham Palace grounds is complete without visiting this wonderful park. From its vast animal wildlife to its beautiful trees and lake this visit will really help you get rid of any stress you might have.Highly recommended!
A Place to relax and enjoy. Great park in central London, with chairs to relax while you watch the hundreds of birds, ducks, swans and many other species. The trees are beautiful as the flowers.

Quiet and Peaceful Spot amid the Bustle. We crossed through the park on the way to Churchill's Bunker. It was a very pleasant walk. The little lake is pretty and view across it to the other building was too.
Squirrel feeding at the park. Love this park lazy picnic days with my family and friends cute little island . Children loved feeding the squirrels monkey nuts and its not far from Buckingham palace

Gorgeous. This park, along with all the parks in London, is a beautiful place to spend time. It amazed me how the sounds of traffic fade away when you're just a few steps into one. A great place to slow down a bit and regenerate!
Peaceful place to spend a walk. Small but beautiful park, nice lakes, swangs, flowers... Very relaxing. You can see london eye from a little bridge! Very nice :)

How can a park be a tourist attraction of a city like London?. Yes, its a great park. Good for jogging and strolling around.
But for a person who is a tourist in London - is St. James Park really a place one would want to VISIT?
Don't think so. If you cross it on the way somewhere, good, enjoy it but don't list it as a tourist attraction please !
Little slice of heaven. Love this park, truly leisurely and relaxing right in the midst of all the hustle and bustle. London has the best parks in the world.

Beautiful. Although one of the smallest Royal Parks it is undoubtedly the most beautiful. One of the reasons being you can walk around the whole of it in under 2 hours, it is also very close to other major attractions such as Buckingham Palace. Admire the view both way from the footbridge, visit the wild birds around the lake, take lunch in the excellent restaurant.

Absolutely Superb . This is one of my favourite parks in London situated in a strategic place where one can walk,sit,relax,read or just wander around appreciating nature in all its glory...watching the ponds and the swans majestically gliding...a real refreshing experience for all those nature lovers like me.Dr.Javed Rasheed

Take a Stroll in the Park. We have visited several times, and all the London parks are delightful in the springtime. It is an interesting place to see people, plants, trees, ducks, etc. The London parks are a pleasant break from the bustling city, traffic, and sidewalks.

Urban retreat from hussle and bustle. Great park to escape traffic. Lots of birdlife and love the squirrels playing around in the grounds. We cut through on our way to watch the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace.Deck chairs in grassed area are pay if you use. All in all a pleasant spot and worth a stroll even if you are just getting to another site

Great children's playground and kids only bathrooms. Great park to take a break from sightseeing. Lots of snack carts offering hotdogs and ice cream. The children's playground is wonderful and had children only bathrooms. Very clean too!

Sunny Day. We walked and sat in the park this weekend just gone. It was reasonably busy due to the good weather but not overly crowded. The park is a nice break the busy streets of London and you almost don't feel that your in the centre of the city.Lots of animals and trees and everything seemed well maintained.With Buckingham Palace at one end and Horse Guards Parade at the other it joins the two perfectly. We will be back for sure.

Pelicans!. I really love this park, It's most possibly my favourite place in London, Squirrels and swans and geese and ducks AND the Queens Pelicans, what more could you ask for. The grass is lovely to sit on and there's benches as well, I spend ages feeding the geese and ducks, and watching all the water fowl, It really is a lovely park to walk in!

Worthwhile Walk. This is a beautiful park that is quiet and serene. There is a pond to walk around, swans to watch and beautiful flowers. In a huge city, this was a terrific place to find some peace and quiet for a few moments.
Busy busy busy. Wonderful little park, to be avoided on the weekend as it gets absolutely mobbed. Very pleasant to sit in a deckchair and watch the world go by, or admire the wildlife.

My Favorite in London. We love to take some time out from sightseeing and just stroll through parks when in London. This is by far my favorite. It is so peaceful, yet it is in the middle of the city. It is easy to get to. We were lucky, as we were there on the first day of nice spring weather. There were lots of locals out lying in the grass, having picnics, playing with the children.
Beautiful. Filled with school groups when we visited so lots of noise and chaos, but terrific walking paths, good signage and lots of birds and gardens.

Regal Park. One of the most regal of London’ s parks stretching as it does from Horse Guards Parade to Buckingham Palace with notable buildings along its perimeter. These include Clarence House, Marlborough House, St.James’s Palace, Lancaster House, 10 Downing Street, and Wellington Barracks where on the day of our visit troops were leaving the barracks for the ceremony of the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. The centrepiece of the park is a large lake around which are numerous colourful flower beds. There are a number of statues in the park, and a restaurant by the lakeside. Our visit coincided with lunchtime so there were a number of suited office workers taking the opportunity to have lunch and stroll the park.

Pleasant. Pleasant and placed right in the heart of central London, this park connects Buckingham Palace to the Westminster area, a short picturesque walk through leads you to the Churchill War rooms, Downing Street and Whitehall!
Always lovely. ...still my favorite place to while away some time in London (if you have any between all the sightseeing).
So beautiful . My favourite park in london so farIt's close to big hen and the palace so if you are around for the change of guard then so stroll around in this park
Nice park. It is nice park to spend some time. Daughter loved all the birds there. And also the statue of royal Shaun the Sheep.

Wonderful -in the Middle of London. Take a picnic or buy food there. Stroll the paths, watch the swans and ducks...quiet and peace in the midst of London. Views of Buckingham Palace. Feels like a fairy tale. Great break from sightseeing
Romantic. huge park in the city's heart. clean, attentive enjoy a wonderful walk in nature and yet you are in the heart of the city

Our favourite place in London!. With two kids -6 & 9 years - in tow, St James park with its fabled pelicans (which we could not see), the ducks and pigeons and squirrels was an instant hit. Go at 2 to watch the pelicans being fed, but do take plenty of peanuts and bread to feed the squirrels and birds. Laze around in the sun, have ice creams and generally spend a great afternoon here! We went twice - and even though tourists love it, the weekdays were much less crowded and easier for the kids to enjoy.

Beautiful. I always called this my son's back garden when he lived in Westminster. It was such a short walk and is so wonderful - as it should be for our Queen - the Palace overlooks it. Walk along the lake, admire the flowers, feed the squirrels, watch the pelicans or just sit back, relax and let the beauty soak into your soul.
Happy memories of a beautiful park. AI summer picnic was in order when we visited and although over 12 months ago I have very happy memories of my visit hereI would love to return one day

Peaceful spot . We wandered through here on our way from Buckingham Palace, severely regretting that we hadn't bought a picnic! Plenty of space available to sit down despite it a lovely sunny day. From the hustle and bustle just ten minutes prior to entering, and it actually being quite a busy park (the day we visited anyway!) it was still serene and peaceful. We were able to watch the ducks and lots of various other birds on the water (we only saw one notice board that named the bird types with pictures but there may have been more information boards that we missed) Friendly squirrels that actually come right up to you to see if you have food for them, fabulous for kids and big kids alike! No litter in sight around the park despite there being a few food and drink vendors situated by entrances/exits, so as well as people being on there best behaviour and putting rubbish In bins the rangers seem to keep on top of things too! Cannot talk further about the food and drinks vendors as we didn't actually pay any attention to them walking past knowing we were eating later in the day other than to say an icecream van was definitely one of them. Beautiful flowers dotted around the place, and some perfect spots for pretty scenic photographs.

Squirrels!. Stunningly beautiful park with lots of wildlife. The best things are the amazing, tame squirrels. London's best attraction! Take nuts (unsalted peanuts are fine, but no human junk food) and they will happily sit on your lap or climb up your leg to get the food. Achingly cute and endlessly entertaining. The only problem is that if you are with kids you may have to bribe them to get them to leave!
tranquillity in central london. Small compared with some of London's parks but better as it means you can see it all, great location near Buckingham Palace and a good spot to relax.

Picnics / Playground / Nice lake. This park is different from Hyde Park or Kensington Gardens because it is a bit longish and probably smaller. There is a lake that covers the length of the park and therefore the vegetation is a bit different with all these over-hanging trees over the lake. It was nice because there were loads of swans and ducks and one would be surprised by the speed they swim. The park is over-crowded because there are all these tourists, overhang from the changing of the guards or on their way to Whitehall. We can even see the London Eye from the park. Although we didn't have a chance, there is even a playground here - near the Buckingham Palace end.

An Oasis of calm. This is a beautiful park. I didn't want to leave. It is so serene and peaceful, but only minutes from the heart of London. London is full of beautiful parks. This is one my favorites. A great place to rest after walking all over town.

Nice walk . Great for just a nice stroll in nice weather, all the animals come up so close to you I've never seen them not so nervous taking food people were giving them, great place to bring young children
A lovely day in the Park. It was wonderful with all the animals and the birds. I loved feeding the squirrels. Lots of people enjoyed the sunny weather. An ideal place for a picnic.
Wonderful place to be. If you are looking for a bit of peace in busy central london St James is the perfect spot... and only a quick walk up see the palace

My favorite Park. Its a great park to take your kids too. Apart from the superb London Plane trees . Theres a lovely pond with ducks of all varieties plus you can go to the Horseguards place or Buckingham palace. Well I love it

Nice park. London is so busy and yet you can go to St James Park and find your own piece of grass to sit near the lake and relax. The park is a good size and very enjoyable to walk in or sit and have lunch.

An oasis of tranquillity in the heart of London. My favourite park in London. You can usually find a quiet spot to escape the hustle and bustle of central London. It is so close to so many major sights and a great place for a picnic.

Ducks!!. London has some of the greatest parks of any city in the world. St James park has a special place in my heart in that as a little boy my parents would regularly take me to St James park to see the incredible ducks from all over the world.They are so beautiful.I always remember asking a park keeper why they did not fly away & he said because they were protected & well fed. In fact there wings are clipped but given how well they are looked after I doubt if many of them would leave even if they could.There have been ducks there since the 1600s!!! Every time I am back in London I always take a walk through St James. If you are going to London this park walk is a big MUST!!!

Favourite London picnic spot !. A stop by any food store : some cheese, wine, biscuits and off the park. Make sure you have a couple of pounds to hire the lounge chairs on the green and enjoy a perfect afternoon. ( an attendant will be around to collect the money but you can help yourselves to the chairs at any time ).

Expected to be out in an hour but happily stayed 2.5hours. The war rooms themselves are a great story, and I really enjoyed listening to the audio tour which was to-the-point, humorous, and informative. Such a surprise that these most important events and decisions took place in such a spare, rudimentary space under the streets of London. The big surprise was the Churchill biographical section which was absolutely fascinating. He was an incredible personality and I enjoyed seeing how he approached his life journey at critical points. Makes me want to read more about him.

Beautiful. A lovely spot in amongst the busy Mall and Birdcage Walk perfect for a picnic or a wander. The swans on the lake are lovely to watch.In the middle of the park there is a fountain that is lit at night giving a fairy tail look to the park, I imagine it would be quite a romantic spot.
Beautiful!. Walked throught this park on our way to Buckingham Palace. Its simply beautiful! Lots of birds to see!

A soothing oasis amidst the bustle of central London. I've walked this park for nearly 25 years having worked nearby - it still never fails to soothe and uplift my spirits, providing a memorable environment no matter the season of the year - plus the surrounding areas of Westminster provide many other attractions and its all easily accessible by either bus or tube.

peaceful. Calm peaceful park. Joined the workers who were lunching. Not as big asHyde park, which more familiar with, but a nice place to stop and eat sandwiches and get away from hustle and bustle of the city

one of the nicest. really nice park in London, one of the best. can be hard to get over the bridge and through the other side if there's an event going on (security) but you get a nice view of the london eye!

Escaped the Buckingham Palace Crowds. Snapped a few pictures in front of Buckingham Palace and then quickly made our way toward the park. There were still quite a few people along the paths, but it was still peaceful. The gardens were lovely and we enjoyed looking at all the flowers as we strolled along. Walking through the park is much more scenic than walking along the Mall toward Trafalgar Square.

Lovely place. This oasis in the middle of a hectic town is perfect for a stroll. Enjoy the beauty of the flowers and the calm atmosphere, maybe even a cup of coffee. Definitely worth spending a couple of hours here.
Nice n' quiet. It's a nice place to sit and relax, to walk around or to people watch. It is peaceful and quiet and not too busy with people. Worth a visit !

Beautiful, quiet, and a relief after shopping.. Loved the variety of birds and getting back to nature after shopping made you appreciate life. Amazing to have squirrells runn ing all over the place and some eating out of your hand.
Beautiful Park. There are so many parks in London, and this one is beautiful! Luckily it is not one of the "keyed parks", so everyone is welcome. A great place to enjoy the day and take a breather!

Very nice greenspace near Buckingham Palace. We walked through St. James Park from the Houses of Parliament/Big Ben to Buckingham Palace and it was a nice walk. The walkways are even, wide and covered with shade for most of the walk. There were many people in the park on a Thursday morning, enjoying the waterfowl, and generally lounging around in the park. There were dogs around (on leashes) and a few early picnickers. We didn't stick around, but I would recommend walking through when seeing the sites around Buckingham, Trafalgar Square and the Houses of Parliament.

Love it.... Every time I go to the park I take a bag of peanuts with me. Squirrels are so cute and friendly. Amazing amount of birds from ducks to Pelicans. Park is clean and close to Buckhingam Palace or Traffalgar Sq. one of my fav parks in London!

A very pleasant stroll.. London Parks are allways generally kept in great condition. Despite the hoards of tourists and visitors it looks immaculate. No rubbish, I'm sure the grounds man have been working hard and the grass freshly hoovered! Well it was looking good! The park cafes were not so busy on this visit, and the staff friendly, albeit a bit over priced? We didn't get to see the Pelicans until our later stroll back but the rest of the wild fowl all seemed happy too . It's a great place to relax when the sun is out and see the world go by.

lovely park. When we visit London we always go across St.James's park, nice to see the ducks, swans, the nice green lawns and the beautiful flowers. If you pick a nice sunny day the photos are brilliant. Nice for relaxation and for a coffee with friends.
A place to take a good and relaxing walk. As every big city, London has several parks, St. Jame's Park it is one to take a good walk during your visit to London, to slow down your stress level.

The best park ever!. So many squirrels! I had a lovely walk with my boyfriend and my friend feeding the squirrels and birds, they are very friendly! The park looks very nice, but the squirrels are the best thing about it! Will be going back shortly to see my squirrel friends! haha
Tranquil. A peaceful haven for a family picnic. Even on a sunny day in half term the park felt tranquil. Amazing wildlife
Love the natural scenery . They have left the vegetation stay natural, wild and free. Simply beautiful to stroll along the park sidewalks. Saw many birds, geese and ducks.
Lovely open space. Beautiful gardens and enjoyed the squirrels running around. Lovely place to pack a picnic and nice bottle of wine
Gorgeous park!. Great place to sit relax, people-watch, kids or dogs to run around, have a picnic. Plenty of wide open space, shade trees, and nicely landscaped.

Pretty. The park is close to Buckingham Palace. We walked through, it was very pretty and calming. weather was ok but not ideal but lots of people about that were enjoying the park and looking at the water, wildlife or having coffee chatting .
Lovely park for a stroll and picnic. The flower beds, the ponds and the large shade trees make this a great spot for a picnic or just a place to sit and watch the crowds go by.

My favourite London park. I've been coming here for years, and each time it feels very special. There is lots to see, lots of wildlife and the omnipresent squirrels, but also lots of coffee vans / cafes and a brilliant playground for the kids.

Gorgeous park in May. Being in St. James park of a perfect May day is ideal. The grounds, flower beds and paths are lovely. There were loads of people taking advantage of the Spring weather and having picnics, feeding the ducks and strolling. Take a break from the museums and sites and grab a tea or coffee and relax in the park.
Lovely walk. Beautiful park connecting Buckingham Palace and Horseguards / Whitehall. Take your time walking along the water. London is one of the best walking cities in the world.
wonderful park. wonderful to walk in and around this beautiful park, its all a way from the madness of london, its is so nicely planted, peaceful and yet a short walk back to the sights and sounds
Best stocked London park. Oasis in the center of busy London with amazing variety of wildlife (mind, they are wild - not a zoo) including the Russian pelicans from 16th century! Breath of fresh air!
Beautiful Park. I loved this park! The best part is on the bridge and in one direction is Buckingham Palace and then the other direction is the Whitehall palace (Banqueting House).
great escape. Big enough to escape and be alone if you want or be alone with someone.... :-) Nice place to relay read or just hangout with friends!
Wonderful place!. Always a nice place to have a walk or enjoy some sun when in London! It is never too crowded and it is close to some of the most important places to visit for tourists!

Interesting tour!. I took a stadium tour with my Mother In Law, who is a big Newcastle fan. The stadium is impressive to see, and had decent toilets and food stands. Couldn't ask for much more really.

Beautiful. This is such an attractive park and as we were passing Horse Guards parade, the procession for the State Opening of Parliament came by, so we had a fantastic view. Also, when we passed the bird keepers cottage, we spotted a heron on the chimney. In today's paper, there was an article about the heron at no. 10 , so perhaps it was the same heron.
So much Green in London. This park has a waterway running through it. Very quite area. Lots of birds and people to watch. Close to the Palace and Mews.

Beautiful serenity in urban setting. I stumbled upon this park while trying to manoeuvre away from Buckingham Palace and a race that was taking place in Hyde Park. What a beautiful spot. You honestly wouldn't think you were in the centre of such a metropolitan area. Well worth a look, so relaxing and lovely spot for a picnic.
Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by on a good day. Lovely place, great views of historical buildings, view of Buckingham Palace from the bridge over the lake is excellent

gorgeous park leading to Buckingham Palace. While visiting London make sure you will organize a walk from Trafalgar Square via St James park to Buckingham Palace. Unforgettable experience you will enjoy. Park offers strolls along long lake water feature, ice creams, friendly squirrels which will come to your hand, benches you can rest on, etc. At the end of it there is fabulous Buckingham Palace (watch the flag on the top of it - flag up: queen is in, flag f=down: she is somewhere else). You can then carry on walking either via streets along the palace (on the left side) to Westminster Abbey and Houses of Parliament (Big Ben) or through Green Park (on the right of Buckingham Palace) and right into Ritz for a coffee (no shorts accepted at the entrance!) or simply take a tube at the end of Green Park park and head wherever you want to! Good luck!
A Bit of Green. Wonderful park just up from the Palace. Of course the words out and it is carpeted with Londoners and tourists most times. Goo early for the best patch of grass b
Lovely walk through St. James's Park. Among the many beautiful public parks in London, this is a great place to walk and enjoy the landscaping and flowers.

A Hidden Gem. St James's Park, next to Buckingham Palace is a wonderful little oasis. There's a great cafe, loads of birds including Pelicans and lots of rare ducks. You can lie on the grass or stand on the bridge looking towards the London Eye or in the opposite direction, the palace. On either side of it are busy roads but once you're in the centre of the park you no longer hear the traffic.It's 5 minutes walk from Trafalgar Square and 10 minutes from Big Ben and The Houses of Parliament. If you're feeling energetic, there's a great walk through St James's Park then on through Green Park and then Hyde Park to Kensington Gardens. The walk also takes you past the Wellington Memorial arch.

Romantic. Nice park for a romantic walk, with a big pond. Went for a walk after visiting Buckingham Palace and stopped for coffee at the cafe there where we had the nicest carrot cake ever. Recomended.

Another beautiful park. You can walk around London through it's wonderful parks, pop out to do your shopping, grab a picnic lunch and go back in the park. Really safe, relaxed and very clean. You can hire bikes and cycle around and leave the bikes at different locations which is a great way to take in the parks , their monuments, lakes and fantastic trees.

What's a great place to picnic with 12. The Queen on her way to Westminster for the State opening of Parliament,Bands,Guards,Gun Carrriages provided a great half term day out for 8 grandchildren and four adults. Splendid play area,good grass areas,marching bands and excellent grass area with a home made picnic of everybody's favourite food.Then a walk past the Queens house,up,Constitutional Hill to Marble Arch and then to Hyde Park for the fountains and ice creams before saying good bye was exceptional and cheap,even with cheap off peak rail fares from Kent
BIrds. Very nice walking park. Lots of birds, ducks, swans, etc. Great view of Buckingham Palace in one direction; the Eye in the other.

A lovely park. I saw a fox, several birds, I was feeding the local squirrels (take some nuts with you), it i crowded but great!
Always take an umbrella with you in London, and some Hunter shoes!

To me, the nicest park in London !. It is small enough to go around easily for all ages, has plenty of free space to seat and relax or picnic, even during the highest season and hottest days. It has an amazing variety of birds and ducks and it is always a big high for the little (and big) kids.The bridge across it gives the best view of Buckingham palace in a surreal setting.Just go!
Number one in many parks. There are many parks in London, but this is very beautiful with gardens and ponds. Benches and places to rest, if you need a pause in your journey.

Wonderful landscape with huge varieties of birds. The park is accessible by tube at St James station or just five minutes walk from Trafalgar Square. The park is wonderfully landscaped with some natural environment which makes it a haven for a host of birds, ducks, swans, geese, pigeons including squirrels. Be sure to bring some nuts and food to feed them and this will add to the highlight especially if you have children In your group. It is very user friendly with lots of wooden benches and deck chairs to soak in the sun. Clean and well kept it is really a thrill to laze in this atmosphere. There is a cafe within the park and is a good place to unwind over food to enjoy the park. Just five minutes away is the Buckingham palace.
really lovely park. Lovely park, loads of flowers, ducks, geese, pond - what more could you ask? Worth the diversion on way back to Victoria station.
The Queens birthday salute. We loved this event on April 21. The horses charge with guns and the whole spectacle is worth a visit. The band played and we joined in the march.
St James's Park, London. Peace and Quiet. Tranquil setting in the middle of London. A nice place to get away from the rush of busy life.

Peaceful and beautiful. This is a peaceful and beautiful park in the centre of London. It is located between Horse Guards Parade and Buckingham Palace. It has a range of wildlife including pelicans, geese and ducks roaming wild and there is plenty of seating to sit out in the open or in the shade of the trees. I had a leisurely picnic lunch there a few days ago, just people watching. It is a peaceful haven to recharge batteries during a visit to London. Lovely!

Quiet walk in the heart of the city. When you have time and the weather is nice, the walk from the Horse Guards Parade up until Buckingham Palace is very beautiful and offers some calmness at the heart of the city. The park has beautiful gardens and ponds with ducks and geese. If you don't have time, however, the part at Horse Guard Road is my favorite, offering a place to sit and enjoy a drink.

Military Display. We were most fortunate to end up here after the Churchill War rooms & there was a static old WW11 military display on, with people dressed up in the uniforms of the period & lots of things to interest every member of the family, memorabilia, tanks & aircraft, trolley buses & even a NAAFI shop & cafe where you could purchase the best Devon-shire tea in the UK.

Feed the Squirrels!. Beautiful park!!!! Bring some peanuts if you can! The squirrels will crawl right into your bag to go after them. It's fun to feed them (not really sure if you are supposed to, but...) Beautiful park located in front of Buckingham Palace. A must visit!
walk for hours in the fresh air. brilliant place for walks and enjoying the fresh out door air, some nice places to sit down and enjoy a coffee or a tea

One of our favorite places in all of London!. We walk through St. James's Park almost every time we are in London. Start at the Horse Guard's Parade and walk through St. James's. Cross over in front of Buckingham Palace and enter Green Park (my most favorite of all!). Walk all the way through to Piccadilly....it's a great way to spend a morning or afternoon!
St James. This park is so beautiful as are all the parks in London. Take time to enjoy everything the park has to offer.

View to Die For. Been many many times but on the glorious spring day we went, it was probably at its very best. Congratulations to those who tend it. No litter, brilliant spring colours and that iconic view from the bridge towards Whitehall. Lots of clicking cameras but can you blame people. A must see.
Clean and beautiful. Beautiful view, clean grass. Clean toilets. Many squirrels which are familiar with humans. Must see.

Our Favorite Park. We visited the park to relax and unwind several times during our week in London. Loved sitting and watching the mute and black swans with their babies. Quite a variety of waterfowl could be seen. It was clean and lovely. Very close to Buckingham Palace. We enjoyed walking around the lake as often as we could. One of my favorite spots in London.

Tranquil in the heart of London. I love this park. In every season it shines, even in the rain. The flowers and ducks and squirrels are always entertaining as are the tourists. It is small enough to be easy to get around and near all the big attractions.

While visiting the area... Nice park, not much different than the other wonderful london parks. Never passed the beginning near the palace due to the cold and rainy day. Visit if you go to the palace but not if you are on a different part on London. Add a wonderful time feeding the pigeons and even spotted a squirrel. Can't say that on other parks like hype park and such. The weather made as run and we never left the area near buckingham take that into considertion while reading my review.

Beautiful. It's a beautiful park! I had to walk through it from the underground to get to Buckingham Palace and it's such a relaxing walk. There's a stand or two int he park selling refreshments which is handy!We were approached by people trying to sell roses and saying if we don't we'll be cursed, but it wasn't a bother.Right next to the underground, great park!

Beautiful and serene like the parks in China)). Visited here back in Sep 2009 when studying at QMUL, St. James's Park was part of the students' tour package. The black and golden gates mark the unique form of gates the Brits have. The fountain and resting areas were very relaxing and soothing; no loud noises and no pollutions! Fresh air and aroma from the flowers like those in China. Love it!

Top park. I you had to imagine a perfect park this one would qualify. Just over the road from Buckingham Palace it's the place to retreat from the bustling crowds. A lovely English garden with the compulsory lake and plenty of shade.
Lovely park. It's a lovely park but quite a lot of tourists are seen here now days. There are a bunch of funny squirels always looking for some food.

Very pretty walk. We walked through the park on our way to Buckingham Palace, as it was very near to our hotel. Really pretty, lots of birds, ducks, etc. The only issue we encountered is that it was a bit windy, and we kept getting little bits of debris from trees in our eyes. Everyone was walking around rubbing at their eyes that day! But it was still very nice...really enjoyed walking through.

Absolutely Beautiful and Wonderful Water Fowl. It was such a wonderful stroll with lots of birds, ponds and flowers. There are benches to sit and read and it close to the main attractions like Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey. So after hitting those it's a nice place for peace and quiet.

A lovely walk. This is a nice park to stroll. During weekends and holidays it can get very busy. The pond is very pretty and the trees as a backdrop is nice. The ducks, squirrels, and geese that live in the park are interesting to watch too. You can cross over to Green park and have a picnic lunch on the green.
More rain. Our day was spoiled by the rain, we did move around when we had the chance but our picnic in the park was abandoned. Next time maybe.......
Peace and quiet. Spent a few hours walking through this beautiful Central London park in the sunshine well worth spending some time here !!

London green lung. A green lung in the middle of London , a pleasant place to run or sit happily on green grass and eat cheese and drink wine . Minute walk from the royal palace . Ducks , geese and squirrels walk freely near the artificial lake .

Lovely escape. A very nice stroll from end to end. A bunch of squirrels, and birds to admire. The scenery is very beautiful, even for the time I went (in January). It was fairly quiet, for being in central London, and it was a lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

A Magnificient Park. We totally enjoyed walking through the park. We were fortunate that the weather turned warm and the flowers and trees were all in bloom. A very restfull spot close to Buckingham Palace.

A very pleasant escape from the London hustle. Loads of ducks and birds to admire.
Friendly squirrels
Great scenery
The lake looks excellent and reflects the summer sky.

Busy time celebrating 70th anniversary of VE Day. Very busy time with great displays for the 70 the anniversary of VE Day. The highlight as always was the Spitfire on display. Great atmospher in the park with thousands of people enjoying all that was going on and cheering our war vets.

Gorgeous... Supprised it wasn't bussier.. Great place to feel like you are getting away from the busy spots of trfalgar scquare and uckignham palace. Gorgeous planting here and lots of wildlife.We went on a sunny sunday afternoon and I was supprised it wasn't heaving with people. We found a nice spot to lay down. A sense a calm and feeling close to nature in central london. Lovely.

A pretty park in central London. Very green park, easy to walk around and view the many statues of famous folks, e.g., Ghandi, A.Lincoln, etc. The flowers, ducks, and geese all add to the beauty of the place.
Beautiful Park. I've seen many photos of the park but they did not do it justice. It was so beautiful and I really enjoyed my time here.
nice strall. we liked the ducks,swans and squirrels very much.We fed the duck and some of them really did not fear of us and came very near.
Fun park for all. Watch out for Dog poop and skater which are not allowed to my knowledge, wait until late evening for best weather and wildlife is abundant every day

Every kind of duck!. What I like most about St. James Park is the plethora and diversity of water fowl. There are several bridges criss-crossing the water and it ends at Buckingham Palace circle so is a convenient place to relax and wait for friends. It 's very popular with families, and the birds are well fed by visitors. Watch where you step however.
Love the squirrels . Beautiful park it is the calm between two great scenic/touristic parts in London. Awesome place has a few spots you can stop at to eat.

Beautiful!. We walked through the park and really loved it. We thoroughly enjoyed the ducks, lots of benches to sit and take in the scenery. The gardens are maintained well and the park is well located to get to Buckingham palace! Perfect to enjoy a snack during a days worth of exploring in London. Beautiful park!

One of the best park in centre London. Definitely one of my favourite!
Ideal with friends or family, from the bridge the background is one of the best for taking pictures.
Very well frequented park.
Beautiful. Simply exquisite. A must see! You will love everything here! We detoured our walking tour and came across the park. Well worth the visit.
A park with a view. This was the park I use to play in as a child. Now as a man I take my friends from abroad grandchildren and tell them about the history all around
City Haven. Agreat place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. St James Park is beautiful and peaceful.
Great Park. You walk through it and you can get to buckingham palace.... great place for visiting and taking family and friends there. I took a friend from vietnam there and she loved the park...

Picture perfect. Walking through St. James's Park to get to Buckingham Palace was like walking through a movie! The grass is green. The area is clean. The animals are out to play. It was such a relaxing walk.

The perfect London park. My favourite park in London. The only thing that it doesn't have are boats on the lake.
The perfect way to walk from Buckingham Palace to Westminster and Parliament Square or vice versa.
Some great photo opportunities, walking over the bridge with a view of the London Eye on one side and Buckingham Palace on the other.
Calm in the city. Great walk from Waterloo to Buckingham Palace to see the changing of the guards...Peaceful and beautiful.
Beautiful park!. Perfect for families with children.Reserved play area with dedicated restrooms for children, good benches for grown ups etc.
Very nice park. It is excellent place to relax. It is beautiful, well planned and taken care. I really like to just walk around or sit and enjoy this beautiful place in London.

A Walk in The Park. ST James's Park is very large and if you take a quick look at your map you will see a walk up West Carriage Drive will connect you from Knightsbridge to Oxford Street. On the way you can visit The Princess Of Wales Memorial Fountain and Gallery, cross the Serpentine Bridge, seeThe Nursery , break for a nice picnic lunch and then take a path to Speakers Corner on the corner of Marble Arch. Then after seeing this, you are ready for a bit of rough and tumble , achived by walking and shopping in Oxford street LOL. Oxford Street is a long Road so if your feeling tired turn Right down Regent Street see a few more decent shops and then on into Piccadilly, perhaps to see a show orFilm Yeahhh ! A good day out and maybe Dinner to round it Off.
A classic!. Visited on 70th VE Day so they had special exhibits. But a beautiful garden anytime. In the heart of royal part of city.
nice for a gentle stroll. A great place to wall round at your own pase lots to see take a camrea and when you get to the other end you get to see buckingham place.

The bird life itself is worth seeing. In the heart of London another green area! You can look back at the London Eye and the Houses of Parliament , across the lake to some exquisite London properties and see people sitting in trees reading book. The cafe is good for a coffee. The birds were spectacular. On a nice warm day take a stroll or wrap up on a cold day and take a stroll.
best view in London. stand on the bridge, look at the beautiful view towards parliament... I think it's my favourite London park.

Small but full of life and variety. There is lots of flora and fauna at this small park, ponds/lakes, park benches, etc. A truly delightful park that might be missed due to its more famous neighbours.
Overfilled and overrrated. If you want to see loads of tourist strolling around slowly that's your place to be, nice park though
Gorgeous. beautiful park centrally located near Buckingham Palace. Lovely walking paths, water, fountains, swans, and the flowers are absolutely amazing. Great place to run or walk ;-)

Beautiful park. St James's Park is the oldest of the Royal parks in London and certainly one of the loveliest it is a real joy to stroll through this beautifully kept park and a visit to the lake is a must

A Gem in the heart of London. In the shadow of Buckingham Palace this is one of my favourite green areas of our Capital City. Wild life (Ducks etc) and Flowers in abundance a place to forget the hustle and bustle!

Central London park. This is the place where I first saw squirrels in London. It is very easy to reach and a good break or to fill in the space from watching the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace.
beautiful. Spent some time here during 'VE DAY celebrations. Great exhibition of WWii vehicles, aircraft and much more. Park itself very pleasant.

Lovely greenery. This park is right next to Buckingham palace. The Park is soothing to the eye and there are a number of ponds, trees, flowers, birds and squirrels. The birds and squirrels are not shy of humans and come close hoping to be fed. Its a great place to walk through from Buckingham palace on your way to Parliament square.
Cabinet War Rooms. Went to Cabinet War Rooms arrived at 11:00 missed all queues which were extensive at 1pm when we came out. Very informative and interesting
Nice Oasis of Calm in London. Great park in the middle of London, a nice place to walk and relax. There is a great lake in the middle of the park with an interesting selection of ducks.

Nice walk between Buckingham Palace and the stables. Nice walk between Buckingham Palace and the stables.
Can get very busy on sunny days...and especially just after the changing of the guards
Beautiful beautiful. Nothing bad...just beautiful. Well kept. Gorgeous flowers, fountains, etc. Clean. Good signage. The paths are easy to travel. Good for young families, pets, adults.
P. A beautiful park with grass trees plants flowers water fountain birds squirrels and lovely place to walk sit read chill
beautiful park and a short cut to many places in london. Really nice park with views of Buckingham palace lots of ducks and water with bathrooms and a short cut to trafalger square

Pretty Park to take a stroll. I travel a lot for work and try to stay at Marriott properties. St.Ermins is on this Tube stop and part of the Marriott family. The New Scotland Yard is right around the corner. There couldn't be a safer location! The Brid Cage walk is beautiful.

Spend an afternoon here. St. James Park is a London jewel - it is the best park for enjoying a sunny afternoon. Wonderful flower gardens, great benches, fun with waterfowl and delicious ice cream treats. Don't miss this park - it's great to stroll through on your way to Big Ben from Buckingham Palace

'Love this park'. You would never think you were in the middle of London or near Buckingham Palace when you are in the centre of this park. So relaxing. Great space, lots of play areas and birds to see on the water.
Just great, situated in between horse guard parade and the palace and just off the mall.

Beautful. This park is located next to Buckingham Palace. Its easy to get to buy bus or subway. Take a very relaxing stroll after a hard day. They have chairs you can rent. The flowers are beautiful. Walk through the gates and see the palace.

Sneezing and sniffling all the way through. We walked to St. James's Park on our first day. The trees and flowers are very beautiful. The tulips were not quite blooming just then but something sure was! As soon as we entered the park, I started coughing, sneezing and sniffling and my eyes started watering like crazy. We couldn't stay long because of that but what we were able to see was beautiful.
Beautiful park. You can't come to london and not visit this park ,very pretty ,well looked after flowers beds whole area is beautifully kept .makes a lovely day out walking

Need a break from bustling streets of London? This is it.. This was literally the first place we visited when we arrived to London. It took us a while to freshen up, gaze around and relax. It surely takes you into a whole new world away from bustling and busy streets of London. It really recharges your inner batteries!

A garden in central London unrivalled throughout Europe. The trees, flowers and the proximity to Buckingham Palace for the Changing of the Guard, The Mall with the wonderful huge Union Jacks displayed.

Best park in London. If the sun is out, and you want to walk through a London park, this is the one to visit. The park is beautifully designed and impeccably maintained The pictures I took with my phone look like postcards. It's usually quite crowded, and not as big as Regent Park or Hyde Park,so you won't have any quiet space to yourself.

Beautiful park. My party were visiting from Las Palmas, so not used to much green area, as such they really enjoyed the park. as they said just to see that amount of green area along with fascinating trees and wildlife, such a squirrels up close. They liked the 'Princess Diana Memorial Walk' emblems that are in the pathways of the park. Really a lovely way to spend an hour or so on a sunny day. and as we had just finished visiting Buckingham Palace very close.
Quiet, lots of green. A good place to go if you need a little peace and quiet during your London visit. Get to the middle of the park to relax.
Lovely place for a walk in the busy city of London. Beautiful park and lovely for a walk. The park is a credit to the London Authorities and hard work of the staff.
Beautiful park. We watched the changing of the guard then crossed to the park which was full of colour and wildlife. We stopped for a warming coffee in the superb café just off the riverside

Bridge with a view. The tiny bridge in the middle of St James Park is one of my favourite London spots to take great photos, make sure you take a photo from both sides! Lovely park surrounded by history.

Great view, lots of birds great for people watch.. St James's Park in Westminster is free and lots Londoners go there to walk,run, take pictures, feed the birds and just hang out!What a great place, lots of grass, path way, water fountain, swans, many different kinds of birds and fowls.There is a restaurant in the park to get coffee, snack, have afternoon tea-make reservation first or you may be disappointed. Enjoy a cool beverage, or a pint or sit down and get served.Spend as much time as you have and enjoy nature to the fullest. Great place!
Beautiful. A really wonderful park across from Buckingham Palace. It's a beautiful park to walk through and spend a couple of hours. Lot's of different birds and waterfowl. Enjoyed our time there.

Favorite park in London. I loved strolling through St. James Park! It is beautifully maintained with gorgeous flower beds, big green lawns, a charming pond with ducks, and views of the London Eye and Buckingham peeking out in true distance. It is a smaller park which makes it easy to explore and is right in the center of many main attractions in London.

Wonderful oark. St James park is an oasis of nature in the centre of London. Luckily I work nearby and pop here often at lunchtime for a walk or just to sit and eat my lunch. This time of year the flowers are blossoming and it looks lovely. It does get busy but it's still glorious. Stop and get an ice cream or visit the inn on the park while you're there.
Great place for a run or a walk. Beautiful park with a view of Buckingham Palace. For a longer run go around St. James then head over to Green park right next door.
Splendid!. Walked around St. James' Park while I waited for the "Beating the Retreat" ceremony at Buckingham palace. Just beautiful, wonderfully maintained and perfect for a morning/evening stroll.
Absolutely a must see!. The flowers and the wildlife in this park are amazing! We took a leisurely stroll through the park a took many pictures. Very lovely.

Relax and slow down your rush life. . Just take a walk, deep breath, and relax there.
Nice park in town. Good choices for picnic. There is ‘Inn the park’ restaurant and some more food kiosks in the park.
Another plan for walking through the park to reach the Buckingham. As from May-July there will be guard changing around 11.30am.

Still as beautiful as ever. I always go to this park when I am in London. It's so beautiful any time of the year. It's a quiet peaceful oasis in the middle of a very busy London. I especially love just sitting and watching people and clouds go by. Like coming back to an old friend every time.

the heart of London. i believe that St. James's Park is considered the heart of London because it's really amazing place with many ceremonial parades and events of national celebration.The pelicans are fed every day at 14:30, and there are water birds, plus owls, woodpeckers and bats. There's a children’s playground, and deckchairs from April to September.Changing the Guard occurs daily in summer and alternate days for rest of year; The Queen's Lifeguard changes daily at Horse Guards Parade Ground.
Beautiful Most of the Year. While you are visiting the tourist attractions, take a break and walk in the park. You'll thank yourself for it.
Lovely Park. I was very impressed with the Park - such a nice quiet place in the centre of London. Very peaceful and plenty of benches to sit and relax.
One of the best. One of the most beautiful park in London. During the spring and the summer time is the best place to chill out in central London. U should see it if ubare around.

One of the most beautiful places in Central London. The park is in between the Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace and it offers peaceful place to relax, have a picnic or for a nice walk away from the noise of the city.
Beautiful park. If the weather is nice, I`d recommend a visit to St. James Park.Beautiful landscapes, lots of birds, ducks and really nice atmosphere.

. Very picturesque and peaceful with a great vibe in the summer but can sometimes be spoilt by massive groups of tourists unfortunately! It's nice to take a ride on the borris bikes through to green park!
Lovely and peaceful. Nice to dive into greenery, is fine for meandering, there is water, birds, humans, benches, I cant ask for more.
Quiet. Beautiful, well kept gardens and quiet. If you want to experience class rankings in London, visit the neighbhood.
The path to Buckingham Palace. Very relaxing and refreshing atmosphere. You can watch the birds, the beautiful flowers arrangements and relax away form the madding crowd. Enjoy it!
Beautiful Park. Spring was in the air! The tulips were blooming and the wildlife were out and about welcoming spring, too. Enjoyed our walk from the Buckingham Palace.
Beautiful green aoace. My favourite of the London parks as bit is vast and in the centre. Lovely to just sit and relax with a coffee it ice cream in summer
Relax. Excellent place to relax on the grass after a long day of walking London streets. Very nice and close to The Mall and Buckigham Palace

RELAXED. With all the traffic so close to the park it is unbelievable quiet in St James Park - within just a few minutes of being inside the park you feel that the hectic life of London appears worlds away - simply a lovely place to be assuming the weather is reasonable.
Great with kids. When I am stressed out I came here to find some inner peace. Love it! Kids love it and I can read a book while they are playing!

So beautiful Tulips. We got really lucky to be there at the right time, when all different colours of tulips were blossoming, they were at the peak!!!
It was a feast for our eyes and that subtle scent in the air .. it was absolutely stunning !!
It was a delight to spend time in this park, so well looked after.

Favourite London Park?. Could be argued this is the favourite park of many Londoners, me included. Views all around of famous landmarks and lots of green space to relax on! Great to sit and watch the birds. The flying ones that is. Shame you have to pay to sit on beach chairs. Take your own to rage against the machine.

April Blooms!. Coming from the northeast United States, seeing all of the flower beds in bloom at St. James's Park in April was a welcome sight! This is a great place to spend an hour or so wandering around taking in the beauty of the blooming flowers and great outdoor atmosphere!
Little gem of a park. My favourite local park.... lovely to bring a blanket and a pic nic ... lots of friendly squirrels too!

pure delight. We visited the park as often as we could as it is beautifully maintained and very tranquil even though it is in the middle of the city. The ducks, swans, geese, squirrels and other inhabitants were very entertaining

Nice park in the city. Very nice park right next to Buckingham Palace.
Not as big a park as other cities but worth the visit, park has a real history to it and nice ponds with ducks etc.
Lots of locals also use the park to go for a walk, ride and walking dogs.
Springtime!. I can absolutely recommend a stroll through the park on a nice day in May, great scenery and a nice walk.
lovely. If you are looking for a quiet place to walk and distress then St. James Park is lovely green space in which to do that.

Lovely flowers. St. James park is always clean and the flowers always look so beautiful what ever time of the year you go , then of cause there's the lake and all the lovely birds including pelicans plus if you stand near horse guards parade a wonderful view of Buckingham palace

A ROYAL PARK IF THERE EVER WAS ONE..... Plan part of your walking tour of London to include a leisurely stroll through Saint James' Park. Lovely ANY TIME of year, but Spring and Summer being particularly inspiring with everything green.

Thousands of daffodils!. Nice park in the center of the city with thousands of daffodils blooming. We walked around before we headed to see the Changing of the Guard at St. James's and Buckingham palaces. Very nice walk around the park.

Fabulous gardens, immaculately maintained.. We took a leisurely stroll through St. James's Park on our way to the London Eye area.
Enjoyed the animals, flower beds, squirrels, pelicans etc.
Just a nice thing to do whilst in London and completely free !!
Great place to run or stroll. LOVED the gardens, the wide foot paths, and there were many runners, cyclists & walkers around just enjoying the scenery!
Beautiful! . So pretty and peaceful. Loved people watching and resting from a day of touring. Would adventure here again for sure, and great location!

Great Place for a Break. In the heart of the city, just next door to Buckingham Palace, is St James's Park. It has: a small, but very nice playground for children; Beautiful flower gardens; squirrels; and stands selling deliciously unhealthy waffles.
Take a break here before heading back into the madness of the city!

Beautiful. We stayed at the Ritz and the Park us right next door. In the Spring it's beautiful. Wonderful walkways, flowers, festive. Of course, THE Palace is right there also, so it's well worth the trip.
Lovely respite. Great for walking and at this season enjoying spring flowers and trees. Some good coffee stops around the lake

Good park in the middle of the city!. St James park is a good place to relax in the middle of the city. It has a tiny lake, with a lot of threes and a lot of benches to sit. It also have a lot of friendly squirrels that take food from your hand and are not afraid from you!

Smaller intimate park. St. James' Park was my favorite because of it's size. Reminded me of the Public Gardens in Boston. Beautiful flowers and close proximity to Westminster area. See the little Gardener's Cottage!

Nice park. Very nice park, located right near Buckingham Palace. You can also get some views of the London Eye, which is nice. We went in mid march, and the flowers looked really nice. Definitely nice to take a stroll through here after a long day of sightseeing.

My favorite London stroll. This park runs along the road into Buckingham Palace. It is full of birds, plants and incredible views. My favorite spot for pictures in London is on a little bridge where you can see the. London Eye on one side and Buckingham Palace on the other. The view is framed by gorgeous trees sweeping over the pond.

Beautiful cozy park with small but very active playground. St James's Park is definitely one of the most beloved parks in London, not as expansive as some of the other parks, but very much in the center of the town, adjacent to Buckingham Palace and the Mall. For families with small children visiting the area, it has one other great advantage: Within view of the Buckingham Palace, at the very South-Western end of the park is this quite elaborate small playground with swings, sand pit, saw horses and much more - it is a busy, busy place but well situated on a sight-seeing itinerary to give a break for the little ones.
Flowers flowers and ducks. Nature in the heart of London. Scenic views to Whitehall, LondonEye, Buckingham Palace. Suitable for romantic walks and sentimental randez-vous

Delightful. Clean tidy and spacious green area with some surprising history attached from mp scandals to perhaps secret meetings with princess Diana and another gentleman... Who knows the possibilitys are endless!

Absolute delight. The park is between westminster/churchil war rooms and Buckingham palace....its a nice walk...there is a duck pond, lots of birds and also pelicans..you can feed the pelicans at 2 pm everyday....the squirrels are fun too..they eat right off your hand..it was fun feeding them...lots of great photo opp....loved it

Beautiful Park!. Very busy so plan to stroll and not walk at a fast pace! The flowers and trees and lawns were quite beauteous! We walked back to our hotel from Buckingham Palace after the changing of the guards, so that may well be why it was so busy! Enjoy!

Beautiful park. Spent a lovely couple of hours here admiring the wildlife and the views, stuck in between horse guards parade and Buckingham palace, this park is and unexpected beauty in the heart of London, great for photos

Tranquility. Tranquility in Bustling London! Really!! Yes You Bet!!!
Come to st James Park.
Even for a quick business chat with a colleague who's in London for the day we grabbed a Sandwich, walk, talk business and then on our way

Lovely Park for a Stroll. This park is amazing in the Spring time, the flowers are in all their glory and the sun chairs were out available for anyone to use. I happily spent two hours having a leisurely stroll and a picnic lunch which was a welcome break from sight seeing
Lovely open space!. A great space and includes lots of fun things to do! The playground for the little ones is fun and is adventurous from the others.

relax close to Queen and her Guards. Although there are only a few benches around, the park is a perfect place to rest your sour feet in between long walks. Make sure you have a little pick-nick and a blanket with you (s.a.) and enjoy a little time out.
The most attractive park in London.. The park is close to Buckingham Palace. The best hour to visit the park is around 7.00-9.00 am( early morning) ...to see his beauty.

Great for morning walks/jogs. Beautiful gardens and birds abound. A quiet stroll in the morning will be rewarded with sights of flowers, wild life, and many Londoners out getting morning exercise! Walk up to Buckingham Palace and await the Changing of the Guard at 1130-1200 if you have time.
Most Enjoyable Park In London!. Just being able to watch the birds along and in the ponds is incredible! Though not incredibly large, it is very easy to stop and think.

Take a few minutes out of a after a busy day to relax here. Central London can be too busy, so take a few minutes away from the bustling crowds and stroll along here. Walk, or take yr shoes off your feet and laze in this park. There are excellent trees, flowers and the pond coming from St James tube, rather than Green Park / Piccadilly - which I find too busy and full of traffic. Then, there are the birds congregating on or around the pond. A great refuge in the middle of the city.

Lovely park. We enjoyed walking through this park when going by foot from Westminister area to view Buckingham Palace. There are sidewalks and a lake walk. It is shaded with trees and has flower beds as well as resident birds. Dogs are asked to be walked on leash due to the wildlife. There is a tube station on one end near the park. Well worth a nature break or just a pleasant walk on your way.

A little slice of nature's beauty in the heart of London. We walked through St. James park a couple of times during our eight-day visit to London. We were there in the middle of April and everything was starting to bloom. The beds of tulips and other flowers were like candy for the eyes. Simply beautiful. Walk through this park with someone you love.

Relax with a cocktail after a busy day!. Take the weight off your feet after a busy day of sightseeing/shopping/working and relax in this trendy bar which does excellent cocktails and the service is first-rate.

Blooming Lovely. This park is amazing.So many pretty flowers and mini lakes to look at. They even have deck chairs that you can use free of charge. It's so central and easy to find. Best of all it's free!
An evening stroll in the park. The park is beautiful at this time of year! Stunning display of flowers. It really is a most pleasant place to relax in the heart of London.

A Nice Place to Stroll. ST. James Park in central london is one of the best places to spend your time alone or with friends. A beautiful park near the Buckingham palace and a walk along the water way is mesmerizing.
Fun in the sun. Enjoyed our walk through the park and the children loved playing in the sand pit at the children's area.

Beautiful nature . If you want to escape from a city but be close to it this park is definitely on to do list. You can sit on a grass, watch animals run around and enjoy ur day, have a little snack or something :)

Pretty park. This is one of the loveliest parks in London! It is not a huge park, but it has lots of beautiful flowers, trees, a lake and birds & wildlife. I love to stroll around the park. There are chairs and benches if you need a break, and even a cafe in the middle of the park. It is so nice I wish I could go back this second! It´s a little bit crowded during tourist season, sunny days and weekend - but not too much to still enjoy it! It´s free - another reason to visit!

Favorite Park in London. Just beautiful. Make sure you walk across the bridge in the middle of the lake for great views of Buckingham through the park. Also enjoy the swans, ducks, and other birds in the area. Its an oasis in the middle of the city that provides a lovely walk between Westminster and Buckingham.
One of London's nicest parks. Well worth wandering around this relatively small park. Great views of Buckingham Palace, the Foreign and Commonwealth Office, No10 and Horse Guards Parade.
Urban oasis. Love the wildlife ... we could practically reach out and touch the great blue herons, white pelicans, geese, and ducks. It's a lovely park for strolling through.
Beautiful!. Visited on a warm sunny April day, so that certainly added to the experience. The flowers were in bloom and so colorful and well taken care of - a nice break from all the sightseeing!
Quiet park. Nice. Idyllic. Flowers. Relaxing. Loved it. A nice place to relax from the noise in town. Even lying chairs.
Nice walk in the park. A must if you're near Buckingham Palace. We walked through it to Buckingham and then again to Westminster.

Relaxing atmosphere. The park offers a nice atmoshere far from the crowded streets. On sunny days you can sit on the grass and have a picnic and admire the beautiful trees, flowers, ducks and pelicans on the lake.

Beautiful gardens. I was there mid April so all the bulbs were blooming. I loved the formal gardens mixed with the more natural looking lake. From the park, there are great views to the London Eye, and the Queen's Armory. There's a casual restaurant with a roof top terrace perfect for enjoying a sunny day. There are also lawn chairs for rent on a big central, sunny lawn. London is so busy, so hectic and this park gives a nice respite from that, as well as being a nice stroll to other tourist attractions.
An Oasis in London. Nice to take a breather here after seeing the other "must see" sights around the area. Lots of wildlife, especially birds to see. Other than that, it is what it is, a park.
lovely park. Enjoyed walking in the park on a sunny day eating an icecream with my grandaughter,lots of families enjoying the sun and feeding the ducks.

Some flowers allready. We spend little time in the parks around Buckingham Palace and there was some beautiful flowers to see. Quite a lot of people. Around the Palace there was quite a few broadcasting groups as they were prepared for the announcement of the birth.

Lovely. Had a lovely stroll through the park on a weekend visit. Very close to all the sights, Big Ben, Trafalgar Square, Buck Palace. Across the way is Green Park and if you're prepared to walk you can venture to Knightsbridge and Harrods.St. James has a lovely little cafe and a large lake with plenty of ducks on, ideal for families.It was just nice to eat our lunch and watch the world go by. It's fairly quiet considering it's in the middle of a capital city just a few hundred yards from the hustle and bustle.

Take a walk in the park. Was a brilliant sunny afternoon when we were there. The flowers were on full display, the sun shining and Londoners were out and about. Even the squirrels and birds were on display. Was a great way to finish a day of sightseeing.

Excellent after long walk journey. I've been walk around the Westminster area afternoon, and then i got some rest in this park, it was quite wonderful and relaxed, gardens & lakes.... everything was so far so good.Highly recommended and Beautiful.
Lovely park. The tulips were the highlight. I have not seen such a lovely collection of colourful flowers right in the midst of a natural landscape and in the heart of hectic urban activity.
Romantic. On a dry day this park is full of happy people all chilling reading a book or relaxing with a picnicSometimes celebrities can be seen working out or having a jogLovely placeSo romantic

Gorgeous outdoor space, great for photography!. Beautiful trees (especially in spring when the blossoms are out), stunning flower gardens and of course, the lake and ducks/ swans. Perfect any time of year for a stroll. Also worth checking out the Royal Horse Palace where they do the changing of the guards at regular intervals. Perfect photo opportunities abound.
a great place for a family afternoon. lots of open space, good for the kids, lots birds, ducks,close to central london, will give you a good work out,

Hard to stop taking photos!. Absolutely beautiful in early spring! As we walked the path through the center of the park along the lake, each scene seemed to out-do the last. The design of the park is a perfect balance of "natural" beauty and showy flower combinations. I'm a gardener from up north in the U.S. and I was so ready to see blooming flowers and perennials coming back. The tulips, primroses, hyacynths and daffodils were spectacular and the vistas picture perfect The swans, ducks and pigeons are quite tame and are easy to see close up. There are many other birds in addition to the pelicans to watch as well. It was wonderful to see so many people enjoying this lovely park -- and it was also wonderful to see that people seemed very careful to keep it neat and tidy -- no litterbugs here!

Absolutely Wonderful. Now, truth be told we were in the park on one of the most glorious weekends in the past decade; however, we found this park singularly charming. Places to walk and relax near so many of the great landmarks. You don't need to go out of your way to get there, just make sure you walk through when enjoying my favorite city in the world.
St. James's Park .... Alive with spring flowers and fervent fowl, the mid-city park encouraged pedestrians to linger linger and laugh under Wordworthean clouds.

So well kept.... We walked through here on route to Buckingham Palace, taking the time to look at any of the war memorials & the truly beautiful flower arrangements.This park is so pretty, great for a picnic stop or just for a nice stroll.My children loved seeing lots of birds & squirrels.Carole : )
Need to spend more time here. Whenever I'm in London, I take a quiet stroll through St James's Park. It remains one of the most beautiful parks build by King Charles I.
Gorgeous. We loved strolling. Don't miss the AMAZING cafe in this park. Puts New York to SHAME. If you have kids buy some duck or bird food before you come. They will have a blast.

Brilliant place for a rest after shopping. Close to Buckingham Palace and Harrods, brilliant place to have a rest from all the noise and all the people at Buckingham Palace. Places to lie down. You can by food and drink from several mobile trolleys. A lot of animals have the water as there habitat. Probably a smart place to bring the kids when they get tired. Birds of all kinds and sizes live in St. James Park. Go there.
lovely place. Is one of my favourite places in london. if the weather is nice it is the nicest place to enjoy with friends and family.

Lovely but. This has long been a favorite park for me. However, it is so nice that is it now crowded. It is unavoidable due to it location between Westminster and the Palace. For more peace and quiet, Hyde Park, Regent's Park, Holland Park, and especially Kew Gardens are better.

The prettiest park in London. Not as vast as Hyde park or even nearby Green Park, St James's is more compact and yet filled with unique and charming features of its own - it's small enough to stroll around without tiring you out, it has a restaurant, a wide selection of waterfowl, some superb and unique views that make interesting photographs and has been used as the backdrop and setting for some memorable British films - from the bridge across the pond, you can look towards Buckingham Palace, set among the green trees in summer , or out over Horseguards Parade with the London Eye and the Shard showing above the imperial splendour of the Whitehall skyline On the lake itself, you might see a widgeon, a teal or even a mandarin duck - and you are certain to see the Pelicans . Best visited in good weather in the summer, when it's flowerbeds are at their best, it's a very tranquil park with a play area for young children as well as good facilities for older visitors. No visit to London is complete without a visit to this place - it's really superb.
Oasis in central London. A lovely park with great views from the little bridge across the lake. The flowers in spring are always lovely, one of my favourite places to wander around when in town.
Beautiful park to rest. If you are tire walking between the Buckingham Palace and to Big Ben and all the other attractions by the river, you can rest up at the park.
