Busy yet peaceful. Just off the mall and surrounded by so many other tourist destinations, but worth a walk through for the birds, squirrels and peacefulness.

You like ducks- come and visit. This is a park near Piccadilly Circus, Buckingham Palace, et, which I have visited many many times and spent hours looking at the birds. It is especially interesting at dawn and dusk when the flocks of (mostly) geese group and fly off from and to other nearby parks. Often quite crowded (but shut at night) and a few cafés. This is a welcome home of peace is a busy city.
Wide open and near several tourist sites. Big open park near many of the favorite tourist destinations like Buckingham Palace, 10 Downing Street, etc.

Central London peace and quiet time to enjoy and reflect. Step into the park and you forget you are in central London. This park is brilliantSpace to work, and run about, space to sunbathe if the weather is kind, but gives you the opportunity to watch the world go by, and with reduced noise it is easy to get wrapped up in what is a great place to be. There is some surprising wild life - Pelicans You are also not at risk of the mad speeding cyclists, as they respect the areas where they are banned. This is a place that you can spend time before rendering the London hustle and bustle

A beautiful place to walk and sit, so close to the heart of London. The park borders Buckingham palace mad joins right back to hires guards parade. A lovely park with ponds and running water, a haven for tourist, locals and wildlife. Where else can you see resident Pelicans in the uk? Beautiful park with plenty of opportunities to bask in the sun, eat ice cream and drink a cuppa while sat on a deckchairs. A small piece of forever Britain
peaceful. a peaceful spot, lovely place to sit on a sunny morning and watch the wildlife. Great views of Buckingham Palace
Beautiful. I would recommend visiting after watching the changing on the guards. The park is stunning during spring and look for the swans in the pond

Happening place in the London sun. It is a beautiful garden with a lovely lake and tons of water birds. After a long day of walking the city it was a great spot to sit and relax before heading over to Buckingham Palace.
Haven in posh London. Just a great place to walk about or sit and look at water- ducks - people, Lovely at any time but especially on a hot day

Stunning park at sunset. We arrived after a long trip from America just barely awake. We were forcing ourselves to stay up to try to get on London time, so we went out for dinner and decided to take a walk to keep moving. I know this park was close, but had no idea how stunning it would be. This was our among our first impressions of London.Wow. While we did not stay for long, we did walk a good portion of the south side, across one of the bridges and took lots of photos. It was a Thursday evening, so not real busy. Some of the flowers were blooming, and the grass was green, so it looked like spring to me (from Wisconsin). Not too many bikers or joggers, and everyone was polite. Stunning. Thanks for this park.

In Full Bloom. Now is the time to visit St. James Park. The man hours it took to plant all the bulbs and flowers is staggering. A riot of color everywhere. A must visit. Our visit to London was during a "heat wave" so the park was very crowded. But the Brits are relatively quiet and respectful which made it pleasant to stroll through the gardens.

Beautiful,place for a walk. We came to the park on the perfect spring day. The birds were strolling around by the water, the tulips and daffodils were all in bloom and the sun was shining. This park makes you feel you're not right in the city. Great place to relax!

Prachtige omgeving midden in de stad. Scones with clotted cream in the park and fresh strawberry jam yammi. Beautiful spring flowers and gray squarrels in the middle of the town. Nearby all the important monuments.
Great location. Perfect location for a walk through the park, can also see Horse Guards Parade and Buckingham Palace right across the street!

Beautiful in Spring!. The flowers and lake are beautiful when all is in bloom! Great for a slow walk with so many notable facilities bordering the grounds. Playgrounds for the children and plenty of ducks and birds to watch, too. We typically walk from Green Park, past Buckingham Palace, through St. James Park, on to the Horse Guards Parade, 10 Downing Street to Westminster...a wonderful loop!
Superb!!. One of the best maintained parks in the world !! Right in the middle of London!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
quiet and peaceful. a very nice park for a picnic, lots of shady trees and the lake is always full of swans and geese and other birds!
Beautiful. Did not go to London to see Buckingham Palace but the park in front was beautiful. Plenty of room for everyone there. Nice lake with protected water life.
lovely relaxing park. spotessly clean well kept and escape from the bustle of london well worth a visit to relax and just chill

Lunch break on the lawn. Nice park right next to the Buckingham Palace. Quite crowded and the snack from the kiosk wasn't too cheap. However it was nice sitting on the lawn in sunshine watching people wondering around.

Lovely. We enjoyed a walk through the park most days of our stay, such a delight. Very clean, loved the Pelicans and other waterfowl.
Plenty of refreshments available if you want it.

My favourite London park!. Have been here many times, but actually spent proper time here for my Daughter's 6th birthday, we walked from Leicester Square as we had to do the obligatory M&M world and Hamley's first.I love London anyway, but it was a gorgeous summers day and after a walk like that it was great to roll out the picnic blanket and set up shop, we met family too so the kids ran round the trees and had their pics taken in the deck chairs.The facilities were great, although busy there was plenty of room, you weren't on top of each other, took a walk through the park after lunch to Buckingham Palace, we couldn't have planned a better day out.Can't recommend it highly enough - London really is the best city in the world, at any time of the year x
clean and spectacular. went there on saturday, it is very clean, lovely views of the lake. lovely to be able to relax in the centre of london.

Beautiful park with palace view. Well, with the Queen and her relatives living all around it, you wouldn't expect this park to be ugly and neglected. But it actually surpasses expectations. It's just the most beautiful peaceful little green space that takes you out of the London traffic, with a lake in the middle and swans. ducks and geese wandering around, and beautiful flowers and trees with little grey squirrels scurrying around. Absolutely delightful to sit there on a warm day and admire the view of Victoria's fountain and Buckingham Palace through the trees.

Beautiful park....with Pelicans!!. One of the best parks in central London. Great for a sunny day walk. The only park in London with Pelicans. If you go at 2.30 you can see the Pelicans being fed on the rocks. Nice walk from Trafalgar Square to Buckingham palace Well worth spending a couple of hours hereOnly down side is most of the lawn areas are fenced off so not ideal for a picnic only a walk

Nice walk to escape the crowded streets of london. Lovely on a sunny day and just have a stroll and appreciate the green space in the middle of a large city. Or take a picnic and sit on the grass watching the multi- varied people passing by.

Great park to spend time in. A beautiful green patch in the middle of the busy city. From the middle of the park standing on the bridge going over the pond/lake you can see Buckingham palace at one side and on the other you can see towards the London Eye and Horse Guards Parade as the trees part for a perfect picture. Plenty of open space to go for a picnic/ kick a ball around or just relax and enjoy the (hopefully!) good weather. Also has nice areas for kids to play on. Well worth a trip if you're in the area.

Lovely. Great to go for a stride or sit on the lawn and enjoy the day. You can also walk down Pall Mall and take some selfies by the Buck Palace. Tip: If you area a runner go early to avoid the crowds.
Best park in London in the centre of the city. If you are in London during spring time don"t miss it.Its a festival for all our senses. Flowers and water , lovely pathes and the big city a step away

Lovely walk in the park. This park is wonderful for a days outing with the newspapers if the weather holds up. so much activity and close to Buckingham Palace. One can also take a picnic and just chill with friends.
A must to visit!. If you're at Trafalgar Square, Houses of Parliament or Buckingham Palace this beautiful park is very close. You'll always remember and never regret having spent time here.
What an excellent place to stroll. Lack of bathrooms was frustrating since some were closed for renovation. But a great place to enjoy a picnic and do some people watching.
Relax. Please do yourself a favour and reserve at least 20 minutes for a walk in this wonderful London's park. Very relaxing.

Beware of Deception and Danger. The park itself is beautiful, the squirrels are not very shy of humans and the birds, ducks, swans and other wildlife are amazing. However, if you are not alert, some middle-aged women will trick you. They know exactly that the peaceful and beautiful surroundings will make you more inclined to believe anything they say. They ask you how you are, where you are from and give you flowers then aggressively ask for money saying it's childrens day even if it's not. If caught that way, better give some change as they are gypsies and are untouchables here in London. We tried questioning them as a friend was tricked into giving his £5 (he needed change to use the loo) but he got just 50p in return. Plus, we knew it wasn't children's day so I started arguing to get proper change but a crowd started forming around us and we really felt that our lives were in danger and so we let it go. It might be the only way for the gypsies to earn a living but I must admit, it is pretty scary and sad for the tourists at the same time so be careful!

a small, very well located, and beautiful park. Between Piccadilly, Buckingham Palace and Hyde Park, this is a wonderful relatively small park. The trees density is high and when you walk inside the park, you are in the shadow, or protected from the rain (that happens a lot in London!).I used to cross it both ways every day when I was living and working in London. It was a pleasure every day.

A real leisure of wandering the park. Much to visit from withing, like Buckingham Palace, Horse Guards Parade etc without needing a car. The lake is special with great backdrops, and virtually no noise except nature. More manageable than Hyde Park, and in my opinion more character

Beautiful birds in St. James's Park. This is a wonderful park. There is water, paddle boats, ducks and geese, and a wide variety of birds. Locals and visitors alike stroll or sit in this vast green area. It is a beautiful place to relax or pass through from one part of town to another. Enjoy
Family time.. Sadly only got to see this from the open top bus, but looks to be well worth a visit, plenty of family`s ect all sitting having picnics ect. Open top buses take you to gates.

Great for a picnic. A charming park in central London. Perfect for a picnic on a park bench overlooking the water and interesting waterfowl. On what was the warmest sunniest day of the year so far it was so busy we had to squeeze onto the bench with others!

Very good park. Very good park with facilities suitable for families with small children. I had a 5 year old desperate to go to toilet and found a toilet very close to Buckingham palace so averted wet clothing...

Spring-Piknick!. Went here with my boyfriend on a sunny spring-day. Full of people but still enough of space for everyone! Found a perfect place, calm and relaxing although the squirrels tried to steal our doritos..
fantastic park. love the swans on the water, the spring colours, views on the palace and the landmaks we great.....fab place to eat lunch

Lovely walk from Buckingham Palace to Westminster. Lovely park to stroll through on the hottest day of the year to date. Lots of people enjoying their lunch break, a great play area for little ones, beautiful blossom on the trees, fabulous swans, a very pleasant half an hour.

Lovely Little Park. This is a really nice little park with a little place you can get tea coffee's and snacks from. It is very peaceful, the squirrels are friendly and quite entertaining to watch! I entered the park from The Mall and was lucky enough to see The Queen, Prince Philip, Will & Kate having a police escort down The Mall just as I was entering the park.

Lovely Park. The daffodils and spring flowers were out, the sun was shining and it was lovely walking through the park.Lots of people out relaxing and it is well worth a visit to stop and watch the birds (and people) for half an hour.Worth a visit.

One of my favourite views in London. Each time I visit London I cone here, the view rom the bridge towards the city is stunning and each time looks differnt with weather and light.Plenty Wildlife from duck and duckilings to squirrels and pelicans.Lots people lunching as well as tourist. Good view to Buckingham Palace.Great place to visit and soak up the atmsphere.

Beautiful Park. Loved strolling through St. James's Park on our recent trip to London. Simply beautiful and well maintained. Very entertaining to watch the birds and other wildlife. The lake and waterfalls are lovely and relaxing.

470 years ago. St James's Park is the oldest of the London's eight Royal Parks. It's an oasis of calm in the busy city and is easily accessible from various points of interest.From our hotel on Jermyn Street (The London Cavendish) it's a short walk down Duke street to St James Square then Pall Mall then across The Mall into the glorious green of the park.From Trafalgar Square it's a short walk up The Mall or you can arrive from Horse Guards Parade, Birdcage Walk or Buckingham Palace.Whatever route you take you will enjoy the open space,the pelicans,swans and squirrels .The views from the Blue Bridge are amazing - Big Ben,the London Eye, Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards.While you are sitting taking in the tranquillity just imagine 470 years ago when this area was mainly farmland where pigs would graze. Move forward to 1536 when King Henry VIII created a deer park and built a hunting lodge that is now St James's Palace move forward to 1603 when James the First had the area landscaped and when King Charles II became King in 1660 he had the park made more "formal" In 1820 the park had the great makeover we see today. The curving lake, winding paths, the wonderful processional route of the Mall all produced by John Nash and by 1827 it was finished.Hope you enjoy your walk in the park and my little bit of a history lesson !!!

Nice and quite place. A park that kind of takes you from Trafalgar square to Buckingham palace.A very nice and quite place, you will not find many people moving around, nice place to feed some Squirrels and watch ducks crawling around in the small pond.
A good place to click some shots with a very nice view of Buckingham palace.
For bird lover. This park is famous for bird specimens including a large number of swans. Not particularly large park but very central for a pleasant stroll.
A lovely walk. A cracking, well kept park in the heart of London, well worth a wander to get away from the hustle and bustle for an hour or two if you have the weather we had when we visited.
Lovely Park.. Lovely park to just stroll through and take in it's beauty. Great views of Buckingham Palace. St James Park Lake is lovely.
Great place. Lovely place, gardens full of flower and interest, cafe excellent food but a bit slow service with the coffee

Hand Feeding the Squirrels. I have some lovely photos of squirrels taking nuts out of my hand, my little girl will loves this. A lovely park with lake, ducks and unusual breeds or ducks a huge Royal Sean The Sheep at Buck House end, time your visit to see the changing of the guards.
Beautiful Park. It was very refreshing to take a walk around St. James Park, it is a very beautiful park making the place also to be very beautiful.
Stunning. Nothing better than a walk and a chill in St James Park, watching all the people pass thro, and the beautiful sites around you..... no better place

The finest Park. I live and work in London and never tire of walking through St James Park. It may be small in comparison to others but the views are amazing and it represents London in a microcosm.If you are visiting London and are in need of a break from the crowds surrounding Buckingham Place, Whitehall or the Houses of Parliament take the two minute walk to St James Park and relax in this central London Oasis of calm and tranquility

Perfect for the long stroll. Wonderful park.Ideal for hand in hand walking around, it can be used as a small getaway if you just have time for that or a really long walk if you explore deeper into the park.

London's Loveliest Park.. Visit this park and spend time watching the wild life, feeding the very tame squirrels ( they love posing for photographs).Also watch for the water birds, Pelicans, Herons, and so many more.There is also the beautiful little house where the princesses Elizabeth and Margaret used to play as children, and the very finest view of Buckingham Palace from the bridge that crosses the lake.

Beauitful and Relaxing!. My sister lives round the corner from this park and I really enjoy coming over here to either people watch or simply chill and read a book, its lovely and quiet. Great place to bring your children in the summer to feed the ducks.The mini café is very expensive and sells stupid little sandwiches so bring your own.
A lovely prk. A great hidden gem in central London. A lovely visit on a warm summers day! It's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle and just chill for a bit :)
nice little park. this nice litte park that located in the middle of the town is very peacful, clean and pleasent. A nice place to stay in the middle of the day.

stunning park. i was lucky with weather in early Jan, it was warm sunny day. It added pleasure to walk in the park, but actually it is beautiful at any time in any weather. Piece of royal history also. Chilling atmosphere and fantastic place in the center of huge city. In good weather worth of spending couple of hours just walking or sitting there. Close to other major attractions.

the best views in London. A 'must' for every visitor to London; see the Palace, the Mall, the guards (mounted or otherwise), the bridge in the centre of this park... with the best views in London (each way from the centre of the bridge)... most surprising! Take some unsalted peanuts or other items to feed the (grey) squirrels, coots, moorhens, pigeons.
Beautiful walk. It was just lovely with the swans, squirrels, and other wildlife on the lake. With breathtaking view of the London eye in 1 direction and Buckingham palace in the other!

Wonderful respite in the middle of organized chaos. We travelled to London for Easter holiday with 2 children aged 5 and 3. Our stay was short so there was not time for milling around and truly enjoying this calming oasis. But we did stroll through it going from the Horse Guards Parade to Buckingham Palace. I truly wish we would have had more time. The kids loved the wildlife - there were so many species of waterfowl, birds, squirrels. The park is well kept, and contains the Princess Diana Memorial Walk. There is a small playground that we did not get to enjoy due to time and weather, but if we go back we will surely stay longer in the green haven in the middle of it all!
Beautiful. In Spring time, its simply beautiful. A very nice walk between the landmarks of the location. Very well kept, spotless in fact.

A relaxing unspoilt gem in the heart of London. Like so many others who work nearby I walk through the park in the morning and enjoy at lunch time ad hoc when the sun is out. The park is a relaxing spot and well worth a visit. You can either sit on the grass or if you arrive early enough utilise one of the park benches. Best to bring your own lunch with you, because the park food suppliers are so expensive, and enjoy it sitting on the benches nearest to the lake to enjoy all the sights - although be warned the local wildlife may also want to enjoy your lunch!?
The place in London!. where you feel good! if you need a breath of peace in the middle of the city that is one of the best place! also the sunset is enchanting!

Visited on the way to Buckingham palace. We cut through St James park on the walk to Buckingham palace. The park is lovely, it is clean and the atmosphere was great especially because the sun was shining. Some nice huts/shacks selling drinks and snacks. Great place to visit to escape the city, whilst still being in the centre of London.

Wonderful. A lot of walking, but what can you expect with a park that size. Not quite a much flower color, but it was the end of September when we were there and the weather was getting cooler. It is a place where you could just stroll for hours on end and just all the cares of the world disappear.
Gorgeous Park. Lovely park near Buckingham Palace. Nice to walk around with plenty of wildlife and great views of Buckingham Palace and The Mall.

Beautiful haven in midst of busy city. Green space, birds chirping, and children playing in the midst of a busy city. Take a break from sightseeing and just enjoy the manicured gardens, friendly squirrels, and elegant water fowl.

Lovely Peaceful Place to Just Wander and Enjoy!. This is a short walk from the Stafford Hotel, which we enjoy, so when time permits we like to go to the park; watch the ducks; sit on the grass or a bench; people watch; just enjoy all that surrounds you which is mostly green, at the right time of year! Spacious, never crowded, peaceful.

Kind of reminded me of Central Park. Great to get away from the noise of the city. Also, it is a very interesting walk on either side. Apparently it is a great place for a romantic rendezvous judging by the couples there.
Nice place. It is nice place, but it can be very crowdy and because some people simply does not respect any rules, it can be also unpleasant.

Most beautiful park in London!. It's in my opinion the most beautiful park in London, with nice pathways surrounded by colorful trees and plants, different animals doing whatever they feel like, and amazing sceneries for pictures. Worth a visit!
!!!!!!!. Ducks ! Swans ! Birds ! lovely walk. can rent a Barclay's bike and roam around. combine with Buckingham palace sighting. great for early morning walks. Birds don't attack :)

Walking there. The weather was nice and the walk was really good. This is a piece of silence in the middle of a beating city. Was clean and prepared and many people managed a short break to take this feeling... I like it.

A little gem. It might be the fraction of the size of Central Park. It might not have a zoo. But it has pelicans, a café, and a view of not one, or two, but three royal palaces.
A lovely place to check out of the bustle of London for a while.

A bit of Narnia in London. This place is our must go to spot every time we are in London!! the waterfowl, the gardening, the pond...It all works together to form a place of magic. Best park in London, and that says a lot!!

A good break from the hustle of the city. A very nice walking park with beautiful views throughout. There are tons of places to stop and soak in the the calm ambiance. Lots of ducks and swans for the kids to see and we even paused at a small playground area. Its right next to the busy Buckingham Palace. Take a moment to relax here in between your sightseeing.

Squirrels and nuts!. I've spent some time enjoying the sun around St. James's. It's such a beautiful and magical place. For the ones who enjoys urban wildlife, you can feed the squirrels (only things that won't harm them, please!) and they are really friendly. I wouldn't say the same about the Pelicans. But the place is wonderful. I wish I could spend every sunny day on that park.

Kids will definately enjoy Squirrels ,birds. If you are lucky then you will get nice pic with squirrels. If you are family man then make sure you will go for walk along with Kids. Its not big park but you can take walk while visiting Buckingham palace. Walk around and you will find many friendly squirrels and If you are lucky then you will get nice pic with squirrels

A quick yes. Just a really quick one to say my partner and I visited for the first time and really enjoyed walking around.Its very beautiful with lovely open spaces, trees and flowers. Nice to spend a couple of hours if you fancy getting out and are not sure what to do.
Prettiest Park in London. Prettiest Park in London. View of Buckingham Palace, Swans, Ducks, Daffodils in April are a sight to see!
The Queen's Park. Lovely well maintained park with unique wildlife not found anywhere else around the county. Although not at it's best in the wind & Rain!

Beautiful and relaxing. I always enjoy a relaxing stroll through St. James Park whenever I have some spare time. Great way to escape the rush of the big city. Lovely views of Buckingham Palace, plenty of greenery, ducks, swans, squirrels.. a lovely and peaceful place to unwind and watch the world go by.
just ok, not much there. it's very wide open, not many trees, more of a picnic area at best. I was expecting a lot more nature and was a little disappointed.

Spring forward in the park..... One spring morning in March my husband and I decided to go for a walk in St. James's Park, the oldest Royal Park in London. This lovely parkland,once a marshy watermeadow, now has lush grass, trees and flowers, including dancing daffodils, the national emblem of Wales, and a sign that spring is on its way.The park opens at 5am and shuts at midnight so there is much time to relax and enjoy its natural beauty. Deck chairs are available. There is a restaurant and refreshment stops.We walked through the peaceful park observing cheeky squirrels at play, the resident colony of pelicans and many species of ducks. We admired views of the lake, London Eye and Big Ben.We soon arrived at Buckingham Palace and the Queen Victoria monument. It was a lovely start to a beautiful day.

Squirrels Galore!. Beautiful park any time of the year. This visit we brought some monkey nuts with us especially so the kids could feed the squirrels (who are very tame...the squirrels that is!). Beautiful birds, lovely lake and very well kept gardens. A must see in London!
Beautiful!. Great park for an afternoon stroll! There is a nice view of the London Eye and other buildings. Very peaceful, would be a good place to hang out and enjoy a good book.

My favorite park in London. A visit to London would be incomplete without a stroll trough St. James Park. Good photo opportunies, beautiful flowers and lots of birds :)Tip: some of the squirrels are quite bold - be careful if opening bags etc. My sister had one hungry squirrel climbing up her leg in hopeful attempt to snatch food from her bag.

Beautiful!. Beautiful and relaxing! Flowers, flowers everywhere - even in March. A good place to sit a spell and people watch, or just take in the natural - well, maybe not so natural - beauty. London parks are kept up beautifully. Part of its charm.

Always love park, love the nature. Always love ducks/birds/squirrel feeding, always love to walk on the green and the smell of the leaves.Dont forget to bring some bread and nuts. Perhaps it is cold in the winter, but the animals still need feeding.If it is in season, you may be able to pick some chestnut home. but you might have to fight for the nuts with the squirrels.
Beautiful to walk. Nice park to walk to Buckingham Palace. You have the possibility to go to the toilet, get something to eat. Possibility to sit and relax on a bank.

Flowers in Bloom, a relief from USA cold Winter. I had the chance to walk through St. James Park that is reported to be one of the prettiest in London. Indeed, it is a delight with spring flowers in bloom, pleasant walkways and arched bridges over the ponds. It is also centrally located just south of Westminster.

Very cosy smaller park in london. We love this park you can have good stroll with the water features around you, it's not as big as some of the other parks in London but it's a special place , from here you can reach Buckingham Palace at one hand and Downing Street on the other and Trafalgar Square and Big Ben round the corner.

Must see park. At anytime you must visit this green spot in london center.
Beautiful surroundings and impressive bird life.
The squirrels make the top of it
Great park in the middle of London. Squirrels everywhere, white swans, black swans, even Indian ring neck parrots I the blossom. Great time to see the daffodils ion the lawns too.

The Best in London. The best ... in the end of winter, simply the best view. Looks like a unique painting ! Very touristic, please avoid the peak times. Very central and easy to find. The atmosphere is amaizing. Go there as many as you can !

Amazing Walk towards the Palace. This park is just simply amazing. It's full of ducks, geese, swans and daffodils. It's a great way to make your way towards the palace. Great place to reflect on your day, since it was surprisingly quiet, especially with the amount of cars that go by. This park cant be missed, especially if you are headed to the palace.

Just another city park.... It's nice that there are benches but there is nothing rich or great about this park except you can see a couple of nice buildings from it. Not a memorable park visit at all.

Peaceful. Saint James is the opposite of Hyde Park, normally crowded. The lovely lakes with the birds coming to be fed, the benches where one can sit for hours just observing people coming and going. Great to take amazing pictures

Ducks, Geese, Swans & Daffodils Greet Visitors to the Park. A beautiful stroll through the park on a cold Saturday in March. Great place to stop for a hot chocolate and coffee and wait for the changing of the guard to commence on the Mall.

Absolutely beautiful!. This is a wonderful place to walk from Parliment/Westminster Abbey down to Buckingham Palace. Sit and watch the people or the beautiful birds. I saw many wonderful swans and exotic looking ducks. Well maintained, worth the walk....
Gorgeous on a spring day. The lakes and canals are beautiful and the water fowl amazing! Pelicans! Just a really pretty place for stroll.
A lovely walk. London has many lovely parks and this one would be a great way to travel up to Buckingham Palace from the Westminster Abbey & Churchill's War Rooms area.
Squirrels!!!!!!!!. I love everything about this park. I love to use it as a relaxing shortcut through London. The squirrels are a joy to watch. The park is beautifully maintained.
Lovely. A lovely park, just in the very heart of London. Not much to propose regarding what to do. Just stroll around and relax for a while, away from the busy atmosphere of the british capital.

Nice playce. I like this park . There was many people who running , walking . There was many nice flowers . People wajking with dog , with kids.
Very nice park
Beautiful place to walk and relax. Beautiful place to walk and relax. Get a hamper from Fortnum and Mason and make it a day. A great place to walk and see and be seen.

Very pretty. Beautiful park right at Buckingham Palaces gates. Plenty of bird wildlife and squirrels and even in winter it is bursting with bright daffodils. It is busy but most of that is through traffic so you can easily find a place to sit and enjoy a picnic or just enjoy the scenery.

My favourite park in Central London. I just love this park! I walked through it this morning and it is just so beautiful, with the daffodils crocuses. The ornamental lake is beautiful too, but the wildlife make this park really special. Aside from the squirrels, there are swans (both white and black), pelicans, a wide variety of ducks (Mallards, Mandarin ducks to name but two) and geese. It is a lovely peaceful haven in the centre of London. Amazing that, hundreds of years ago, this was marshland!

A pleasant stroll to mingle with nature. Tkae a pleasant stroll around this wonderful park. The foreshore of the lake is dedicated to wildlife and a multitude of ware fowl abound. Squirrels come down from the trees seeking out titbits from the passers by. The gardens in bloom in spring are a delight to the eye and a credit to the team who constantly maintain the park. Weather permitting pack a picnic lunch. Just a stones throw from Buckingham Palace and other attractions this has to be one of the must see destonations while in London

One of the best parks I have seen. it is one of the busy parks I have seen in London. it houses the Buckingham Palace and also Queen Victoria memorial right in front of the palace. The change of Guards ceremony is also worth watching where the New Guard exchanges duty with the Old Guard. On certain periods, you can see the palace from the inside.

A really Royal park. A really beautiful space in the centre of London which will calm your soul in such a frantic capital city. Well maintained with ample seating on which to sit and admire the view of the lake or grounds. Ample refreshment venues. A walk here is not to be missed!
Beautiful.... a beautiful reprieve from the city...flower and trees were just starting to bloom. It is such a beautiful place.
Bring Snacks!. A great stroll on your way to see the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. Just be sure to bring a snack to share with the park locals.
one of the best London parks. where else can you see pelicans, hand feed squirrels and see horses on guard nearby? Nice small kids play area and kiosk, a fantastic park

Beautiful Park. Feed the squirrels some nuts, watch the pelicans and admire all the different types of birds. Its almost like a little bird aviary in the centre of London. The best way to see it is to get off at Westminster Station (go see big ben and westminster abbey) then walk the whole way through the St James Park to Buckingham Palace. Its a great little circuit.
Beautiful. Spent time enjoying the wildlife and marveling at the trees. A lovely natural break easy to find, by the Thames!

Almost Magical. As everyone else, we went to St. James Park after checking Buckingham Palace. I usually didnt like park but i do love this one. The park full with birds and squirrel, even on cold winter morning, strolling there was so enjoyable.

Simply beautiful. This park is not so big, but how beautiful! Many kinds of flowers and trees, a lot of squirrels and birds, and great views. If you go to the Palace for the side of Trafalgar Sq, go though St. James's Park. And also it is just amazing when you go there when it's empty, without tourists. If you're lucky, it is possible early in the morning or on a rainy day:)
St James Park London. What a wonderful way to spend a sunny Sunday afternoon. Buy an ice cream and sit under a tree with someone you love! One of life's free treats.

Pretty Park. We walked through the park from Buckingham Palace on our way to Big Ben, Houses of Parliament. It is a very nice area. It was chilly out, however there were still tons of people taking walks, hanging out on the green reading a book, people with their dogs. Would love to go back in spring and summer.

Breathing space in the hub and bub of London. I like this park, its stunning on a early misty morning and especially when you catch it when there are not many tourists about. almost a bit eerie but so lovely.

Nice walk and see the pelicans :). Personally much better then Hyde Park although smaller. Nice to walk round the lake and onto the bridge. A lot of birds and pelicans also. Exactly in front of Buckingham Palace, so be sure to watch the change of the guards and St James Park together.
Lovely piece of London. I have visted this area several times both early and late in the day, the park always seems a million miles away of the rush of London

Gotta go back!. We enjoyed walking through the park, although we were there just a bit early to catch the spring beauty. Although the vista of the building surrounding the park would not have been able to be seen with the foliage in bloom. Loved seeing the swans and other various wildlife as well.

Beautiful park in the city. A beautiful park which is not too large to stroll through. I started at Buckingham Palace and walked my way to Big Ben's. It was nice and peaceful, a break from the busy tourist sights of London.
beautiful place. Never met such friendly squirrels, the kids loved it! They were taking nuts from our hands. A couple of places to stop and get refreshments

Where are the pelicans?. Lovely sunny day, basking on a bench beside the lake with picnic - doesn't come much better in central London. Plenty of waterfowl, herons, swans, geese, ducks, coots, the lot but missed the pelicans.

Spring & Sunshine,. A lovely park well maintained, with plenty of bird activity, blossom and bulbs getting into bloom this spring. The Inn on The park was excellent if not cheap, but good quality. A white bread ham and cheese sandwich was £4.90 and the muffin at £3.80, they were of nice taste and the cup of tea was £2.10 refreshed my pallet. The park did not convey I was in the centre of London as it was peaceful and quite.

Tranquility. I love this park, just off the Mall and with a view of Buckingham Palace at one end and the buildings of Horse Guards Parade at the other end. It is a delightful place to rest, next to the lake and all the wildlife it contains.

Always find time for a stroll!. On a quiet day, or a busy one, we should make time to visit St. James' Park for a stroll. The amazing paths, rivers and forestry can relax the most stressed Londoner after hours of work. Observe the ducks and the people around you. They smile. They feel optimistic about life. And this is what St. James' Park makes you feel.

Such a beautifuyl place!. The park on a Sunday being that Spring was almost here was full of life! Plenty of animals, squirrels, birds, ducks, geese and swans and of course many families with their little ones all enjoying the sunshine and the trees and flowers starting to bloom...lots of daffodils, and great views of Big Ben and the London Eye in the background.

Lovely Green space. soo lovely right in the middle of chaotic London but we went on a sunny day very pretty and lots of info to catch up with...great view from the bridge straight to Buckingham Palace

Heaven in the heart of London. This park offers amazing sceneries in the heart of London. It's peaceful and relaxing despite the big number of visitors. It's a must visit park in London along with Regent's Park.

Gotta do it as a tourist. If you are a tourist visiting Central London and you are walking from Victoria Station or Buckingham Palace or even the Abbey/Parliament area, go through the park, it is lovely and a must. Though I am a confirmed bird-hater, I quite like them in this setting, even though the Eastern European people feed the pigeons too much and they are all corpulent!! But really, there is a sweet cafe to sip a latte or have a beer, watch the people and wildlife and take a 15 minute stroll around the park!!

A Piece of Royal's Gardening Art. My journey through the London’s Park continuous and on Sunday 22nd of March I marked St. James Park.First of all the day was outstanding sunny with a pleasant breeze.I have, to be honest, personally, I prefer wilder nature but, St. James Park is beautiful. It is a piece of Royal's gardening art. It is Clean, tidy, and prosperous Flora and Fauna. I was impressed by the many varieties of bird’s species. It is ideal to spend a Sunday outdoor with kids; they will find a lot of little creatures to observe and get used too.I would like to call St. James Park “Lazy Park”. Perfectly suitable for those people who would like to spend sometimes outdoor hanging around one of the many meadows doing nothing or having a Pick Nic.I will come back.
Tame squirrels and bird life. This is a great park for a stroll, and especially as it is on the way to the Embankment. Very pretty in Spring. Always good to watch the geese and look for pelicans.
Nice Walk. Nice area to walk in central London. The park is well maintained.Right by Buckingham Palace for those who might want to see how the very rich live.
Nice to stroll around and sit, watching the people.... Nice to sit, have a tea and watch people from all over the world going by. 10 mins to Buckingham Palace

Don't take the bus, walk the park. So central and such a lovely place for a wander or a picnic lunch in good weather. Check out the pelicans and amuse yourself watching the tourists photographing each other feeding fat pigeons. It is so easy to walk around London through these green spaces and helps newcomers to the city to get to grips with the geography.
Lush green. All you can seee is lush green laws and beautiful looking garden. Very huge and should be great to visit in the springs. Go there if you just want to relax and spend a good time

Beautiful place to take a stroll.. My husband and I got engaged here many years ago. It is a beautiful park with a pond and lovely flowers. It is right in front of Buckingham Palace, so you can visit both at the same time, then go on to Trafalgar Square, which is at the opposite end of the park.
Beauty of Nature. Indeed a wonderful place in the city of London. Very refreshing and cool. Such an amazing scenery in front of Buckingham Palace.

Lovely. I always walk through this park when the sun comes out.
It's really nice and with the tourists about it makes it extra special.
Beautiful Park. A really nice walk from Whitehall to Buckingham Palace. A nice mix of tourists and locals. In the spring there are many daffodils planted.

Pleasant Walk. The weather wasn't the greatest for walks in the park (in February) but that didn't seem to stop the crowds from enjoying a pleasant respite from the bustle of London. We returned a couple of times even though it slightly lengthened the distance and time to our destination.

Great place for anyone to take a stroll. Brilliant place to relax, exercice or travel through. Away from the busy streets of london it great to see such thriving wildlife of such variety. You can find a peacefull place to sit down or just take a slow stroll and clear your head. A must do if you are visiting the area.

Pleasant haven in a busy city. Visited the previous night on a West End Ghost Walk tour. Went back in daylight to see how lovely it was. It was a chilled place with people walking or lying on the grass. Plenty of wildlife to watch. Well worth a stroll through.
Very pretty, great to walk around. I really enjoyed walking around this park, it is close to famous landmarks in London such as Buckingham Palace. The park is very well kept and clean.
Beautiful during every season. We love this park! It is small enough to walk, some beautiful water areas and close to some major sites.
Feeding Ducks. Fun place to walk and feed the ducks. Excellent for all ages. Beautiful displays of flowers to enjoy or just sit and people watch.

Daffodils in bloom!. What a beautiful refuge in the heart of London. Walked through this park several times to escape the hustle and bustle. Slow down and take a deep breath. A trip to London is not complete with a stroll through this park.

A beautiful outdoor scenic space in the middle of the city. A spacious bit of tranquillity right in the heart of London. The park is a beautiful area to explore in itself, or you can walk through en route to the historical landmarks that surround it. Use the park to inter connect your historical exploration of this great city.

pelicans steal the show. beautiful park to walk through or on the edge of. crocus in purple and white, yellow daffodils. beautifully colored ducks, white and black swans. but the 4 giant pelicans stole the show. swam to the shore, walked out with great show and peacocked down the fence line for all to see. cameras were going crazy.
Take in the view from the bridge. Don't miss the extraordinary view from the bridge - face the opposite way to Buckingham Palace. A skyline that you wouldn't expect in London.
Best for lazy Sundays. Beautiful park with lakes, swans and ducks, views of Buckingham Palace... what else do you need? Get a bottle of Prosecco and lay down for a nice chat and a lovely time.

Away from the madding crowd in the heart of the sites. This peaceful park is sandiched between Whitehall / Downing Street / Cabinet War Rooms and Buckingham Palace and is the perfect place to take a moment amongst birds and squirrels. There are public toilets here, a cafe (and lots of icecream and coffee stands too when the weather is good). You can sit quietly and watch the world go by, eat lunch or even watch the Pelicans being fed!
Cool park. This park is smaller than most parks in London and has little to do other than wonder around but the main entertainment is the squirrels. Nice place, nothing exceptional

Green, lovely strolls, huge. Plenty of Squirel. Enjoyed strolling here, and to see the cute squirrels. lovely walks. although you need good shoes as some of the walks around here are long. However you will get a good workout.
nice. great place for a quiet walk and a picnic lunch. close to the palace. saw chip monks in the trees it was great.
lovely park. very nice park close to Buckingham Palace. It's a fine place to see some nature while waiting for the changing of the guard or after it. Locals love it as much as the tourists!
stunning spot. An oasis in the middle of all the sights. Wander the paths, watch the birds and squirrels, sit and watch the world go by, admire the planting, enjoy a coffee from one of the stalls.

Watch the Pelican Feeding!. Every day between 2:00 and 2:30 the keeper feeds the pelicans. Free to watch and only takes five minutes, but it's a pleasant diversion. You need to be in the area waiting, because it happens fast. It takes place at the east end of the park near Downing Street. Look for the pelicans, they will be waiting on the grass near the little park office building waiting to be fed.

squirerls!. Everybody comes here to see squirrels and to feed them, so you should consider standing in line to give your tasty present to the animals. Or you can just watch)
Oyherwise the park is very nice, beatiful view over the lake and very beatiful at the sunset
Great Park!. We just took some time to relax and walk. A great park to people watch as well. Nice place to break from the hectic pace to see everything.

NIce place to stroll around. We passed through St. James Park en route to Buckingham Palace. It was really quite pleasant. The flowers were beginning to bloom, the birds were squawking for food, the swans were in the pond and plenty of locals and tourists enjoying a beautiful day in the park.

Best of London. St. James's Park is not as large as Hyde Park but it is probably the most beautiful in London at any time of the year. Obviously Winter is the least attractive time but even then on a mild day it is wonderful. Definitely one of my top urban parks in the world and a must see for any visitor.

It's the best of the royal parks. This is a gem of tranquillity in the centre of one of the busiest cities in the world. Whatever your reason for being in London, try to have a stroll through St James's Park.
Perfect Stroll. My husband and I never visit London without a stroll through St. James Park. In every season it is a marvel.
Beautiful. One of my favorite spots in London. Relaxing. Great if you want to have a day off to put a blanket down and enjoy an easy day!

Peaceful. Lovely Park surrounded by many of London's famous landmarks, but once you are in the park its easy to forget you are in the centre of London as the peace and tranquility of the park is inspiring. You can site on the benches and watch the world go by - watch the wildlife or just relax before you go back into the hussle and bussle of London
Bird park of class. Walked in this park and looked at all the birds and all other animals. Very nice walk between the Royal Horse Guards and Buckingham palace.
A pleasant surprise. We walked through the park on the way to Primrose Hill, stopped for a coffee and really enjoyed it. Highly recommended.

Vibrant. There is a buzz in the air. Everything(and everyone) seems lively, trendy and, well 'on'. You can grab a coffee, or get a sandwich, walk around, or sit down and watch all sorts of people go by. Nice little gem if a spot in busy ole London!
A pleasant stroll. The pelicans are the star turn but there are plenty of other exoctic birds and ducks there. Made a change from walking down The Mall.

Beautiful Park. You wouldn't think it were possible to find a calm place in the centre of bustling London, but it is still possible (at the right time and in the right place) to grab a moment's peace in St James' Park.
Lots of "wildlife" too for all of you nature lovers, definitely worth a look if you are in the area.

Big park next to Whitehall. After visiting Churchill's War Rooms, we walked over to Green Park. There were some flowers peeking out from their beds, a sure sign that spring is almost here. There were two big birds, probably herons, in the middle of the pond. I am sure that the park is very pretty in warmer weather.While waiting for a cab on the fringe of the park, a short motorcade with security passed in front of us. We saw the Queen passing by in a Rolls Royce. We had heard that she was in a Whitehall building but never expected to catch a glimpse of her!

Beautiful oasis. In the centre of London, this is a delicious oasis. We were aided by gorgeous March sunshine but it is a lovely walk through from Horseguards to Buckingham Palace. It contains "Inn the Park" but we just indulged ourselves with a couple of drinks of tea and coffee from the static huts. Look out for the pelicans- not exactly native species! Lovely to see mounted police too.
great park. great park. Found a lot of squirrels and football-playing guys. Nothing special but a nice stroll especially in summer

A great place to picnic. Best in the Summer months when office workers (and visitors and tourists) take the sun, eat a snack, use the cafe or just wander around the Serpentine. Very British! Also shows how well off London is for green spaces.
A gentle stroll in the park. walking through St james park away from the hustle and bustle of town...a litlle peace quiet and colour in the heart of London....its got to be done

Beautiful park. After walking for quite a few hours, it was lovely taking a break busy London. We strolled through the park and then sat on one of the garden benches, overlooking the lake. We then had a light lunch in the cafe/restaurant in the park which was reasonable and tasty...
Beautiful!. Nice park to walk through with flowers, ducks, and birds of all sorts. If our weather had been nicer we could have had a picnic there!
Pretty Park. great outdoors park, very touristy location right by the Buckingham palace, the little lake with the swans was a gorgeous site.

the birds.... beautiful park...the birds were the best part though. SO MANY BIRDS!! also the squirrels are wonderful - fun to watch people touch and feed them. definitely worth a visit when coming to London...animal entertainment at its finest

Flowers sun and views. Obviously visitors to London go to Buckingham Palace but St James park in the spring sunshine is magnificent.The spring flowers are coming out and the pelicans are getting ready for showing themselves off. The backdrop of Horse guards and the Mall with the flags flying is spectacular and is worth a walk. The tea and coffee rooms are a good rest place and not expensive.
Lovely. We are living close to the Park and we really enjoy our daily walk, is like to be outside London in the Country side!!!

Great place for a break. This park is one of my favorite places in London as it is located right in the tourist center of the city, which allows you to go through it a few times during your ride. It is an oasis of tranquility in the center.
Fantastic. It is a very romantic and lovely place to visit, just been lucky that was a sunny and lovely day so we enjoyed so much!!!
Uber friendly. The park was exquisite, as it is filled with small animals that are just vying for your attention. The squirrels were definitely my favourites!
Lovely walk around the lake. On a nice sunny day it was a very nice stroll round the lake finishing up at the cafe for a drink with our friends.Lovely haven of nature in a crowded city
Park Tour. Excellent near the Zoo excellent tour at the morning.Is acalm place lot of peoplewith theirpets niceview, long walk.

Beautiful. St James's Park is a beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. Charming to wonder around and see the squirrels, so tame, running across the path and balancing on the railings! The duck-keepers cottage was charming and there were Albatross in the lake! Trees and lawns... beautiful..

GORGEOUS!. This park is lovely! A nice stroll through the beautiful trees on a sunny day is just the break you need from the hustle and bustle of the city. Chairs to lounge throughout, it is a quiet refuge in an otherwise chaotic place. The park is home to many ducks and squirrels (who love to be fed and will gladly accompany you on your walk to pick up scraps!), and has a great view of the city from the pond. If you need done downtime but don't feel like going back to your hotel....stop in here. You won't regret it!
Squirrels & Ducks. A wonderful place for a walk on a sunny afternoon in London. Sit on a bench and enjoy an ice cream whilst watching the ducks.
its a park. It has grass, water, squirrels, ducks, and toilets. What more do you need in a park? An art gallery? It has one of those too!
Beautiful. Can't be beaten on a lovely sunny dayWould strongly suggest the full walk Hyde, Green and St James parks
So pretty. My kids and I loved our afternoon here, feeding the ducks, eating ice cream and relaxing in our favourite city in the world

Always pleasant. Good for a coffee too. Spring flowers are out now and there is a wide variety of bird life around the pond. The squirrels are tame. There are 2 or 3 coffee stalls but we enjoyed coffee and a cake at the Inn in the Park, next to the lake and near the Horse Guards. Hard to believe noisy busy London is just round the corner.
An Oasis in central London. Its a great place to charge your batteries and get away from the busy traffic in London. I recommend having a picknick here or just relax on the lawn.

no pelicans!. Lovely to go in winter and see the circuses and staffs starting to poke through and flower. Disappointing for the kids as no pelicans to be seen. Made up for by a double drive by from the Queen though. Cute little sand play area at the palace end off birdcage walk.

Serene and great for a quick nap!. My husband and I walked the park on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Families, couples all over the greens relaxing and enjoying the gorgeous weather. Gigantic swans and ice cream shops throughout. You can rent a chair on the green, take a nice nap and be a local for the day.
Beautiful. Passed here on the way from the London eye to Buckingham palace yesterday.The amount of animals here was incredible and they're all so tame! Lovely place to sit and relax in the sun.

Beautiful royal park. A lovely way to while away an hour or so in central London. Not too far from Victoria station. Plenty of places to eat and drink. Always lots of birds dong what birds do. Great place for people watching. A handy spot to rest whilst waiting to see the changing of the guards or pre matinee performance. Take a moment to stop on the little bridge and admire the view of Buckingham Palace.

Beautiful. In September this park was beautiful. We were only walking through it to get from one place to another but we fell in love with it. There were great views of Buckingham Palace and the London Eye. The park itself is delightful.
Very peaceful. It was very pretty and close to St James palace, lovely shops on the way there and coffee shops and little local newsagents etc.

A nice green space in the chaos of London. A pretty basic park. There is a childs play area and numerous tea/coffee stands. The toilets are very clean for such a busy public area. Buckingham Palace is at one end of the park, and Trafalgar Square is just outside at the other end.A nice little park to take a stroll, or sit in in the summer.

Picturesque stroll through the Park. What a beautiful way to spend an afternoon! Strolling through the park you not only get a glimpse of the beautiful landscape in the heart of London, but you also catch a glimpse of some of the protected wildlife! The ducks and swans and squirrels were cute!

Go see the ducks, geese, coots and even pelicans. The lake me dears! Man made it may be, but it is beautiful and a complete tour takes little time but is quite exhilarating and if one needs refreshments, there is a great restaurant/bar on the Mall side of the park.Worth going just to walk and enjoy the view which is a stone's throw from Buckingham Palace.
Fun . Who doesn't like to play with the squirrels? Beautiful park, clean, with benches and shades to read your favorite book. Love it

St Jame's Park London. This is a small park in comparison to Hyde Park. When we visited it was very busy but we did find somewhere to sit - on the grass. There is a cafe to get refreshments, but I think it could do with some seats/benches for people especially if it;s been raining previously for people to get in the green space for lunch etc. Having said that it is nice to be in a green space after the somewhat busy surrounding area.

Busy but an oasis. Great place to take the weight off your feet and take in the surrounding skyline. Great Kids playground and facilities! Always important!!! Dry times, warm times take a picnic or pick something up and enjoy.

Fantastic place to relax. I like this place however if you are from Africa like be be ready sometimes to get hay fever which I did not realize is the thing itching my eyes till a British born friend who was with me told me.I was glad to attend Queens Diamond Jubilee , with gun shots, Ferries passing at the Thames River. Waaaaw I love London.

Attractive Park.. I often take the time to wander through this park when walking into the West End from Victoria Station.Terrific lake with all sorts of wildfowl and don't miss the pelicans which are usually at the Horse Guards end. Was lucky once last summer when saw one up close near to the lakeside path.There are well-looked-after flower beds with excellent seasonal displays.There's almost nothing to dislike about this park, the only negative for me being the large, ugly modern café.  Buckingham Palace and the Queen Victoria Memorial are at one end. Horse Guards Parade leading to Whitehall is at the other. The length of The Mall bounds the North side. This place couldn't be more central and is a superb place to unwind for a while during a busy day's sightseeing.
Take some bread and feed the ducks. Out little ones love the ducks and a picnic in the park. When the flowers come out take a blanket or rent a chair in one of the parks.

The best royal park. The park is beautifully landscaped, with the most fantastic views of Buckingham Palace and the Foreign Office from the bridge over the pond. Elsewhere there is open green space for lounging, paths for walking, squirrels to torment and be tormented by, waterfowl in abundance, all within easy striking distance of Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly, Victoria, Knightsbridge, and of course St James.

Beautiful Park. This was so nice to see. All the green and the wild animals around, it was such a contrast to the scenery here in California with all the lush foliage and lakes. It is so beautiful during the early morning and the fog is lifting in the winter. You can see all the behind the scenes for the different palaces and houses the royals live in as the days suppliers are coming and going before all can witness.
Lovely. Beautiful park for bird lovers. The squirrels are incredibly fun and friendly. Excellent for a break from shopping and sightseeing. Lavatories are available in the park.

Beautiful. On my way to meet a friend, I found that I was rather early and decided to take a stroll around the park. It is located off the Mall on the way down to Buckingam palace - that is the direction i was coming from.It was lovely and peaceful and the squirrels are extremely friendly so make sure to keep your food out of their reach!There were a few little food stalls and toilets located by the gate leading to the Mall.

Great place to walk. A lovely place to wander around on a nice day. It can get a bit crowded on the footpaths sometimes, but that doesn't take away from the experience. I've been here countless times over the years, and it's nice to know that right in the middle of the city you can just slip away from the concrete and see a bit of nature.it's big enough to enjoy a good walk, yet small enough so that you won't get lost. Whether you want a romantic walk; to feed the ducks; or just to enjoy a mindful wander by yourself, you can do that here. Nothing quite like watching the sunset on the bridge here.I make a point of going for a stroll here when I'm in the area.
Tranquility amid the storm. Quiet, friendly wildlife, seats, sunshine, pleasant time before the mayhem of Buck House. Better as the sun was shining and the birds were in abundance

Great alternative route. most people on the way from Trafalgar Square to Buckingham palace on the mall but please go left and walk through a lovely oasis in the centre of London.Full of ponds ducks and squirrels is great for small children,and it's quiet peaceful before arriving at the busy gates of buck palace ... Enjoy and relax

One of England's best.... This is the park of Central London. Beautiful and well kept. Nestling between Buckingham Palace and Admiralty Arch and Horse Guards Parade Its a tranquil hub of green in a rich vibrant cultural and historical London.The grass is green and the trees are strong and tall. Squirrels run around and so do the bird life in the great lake that lies in the centre with its romantic bridges.Ducks, swans and pelicans swim majestically all over and you can peek Big Ben through the trees as you walk around.Beautiful and we'll kept. A true gem of the city not to be missed.
Beautiful, even in winter. Had a stroll in the park and a coffee with my son before he got his gold d of e award at st. James' palace. It's a lovely place for a walk even in the middle of winter.

Great Place To Relax. It is a beautiful park in the center of London, its also very big so loads of space for either a long walk or a run around. Great to go with your significant other or your children. There are also many places to eat near by which are also great places!

Beautiful, peaceful. A lovely place to walk in London. At its best outside of the peak tourist season.
There is, weirdly, a wonderful collection of birds living in the park. At dusk, I have seen herons swooping over the lake, and the famous white pelicans are well worth a visit.
Super cool!. It was the first time in my life when I was in a park, which as so many wild animals in it :) brave and kind of annoying squirrels, many birds and such a romantic atmosphere :)

A lovely place. This park is my favourite in London. Not just because it is next to Buckingham Palace, so it is very clean, safe and quietly, but because here are the most tame squirrels. They are coming to the walking path and not just easy to feed them but some braver run up to peoples legs if they hear the noise of the treats bag. Each time I go there I used to buy a huge bag of mixed nuts and jangle the bag to call them. There are also lovely birds and at summertime beautiful flowers. A little treasure in the middle of London. Love it:)
Nice place for a walk. We walked from Buckingham to Westminster Abbey... nice park. Water features and trees make it a restful place.

A Great Place to Walk, or Just Sit. While it's sort of overshadowed by Green and Hyde Park, we love St. James Park. With well-tended grounds, and some unique, semi-hidden surprises (such as around the pond), it is another wonderful breath of fresh air, right in the city.

Like a Nature Preserve in the Heart of London. St. James Park is a lovely oasis away from the tourist crowds of Buckingham Palace nearby. Paths wind around a pond which attracts numerous species of ducks, geese, swans, pelicans, egrets, etc.--a birders delight! Its so amazing to see the varied species living harmoniously in the midst of London. The grounds also include a restaurant, which we did not try, but it seemed like a perfect place to relax and reflect on the parks natural beauty and its inhabitants.
Green great!. An amazing park to spend quality time, you don't even feel the time going by, also is an excellent place to skate, bike, picnic! I do recommend this park over any other.

A nice walk. Such a nice park between The Buckingham Palace and The House of Parliament. Good to make stops during busy touristic explorations. Feed the squirells or admire the pelicans. Grab a lunch and enjoy it on the grass on a warm, sunny day.

THE MOST BEAUTIFUL WALK I HAVE. trough wall st, james's park I just fell in love <3 it's was like in fairy tale, beautiful threes, birds, squirrels... omg that place is MUST SEE in london <3 love love love

Beautiful Urban Park but a bit overrun by less desirables. I was asked for money several times along here and there were several less than desirable groups of young persons who made it quite difficult to pass through the park. Still, that is part of the challenge of learning a new city and the park has a wonderful history.

Nice Enough. Nice but it was far too hot when I went. As a man in my twilight years I become very easily dehydrated. It was a long trip from North London for an eldery gentleman like myself and the bottled water prices were absurd. I was positively panting by the time I made it back to my flat

Feeding the squirrels is a must. St James's Park is a must when visiting London, on hot sunny day's there's plenty of room to sit and while away a few hours, it's very busy so those who love to people watch will be in their element, but most of all, the best reason to visit is to feed the squirrels, who will quite happily sit at your feet while you feed them nuts, my children think it's the best thing ever! Just remember to buy a bag of nuts before you visit.
Beautiful space to wander and talk.. Very conducive to spending time just wandering and thinking or talking.Ducks and wildlife good fun.Lovely hanging willows and vistas to enjoy.
Nice park. We walked thru here rather than on the busy vehicle streets while moving from one area to another. It is a nice green space within the city.

Small park, big experience.. A different experience, every time I visit, with the park connecting horse guards parade ground with Buckingham Palace, it is a great place to rest and restore. This visit was late winter, but there was still much to see and enjoy, especially the birds, ducks, swans including black swans and the amazing pelicans, such variety. Great for the whole family with a children's playground and a place to buy hot drinks and ice cream. Young children just love watching the cheeky squirrels.
strolling. Go three st.James's park see the animals and end up at the queens Buckingham palace. Where you can see the changing of the guard quite a treat to see!!

Magical place. Wonderful gaslights give a magical feel. Climb the hill: you will be amazed there is one but it is really there. The see if you can choose a favourite tree- it has to be a plane tree, nothing else counts. From the centre you can enjoy all the lights shining from Mayfair to tempt you back to indulgence.
Fine Park to relax. Ponds, fountains, trees and grass. Buckingham Palace on one end and serval places to relax and wathc the birds or the world go by.

well worth the time to stay and watch and walk. We were at this location about 8 time during our trip to London. Every time we attended it and walked about we saw different things. The events with the barracks and Buckingham nearby are a great pleasure to view. This has to be a highlite of any vacation to London.
brilliant. The park is gorgeous! Romantic, beautiful and charming. Perfect place to go with children. It has a playground with a sandpit, a lake with swans and pelicans.

too good to miss. If visiting central London and have a hour to spare, take a walk along The Mall that connects Trafalgar Square with Buckingham Palace. A 2 minute walk will bring you to St James Park with its grassland, many flowers and lake with many varieties of duck. Also look out the pelicans!!

Lovely for a stroll. Very well kept with a brilliant back drop. Lovely cafe to grab a coffee or lunch. Very close to Green Park, the Mall and Buckingham Palace. Does get very busy in the summer with tourists.
Lovely park. Always green, beautifully kept park, with geese and ducks and a few other more exotic birds too. Just over the road from Buck House which is handy for Queenie!

An oasis of green in the vast metropolis. Large secluded space right in the heart of London, yet so, so peaceful! More squirrels and ducks than people! An amazing
place.

Great place for a picnic. We spent a couple of hours here during half term, having a picnic. The youngest member of our party, 9, had a great time chasing squirrels. It's a beautiful setting, away from central London traffic. Even when it's busy, you can find a bench to rest and admire the view. The lakes are teeming with interesting birds. It's a good resting spot between Buckingham Palace and Horseguards Parade, so fits into a day seeing the royal sites perfectly.

We are so lucky to have wonderful parks. The view towards Buckingham Palace from the bridge is unrivalled, its great to see the children feeding the ducks, couples talking, office workers relaxing in their lunchtimes, and sometimes you might spot a politician taking a turn round the park. When I worked in London many years ago I used to see Mary Wilson (Harold's wife) regularly walking her dog in the morning, lovely lady, always said good morning.

One of London's open spaces - lung for this huge city. Just love the feeling of an open space where you can enjoy relatively clean air and to people watch - some of the sights you see are mind blowing

Peaceful St. Jame´s Park. Beautiful park if you want to enjoy a moment of peacefulness amidst the craziness of London ! To avoid if the day is grey and rainy as the park is huge and will not be able to find much shelter ! It is also close to Buckingham palace, so your touristy visit will be complete !
Tame birds and Squirrels WOW. A lovely oasis in the heart of London. Our Grandaughter loved feeding the birds and the squirrals jumped up on her leg to get to the nuts she was dishing out!

Small escape. This central park is situated almost next to the Buckingham Palace. Still, it's a green heaven where you can escape from the busy rhythm of the city. It's quite big so you must spare your 1 hour for a joyful stroll. Don't forget to picture squirrels and the animals in the lake.

Lovely Walk. A beautiful walk thru St James Park. Sit on the grass or hire a bench in the sun.
We enjoyed a couple of hours just walking and people watching.
Get a drink or ice cream from the vendors on site.
Lovely. Just set and enjoy the birds the flowers so beautiful ! The swans are so graceful . Great for the whole family relax and enjoy your time in London we did .

Different feeling when you visit it again. I cannot count how many time I have visited it in the past, but I never felt disappointed whatever the season and whenever time I was there. The landscape, the lake, the birds, and particularly the pelicans, which originally came from Russia over 300 years ago as the special gift to the British Royal family.
Hubby's 50th treat. Lovely city break close to all attractions in walking distance , lovely views from hotel all friendly except for one barman which spoilt our break

Fab park even on a gloomy day. this park is quite large could possibly benefit from a few more toilets scattered around in all honesty, it's immaculately kept I didn't see 1 piece of litter at all, the park would be a fab place to have a picnic on a summers day.
Strolling along. Beautiful relaxing park. Enjoyed eating an ice cream cone and sitting on a bench watching the ducks like a local.
Nice and quiet. Walked from Buckingham palace all the way through St James Park wildlife very impressive young lad enjoyed seeing all the birds

A taste of a London Park. It is as small and as big as it sound be! You see in one side Buckingham Palace and in the other London Eye.Great area for your morning 'take way' breakfast and cofee and just 5' walking time from the Palace to see the change of guards.You can take even a small "nap' under sunshine in a summer sunny day.Or even better take a basket with 'goodies' the one you love and enjoy a glass of wine among nature's great painting!
For a walk. So so wonderfull park, for a walk in the fresh air out of the traffic of the city,nice moment.. will visit it soon for raking a coffee

Calm and relaxing. I took my sandwich and apple juice and simply had a terrific piquenique seating on the - cold - grass under a great and warm sun. Amazing to have such a huge place for relaxing during lunch time in the centre of London. Have a try!

lovely park. we decided to have a little walk through the park when we visited London. there were squirrels and they seemed to enjoy being hand fed. its quite enjoyable having a short stroll through. there is also a small cafe

Royal Backyard!. One of the most beautiful places in the world. Located right next to Buckingham Palace. There are many things to do in this park...but the best part are the many animal inhabitants. A beautiful place!
loooove!. St James park made the walk from Buckingham Palace to Trafalgar Square a delightful afternoon! So fun! and the swans!!
One of the Best Parks. The park is lush green, along with that a rich collection of free water birds. An awesome site to make a pleasant day :)

The loveliest park in Central London. I have always have a soft spot for this park although it can get rather crowded. Its position is fantastic with great views of Buckingham Palace and Horseguards Parade but the planting is fantastic especially in the spring and summer at the East side of the park. The lake is also very picturesque and there are plenty of ducks to watch as well as Pelicans! THe cafe is not great and rather expensive though. In the Summer it is a great place to sit and eat a packed lunch along with many office workers.
one of my favourites. always worth a visit, beautiful nature, pretty lake, "wildlife", a lot to see and enjoy - especially the view from the bridge

Beautiful Park. St James Park is located near many of London's attractions. On a nice day the stroll through this beautiful park to visit Buckingham Palace is enjoyable. There is plenty of seating and if you want to relax for awhile you can high deck chairs. There is a small lake with a fountain in the middle. There are numerous species of birds on the grass and on the lake. There are squirrels running around, children chasing birds and people feeding the ducks. There is a great view of the London Eye from the park. The park can get very busy with tourists at different times of the day.

nice park in London. As there are a lot of parks in London,for visitors this one is the best bc you can see anything that you have expected to see in the park like nice lake, nice flowers, animals and the location is so good for tourists.

Green area with room for people. I like all green areas, ofc some are more interesting than others. But I really liked this pond with ducks in here. And extremely practical with all this benches.
It seems like its a people park where everybody are welcome, thanks !

Peace and Tranquility.... Just next to the Buckingham palace is St.James's park.What a place ....serving as a habitat to geese,swans,birds,pelicans and squirrels etc.It shows how secured the animals feel here and exhibits the love of the people of London to them.The peace and tranquility here made us to sit the whole day here.Simply fabulous and amazing place.Easily approachable through Green Park tube station.Entry is free.Children park is present in a part of the park .Lake is clean.Dont forget to bring bread and peanuts with you to feed the animals.

Hand feed the squirrels and birds. So, it's a park....... But it is exceptionally beautiful and the birds and squirrels are so tame, they are practically domesticated. Do yourself a favor and buy a bag of peanuts in the shell and feed the squirrels. They will literally climb on you to get them and it is a pretty neat experience. It is a beautiful walk to other key tourist attractions and gives you a reprieve from hustle and bustle of busy central London for a bit.

Nice walk from Buckingham to Whitehall!. Traveled through and enjoyed seeing the swans and other fowl. Nice park even on a gray day. Take a picture from the bridge....great view of the buildings in the distance.

One of my favorite places in London. Really nice place for a walk in a weekend off. Whether is a cloudy or a sunny day St. James Park won't let you down. You see squirrels and the pigeons walking around, you'll see nature that you almost forget you're in the city. A must see in London

One of my most favorite places in the world!. Squirrels! Swans! Pigeons! Nature! :) One of the most beautiful places in the world. Located right next to Buckingham Palace. There are many things to do in this park...but the best part are the many animal inhabitants. A beautiful place!

A green city. Liked the green spaces within the city of London and the lovely flowers/ gardens. Most are on the sightseeing bus routes and easy on/ off stops. A nice break from the walking and tours to find a peaceful spot!

Park oasis in the middle of London's biggest attractions. Especially during nice weather, this is a beautiful place to stroll around, enjoy nature but also be right in the middle of the bustle of London. Near Buckingham Palace, Admiralty Arch, Trafalgar, and a 15 min walk from Westminster Abbey and Parliament.

Pelicans, geese, squirrels and more. Lovely for a walk on a crisp day from Green Park tube station towards Parliament Square. Views of famous buildings, green open spaces, water, wildlife - what a way to start and finish a day in the office!

Possibly my favourite place in London. While we just did a walk through of the park while sightseeing, 2 years later it stays in my mind as a beautiful place. Lovely for seeing lots of birds yes, but I could just sit for hours and gaze at the lake and gorgeous foliage.
St. James Park. I was impressed that just around London, there is such a serene well-kept natural environment, that does give a home to many birds that are so at ease as if in the Garden of Eden.

Tranquil Moments. An Excellent Encapsulation of one of the most Stunning representations of London Parks at its best. This stunning location offers visitors a real insight into Beautiful, well tendered London Park.
