Go and feed the ducks!. Like most of the parks in London, St James's Park is a gem and free - hooray! Take your leftover toast, croissants and rolls from breakfast and feed the ducks. You can go on to visit nearby Westminster Abbey and Horseguards Parade afterwards.

Beautiful Peaceful Park. England isn't known for its animals, but you will find lots of birds as you walk through the wonderful park with water, fountains, trails and peace. We walked from Westminster Abby area to Buckingham Palace through this delightful surprise. Enjoy the gardens and trees.
Serenity in the heart of London. A pretty little park, peaceful & with lots of interesting bird life. Wonderful sitting on a seat, tucked away from the hustle bustle.

The Best of the Best. London has some of the best parks I've been to in ages - and that includes Chicago, New York, and Paris, recently. St James park was simply the nicest of all of them. No matter which side of the pond you're on, the views are phenomenal. The gardens are beautiful, the benches are in the most picturesque spots, you can be in the sun or in the shade, and the views by the shed (duck-keepers quarters, maybe? I can't remember offhand) are enough to give pause. As an added bonus, you might be able to get a squirrel to climb up your leg, so I hope you play your cards right.Keep an eye out for the rented-lounges. They're a little pricey but they're incredibly comfortable. Even more important, if you're there on a rainy day, you'll get to see the monitor/worker standing in the rain making sure no one is relaxing. It's worth a laugh.

Beautiful and Peaceful Setting. St. James Park is a beautiful park that allows you to catch your breath in the city of London. Take in one of the tree lined pathways and enjoy the many birds, ponds and park benches as you stroll through the park.

Beautiful at all times of year. At James' park is wonderful. The gardens are kept very well with impressive flowers most of the year. The lake in the middle is pretty. The views of Buckingham palace are good. I enjoy sitting in the park at lunch time or after work. It's lovely to have such a green area in Central London. Definitely worth visiting if you're in London and want some relaxation. The inn on the park is good for a drink or a bite to eat but it's expensive for snack food.

Another beautiful London Park. Breathtaking park---a close second to my favorite: Hyde Park. Londoners know how to craft a gorgeous space--landscaping is perfection. Fountains, flowers, ducks and swans---truly beautiful setting. Visit Buckingham Palace and then stroll through St James. You won't be disappointed!
amazing. an amazing place to relax and think about your life and the meaning of life. or even read or write a book.

Beautiful!. This is a beautiful park. It's the Queen's private park, so it has low fencing around the perimeter- no walking through it, but lots of swans and other birds all over the park to see from the fences. There is a beautiful fountain, sculptured bushes and beautiful flower beds.

Stunning Park. I just have to say that this was one of the prettiest parks that I have ever been to. Beautiful flower gardens and a large lake filled with every imaginable water fowl you could think of swimming around. Was a 5 minute walk to our hotel.

So Relaxing. It was a warm afternoon and my wife and I decided to walk back to our hotel in Pimlico from shopping in Oxford Street (no mean feat). We have never walked through St James Park before and it was quite an eye-opener. There is a great place to get drinks and food and sit on a deck near the lake with a cold Pinot Grigio (or two) and watch squirrels, ducks, swans etc "entertaining" us. A large number of "suits" were also there, so it is a top spot for relaxing after work and the environment was first-class. This will be a place we will visit again to chill-out and relax.

Relaxing London Park. St James`s Park is an oasis amid the hustle and bustle of London all around it. The lake with fountains makes it feel lovely and cool on a hot day. There is a little play park for young children at the Buckingham Palace end. Also a pleasant cafe near the lake

Respite in the center of London. In the summer, when London is packed with tourists, there are very few places where the crowds abate. St Name's Park is a quiet(er), green space between Westminster and Buckingham Palace. There are stands to buy a drink or ice cream, and a pond to enjoy. Stand on the bridge and see Buckinhzm Palace in one direction, and Horse Guards in the other. Be advised.. the grass if free, the deck chairs are not.
St. James's Park. One of the best parks in London. Im surprised at how well it is kept for being in the centre of London.

Lots to see in the park - including some things you may not want to. St. James' Park is a very nice, quiet, refuge in the middle of London, right beside Buckingham Palace and close to parliament and other attractions. It's a lovely place for a break and to people watch. However, sometimes those people are engaged in some strange activities - unusual choreographed dance movements, lovers who can't afford a room for a couple of hours, and those engaged in activity that can't be described or explained. However, the views of several attractions are outstanding - including very photogenic views across water from the bridge. Birds, animals, flowers, surround you. Just keep an eye open so you don't have to explain to your child "what that man is doing".
Nice to walk around!. It was nice to walk around the St. James's Park after seeing changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. The blue bridge is great to take pictures

A beautiful park. London has perhaps the best parks of any major capital city and ST James is amongst the best, wildlife and tourist mingle together with squirrels so tame they will literally steal your food - so take care, worth a visit, the cafe is OK at best but better to take a picnic

Lovely park sacrificed to modern life. This has long been our favorite park. But since the Olympics it hasn't been the same. Many sport events now take place there. The friendly squirrels have been traumatized, especially the young ones. The wonderful band concerts of the summer are a thing of the past, though it has become a popular venue for pop/rock events. I don't believe that they even put up the bandstand last year. The sports events tear up all the grass. Very sad.
Beautiful city park!. Stayed 5 minutes away and walked through the park several days. Absolutely beautiful. My son loved feeding the squirrels & pigeons.
St James Park. Close to Buckingham palace also, this park is ideal for a hot sunny day picnic.Good tube and bus connections but can get very busy at times.

Good view of London eye for photo opportunity.. Lovely gardens.Tame squirrels would feed out of your hand if food available(take some with you)On the bridge you do have a fantastic view of the london eye as the backdrop for a picture or two.Very popular being close to Buck palace and the Mall.

A Walk in the Park. This park sits in the space between Whitehall - the street where most government departments are based including the Prime Minster's house - and Buckingham Palace the Queen's official London residence. It is a lovely park with a small ribbon lake running down the middle. The lake is populated with a wide variety of birds including pelicans! The park is also full of semi-tame squirrels who will take food from you. The foot bridge over the lake in the middle of the park is the best place to take photographs from as you get great views of both Whitehall and Buckingham Palace.The park is very busy in the summer filled with both tourists and workers from the surrounding offices enjoying the sun. It is a good place to stretch the legs and enjoy the scenery.

Beautiful park with amazing views of Buckingham Palace. Beautiful park, with lovely views of Buckingham Palace. Plenty of space to sit down and relax or rest. Toilets and little cafes dotted around the park to allow you sometime to chill out. Also good photo opportunities.

Great lunch stop. On a beautiful day, this was a great place to stop and catch our breath a little, just a stones throw from the hustle and bustle of the main city sights, sitting here a while and then taking a gentle stroll through, seemed to restore the peace and calm again. Idea for sitting with some lunch - but watch out for the cheeky squirrels!

So much wildlife. This is a lovely park; a breath of fresh air in the centre of London. So much wildlife to see - our children were fascinated by the fearlessness of the squirrels and ducks. It's a great place to let your kids safely blow off some steam and even with the crowds in July, it never feels too much.
Absolutely gorgeous. Went there today with our 3 year old son. He had fun chasing and feeding squirrels. The garden is fantastic and the river follows thru the garden making it even more beautiful.

Always a good thing to do when in london. Beautiful park with lots to do around the park too.....Buckingham palace! !! Downing street!! Changing of the guards. ... also nice to just relax on the grassed areas, feed the ducks or go for a jog. Such a little get away from all hassle and bustle of the busy city.

Just another Park. This park is just another park. We found the parks in London to be just average with little wow factor. Mostly they are just grass and trees. The area near the metro station has a food kiosk and there are no chairs available to sit on except for the folding chairs for hire.
My Wife enjoys strolling her .. No matter what time of your there is enough to engage the casual walker and we visit as often as we can when in London.

Absolutely Gorgeous. LOVE this park. Tons of ducks, geese, birds, and squirrels - but none of them bother you! The landscape is immaculate and the flowers are SO beautiful. A fantastic place to chose for a walk to the palace.

Beautiful Park. Came here one morning and was fortunate to see the guards parade coming from Buckingham Palace towards the big square where they do the changing of the horse guards.The park itself is nice, and you can unwind a bit from all the walking you've done and maybe eat a sandwich or something that you bought to go.
A very beautiful Park. We walked many miles during our week long visit. This is a great place to walk, chat, take pictures, check out all the scenic views, many birds. Very clean, an so relaxing.
The best park I've ever seen. This is, by far, the best park I've ever seen in my life. The gardens are beautiful, the wild life is amazing and there are squirels!

One of our favourite ones. I would say this is one of the parks in London. There is a lot of wild ( but friendly)animals everywhere. They are really cute, the air is fresh. All in all, a good place to have some rest.

Lovely spacious park. Plenty of space well kept cottage garden went to see pelicans being fed daily at 2.30 waited ages but they were not interested in food so park person didn't feed them, difficult to explain to a 7 year old. Walk from horse guards to buckingham palace admire the gardens. Lots of ducks heron dragon flies.

Very nice park. Even in large capital city, one must be able to rest and enjoy Nature. The London parks provide green landscapes and the wilderness is also emphasized by ducks, swans and squirrels. Do not hesitate to buy some biscuits and let approach them at arm's reach.

Great for a picnic. We bought snadwiches from a nearby Pret a Manger and walked to the park for a picnic. Lots of trees and places to sit. Beautiful gardens and paths and close to the Horse Guard's Parade on one end and Buckingham Palace on the other. Allow plenty of time to walk the entire park because the gardens are worth it.

A beautiful park - a free day out. My mum and I were able to spend a few hours sitting in this park watching the world go by. There are a number of geese and ducks to be fed. Also there are swans and we we're lucky enough to watch a heron and numerous dragon flies down by the water. Good place on a sunny day with benches in the shade, but you may have to walk to find them. I would recommend that you take a picnic with you as there is a limited selection of food vendors. Also stand on the bridge and get beautiful pictures looking to Buckingham palace one way and the London eye the other.
A great spot to read and relax. A perfect park, very central and with a lovely design, around the lakes. Perfect for summer relaxing, reading and people watching!

Lovely. Nice park. If you are a runner you can do this park to Green Park to Hyde Park. What a beautiful run that would be. This park is busier than Green Park just to the north. But as parks go, you cannot beat the English parks.
Excellent. This is really the best park in London. What a great place to relax while wathcing all green and animals. Don't forget to take some pictures on the bridge where you can see the London Eye.

Lovely. We enjoyed the park and the lovely gardens. Nice view of Buckingham Palace from the park. We ate sandwiches we bought from a stand. Reasonably priced and very good. Nice way to relax and chill after a day of sight seeing.

a lovely place to relax for a bit. Love the huge trees, plenty of walkways and places to sit on the grass to watch the squirrels run around. The pigeons only get annoying if some idiot nearby feeds them. The garden beds are bright this time of year and look well maintained. Birds on the lake are interesting to watch too.Don't get tricked into thinking the deck chairs are free just because they are lying unattended on the grass. There are quite a number of free seats near the lake though.
Oasis in London. It is hard to believe such a lovely area exists in London. Many local schools use the park and on a sunny day it was a day to remember

Perfect. I stumbled upon these gardens while exploring London and fell in love with them. Every part of the gardens is different, beautiful and interesting. From the ducks and swans in the lakes, to the deck chairs on the grass, this park has it all. A lot of people were running and cycling through the park, and others were casually strolling through, lazing out on deck chairs & park benches, or sprawled out on the grass soaking up the sun. I'm sure the gardens would be just as beautiful in winter too, in a different way. It's close to main attractions like Buckingham Palace so do pop in and check it out. You won't be sorry!

The perfect walk from parliament to the Buckingham Palace. The park is the perfect route from the Parliament and the Westminster Abbey to the Buckingham Palace. Lots of people walking and sunbathing in the summer. Beautiful nature. It worths making it your walk path to the palace or simply for a nice walk with your family.

A great place to relax. St James`s park is another of the great green spaces of London, It`s fantastic for relaxing, taking photos, read a book, have a nice chat, and above all enjoy London from other view.I highly recommend it for everybody.

Gorgeous place. We spent a pleasant afternoon there. The park is a good option for a walk and it is a nice place for meditation as well. On summer it is perfect for a picnic with friends. If you stay in London for a week or more, I advice you to visit there. If you're in a tourist short trip and stay considerably far away from the park, if you intend to visit the "main" attractions in London, you should leave the park for a next visit.

Great experience!!! Beautiful gardens!!. We spent like two hours in St. James Park, walking around and watching birds, flowers and people. Was very nice time for the kids to play with doves, ducks, and squirrels. I enjoyed the trees and very well designed gardens. If you visit the park after Guard Change at Buckinham Palace, expect to have lots of people.

Nice picnic spot. In the shadow of Buckingham Palace, a stone's throw from the Churchill war rooms and, a bit further, the Parliament building, Big Ben and Westminster Abbey...more sights per square kilometer than an almost anywhere in the world. Great for families and lazy travelers like me. London, outside of ridiculous hotel prices, is just a terrific city.

Very nice for a stroll. Nice park in Westminster. It's an easy, level stroll through here between Buckingham Palace and the Thames. The lake is beautiful with colorful and amusing waterfowl, including HRH's swans.
Picknick in St. James Park, London. Bring your own food/drinks and join the plentyful who selected to enjoy their lunches/snacks in/on the green after tiring miles in the sunshine.

Lovely park for run around!. On a school trip, used the park as a picnic lunch stop and run around. Lovely spot, very well kept flower borders. The restaurant even let us fill up our water bottles. Top service

A Lovely Stroll. Beautiful park on the way to Buckingham Palace. This was a nice place to take a stroll and wind down after a busy day of sight seeing. We were able to catch the pelicans being fed. That is a sight! There are a ton of different birds to check out while wandering. We ended out stroll will a wonderful ice cream cone. Definitely worth a visit!

Great for Bird Lovers (And photographers)!. My wife and I are bird photographing enthusiasts. We didn't see many birds during our entire trip in Europe (UK/Greece/Italy), but there was a great selection here. Lots of species, with easy access. We had a 400mm lens and took some great photos, but many of the birds are nearly domesticated and will come pretty close, anything over 100mm could work. The park has a great atmosphere and if you have some time, plan a picnic here! You'll be glad you did.

Quiet respite . We enjoyed our visit to St. James park . It was a relaxing and quite lovely. It is not as large as Hyde Park but just as lovely,if not more. Grab a lunch from the many food halls throughout London and just relax and enjoy. It is a lovely escape from the all the running around of sightseeing. Go and enjoy!
Stunning. Stunning park with beautiful views. It is lovely both in the winter and warmer months. Lovely walk and well worth a visit!
Chilled and beautiful. This is one of the many beautiful parks in London and it is on the way to the Buckingham Palace, so it is easy to walk by it.

Lovely park, many birds.. Strolling through the parks of London is a delight, and St. James' Park is one of the best. It is big enough that you can stroll around for hours with new delights around each turn of the path, yet small enough that you don't feel lost or disoriented. We especially enjoyed watching the birds frolic in the water.The pigeons are very friendly, as are many of the ducks.
peaceful location. A lovely place to take an afternoon break and just sit and people watch. Packed a picnic lunch and took a break from the hustle of the city

An oasis in a concrete jungle. This park is absolutely fantastic and if you like ducks you can't miss the place. The park is a good route to walk to Buckingham palace instead of strolling along the mall.

Great park for a leisurely stroll. St James park is a very pretty park to take a relaxing stroll. It's a great size park for a nice walk. Big enough to make you feel like you're not in the middle of a major city, but not so big that it feels endless. The lake has a fountain, and a bridge with nice views. There's tons of birds and ducks, and several squirrels which have clearly been hand fed and were not scared of the people. (I was shocked at how fascinated many visitors were by the squirrels). We walked around the lake and back. The park is very well maintained and manicured. The flowers were pretty and the grass was well kept. (Hyde park was overgrown and not well kept).The park is adjacent to Buckingham Palace, so beware that when the changing of the guard ends, the park is flooded with people leaving.We also stopped at the cafeteria after our walk for a quick bite, and there was outdoor seating to sit and people watch while you enjoyed your food or drink.This was a great free and relaxing attraction to break up the hustle and bustle and expense of the rest of London.

Beautiful and Relaxing!. Strolling through St. James's Park is a great way to slow the pace of the day and relax. As one would say...."Stop and smell the flowers"....for there are plenty in the park! This park is very scenic with walkways that's meander through lush lawns and groves of gorgeous tress. The park has several large ponds or water features that brings calmness to one's day. Stand in the middle of the foot bridge and look one way to see Buckingham Palace and look the other way to see The Eye. Have a picnic lunch in the shade of a big tree or read your favorite book. Great way to spend a few hours!

Stunning. Luckily the day I went was unusually for London, a nice day! Heaps of people around and lots of local wildlife, including the ever cute squirrels. It was lovely to walk through the part knowing that I was in the middle of London! Heaps of places to sit and take in the stunning views
A beautiful place to walk and relax. London has so many parks and this was one of the nice ones. Take a day to relax and enjoy the beauty.

Nice park near to Buckingham.. In the morning on the way to Buckingam Palace, we are walking through the park, nice clean , at this time little bit early morning still not many people int park, We are in hurry to see the chancing guard parade in buckingham, so we are not spend more time there, but very nice to relax after the busies London town.
Don't Miss St. James Park. St. James Park is really beautiful and not to be missed! The location is great and it is really nice to walk around and take in the sights.

Tranquility. St. James' park is a little version of Regents park hence the lake and the island in the middle are similar. However, St. James' Park is more beautiful and has the sense of tranquility compare to other parks of London. Apart from its great location, it is also a good place to have a break from the busy streets of London. You can do any relaxing things in this park and my favourite is having a late afternoon walk where you can catch the sun setting down behind Buckingham Palace.

St. James's Park - An attractive Royal Park next to Buckingham Palace. St. James is one of the Royal Parks in London which rests directly east of Buckingham Palace. This is a 23 hectare (57 acre) park that is well worth spending some time during visits to London due to its proximity to the palace and other important and interesting attractions in the city as well as the natural beauty of the park itself. We enjoy St. James Park for the lake which splits the park in half, the lovely landscaping and manicured gardens and the birdlife which reside at St. James Lake. During the warmer months, the flower gardens which are found along the north side of the lake are very nice. We have always enjoyed walking across Blue Bridge as well, stopping at the halfway point for the lovely views from here. At the lake, you can see many species of waterfowl, including geese, swans and well as a resident colony of pelicans that can often be seen swimming the lake. Interestingly, the pelicans are supposed to be the descendants of a gift of birds giving by the Russian Ambassador back in the mid 17th century. There are several refreshment points, an Inn in the Park restaurant and plenty of park benches and grass spots for you to take a seat and enjoy your time in St. James Park, particularly during the warmer months of the year. We find the walk along the lake an enjoyable approach to Buckingham Palace, preferring it to the more direct route, The Mall, which serves as the northern boundary of St. James Park. In the end, St. James is very close to interesting and important attractions which makes it quite convenient to visit when spending time in London. It is one of the more attractive Royal Parks, which makes another good reason to spend some time here if you seeking a bit of green space in between your sightseeing efforts.

Peaceful in the heart of it all. London is the most beautiful city and its parks help make it that way. When you get tired of the hustle and bustle, just have a walk through here, but I wouldn't advise it at night.

Nice and peaceful. My trips to London always include a trip to this park. It is a peaceful oasis in the middle of this busy and noisy city. St. James's Park is beautiful at anytime of year. Kids should love the squirrels and the ducks and adults can sit in the grass and relax. There is something for everybody.

Beautiful Park, great for a stroll and to feed ducks. I came recently with my husband as it's always a lovely place for a walk, plenty to see and do.We'd brought a loaf of bread to feed the ducks and swans which was fun and some of the squirrels got in on the action too. A lovely lake, plants, gardens, fountains, deck chairs for hire and a fantastic picture opportunity on the bridge to see Buckingham Palace on one side and the London Eye on the other.Walk right up to Buckingham Palace, down the Mall and into Whitehall and you'll get a good feel of the park's vastness and beauty. Free entry also. A fab way to spend a morning or afternoon or even to have a picnic if the weather's good!

Make the best of the Royal Parks. Some fantastic reviews of the parks on the site especially St James, my advice is enjoy while you can as the contract for maintaining the parks has been awarded to a new provider at a reduction of 20 plus% so something will have to give and I suspect it will be quality
Beautiful oasis. I spent time in this park because I had to wait for my reservation time of seeing Buckingham Palace. The park was very wide and beautiful. The Lake was so nice.

Beautiful. A beautiful park to walk around - not to big and plenty of ducks, swans, squirrels to look at. Grounds are lovely and clean with gardens well maintained. Lovely walk from Buckingham Palace to Horse Guards parade

WAS LOST BUT FOUND..... In my excitement to start touring London after checking in at my hotel, I forgot to take with me my newly purchased London Map. My goal was to begin my visit by going to Buckingham Palace first.  I started asking for directions and in the process, got lost several times. During my walks and retracing my walks, I "found" St. James Park. I did not know how big it was. I kept walking and walking and felt like I was never getting out of the Park and would not be able to see the Buckingham Palace! What's good is that there are benches in the Park that I could use to rest my tired feet. During these resting periods, I met 3 female strangers who shared with me their London experiences while we were all resting at these benches. Watching the beautiful flowers from these benches is also another benefit of getting lost at St. James' Park. Lessons learned for me: Study the London map. Plan B - if lost, have fun, sit at the bench, watch the people, admire the gardens and other beautiful parts of St. James' Park.

Bring nuts for the squirrels!. A small and beautiful park right in the heart of London, very well-tended, very green and relaxing. The highlight, for us, was feeding the very friendly denizens - squirrels and all sorts of ducks and geese. We bought some nuts at a nearby store and spent half an hour just feeding the squirrels and seeing how close they would get (answer: as close as you let them, eventually...) When we had some time to kill before our return flight, we all agreed this would be a fantastic place to spend the remaining time in London. The proximity to Buckingham Palace doesn't hurt, either.

Glorious Day in the Park. I planned a day out in London with my parents (their first visit) that included walking through St James' Park on our way to The London Eye. I pre-packed a picnic lunch and we hired deck chairs and had a lovely afternoon in the park. It's a very pretty park, and just perfect for enjoying the sunshine.

Place of peace. Very nice park. Home to a variety of birds, including swans. We spent about three hours walking the park, reading the information signs and enjoying the wildlife. London is hectic. The parks offer a wonderful reprieve. People flock to the beauty in the museums and the majesty of the castles but often miss the beauty and majesty of nature in the heart of the city!

What a Lovely Spot In the Middle of London. We were doing a walking tour of London we found described online. It suggested a stroll through St James Park. This is a beautiful spot with wonderful gardens. It is quite large and is well worth taking the time to walk through. The vistas are spectacular.

Beautiful. A beautifully maintained and laid out park right in the heart of Westminster, this is a peaceful place where you can see squirrels, ducks and plenty of pigeons! There are benches to sit on and enjoy lunch and plenty of paths for walking.
Back to nature. In a big city like London, it's very important to have a peaceful place & very natural like St. Jame's park.. With its lake, fountains..

Beautiful park filled with wildlife. This park is a beautiful place to visit and take a stroll. Not only the trees and the flowers but the animals are what make it Truly special. So many different types of birds to see and so many friendly squirrels. They are all so used to people that they are very friendly. Really worth taking a walk through if you enjoy nature.

Good for a walk but not a destination. The Park is just like many in London, all worth a leisurely walk, rest relax and possibly a picnic. Its pretty, smaller than Hyde Park, doesn't have a lot to see that's different to other parks.

Grass Birds and Fountains. In the centre of London you can walk on the grass feed the ducks and other birds and look at some nice fountains and flowers. Just the job after walking around Oxford street getting sore feet.

Loved this park.. What a lovely relaxing place after the bustling crowds around Buckingham Palace. Lovely lake with lots of ducks and swans, lovely walkways. Lots of open space for children to place. The only downside is the price of refreshments on sale, so expensive. Saw the guards march from the Palace through the park which was good.

Lovely place to relax with friendly ducks and squirrels. These are lovely park grounds and a great green space in the centre of London. Plenty of spots to sit down and enjoy people watching or enjoy the wildlife. There are cafe points around the park to grab drink, waffle and ice cream.Head for the bridge in the middle for lovely pictures of the Palace in one direction and the London Eye in the other.

Peaceful park in front of Buckingham Palace. A great walk is to start at Buckingham Palace, walk down toward Horseguards Parade Ground, Trafalgar Square and the Thames. St Jame's Park is a quiet, green oasis filled with lots of animals, flowers and folks strolling about. There are cafes and restroom facilities along the park. Much nicer than being on the busy streets. Also, the location of the London Marathon finish line.
St. James Park. Even though we went in winter it was still manicured and lovely. There were beautiful flowers along the walkways and nice benches to relax on.

Nice Park. When walking through London the park is a nice stroll on the way to see Buckingham Palace. I wouldn't specifically say that it is worth making an out of the way trip to see, but it is right between several other attractions.

Great Views of Buckingham Palace. Make sure you cross over the bridge to see the beautiful view of Buckingham Palace.Can you find the pelicans in the pond? Seen them a couple of times...... Plenty of herons, swans, various ducks if not though.
Great and relaxing time. Seeing the squirrels and fowl is great entertainment for young and old.Good place for some relaxation after a busy touristic day.

Favourite spot to read on a sunny day.. This is a lovely park. It tends to be slightly less crowded than the others I've visited on a sunny day, and there are lovely benches facing the lake under weeping willow trees. If you want a nice place to read, have a picnic, or just people watch, I highly suggest this park.

Bit of fresh air right in the middle of London. Love how green and tranquil this area with its lakes is even though its situated between Buckingham Palace and Horseguards Parade Ground. I like how you can wander out of all the traffic and tourists and find a bit of space to relax and the views. I don't like having to share with so many people sometimes - bah humbug - ha ha

Pleasant place to while away an hour.. On a warm day, this is an excellent place to visit.We visited on a whistle stop visit to central London, trying to see the sites in an afternoon after spending the day at the Tower of London.It is adjacent to Downing Street, Buckingham Palace and the Mall. It was perfect as a place to rest the aching feet when walking up or down the mall.Toilets and a Cafe were available at the Westminster end of the Mall in the Park.
Splendid Park. Excellent place to spend time to enjoy nature! Fell in love with the squirrels! Take some peanuts and the squirrels will eat from your hand. Many species of birds.

Beautiful park near Buckingham Palace. We walked from Buckingham Palace through St Jame's park to Horse Guards Parade - it is beautiful and it was lovely to see people sitting around having picnics - reminds of how a park should be

Anytime of year. By far the most lovely place in London. Anytime of the year the park is immaculately kept, the wildlife so cheeky to watch, and people doing 'their thing' so interesting. The café is great and you can feel part of the ' in crowd' quite comfortably. Just walk, you will not tire of the scene and our 'second to none' heritage.

Be entertained in my top favorite London Park!. I don't even know where & how to begin to describe this wonderfully situated Royal Park. Firstly, it's close to a lot of attractions especially if you are to visit the Buckingham Palace, Horse Guards, Westminster Cathedral, Piccadilly Circus, the Embankment, etc! Just walking through St.James Park is actually entertainment enough, with the many diverse views, people & birds you come across. I love hanging around a fountain or two (they have several) because it's so relaxing & nice to just look at, and a lot of birds can be seen nearby. The lovely flowers in bloom adds to the ambience, but best of all there's this restaurant/cafe perfectly situated somewhat in the middle of the big park, They offer a lot of refreshments from juices to wines, cheeses to sandwiches & muffins to what-have you's! The BEST part...it's got an awesome view if you decide to sit outside. I really try not to miss visiting this place whenever I'm in London. It's simply so relaxing & beautiful! It's a photographer's dream even if one is just an enthusiast :))

Loved the squirrels. It was nice to have sunshine in winter...so we spent our time in St James Park. It was wonderful with all the different birds and I loved feeding the Swans and the little Squirrels. The beautiful trees and leaves with all the colourful birds was a wonderful experience.
our favorite place in London. If you were tired of all the shopping and old buildings in London, come visit here and spend a nice afternoon enjoying the breeze, animals, plants and the lakeview.

one of my favourite parks in London. St James's Park is idyllic, fantastic location, offers great variety of flowers, tress and all beautifully arranged. We enjoy a walk in this stunning garden in all seasons. Cafe offers good food too! If you visit Buckingham palace, can walk through St. James's Park to Charing Cross or China town.

Love it. One of my favorites places in London, would go there every time when travelling to London. Late spring/summer color fete is what I love.All flowers around,birds,water- feels like time has stops. Worth go for walk.

A Tourist's Respite. This is a beautiful park in the heart of London. After touring London, this is the perfect place to rest your weary body by relaxing on the grass. Friendly people enhance the ambiance of the park and give you a chance to meet some of the "locals".
Jane L.

Beautiful park in heart of London. The title and rating say it all. Beautiful green park located in the heart of London. Lawns are green and perfect for laying down to relax or picnic on a nice day. Loads of trails and paths for strolling, jogging, and people watching as well as enjoying the greenery and animals. Tons of different types of waterfowl, ducks, swans, geese, etc. Fun watching kids and seniors feeding them. Great place to visit and just relax.

A resting place for the weary tourist. This is one of the most beautiful parks in London and close to many places of interest being close to many Whitehall attractions and Buckingham Palace. There are expansive lawns, trees, flower beds, water birds and other wild life. Just the place to relax for a while.

St. James Park Is Gorgeous!. From the enormous pelicans to the littlest blue footed coots in the water, St. James Park is absolutely perfect. The view in the distance of the London Eye at one end, and of Buckingham Palace at the other, is incredible. The little restaurant serves great coffee and pastries; the gardens are sublime and full of colour, and its a perfect size for a gentle stroll. While we were there, a shower left a brilliant rainbow behind, which suddenly morphed into two, one above the other! Just a perfect little place- highly recommended.
A walk in the summer. Just a walk in summer is this park is loads of sun bathers and dog walkers in winter nothing else but snow but be carefull of roller bladers

Place for rest. After a day of visiting the monuments in London, we came to St. Petersburg. James Park. Warm weather and blue skies here elicited a family with children, students and weary tourists. In the park you can rent a deck chair, watching the pond water birds, or just relax with a book tal. Our family has set the local snacks and ice cream are well rested. The park has many statues and rare plants. I recommend everyone to relax while visiting the city.

beautiful. This is one of the parks adjacent to Buckingham Palace and opposite the Royal Horseguards. It is a busy park with plenty of distractions such as squirrels and birds. Deck chairs can be hired to allow lounging and people watching.

One of the nicest parks. St. James' Park is one of the nicest parks in London - very peaceful, colourful and scenic. I always visit the park when in London and recommend it to others. It's lovely to stroll around with friends on a sunny day!

Pleasant Park. It is a nice park to take a stroll through. There are not many monuments or colourful flowers throughout the park, but still bring your camera. There are plenty of ducks (and other type of wildlife), background monuments and scenic portions to keep you snapping pictures.

Quiet Oasis in the centre of London. As a family, we never get tired or bored of St James's Park. It is a lovely oasis in the centre of London. OK, there are still quite a few people in the park at times, but you can still find a quiet spot for yourself in the sunshine. It is well laid out and of course you get a great photo opportunity from the bridge, with Buckingham Palace in the background. Cafe is always on the busy side, but the staff do well to keep the flow of people served. Only had a coffee take out, so cannot comment on the quality of the service or food. We sat in the sun overlooking the lake for a couple of hours just watching the world go by - Great!
Feed the ducks. One of my most favorite places in this country, bring a loaf for the ducks, and make sure u have a ice cream , a real jewel in the crown
Our favorite park. There are many parks in London -- it is a very green city, but I must say that St. James park was our favorite.
Wonderful park. This was our favorite park to visit and take portrait pictures. Fantastic flowers and shrubs. Lovely backdrop especially in the Spring

A Pleasant Walk. Spent a nice time having a very relaxing walk in the sunshine. Lots of paths through the trees and along side the water. Plenty of animals and birds to see with display boards to show the different birds in the park. Very pleasant.

In the Middle of Nature right at the heart of a metropolis. I could not believe that such as huge park could exist with so many small animals like squirrels, birds of all kinds and water bodies right at the heart of London city. A great place to relax in the middle of nature and catch you breadth while exploring the city of London.

Nice Relaxing Park. Spent a couple of hours here relaxing last week and you almost forget you are in the middle of London (well apart from how crowded the park can be). Coming from Edinburgh I forgot how lucky I am that I can go to a park here and there only be a few other people, but in London it takes some getting used to as there are just people everywhere - lots of them!!Nice park though and would definitely go back next time I am in the area :-)

Nice and peacefull park. I haven't seen the hours passing by in this park ! There's a lot of animals to see, and of course, the squirrels are completely at home ! how funny it is to watch them run, pick up food ... they are also coming really close to us.. !

Worth taking an hour or so out to relax in this beautiful central London park..................... If you are visiting London and want a break from the shops, traffic and general rush of an international city, then this park is the place for you at any time of the year. Totally relaxing and exceptionally beautiful with flowers, a lake, wildlife and a mixture of locals and tourists all just enjoying taking a little step out of the city's buzz.If you live in London, then incorporating this park into your daily route to and from work is highly recommended.It's a small park so it doesn't take a long time to stroll round but on your way, you will see a wide variety of birds and at this time of year you'll see the most charming baby ducks and swans. There are squirrels scampering all over the park.The park is conveniently situated between a number of tourist attractions such as Buckingham Palace, the Mall, Horse Guards Parade, Trafalgar Square, Downing Street and Parliament Square with Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament. It is an easy walk from St James Park or Westminster tube stations.There are ice cream and drinks vendors in the park and a restaurant near to Horse Guards Parade. The public toilets are also at the Horse Guards Parade end of the park. There is a designated childrens play area near to the Buckingham Palace end of the park and a large number of seats throughout the park where you can sit and enjoy the peaceful surroundings.
Nice walk. Find out the park just walking in the city and it was wonderful! Very beautiful landscape with nice animals and a great vibe.

A nice commute. I often go through the park on the way it meetings and was lucky enough to wander through last month when the daffodils were blooming and the squirrels were scampering about. Beautiful part if London.

Gorgeous. This park is absolutely gorgeous. There are many different types of wildlife, including the famous pigeon-eating pelicans, and squirrels that are not at all afraid to run right up to you. It really is incredibly pretty. You can see different things from the park, including the London Eye. I would highly recommend strolling through, or even a picnic if the weather is nice.
A gentle place to stroll. Loved this space off the Mall, green luscious grounds, lakes and wildlife (birds, ducks). Can get crowded but find some spare ground and settle in and people watch

lovely walk. what a lovely park very clean and beauitfull flower beds nice to see the wild life round the lake and all ages of people enjoying the weather. toilet was free and clean food and ice cream was a bit pricie. nice walk to the palace if weather is good

Nice gardens, and very friendly squirrels!. Walked into this garden after visiting Westminster Abbey, and on our way to Buckingham Palace. As we don't have squirrels at home, it was great seeing several very friendly squirrels in the park!

Beautiful Park. Gorgeous grounds to tour, lovely to walk through or to sit & people watch. We had an ice cream & enjoyed gazing at Buckingham Palace after our tour. It was a nice place to rest in-between our bus hop-on-and-off spots and walking.

Beautiful park!!!. We took a stroll from Westminster abbey to Buckingham palace and walked thru the park. Beautiful Park with a pod in the middle. One should not miss this park if you are visiting London.

Worth an hour walk around. Ok. You're a tourist and have most likely checked out Buckingham palace (and perhaps the changing of the guards). Why not pass an hour at this park which is right next door and has a lovely "duck pond"? There are many interesting species of water birds to include my kids favorites, the pélicans....Note....Heed the signs and don't feed the pélicans, I tried this once about 7 years ago and they are quite aggressive at trying to get more (even when there isn't any.) Even at 6'5" I found the beaks of these 4' +birds rather intimidating and little kids that try the same may get injured (though the bite wasn't really strong or hurtful to me). The gardens are set up nicely and I have to say that it's a nice hour or so just getting away from the usual tourist traps. There is also a small restaurant next to the pond that serves the standard overpriced drinks and snakcs (should you so desire).
Beautiful & relaxing. The greenery is breath taking and the whole park is so relaxing, there so many squirrels, it's a fascinating place to capture spectacular photos.

Busy but beautiful. Take nuts for the squirrels and bread for the ducks. Visited the park a couple of days in late April and it was beautiful -especially the azaleas in full bloom at the west end of the lake.As you walk along the lake side you'll see a huge variety of ducks, geese and other wildfowl, most of them up-close as they're eager to be fed.The usual London squirrels are to be found along the paths, much to the delight of tourists from around the world. Take a bag of nuts (hazelnuts or shelled peanuts are popular) and they'll be eating from your hands.It's a great park for children, and there are plenty of small huts selling snacks, sandwiches and ice creams scattered around. Note: they don't sell nuts, so if you want to hand feed the squirrels, stock up before you get to the park.

Excellent for photos and relaxing. My favorite spot in London. These park has nice places to take photos, chill out and have a picnic. Play with the squirrels but take care of the pelicans! It is very nice to include this park in your walking between the Big Ben and the Buckingham Palace.

Perfect. We were very lucky on our trip to Londodn and had a splendid sunny and warm weather all trip long. the blossom, the pelicans, such a picturesque scene! loved it. Just wondered in the Park's pathes and enjoyed the lovely weather.

Still haven't seen those Pelicans!. A beautiful park. Lots of space to chill out and spend a quiet lunch time or afternoon. Always go with my girlfriend after a a day of shopping. Perfect sport for a picnic away from the hustle and bustle of the City. Have seen lots of mentions of Pelicans, but after a few visits i'm still yet to see them!
Beautiful Day. We had such a lovely walk around St James' Park. Amazing amount of bird life and the first squirrel I have ever seen! So adorable! Lovely on a sunny day, like we had.
Very peaceful. Just so peaceful in busy central London, ducks and squirrels running about, lovely. Sunshine, deckchairs, fab.
What a beautiful park!. A walk through this park is nice and leisurely.There were a number of joggers running through as well.The sights are wonderful, and atmosphere is very calming.

A great place for a picnic as well.. St James feels like oasis in the city. A place to walk, to relax, to enjoy the nature. It is also a very friendly place for an inexpensive lunch picnic style. If you are on a budget buy a simple lunch at Tesco express and sit on the grass and have a feast with your companions.
Lovely stroll.. A gorgeous park in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world. If the sun is shining it is the best place. Beautiful.

A beautiful walk when near Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey. St. James's Park is a beautiful walk - even on a cold rainy day. There are lots of different kinds of birds but the Queen's Eastern Great White Pelican's steal the show.

The beauty of an English park in the middle of a city. If the sun is shining and you are anywhere near Trafalgar Square/Westminster/Buckingham Palace it would be a crime not to visit the beautiful St James Park. If you have kids its a lovely place for them to take a break from pounding London pavements. Beautiful flowers, a lake with plenty of ducks, geese and swans, a small kids playground. There are places to get refreshments too but bring a picnic and sit on the grass and enjoy the promenading people! Half way along is a bridge that gives you a fantastic shot one way of Buckingham Palace, the other way Westminster with the London Eye peeking over the top. Smashing and it's free!
An oasis in the middle of the city. It's so peaceful and well designed so that runners and walkers don't keep colliding! And surprisingly quiet considering its situation

St. James park. The park has a soothing atmosphere, with lots of birds all around the squirrels are all so adorable. The park is relatively big and from the park you can get a view of Buckingham Palace. It was a beautiful experience

The smallest and the best. This is a small back between Westminster and 10 Downing Street and Buckingham Palace. Take the underground and walk through Green park towards it, or get off at Westminster and/or St James Park. There is water, flocks of birds and the very best view of Buckingham Palace through the trees for good photographs. A delightful walk for all ages, in the very centre of the City
The elegant park. Situated in a beautiful area facing the Buckingham Palace with the Green Park on the other side and changing of Guard every day.

Great park. Very beautiful park, lots of birds, some unusual, squirrels that eat from your hand and that is enough for me. There is also a lake , lots of flowers. Very beautiful to spend an afternoon or a lunch break at.
Beautiful park. The nicest park that I never saw. There is squirrels everywhere and some duck . A lot of nature in the city center. That's impressive.

A relaxing stroll. We were given directions from buckingham palace which would lead us to the Hard Rock Cafe, the park was beautiful very clean and so relaxing that we actual took a seat and rested for a while, this park also has the 'princess Diana memorial walk' which i thought was a lovely touch just being off Buckingham Palace.

Wonderful park. Waling through St James's Park is always a pleasure, but if you get the chance on a nice sunny day, hire deck chairs and enjoy the atmosphere and views. A really nice place and right in the heart of Central London. Bucking Palace and Westminster only minutes away.
Beautiful and relaxing. The flowers were in beautiful bloom even in mid-March! What a lovely park to sit, relax and enjoy the morning. A great spot to get away from the tourist noise for a few hours.

Lived in London all my life, only just visited!. Having lived in London for the past 21 years, I've never actually ventured to this part of the city other than for business. So strolling through St James's park with my partner and her family was a nice experience.There are so many birds from pelicans to pigeons and an occasional squirrel all which seem happy to be fed by hand.The family really enjoyed the trip around London especially the park and we have been told we must go on a picnic here one day.
Beautiful!. By far the most beautiful of all the parks. Lovely and peaceful - well maintained and lovely and colourful in the spring.

Special. Stumbled upon St. James's Park after walking through horse guards.
You wouldn't believe you were in the centre of a London.
Beautiful when in bloom, very peaceful after the mad crowds. Only downside not enough benches to sit and enjoy the views.

feed the pelicans!. there are giant pelicans in this park that will let you pet them! that's right...you can scratch the pelican's head while he smiles softly at you! I was in love! they will love you even more if you take them some bread to munch on!

Gorgeous. This actually was one of the highlights. We had meant to just walk through a section and ended up spending much more time there. Being spring the flowers are just beautiful and so much fun to watch the "wild life". The various ducks and bird life and the tame squirrels, oh and People watching.
Many, many photo ops available here.

Beautiful. I had gone to Westminster area twice already before I stumbled across St. James's Park on the way to Buckingham. Really beautiful, well kept park and gardens, with tons of picture opportunities of the park itself as well as of the various landmarks in the background. Doing my tourist research I hadn't really across St. James's, but would highly recommend it for a leisurely stroll in between attractions, such as Big Ben/Westminster Abbey and on the way to Buckingham. Also, I could the Changing of the Horse Guard just by chance (think it was around 11 or 11:30 on a Thursday) and found that to be pretty cool, with no huge crowds.

Always enjoyable. I always like to come here, only sometimes I wish there were more benches - on lovely summer days it can be somewhat difficult to find a place to sit. Still, it's worth a visit and a lovely place to see creatures.

Wowee. I walked through the park on my first day in London. The sky was clear and daffodils were blooming. It looked like everyone in London was sitting on the grass enjoying the spring weather. There are nice views of the Eye and other landmarks from the park. I sat on a bench a people watched for an hour and it was relaxing and beautiful.

Don't pass up a walk in the parks of London.. I live near Chicago, and this winter has been long and hard. It was a delight to walk in St James Park. The flowers were starting to bloom and the whole park is just beautiful.

Beautiful!. Right smack in the middle of London. A wonderful little getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. Great for a picnic, a peaceful walk or just a place to sit and enjoy the lush green gardens.There are a couple of nice places for photos as well.

Great photo opportunities. We walked through this park several times and always enjoyed the views. The birds and especially the pelicans are so relaxing to sit down and watch. Make sure you cross the bridge and take a picture of the water fountain and the horse palace guard building in the background. Refreshing walk to and from destinations.
Lovely!. I walked from the Horse Guards through St James's Park to Victoria Station. The parks in the middle of London are all lovely. Definitely worth an afternoon stroll.
Beautiful park in the centre of London. A perfect get-away in the middle of London. Very nice surroundings, lots of birds and many strollers.

Great place to get away from city life for a bit, in the middle of the city!. This a peaceful, absolutely beautiful park. Everything you could wish for in the middle of London. You can walk through it to Buckingham Palace but I encourage you to walk slowly, you'll enjoy it. Everything is lush.

Beautiful. What a lovely oasis in the middle of London. When we were there in March the Daffodils and Crocus were in full bloom. Unusually the sun was shining which added a great deal to the day. Stroll along the paths and there in front of you is the big house, Buckingham Palace. Fairly tale stuff. What a magnificent buidling

Perfection. Having strolled along Whitehall, crossing Trafalgar Square, going through Admiralty Arch we entered St James Park. The slash of colour in the flower beds was stunning. The muted green of the willows & cherry blossom were ethereal. The variety of bird life including Heron, Pelicans as well as Ducks & Swans was fascinating. Beautiful weather made the visit perfect.

Fantastic place to reflect on the incredibly impressive buildings surrounding this park!. So, right near by this lovely green space, you have Horse Guards Palace, Buckingham Palace, The Churchill War Rooms, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. After you've wondered around and checked out those buildings, grab some food, some cider, and then sit and enjoy the pleasant greenery that St James's Park has to offer. Brilliant!
Put A Spring in my Step!. Beautiful spring experience. Only down point is it is a busy place and currently the restaurant is closed.
Wonderful park. You should definitely take a stroll here if you are on the way to Buckingham palace, it is very charming.

The oldest royal park. Well, it is one of my favorites parks. Have been here many times in all seasons, it is beautiful in the spring with all the lovely blooms. The lake is really nice for watching the swans and ducks.
On a sunny day bring a picnic and enjoy it sitting on the grass. There are plenty people doing that.

My Favourite Park In The UK. I love this park. It is so beautiful and on a sunny day you could spend hours in here.It is located right in the middle of pretty much everything and even at night is lovely. Even if you are just heading back from Buckingham Palace it's worth cutting through. Keep and eye out for the black swan! :)There are lots of benches and some cafe's and ice cream stands that are around in the summer months. It's just perfect.

Beautiful. What a stunning location.The pond has some of the beautiful ducks I have ever seen.Plenty of benches.Will be great when the cafe opens again.Try & combine the visit with the changing of the Guards, approx 4.15pm.
Gorgeous park!. Great for the kids, very peaceful and quiet. Nice play area for children. Love it here! Highly recommend an afternoon visit.

squirrels feeding from your hands. Gorgeous central London park. Lots of wildlife in the form of birds and squirrels who will happily follow you or approach for food. They're everywhere! Very serene walk. Was too cold to sit down in February, but looking forward to long, warm days here in the summer.

Very nice. Was lovely weather so decided to come and eat lunch in here as there was a small food can in the park. I was disappointed by the food it served though. It was just plain hotdogs, no onions no cheese no nothing. They served the hotdog to me cold and it tasted disgusting. The park was let down by the other flowing rubbish bins.
Once a life time place during spring specially. The flowers growing wildly and the ducks beautiful place in the middle of the city. A must see when in London.

A beautiful Park in Central London. I first went to St James's Park when I went to a Buckingham Palace Garden Party to Celebrate the National Trust Centenary when I was the Custodian of playwright George Bernard Shaw's home Shaw's Corner. It was a beautiful summers day & afterwords fancied a walk & St James's Park is right opposite the Palace. This was a perfect ending to an unusual & perfect day. The park holds a lot of history from our Kings & Queens & some rather naughty things happened here in the past, but it was all fun & the gardens are beautiful with a peaceful atmosphere. I have been time & again to this delightful park. Outstanding to say it is in the centre of noisy London.

One of my favourite parks. St. James' Park is a small London park near to Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey/Parliament. There's always birds to see and feed and beautiful flowers. There's some nice views of Buckingham Palace on the bridge in the middle of the lake. There's plenty of kiosks for refreshments here. Historically, a couple of ladies used to bring a cow to the park and people could get fresh milk from it.

Fantastic for people watching!. A beautiful park, with plenty to see. It was amusing to watch the tourists taking photos of squirrels! There are plenty of snack bars selling food that is not too expensive. It is an easy walk around the park, with Buckingham Palace at one end and Horse Guards at the other.

Lovely. The park is nice and clean. You can see the Buckhingham Palace in the background and if you are lucky enough to get a sunny day, you will see squirrels, swans and ducks. The coffee shop in the center is not bad, but the outside is not clean, lot of bird dirt, so nothing special.

Relaxing nice walk. Went here with my boyfriend to walk through to see Buckingham palace. We live in the new forest but going to a park like this in London was lovely loved seeing all the ducks, pelicans and the squirrels come so close to you. So relaxing would be good to take a picnic down there

Ever so crowded. You can easily spend a nice summers day here in the park. It has a lot of space however it can be very very crowded in the summer with the school holidays. They have food and the lake is nice. The central location means that the horse guards parade isn't far off. Good place for a picnic in the summer.
nice break from the city. it is a nice peaceful break from the city on the walk to Buckingham palace from green park i would recommend.

A good park but lake could do with some better management. A lovely green oasis in a busy London. The flower beds and trees are usualy worth a visit at any time of the year. The wonderful London plain trees are a joy. My only criticism is the lake that copuld do with some rubbish clearing at times, yes I know it is not the park keepers fault but we do live in England where dropping litter appears to be the done thing. The other point about the lake is the management of the bird life, the large collection of ducks and geese appear to be superceded by the ever increasing coot population.
Animals. This park has many animals and you can be with it closely. It's a good place to let your kid enjoy with animals.

Pretty park. Just across from Buckingham palace or opposite end Churchill's war rooms. Take a stroll. Lovely grassy area, and lots of birds. Also it's FREE! Nice large trees, benches and a nice place to rest tired feet.

Lovely in the rain. I walked across St James's Park today in the rain. In the distance, I could hear the band playing during the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. Even though the weather was bad and it is February, the park had a lot of visitors, especially on the bridge across the lake. It was a delightful experience.It was warm for the time of year and there were a lot of gulls, refugees from the stormy seas. There were also a lot of ducks and geese, especially a group of 10 greylag geese. It was a magical experience. The daffodils and snowdrops were out.London is very fortunate to have such lovely parks
Even on a rainy day it's still beautiful. A true must see of London no matter how short your stay. Sunny or not, the park will always bring a smile to your face
The best park in central London. This park is the one I liked the most in London, you wake through the park by the lakes and finish your walk next to Buckingham Palace.

Must see. One of the best park I've ever seen, clean, cozy, romantic, very beautiful. Fearless squirrels, different almost tame bird, lakes and fontains, flowers, branchy trees all this makes Park unforgettable. It's a real jewel and I understand why Prince Charles' Family likes spending time here. Beautiful at any weather.Not small so consider the time to get enough of it.

Amazing spot ... In my opinion St James Park is a wonderful place to go for a walk any time.. it's a "hidden" gem of the city because it combines a view of Big Ben, London Eye and Buckingham Palace !!!! Squirrels, ducks, dogs, ravers .. yeah it has such a "wildlife" .. For me it's a perfect little escape in London !!!

Big surprise to see so much wild bird life. Had a lovely walk through the park from Horseguards back towards Green Park and really enjoyed the very wide variety of wild birds/ducks etc using the small lake - there is even a pelican!!

A quiet place amid the bustle. This used to be a park I walked across getting from A - B in London but on this occasion it was a moment of quiet after a tour of old haunts. It was a cold rainy grey wintry day and I had visited every I wanted to. Heading back to the hotel I decided to go via St James' Park. As ever the wonderful array of water birds were visible and the usual tourists were filming pelicans and grey squirrels. I found a kiosk selling coffee at a very reasonable price and they made life so much easier by putting the sugar in for me.The surfaces of the paths were reasonably smooth which my bones appreciated after the bumpy ride my mobility scooter and I had had round some parts of London!It was lovely to sit watching the birds, sipping an excellent cappuchino, listening to a peel of bells in the rain!
An oasis. Close to Buckingham palace. Stroll around this lovely peaceful park. Beautiful in spring. Pretty birds.. Some I did not recognise.Have an ice cream and enjoy London at its best

The most famous Royal Park. It's absolutely beautiful! It so green and lush with a huge variety of colorful flowers. St. James Park is particularly showy in the spring time. It's a great place to walk through (or walk around) on your way to Buckingham Palace. The lake is truly a great place to photograph all types of birds. Go early so that you can spend some time taking in the scenery near the lake. Then you can watch the changing of the guard once you get to the palace. We happened to be at the park during one of the rehearsals for the annual Trooping of the Colour ceremony. I'm not sure if our guide planned it that way, but it ended up being a total surprise for us. It was a very memorable visit.

Excellent must see park in London. This was my favorite park in London! It is just so beautiful and fit for the royal family. There is wonderful pond with so many different types of birds. There are plenty of places to stop feed the birds or the very tame squirrels or pick yourself something up to eat or drink. The park is busy but not to busy to feel like there are too many people around. If you need some peace and quiet or need a place to get outside and just breath Check this place out!

Photogenic, so much to see. Wander across Green Park and you will come to St James Park. Surrounded by beautiful architecture, birds in the lake, fountains etc, abutting Buckingham Palace and five minutes from Trafalgar Square -this park has everything. Great for photographers ..... Highly recommend over say Hyde Park

Amazing park. A great park to view all sorts of birds, and squirrels! Oh, and there is the occasional fox to spot.Might be full of tourists though so you have to go there during the week to enjoy it the most

Best park in Britain, loved it since I was a boy. I used to go there every weekend and have a pic-nic there with my grandad and I still miss those times, its peaceful, beautiful, there's always activity amidst the hustle of London, Within a few minutes walk of Buckingham Palace and the guards. In my opinion the most peaceful place in London with its large main lake and greenery.
nice park. nice park, good for a walk on a nice day on the way to or from buckingham pallace, close to hyde park
oldest park. oldest royal park in london. free to enter. a large lake that is a wildlife sanctuary for ducks, geese, swans and even pelicans. good to spend 1-2 hours in open air.

Oasis in the City. The park can be described nothing more than peaceful, the opposite of most of London. Unlike Hyde Park it is more of a family park in my eyes, great for children. The park is perfect on a warm summer day, popular with bird watchers and runners. A great place to take a break from the constant buzz of London. If you're staying in London then a walk around the park in the morning is a must.

wonderful. very calm and tranquil.
great for strolling, enjoying the nature especially in the summer.
there are ducks, and some other kinds of birds to be fed (can bring some bread for them).
and even some of the squirrels seem friendly and not scared to be fed by human.
Beautiful. Stunning park, manicured gardens, epitomises British gardens and finery, brass band playing, deck chairs, ducks to be fed, just wonderful on a summers day

There's something quite tranquil about this park. Lovely walk through the park from Horse Guards to buckingham Palace. Wildlife, particulary birds were a lovely suprise. It broke up a hard day walking London. I would recommend as it helps you, for five minutes at least, forget that you are in London.

nice quiet park leading to the Buckingham Palace. If you are at Trafalgar Square, it is recommended to walk through the Admiralty Arch into the Mall which leads to St. James Park on the left. This park offers a great view of the Buckingham Palace at one of the bridges and a view of the London Eye from another bridge. It is a quiet park for a stroll where the ponds are full of different waterfowl at Duck Island. A definite nice park to walk through on a Sat./Sunday morning while in London.
Very Nice park. Very Nice walk watching the pelican, ducks and others image-onderzoek did like THE chairs in THE lawn
Loved it. Great park and my son loved the squirrels, ducks and birds. Unfortunately it was really cold so couldn't stay long.A must visit.

The Queen's front garden.... This is a really old Royal park, with a beautiful lake, lots of wildlife and nice deck chairs for hire in the summer.You might be lucky and see a Royal or two on their morning jog, but it's still a nice place to be, even amongst the lesser mortals who frequent this lovely green space. There are swans here, but they all belong to HM, so hands off!!!

An ideal place for relaxation after the Visit to Buckingham Palace. After visiting the Buckingham Palace or after witnessing the Change of Guards parade at Buckingham Palace, one needs a place or park to relax for a while and that is where the St.James parks is very useful for the Tourists, the park, being very close to the Palace.. It has all the requisite facilities for this purpose with some snack shops, restrooms, a vast lawn and a small canal with some swans and other birds to entertain you when you sit and relax. I will not call this as a great park after seeing many great parks in London but still it very useful for the purpose as I had mentioned in the beginning itself.

Pleasant Park. This royal park is located along Buckingham Palace. It is very pleasant to walk in the middle of squirrels. These are used for walking and do not hesitate to come and eat out of your hand. You will find plans for the park each crossroads, which is quite convenient for you to locate in this large park. The center of the park is free and clean toilets. This park is a green bubble in this beautiful city. This park is perfectly maintained. There is an artificial lake, which looks very beautiful. It is very nice, quiet and a great place to get some rest or calm.

Beautiful St James's Park. Beautiful park in the heart of the hustle and bustle that is London. The perfect place to unwind after a long day sightseeing or a busy day. Pretty little squirrels run all around the park and are really friendly with people, especially if they've brought nuts to feed them. A lovely lake snakes through the park with lots of ducks and swans. One of the prettiest places in London.

Great park - go & see the wild life. We were lucky enough to be here during the coronation in June 2013. The park was extremely busy but still easy to get around with great views.Plenty of space to sit and relax. The squirrels are funny to watch & they come up very close to you. One was trying to climb on me.The location of the park is great with plenty of other attractions to see nearby.Lovely park & well recommended

Relax, unwind or take a short-cut.. This is a lovely park. It's one of the 'Royal Parks' and as such enjoys (in my opinion) a slightly higher level of maintenance. It's a large park but can be made to feel quite small in the summer months with the high number of visitors who like to enjoy its merits, space to sit down and relax can be difficult to locate at times. Why would people want to visit you may wonder. The location of the park itself is perfect. Just yards away are Trafalgar Square, Whitehall, Downing Street, Horseguards Parade, The Mall and of course Buckingham Palace. The park has a variety of resident birds (including Pelicans) and wildlife which are quite tame but not overly so. All in all it's an ideal resting spot on your tourist trail, whichever way you're heading.

One of my favorite parks in London. One of the great things about London is that you always have a great park to escape to once you need a time out from the busy streets. St. James's Park is ideally located between the Big Ben and Buckingham Palace, so you are very likely to walk through it at one stage of your visit. It truly is a great place to relax, have a snack or a picnic, sit on one of the wooden benches and observe the ducks and geese (and pelicans, if you are lucky!), take some great nature shots... Make sure you go over the Blue Bridge for some fantastic views of the Buckingham Palace and the London Eye. It is definitely worth a visit!

Walk for miles. An amazing park, a green area oasis in the centre of the Capital. So many areas to walk. I spent a good hour just walking around. Even had 2 pigeons land on my arm which was interesting. I think they thought I had food. The area is ideal to relax, enjoy a walk or read a book. I will certainly revisit as the grounds are well kept and enjoyable to visit.

Anytime. A superb peaceful, quiet area, where squirrels literally crawl on you, geese delicately bite you to make you aware that they want some food: it is another world where the current problems and worries seem to fade away.Beautiful landscapes, well kept park.

All mads for the squirrels!. Really wonderful park, it's plenty of wild lifeYou can see a lot of different animal it's a fantastic park where can you have your own amusement with friends and, just get a lovely moment with your partner!Swan, goose, squirrels, And everything else it's so cool see them running here and there! Amazing landscapes and a peaceful please where you can focus on your own thoughts :3.

An oasis. By far my favourite park in London (and I have done them all). Relatively small but you can still get away from the hustle and bustle so close by. An easy walk from Victoria or Trafalgar Square. It has the most beautiful lake and the views are amazing - excellent for tourist photo opportunities. It is really hard to believe you are so close to Buckingham Palace, Pall Mall and No 10 when you are sitting on a bench enjoying nature!! Wonderful anytime of the year.

A pleasant well kept park. St James' park is a quiet area within a few minutes of Buckingham palace, it is the oldest royal park in London and has been shaped by kings! There are informative signs around the park describing its history and surprisingly on the lake one can find not only the usual waterbirds but also a group of pelicans. There are refreshment stands as well as a licensed restaurant that also serves takeaway snacks. I was there early morning and found it to be a peaceful, tranquil place for a pleasant stroll.

Relaxing. We strolled through this park on a sunny, warm afternoon as we waited for the changing of the Buckingham guards. We didn't know about this park before we happened upon it and were happy to have found such a relaxing, pretty location.

Beautiful bontanical garden & lake with marked flora specimens. Another nice surprise and right across the street from the Horse Guard parade grounds and Cavalry Museum! This was my favorite park in all of London, so unexpected, and free. Many of the plant specimens are marked here in this well landscaped park. Plenty of benches for relaxing while looking at the lake and many species of waterfowl as well. There is a lovely informal cafe on the grounds to have a bite and sit. Take a well traveled path which is a short cut to get to Buckingham Palace and what lovely scenery to behold along the way.
St. James's Park. Just beside the Buckingham Palace amazing place with awesome birds and ducks to see.Nice quite and calm place to be.

Beautiful Park Close to Buckingham Palace. This Park is off to the side of Buckingham Palace so certainly take a nice stroll through there. It is free and the children enjoyed it. They got so excited over the squirrels and ducks and other birds. It is a short stroll from the Eye of London and Houses of Parliament.

Relaxing. St James's Park is a nice alternative to walking along The Mall. There are a number of interesting photography opportunities of different vistas towards Buckingham Palace and the London Eye from the park. An unusual find in the park were a number of Pelicans on the lake. Plenty of open green space to relax and chill.
Like a second home. I go near enought every working say for a walk through the park its amazing and so peaceful and nice. Many people flock to hyde park but st james is just as nice

Pleasnt place to relax.. This park is a great place to relax and take time out while sightseeing in London. You would hardly think that you are in the heart of London as you sit on the grass etc and watch a cheeky squirrel scamper around. The garden beds are usually full of flowers etc. Very central to Buckingham Palace, the Queens Mews , War Cabinet Rooms, Whitehall and Horseguards.

Great location. What a great location for a nice relaxing walk. so clean and full of people walking around relaxing. Nice area to sit in the grass and watch the world go by. You also have St James Palace if you to visit something nice. Have a nice Hot choc and walk around.

fabulous relaxing place. Great place to walk around and crossing a nice bridge in between viewing the nice lake and the birds. Many seats around facing the lake to it in front of the it and watching the people feeding birds and enjoying their time. Toilets available and snacks kiosk nerby. We tooked our hot chocolate and sit in front of the lake, it was wonerful!
Free & perfect!. Highly recommend walking through the park and if you have time sit down and enjoy a cup of tea of coffee!

Just sit down on a bench in the sun and enjoy. What more is there to say? Added to the multiple faces of London there is the luxury of having a substantial amount of enjoyable large and small parks. These parks can't be given over to office block developers, thank God, because most of the major parks are owned by the Royal Family. St. James's park is situated between Buckingham Palace and Whitehall. One of the nice features of this park is the large elongated water area, where many species of fowl, water birds, etc live. The path along this water area is studded with wooden benches, where you can relax, watch the birds, watch the tourists, eat a sandwich and generally have an enjoyable time, even more when the weather is clement. Furthermore, some years ago an eatery was built in the park, called appropriately "Inn the Park", which pride itself on the environmental rapport of the eatery with the surroundings. Apart from having good bathroom facilities, in my personal view this eatery is overpriced and uninviting. When you start at the Buckingham Palace end you emerge from the park probably at the back of the Horse Guard Parade.
Lovely park. Another lovely london park. Visit buckingham palace first and then walk through st james park on way to see queens guard horses. Use park for a rest stop and enjoy all the wildlife.
