Lovely place!. We went to St. James's park with our two little ones. It was beautiful! We enjoyed seeing so many animals up close and personal. We brought peanuts to feed the squirrels and ALL the animals wanted some! Pigeons, squirrels, crows, geese, etc. We enjoyed it so much the first time we came back.

Gorgeous. This park is beautiful. We saw swans and ducks, birds, squirrels, and lots of nice people strolling their dogs. There are tons of great photo opportunities as well, with a view of Buckingham Palace and Big Ben. The weather was fantastic, as well. So enjoyable!

A relaxing stop right in the middle of Westminster bustle. One of the most obvious landmarks in London, St. James's Park is an excellent stop to spend some time away from the hustle and bustle of Westminster. It is ideal if you want to relax before or between you visits, for example, of Clarence House or Churchill's War Rooms.

Superb for squirrel lovers!. I visited this park yesterday after university and I was impressed with the vast number of squirrels there. Although I didn't have any nuts on me to feed them with, I tempted them with pieces of leftover pear but some pesky pigeons ate those bits of pear! The park also has a lovely lake with a bridge over it and a decent view of Buckingham Palace. If you love squirrels and want to unwind after a busy day, this park is for you. 5/5.

Beautiful and relaxing!. I was in the city with a group and we were brought through the park with a tour guide and I absolutely loved it here! There was so many squirrels who come right up to you looking for food. It was such a change from the US where the usually run away from you. There are also many opportunities to take in scenic views of water and beautiful trees. Looking back at my pictures from here, I can't get enough of the beauty that lies in the park. Definitely recommend strolling through if you have the chance.
Squirrels ate from my hand. brilliant park, squirrels even ate from my hands, surprisingly you will also see ambassador pelicans given to the queen from Russia

Lovely place. I visited here a few times and really enjoyed the walk. At one point I met a man who was telling me about the birds and ducks and showed me where some babies were. He was so lovely. I love this place.

Wow! Lovely!. Took my daughter for a walk here after we went to buckingham palace. Beautiful park in the middle of the busiest city I have ever visited. Lovely birds and wow, the squirrels came so close to us! Would recommend this to anyone of any age, for a break from the madness
Beautiful. We went for a walk through st James park. It is a beautiful park with lots of birds squirrels. The park also has some beautiful views. A must when you go to see Buckingham palace.
full of wild life. A pleasant break from the hustle and bustle. Quite a few places to grab coffees and snacks and free toilets!!Semi tame squirrels abound as do geese and swans.

Pleasant walk with surprising company!. We decided to walk from Buckingham palace to Whitehall and were so pleased we did as we wandered through St James Park late in the afternoon. At that time it wasn't crowded and the wild life was abundant. Being Australian were were very taken by the squirrels that were asking people for nuts by sitting up on their back legs and staring at you. An older man was feeding them and indicated that he had bed for over 20 years. He shared the nuts so the kids could join in. There were many birds on the water and it was an extremely peaceful interlude to the busy London buzz surrounding the park.
Nice park in the centre of London. Lovely park but always gets very busy in the afternoons. Lots of waterfowl walking around and lots of tourists taking pictures of them.

Lovely walks. I spent a few enjoyable morning walking around the park when I was in London. So lovely! Also enjoyed sitting quietly by the lake watching the ducks and people walking by. Highly recommended to those who love vast and well-kept gardens.

Peace & Tranquility. What a beautiful place to retreat to in a busy city, where squirrels abound & even approach you.The garden beds are so rich in diversity & the lake & vistas are stupendous.Would have liked to have spent some more time there it was sooo relaxing.Have a lot of photo's to jog the memory.

St James Park. Lovely park and so central to everything. The palace view and the walks are so English.Watched the Queens jubilee last year and picnicked on the grass next to the lake whilst listening to and watching all the great acts perform. We stayed at St Ermin's hotel just off the park and everything was fantastic. Go to the park next time your in the city. You will not be disappointed.

Love this park. I absolutely love this park for it's central location and stress less feeling. Always when visiting London I want to have a little walk around here. Too bad they don't have any lightning at evenings, and some points of the park get very dark, though not scary.

So lovely!. I have visited this park a few times during my stay. In the mornings it is a quiet oasis of calm. On weekends there are more visitors but never feels crowded. There are gorgeous views across the lake to Buckingham Palace, Horse Guard Palace and the London Eye. The waterfowl are numerous - including pelicans, geese and swans. My family (with 2 boys aged 8 and 10) enjoyed walking along the Princess Diana Memorial walk - and particularly loved the numerous squirrels around. There is a very nice café which serves decent food and OK coffee. Recommended for a break from the hustle and bustle of London.

Amazing. Never seen such an incredible green area in a main capital city. You should also head for the hyde park, which is huge. St. James's Park is known for a colorful, active and very special atmosphere

Beautiful park. A serene getaway from busy London.. I was able to enjoy this park on our last day in London. My younger daughter and I took a walk through this park on our way to Buckingham to get some pictures before leaving London. The Duck Island Cottage was beautiful, and the gardens were worth getting up early.

Love this park, but avoid the food kiosks.. St James Park is tranquil, lush, and green. Located a short walk from Buckingham Palace, it offers a peaceful setting in a very crowded and bustling area. There are several food kiosks located within the confines of this park. They all appear to be very clean. However, on more than one occasion we observed rats scampering from underneath the buildings and make their way into nearby trash cans. This is certainly concerning to us as we had eaten from these kiosks several times during our stay in London. We also observed a rat chasing a squirrel in broad daylight. Perhaps metal tarshcans with lids may help to curtail the rat's nightly excursions in search of food.

Idyllic green oasis in central London. I planned to walk through St James's Park in the process of getting from A to B, but very soon I had stopped and I began to appreciate the park as a destination in itself. I spent a long time by the lake and the old cottages just watching the wildlife, watching the people, chilling and soaking up the relaxed atmosphere. Wonderful!

Feed the squirrels!. Went for the first time yesterday and what can I say such a pretty park. It has a little playground for kids and plenty of greenery for them to run around on. Lovely for couples, family's anyone really! Top tip!!! No it's naughty take some nuts for the squirrels and watch them come up and eat out of your hand.

if the weather is good. if the weather allows it ,worths a walk in this park. in the heart of the town and you feel like countryside.Liked it a lot,the palace is close so you can combine the change of the guardians.
Fantastic! . Squirrels are plentiful in this park and it is a wonderful experience to stroll through the green land. This is a definite five stars!

Nice stroll after visit to Buckingham Palace. We took a walk on a sunny day just after visiting Buckingham Palace. Nice, green park, very popular among locals and tourists. Many birds. Good place for a lazy stop during London sightseeing.

Squirrels!. For those used to seeing them, I know squirrels have as much appeal as pigeons or seagulls!But for a "first-timer", it was lovely to see these little creatures right up close. One in particular was very tame and approached us on the path, looking for food which, unfortunately, we didn't have :-(.The park itself looked gorgeous in the beautiful early autumn weather. It is a beautiful place to stroll, picnic or just admire en route to other attractions in the area.

lovely central London park. spent time walking through St James park while touring the city on foot, it is very picturesque with ponds, fountains & various birds including pelicans. Such a lovely park to walk through on your way to or from Buckingham Palace

One of the lovely London parks with a pelican. Not as big as, say, Regent's Park, but lovely nonetheless. Stretching along the Mall and towards Horse Guards Parade and the back of Whitehall, it is a great oasis in the hub of things. The flowers and lakes are well kept. We took our Granddaughter this summer as she loves a jaunt to London and as we walked through there was a pelican standing on one of the benches. Quite a crowd gathered but he wasn't moving for anyone!! I took a photo. I knew there were pelicans in the park, but in all the times I had visited, had never seen one.
Lovely place to walk around. Very nice park with number of gardens. Just perfect for relax. Whether you are looking for a place to rest for a while or have a picnic, you will find it here.

Best park in Central London. Smaller than Green Park or Hyde Park, but oh so much more interesting. Gentle, restful and with the lake that is famous for its birds. It is simply a joy, and the lavatories are clean, too! If we need a rest in the middle of a hectic day in London, this is the place for us.

Lovely park in central London. St James’s Park, in the City of Westminster, is the oldest of the Royal Parks of London. Very central, it is located near Buckingham Palace & the Horse Guards. The closest underground station is St James’s Park but you’re also not far from Westminster.Of all Royal Parks it is one of the smallest in size, but don’t miss out as it is also one of the loveliest. It has a lake, two islands and a resident colony of pelicans. The views from the Blue Bridge are truly beautiful, especially when the sky is blue or when the sun sets in between trees.Since a picture is worth a thousand words, you can check out lots of pictures there :http://cappuccinofields.com/2013/09/23/london-parks-st-jamess-park/

Great views. It's easy to get distracted by what is so close by, such as the wildlife all around you, but if you take the time to stop on the bridges across the lake, and look towards Buckingham Palace or back towards Horse Guards, you will see some of the best views of these locations.

A Beautiful Park.. It's at least 2 minutes walk from St James's Park Tube Station. If you're coming here, be sure to bring a camera and spend at least 30 minutes to appreciate the beautiful park. Children especially will very much enjoy it here. There are squirrels, ducks, pelicans and other kinds of birds in the park . No eagles or ostriches though, in case you're wondering :)It's a park, I can't say much about it, but you have to go there to see why everyone goes there. If you fancy sunbathing, doable. Maybe not in winter or late autumn I guess?Many other must-go places in London is walkable from here like Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square and Leicester Square. So if you're travelling by public transport, worry not about how to get to these other places, just get a map and buy comfortable walking shoes.

An oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of London. On one of our days in London, we set out one day to see all the sights. It just so happens most of those sights are all within close vicinity of one another. Eye, Big Ben, House of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, etc. With all the tourists and locals around it was what I would assume a typical busy London day. On the way to one of our destinations, the route led us through here: St. James Park. Despite being in the middle of the busy London areas it was relatively quiet. It was very clean and very green. The park definitely looked well maintained. It was a nice stroll and a good change from seeing all the buildings around the area. If your time in London is limited, this attraction is not necessarily a must see, but if your strolling around the area with time to spare, cut through the park instead if you can to your next destination.

St James's Park - firm favourite, real treasure. I just luv St James's Park.  It's been a firm favourite since I first visited London as a child, then became a Londoner and now more of a visitor. So it's a decades long luv-affair. It's a happy place. The gardens no matter the season are beautiful - from the crisp'ness and snow of winter and seeing pelicans in the snow ... to burst of spring, daffodils and blossom on the trees, to the summer with riots of colour and, in autumn, the beautiful hues of the trees. The lake is a bird haven.in all all... A real treasure.Events too ... Concerts in the park in summer are fun and full of relaxation and the bird life adds to the fun times. From age of 5 to hopefully when I am a 100, St James' is simply great.And the ease of access - it's a super meeting point - as the palaces of Buckingham and St James' are nearby as are the Houses of Parliament. So this is "a must do and enjoy".

When the sun shines, there's no better place to be.... If the sun is out, take a walk and lay down on the grass or grab one the park's chairs, relax and enjoy. This is probably the best place to be in London to recharge one's batteries. A clear sense of peace comes out of this chiseled landscape. And the tenant of the Bird keeper's cottage must have the best view one can dream of in London...
A pleasant walk. Walked through the park after visiting Buckingham Palace. Our 11 year old granddaughter loved all the squirrels and ducks. Pity is was raining but still a pleasant stroll.

Heaven. This may be my favorite place on this Earth. I have been to this park each time I have visited London. It never gets old. It is beautiful and full of life. The parks of London really make the city. You feel so refreshed there and it gives you a bit of a break from running around to tourist spots. Great pics from both sides of the bridge in the middle of the park. Do not miss if you are in London!

Great place to refuel. After the hustle and bustle of London it was so refreshing to sit in this park and watch the many different types of birds being fed, and just enjoy some of the natural beauty of London.
Excellent. Very Scenic Park with plenty of areas prefect for a picnic or simply relaxing on a hot summers day. Very child and pet friendly.

Simply brilliant!. Walked round this park three times in three days and loved it each time. It's full of birds of all shapes and sizes, from pelicans to ducklings, and is teaming with sqirrels. Take some bread and nuts with you and you'll be able to hand feed the birds and the squirrels. My advice is to leave the footpath and go for a walk in the trees. You get a whole different perspective of the park and the squirrels come bounding up to you looking for nuts - superb.

Unexpected beauty on the way to the palace. We had taken the tube to St. James and wanted to walk by Buckingham Palace before walking back to our hotel at Covent Garden. This park is exceptionally beautiful and well maintained. Just a pleasure to stroll around. We have two kids ages 10 and 13. There is a waterway down the middle and birds of all kinds, including swans, several ducks with their baby birds in a row. They are quite used to people so my daughter was able to take some great photographs of baby birds etc which she loved. We often stopped to look at the wildlife and the flowers. Very relaxing. If you're going to the Palace make sure to walk through these gardens!

#1 Park. I say #1 due to all the parks or public gardens in London are beautiful. I asked a cabbie about that, and he told me the city goes out of its way to keep them up. Well, it shows. In St James there are flowers that will have you snapping away for several minutes. It is a beautiful area and spacious.
Peaceful. Just relaxing and beautiful and peaceful. A great way to unwind after a stressful day to walk through the quiet park taking in the flowers and nature. A great way to relax
Beautiful! !. Dont go to London without walking through here. Totally stunning!!!!! Relaxing and picturesque. enjoyed an icecream whilst walking through to Buckingham Palace.
you should not miss it. It was beautiful, the children liked the birds. It is free, and near to Pakingham Palace. London visitors should plan to stay at least 3 hours in the park in a sunny day

Tranquility in downtown London. Beautiful gardens and very peaceful. A good place to enjoy a good book and just let time goes by. Do not miss the wildlife living in the park, such as various birds, swans and huge pelicans.

Best park in London. Very calm and pretty, lots of flowers and little animals running around (be careful the squirrel are a bit suicidal!!) cute little lake as well, it's perfect place to relax and still be close to all of the attractions in London so you can actually just stop during your day :)

A natural spot in the heart of busy London. If you want to relax from shopping and other businesses, stroll in this marvelous park, rest on a chair and enjoy its wonderfull man made scernery. Gaze at the numerous species of water birds (swans, geese, and many duck varieties). A little sqirrel will compete, peacefully, for food.The best way to reach Buckingham Palace is through St James Park, you may witness the horse guard returning to their stables.A picnic is agood way to have a midday pause: Many do it fropm the nearby offices but not il its
great for walk!. This place is great for walk in the fall, I love all the greenery around, restaurant near by great park to just enjoy a nice stroll.

Peace & Calm in the City. St James's Park is my favourite park in London and we visit there whenever we stay at the Hilton Hotel, Green Park as it's only a short stroll from there. Once you have escaped the crowds at Buckingham Palace you enter this beautiful park with its lake teaming with water fowl, including black swans and pelicans. I always spend time watching their activities with great joy.The park is quite large and very well maintained with deckchairs for hire and several stalls selling refreshments. There are beautifully created flowerbeds and from the bridge across the middle of the lake one has good views of horse guard parade and the London Eye in the distance. Great photo opportunities.Despite large numbers of visitors the park offers peace and tranquility within such a lively and noisy city.
Pretty park with nice restaurant. It's a nice stroll with kids and they have a very nice restaurant in the park. Kids will enjoy waking through as there are many ducks, swans and geese.

Nice Park!. Walked through St. James's Park, was a lot to see, trees, grass, but also an area to sit, although, you had to rent a deck chair for about £5 an hour (I could be wrong on the pricing) me and my husband decided to find a free bench to sit on. Was crowded, but I guess everyone wanted to visit the famous St. James's Park.

Beautiful Park. Right next to the palace, Horse Guards and tonnes of other sights. A beautiful park with a huge pond in the centre. Loads of ducks, pelicans and swans. Bandstand and deckchairs. Lots of benches to relax on.A nice walk through and around. There are a couple of food stalls that do a great hotdog. I love the atmosphere, it's nice and serene. Very pretty especially in the summer months. Immaculately maintained. Definitely worth a stroll through.
Lovely city break. Lovely place to take a break from the London buzz. Take a chance to walk around the park or to just relax and chill lying on the grass with a book, for example.

Very friendly squirrels. A beautiful park, with a lovely river running through it full of lots of wildlife, such as pelicans, swans, many other different types of birdlife. Many benches to sit in, plenty of shady trees everywhere, lots of green; Favourite part was that the squirrels come right up to you and eat from your hand, so take some nuts along and something extra for the birds. Ended up at the Horse guards parade, from here, which was also very impressive. This was by far our favourite park in the centre of London, my youngest teenage daughter loved it and begged to go back again, although we never got another chance to, save it for next time we go to UK!
St.James Park. Beautiful large space, ideal for walking and break from the city crowds. Great! Squirrels eat from hand, nice.

Beautiful!. This is a beautiful park. Easy to walk through. It leads from the Horses Guard through to Buckingham Palace and is amazing in the summer. All the baby ducks and cygnets are out and the park is green and lush. Heaps of shade to find a place to sit and rest and take it all in. One of my favourite places.
Nice an Relaxing. When the weather is great nice park to enjoy. Mae sure to check out the views of Buckingham Palace from cross the lake area as it makes for a great photo.

Just lovely. Visited yesterday and walked from Buckingham palace to horse guards through this lovely park. A super little play area for the children, lovely green areas and views back to the palace and the eye. Will def be visiting again with a picnic. Great toilets by park too for little ones. Lovely walk by the water too.

a breathe of fresh air. in the centre of one of the worlds busiest cities St James Park ,tranquility itself ,beautiful lakes alive with wildfowl from around the world and nearer home. Squirels bounding around searching for a friend to give them a morsal or two. Plenty of outlets to buy tea /coffee or cold drinks and then just sit and enjoy the peace

Nice walk from Buckingham to Horse Guards. The park is very pleasant, kids can run around and don't complain to walk the distance.
Beware of the duck, birds, pigeons !

Peaceful oasis near Buckingham Palace. A wonderful park that stretches from Buckingham Palace to Horseguards Parade, with many beautiful gardens - congratulations to the gardeners on all their hard work. There is an interesting range of ducks and birds that are not averse to sharing your lunch if you are not careful.It is a peaceful location very near the hutle and bustle of the Mall, well worth a visit.
A beautiful Park. This park is a beautiful park in the heart of London. We walked through the park and enjoyed it. There are bathrooms in the park as well. Definitely worth a visit.

Tranquil oasis in heart of London. On way to Buckingham palace we walked by this park. Didn't plan on this but we took more time strolling through it. Linger around. Catch some wonderful blooms on flower patch. Caught glimpse of a few squirrels too. They seems an inquisitive lot perhaps looking for food as they do come very closer yet never quite touching you and quickly scurried away to forage for food. Kid had great time interacting.
Oasis !. Lovely peaceful park in the heart of the capital, with views of Buckingham Palace and The London Eye.

So Beautiful on a Sunny Day. This is a lovely Park to wander through on a lovely sunny day, there are lots of places where you can sit and take in the activity going on around you, or you can buy a nice cuppa at one of the little kiosks and sit and enjoy it under shady trees for a good rest. This is a lovely place to wander when the weather is lovely and sunny.
Gorgeous, must see. Stunning park with great places to sit and relax for lunch. Water features are fantastic and just a short walk to other entertainment in London.

Beautiful park and wildlife. This is such a lovely park to wander in. It has a multitude of water birds and the squirrels are so cheeky that they would come and feed from your hand. Beautiful place to visit on a bright and warm day when you have the opportunity to relax.

A pretty park. A great pretty park in the centre of London right opposite Buckhingham Palace. Nice fountains, flower beds, lots of benches around the lake to sit at and watch the world go by and admire the ducks and birds. You can walk through it to get to Horse Guards Parade and then the River Thames.
Take a walk. See the sights with a nice walk, from Westminster all the way to Hyde park makes a lovely walk or vice versa.

Relax here in between walking around London. The perfect park to relax for a while and catch your breath after walking and sightseeing. If you want to visit Buckingham Palace, then St. James's is right by it. Our family chose to come here to chill out, take in the tranquil gardens and watch the ducks and swans on the water. Its great to bring a packed lunch or have an ice cream when the weather is fine.
relaxing. love the large stretches of park in busy London...good place for a sandwich, a run or for you kids to chase squirrels which are frequent in the area.

Beautiful place to Stroll. Just off the Mall and stretching down to Buckingham Palace, St James Park, full of lakes, squirrels, bird life, a quiet haven from bustling London to relax and have a picnic, but close to many sights like Trafalgar Square and Westminster

Right in the Middle. If you fancy a walk nearby Westminster, escaping from the city : here's the place to go to.Rather small, St James's Park can be accessed walking from Picadilly Circus (5 minutes) and will get you through the Horse Guard Parade and then go on towards Nothwalk.Alternatively, you may walk to Westminster Abbey and Big Ben...A simple, easy and quick walk right in the middle of London's most beautiful buildings.

St James Park, London.. St James Park is the oldest of London's 8 royal parks, a great peaceful place to chill out in between seeing all the attractions.The park is to one side of Buckingham palace, The Mall and Horse Guards Parade.Facilities in the park include a childrens playground, deck chairs to hire and toilets.St James's park has a lake with 2 islands. West Island and Duck Island.There are many ducks, waterfowl and Pelicans to see.I have been here many times, bring a rug and sit on the grass. It is charming and peaceful to enjoy some time in the sun.

Beautiful park.. St.James's Park is a must see in London, such a stunning park as are all of the royal parks. Spent an afternoon here on a date and it was beautiful. The flower beds were gorgeous, the lakes and the water was just wonderful. It was an extremely busy park,but you can still manage to find a space on the grass to sit and enjoy the view and each others company. Defiantly recommend it. And it is on the outskirts of Buckingham palace. Beautiful :) Easy to get to from the tube stations and toilets and restaurants located around the parks.

Beautiful open space in the heart of London. St James's Park is a breath of fresh air and a lovely walking location in the heart of London. Very peaceful with a lovely lake and romantic views. Walk through here on your way to the Palace i you are visiting, or just spend a lunchtime relaxing in the open air.

From Whitehall to Buckingham Palace. We walked through this park on our way from the changing of the horse guards at Whitehall to Buckingham Palace. The grounds and flowers were lovely but the pond looked very polluted with algae and trash floating in it.

A park to relax in. This park is a delightful place to stroll through while admiring all the immaculately kept flower beds. The lake attracts a wide variety of water birds some of whom are quite tame as are the resident squirrels!!! The trees surrounding the lake are beautiful. It can get VERY busy in the tourist season but is worth a visit at any time of year. There are plenty of seats and deckchairs scattered about the gardens and small cafes.It is a very good place to rest in after visiting the surrounding local attractions. As it is so near The Mall you often get the chance of seeing the horses being ridden up to St James's Palace for the changing of the guard.

Park yourself a while. St. James's park is simply wonderful, it runs from Buckingham Palace along the Mall to Horse Guards Parade. This is a totally different park to Green Park which is just over the road. St. James's offers lots of wildlife, the squirrels will happily take peanuts from your hand and the ducks and swans are always ready for food.The flower beds are really beautiful and are well maintained. The lake is very nice to see and adds to the overall beauty of the park.There is a cafe and also public toilets which are free to use. You can see The London Eye in the distance, and you can get some great photos.These wonderful green spaces within the Capital are so very special and such a break from the hustle of the City.My advice is to try and visit this park and enjoy all that it has to offer.
Very Pretty and Well Kept. It is not the biggest park you will find in London but it is one if the nicest and best kept. Easy to get around and can see it in a few hours.

The perfect stroll. A park next to the Mall on the stroll from Traflagar Square to Buckingham Palace. Flowers, ponds, grass. If you were a horse with blinders and ear plugs, you'd swear you were in the countryside.

Peaceful Time Out. A great place to take a bit of a time out from pounding the pavements of London. From Big Ben, London Eye and Westminster Abbey and en-route to Buckingham Palace, its a great place to sit and watch the birds, squirrels and people of London while recharging the batteries. The gardens, flower beds and trees are beautiful and a break from all of the man-made attractions. The air even feels cooler and cleaner in here. Also a good place to let the kids of the leash for while because you cant let them run around London so a good place fro them to play and let off some steam.

Lovely park. We truly enjoyed our short stroll along St. James's Park on a Friday evening in late July 2013. While the park was well attended at the time, it was relaxing and very enjoyable. Some people were sitting on chairs or on the grass, many were simply walking and enjoying the great variety of birds and animals. I was surprised to even see a lad feeding a squirrel right off his hands.The park has many paths you can choose to take; a lovely lake with different geese and ducks; and it is across from Buckingham Palace, which makes the experience ever so memorable. You can walk to the Horses Guard and on to Trafalgar Square at the end of your visit. It is definitely one of my favourite parks in London.

Great place to chill while visiting the West End. Loved it - especially in good weather - to have al fresco lunch and - chill between sight seeing. We walked from the Picadilly Circ to Kensington Palace ( Willliams and Kates home) just through the Green Park - then Hyde Park then Kensington Gdns.

Beautiful escape. Some parts of the park are commercialised, rentals for lounge chairs in an open park - is a huge turn-off. A menagerie of birds is also there with beautiful flowers and trees. Take a walk along the Princess Diana memorial walk and be amazed. A tranquil place away from the hustle and bustle of the city. This is certainly one of my favourite spots in London.

Lovely small park, in front of Buckingham Palace !. This park has a lovely homely feel to it. That I would suppose, is its proximity to Buckingham palace. A lovely park to relax after going into, or around the palace, and close enough to Westminster (10min walk), to plan a boat trip, after visiting Palace, relaxing in park for 30 mins, and continuing to Westminster....

Beauty in the Big City. St. James Park has got to be the Most Beautiful Park in London, and there are many to choose from. From the rolling lawns and Shady Norfolk Plane trees, to the waterfowl, and the Bird Keepers House , surrounded by gardens and fountains. Take a walk, listen to the peaceful nature, in the heart of the bustling City of London.

great to visit. this is a beautiful park to walk through when all the flowers and trees are in bloom as the smell and look of the place is amazing. when you go to london dont miss this park as it is fantastic

Overated. I saw this park during the early morning in what (for London) was a 'hot' week where on one day the temperature reached 33 degrees, so my review is biased by that.
The central lake looked to be in poor condition: the water was slimy.
It didn't look attractive like for instance Melbourne's Royal Botantical Gardens lake.

Nice place. It is a big green park across Buckingham Palace. It was late spring when I went there.Crossed the park to catch the bus. Many people were having a day out with their family/friends. The trees were magnificent. I was running against time so did not have much opportunity to sit on the bench and enjoy the cool evening air. Would like to go there again next year.
Nice. Nice park. Take a picnic and a blanket. You won't be disappointed at how beautiful the gardens are. Superb location too. London is such an inspiring place and the park reflects that.

Bodacious bounty of beautiful. This is a really magnificent park. There is a lot of wildlife located within its confines. As I walked through I saw tons of birds and squirrels along the water. If you want a temporary escape from the pollution in the city this is a pretty good place to go. You can actually breathe deeply without worrying about all the fumes you are inhaling. The surrounding trees keep the air pretty fresh. A lot of high quality O2 here.

Nice place to relax with kids. On the way to Buckingham palace - i passed through the park with my daughter. We enjoyed the green trees, the lake and the animals around it. Pity that part of the lake was dirty and unmanaged.
A beautiful, chilled side of London. What a beautiful oasis in the middle of London - a great place to take a break from the tourist trail - good value, tasty eateries in beautiful surroundings.

Beautiful park. Beautiful park and well worth a visit if you are nearby. There is a lake in the middle of the park maintained for wildlife - ducks, geese and even a few pelicans! There are a couple of stands selling snacks, ice creams and drinks. The park is well maintained.

Wonderful place to relax after visit to the Palace. We had short rest after visiting the Palace before going to the next attraction.My son enjoyed running at the garden. Birds were everywhere.Just be careful not to sit on the bird droppings.

Beautiful Park. Great views all around, there's a place for the kids to play, and places around the corner if you need to eat or drink. To sit down and rest on some folding chairs, it would cost you £1.50 or more depending on how much time you plan to sit but there are benches all around which are free to sit on.
perfect for small children. Lovely park, good size. The children's park was in lovely conditon; very clean. Lots of ducks; don't forget the bread!! ideal location to escape the crowds

It has a small lake in the park, beautiful flowers and trees. Out of the Buckingham Palace? Please go directly to the St James Park. It has a small lake in the park, beautiful flowers and trees, perfect place for children to feed different animals and get to know them better, have for example some bread or apple with you. Oh, the air in the park is perfectly fresh.
Ducks and castles. A beautiful park complete with ducks and doves, strollers and sleepers, loads of people watching and the Changing of the Guard right there on the Mall. Magical!

Impressive Gardens. Beautiful well kept park and a great place to take a break/picnic from sightseeing! We visited here on the way to Buckingham Palace and couldn't resist taking a little relaxing break and enjoy the shade from the sun and time to rehydrate!!!

Lovely park. I always passed alongside St. James' park, on my way to some museum, attraction, the Thames, ... Till now. Saw the pelicans and I thought, well, why not walk a little bit closer. And what's that, a little bit further? So I finally visited the park (not all of it, must go back though). It is a really natural looking park. Well, it isn't of course, but it's so well planned that you have that impression. You can stroll avond for an hour or two, take this little path, than that, looking at the swans and ducks, trying to imagine if you could maybe plant those flowers in your garden. Sitting on a bank here or there and have a little chat with londoners... Love it! I suppose it's not really that what city trippers like to do in London, but I think they're wrong :-)

Beautiful Park. Strolled thru SJP after visiting Buckingham palace , with the hot weather people were out In force and the park was full of happiness .People relaxing , sunbathing , picnicking , and just soaking up the relaxed hot weather .During our stroll we encountered some of the tamest squirrels I have ever seen you could even feed them by hand .The park is full of lots of different birds who have made the park their home. Yet another iconic London park that is well looked after by the park management and by the visitors.
Beautiful gardens, impressive. Cut through for a walk through the park on your way to Buckingham palace. Take your time to enjoy the beauty of the flowers, ponds, wildlife, etc.
A nice park. Wonderful to walk through on a hot summers day, a little bit of peace in heart of London. I was amazed to find the ice cream stalls were reasonably priced too!

Just so pretty and relaxing. Enjoy a nice stroll along the park, together with squirrels and birdies :) It's a lovely setting for your London photos, too. The colours that surround you are amazing! I spent a lot of time buzzing in and around this place while living in London, and now when I look back, this parkis one of my first memories of London. It's a lovely walk to Buckingham Palace and you can sit in the park for hours on end, just peoplewatching and soaking in the amosphere.

Wonderful place to relax in London. Between sightseeing, this is a magnificent place to just relax and enjoy the outdoors. What makes this park special is its proximity to Buckingham Palace (it's right in front of the Palace!). I was able to get some nice shots of the palace from the gardens, while avoiding crowds.
Beautiful Park. Wonderful to stroll through on a sunny day. My husband and I really enjoyed it on our way to Buckingham Palace. The next trip, I'd like to spend more time there.

Beautiful spot to relax after sightseeing. There are so many wonderful things to see in London, sometimes you find yourself wanting a quiet place to stroll or relax. St James Park is just what you need - its just down the road from the Westminster area and its a gorgeous place. Watch the swans on the lake or the squirrels running about!

Central to any visit in London. London should be very, very proud of its commitment to green space. Every time I come I love to walk from Green Park through St James park and on through Hyde and Kensington Parks. I love that it is so well used by people and their dogs. The birds are a treat and many that we saw nesting when here in May we now saw with their broods. I was a biologist in my life before medicine and spent several summers studying American Coots in BC and love watching the coots here feeding their young 'Humphries'. It is lovely to see how well used it is by Londoners and travelers alike. St James in particular has lovely signs up explaining the different bird species. It is also amazing how just steps from the hustle and bustle of the square by Buckingham Palace you can be in the relative solitude of the parks. They have beautiful perennial gardens that were in full bloom this time. The only negative is some of the garbage in the park waters ....perhaps jail time for the polluters would solve the problem!!!! Always amazes me that people would just throw bottles in the water. More garbage cans might help and more frequent pickup might also help as some were overflowing ....so at least some people try but I suppose there will still be polluting pigs.....amazing that people can defile such a lovely place.
Relaxing. i passed there by luck , i been out from Churchill museum and i crossed the street to other side and i found my self in St. James's park , its one of the best parks i ever visit ever .

Nice park, but there's better in London. It is a very nice park, but it is a little bit smaller with less to take in than in other London parks. It is good if combined with Green Park and Buckingham Palace.

wonderful sit in the sun. Sitting on the grass by the lake, coffee bar + ice cream store on-site and one of the World's most iconic buildings (Buckingham Palace) staring at you - what is there not to like ? Tube station + pub 100 yards away.

Nicest park during our visit. Very nice park next to Buckingham Palace and the Mall. We also visited Hyde Park and Regents Park...St. James was our favourite. It was busy, but still felt like a nice hideaway. The Mall next tot the park is impressive.
Terrible playground. Needs a complete overhaul. the concrete so rough if kids fall over its like a cheese crater! Bad, bad, bad

Lovely In London. If you want a few moments of peace and quiet in the center of London, then go to St James' park. It is so tranquil with squirrels running round and the ducks on the pond. The park is so well kept, the flower beds are so varied and beautiful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stroll to Buckingham palace before the hoards of people descended again.

A genteel walk into the past. St. James Park is an oasis of peace and quiet in central London, and affords one great vistas from the bridge over the pond - looking west, trees frame a corner of Buckingham Palace, and looking east, one can see the London Eye looming over the buildings in Whitehall in the foreground.
One of the many green lunges in london. It is one of the many green spots you can og into and realy relax. Get away from the noicy London into the park and realy relax
Great park for wildlife. Busier than Hyde Park as it is smaller but equally nice to spend a few hours. The birdlife is amazing (including pelicans.) There should be places like this in all towns.

Favourite Park in London. I just love this park. It does not have the size of Hyde Park or the flowers of Regent's, but for me, is the best to just walk through, feed the birds and the squirrels. And there are a lot of them. This is the place that I have visited more times since I have moved to London. ;)

Best part of London for a 9 year old animal lover!. When my daughter's teachers ask her what she did this summer, it will be "I went to London and.." Saw the Tower of London? No. The changing of the guards? No."I saw baby swans, and ducks and pelicans and squirrels and pigeons ate out of my hands!" Beautiful gardens, very peaceful environment - bring your camera and let the kids run and play!

Nice place on a hot day, St. James's Park.. St James Park is on the left side of The Mall heading towards Buckingham Palace, on a very hot day it is a ideal place to cool off, it has a lovely Lake full of wild life and great views, there are lots of shade plenty refreshment venue's and free toilets, after walking round London for a few hours we needed to cool off so off to the park, there were thousand of people under the tree's either cooling off or passing the day, a nice place to go.

My Dream Park. I was accidentally found this part when I visited Buckingham Palace. It's only a minute walk from the Palace and about 5 minutes to Westminster Abbey. Here's the best place in my opinion for chill and relax (if you are not animals hater). You can bring some food for picnic in the park but please don't forget some bread and nuts for all birds and lovely squirrels too! I would say this is the place that if I'm in London and getting bored of walk around the town and stay in the room, I'll just go to St. James Park ! ;)

Brilliant Park right in the heart of London. An absolute must for any wildlife lover. Great for photography. A great variety of waterfowl to be seen including herons, pelicans, white cheeked pintails, black hooded mergansers, smews, ruddy ducks, black swans etc..... Very friendly squirrels - just take a bag of monkey nuts with you!

Lovely park in the centre of so many sights. Makes a great walk through St James Park down to Buckingham Palace. So peaceful with birds and squirrels, blue and white striped deckchairs and quintessentially British!

Lovely Park and an Oasis of Tranquility. We love this park and visit each year with the kids when on a half term city break. There are plenty of pleasant walks around the lake and in winter the squirrels are quite bold in taking nuts from your hand if you are patient enough. There is a nice café/restaurant in the centre of the park and a couple of coffee huts at either entrance at the Buckingham Palace and Green Park ends.A children's play area at the Buck Palace end provides a nice place to sit and enjoy a coffee whilst the kids play and you are fairly close to Green Park if you fancy a walk up towards Piccadilly etc.A 10 minute walk from Westminster Bridge in the other direction means that St James is easily accessible by foot from the centre of London and tube id also close by for those who prefer.

Had a nice stroll. We had a nice stroll through St. Jame's Park on our first day in London. It is an amazing feat and a sign of strength of Londoners to place and maintain beautiful parks inside one of the busiest cities in the world. Peace in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. Take the time and enjoy these parks.

Nice- don't go out of your way- but if in the 'hood.... Nice, sedate, an oasis of water (a bit green but water nonetheless). Interesting huge pelicans and swans.At least walk along the south end (at the entrance to Churchill war rooms)
Beautiful!. So impressed with this place! A lovely stroll through the park looking at the birds, enjoying a coffee from a little kiosk. Loved it!

Small and nice park!. St. James Park is one of the 3 three parks around Buckingham Palace, the other two being The Green Park and Hyde Park. Although St. James is a nice walk and a good place to take a break and relax. I'd prefer Hyde Park or Green Park.
Lovely place. Enjoyed the peaceful morning there. My toddler loved chasing the birds and feeding the squirrels. Caught the changing of guards at the end of the park after our walk. Perfect!
Nice park. I walked through St. James Park to get from Buckingham Palace to Hyde Park. It is a pleasant walk through a park along water with lots of birds, including pelicans.

Love the pelicans. I decided to walk from Westminster Cathedral to Oxford Circus as the weather was fine, and went through St James' Park. Despite having lived in London for a couple of years, I had never been to the Park. I mentioned my visit to the Park to my aunt who has lived in London for over 50 years, and she said that she had never been there. The main attraction for me was the unexpected sight of the magnificent pelicans. They were first introduced into the Park in 1664, and currently there are six of them, including three Great White Pelicans which were a gift given this year by the City of Prague.

Time to chill out. This park allows you time to chill out and to wander around without having to consider central London traffic. There are organised walkways and places to buy food if you need to. The lake in the centre is large and is occupied by a family of pelicans towards the end. Buckingham Palace is at one end and Horse Guards Parade at the other. The park does get busy especially on nice days as workers in the area sit and eat their lunches on the benches. Quite a pleasant atmosphere considering you are in the centre of London.

Beautiful. Very well worth a stroll through this Park. Very rejuvenating and relaxing with excellent greenery all around and a very friendly group of swans and ducks in the pond. Lots of places to sit on benches if you do not want to sit on the grass.If it is not raining....just do it.
Peaceful Park!. A walk through St. James Park is a lovely approach to Buckingham Palace. The water, flowers, wildlife, and surroundings are very beautiful and an oasis in the bustling city of London.

Lovely spot. Great area for a walk away from all the busy traffic and landmarks lovely gardens a variety of birds superb lake situated in the centre, you can sit on the grass and watch the world go by while easing those tired limbs a must for all those who like a walk through one of those special parks.

So calm and so pretty. So calm and so pretty. Fab views of Buck Palace from the bridge over the central lake. Plenty of wildlife to entertain the children and enough concessions to grab a quick drink or icecream.
A refuge. This park is a lovely refuge from the general hustle and bustle of London. Wander though and enjoy the swans and views of Kensington Palace or just use it as a short-cut.

The most beautiful spot in London. St. James Park is my favorite place in London. It is perfectly situated for the stroll between Buckingham Palace and Westminster / Parliament / Big Ben. The centerpiece of the park is a lake that is home to many different kinds of birds, including swans, ducks, geese, and pelicans. The gardens are beautifully landscaped with flowers and flowering bushes in a very natural way. Sure you could just walk briskly through on your way from one tourist location to another ... but why not take your morning coffee or lunch and sit on a bench in St James Park. You'll be glad you did!

Beautiful, but beware allergies . Beautiful, great for a stroll. Plenty of ducks, geese, and other birds you can feed. Beware pollen and dust in the spring and summer - nothing has ever set off my allergies so strongly!

Relax in the heart of the city. We were in the park to watch the Trooping of the colour which was wonderful, but we found so much more there to do that we went back the next day. The birds are entrancing, pelicans, geese, herons, coots, more hens, swans and cygnets, joined by the friendliest squirrels in London. Plenty of benches, good food to eat and a play area for anyone with children. Take a picnic, watch the wildlife and the world go by.
lovely. So glad we visited this park- lovely sunny day and just sat and people watched. Lots to see and a cafe in the park where we sat and looked over the lake
Must spend some time. A great place for relax. Well maintained. Major oxygen supplier to the city. Can see palace routines as and when required.

a place to relax.. After a long walk around Westminster we made our way to the park, there are very clean and well kept public toilets free to use and the park is a place to relax, or walk through. It is close to The Horse Gaurd Parade and Waterloo place. It is a nice place to take the family to sit and enjoy maybe a picnic together and rest whilst walking around the area.

Beautiful Park. Such a beautiful park St. James is!!! You come across it when you walk from Westminster towards Buckingham... It has everything that a park needs - beautiful water body; full of ducks, storks and swans and beautiful grassy mounds and is filled with the most beautiful and friendly squirrels ever!! You can also hire deck chairs for the hour or the day!
A lovely walk. One of my favourite walks is through this park which is peaceful, well maintained and interesting. My wife and I go on every visit to London

A lovely oasis in London. I loved this park. Great peace in the middle of huge London. Buckingham Palace is close and you can walk there as well. The ducks were so cute. One followed me up and down. Hot dog and ice cream stands for those who want a snack are nearby too.

Very nice and relaxing way to spend time. It was a very nice, sunny day and my hubby and I could stroll around the park for hours. There are also a lot of benches to sit on if ever you feel tired but even doing that will be enjoyable given the nice scenery this park could offer.

One of the best places to spend time. This is a lovely park that always seems to look great. It has plenty of space to sit and relax and it seems to be on the way to anywhere in London. There's also free public toilets which make it very useful as well.
The squirrels are entertainment in themselves!
lovely. nice walk we really enjoyed the walk around the parks other than that London is too busy!!!!!!!!!!!thake your time and enjoy the walk

Peace and natural beauty right in the heart of London. Visited the park on one of the hottest days of the year. It was busy, but it didn't feel it. It was very peaceful and an area of natural beauty. The plants and trees were lovely and the grounds are very well maintained. I have been to London many a time but this is my first time I visited one of the parks. For a bit of peace and quiet in lovely surroundings this place is perfect. It is just lovely to walk around. I was lucky with the weather and I would recommend this park to anyone wishing to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a while.
One of the best Parks. a superb park in the heart of London, with plenty of openings and places for a picnic. Lots of palaces very close by.

Don't Miss the Pelicans!. This is a beautiful park. We walked through frequently on our trip since our hotel was near the Palace. It is a great area. The last night we were at a path near the far end of the park and happened upon the pelicans. They are huge and amazing to see. The birds were near the path and much larger than I could have imagined. We were blessed with wonderful weather and took advantage and walked through the park on our way to other places. The local people as well as the tourists spend a lot of time in the park and we found it a great reprieve from the hustle and bustle in the nearby area.

Amazing how good a park can be.. We sat on a park bench. Although hundreds of people and for a mixture of languages ​​passed in front of us, the peace and quiet around were very pleasant.We bought a box of fruit and coffee, listening to the birds chirp and we followed the squirrels.No wonder that after having so much funwe returned to the same area two days later as well - when we had free time.Quality time!!!
Beautiful. At The start of our holiday the weather was quite poor ( funny of London) but the day we walked through the park it was just beautiful everyone was out sun baking and it was wonderful

Beautiful. Absolutley beautiful park. We were lucky enough to be there when there was a gun salute. 6 Canons, 41 shots. It made the ground vibrate it was so loud. They opened the big gaqtes that lead out onto the road past Buckingham Palace and all the Horse GUards with the artillary rode out of them. You could spend hours in there. Spectacular
Lovely park. Lovely, well kept park between Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square. Lots and wildlife and attractive gardens.

A small but beautiful park. St.James park is located just outside the Buckingham palace and although its smaller than Hyde park it is very well maintained and the gardeners work overtime to keep it full of flowers thereby giving you great photo opportunities . For those it eager for a long walk in Hyde park - St James's park provides a great opportunity to stretch the legs without straining the muscles!

A refuge in the middle of London.. Traveling from Westminster station to Buckingham Palace we had the opportunity to walk through St. James Park. What a beautiful park. You can find solitude in the hustle and bussel on London. I spent more time in the park than at Buckingham Palace. It's amazing how the park absorbs the noise of the city. Park is quiet and peaceful. Loved it.

Great placce to lose yourself.. You can see everyone doing everything thing here. Take a walk for hours, beautiful scenery, joggers, bikes, people walking their dogs, laying on the grass reading, picnics.....I can keep going. Just a beautiful park to relax in and feel safe.
Relaxing, lovely park. Had a lovely stroll through st James park up to Buckingham palace,watching the wildlife even in the rain! Would have been nice to sit in the sun and watch the world go by.
Lovely Park and Scenery. Lovely park to walk around especially on a sunny day. What I really like is at night as the lake is illuminated and has a real romantic feel to it. Enjoy it.

Favourite Place. In my entire trip of London, this was my favourite place. The swans and ducks in the ponds. The flowers in blooms had the park in a nice aroma. Even the squirrels were people friendly coming up quite close to you for treats.
An oasis of calm. Gorgeous place whatever the weather. Spent a couple of hours here just walking, sitting and watching the wildlife. Very peaceful.
peaceful. city of London, but peaceful lake and surroundings. plenty of grass to sit on ( as lots do when its sunny). so close to Buckingham Palace.

Beautiful Park. St. James Park, very close/bordering Buckingham Palace. Decorative and well-groomed flower beds. The beautiful lake is filled with birds. A very soothing atmosphere. It is a wonderful place to stroll through or just sit and have a bite to eat. Immaculate and relaxing surroundings.
Truly a gem. Sun,trees,lakes,ducks,squirrel,birds and what not..A lovely place to relax and refresh while exploring this beautiful city.
Family visit. Love the hustle and bustle of a weekend in this park. Great for people watching with a coffee. Lots of wildlife and great for photos of Buckingham Palace.

To the Queen's Palace!. Beautiful tulips blooming during the spring. After visiting the Big Ben, walk toward "Birdcage Walk" street. After about 15 minutes walk, you'll end up at Buckingham Palace and the Royal Guard Museum. If you're hungry, there's a little shop toward the end of the park. If you're catching the Tube, look out for the statue of the boy, there's a little short cut there to tube station: St. Jame's Park.

Hard to beat as a park anywhere in the world. I use this park at least every week , it is elegant,historic, comfortable,serene,and wonderful.Not dominated by tourists it is a park where local workers mix with visitors politicians & those who cherish it and visit regularly.Nice restaurant for lunch, ice cream stalls(very discreet) plenty of places to sit, lie,Deck chairs, bands in the summer.Careful in the spring the pelicans can horrify visitors by scooping up and devouring the tiny ducklings!a delight linking the Palace of Westminster and Buckingham Palace with lots of water.Sublime!

Great place to slow down in busy city. The lakes and waterfowl along with coffee and ice cream vendors add to a nice atmosphere. Also given that you are on The Mall with Buckingham Palace behind you it does feel surreal at times.

wow. such beautiful views. Just came back on May 17 -- when we visited the tulips were in full bloom and it was just breathtaking how beautiful everything was. you cannot miss a walk thru this huge park. there are ducks, swans, birds ect it is just lovely! you can walk thru on your way to Buckingham Palace to watch the changing of the guard!

Really nice. After a full day on our feet we stumbled upon this park, it was great for laying on the soft green grass under the shade of the many trees.I like bird photography and found this place to be a haven for numerous waterbird species.......Great, relaxing place.

Simply stunning!. Walked thru the park over the bank holiday weekend, it was blissful. The sun was shining, the grass was full of people sunning themselves. The grounds are so well kept and we saw loads of huge fish in the lake. It is such a lovely part of the city, a real oasis.

Loved the ducks. Beautiful walk. Loved the ducks and other birds. They probably looked ordinary to locals but I found them very strange looking and different. Much busier than expected but didn't bother me. Vendors selling ice creams, we must be in London! We were amazed that anyone would want an icecream, it was about 8deg celcius, we found it very cold. I was very impressed that the gardens had so many flowers blooming in such a cold drizzly climate.
Beautiful. Lovely flowers, a nice pond, good little restaurant. A good way to walk from Buckingham Palace back to the Horse Guards.
One of my fave parks. This is a great park, and it's huge. Ponds are beautiful, crowds are nice and mixed, not too touristy not too local. Just pleasant and fun.

tulip beds awesome. probably the best designed tulip bed we have seen in all our travels---the sheer zigzag design and the crafty color combination of the main tulips and the background flowers were a harmonious blend and such a treat for the eyes... had a picnic lunch on the bench near the tulips in front of the lake and enjoyed the whole experience... the riot of color was awesome given the fact that we had heard London had the coldest April in 65 years
what a great park and the Queen at the end !. what a lovely park in the middle of things. full of history and lovely gardens with the Queen at the end !alwasy enjoy a walkaboutn the St. James Park

Picnic in leafy park in tranquil surroundings. We bought our picnic nearby and sat on the grass, watching the wild fowl carrying on their daily life around the water. Flowers and gardens so magnificently kept. Grass white as snow with daisies. Cheeky squirrels accepting food from passers by. Troops of school children wandering around kept in tow by teachers. London in springtime - a wonderful place to sit and watch the world go by!

Loved the park on a sunny Sunday morning:). We walked from Trafalgar Square to Buckingham Palace. Stroll through the gardens by the lake, watch the ducks and pelicans,feed the squirrels and enjoy the scenary. Would recommend if you enjoy mother nature :)
Lovely relaxing park. Beautiful gardens, particularly the tulips. Sat and watched an array of exotic ducks and geese, mallards and drakes and swans and ate ice-cream. Bliss.

Great bird sightings. We just breezed by one end of St James Park and the lake on our way to the nearby Churchill War Rooms Museum. Like all parks we visited in London, the lake area offers a nice place to walk, relax, and spot birds. We happened to stumble upon two beautiful storks sunning themselves on the large boulders inside the lake. Amazing! Even in a large city like London, the huge parks offer some great green spaces to have a quiet moment.

Great walk from Westminster to Kensington. Head in from Buckingham Palace and take a detour to Speakers Corner. It's better in person... Then strike out for Kensington Palace. It's a great walk don't be afraid to meander. The Albert Hall is along the left flank of the park and in the park is the Albert Memorial. Ahh Victoriana!

Stunning Gardens. Proximity to my hotel and Buckingham Palace was perfect. I had a snack on the terrace of the Park's restaurant, wonderful for enjoying the view. Probably strolled the grounds for over an hour, taking pictures, people-watching, thoroughly enjoying the scenery. So glad I took the time to stroll these beautiful grounds.
Relaxing. Walk through the park to get from Picadilly circus to Buckingham Palace, to escape the hustle and bustle of London. The park itself is very relaxing and well kept.

Lovely Park!. This beautiful park is situated opposite Buckingham Palace and affords lovely views of a lake, bird life and flowers. Scenic walkways take you from the Palace in the direction of Westminster Abbey and toward Parliament. The bridge over the lake offers great views of the white pelicans and other birds.
Nice place to relax and have a picnic. Love St James park, great on Summer days for lunch time. Grab some sandwiches from home or even better a take away Nandos and chill here for the afternoon

A lovely Open Space. A beautiful park in the heart of London. On a warm day you can sit on a bench and watch the world go by. Or laze on the grass and stretch out. There is a lovely lake with a bridge across, where you can see the Pelicans. Come and revive yourselves with a picnic (if the weather is good) after having visited Buckingham Palace, The War Rooms, Horseguards or Trafalgar Square and the National Portrait Gallery.

A place to rest near the crowded tourists spots. This little oasis of quiet is near WhiteHall, where one goes to see the changing of the guard, clubland (where all the famous private clubs are located), Picadily circus, and, if you walk in another direction, Buckingham Palace. Good place to come after you've bought a sandwhich at Eat or Pret a Manger.

Spring Day in London. I really love to walk through St James Park, with the back drop of Buckingham Palace, and other lovely buildings. The trees were a little late in coming our as were the flowers, but no matter we enjoy everything about the park. Well worth a visit.

a fabulous london walk. Well its spring so it is very beautiful blossoms and tulips and huge expanses of green green lawns. St James is lovely its small and the gateway to a lot of fabulous attractions. The changing of the guard, the Ritz, Picadilly, The Mall. Lovely ..... if you feel like a walk and want to know you are in London this is truly special
Beautiful. Lovely park near the Buckingham Palace.It's perfect for a quick rest while exploring this beatiful city!

Great Tranquil place in centre of London. Lovely place to mellow & look around & think you cannot possibly in London. Family picnic are quite common & nearby Green Park & shops can supply all the necessities.

Lovely Park. Absolutely love my walk through St James Park on the way to see the changing of guards at Buckingham. Definitely plan your trip so you may walk through this idyllic park with so many different species of birds. Although this is a very small park it's great for a nice relaxing walk.

Nice Park. We had lunch in the restaurant which comprised honey glazed chicken and sweet potato with a glass of red for £10.50. The wine was a bit acid, and a little salad or more veg would have added to the meal for little cost. Toilets available, busy.

Beautiful family-friendly park. St James's Park was once a Royal hunting park in the centre of London. Today the park offers a truly beautiful environment for visitors of all ages. The lake is impressive and there are fantastic views from the bridge across the lake looking towards Whitehall. The view is reminiscent of Camelot! The park is maintained to a high standard with beautiful flower beds, green lawns and well-maintained paths bordering the lake. Look out for a wide range of domesticated and wild ducks/geese on the lake. Children will enjoy feeding the ducks on the Pall Mall (north) side of the park towards Whitehall. Text panels mounted around the lake assist visitors with the identification of the ducks that can be seen on the lake. Deck chairs are available during the summer months. There are catering facilities within the park ranging from a proper cafe to a waffle stall. Be warned that the park gets especially busy during the Spring and Summer immediately following the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. A great place to 'chill out', admire some beautiful views and plants and generally watch the world go by. There is a playground for children at the Buckingham Palace end of the park.

The English are very keen on gardening……. That’s what I’ve heard all my life, and the parks in London confirmed it. St. James Park is on the walking tours in the Westminster/White Hall area and is easy to find. If you’ve just toured Westminster Abbey, go North past Methodist Central Hall. When you come to the name of a street you’ll never forget (Birdcage Walk), take a left. The park will be on your right, but keep walking to one of the main entrances where a large map of the park is located. St. James Park is a real respite from city life. It’s not a formal garden but it’s the perfect answer if you’ve been around a lot of concrete and steel and need a break. There are many paths that criss-cross through the park, and you can also make a circle around the lake. You can even see Buckingham Palace past the far end of the lake. You can stay for as long or as short as you would like (with no charge), but it took some perseverance to move on to more sights, as May is a time of exquisite colors and green, green grass in the park.

Good with children or after ... Out of the Buckingham Palace? Please go directly to the St James Park. It has a small lake in the park, beautiful flowers and trees, perfect place for children to feed different animals and get to know them better, have for example some bread or apple with you. Oh, the air in the park is perfectly fresh.
Pleasant. Very pretty, beautiful surroundings/gardens, large and so nice to visit during a lunchtime away from the office.

Beautiful Parkland in central London. St James's Park is bursting into bloom for Spring, and it really looks stunning! This is a top place to relax, stroll, take photos and just people watch, especially after a hard day's sight seeing! All the wildlife is just charming, especially the cute little squirrels, it's just a shame so many tourists don't heed the signs telling people NOT to feed the animals. I saw squirrels being offered chocolate cake, nuts and assorted other junk, which is such a shame because this will make these animals so unwell.The park is well serviced with amenities such as toilets, seats and kiosks, and I thoroughly enjoyed my stroll in the park this morning.

Relaxing walk through.... After the hustle of viewing the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace, this proved a pleasant side route to our next destination through the Royal Gardens & Aviary, featuring many unique waterfowl around several ponds. The short fences were obviously to keep humans away from the water, keeping their habitat pristine! Nice...

So close. close to Palace and Victoria Station. Cold and rain,park was nice. No other tom addclose to Palace and Victoria Station. Cold and rain,park was nice. No other tom add close to Palace and Victoria Station. Cold and rain,park was nice. No other tom add
Nice park. You can see London Eye from here, it's amazing. And also, you can see horse soldiers, and take picture with them.

Lovely walk. The park is really lovely. Its worth taking the time to go there and have a nice walk. There is lots to see, squirrels, ducks, beautiful flowers and plants. There are a couple of really nice ice cream stalls and good toilet facilities. There's a lovely bridge you can take a lovely photo of the London eye in the background.
Good. This is a good place to walk around especially in the hot weather. Wildlife will come up to you if you have food so can get some good pictures, recommend having a walk around here

Nice Park-friendly bird life and squirrels. Nice big park with large lake. Walk through from Trafalgar Square to Buckingham Palace. Eating places in the park and take aways. Lots of birds and squirrels who pster you for food, so take plenty of nuts and corn and bread. Good for kids as water is all fenced off

A place to stroll in London. If you want to visit buckingham palace you will propably go through the garden and it's a good idea.
You can play with squirrel in the park or decide to lie in a deckchai.
But you can also simply walk and enjoy the scenery.
A wonderful backdrop to Buckingham Palace. Stroll through the gardens by the lake, watch the ducks and pelicans,feed the tame squirrels and look around at the magnificent views of central London.

A beautiful garden many forget about. Many visitors just seem to know about Hyde Park and Regents Park and forget St James Park. The other two are beautiful, but St James is my favourite as it is that much quitter. With Buckingham Palace on one side, Piccadilly on another, Pall Mall, Horse Guard Parade and Churchill War rooms on another… and Victoria street on the last you can move between these locations easily in a beautiful garden with a lovely pond and wildlife.

Heavenly Park. This park is SOOOO amazingly beautiful. Black swans peacefully, iconically gliding upon the shimmering water, birds of every sort...ones I have never seen in my life. Even in the bitter cold of what turned out to be the coldest Easter week in history walking in this park was fabulous. I have also ventured here in the summer wandering this bucolic bit of green in the center of London. This is a grand place to walk with kids in tow or to push them along in a stroller as the birds are that fun to look at and there is ice cream...even on a cold, blustry day.

Explorer. If you are a tourist or live in London, the park is always a great place to visit right in the centre of the city and close to Buckingham Palace. The park is well laid out and maintained with a variety of wild fowl linning the lake, it is pleasant to stroll around the walk ways and sit and people watch or in summer maybe have a pinic.

Beautiful space for a walk in central London. This is a great place to stroll while visiting central London, as is the adjacent Green Park. It's close to Buckingham Palace, St. James's Place, Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly Circus, and Westminster.
Lovely spot.. 28 different kinds of wildfowl counted, obviously a tourist trap but still the nicest of London's parks IMO. Nice to stroll through when doing the tourist trail.
lovely park, plenty of benches just lacks facilities. lovely well kept park, plenty of benches to sit on and plenty of grass areas to sit, play etc, nice park just lacks toilets

Nice park near Buckingham. It's small compared to Hyde Park, but it was still very nice. Daffodils were in season, covering a significant part of the park. Take a stroll after watching the changing of the guards.

Beautiful walk, views and a play in the park. Really loved walking around St James's Park, watching the birds and squirrel's running about. Didn't feel like we were walking in the center of London. The children enjoyed the park, the toilets were Free! the view of the palace and also the London eye were lovely too! A def. must for a time out from the busy streets!

Stroppy Geese. lovely maintained park right outside Buckingham palace - great walks to Westminster, Horse Guards etc
watch out for the stroppy Geese !
Breath of fresh air. Lovely to walk through on the lovely (and first) springlike day that was today, nice to get some good fresh air and watch the world go by

Parks in London. Parks in London are great for kids but not only. Changing of the guards, the band that marched on Easter and at least 5 squirrels that insisted on beeing fed, were all part of a great moment on a cold sunny day filled with fun and relaxation. Have an icecream and sit on a bench, bought some of my childhood feast back.

Pretty park. If you have time, stroll around in the park but if you don't…i would still pass by this place (walking briskly) as you make your way to other attractions nearby. I walked from Buckingham Palace to the park, its very close by. It wont hurt to take 10-15 minutes to see this park. Coming from someone who had about 8-9hrs in london before I had to catch a flight. LOL.
Lovely space. Whatever the weather (except rain and snow obviously) St James's Park is a good place to spend time. Lots of open space for kids to run about, or just a place to walk and think.

Best park in London for kids. All children will enjoy seeing the ducks, swans, geese, lovely flowers, ponds and fountains here. A most enjoyable setting to let children run and play for a bit. Very close to Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, and Buckingham Palace.

Don't forget your nuts!. Just about our favourite park in London. Loads to do, lots of lovely views and the squirrels are bonkers, come running right up to you and are very friendly, just don't forget your nuts to feed them, if you do you'll have furry friends forever.

Beautiful park and a great place for afternoon stroll!. I had a few extra hours in London and decided to take a walk around St. James Park which turned out to be a fantastic decision. The park is right in the center of London, but is a great place to get away for a few moments. Would recommend to any weary traveler who just needs some peace & quiet.
Enjoy nature. Walked past it on the walking tour I took. Beautiful. Well worth a proper explore. Not far from other attractions like the war rooms, where Churchill sheltered during the war.

One of my favourite Park ever!. Amazing and very relaxing Park. Friendly animals most of all squirrels ;-) I love to feed them with nuts. The park is full of benches and perfect to go if you want to read a book and relax yourself. So many different kind of flowers and accurate gardens. Fantastic place for all those people who enjoy Mother Nature

nice walk around Buckingham Palace. We went there on a friday's noon. You can walk in the park & go to the palace of the Queen at the end of the path. You will sse some guards in typical garments and the park is full of birds & squirrels. You have the possibility to eat and rest quitely, so if you want to get a moment off during your trip in london this is the perfect park with Hyde park
Nice bit of quiet in the city. I strolled through here after walking from Covent Garden up to Buckingham Palace. It was nice and quiet there and I really enjoyed it

Delightful. This is my favourite London Park. I could not possibly say just how many hours I've spent there over many lifetime. Now that I no longer live in London I miss it terribly & therefore, it is a given whenever I am on a visit. I always find it delightful even on a rainy day. I don't find it dreary in winter either. Such solace in the midst of amazing places & busy London life. A 'friendly' charmer.

Friendly Animals. I took a walk by the lake in St James Park where there were wierd and wonderful birds mixed in with the pigeons! The squirrels there were so bold compared to most and people were hand feeding them! Great diversity of wildlife!!
Pretty even in the cold rain. I think the best thing about this park is that you can pretend you are truly a wealthy Londener out for a springtime stroll!

Between central attractions. A good sized green space between Parliment Square and Buckingham Palace (with a lake). This is a lovely space with many pathways which connect to all edges of the park. Flower beds are planted according to the season and look spectacular. Good views of Buckingham Palace.

A lovely walk for some peace and quiet. St. James Park is a nice place to enjoy a stroll away from the Park Lane throngs of people. Flowers were popping up given spring time, although the wind and drizzle during my walk made it seem more like autumn! Regardless, plenty of birds singing, and squirrels walking right up to me, perhaps they thought I was going to feed them. Overall a nice place, small enough to walk around, get some fresh air and enjoy peaceful time.

Overly friendly squirrels. Wonderful place for a stroll in the midst of a day of sightseeing. Great place to relax and enjoy a sunny day. Maybe pack a picnic if you have the time. I would be wary if you have anything of the edible variety. The squirrels here fear nobody and will gladly come up to you if you appear to be the least bit inviting. I definitely recommend going in the spring or autumn.
A sunday stroll. A lovely small park which is ideal for a leisurely stroll between Green Park tube and St James Park tube.
An Oasis in the City. A lovely place on a sunny day to sit and watch the world go by - a beautiful park to have a little peace and quiet amongst the hustle and bustle
