Great walk in central London. A beautiful central park that incorporates lush greenery, beautiful plantings, fountains and water features. Walk its meandering paths to historic sites like Buckingham Palace, guards etc.

Don't Miss The Horticulturists Creation Of The Crown Jewels!. Directly across from Buckingham Palace is St. James Park. Great place to relax and enjoy people watching or feeding the wildlife. The park also has quite a large cafe/restaurant. We opted for the chicken and corn pie at the cafe which was quite tasty. We did not realize that there was this incredible display of plants and flowers creating a resemblance of the crown, truly incredible. The park is a nice place to escape the city for a while.

It is so close to the Palace, and also the other parks in the westminster area. Take a picnic and enjoy a break from the chaos of oxford street!

The most attractive park in London. St James's Park is very close to many of the major tourist attractions in Westminster, eg Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. It can therefore provide a welcome escape from the busy streets and, even when crowded, always seems to have a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere. A lush and green oasis in the heart of London. St. James Park is covered in lush, green grass. Located within the confines of the park is a pond, which is home to many heron, swans, and geese. The resident squirrels are friendly and will quikly scamper up your leg for a peanut. It is a great place to relax and unwind, or just find a park bench and people -watch. It is located across the street from St James Palace and a very short walk from Buckingham Palace, Clarence House, and the Horse Guards Parade. The National Police Memrial is also located on the grounds of the park.

small and perfect. small (in comparison to Hyde & Regents Park) but perfectly formed. One one side is majestic Buckingham Palace & the Mall and the other is the grand and powerful architecture of Whitehall and the Houses of Parliament. The bridge across the park's lake is perfect for the vista towards the beautiful domes and turrets of Horse Guards Parade.

A Good Chill Out Area. Wow a peaceful relaxing park right in the heart of London and especially good for people with young children wanting to let off steam.There is so much to see in the park lakes pelicans,ducks, geese, swans,and moorhens to name but a few and the tameness of the squirrels is quite fascinating it is well worth taking bread or something because many of the animals will feed from your hand. There are toilet facilities and plenty of food and drink places within the park and lots of lovely level paths for anyone with walking problems.Also the bonus is that people can walk from Horse Guards Parade Ground right through the park until they reach Buckingham Palace. There is ample seating all around the area too.Definately worth a visit to get away from the shops.

Visit when it is not raining heavily. We visited twice as the first time it was pouring heavily but the second time around was fun. Especially when you have kids with you. Our son enjoyed running around and having his own freedom. Great place for a family day out and relax

Beautiful. Lovely park, a short walk through Green Park from our hotel in Mayfair brought us here. Some superb views from the Serpentine of Buck House at one end and Whitehall at the other. An amazing small quirky cottage at the Whitehall end, I must look up the history of this. Only in London will you find parks like this. Oasis is the right word.
Relaxing. We walked in St. James Park early on a Saturday morning and it was almost like we had the entire park to ourselves. Very beautiful and relaxing.
Ponds & swans & green & open. Huge green park with ponds and swans in centrl London. You would not knonw you are inthe middle of one of the great cities of the world. A delightful oasis.
Fairly good for a nice stroll. just a by-pass beautiful garden after you've done the Buckingham Palace visit. Pretty decent and beautiful. Worth a stroll.

Beautiful park, and huge!. We walked through this park several times as it was close to our hotel. Very beautiful and some of the gardens were in bloom while we were there. Read the signs,as you can easily get turned around as you try to navigate between lots of tall trees and acres of lawns.
Lovely park. Very peaceful, tranquil little park off the Mall near Buckingham Palace. Lovely for a walk, quiet coffee or to feed the ducks.

London has Beautiful Parks!. Wonderful park, especially in the sunshine. Beautifully kept and lots of benches for picnics or reflection. Don't feed the geese ducks or pigeons, or you will be surrounded! Pity about the toilets (Ladies) which weren't as well kept as the grounds.....This may be due to the sheer numbers of visitors at the weekend.

What a great park! Beware the squirrel gang.. We walked up through the park on a drizzly morning but it was still peaceful and lovely. We walked through the park from the east (near the Royal Horse Guard) towards Buckingham Palace. There are a number of species of water fowl along enjoying the pond and, if you do it on Sunday morning, the Mall is closed to traffic so there is little if any traffic noise. Beware, however, the squirrel gang that occupies the area about 100 yards in. They are bold little creatures that will come right up to you for food. I say 'beware' jokingly as they were adorable. Even if you do not look like you have something, they come within a couple feet and wait for you to give them something to munch. Take a few nuts in your pocket. This little squirrel gang will certainly eat from your hand.

Another gorgeous oasis that London does so well.. Bordered by Chatham House, Naval and Military Club and the excellent East India Club and many other prestige buildings the park is tranquil a respite from the pace of the world, a charming well 'loved' oasis.

Beautiful park with overly friendly wildlife.. Accidentally wandered into this park after visiting Westminster Abbey to eat our lunch. Gorgeous setting. Ate on a park bench surrounded by birds, crows, pidgeons, ducks, swans, geese, and waterfowl I couldn't identify. Best of all were the red squirrels that i could have picked up because they were so friendly.

My favourite park in London. I love this park because it has everything a good park should have. It is not too big to explore every nook and cranny, it has water, St James Lake with many types of ducks, geese, swans, coots and moor hens. It has plenty of seats which are fine to watch the world go by. It is adjacent to the Mall and Buckingham Palace, it is easy to walk to from the Houses of Parliament. You can sit in it and see the London Eye. What is there not to love about it?

Such a lovely park!!. Lots of benches and wildlife. The gardens are immaculate and peaceful. There were lots of tourists but that didn't take away from my visit to this park. I was able to sit quietly and read my book and there were stands that sold hot and cold sandwiches and drinks.

A must if you're near the palace. Lovely good sized park for a stroll and sightsee without feeling you've missed out on something. I feel sometimes the parks in London are gorgeous but also too big to relax and complete in a day. This park has a mix of the ability to make you feel usurped in greenery, relaxed, and beautiful without being endless!
Lovely Park. Wander around and enjoy the sights. Watch for pickpockets - we had no problems but there were signs posted
Green space in central London. It is delightfu; to have a green space in central London, with water. Charges for deckchairs are steep!

A glimpse of wild life in the city. Great walk, not so great in the rain, but it finally got sunny on our last day in London and between all the pigeons, ducks, geese and swans, and the squirrels that will climb onto you to grab that nut out of your hand, it was pretty awesome.

Relax With the Pelicans. One of our favorite parks. A little threadbare after the Diamond Jubilee, Olympics and Para-Olympics in 2012, but they are moving quickly to bring the park back up to snuff. The Horseguards (beach volleyball Olympic venue) on one end and Buckingham Palace on the other, St. James Park is a great place to watch people and feed the birds. Don't forget to pick up a loaf of bread before you go. You'll make great friends with the ducks, geese and swans. They don't want you feeding the pelicans.
Loved it. Loved the little squirell running about the crowd and climbing up people's legs lol. The park is well kept as are most of th eparks in London.

Squirrels!. A nice retreat to make a pause or to just relax... Lots of squirrels and pigeons. Well, no wonder, if they are spoiled by tourists who feed them (even if it is not permitted, as far as I know)

The Royal Parks.... We were able to pass a lovely afternoon going for a walk down to St James's Park to see the three palaces that are located around the park. The park itself is a wonderful green space with beautiful landscapes. We also made the most of the deckchairs in the park to take some time out and rest our feet.

It was really nice surprise to find out in the middle of city such quiet, beautiful green spot. I like the garden, pond, and small farm. You feel you have seen far beyond city. It was peacefull nice place.

Calming break for a busy London!. We took a long stroll through St. James' Park on our way to Buckingham Palace. A small area of the park was under construction while we were there, but it hardly made a difference due to the large size of the park. It is quite clean with long and winding paths, plenty of benches, the ability to rent lounge/sun chairs. They also have refreshments available (Sodas, water, coffee/tea, candy, ice cream, crisps, etc) and also a sit-down restaurant within the park. As others have mentioned, the wildlife is very friendly and the squirrels will eat from your hand. I recommend bringing nuts if you would like to partake in this (walnuts in-shell are best). I suggest this as a great place to bring a blanket and picnic on a nice day.
Beautiful. Very Relaxing, we were there on a good day, so it was peaceful, and such nice relaxation around, as we didnt see any greenery until here in london, as everything goes too fast! x

Come to an outside concert at the Park. One of the things I love about British parks are the military concerts and the green spaces in the middle of a large city. You can choose a chair to sit but be prepared to pay an attendant for the chair, just a few pounds. Or sit until an attendant approaches, pretend that you did not know the chairs have to be "rented" and sit on a blanket on the ground. Fun to sit and watch people. Some concession stands available and right near the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. Get a picnic lunch and enjoy a nice lunch for minimum costs.
Picnic perfect. Enjoy the tranquility in the central of london and the squirrels begging for food perfect place to have a picnic.

a walk through the park. this park was excellent the well cared for flower beds and the solitude of the par was brilliant. although work was been carried out at the far end of the park it didnt spoil our enjoyment in any way.
Beautiful Park, anytime of year.. Visit this Park every time we are in London.be careful there are crazy Squirrels who enjoy climbing up your leg haha :)

An oasis in London. Even on a wet day, the park is lovely. More wildlife than I expected, and signs telling us not to feed the Pelicans. Having said that, we didn't actually see any..Renovations are going on, with lots of areas fenced off, for re-seeding. Even so - it was very quiet for the city centre. Well worth a visit.

lovely but stalkers in the form of dechk chaior attendants. The park is lovely oif HUGELY popular. It was full of tourists and you could hear the noise from the road. The deck chair people are like ninja's they jump out on you demanding payment so I just stood up and walked off! Otherwise ok if as I say vry crowded in tourist season

Incomparable on a sunny Sunday afternoon. The 9 year old in our party loved the ducks, geese, etc. in the park better than anything in London. One can feed them in designated areas. It is an extraordinarily relaxing stroll. If you like it, go to Kew Gardens, too.

Beautiful gardens, great walk from BP to Hyde Park.. The gardens, lakes, ample spaces for picnic, very accessible, lots of trees, walks. An easy stroll from Buckingham Palace to Hyde Park Corner and visit the new memorial for fallen airmen on Piccadilly, recently opened during the Queen's Jubilee.

True Love. I absolutely love this park and make a visit every time i go to London.There is no where really to buy food apart from the obvious burger/ice cream place but it's quite pricey for what you get.It's right next to the palace so it's nice to walk through either before or after going to see it.You can relax on the grass and or go for a walk along the pond, it's big enough to not get over crowded.Tip : take some nuts to feed the squirrels as they are so friendly you can feed them by hand.

A Haven of Peace in the Centre of London. This is such a lovely place to just wander in and there always seems to be something going on -- and yet you are in the very heart of London. It is the ideal place to drop in to when you want a break from all the Visiting you might be doing in London. It is well appointed with facilities and the lakes in particular give some lovely photograph opportunities. It is a great place to sit and really watch the world go by! Thoroughly recommended!
A walk in the park. This is a beautiful park, made for wondering whatever the season. Take your camera and enjoy the flora and forna, take a picnic and a blanket and have a chilled out day.
parks. lovely park to walk around if its a nice day plenty to see and places to sit and eat or cafes to go in
Beautiful Area. I walked through here as a byway to another area, but it was gorgeous. There is a view of the London Eye from the bridge in the park, and lots of nice places to relax.
Oasis. Beautiful calm green area in central London. Interesting history, well preserved and great Olympic legacy

A Little Haven of Peace in Bustling London.. Very close to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey and Houses of Parliament ( and St James Park Tube Staion) is St James Park.Take some time out for yourself, buy an ice cream and relax for a while. Deck chairs cost $1.50 an hour if you want to stay for a while.Chill out, feed the squirrels and get ready for more of London's many delights.

a total delight. ONE OF MY FAVORITE PARKS IN THE WORLD. I love walking, strolling, sitting in the grass or in the chairs. Bicycling. don't miss it. beautiful scenes, but go to the other parks as well and don't miss the Serpentine Gallery in Kensington!

My Favourite Park.. Used to walk around this park every lunch time when I used to work on Whitehall. Visited the park last week for the first time in a few years, and it looks as wonderful now as it ever has done. Without doubt, my favourite park. You can have a nice walk around the lake and encounter many birds and ducks, and even some pelicans! An idea break from a busy day of site seeing.
nice surroundings. following a lovely lunch , went for a walk in the park, lovely well kept nice place to relax on a bench and watch the world go by
St. James Park. Beautiful well maintained park. An oasis of peace in the middle of a busy city. Obviously, close to Buckingham Palace

Relaxing and full of friendly birds and squirrels. This park is excellent place to stroll around in if you have time enough i London and want to relax. All the birds are very friendly, even the pelicans walked around people. The views to Buckingham palace is also very nice. If you like squirrels they are plenty of them and very social and eat from your hands. You can buy peanuts in Tesco (Trafalgar square) for example and have lots of fun.

The quintessential city park. We didn't plan on visiting St. James park, we kind of stumbled upon it after seeing Buckingham Palace. What a find!The flowers were blooming, swans swimming in the pond, young couples holding hands and walking. It's like walking through a movie, everything you'd expect in a perfect park. We were lucky enough to be in London when the daffodils were blooming in the adjacent Green Park and that was stunning as well. If you're in London in the spring at can visit these two parks, you will see the best of what urban parks should be.You can walk them both in 20 minutes, but I bet you'll spend a lot more time than that. We didn't plan to see these parks, but they were one of the highlights of our trip. An unplanned bonus.
Beautiful park. It was a beautiful park and we had a good chance to stretch our legs. Unfortunately the rain kept us from spending much time in the park.
nice and clean. nice park, very clean good to have your lunch break in if away in london with work.relaxing and not to say if the weather is good of course.
Lovely Park. We walked through the park to see Buckingham Palace ... it was really nice ... the mall was closed off so this was a short cut.

The best park in London!. The view from the little bridge down the Buckingham Palace end of the park, looking up towards Horse Guards, must be one of the most beautiful views in London - absolutely enchanting! Nothing to dislike about it!
Beautiful Park in the Middle of London. Great for walking and resting in Central London. Lots of joggers and bikers enjoyed the wide walkway and it was well lit at night.
Squirrels!. Very beautiful walk, lots of wildlife. Lots of benches to rest and watch the beauty. I prefer Hyde park but the squirrels were adorable.

2 pounds for a chair?. When you're a tourist you walk most of the day and then you happen to walk through St James's park and see a deck chair. By then you have sore feet, sore back etc and just want to relax for 10-15min. It's a shame they charge you for this. In Melbourne they put these chairs up and it's free to sit in them. So I was a little disappointed. So didn't use them and made use of the free grass.

Beautiful park near Buckingham Palace. We were lucky enough to be staying in London during a sunny September week end which made walking through the park very pleasurable. Deck chairs for hire and refreshments available are a welcome bonus.

Great Park. You can go through this park to reach Buckingham Palace. You get to see lots of different breeds of birds in the park. The time that we were there, it was right after the Olympics event, there were close sections in the park, bad timing I guess

My Favourite!. By far my favourite of all parks. Just sheer elegance, swans look amazing. take a stroll in your lunch break if you work nearby, you'll have a great day at work afterwards, or take a picnic on a Sunday. Beautifully kept grounds, immaculate. So proud it's in London!

My favourite park. St. Jame's park is my favourite park in London. I know them all but this one is the cosiest. Whenever I go there, I take almonds with me to feed the squirrels. They just love almonds and they even climb up my legs to get them.

Beware of aggressive wildlife!. This is a very nice park in the heart of everything. It can be a tranquil break from sightseeing - however, if you select a bench near the lake, you will definitely meet a squirrel. It will approach you from behind and put its paw on your shoulder. You will either find this charming, or you will leap from your seat and demand to leave immediately.

Great park to relax. Half way between Westminster Abbey ,Parliament buildings and Buckingham Palace.Great area to have an ice cream ,relax and watch different species of birds ( cormorants, ducks, swans etc)

Beautiful!. Took a lovely walk through St. James Park following the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. What a delightful place to enjoy the unusually warm weather. The park is scattered with lawn chairs so you can relax a little after a busy day of sightseeing. A little bit of Paradise in Central London.
Peaceful place amidst the hustle and bustle!. A beautiful, relaxing, peaceful place when you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of London.

Lovely park day or night. Last time I was there lots of building works along the park were happening so it wasn't the quietest of visits, but I do love the park and it is a quick cross route to other London Landmarks. On a sunny/dry day it is a great place for people watching. The exit towards Buckingham Palace is a good and different place to take a photo from.
simply amazing. one of my favourite parks in the world! simply beautiful, if the weather is amazing like it was when I was there in sept 2012, expect it to look like heaven!

Well maintained. This park is excellent especially if you have small children. There are many ducks and geese to be seen as well as squirrels all in the centre of London. There are vendors selling confectionery and a crown shaped display created out of plants. The park leads you out onto Pall Mall and Buckingham Palace so this is a pleasant experience if you are on your way to see some of the more popular attractions.

beautiful park. An oasis of peace in the middle of London. well kept and calming near to Buckingham Palace.Able to see the horse guards rehearsing for state occasions close to this park.Wonderful atmosphere.
Right next to Buckingham!. The pelicans in the park are giant! It is a nice short walk nearby the palace on your way to our from Big Ben, London eye, etc.

Wonderful!. An oasis of tranquility in the enormous city, this park, just as the other London parks, will calm your nerves and will cut you from the crowds of the megapolis. The fat and playful squirrels are a sight by themselves but the different birds of all colors and sizes ( geese, ducks and of course the swans) as well as the fishes that can clearly be seen in the transparent water really provide you with a relaxing feeling. You can feed them and they are very tame -- a clear proof that nobody dares bother them! It is a pity that some parts of the park were closed because of security concers as I was there 2-3 days before the Olympics. Still, I am glad that during the Olympic games,London and Britain were spared the terrorist attacks of past years and past events.

Beautiful / relaxing. We've been loads of times over the years on our visits to London from N Ireland. Love just sitting on a rug and watching the world go by; and wife and daughter love feeding the squirrels!
beautiful park lovely area. went there to see marathon but would have liked more time to spend in park its-self as was a lovely park and cafe, lots of birds and wildlife on lakes

Squirrels!!!. I spent the afternoon in St James's Park, bought myself a picnic lunch from the closest Tesco (which actually wasnt that close). It was nice and relaxed & great to see familys out & workers obviously on their lunch breaks. The lake was nice as was the cute little gardeners cottage. & I loved the squirrels! We dont have them in NZ so it was a real novelty for me to see them there.

Detox your mind. I can't do it justice... From it's wild life, to its lakes , and lush greenery leave you speechless and refreshed .It is an absolute must to start your day or to draw a grand finale. Regardless of the fact of it's proximity to a few touristic attractions, it stands alone majestic and sufficient to put a free long lasting smile on your face.Great for kids too.
Beautiful. The view and tranquility of the park is amazing. It's picturesque without trying. Great for an arvo picnic in the park.

A treasure in London. This is a true must do. Located between Buckingham Palace and Royal Horse Guard Parade the setting is simply beautiful. Many birds squirrels to see. Take a bag of nuts to feed the tame squirrels. They eat the nuts from you hand. A nice place to relax on the sunny day.

Hidden city taste of nature. Near our hotel and a lovely find in the centre of London. Super shortcut to so many places and relaxing after the hub of the city.
Unfortunately disrupted by Olympics at time of visit.
St James Park, London. There is nothing like a blustery cold morning for a walk at St James Park, London to enjoy the colours and active squirrels and birds that make for a memorable visit.

Relax while looking out for the Royals.... I have walked through this park many times. You have Buckingham Palace at one end of course, and at the other the back of the buildings which face Whitehall, including Downing Street. One side has The Mall leading down to Admiralty Arch, and the other side is Birdcage Walk which leads to Victoria. Horse Guards regularly leave the Palace for the barracks in Birdcage Walk and can be viewed from St James' Park, usually at 11am I believe, but best check that. You can hire deckchairs in the park and there is a small food stall, although I haven't tried it. Ducks, geese and squirrels a plenty. In the summer it is gorgeous.
Lovely park. Very nice park with a lovely lake and very cheeky squirrels. Very close to Buckingham palace. A nice spot to sit down on a bench for a weary tourist.

One of the best parks in London by far!. St. Jame's Park is a picturesque patch of green with lots of wildlife for kids and adults to enjoy! I always love going there and even after having seen it so many times, I always enjoy it as much as I did the first time I went.

My favourite park.... If you happened to be at the Trafalgar Square and you wish to visit Buckingham Palace you have to pass through the Mall, and next to this great park. It is such a sweet park, as I previously said, my favourite. Many varieties of birds and swans will surprise you. Bring some food to feed them. Also you can take some amazing photographs with London Eye as your background.

Beautiful vistas. This park is just off the side of bucking ham palace and the day was sunny so it was a park full of life many people and their kids playing in the park . A nice pond in the middle and geese swim right up to you , very nice
Beautiful. Both Hide park and St.James are beautiful, and well maintained. We bought groceries from Harods, and had a pick-nick lunch in Hide Park

The garden of Buckingham Palace. I used to work near this park, previously I had been unaware of it. perfect for a walk with young children who will marvel at the wildlife, a wide variety of birds, both big and small, and other animals, or just retreat here with a book or newspaper and escape London for a couple of hours. Very good restaurant in the grounds and a tea shop and ice cream stand. One of London's prettiest parks. Look down from the top of the park and you can see why it could be termed the garden of Buck House.

Peaceful Walk in the Sun. Have a walk around this Royal Park and try and find the Pelicans!!We walked from Buckingham Palace down to Westminster as an alternative to Birdcage Walk. Try out the deck chairs and picnic spots.

Nice place to relax. St. James's Park basically connects Buckingham Palace with the political centre of London, and acts as a green lung in the city centre. It's a great place to relax and disconnect, and you'll often see people laying in the grass, couples making a romantic stroll, or families enjoying one of the largest parks in the city centre. Too bad they don't allow you to go by bike inside the park.

Fabulous park to watch the world go by !. We walked all over London, visited Buckingham Palace and after we walked back through St James park. Beautiful and very well maintained. Joggers paradise and great to sit and watch the world go by, don't pay for a deck chair, just sit on the grass. Beware of hawkers and if not aware, it would be pick pockets paradise, which is a shame..next time, I would like to take a picnic, and sit back and watch the world go by.
Central London's best park. Just for the views from the bridge across the lake towards Horse Guards Parade......go early on a sunny summer morning - fabulous; I never tire of it.
Lovely setting. A beautiful place to escape the noise of the city, almost hard to believe it is in the center of London.

It's a park!. Walked through here with family and was not expecting anything too amazing, and I was right, it's a park. There are trees, lots of pigeons, some bloke hawking out deck chairs for £1.50 per hour and a refreshment hut that smelled like they did good hot dogs.

ghostrider. Visited the park a couple of times a very big place and well maintained everything you would expect of royal gardens. my only disappointment was the mapping was a bit vague and took several attempts to find london zoo , overall i recommend the visit

something for everyone. I enjoyed part of my run in this park. there are nice bridges and sights. On my trip some of the park was inaccessible as they were tearing things down from the Queen's Jubilee the weekend before. Although some of the park is closed to biker's, I did find a lot of them. There is plenty of shade and many different water structures, benches, trees, and flowers to enjoy.
Beautiful Park. It was a lovely summers day when l was at the park and it made the walk even more enjoyable. a nice place to take some lunch and sit and enjoy the views and the people in the park.

The best Park. In my eyes this is the best park in London it certainly is tranquil I love to sit here (if you can find a seat) for hours and watch the squirrels, flamingoes and other wildlife you come across.It's easy to get to from Whitehall too just go through Horse Guards Parade and it leads you straight to Buckingham Palace.There is a bridge upon which you have a manificient view of the palace.its a fairly small park compared to some of the others but not too crowded.
Nice park. Very quite and nice park for a walk or a break in the afternoon. Ideal to take a rest from the chaotic life in London and all its attractions.
Best to see when on the bus. We didn't bother walking around the park but its ok to see when driving past on the bus/ hop-on buses.
beautiful. so many lovely parks and all pretty flat. Lots of grey squirrels ( I know they are not native, but we loved them)
Gorgeous park but inadequate toilets. Lovely park with children's play area. Not enough toilets - a couple of portaloos on one side of the park was not enough for the amount of visitors

Great views of Buckingham Palace!. I visited this park on a very hot day and it was full of people enjoying the sunshine. It was nice to stroll through, the squirells are so friendly! The bridge in the middle of the park was a great spot to get photos of Buckingham Palace. Unfortunately when I was there half the park was closed due to the Olympics but it cant be helped.
Peaceful and quick walk to Palace. This park is near the palace and also a lot more quiet than hyde park. recommended on a hot day - make the most of good London weather!

stunning. a beautiful park to walk around if you want to get away from the busy city; it is London's Central Park. Squirrals are very friendly and unnverved by people so you can feed them and they are very cute. A great place to see some of London's most spectacular palaces.

Pretty as a picture. I am staying with my son at Waterloo, in London and decided to make good use of a spell of sunny weather in the morning on saturday, and wander off to a nearby English park. Friendly tube station attendants, Bobbies and Paralympics venue staff, pointed me in the right direction and soon I was following mobs of tourists as they too made their way into the area. Once inside St James's Park I was struck by the wonderful landscaping, the pretty flower beds and the Tiffany fountains, the fat pelicans, inquisitive moorhens and host of other waterbirds and umpteen squirrels that seemed so comfortable amid the throngs of visitors. The golden cherubs atop the statue outside Buckingham Palace peeked through a shroud of trees ..... managed to get some nice pictures too.Although there was a bit of jostling in some of the areas, on account of it being peak season, the park did seem to be big enough for everyone, even though one part was blocked off for the Paralympics event related arrangements. I had a lovely time exploring the park. Next time I will go with a sandwich and a flask of coffee and sit on one of those easy chairs and do my sudoku/crossword.Got a glimpse of a Canadian women's team going off somewhere to practice for the paralympics too!

Beautiful. My favourite City Park ever, anywhere. Bustling with professionals and tourists alike, ideal short cut to get anywhere in Central London and just so beautiful. Great for a picnic or a break from the office!

Delightful. I like walking through this park form Victoria towards Trafalgar Square. I never tire of seeing the ducks in the pond, stopping to enjoy the seaonla flowers and sit on the grass to catch the sun... when it shines :)

Really scruffy after the Olympics. Why?. I was really disappointed returning here after not visiting for a couple of years. It was so scruffy, with remnants of the olympics littering the place. What must our foreign visitors think?

A beautiful park for a leisurely stroll.. A beautiful park for a leisurely stroll in the heart of London. Great to see the ducks, geese, swans and even pelicans in the water, and the famous deck chairs on the lawn. A real treat was to see views of Buckingham Palace and to walk part of the 7 mile Princess Diana Memorial Walk and see memorial plaques set in the ground along the way.

Nice central London park with cafe and space for picnics, just.. Surrounded by royal buildings and near to some of London's most famous attractions, St James' Park is a good spot to take time out in the sun, and they also have a decent (but expensive) cafe/restaurant (and toilets, which is handy!).

Beautiful Any Time of the Year. I was visiting in the autumn, and it truly was beautiful with all the leaves turning. The thing I like about this Park is that it is used by Londoners, and it is a relaxing and peaceful refuge in the centre of the city, where you can sit and watch people on the way to other places. Of course, the squirrels are uber-cute and the other wildlife - geese, swans, ducks, pigeons are relatively tame too.It is a great way to while away a few hours, especially if you have children, and best of all - it is free!
Beautiful. A lovely park with superb views between Buckingham Palace and Whitehall. View from the bridge is not to e missed.
A beautiful park in central London. A lovely verdant park overlooked by Buckingham Palace. Some wildlife and views of Westminster. Green Park is nearby too.
Very Picturesque. a lovely park right near the royal palace. in spring the sunshine makes it amazing - great to sit down and read a book or have a coffee break in the middle of sight seeing
Realy nice. My favoritt park!Here you have the birds and the cute squirrels.Nice to walk in and come up to the Royal palace.

Beautiful gardens. The gardens were very well maintained and lovely. I wish we'd had more time to explore the park. It was busy there, as preparations were in progress for the Diamond Jubilee celebrations.

Lush green paradise (with water birds) in the centre of Lonon. Take a walk, admire the birds and flowers, rent a chair, eat lunch, and you can do it all in an hour at St. James. A truly English experience, stunning views of Buckingham Palace.

Whats happened?. We have been to St James' Park many times before and really enjoyed this open space in the heart of London. This time was a great disappointment. The whole place looked uncared for and overrun with crows and pigeons. There was a great deal of rubbish around and the flower beds needed some serious work to bring them up to their former glory. I think the presence of the Olympics might have had something to do with the decline, however, you would have thought that with all the extra visitors a greater effort might have been made

I liked it a lot but..... I really liked St James Park but since it was in the Queens Jubilee it was CROWDED, I prefered much more Regents Park instead of this one. But it's beautiful and maybe you can get it with less people which shall be amazing then :)

One of the more regal of London's exceptional collection of city parks.. Very beautiful and exceptionally well maintained park, in the shadow of Buckingham Palace. Fantastic collection of wildlife. Worth the visit around lunchtime, when many of central London's workforce take their chill-break here, away from the pressures of Londonite tribulation.

Beautiful gardens. Very nice park to take a stroll, relax from the city rush, and enjoy nature. Flowers are well kept and beautiful. It was a sunny day with nice temperature and locals take advantage to take a sunbath.

St. James's Park - Beautiful. St. James's Park, in combination with Green Park, Hyde Park, and Kensington Gardens, should almost earn a full day of your travel time. Without any exaggeration, they are some of the most beautiful parks that I have ever seen. Even if you don't have a full day to allocate to the parks, try to at least take a quick stroll through part of one when visiting nearby attractions (Buckingham Palace, Serpentine Gallery, Horse Guards, Westminster, Trafalgar Square, etc). The landscaping varies from au naturale to manicured, yet all of it is stunning. The abundace of wildlife (squirrels and MANY species of bird), considering that the parks are right in the middle of the city, helps attest to the quality of these parks.

A beautiful and peaceful respite from London's bustle. St. James's Park is a serene collection of gardens, lawns, ponds, and groves of trees, perfect for a stroll. It's also easy to find, as it's bordered on the north by the Mall, and Buckingham Palace sits at its western tip. Make this part of your walking tour when visiting Pariament, the Palace, and the Horseyards.
Neat and Tidy. Lovely displays of flowers variety of wildlife lots of places to sit and soak up the sun or sit in the shade on the whole very pleasant park

Small animal sanctuary. I found the animals in this park not only abundant, but also very friendly. If you take some small nibbles with you, the squirrels will gladly take them from your hand. It is peaceful and calm within the park, a nice contrast from the city. There is a beautiful stroll around a large pond filled with all sorts of birds. Within walking distance from several big attractions (Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, etc).
beautiful stroll. Great walk from from Westminster Abbey to Buckingham Palace with a beautiful lake. Great place to stop for an afternoon break for coffee or ice cream.

Beautiful.. Very nice park with plenty of seating. Take a photo of Buckingham Palace from small bridge there. Also, while on bridge, turn your back to the Palace - you will have a great shot of the London Eye.

Great place for a picnic. We loved taking the grandchildren to St James Park for a picnic lunch as we started out two-day trip to London. We arrived at 11.30 just in time to see the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. Only down-side was the location of the toilets and the very long queue - come on Boris, get this sorted out - visitors to London deserve more than two portaloo buildings.
Lovely space. Had a nice leisurely walk through park. Good facilities. Nice to relax in. Great view of palace. Clean and gardens well kept.

Calm in the City. I work just a few minutes from St James's Park and often find myself walking around there of a lunchtime throughout the year.The views of Buckingham Palace are wonderful and there is plenty to see around the park too. I often take monkey nuts with me and the squirrels will gently take them from your hand (or run up your leg and sit on your shoulder).I enjoy coming here all year round just to observe the colours of the season and get a little 'me time' from my usually busy days in the office.

Lovely and central. There's no way you'll miss this park on your visit to London, unless you plan on skipping Buckingham Palace, which seems unlikely. It's very close, and the Changing of the Guard pretty much goes right by. The park is well cared for, with ponds, swans, flowers, and is a good stroll. It also connects to Green Park (free chairs on the lawn for tired souls), and can get you a good distance away from cars and noise.
Nice place to take a stroll. Very pleasant park to sit and read a book. Lots of greens, Roses are adorable. A good place to take a stroll.
Glorious day. Loved the rolling grass perfect for a picnic with plenty of kiosks for the obligatory ice cream! Plenty of shady areas too as 30 degree heat
A beautiful place in such a busy City. A calm oasis in the busy city. Visited on a very hot and muggy day and felt the world around me melt away

St James Park blocked off during paralympics. Coming back from houses of Parliament we had our route planned back to our hotel on google map but found St James park blocked off all around the park and all the entrances but one blocked off with no signs or directions for altertnative routes and got into a panic as it was pitch black. Got in one entrance but then couldnt get out. Even the staff at the entrances didnt know where we should go. A 10 minute walk took 50 minutes and we were exhausted! spoilt what had been a perfect day sightseeing and was annoying as we had made our plans so carefully. I understand that this is due to paralympics but still signs (which are lit up) should warn you as you approach so u do not waste your time and end up going to far to be able to turn back! Especially when its dark (well it was pretty dark at 8.40 when we started but very dark by the time we found a way out at Buckingham Palace. So much for our short cut!) ! Hotel told us many people at the hotel had the same problem :(

a wonderful walk. We love the walk from Mayfair and our hotel thru Green Park and then St. James Park. No matter the season, it is a must thing to do. Wonderful flowers, views of historic places. Great to leave Mayfair and end up in Whitehall on just a simple walk!
Beautiful. This park is a lovely oasis of green in the capital and sometimes overlooked. Well worth making a detour to walk through parts of it if you are in the area.
Beautiful Park!. This was a lovely park close to Buckingham Palace. Great place to picnic or catch parts of the Changing of the Guard.

Beautiful. Great views of the london eye and buckingham palace!! Beatiful place for a picnic or just chill. Careful with the swans!! They are very beautiful but might get aggresive when trying to get too close!!
Classic London Park. Great place to take a stroll and experience London. Easy to access and a pleasant place to spend a few hours.
Nice place to sit and eat lunch. We went to have a look at the Palace and had our lunch in St James's Park. It was great just to have somewhere to rest in Central London.
A lovely park. This is a great park to sit in when it's sunny or walk around when it's not. It's lso superbly well located for getting to other great London attractions.

Lovely park. It's lovely to see that a city so big and urban can still make room for such a lovely park. I enjoyed having a sit down in this park, watching all the nature and taking a short break from the fast pace that you find when you leave the park!

Good place to chill. My friends and I, we meet once in a while in central London but as a student our budget is limited and we usually save it for quality food later on in he day. So what do we do? we go to parks and by far, St.Jame's Park is mine and my friends best place to chill. The place is so pretty, the scenary are amazing, and its easy to get around too. Would be coming here often in this summer.

On a sunny day.. Lovely location with Buck House in sight at one end and the Mall running down one side. A bit disrupted by what's left of the Olympics and could walk all the way through as it was blocked off.

St. James's Park. All of the parks in London are very beautiful. I remember the swans who swim in the lake. They touch their heads and make a heart between them. The park is clean with a lot of flowers. It's close to the palace, so you can't missed it. :)
great place small rooms. great place very close to all neede for turist in London.Kind staff.Very very clean !!!Good breakfast.Rooms very small and no closet.No family rooms.
St. James's Park. Lovely and prinstine...and away from the central noise of London...you can even see the St James's Palace...

Relaxing and feeling in nature at the middle of the city. Nothing better than strolling in the park to relax while visiting London. You get sights of the Buckingham palace between the trees and yet enjoy all the green space making you feel you are out of the city.
Beautiful. I wild recommend getting bikes and cruising through the parks. They are amazing as long as it is to raining
Relaxing and easy to get to. We had a great time walking around this park after we watch the changing of the guards. Lots of ducks and geese and nice views of the city and Buckingham Palace
Perfect ona sunny day. The children loved this park, feeding the ducks, squirrels and fish, a nice place for a rest after watching changing of the guards.

gorgeous. green haven in the heart of the city, when i worked nearby (buckingham gate) and would just sit on the grass there near the water side, you could buy an ice cream from the vendors there and just sit and enjoy the sunshine. Londoners are very lucky with the green areas we have.

Favourite Park in London. A very pretty park to meander and catch breath specially in Spring with the cherry blossoms and daffodils. An elegant lake with birdlife. Close to Jermyn St and Horse Guards.
One of my favirote parks!. It manages to combine a beautiful green space with the the city with veiws of thel London eye, the treasury and of course Buckingham palace!

Beautiful and green park. We walked through the park to Buckingham Palace to view the womens' marathon in the 2012 Olympics. There are nice walkways. It was raining while we were there, so it was a little muddy. Beautiful trees and grassy areas abound.

Beautiful park. It's a really beautiful park in the heart of London and a must-do on your way to Buckingham Palace. If there's a bit of sun out, every Londoner will be out here relaxing, playing ball, and tanning him/herself.
Pretty park.. Very pretty park. Enjoyed walking through after we had viewed Buckingham Palace.Quiet area- hard to imagine it is in the middle of a very busy city.
Beautiful!. This is where the group I was with spent New Year's Eve, and the show we got to see - with the fireworks and what not - was amazing!
Our prefered park during our stay in London. We went there and had a very nice walk, relaxing, admiring the gardens, a great afternoon for the family visiting london
Squirrels!. Just a beautiful place to take a walk on a beautiful sunny day, and my husband had a great time plaing with squirrels, as he'd never seen one before!
Lovely escape from the city. Lovely escape from the hustle and bustle that is the big city of London. Just to stroll through as a family after visiting Buckingham Palace.

Senctuary. This is a special park that is unlike most of London's lungs, as pretty as it is for humans, it is a senctuary for animals.
Animals there are very friendly, but don't push too much as ther are still in the wild.
Oasis in the Heart of London. this really is a beautiful space. its right across from Buckingham palace, just off the mall, down from trafalagar square. amazing for a picnic on a summers day
very nice park. just went out with my girlfriend just for a short walk around green park but we spend almost 4 hours unknowingly walking around the st james park and we enjoyd that
Great for wildlife and a relaxing walk. A great break from the hustle and bustle of London. A ton of different kinds of birds and animals are all over here. Take your time walking through this park

an amazing place!. just a walk in this place can make you feel like totally out of a city, higly recomended but not during olympics, huge portion ( near trafalgar square ) completly closed because of olypic venues .
Lovely place. Visited here many times, and had occasion to wander through to the Horse Guards Parade for the Olympics London 2012 Beach Volleyball sessions. It's a great place to be.
enjoyable stroll away from hustle and bustle. very nice place for walk, take some nuts to feed squirrels as they are very tame and it is a treat to feed them

A really pretty park. It has plenty of room, the atmosphere is just lovely, the animals, flowers and trees really contribute to the place. Many benches, shade. It's a really nice park to spend a few afternoon hours.

Nice walk in the park.. Unfortunately, St James's Park was very busy and access limited because of preparations for the Queen's Jubilee celebrations. I have been there on a previous visit to London and enjoyed a walk in the park, it wasn't raining then either!

Loved it. Wow ! Spent a afternoon with my family and everyone loved it. Lovely atmosphere, great surrounding .. You can easily spend a day here. This park is amazing. I would love to visit here again.

green very green. a very huge park with lots of tree n fountain. just behind the Buckingham palace. u can walk through the park to reach picaddily circus. i felt very fresh visiting the park. it was great fun specially families with children.
Small. nice. I like this park because of good location and park it is not very big. Around you can find nice coffee shop. Just I didn't enjoy so much because it was a party near.
A walk in the Park. Loved being close to St. James's Park for walks and it was our route to Horse Parade and the Olympic Beach Volleyball matches!

A welcome respite in busy London. We thoroughly enjoyed a visit to St. James's Park on a Saturday in May. The gardens were all abloom and very attractive. The day we were there, the park had many scout groups that were participating in games and relays to raise awareness of the need for shelters for homelessness caused by natural disasters.
Gorgeous grounds. Perfect place for an early morning stroll. Quiet joggers, equestrians, and the birds make St. James Park a lovely start to any London day.

relaxing. We took at stroll through this park go to Buckingham Palace. Very relaxing and plush. It is mixed with ponds, flowers, and trees. Very nice walking and enjoyed seeing the fish and duckes in the water.
Great Place. Nice place to relax in the heart of the city and not far from the centre and all the attractions. Not good if its a raininy day
Pleasant walk. Lots of rubbish, sadly homeless sleeping there? Gardens, neat and attractive and plenty of rest spots, no bins?
Lovely oasis. We strolled through St. James's Park and marveled at all of the animals and flowers in central London.

Great place to Feed the Squirrels!. Massive park, great for a picnic on a warm day. Just remember to take a blanket and peanuts for the squirrels. They are super friendly and will just come up to you for food!
Superb Oasis. Great park in front of BP with a lovely almost Parisian feel to it. The bridge gives you excellent views and I always like seeing the swans.

Peaceful park with lovely gardens and views. Try to walk through at least one of the large parks during your visit to London - they are manicured, safe and lovely. Sit on a bench and eat lunch like a local, watch the people go by and just breathe. This is a convenient park for Westminster Abbey, the Cabinet War Rooms or a stroll down to Buckingham Palace.

Beautiful. It may not be the biggest park in London but it is very beautiful just the same. We went on a lovely day and found it quite by accident. It's very well kept and very green. There is some great wildlife in the park and it's a lovely place to walk around.
Kids Will Love It. In summer, it is brilliant, my kids loved it. There is a duck pond where kids can enjoy the view & stroll around the park

relax and watch the world go by. one of my favourite parks in london and a great place to take a breather when you have sore feet from all the sightseeing
squirrels are very cheeky but fun to watch

One of my favourite places in London. Much quieter than Hyde Park and it's a more intimate setting. Pack up a picnic on a Sunny day and sit near the ducks. So peaceful. One of my favourite indulgences in London is to go here for an hour and just do nothing!

Beautiful Park. This beautiful park is so close to Buckingham Palace - we walked through on our way to see Changing of the Guard, then had to go back again for another more leisurely stroll. It is very lush, green - and such a relaxing atmosphere, right in the centre of the city of London. The park has plenty of squirrels, swans and water birds. We were enthralled by the squirrels who hold their food in their front paws and sit up on their hind legs - they came so close to us and we took many photos, as we do not have these at home and we found them to be charming creatures. Try to stop in here on the way back from viewing the Change at Buckingham Palace - if it has been crowded there and you have been jammed in amongst hundreds of people for the best part of an hour or two, then you will welcome a spot of relaxation and breathing space in St James Park.

Summer had arrived that day. We were able to mingle with the crowds & sit & watch the world go by on a brilliant sunny Sunday......This park is well kept & tidy.....no litter & empty binsIt made a lovely end to our weekend in London
Lovely park. We enjoyed this park, but more so, the beautiful homes that were on the border of the park. The park is very lush and green and well kept.
Beautiful park. This is a wonderful place to wander down paths and see displays of flowers, ponds with swans and the views of Buckingham Palace. Great place to watch the changing of the guard.

Perfect place to enjoy a sunny afternoon. In you come donw here on a sunny day, you will find plenty of people resting on the lawn. A perfect place to rest after long hour exploring London. Bring your own food and drink to have a picnic there.
A good place to relax. Preparations for the beach volley ball meant a long walk to get there! Agood place to sit in the sun, watch the ducks and relax.

lovely!. relaxing chilling place on a hot summers day which a picnic ideal place to visit for couples families and groups. If the weather gets to hot there are alot of shade areas i would recommend as it is in a great location.
Lovely Park. Went here with the kids on route to the Palace , beautiful park but lots of it closed off due to the Olympics, loads of people about and place was buzzing, very well kept gardens .

Excellent walk, ate lunch in the grass, on the way to Buckingham Palace. We bought lunch at a little cafe by Westminster Abbey and headed toward Buckingham Palace looking for a place to sit and eat our lunch. Just happened on this park, has a lake, tons of grassy area, and leads right up to Buckingham Palace. We sat in the grass and ate our lunch and the kids ran wild. Beautiful flowers and trees blooming everywhere, very relaxing in the middle of the city. Park is probably even better, but much of it was blocked off for Olympic events preparation, thinking they do volleyball and some running events start here. Use it as a good rest/break area during your sightseeing around London, easy walk from Westminster, Buckingham, London eye, etc.
Limited Space, Poor water quality.. Preparations for the Olympics inhibited our use of the space. The water did not look well cared for.
Gorgeous!. We loved this park. Enjoyed watching the swans swim and the squirrels dart about. It was stunning as the blossoms had just come out and everything was blooming. Magical place to relax.

What makes London so unique. St James's Park is beautiful and peaceful. You wouldn't know you are just feet from some of the busiest streets in London. St James's Park is just one of London's many parks. Strolling through them on a sunny day, you realize how fortunate you are to be in London and how London is unlike any other city. Trees, people, friendly staff. Wow.

Lovely park near to the sights. We often visit here before walking along the South Bank. Our son loves the childrens park and all the squirrels everywhere.Nice way to spend an hour but probably not any longer.

Squirrels galore!. St James Park is well kept with plenty of park bench seating and relatively smooth footpaths. The park is full of wildlife from Pigeons to ducks and particularly many cheeky squirrels who were bold enough to eat out of the hands of the general publicThe weather during my visit was pleasant and the park was busy - plenty to see away from the hustle and bussle of the main commercial landmarks
Mid July 2012. Beautiful scenery, peace & serenity in the heart of London. The topiary tribute to the Queen's Diamond jubilee was beautiful!
Peace, flowers and water, perfect. Like all the many London Parks, this is a peaceful place in the middle of noise and action.

Enjoy nature & greenery of St. James Park. No visit to London will be complete without a leisurely walk through nature among the beautiful greenery of St. James Park en route to the Buckingham Palace. Great place to have a family outing on a summer afternoon.
Nice!. Lovely view of Buckingham Palace. Really big and all different places to walk around.

Well worth a visit. A lovely small park adjacent to The Mall, A pretty lake with many water birds and pelicans. Benches to sit on and enjoy the view or eat a sandwich. Deckchairs. Occasionally a band on a Sunday. Great in Daffodil time from the end of February.May be difficult to get into during Olympics. Suggest you enter from the Buckingham Palace end.

Beautifull scenery, great for bird watching. We went to the park one afternoon and luckily had great weather. We had an ice cream on a park bench and watched the swans, ducks, pigeons, and squirrels in their natural environment. Great hour spent.
Best park in London. Brilliant location for a run and just walk. Spooted alot of eggs there over Easter
Parks. Lovely place to spend an afternoon. Often pop there after shopping in town and before dinner.

a lovely "dry day " out with kids. There is so much in London that is free and brilliant andSt James PArk is one of these places. I woudl rather spend a few hours here than commit to the London Eye for £58 for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids. Free does NOT mean rubbish - far from it. Enjoy London without the expensive entrance fees
Lovely views. Come here for a respite in your busy day, walk and enjoy the views of the London Eye, the Palace and all. Very beautiful.

take some nuts with you.... ...and the squirrels will eat them from your hands!
If you are brave enough, let them climb up you legs!

Squirrels bite.. The Grandchildren loved the park , there was a crown made out of flowers which impressed us all, but what we will remember it most for would be the animals, I warned my grandchildren that the squirrels would bite so my youngest grandson had to put his finger out to see and said ouch, which gave the other two a laugh.
Pity about the disruption. A wonderful park unfortunately disrupted by preparations for the OLympics.

Small but lovely. The park is small enough to feel that you know it. Some nice plantings, fantastic waterfowl and the tamest herons you'll ever find. A great place for a walk or a run or to sit on the grass and watch the world go by. With Buckingham Palace at one end and Horse Guards Parade at the other, it's fantastically situated. Sadly, for the Olympics, its pleasures have been largely denied us as the place was being fenced off when I ran around there recently.
Maybe after the Olympics. we will return a sunnier day after the Olympics hoopla is over...it wasn't very inspiring in the early evening with all the security and construction going on...
Quiet and peace. Walk into green grass and among beautiful trees take us to a great felling of peace when we are in this park. It´s a really good example of partnership between nature and city.

Nice walk through the park. I had some time to spare before my onward journey from London so I decided to go for a little walk through this park. The park was very clean and quite busy as it was a sunny afternoon in London. Plenty of areas to sit and relax.

Brilliant!. I don't know what else to say, really. Londoner's really know how to make full use of their park space. What a lovely place to be! There are lawn chairs, places to purchase a bite to eat, drinks, comfortable walkways, wildlife galore, luscious grass and flowers, shade trees, and a pretty view of Buckingham..........You won't regret making some time for this green gem!
Fab views. The topiary crown is worth looking at, great for taking pictures of Buck Palace

Nice Place to Relax Between Sights. We planted ourselves down in St James' Park twice during a recent trip to London just to relax. The people and waterfowl watching was great. Parts of the park were closed off for post-jubilee or pre-Olympic festivities, but I'm sure this was only a temporary issue.
Nice for a visit. St James park is a nice slice of quiet in the hustle of London - but you need the sunshine or at least half decent weather to make the most of it.
Fab sight for lunch!. Love all the green, the birds, the tranquility. Perfect spot for lunch or afternoon tea.

Great views. Spring is the best - seeing all the birds with their young, and the light in the early mornings means the views from the footbridge over Buckingham Palace and Whitehall are lovely. But winter - with the geese looking as though they are posing for their portraits to feature on your personal Christmas card or the willow bending lower under the eight of the snow - gives a different perspective again

Lovely park and so huge!. We were amazed by the size of this beautiful park right in the centre of London. So big it doesn't really get crowded even on a summer's day. The flowers and the lake are outstanding. Don't miss the bird keeper's cottage on the lake

Great place to go when the suns out!. I used to work near here so lunching in the park was almost routine in the summer. Its a fantastic place to escape office environment for a bit - but extremely busy with tourists.Great for kids - variety of ducks and birds around the lake.
A walk to remember. This is a lovely park, full of flowers, statues, ponds. Great people watching! Clean and a great way to cut through town on your way to a museum
Good place to walk. Great park, beautifull lake. Squirrels all around you. Take some time and walk without concern.
Great location - nice features. The water is great, the swans and other ducks - and then a great view toward Buckingham Palace

Way too crowded, but its still a chance to relax for a minute. Park is medium size but due to its location next to buckingham palace its crowded to the maximum level. Forget about taking your family and stay there for a picnic. Its only for a quick walk, as the crowds wont let ya take a longer walk. Its just ok but there is no point in going there for a purpose.

Favourite London Park. A bit of a Hyde Park in miniture. Great for strolling, close to a number of main attractions (sits between Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards Parade). Some great wildlife concidering its central location - see squirels eating out of peoples hands (probably not recommended by the health and safety experts!), some quite rare waterfowl, even pelicans! Great view of Buckingham Palace over the water. An excellent place to step out of the hustle and bustle of London. Includes a couple of snack and drink kiosks.
Beautiful Park. All the Royal Parks are gorgeous. There were Swans with a row of babies. How precious. Saluting the Diamond Jubilee there was a gorgeous topiary of the Crown Jewels.

Lovely park. Husband and I strolled through after watching the Changing of the Gaurd and walked all the way to Westminster. The park is beautiful with lovely flowers, waterfowl and squirrels. Lots of people were enjoying the day sitting by the pond, biking or just relaxing in the grass. The flowers are also very pretty. Would have liked to spend more time here but we were in London for a limited time. Certainly worth a stroll though!
James Park, Queens Garden. Its a must walk through and you'll get a taste of royalty, well maintained gardens.
Lovely Walk. It is a beautiful park in the heart of London. Walking around it seems very healthy and cheerful. I like to visit it ever time I am in London.
A very beautiful park. Wonderful place for a picnic, to take children, in a nice part of town.

A Stroll in the Park. My wife and i took a leisurely walk through the park on our way to Buckingham Palace and Clarence House, the only thing missing to complete the walk was a military band playing in the park
Wonderful Walk. Great for a stroll; if you love to people watch, great place to relax with a picnic!

nice place to relax. 5 minutes from the hussle & bustle of piccadilly circus & 5 mins from buckingham palace a lovely park to relax with friends, partners or the family. as with most places food & drinks are overpriced & more choice should be available

Enjoyable. It was lovely day with my family
If you visitvlondon and didn't go there you will miss something
Take your camera!. Always worth a stroll. Take the time to relax and enjoy this magical spot in the heart of London! Truly beautiful with gardens and flowers year-round!

Nice place. A nice place to have a wander, there are a lot of activities going on in an evening there and also at the weekend. It's a nice play to go for a stroll and you can also hire Barclay's bicycles if you get tired of walking. There is though a bit of litter here and there, but it's still a lovelyn respite even if it is a bit difficult to get a seat on one of the benches during July 2012 because of all the tourists coming to see the Olympics :-)

The best London park. In my opinion, this is simply the best London park. Attractive landscaping, a lake with a bridge over it and views to Buckingham Palace, deckchairs, a bandstand and refreshments. What more do you need?
Oasis in central London. Always a treat to wander through the park. Children love the birds.
Calm. One of my favourite London parks where you have fab views of Buck house, enjoy your picnic whilst watching the ducks etc., on the lake.
St.James's Park. Love it, a piece of nature in the middle of a big city!!
A lot of green!. Big green park with a lot of plants, ducks, birds and squirrels. Nice place to go for a walk
Beautiful Park. Nothing not to like here; a pleasant stroll along a long lake with several benches and areas of green grass to sit and enjoy the view.
Wonderful park. Excellent for kids and adults alike. Full of birds, Queen's crown flower arrangement. Excellent walk.
Lovely walk. From Trafalgar Square walking toward Buckingham Palace, this is a very nice walk.

During the Olympics avoid this Park. I have visited this park several times before especially on route to Buckingham Palace but at the moment avoid the whole area of The Mall and park as this area has been allocated for an Olympic venue so there are diversions with The Mall closed as well as parts of the Park. After the Olympics put in back on your list but not before. Avoid.
Worth a walk. Near Buckingham Palace. Lively and beautiful city park.

Hand feed the squirrels. Well we travelled thousands of miles to see London but one of the highlights (favorite?) part of the trip for my wife was hand feeding almonds to the squirrels in St. James park! It is a beautiful park also and affords some great photos of the Eye and Big Ben
Beautiful to see. Georgeous and relaxing. Loved the greenery and flowers

BEAUTIFUL SCENARIES. What a lovely time we had walking through this beautiful park. The flowerbeds and plants are well kept and maintained. Beautiful animals all over the park and lots of squirrels to feed. Very clean.
-Free-. Lots of grassy space to run and picnic in. And it's adjacent to Buckingham Palace and right down the street from Trafaglar Square as well. Peaceful and fun.
Fabulous. This is a must visit park, well kept, the animals are gorgeous and it is small enough to walk around

Lovely Park. These are lovely park grounds and a great green space in the centre of London. Head for the bridge in the middle for pictures of the Palace in one direction and the London Eye in the other.
Great park to ride a bike through. There are free bikes that you can grab and ride around for 20 minutes for free. This was you can see the park.
nice park. It’s a nice park to spend an evening...near to Buckingham palace with a small lake full of ducks and a lot of friendly squirrels
Dog walkers heaven. Perfect for a walk with the dog! Often walk through this park as its large, central and dog friendly.
Too much building going on!. Lots of building work going out so you could only access some parts, not very well organised or signposted.
St James Park. Walked most of the park due to Olympic construction. Nice park in a major city.

My favorite park in London demolished by the olympics. Sadly, I was disappointed on our visit to St. James's Park last week to find that MOST of the park has been fenced off, leveled and re-constructed into an Olympic venue. I hope they are able to restore it to its former beauty once the Olympics are over. It really was one of my favorite spots in London, I remember playing there as a kid and on my honeymoon. The flowers were awe-inspiring. Last week, it was a muddy construction zone, overcrowded and filthy.
Super.. Lovely to see Peter Pan and take a turn around the gardens.

Wonderful Greenery in the middle of London. We had a lovely walk while enjoying the long ,daylight' evening. Unbelieveable to have such wide spread park in the middle of London (from NZ). Very pretty and great to see so many people out enjoying the park. The only slight disappointment was trying to understand how to hire the bikes - so walked and walked and loved every moment!

Divento London. Royal London through DiventoI have always wanted to go to London before but was overwhelmed by the possibilities and what tours to book. I found out about this awesome new app on the internet called Divento London. Although it took a little while to load, it was well worth it and extremely helpful. Another huge advantage is that you don’t have any roaming charges. The nicest part is the app is free and you don’t have to invest in purchasing an expensive travel guide book. The app has different “London walks” that outline a select amount of places to tour. I’m planning on booking tickets through Divento for the Buckingham Palace and St. Jame’s Park!
A Walk In The Park. A quiet respite in the heart of central London. A great place to stroll, people watch - or duck watch - or read a book.
My favorite park. My favorite park in London. I can spend whole afternoon in it and never be bored! Pure satisfaction!
Love the parks in London. Along with Hyde Park, green park, and Regents park, st James is also a good place for picnic with friends, sunbathing, jogging, and other outdoor activities...
Peaceful. Very clean and quiet, nice time to spend some time away from the city noises
Lovely picnic in the sun.. lovely park with old fashion deck chairs, ( small charge for these). can get quite busy though when the weather is good.

Lovely park. Even though it rained, we loved walking around the park, bumping into soldiers and the girls loved taking photos of all the squirrels and different flowers they could find, after we had a welcomed cup of tea in one of the cafe's
Great park and restaurant.... Even as a true citizen of London-I go here often and enjoy food and a coffee or two by the lake. I lovely oasis in a vibrant city!
Good for a walk. Spacious, quiet, close to Victoria, Westminster and Buckingham.
Great pace to walk and spend time. Was a fantastic place just to hang out, spend time with the kids and relax.

Bounded by Buckingham Palace, The Mall and Horseguards. As its located near Buckingham Palace it makes sense to visit it after viewing the palace. Its fun to let the kids run around especially on a sunny day whilst resting or having a light snack. Its the oldest Royal park in London and worthwhile seeing it for the lake with its collection of waterfowl..

St James My favorite park in the world. Love to visit every time I have gone to London the past 40 years this past trip I was there 40 times. I love to watch the beautiful ducks so many different kinds, flowers, the late people watching the views and a feeling of peace even when it is crowded. A couple where I was staying asked for directions to Buckingham Palace and asked any other places to visit in the area and I told them about St James and the next day they told me they loved it and glad I told them about it.

A great place for a walk. Very neat spot in the city centre with a lot of ponds, trees and flowers. Squirrels in the park are extremely friendly so beware, they might actually jump up your shoulder and beg for a bite. Great place for kids, too, with some attractions and a lot of animals to watch.
Escape for seconds. In the middle of the city, near Buckhingam Palace you can rest for a while. It is not very special park in London, there are a lot of parks in London and this is just one of them.

The best central London Park. Between Buckingham Palace and Horse Guards, with The Mall to the north and Bird Cage Walk to the south. The Guard's Memorial is at one end and the Queen Victoria memorial the other. The Guard's Museum / Chapel across Bird Cage Walk. Closest underground - St James Park [District & Circle].

Beautiful, peaceful park. We really enjoyed walking through this park on a drizzly April day. Our kids loved the birds that call this park home. It is a very tranquil spot right off the hussle and bussle.
beautiful park. we walked in this park daily. we really enjoy it! all the green in london is wonderful!

beautiful park!. Out of all the parks in London, this one has always been my favorite. There is a small lake in the center and tons of birds and squirrels running around. There are even some giant pelicans (literally taller than a child!) who will walk around on the paths and let people pet them and take photos with them!

Beautiful park near Buckingham Palace. Loved the park the first time here in 2010 where we had the best hot chocolate ver on a cold winter's day. This time it was not as cold, but very windy with dust and leaves getting into our eyes which did not make it a great day. However the park itself it beautiful with many great photo opportunities, or simply just to sit down and enjoy. The squirrels are always there and are not put off by tourists getting close to take photos. The hot chocolate was still good, but not as great as previously, maybe it needs to be colder to fast better! Great day out walking the park, lovely place for a picnic lunch when the weather is fine.
Peaceful. The park looked and felt lovely as great English gardens do
Walk the park then people watch!. Beautiful grounds and gardens to walk around with plenty of benches on which to rest. Buy an ice-cream and enjoy watching the people in the park.

I was with my girlie friends and we decided to visit St James' Park so we took a detour. and walked around very steadily and then sat on a bench and marvelled at the colours of the trees (which were in bright autumn colours), it made you feel good and to be alive looking at such beauty.

Yet another perfect London Park. Are the royal parks the very best thing London has to offer? I think they might be! Walking around the pond at St. James was so serene and beautiful; even the massive construction going on along one side ( was it for the Jubilee or the Olympics? Who know!) did not mar the wonders of this park. The waterfowl are healthy, diverse, unafraid, and such fun to watch.
Greenspace. Lovely park! Nice to go to some greenspace in a busy and packed city!!
Lovely in the Snow. Makes for a nice walk in the snow watching squirrels forage & chase birds. Not such a big park that feels unconquerable.
A little oasis. You can't help but enjoy the Park. It is such a lovely calming place to escape the rush of London's streets.
Very nice. Nice area and plenty to see. The park is worth the time to visit.
Romantic. Such a romantic park green, flowers squirrels, swans so peaceful in sucha busy city.

Very nice park and a good place to take a break in tourist central. This is a very nice park and a good place to take a break in tourist central. I think it's best approached, and most peaceful, from the Horseguards Parade/rear of Downing Street side. Nice to sit on a bench looking up the lake toward Buckingham Palace.

Gorgeous. We walked through it on the way to Buckingham Palace and it was gorgeous. All the flowers were in bloom and there were cute squirrels running all over the place.Very picturesque. Would have been nice if a little warmer though :-)

Very peaceful to sit and have a break from all the sightseeing. We 'stumbled' upon St. James park on our first day in London in our attempt to find Westminister Abbey. After spending an entire morning and some of the afternoon sightseeing and on foot, this was a lovely park to sit down and relax. It was so peaceful and quiet. Lovely green scenery in the middle of the concrete jungle!

Pleasant. A pleasant green area in the heart of Lodon. It's nice to be able to relax under the shade of the trees. A toddlers play area is situated a short walk away from the bridge that crosses the lake.
Joy. Best park in London in full bloom.overun at the moment with Olympic logistics avoid till September, best when flowers bloom by the cottage
Near Buckingham Palace. This is one of the parks by Buckingham Palace. Nothing particularly special except you will walk by it when on your way to Hyde Park from the Palace.
Great park. It's huge and relaxing.It's even close to buckingham palace if you want to visit some other attractions.
getting across the paddock. beautiful park located between our hotel and the West End. We traversed this park quite a few times & each time were impressed by its beauty and tranquiity.
a lovely wander around London. This is very near many major attractions in central London but I always feel very at peace here.

One of my favorites. I lived in London during school and have been back numerous times and St James is one of my favorites. Perfect combination of proximity to history, gardens, birds and all of the major tourism spots. Just to sit on bench and watch the world walk by is its own reward, but to do it in St James, well.....
oasis in city. OK, its a park, and a park is a park. However, this is in central London, near Ritz/Picadilly. It is an oasis in the desert of a city.

A relaxing area with water features and many varieties of birds. Just off the beaten track, but a stones throw from St James underground station. From Victoria street, turn down to the entrance of New Scotland Yard (a modern building of no interest) and without too much trouble you will find this spacious quiet area. Bring some bread if you take children to feed the ducks and other birds. If you are patient and quiet, stand on the bridge over the lake, place some bread on your outstretched hand and maybe, just maybe a sparrow will come and rest on your hand to eat the bread! All this is free, especially if you bring your own bread. Other attractions are not too far away either.

Little Green Spaces. My fave park near the palace. I love to go and sit there, watch people, birds and squiggles.
