The trees are amazing in itself and it is such a nice break to stop and smell the flowers.There is an assortment of ducks, geese and other birds to watch on the river.They offer a small canteen if you are hungry or thirsty.The only negative is that if you suffer from allergies like me, be careful where you sit and note that there might be a lot of furry hair on the ground and pollen from the flowers and trees.
beautiful peaceful place in the city. loveley and clean,peaceful with lots of wildlife.We visited on a sunny sunday morning -lots of people enjoying picnics and feeding the birds and squirrels.

An Oasis in the centre. A very clean park with lakes, cafe, toilets and walks. Swans, herons and pelicans can be seen close up. The best thing is the backdrop of the Park, it joins the parliamentary bulidings of Whithall to Buckingham Palace.Birdcage Walk is one side of it and the Mall is the other, both interesting places to stroll along.Plenty of seats or grass to have a picnic, and in one area is a bandstand and deckchairs.
Beautiful park. Love to walk here. Close to Buckingham Palace. Great views of palace and easy walk from Palace to Horseguards Parade.
A nice park. A nice park if you need to kill some time and wish to be surrounded by a nice nature atmosphere in central London and big enough if you fancy a stroll.

the best park in london. this park is my favourite of all the parks in london.there are lots of birds to see including pelicans and parrots flying about above you.the flowers and trees always look great.great for picnics and people watching in the summer
England at its best. A delightful escape from a very busy city. A band concert was occurring when we were there which proves the English really understand Pomp and Circumstance.
Lovely place. It was so pleasant to visit this park that I would love to spend all my time there but alas !!! Good lawns , beautiful flowers and the scene from the small bridge is awesome.
Beautiful, but a bit boring. I think its best attribute is that its between Parliament/Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace. I prefer Hyde Park more, with a swimming pond and horse/bike riding.
The roses in early spring are wonderful. I love all of the parks in London. This park is quiet and green with lots of lovely landscaping.
dancing with squirrels. It was not my first visit, but this time I found park almost better than previous. Enjoy "company" of squirrels, sound of trees and water.
Loved the waterfowls. I am crazy about nature, and loved to see all the animal life there. Lots of different water bird species to watch and take photos of
Great Park!. Fantastic place to go enjoy good weather or just to walk. Lots of live, different people.

A most beautiful park, near all the other famous sights. This must be one of the most beautiful parks in London, with formal and informal areas.
What I like, in particular, is its setting: bounded by Buckingham Palace and the Mall and Whitehall. Very popular with office workers at lunchtime.
Very relaxing. On your walk to pakingham palace, many lovely roses and vasting gardens, lots of squerrels and birds should be seen.

So beautiful!. St. James Park is perfectly situated to rest & relax a bit between the very busy Sites of Buckingham Palace and the Parliament/Big Ben clock tower/Westminster Abbey area. A very calming & charming park with its little lake and very happy waterfowl!
just beautiful. very large park with lots of diferent birds ducks geese pelicans squirrels running round and lovely plants very very nice

Recommended well kept but very diverse central London park. I was fortunate enough to work just a few minutes from St James' Park for many years. It is easy to take it for granted. Surely the views from the pedestrian bridge are some of the best in London? Tourists seem to agree, this must be one of the most photographed sites in London. The park has been allowed to grow slightly wilder in discrete parts around the lake especially, presumably to encourage wildlife which certainly on a recent visit seemed to be thriving. There has also been more focus on eating facilities and, unusually for London, there are free toilets.It is a small and relatively compact park, but with plenty of variety, and beautifully kept. It deserves its high level of recommendations.

Fabulous. I'm so lucky that I work opposite St James Park and regularly get to stroll around its fantastic, landscaped areas.The crowds at lunchtime can be a bit much, but, a walk round first thing in the morning, or late afternoon is a calming, relaxing experience.This time of the year the flora and fauna are a joy.Come and visit, you won't be sorry.
Wow!. You could think yourself in Arcadia. Lush vegetation, astounding wildlife, well kept features. And of course great and imposing buildings all aorund.
my favorite park in the world. Love this park, great for grabbing a sandwich and sitting down with a good book - and feeding the ducks. Gorgeous flowers.
a perfect place to walk and feel calm. It is a perfect place to spend some time out of traffic and many people.it is a vry beautiful park,in my opinion it worths more than Hyde Park
Stunning little park. The park is located near the hotel I stayed in it and is a small park, green, beautiful and pleasant. You can see many birds, squirrels. The park is close to Buckingham Palace.
Stop and enjoy the scenery. A large, busy park. Great views of the city. A wonderful area to sit and just enjoy the scenery. You can find a quite moment in the center of a busy city.

Beautiful Park. After seeing the changing of the guard, we walked through St. James's Park on the way to the Cabinet War Rooms and Churchill Museum and were delighted to discover this beautiful, well-designed park. There are lovely ponds, great views, lots of lawns with lawn chairs to relax in, etc. You won't be disappointed taking a walk through this park.
Relaxing. Stroll down the Mall, ogle Buck House, chill out in the park then pop round the back of Prince Charles' place for some good pub grub and a cracking pint.

Brilliant. This Park is fantastic with wildlife, relaxation, near to the Mall, Horseguards Parade, Buckingham Palace and others and Trafalgar Square naming but a few things to see and do including Westminster, Parliament, Downing St.

Cutting a dash through the rain. Great to revisit despite the rain on Jubilee weekend- interesting to see all the preparations for the celebrations. My visitors from New Zealand liked the lake ad the space in the city.
Jubilee Weekend. Very British, very good atmos[here, lots of happy people celebrating the Diamond Jubilee
great park. so many birds and squirrils that crawl up your leg looking for food..great times
Park. My favorite one! So nice and peaceful with all those birds.
Excellent Walk. Very nice walk for nature lovers. Very good sidewalks & lots of photo;s you will need to take
recommended. Relaxing place indeed. Near to Buckingham Palace as well.
Wonderful place to walk around and enjoy. We happened to be there during the Queen's Jubilee celebration, so the park was crowded but you can feel the emotions and elation of the people.
An enjoyable Walk. We enjoyed the park, it was clean and felt safe, a good place for all the family. it also enjoys wonderful views of buckingham palace.
Jubilee Concert. Enjoyed the atmosphere and good view of the large screen

Good views. Visited while on a day trip to London.
It's a nice little park in Central London and you are able to see views of both Buckingham Palace and the London Eye via the bridge.
It's a nice pit stop while walking around the main sites.
Beautiful setting. A small but lovely park that is well maintained and surrounded by impressive historical buildings, including of course the palace.

a beautiful place to unwind. We settled into St. James' Park twice in our visit, once as a brief respite as we walked from Embankment to Westminster and the Churchill War Rooms one afternoon and again as a thoroughfare from Westminster tube station on our way to Buckingham Palace. It is a wonderful place to watch people and amble along as a visitor to city life just as residents do.

Perfect, rain or shine. The atmosphere is amazing. Grab a picnic, sit under a tree and watch the world go by. The best views of Buckingham palace can be seen from the bridge and everywhere you look there's something British to see. In the evening it's lovely to watch local gym classes or to buy an ice cream (that are over priced) but its a lovely clean royal park!
Lovely park wonderful lake and delightful fountains. Do get to this park - one of the loviest in town. Wonderful floral displays. Relaxing and romantic. Great cafe.
A little bit of heaven.. Need a break from the hussle and bussle? Take a walk in St James park it's as close to paradise as you're likely to get in London.

Lovely. Although in the centre of London, you could have been miles from anywhere. A large lake with waterfoul, some tame enough to feed. A lovely sandpit for children and dedicated toilets and picnic area. Views of Buckingham Palace in one direction and London Eye in the other. Well worth a visit.

Best Park in London. This park is the Best in London, a Abundance of Plants and Wildlife, great for Picnics, good restaurants, i recommend inn on the park restaurant, they do fantastic Organic Lager Called Blondie. the Air quality is fantastic. Plenty of Deck chairs for Everyone. if you come to this Park bring bread and nuts for the Animals. it the best place to relax and De-stress after a hard Day.

St. James Park. It may be difficult when you are in a city the size of London with all it's historical and cultural attractions to take a walk in a park, but is lovely and worth the time. There are many historical markers that help you understand how this park was put to use by the Royals through hundreds of years. At one time it was used for hunting grounds. It is beautiful and a lovely diversion among the massive, bulging concrete and stone buildings of the city center.

next to buckingham palace. it has to be one of the best parks in london, your on the mail where the queen lives across the road from st james palace and up the a bit further is clarence house where prince charles lives.
Birdwatcher's paradise. If you want to see all kinds of different birds, come to St James Park! Herons and coots and morehens abound!

peaceful... Nice place to just walk about or sit and watch the world go by, especially during the summer months. Good view of Buckingham Palace and easy walk through from the park to Trafalgar Square and Leicester Square. I visit the Plark at least twice a year during the Summer and its always a pleasure
birds, birds, birds. I was taken aback with the wildlife for a park in the city!
Not Central Park. Nice park but just about average. We were there on a beautiful day and there were plenty of people enjoying the park however there was no really outstanding parts of the park.
St James's Park. It would have been nice, but the barriers were being dismantled from the Jubilee celebrations, so there were workmen and people everywhere.
Good for walking. Nice park for walking or running. Good atmosphere. Don't miss Hyde Park also.

Pretty. St James is a lovely change of pace from the city bustle - a slice of countryside in the middle of London. There is currently a wildflower meadow planting project in progress which is very pretty.
Pretty nature area for a nice walk.. A great variety of birds and ducks can be observed here in a relaxing setting.

AN IDEAL PLACE TO SPEND AN HOUR OR TWO.. This park is ideally situated to enable one to relax on any visit to London's landmarks of Buckingham Palace, Houses of Parliament, Whitehall and Trafalgar Square, which are all within easy walking distance.
Beautifull. The Park is Lovely,and a must is visit the cafe (or restarant)called "In The Park" Excellant.Flowers,animals,fountain lovely to see.
What's not to love?. Green space in the middle of the city. Great place to sneak away in the middle of the work day.
parks. loved all the greenery. great for walks and watching people. lots of birds singing.
diamond jubilee. great royal park able to watch the service from st pauls here then move onto the mall to watch the carriage procession

Peaceful, the place to rest you feet after walking for hours. The park is the perfect place to rest after walling around for the most part of the day. It was relaxing. Walking around the park, feeling peaceful, watching the ducks, the swans and the squirrels, you feel so relaxed.
Nice place. Great park! Nice for walks in good weather and not only in the summer :)

perfect !. clean , beautiful and a perfect spot to relax.manicured gardens ,wonderful atmosphere and friendly , safe place to visit .
visited twice over jubilee weekend . really impressed with cleanliness . many spots to sit and be away from crowd . excellent facilities and lovely tea served with a smile . easily accessible from tube or on foot
Great place to relax. Oasis in central London… Every time I visit the city spend at least an hour in that amazing park. There are less crowded areas, where you can enjoy peace and some nice views.
Nice quiet place.. Really a nice place. Despite there were prepping the place for the jubilee.
Worth the visit. Nice place to walk though especially in the summer of if your heading towards Buckingham palace.

Didn't expect to be serenaded by Paul McCartney.... We wandered in to St James's Park over the Jubilee weekend and happened to arrive just as Paul McCartney began rehearsing for the evening's concert - a real treat! The park is lovely, very well kept and must-visit for us on any trip to central London.

the queens jubilee. what a great park!we saw the concert on the mall and then the next day we walked up the mall to buckingham palace with thousands of brits to celebrate the queen.just a tip.if theres a big event at the palace,stay back near the admiralty archway because the police let the people in the rear go up the mall first.

Our own Secret Royal Park. This Park is not well know as it is hidden behind Downing Street and beside Buckingham Palace. It has a large lake that attracts unusual bird life. There is a great cafe which is run by the Parks so good value. Have a walk through but keep it a secret!
Beautiful. It was nice seeing the rich history of the park. It's serene and well taken care of. Our eyes popped at the information that there was a tree there which was actually centuries old!

Very Clean. There were birds, squirrels, ducks and tons of people but everything was still so very clean and tidy. They even had park chairs out for people to use. Not raggedy ones but comfy lounge/beach chairs. It was well maitained and kept.
Beautiful place. This park has to be visited. Ideal for a walk, it has fabulous views, the lake is full of waterfoul etc, nice place for a family pic nic.
It's not free. We wanted to have a picnic in the park, only 5minutes in someone came and asked as to pay. I don't know if it like that everywhere in the park, but it was still worth it.

Excellent place to stroll around. The flowers in the spring were beautiful. People were friendly and the surrounding buildings were full of history. Watch the Changing of the Guards by the statue outside St James Palace at 11:15 every day.
Beautiful. A great spot near Buckingham palace in which to relax and enjoy the scenery.
Beautiful. Such a gorgeous place to walk in the middle of such a busy city. Well worth it.
quiet and serene. beautiful park right beside buckingham palace. very pretty a great walk to relax after jet lag.

Jubilee Celebrations. What a great park, it was sunny everyone was out sunning themselves. There was a full dress rehersal for the queens guard ceremoney. So we got to see it all without the crowds.
We usually visit Green and Hyde Park but I think St. James Park is now my fav.

Serenity In The Midst Of London. A very peaceful and well maintained park with water features in the middle. There are a lot of birds in the park, including pelicans. We walked here from Trafalgar Square and this was just the break that we needed from the hustle and bustle of London.
My favourite park. Great park, not as famous as regents or Hyde park so less people, which I think is really nice, and it has lots to see and do. Plus lovely walk areas
The best park in London. St Jame's park is a wonder. The ability to wander in a wood land setting so close to the hustle and bustle of Victoria
awesome city park. all the spring flowers were out. easy to get to. so pretty. great place to walk.

A lovely stroll!. London has several beautiful parks and this one is among them. We strolled The Diana Princess of Wales Memorial Walk on our way from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey. It was a lovely park with plenty of places to take great photos.
A Beautiful Stroll. Take a beautiful and relaxing stroll through the park, while enjoying plenty of birds and massive trees.

Great Photo Opps!. St. James park in central london --the best photo ever is the view to Buckingham Palace from St. James Park. The lake is great...and the wildlife amusing!
Close to all the great restaurants and great shops!

bring bread for ducks. In the Queen's back yard the flowers are well done and there are supposedly 50 different types of ducks in the pond. I say supposedly because we only saw 30 or so. Apparently the others were busy elsewhere.
Great Sitting Park. Nice park close to the Palace, the Mews, Victoria Station. Great for people watching, lunching on a bench, feeding pigeons and general rest break.
Fun detour from the busy sights. Great little area between Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square to let little ones run around. Beautiful park!
Just Delightful. Would love to come back and spend time in Summer. Incredibly picturesque. An oasis in a busy city.
lovely. lovely well kept park, ideal for relaxing in the sun!
Park fit for a queen. Tops in my book !! Wow ,this park is so nice and inviting , if you travel to London , don't miss it
Great walk towards Buckingham palace. Since we had great weather it was nice walking through the park, always a good sight, nice flowers and animals all around.
One of Londons best Parks. A wonderful park with lots to see including Na Na ducks who are very friendly. The park also has a pleasant restaurant.

Sun, Shade and Ice Cream.. The park was packed, but still pleasant, with its shady areas and plentiful ice cream vendors fr the kids. The pigeons, ducks and geese always provide some entertainment and distraction, but are less interesting than having the world's diversity on parade. A great green space in the London madness
Wonderful park for a morning jog. It is really beautiful in the spring. Go out in the morning for a stroll.

My favourite place for a lunch break. I love going there during my lunch breaks. It's the perfect park for a walk, no matter the weather. You'll spot plenty of animal life and beautiful gardens, during most of the year.
Just a royal park. Englishmen know how to maintain a park. Period. Not a lot of garbage cans, but this dates from IRA fights.
Absolutely beautiful.. If you are lucky enough to have a sunny day while in London, take some time to walk through this stunning park. Enjoy the beautiful flowers, trees and various birds.
nowhere nicer on a beautiful day. there is a really nice cafe where you can have a drink on a terrace overlooking the lake -
Best on a summer's day. Lovely to sit in on a hot day, gets busy but doesn't feel too crowded. Clean toilet facilities and food/drink stands provided. Too many pigeons for my liking!
Lovely place. You forget you are in a city! People watch to your hearts conent - Watch out though some of the squirrels are mad!
Beautiful. St James's Park is a lovely public space in central London. There are often musical presentations at the bandstand.

Off to Buckingham Palace. Passing through here on the way to the royal home is the way to do it. When we visited it was a wonderful weather day and the Brits were taking full advantage, the park packed with people walking dogs, enjoying the sun. This is one of the oldest parks in London and was once the king's hunting grounds. Worth a stroll through just to enjoy the flowers and scenery. It is easy to forget you are in the middle of the city in parks like this.

Fairy tail in London. One of the royal parks in London. When it is hot day, you will find the best looking crowds in town.The best view of the lake/pond, it's from the top end of the pond, near the palace. It's a magical view. A must seen in the heart of the London,

Wonderful area to take a leisurely lunch. We walked all over London, it is very much a walking city. We took lunch with use and had a pleasant time walking thru the park. We went thru the park several times over our stay as its paths allow you to bi-sect the area.

Lovely walk to The Palace. This park is in a great location and runs between two great attractions, Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace. Walk from one to the other and see the pelicans and cheeky squireels while you do

Honest ice cream vendor. We visited St James Park after visting Green Park - no contest St James is by far supreior.we bought ice creams and walked away only to be called back bt the vendor because I had forgotten to take my change. Impressive honesty that deserves a mention.The park is well maintained and has some really good scenic views.Some of the planting was excellent, particularly the fig tree on the bank of tha lake at the end of the bridge.
Nice :-). Nice walk through the park on a sunny day! :-)Lots of deckchairs able to be used....
Beautiful escape. Gorgeous natural-style gardens with views of the surrounding historic buildings. Take a picnic or just take a walk. Don't miss it.

Cheeky!. One of the smaller Royal Parks, lovely lake and if you walk through the path that bisects the park (the one in the middle) you can get some great photo's of Buckingham Palace framed by the park
Something missing. Well, it all depends on the time you are going. While I was there, no flowers were to be seen, because some work was going on. Normally, though, the park is quite enjoyable.

Love the pond. St. James's park is our family's must do when we're in London. We stroll around the pond, eat ice cream on the lawn chairs and have lunch at the "Inn at the park".Lots of squirrels and birds. The pond is filled with fish taht kids love to watch.
Great place to visit. When the weather is nice, it's a great spot for catching rays, eating ice cream, and playing football.

very beutifule park. i like the the Evergreen of this place.
what we dislike was the problems to find the toilet
it was a hard jobe to find them.
Beautiful park. This park is in my opinion the best park in London. It has a lake, and lots of beautiful trees and animals.

Peace and Pelicans. Delightful for a stroll in London, enjoy an ice cream or coffee and imagine various kings strolling though the Park in the past. See the Pelicans, ducks etc and sit quietly and watch the people passing by. Spot an MP or two, or even a Prime Minister jogging.

Walk through St James Park. The park is amazing and clean, loads of kids from schools all over london and foreign were walking about. There big Pelicans that were in the park as well and was amazing to see one up close. The park has some amazing flowers which were in bloom when i was there.
One of my favourite parts of London. Great for families/couples/ even a few friends who wanna take a nice stroll and see the ducks :) It's exceptionally nice when it doesn't rain !

A beautiful park in the middle of London. I like this park better than Hyde Park. I went here in the early evening and there was not too many people here. Everything was green and lush which made my pictures turn out really nice. Even though its in the middle of busy London it was still quiet and within walking distance to Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, and the St. James Park tube station. Recommended if you want to take a leisurely walk, picnic, or get away from busy London.
Beautiful Park. Great Park with beautiful flowers and a great place to walk
loved the pelicans. relaxing and beautiful and loved the pelicans strutting in the park by the lake
Squirrel's everywhere!. Lovely park to visit, this was the closest park to our hotel, the squirrels were brilliant, they come really close... even up your legs if you let them!

A place to forget about the city. We arrived here due to going to the changing of the guard and had also driven past on the hop-on hop-off bus.Beautiful grounds with native animals running around that are also tame, so you get up close and personal with no problemsWould love to have spent more time here, but we were on a tight itineraryLovely for a summer sunday afternoon to watch the world go by and have a picnic
Nice place!. It's such a good place to go to see the squirrels! They are really cute and makes you feel you are in England.
Nature in the middle of the city. Take life easy. Let the stress in the shopping streets of this great city and enjoy a relaxing moment in this beautiful park

An Oasis in the middle of London. I love the idea of a calm oasis in a bussling city like London, and St James can offer that. It is a popular location--located between Trafalgar and Buckingham Palace, it is a destination walk-through for many sightseers. But you can often find a little bit of green to sit a while and relax, and if you are a squirrel feeder like we are, you will often find the furry friends come to you easily enough. There is a good supply of water fowl available for watching, including some swans (a black one, if you can find him). Spring is a delightful time when the flowers are in bloom and the birds are nesting, but beware of middle months of 2012: with the Queen's Jubilee and the Olympics on their way, even this little oasis is likely to be gone.

Lovely place. On a sunny day, St. James's Park is a joy to walk in . . . the various flower beds, the water birds, and the people. I can only imagine how stunning it must be when the roses are in bloom.

St James' Park. One of my favorite Royal Parks in the heart of bustling London town. And to think that it was once a swampy marshland and a place of ill repute! A beautiful refreshing park for busy office goers to stroll, eat their lunch & watch the antics of the ducks, drakes & the squirrels. Especially beautiful with the spring & summer flora, a beautiful green lung close to the famous tourist spots of Trafalgar Square, Whitehall, Buckingham Palace, Waterloo Place & Piccadilly Circus. A great place to unwind after a hectic round of sight-seeing or shopping!

Feed the birds (but not the pelicans). wandered through here this morning and took some bread for the birds. managed to feed ducks, geese and moorhens. you are not allowed to feed the pelicans though they were quite far away from us so it wasn't an issue. This is a really beautiful little park and well worth a visit. The colours from all the plants are stunning and you could be in the country not the middle of one of the world's biggest cities!
Lovely park. There are an amazing number of different birds in this park. Also, the views of the surrounding city are very nice.

the squirrels. kids love the tameness of the pesky squirrels - so close to city centre , the park took us up the mall without realising it so we popped up at Buckie palace before we knew it. A lovely city park, a break away from traffic and human noise.
Beautiful park, great running in a busy city. Beautiful park with many sites and trails. A great running option in a very busy city.

Fantastic Variety of Birds and Plants. I have rarely seen so many types of birds, ranging from swans to geese to ducks and then some, in addition to dozens of kinds of flowers and trees. A great place to go for a walk on a sunny day.
Beautiful park surrounded by beautiful homes.. Lovely trees, green grass that you are allowed to sit (unlike many French parks) surrounded by beauty.
Great Park. Loved all the flowers, and totally enjoyed the morning walks. Feast bars are a must try!
Peaceful even with the crowds.. This is a popular park, since it links major sites. But it's a lovely stroll and you can get some fabulous photos of Buckingham Palace from here.

Beautiful Walk. Lovely walk with lots of wild fowl. Very friendly squirrels waiting for food. Take plenty of bread and nuts ! Close to Buckingham Palace and Horse guards parade. Toilets on hand, and food places. Lots to see in the area.
green grass, relaxation & squirrels. Visitors should go there at least once. Lovely on a sunny day.

First time we ever saw a squirrel. To continue our sightseeing after a visit to Westminster Abbey we headed over to the lovely St James's Park, it wasn't very far in this large city. There was lots of people in the park, wandering around the extensive grounds, eating ice-cream, walking passed the lake and stunning flower beds, and on to Buckingham Palace at the far end. The park is a wonderful retreat from the busy London streets.
pelicans and ducks galore. another of London's treasures, close enough to hope across and watch the changing of the guards. gardens very pretty

Beautiful walk in the sunshine. What a lovely park, you would never guess you were in central London. We had a lovely Saturday afternoon stroll in the sunshine on our way down to have a look at the palace.
Restful area to escape the bustle of London.. Blossoms in bloom, sunshine and various parades seen on the edge of the park. Loved it.
Relax. Great place to go watch the animals and relax after all that walking around
lovely park. we spent half of day here just lying on a blanket reading a book as we had excellent weather over the weekend and squirrels even came up to you
Paradise. The only park nicer than this one is Central park in NY. St.James's park is nice, clean, beutiful and quiet.
Wonderful at anytime of the year. This place is like the posh sister to Hyde Park. It's all manicured beds and charming pathways. A must-see is the family of pelicans.

So much can be seen in a two mile stroll. Starting at Buckingham Palace, down the mall to the right horse guards, take a right to Churchhill War Rooms, a left to Parlement, Big Ben and Westminster Abbey and then up the Birdcage. Something new and amazing to see every few yards. Don't forget the camera.
Loved it. I liked this park even more than Hyde Park. Very nice, clean. Lots of benches to sit around. And a lot of very friendly squirells...just be ware of the low flying pigeons.

Don't miss this park and the Palace. In the heart of London. Excellent place to get away from it all, beautifully landscaped, wildlife, and close to everything. See the Horseguards parade. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy. http://www.royalparks.org.uk/parks/st-jamess-parkAlso enjoyed seeing Buckingham Palace, the changing of the guard, St. James Palace, and the shops in London. Harrods is a must, but there is simply so much to see. We took a river cruise on the Thames, well worth it, and walked along the South River walk, where there were many neat pubs, Shakespeare theater, markets. So much to see.

Something for everyone. This beautiful park, located between Whitehall, the Mall and Buckingham Palace, has something for everyone. A place to stroll, to jog, to picnic, to feed the ducks, to have a coffee, or just to walk through on the way to somewhere else. Every first time visitor to London should make sure they visit.
green. Very lovely place. Squirrels are so cute! we ate at the self service inside the park...the food was not good at all and the staff not so nice!what a pity!

For nature lovers. I was at university in London and loved going there. It is a nice opportunity to go for a walk and explore the nature. Lots of animals are in the park. What is more, Buckingham Palace and the Houses of Parliament with Big Ben are nearby. Nice place to relax and get away from the busy city.
Must do. What a great place to just walk around and relax--superb views.

Now this is the most beautiful park. It is lovely and peaceful out in St James Park and together with the lake, it is one of the best park to enjoy a peaceful walk in the afternoon or take a sit to absorb the surrounding tranquility. With the Buckingham Palace, the London Eye just around the corner, and the colorful view of flowers, the view is simply magnificent.
A nice and peaceful park. The park is very peaceful. You can eat something, read a book and refreshen yourself.
Just as lovely as ever ......... Having been to London for more than 18 times, St. James's Park is one place we never failed to visit. Reason : just for the beauty of the park ... we love it.
A floral surprise. Very pretty park in the middle of London- squirrels, ducks and lovely flowers
Great area. This is a good place to run free given the open land. Even better is that you can hit the cafe in the park and grab a drink to take with you as you wander the park.

Tranquility. My favourite park in London. Sitting along the Thames I can see Buckingham Palace to my right, and the London Eye to my left and I feel so lucky to be there. There are squirrels to entertain you, icecream and perfect picnicing space. I love it!

Lovely & a Refreshing Break. Absolutely loved St. James's Park. An abundance of wildlife and a view of the London Eye. Lots of great photo opportunities and just lovely to escape the city for a moment.

Just a pleasure to stroll through. St. James is an easy walk from my office and on a nice Spring, Summer or Autumn day it is such a lovely place to stroll through or just to stop and smell the roses (literally)!

Secret garden. st james garden has the famous buckingham palace at one end and horse guards, whitehall at the other. Yet alwasy seems to be looked over. The mall runs down one side and busy trafalgar square is off to the left. Inside this park you will find ducks, geese, funny loking birds,pigeons, sparrows, and squirrels in abundance. All for free. Jsut wondering around.Remember to buy some nuts.There is a coffee, cafe, restuaraunt. toilets, lakes fountains, albatross.yes i did say albatross.Views of the london eye.Views of buckingham palace. beautiful maintained flowers,wild flowers. and it has a peacefullness to it.Not the biggest of parks. But definatly worth a visit in its own right. Very safe.
Beautiful garden. I came in spring and there are lots of flowers around the lake. The view from the park is nice, you can see London Eye and others monuments behind the trees. It's fabulous.

A nice walk. Going to Buckingham Palace, we pass through St. James Park. Nature lovers would love the flowers and the lagoon with different species of birds. It's a delightful walk eventhough it's quite a walk before you reach Buckingham Palace. Well, when you're a tourist, you want to see them all! So, walk through this park before you watch the Changing of Guards!

SJP. SJP is a place of peace and tranquility - enjoyed by so many, yet so near to the heart of London. A place to opt out for a while ... grab a deck chair .,.. and sit and watch t he worl hurry by !Simple pleasures !
Relax, see some squirrels. Relaxing atmosphere. The squirrels are used to people and come really close.

My favourite park in London. This is by far my favourite park in London. Not only is it the Queen's front garden, but it's a beautiful family friendly park that is easily accesible - a must see in London!

Beautiful, peaceful place for a stroll. Like many of the royal parks in London, St James offers beautiful gardens and walkways. This is a medium sized park, a lovely place for a stroll when you want to escape the noise and congestion of the city. Go first thing in the morning to enjoy a peaceful wake-up stroll, and to see a wide variety of ducks and other fowl standing by the lake, snoozing or cleaning their feathers.

Peaceful. After a day of visiting Trafalgar Square, Westminster Abbey, Parliament, Big Ben, and Buckingham Palace to name a few- grab a coffee and snack at a local vendor sit down on a park bench and enjoy your surroundings. Take it all in.
A great place to visit. This is really a great park, it has everything for tourists, it does get very busy, but still worth the visit, and it's great just to wander.
Most beautiful park in London. St. James's park is gorgeous, well landscaped, a great place to go for a walk or hang out and relax.
View from the bridge. Find the bridge and look towards Whitehall for a unique view of London
Pretty and Romantic. This is the most beautiful park in London. The pathways midst the colourful plants are amazing.

Lovely flower beds. I have always known St James Park to havel lovely flower beds and the different type of birds and ducks there is something there for every body there is a children play area and you can feeds the animals and sit around the flower beds lovely cafe there

Beautiful park with great photo-taking potential. A lovely park with friendly squirrels, great views of Buckingham Palace and easy access to a lot of central London.
This being London, some people still walk through it at rather a hurried pace, but you can find your own bit of it to relax in.
Great walking from Buckingham to the Thames.. Really enjoyable walk, tons of pictures of gardens, squirrels and people walking, lying and jogging.
Great place to walk and enjoy the sights. A free walk around the park, lets you see view of Buckingham Palace across the lakes, walk across Horseguards Parade, so much to see which is free.

A favorite park in London. In a city full of green spaces and world-renowned parks, I have to say St. Jame's Park is one of my favorites. While not seemingly in the same scale as Hyde Park or Regents, it has enchanting nooks and crannies. A peaceful and peace inducing oasis of calm in a vibrant, bustling city

The most beautiful park in London. St James Park is so pretty and the views of Buckingham Palace and the Mall are stunning. When it was being prepped for the Royal Wedding it was great to walk down there at lunchtime to see what was going on - even bumped into David Dimbleby one day!
Well kept park. It's a lovely relaxing park right in front of Buckingham Palace.
Wonderful park. It is not the biggest park, but very beautiful! There are pelicans in the pond and many other birds, beautiful flowers and trees, many banches, so nice to walk around and relaxing.
Always for a nice stroll.. Parks are one of my favourite parts of London. They became a part of my daily tour: 1 park, 1 museum, and 1 restaurant.
Very nice. Loved the park. Don't are much for the other tourists, especially the groups of young students
Have a stroll... If you're in the area and going between Buckingham to other places. Make sure to go through the park. Can be a bit crowded if good weather.
Lovely Flowers. This is always a welcoming site at the finish of the Marathon. Nice for a walk and to grab a bite to eat.

A right royal park. I love all of London's royal parks. Each is very special. St James's is small and delicate . . . but you can remember scenes from spy novels . . . sometimes there is a military band playing. But, most importantly, it is a very peaceful place in the middle of a very busy area.

Peaceful retreat. Loved this park. It had a lot of flowers in bloom and the funiest duck that were black with webbed feet that looked like the flowers in the park. The trees were all in bloom with purples,yellows and pinks. Sitting on one of the benches and just enjoying the sites was so relaxing. At the end of our vacation I just wanted to go there to sit and absorb the sites.

Wonderful Sunshine. The park is a marvelous space between the formality of Buckingham Palace and the formality of the government area. The flower gardens, the people sunning themselves in deckchairs, the ducks and geese, the refreshment options - it's a great place to go out when your deep in central London.
Good visit!. Visited St. James's Park. A well held park, we can recommend visiting.
Beautiful. St. James' Park is one of the most beautiful parks I've visited, second only to the Keukenhof in Amsterdam.

St. James's Park is one of the loveliest in London.. This intimate park was part of the royal hunting grounds of kings from Henry VIII until it along with Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens were transformed into parks for real people. St James's is adjacent to Buckingham Palace and divides the governmental buildings along Whitehall for it. It has a beautiful small lake and the landscape is in the English syle popular in the 19th century in England. The trees are old and stately and the flower beds beautifully planted. Don't miss the Cafe in the park, it has excellent food and overlooks the lake. You can even rent a lounge chair and sit in the sun -- that is if you happen to be in London on a warm and sunny day, which can often be elusive!

Lovely flower beds, tea in the restaurant. In April, all the tulips were gorgeous; the flower beds are amazing so take your camera. We had afternoon tea in the restaurant in the middle of the Park, which was delicious. It's a long and lovely walk by the lake, which has fountains and wild fowl all over it. There are quaint wood and canvas lounging chairs around the lake for you to relax on.

A lovely stroll through St. James park with the wildlife. My son said it is nice of the Queen to share her "garden" with us. St. James's park is a beautiful place to be in good weather and it's free! The flowers and trees here are beautiful and there are many types of various wildlife: ducks, pelicans, etc and even squirrels who seem to enjoy eating nuts out of peoples' hands. There is a nice view of Buckingham Palace and in the other direction of the London Eye from the park. We walked through the park on our way from Buckingham Palace to Big Ben/ Houses of Parliament / London River tours.

Beautiful St James. This is a wonderful beautiful natural break in the middle of lovely London. A magical oasis to take some exercise and drink in nature. Give sightseeing and shopping a break look at ducks and remember the deck chairs cost !
Its a Park. Full stop. It is Ok as a park but there are much better places in London i.e. Regents Park
A favourite park to wander!. walk along the walkways and enoy the birds and flowers! Idyllic!
Oasis in a busy city. Kids LOVED it.. Beautiful oasis. We fed birds and squirrels. They ate from our hands, which was excellent. We went daily to the park while in London.
Lovely Park. It is a very quite nice area to have a stroll around
Lovely gardens. Lovely walk through the gardens on our way to Buckingham Palace.
Open space in London. Very big park in the heart of London.The best place to spend a lovely afternoon or evening in nature.

AHHHHH..THE PEACEFUL SERENITY..... Spend a a few hours in this wonderful park.The lake,the flowers,the swans, the dog walkers,the bird feeders,the smells of London.....a perfect relaxing walk in the park.Get there late afternon with a picnic and enjoy your food and listen to the brass bands playing WHILE THE SUN GOES DOWN.......VERY QUINTESSENTIAL ENGLAND!ps.am sure the Queen looks out and admires this great park every day!
Amazing Beauty. Wow, it sounds great. What did you like about it?flowers, colors and harmony. very romantic....
lovely. this seemed like the most lovely park that I saw in London.

Beautiful park ... . Wow st James park was just beautiful wish we had longer to enjoy we cut through on route to Buckingham palace . The flowers are so well kept and all the wildlife is superb. We stop and eat at the lodge (food stand ) for crepes , hot dogs etc and found prices very reasonable and food delicious will re visit in summer an enjoy the surrounds in the sun shine let all your troubles drift away .
Been there 100's of times. And still fall in love with park every single time. Beautifully landscaped. Scenic views and ample benches make this the perfect place to take a nature break.

Nice park. St. James's was nice, but if you're used to living in an area with lots of park and open space, it's nothing to write home about. Part of that may have to do with the weather at the time (cold and rainy), so we didn't linger. My kids definitely preferred Kensington Gardens, where the Princess Diana Memorial Playground is located.

Wildlife!. Such a lovely park! If you like wildlife this is a wonderful place to walk and watch. There are hundreds of ducks, geese, swans, birds of every kind and squirrels by the score, and they're all very tame and unfazed by humans encroaching on their territory!.

Peace of heaven. Beautiful and relaxing park in the center of London. Escape from the busy and bustling streets around you and enjoy the flowers and wildlife birds, feed the squirrels or just lay on the grass...
A great Walk in the Park. What a welcome respite from the sights and sound of London. We had a great walk and enjoyed the flowers and the pond. Very relaxing.
Gorgeous in spring. When the flowers are in bloom, this place is a riot of colours!!! Take a slow walk and take in the beauty that this place has to offer.
An oasis of calm. Clean, pretty, some wildlife, central, plenty of areas to sit. Highly recommend you stroll through between Trafalgar Sq and Buckingham Palace

Excellent way to spend an afternoon. We loved the park. It amazes me that London, where real estate is priceless, dedicates so much area to its amazing green spaces. The gardens in St James are beautiful and well maintained and the waterway is a delight with lots of wildlife and many nesting birds. We really appreciated the signs that indicated what birds were what. The whole walk through the gardens on the way to see Buckingham palace was a delight and given the time of year not crowded at all. We were very pleased to see that the area seems to also be used well by locals.

So that is where the Local's go. We could not believe how many people enjoy this park. It is beautiful. For those that do not know there are comfy park chairs but you have to pay 1.5 pounds per hour to sit on them..

Do not miss it when going to the Pallace. Small but very nice green spot in the center of London.
Stop there for 15 minutes and enjpy the sights .

Escape. Escape the hectic and bustling Trafalgar Square and be transformed to a calm oasis. Walk trough the 100 year old Admiralty Arch as Kings and Queens have before you and admire the lush plantings and ducks and geese on the water. The highlight is of course a tea break,( and we know the British need at least two or three of these a day). Head to the INN THE PARK which is nestled alongside the water and almost dissapears into the landscape. Enjoy your tea and scones or delicious food on the terrace and you cannot believe you are in the heart of London.
My favorite park in London.... ...and I am not sure why. One of my favorite memories of a sunny summer afternoon is a picnic lunch in Green Park.
Beautiful. Lovely park with the palace in the background.Lots of wildlife to see.Picnic tables and places to buy snacks.Pretty lake.
Love to walk through St. James Park.. Lovely flowers. Quiet. Refreshing. All in the middle of lovely London.

Excellent place for a rest. splendid location; nice place to rest on the sunny day! Really. Rent a deck chair (1.5GBP/h) and enjoy the day :) Buckingham palace on the right; Trafalgar Sqaure on teh left and Big Ben just in front of you....nice!

An oasis of calm. Wandered into the park away from the hustle & bustle of Piccadilly Square on a lovely sunny day. Enjoyed just sitting ( lovely deckchairs on the grass!) and watching the ducks, squirrels & the world going by in such lovely surroundings.

flowers, green, birds! nice to take a walk along!. cherry blossom explotion! lovely! you gotta stay for 1 hour at least to watch some squirrels, ducks and wildlife in the middle of one of the bussiest and noisy places in the world, it's just fantastic!
Lovely park. Walked through on our way to Buckingham Palace a lovely park.

Don't be shocked. A lung and oasis in central London, St James's Park is one of the Royal Parks, it was laid out to give the residents of Buckingham Palace a half way decent view and somewhere to go hunting. It is also a very pleasant short cut from Victoria Street to Whitehall and Trafalgar Square.The Park is used extensively in the summer by the civil servants who work in nearby Whitehall and Westminster. It is also rightly poplar with tourists. There are trees aplenty and wildlife, including squirrels, albeit grey tree rats rather than the indigenous red ones.The park boasts a network of lakes, which attract many different species of birds. Others are maintained there. You will find helpful guidance notes posted about the place.On that, I should sound a warning, the pelicans have been known to gobble up smaller birds, which some youngsters might not understand and might thus find distressing.There is a cafe/shop but I've not eaten there so can't report reliably.

St James's Park, the heaven for ducks and squirrels. After looking at the Changing of the Guards at Buckingham Palace, go to St James's Park. Don't forget bread and peanuts to feed the ducks, the gooses and the squirrels.The flowers are beatifully presented. The trees are exceptionnal. The pond is the heaven for many species of ducks and gooses. Visit the park early in the morning if you want to be ''almost'' alone. Afterwards you may experience the invasion of tourists. The Pelicans are quite impressive. Information about the wild fowl is clearly given. For children, it's a wonderful experience to feed the ducks by hand. The squirrels come to eat in your hand. The park is located near many spots of interest including the Horse Guards.The only drawback ... the number of tourists! But, I was one of them.
An oasis in a busy city. What a joy to be able to stroll around St James Park, busy but quietly so and much to see and enjoy
Nice walk!. feed the squirrels, walk up to the palace, have a cone, its a nice walk taht takes you from the hustle and bustle of westminister to the serenity of Buckingham
Great place to play football with kids. Cafe there, toilets, you can watch the guards returning from buck house, loads of room for kids to run around

Nice stop for lunch. Nice park next to bucking ham palace. We had brought our lunch so we walked thru and saw lots of small animals, birds,ducks, swans and squirrels. Open area had seats so we made a circle of them and sat. The attendant came up and told us it ws 2 lbs per chair...not advertised but reasonable so we enjoyed our meals and sitting in the sun.. Nice gardens as well and plenty of space. Could have caught the tail end of the palace guards marching ( we had seen them leave after the changing of the guard )

ALWAYS gorgeous. Every year we try to visit London in April and we are not disappointed by the immaculate gardens of St. James's Park. It is an amazing place to stroll and enjoy the flora and fauna while looking onward at Buckingham Palace the various water features.
Springtime flowers. Lovely to walk through and see all the spring flowers. The pelicans were a surprise.
Lovely stroll on a sunny day. We had a lovely stroll on a sunny day around the park drinking coffee and watching the world go by. Near Green park tube.
Classic London. A classic city park with beautiful skyline views after dark.

Best park in London!. Much better than the overrated Hyde Park - St. James Park is a lovely tranquil place to while away the day in busy London. If you fancy peace and quiet, then this could be the location for you!

Beautiful blooming flowers. What a relaxing day we had at st James park walking around the park watching the birds and the squirrels and looking at the beautiful colorful flowers planted with a big sense of style.The colors vary from red to yellow to purple and the different kind of flowers on display make us feel energized and full of spring warmth.Amazing work from the council I say!
nice walk in april... pretty and traquil. The lake and the flowers were a nice break from the tourist mobs
Pretty park. If you imagine a park in London full of spring flowers then this is what you get. Nice outdoor catering venues.
A walk in the park. Great park for an early morning walk with views of Buckingham Palace. No real amenities but if the weather is nice who cares.

Sunny March. Beautiful weather when we visited so enjoyed a walk round this lovely park Lots of spring flowers out and many birds. Also saw some of the eggs in the London egg hunt game - very impressive
Beutiful. Our Hotel was right on it and it was a fabtastic beautifil park. It reminded me of central park just more beautiful

Really lovely. There are lots of squirrels here and there's a man who comes every day and feeds them by hand! Its lovely to watch. Further on there's Pelicans! I thought I was seeing things, but apparently they were a gift to the Queen from some foreign Royal Family.
a great place to rest. love that park, very calm, pretty , reminds me of mary poppins, great place to take a break.
Amazing!. Fantastic place to have a stroll, relax and enjoy the sublime views on the bridge overlooking horse guards parade with the London eye in the background- just amazing!
Great views. Beautiful park with nice views. Good to walk and to run.
Lovely place for a walk. Want to relax and just stroll around a park? St James Park is the place. I've been there in almost every season and each season has its own charm.

Jolly St Jame's. A relaxing lovely place to stroll when good weather.
Leads off to other places of historic interest.
St James's Park. Beautiful flowers and well maintained. Lovely sunny day which made the park even more lovely,

Lovely park and views in Central London. The walk from Admiralty Arch via St James' Park to Buckingham Palace really is one of the finest in London. There are so many iconic views along the way. It really is a good break from visiting churches, museums, and monuments!

Beautiful park, too busy!. St James' Park is great fun if you're with the children and want to feed a tame squirrel or do some bird spotting. But it is full of tourists and school parties and not the bit of urban serenity you might think you were finding.

Very lovely place to spend hour or two. Park is very well maintained and full of life (water birds, squirrels, friendly humans :)
Flower gardens is very colorful and perfectly composed.
And of course - nice surrounding.
Delightful. In the spring or summer it is delightful! Lots of little lakes, swans, pelicans, statues and flowers. And of course you run into Buckingham Palace!!!!
Interesting open space in centre of city. Was right near my office and a great place to "break out" in lunch hour etc. Good walking destination and always good view of Buck. house.
Somewhere you have to see if you're visiting London. We'd already been here a couple of times, it's just nice to have a walk around
Great!. So clean and pretty, well maintained with plenty of run around space and lots of birds to watch! and great views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge, fyi
The best leisure time activity- feeding the animals in St.James´Park. One of the loveliest places in London:) definitely the most beautiful park
Beautiful!. Being in London in Spring time and spending an afternoon in St. James is quite an experience! Bring a Picnic and watch the people walk by. Class act!
water features. The bonus on this park are the nice water features and birds it attracts. Nice flowers and selection of plants/trees
A nice lunchtime setting. On a nice day, St. James's Park is perfect for a lunchtime picnic. The area is quite open and spacious, a marked change from the rest of London.
A must-see!. Walk through St. James's Park on your way to Buckingham Palace. A lovely walk with lots of trees, flowers and birds and a fantastic view as you approach Buckingham Palace.
Squirrels. My other half loves to feed the squirrels which will climb you

Really gorgeous in the spring!. St. James's park is really great. I was here in the beginning of April and all the flowers and trees in bloom were so pretty. If you stand in the right place, you can get really pretty photos of Buckingham Palace and the London Eye above the trees. There are a lot of cute birds to feed, and a few ice cream and sandwich stands to get an affordable bite to eat for lunch (a miracle in London!) It's right in between Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Square, so it's definitely a good place to get away from city bustle for a little while, or a good place to hang out after being squished by people watching the Changing of the Guard.

The Peaceful Heart of London. I have always loved this park between Whitehall and Buckingham Palace. It is the tranquil spot at the center of London's capital. Rest your feet and watch the swans and the ducks. Go around and smell the flowers. Wonderful.
Best Park. For me, this is the best park. Enjoy the views of green paired with the city of London and its landmarks from all over the park.
When in London.... Either to exercise or to have some rest, this park is definitely worth visiting! I recommend having a pic nic there, in the company of the squirels
Atmospheric Park, best viewed in sunshine. A large variety of waterbirds, and quite a few squirrels. And a great atmosphere. Nothing to dislike about it.
nice walk. we liked the squirrels and ducks, nice flowers, reasonable lenght

One of many great parks. One of many great parks in London and you must visit or walk through, stop for a bite to eat, lots of people sit on the grass for picnics or a pitstop and usually you will find street food available
Beautiful Park in the Spring. the park was magnificent, trees,shrubs, flowerbeds in full bloom, magical

Nice Place to Visit after Buckingham Palace. After seeing Buckingham Palace, we strolled through the park on our way to Horseguards & Whitehall. Plenty of wildlife to see as you walk through the park. There is also a nice restaurant overlooking the lake. An ideal spot for a picnic in the Summer.

So beautiful on a sunny day. Close to Buckingham Palace - we saw swans and squirrels and had a really nice time walking in the sun. some beautiful flowers too. Well worth the trip across the street to visit after seeing Buckingham Palace.
Lovely Park. It is a to lovely park to walk through when heading up to the palace.
nice park. beautiful park with flowers and squirrels. Visit it!!!
London Park. This is the place to come whatever the weather.Beautiful and full of places to picnic.Great swing park and duck ponds.Find a bench and sit and relax
picnic spot. great park, clean, central. walking distance to westminster
green. beautifull full of blooming flowers, cut grass and even a egg or 2

Very nice park, full of vegetation and fauna. I liked the fact that it is so green everywhere, crowded with lots of different plants, and the pond has different birds and animals. People were having a great time as the weather was sunny and nice. Really enjoyed walking around it.

Spring. We were very fortunate that spring was in all it's glory with warm sunny days and such a comfortable nice temperature. The daffodils were in full bloom and grass so green and inviting for bare feet walking. It could not have been better and after shopping and walking around the crowds in the shopping centres this or any park was so inviting and refreshing. St. James park is in such a central position that it requires you to enter and enjoy its beautiful surroundings.
London walking tour. A beautiful area and we saw squirrels, police made feel very safe. A lovely walk to Buckingham Palace, then back into town to Trafalgar Square.
Lovely walks. Great walks with the pelicans, a hidden jem in the city. Must go place for a break from the bustle of London
w/end break. Beautiful and clean and peaceful A pleasent walk amidst the hussle and bussle up to Buckingham Palace.
One of London's best parks. A really relaxing park with great views, try out the roof terrace of the cafe for some of the best views.

The Central Park of London. My husband and I went running here our first morning. We weren't sure if running was common in London but luckily for us, it is not only common - it's downright popular. Running shops abound and many other runners were in the park. It was clean and very oasis-like, making me think of Central Park. But don't plan a visit at night. It closes at 9pm.

Excellent!. Amazing park where you can just sit on the lawn and have a sandwich during the afternoon. Stroll on and you'll see Buckingham Palace at the end of your walk. A great place for families with young kids. There are kiosks at each of the corners where you can get ice cream, coffee, cold drinks & even a hot dog. Excellent!
A lovely place in all seasons. The park is very well maintained and offers a bit of peace after the mad rush of its surrounding neighbourhoods. Lookout for the pelicans eating live pigeons!
beautiful park. This park was so beautiful and had so many pretty flowers. There are so many wonderful places around it. If you go straight through you get to beautiful Buckingham Palace.
Running. Nice beautiful park enjoyed sitting down ad just watching the world go by .

Green, Flowering Oasis. This small lovely park is the perfect place for a refreshing stroll and enjoying the ducks on the lake in the heart of London. All of the flowers were blooming early thanks to the unusually warm March weather, making the park even nicer during our early April visit. It's very convenient to many of the top sights too (Churchill War Rooms, Parliament, Horse Guards).

Beautiful green oasis. St James' Park was just beautiful with the cherry blossom and spring flowers in abundance. We were lucky with the weather in March, felt more like June/July and it was so lovely to walk around this beatiful park with its lake and lovely walkways alongside the flowers.
view the palace from here. go to the far end of the park and look through over the ponds to buckingham. Wonderful.

So relaxing. I had such a great time while walking around when i was going to the London Eye. Peacefull, clean. If you like parks , this one is a place I recommend. Is not that big and definetly worth.

Best view of Buckingham palace. This park is where you will get the best view and pictures of Buckingham Palace. Go to the little bridge crossing the lake, walk to its centre and enjoy! There are many squirrels going around the park and searching for food but be careful not to get bitten! They are rather aggressive little things.
Wide variety of bird life. Loved the different types of waterbirds and the squirrels. Perfect for a picknick on a beautiful day. Even when very busy were we able to find a spot on a bench.
A bit of nature inside the city.. A very pretty park with many different species of ducks, and a great view of the Mall.
Green park. I go there everytime for jogging and its nearby a lake! everytime i visit newcastle I go and run there

st james's park a little oasis. a perfect London park. step away from the hustle and bustle
and enjoy a gentle stroll and coffee in the park beside the lake with its traditional deckchairs, you have to pay to hire one, chill with an ice cream and de stress!
A delightful walk!. It was a bright sunny day in December. I had a great time taking pictures of the squirrels and the swans.

Fabulous early morning walk. I used to work very close to St James Park and walking through the park and across the bridge was the highlight of my daily commute. The park is well maintained, and the flower boarders are updated regularly. For me as a commuter the only frustration was the number of people taking photos of friends on the bridge. Am sure I must be in some of those photos! For this reasoning would avoid going to the park at peak times. The view from the bridge on a crisp sunny winters day is wonderful. There is a restaurant in the park which is ok but quite pricey for what it is. There are lots of squirrels and pigeons, remember to take some monkey nuts for the squirrels if you want to capture a close up picture. If you are in the park at the right time of year you might be lucky enough to see the swans and their singlets or the little ducklings which are so cute. There are a few pelicans but they spend a lot of time on a little island on the lake - if you do see them you mustn't feed them ( or you could end up at the Tower!)

Nice for a break!. If you wanna have a break in your visit on London, St. Jame's Park it is a excellent place to it. You can walk around and enjoy the spirit of London, meet people over there apreciated the view.
St. James Park. This was delightful at this time of the year with the blossom out and the beds of flowers bright and cheerful. The weather was heavenly and it seemed like a relaxing place to be.
Beautiful park. The park is great with a lot of birds. Very peaceful and perfect place for a walk.
St James's Park - another pleasure. So lovely to have so many well kept parks in the centre of London
London's Parks are Amazing. The views are great. The parks are so clean. Much better than New York City parks.
BEAUTIFUL PARK NOTHING MORE. Good place for rest ,peaceful ,quiet, not much to do ....nice for a walk but for tourists it can provide a time out to eat a sandwich if they brought one with them.
very good. everything was very good and nothing was to be desired. Beautiful, fresh, clean and very friendly and cute animals

An oasis amongst the madness which is London.. Well tended as always and great to wonder along the winding paths and see the birds / swans. I love approaching the Palace through the park as it is much more endearing.
Relaxing. Both beautiful and relaxing ... a nice place to visit on a warm day!
a treasure. smack in the middle of london a delight to wander around a london treasure
Beautiful. We were lucky with the weather but the gardens are clean and well kept with lots of interesting things to look at. Very friendly and knowledgable grounds staff
On a sunny day, it's a beautiful walk.. London has a lot of parks but last week - with the flowers blooming and the water fowl out and about - St. James park was dreamy.
Beautiful park. Always lovely to walk through this park. The lake is gorgeous, you can see Buckingham Palace from it and the children's playground is bit different to your regular one.
Great for a picnic. We were lucky visiting on a glorious weekend. Could have just sat on the available deck chairs and watched the world go by!
beautiful day. the sun was shining, the park was spotless. It was so nice to sit in the sun and read and just sit back and people watch.
Nice little park. Very nice little park just next to the palace, don't be lazy and if you visit the palace go back throw the park to the Westminster area

London's most central and most attractive park. A few yards from Trafalgar Square , St James' Park is always a pleasure to visit at any time of year. Very attractive flower beds , a handy cafe / restaurant and a lake full of waterfowl. You can feed the squirrels by hand , or the pigeons too. London is a good city for public parks and this is arguably the best.
Relaxing. Beautiful park to people watch, relax and enjoy the beauty!

A lovely place when its a sunny day. St James is a lovely park. Its overlooked by Buckingham Palace and flanked by Birdcage Walk and The Mall. A lovely place to stroll through and or have a picnic. Try timing your visit to coincide with the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. There are a couple of eating places which are quite expensive and always busy. I have never ate in these so I cannot comment on quality. If you stroll across the Mall you can see the Queens Guard on duty outside of St James Palace. This is most probably the best place to get a good picture. If you time this with the change over, once completed ask the policeman on duty if you can stand next to one of the guards and have your picture taken. My son is a guard and this has happened a few times to him.
Picnic in the Park. Hyde Park is better, but this is also nice, so much nicer than Green Park in my opinion. Take a picnic and enjoy. You also get the chance to see the Queens Guards.
Bliss. One of my favourite places in London. Such a glorious place to walk... amazing.
Most beautiful of the London parks. Such a wonderful park. Located next to Buckingham Palace. This park offers a wonderful stroll along bright flowers and enchanting water areas...

Absolutely beautiful!. This time of the year the park is at its best, at least I think so. All the flowers, the cherryblossom trees, the magnolias and everything coming to life after the winter. Just stroll, have something to eat or drink, sit down in the grass and just enjoy spring.
Beautiful - lots of squirrels!. I love St James Park! The gardens are lovely and there are squirrels everywhere who like to come up for a chat :)
Pleasant park. Plenty of seats and within easy distance of normal tourist attractions
Lovely. Lovely as always--enjoyed the egg hunt ;-) Had an ice cream snack as we strolled through.
A beautiful afternoon.. Stopped in St James's Park during out cycle tour of London. A gorgeous sunny February afternoon. Great atmosphere. Stopped at the cafe - be warned, expensive cakes and coffee!

A Lovely Park. We spent a Sunday at this park and loved it. It is very convenient to Buckingham Palace if you are trying to see the changing of the guard as well. There is a nice children's playground on the same side of the park as the palace. It has a big sand pit and my 3 year old son loved it! We ate at the restaurant - Inn the Park - for brunch. Kind of a limited selection and the service was painfully slow, but there is a patio that looks over the water and is quite nice. Lots of people come to the park to picnic and that's what we'll do next time. Lots of different waterfowl to see while you're there - including some unusual white pelicans. Check the park's web site to see what time the park rangers feed them. Overall, we love St. James's park and can't wait to go back.
British Park Beauty. if you like walking amongst very beautiful flower gardens, then this is your place. picnic if you wish. Just a very relaxing area to walk through. Very near other visitor sites.
Pleasant place. Good for a walking or pick nick, very calm, lots of tree, enjoyable.

Under construction getting ready for the Olympics but terrific. I love urban parks and the ability to walk through busy London and find peace and quiet is really amazing. The park is safe, full of flowers and walkers. Worth it.

Love the ducks. Have you read Good Omens from Pratchet&Gaiman? You should, you can discover few new things about ducks in this park. But seriously, it is such a nice place where you can sit and eat your sandwich during a break from sightseeing. Some parts of this park are very calm, so you can just relax and enjoy yourself.

Beautiful Park with Great Facilities. We walked the length and breadth of St James Park twice as my daughter was enthralled by the ducks and birds. We fed them and the squirrels all of whom were friendly. We had only had a small breakfast so were delighted to come across a hut selling hotdogs in ciabatta and Belgian waffles. A coffee, a coke, a hotdog and two waffles, one with chocolate sauce came to only a tenner, pretty amazing for the centre of London I though, albeit in a park. With a wee seating area, we settle in for a while. The tables weren't clean but I suppose that is to be expected whilst outdoors and surrounded by animals! My daughter followed a wee mouse, saying how cute it was whilst we were seated and I was dubious, as mice get scared easily; imagine my surprise when I peeked down to see a rat staring at me! Aaargh! But hey, there are rats in the world, just be careful when your daughter tries to feed a 'mouse' with a bit of bread though!!The walk takes you straight up to Buckingham Palace; I can't imagine a better route. Maps along the way are clear and let you know where everything is. The area overall is very clean and well looked after and we could have spent all afternoon there, if we'd had more time. Definitely worth a wander.If we'd had the chance to hire the Barclay Bikes (bikes for hire around London, very cheap indeed and such a great idea starting at £1 an hour or even 30 minutes for free! Credit or debit card required though) then St James Park would have been the ideal location to try them out.

Beautiful. The park was filled with daffodils and the weather was great for this time of year, so this made for a pleasant, relaxing walking experience away from the traffic of the city. The approach to Buckingham Palace was outstanding.

Beautiful Park to enjoy a gorgeous afternoon.. Located smack in the center of several Central London sights, this is a great place to take a break or enjoy lunch. There are a few restaurants close by with takeaway, and this is a much better view than any of the restaurants can provide. One thing I noticed is that London does public parks well. There are plenty of species of birds that call the lake home for you avid bird watchers.
fab. we were lucky 2 have lovely weather & sat here with coffee.

A charming floral park with lovely views of London. One of the nicest parks in London. We love the flowerbeds which are kept up to date with the season, and have fun feeding the ducks and other wildlfe that frequent the ponds on the centre. There are wonderful views of the stately buildings of the Capital including the London Eye. A really nice place to visit on a sunny sunday afternoon - or any time infact!
A haven. Such a lovely place to walk and feed the ducks. A haven in the middle of London
This has been my favorite London park ever since I was a student tramping around London in sandals over 40 years ago.. This is a small but very tranquil place to chill after sightseeing or shopping.

Lovely as always. Even on a grey day St James' Park looks beautiful, with Buckingham Palace at one end and Horseguards at the other/ The swathes of daffodils looked beautiful and you can pass your time strolling and watching the squirrels and various ducks and geese. There seem to be hundreds of coots this year!!We had a quick coffee in the Inn on the Park and sat outside.
Nice place for a picnic. Grab a picnic from Waterloo M&S and this is a great picnic spot on a sunny day.
Nice place for relaxation. Stayed relatively close to the park, so went there whenever I could. Very beautiful, with lots of birds and tame squirrels who are always asking for food :)
A fabulous place to get away from the hectic streets of London. A wonderful, typically British styled park and gardens. A great place for a stroll and to take a break from the busy streets.
Green space. London parks are great for their space, st James Park is one of the smaller ones, go and feed the ducks and relax for 1/2 an hour!
St James park. lovely place to stroll around. good place for foodand view is 'Inn the park'
Beautiful Park. This is a lovely park, great lake and little bridges. It's small but easy to walk through to various other parts of the capital. Small but worth a visit.

One of London´s great parks.. St James´s is one of the beautiful parks in central London. Visit the bridge over the lake for some stunning views and great photo opportunity of Buckingham Palace in one direction and an incredible view of the pinnacles and domes of Whitehall in the other.

Squirrels!. One of the nicest parks I have ever visited.
Beautiful, well-kept grounds. Plenty of amenities and well-located. Best of all, the wildlife! Animals everywhere, most of them pretty tame, even the geese out of your hand. The squirrels are really cute and will climb onto your leg to get to their food.
Loved it!

An oasis of calm in London. Located 100 yards from the tube station of the same name. Iyt is a haven of peace and tranquilty with lots of benches, and a refresment centre or two. The birds and squirrels are very tame and will eat out of your hand- a great place for children. The Pelicans are also a sight to behold. if you want to relax, walk, jog or run- this is the place for you.
Beautiful park. Very green and fresh, you could literally smell the air :)
relax. More han a short cut between the sights of London, this is the palce to chill out, admire the daffodils in Spring, the ducks, the passing tourists. Take some lunch and chill out for a while.
London's lungs. A sizeable patch of green right where it is needed. See Buckingham Palace or Piccadilly, then rest awhile by the waters.

Beautiful park. As you walk past Westminster Abbey and the Churchill War Rooms, you will come to St. James's Park. All of sudden, you feel secluded and away from the hustle and bustle of London. There are many paths to walk and quaint bridges over ponds which are hosts to many birds. There are benches scattered every 50 feet or so along the paths if you get tired. If you walk the length, you will eventually come out near Buckingham Palace. A good area for a picnic or for those seeking some quiet time away from the noise of the city. It is very lovely in the summer.

Lovely park. Nice for a sunny day, beautiful park and grounds. Has a brilliant playground for children - princess Diana memorial, with pirate ship and sand pit, keeps them busy for ages.Great day out.
Great Park. The Park is well maintained and so much to see... Loads of grey squirrels and the pelicans are bigger than i had imagined. nice area for all and the park has great open spaces.

Oasis in central London. St James park is a oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of central London. At one end of it is Buckingham Palace and the Other end of it Horse Guards Parade (well worth a visit to get up close to the mounted guardsmen).
Nice in the summer. This is a lovely small park centrally located and easy to get to.

Daffodils and Crocuses Everywhere. We arrived during a warm February and the park was alive with daffodils and crocuses coming up from the grass. With the beautiful city as a backdrop and beneath the budding trees, it was lovely.
Kids loved it. Walked through the park - enjoyed the fresh air. Well kept place
Beautiful. This has to be one of the best parks in London, along with Hyde & Kensington
Beautiful Park. Not at its best at this time of year but beutiful later in the year beautiful bird life and trees

Beautiful. I keep repeating this in all of my reviews. I love this park as like all of London's Royal Parks it is beautiful and you could spend a relaxing day with a picnic and enjoying the scenery, just let the day pass you by.

Wait a beautiful place to walk and sit. We walked and sat in this beautiful park on a sunny December Day. Loved the ability to walk in such a beautiful area within such a busy city. Loved the cafe that is within the park, grabbed something hot to drink and just sat and watched people go by.

Trooping the Colour at St. James Park. We had planned on visiting the ceremony of the Changing of the Guard that takes place at Horse Guards Parade near Whitehall or Buckingham Palace. Doing research on this before we left, I discovered that we would be in London at a very special time with an opportunity to witness Trooping the Colour. It was Queen Elizabeth II’s birthday so crowds gathered at St. James Park to see her and the other royals come down the Mall in open carriages for the ceremonies in the park. My husband was able to snap some pictures above the heads of the crowd that formed in front of us. Yes, indeedy, that is in fact, Kate! Oh, and Queen Elizabeth, Charles and Camilla were there too.
a great walk and relaxing time. a peaceful place with greatviews fresh air and plenty to do
