A beautiful respite from the crazy bustle of the city. A lovely place to walk to Buckingham palace. This year spring is early and there were beautiful flowers in bloom already. It's a glorious park. Lots of birds and ducks. We needed a little break from the tube and buses and crowds and our walk through this wonderful park did the trick.

Visit the duckpond on your walk. I am usually on business in nearby Westminster, but take any opportunity for a relaxing interlude watching the ducks, pelicans, squirrels and moorhens. babies again soon.....
I have given up the smokes here, but not shaken the duckpond habit....
Its in the corner nearest The Houses of Parliament, or a nice walk down HorseGuards parade
Feed the Squirrels. The squirrels are really tame in the Park so bring a bag of nuts to get up close with them.

Best Park In Central London. I work in Leicester Square : sometimes I want to say to the hordes of tourists milling around in the middle of the day 'why are you here in a concrete wasteland when there are 4 foot high Pelicans wandering alongside a beautiful lake about 5 mins walk away?'.
Gorgeous Park. Too many people walking around! Kept up very well. Lots of birds
Peace in London. A lovely park by Buckingham Palace and just off Horseuards Parade sit on a bench Coffee and Croissant watch the world go by, feed the ducks

nice park. it's a very nice park to visit in London! Will love to have a pinic there for the next visit to London! i'm upset that we did not spend more time there and hope that I will come back soon! ;)
nice place to walk / jog. whats not to like. open space and some fresh air in the city. easy stroll with seats and grass. good for a jog too.

a lovely escape from the rat-race. I loved being in the park surrounded by daffodils and crocuses and greenery...and pets! It is a lovely escape from the rat-race of the city, much like Central Park is in NYC.
impressed. the opertuinity to meet people from all over the world at one place and the residences in the location add to the experiance
Great park. One of the greatest parks in London and for a spring walk it is highly recommended.
One great day. Walked through here after leaving Buckingham Palace; could not have asked for a nicer day for a walk in the park!
nice walk. Liked the views and the squirrells. Disliked the dog poop that was everywhere

Dont Drink. First let me say that I loved he park and it was great to take a cold walk in the park. But be warned don't take alcoholic drinks into the park. One f my friends had a can of lager and was told by a policeman that you cant drink alchohol in the Royal Parks! I had never heard of this and Im still nt sure whether it's true or not (perhaps someone from the parks could give a definitive answer on this) but if it is true it's worth knowing as one of our treats when it gets warmer was going to be to take a champagne picnic in St James Park.
Great. Excellent and peaceful place in the city. Many birds and animals mainly squirrels

Lovely on a warm Spring day. This is a beautiful park, lush and green, with a lovely lake filled with wildlife. We were surprised by the cleaniness of the paths and the lack of rubbish. They only thing is that we would have appreciated more benches near the lake, as it would have been nice to sit and watch the birds. Otherwise, a well recommended place to visit - and so close to Buckingham Palace.
Beautiful Park. What a pleasant, pretty park. Even in the winter, the trees are spectacular, and what fun to feed the many birds who reside here year round.
really good. clean, peaceful. enjoyed the park, good break from the bustle of the city streets.
a sunny day. Simply walking through on our way to Buckingham Palace on a lovely sunny day was glorious taking in the ambience .Beautifully maintained.
I just love it. This is the place I love to visit. Amazing place! Make sure you have some nuts for squirrels and bread for ducks and seagulls as they are always hungry!
Wonderfull park. One of the most Wonderfull parks i`ve ever seen, and one of the many in London !!! Especially in summer.Take a rest.
St. Jame's Park. Visiting during the weekend, we had bands playing while we sat on lovely old fashioned deck chairs (for a fee) surrounding the band stand.  Very relaxed.
Feeding the Ducks at St James's Park. My favourite London park. Particularly like all the wildlife especially all the different species of ducks.
St James's Park. Excellent collection of waterfowl, black swans, mandarin ducks, pelicans. You might even see a peckish pelican swallow a pesky pigeon if you're very lucky. Take bread or bird seed.
beautiful. great place to walk around, take a break and have lunch
A little calm in all the bustle. This was just so lovely, quiet and really enjoyable. We fead the birds and squirrels and just sat on benches enjoying the sun. Best of all we did not spend a penny.

One of the loveliest parks in central London. Spring is the perfect time to see this park. The Royal Parks gardeners do a wonderful job of spring planting. Stroll across the bridge, turn towards Parliament then admire the vista across the lake to Buckingham Palace. On the south side take a detour to see the historic street Queen Anne's Gate and on the east side go and see the Churchill war rooms.
Great. Is a lovely park you can spend the day here lots to do and see the grounds are amazing.
A haven of peace amids the maddening crowd. Green, green, green grass, as only England can produce. Squirrels, ducks, swans. Time for reflection, having lunch.
Peace. Serene ,relaxing, beautiful well worth a visit. A pleasant break in the city
perfect for summer. all you need is your book and a cold drink, st james park will provide the rest
A Haven of peace in London. St James's Park is a pretty, peaceful haven right in the heart of London. A great place to relax and watch the world go by.
lovely. To have a park in the middle of london where everyone can walk around and sit and enjoy the day or watch the squirels great place
Its a place, where child can run. Its a place where child can run and enjoy green grass

Must see and have a walk.... Its great location being just next to Buckingham Palace enables you to take a fresh breathe right in the middle of the city. We've been to very romantic scenes in autumn with the leaves on the ground.

Who says London is busy?. My favourite London park by far. Quiet, pretty and full of wildlife. The squirrels will eat out of you hand - and sit up and beg before you even get to them. If you're on the tourist trail take your time walking from Westiminster to Buck House through St James Park - you won't be disappointed.
nice park. nice park to relax near Buckingham palace with lake .... kids will love this park,which is near most attractions,small playground is there.

A tranquil haven in the heart of London. St James Park is a simple park based around a long lake. On summers days, it is lovely to laze in the shade under the trees and watch the world go by. Any time of year, it is a pleasure to cut across. A walk around the lake provides good views of key London buildings. The main road is closed to traffic on a Sunday, which makes it all the more pleasant then.
Great for a picnic. We had a lunch here on the grass in between our Palace tour and it is amazing to have such a great open green space within the great city of London.
Stunning Park. Beautiful for walks sunbathing and typical of the magnificence of the great London Parks which are free to all
wonderful park which backs up to the palace. We loved the flowers and gardens. the waterways and birds and the peaceful and relaxing atmosphere of the park
Great view from the bridge. Full of many varieties of bird, this is a small-but-perfectly-formed park. Stand on the little blue bridge in the middle for one of the best views in both directions.

A very pleasant Park. --in a great City. Lovely for a stroll.
Features in many 18th Century novels--go down memory lane an enjoy.
Very nice park. Very nice place to go for a stroll, for instance when you you to se Buckingham Palace.
Picnic. A great place to stroll any time of the year, sit quietly with your loved one, share a sandwich and be romantic

Sweet little park and lovely cafe. Park was not too large and had a really nice lake with loads of varied birds which our son (a nature lover) really enjoyed. We saw wild parakeets and a mandarin duck. Had lunch at the cafe. The set menu was not really what we were looking to spend as we wanted to eat more casually so it was great to be able to eat on the take-out side and eat outside or in the special tables inside. good choice and reasonable value. Would definitely visit again.

Very nice park , and excellent for smaller children.. I took my 3 grand-daughters last weekend on a Sunday morning to feed the ducks etc .They were thrilled at how close they got to the geese , pelicans and ducks. At the top left of the park , near Buckingham Palace is a very nice 'Swing park' with a sand pit and next to a coffee stall and toilets.Across the road at the end on the park is Horse Guards parade which is worth going thru on your way back to Charing Cross BR
A breath of comparitively fresh air.. A great place for a lunchtime stroll on a nice day.

An Oasis. St James Park is a beautiful expanse of green (and colour in spring and summer) in central London. It also has a beautiful lake. It is said to be the oldest and the grandest of the royal parks and when you walk along the many paths you certainly get that sense of grandeur. I was there just before the royal wedding and it was a blaze of colour from all the flowers. I have never seen anything quite like it.
Very pleasant to stroll round on a wekend. The squirrels, the greenery, the birds and the space
St James Park. its ok a little small for a park, local to Victoria and shops

Lovely park to have a relaxing walk in.. St James's Park isn't big but perfectly formed! Lovely for a wander to get away from the noise and traffic. Plenty of wildlife to watch, you can get a snack and icecream and a great place to people watch. See Buckingham Palace walk through the Park and come out near Westminster Abbey - perfect.
A walk in the park. Many happy memeories of walking through the park kicking up the leaves. I've done it, my children have done it and in the future I'll take my grandchildren to do it.

Perhaps the best park in London. A bit of a hidden gem - doesn't get the publicity of Hyde Park as it doesn't have the events, but it's handily close to Parliament Square, Whitehall, Trafalgar Square etc so worth having your picnic here while doing other things nearby.
Best one. Out of all the parks in London I found this to be the nicest one. Its surprising just how many parks London has and each one worth a visit.
oasis of calm. Lovely place to share a picnic and take a little time out of a busy sight seeing day in green parkland. Clean and tidy.
So peaceful...... A little paradise..... I love London's parks! They really bring some peace to a very busy city! Don't only visit the monuments.... the parks are really worth it!
Wander around. Walked through park from admirably arch down mall to Buckingham palace. Take slight detour just past Clarence house to mews area. Lovely architecture.

In the eye of the storm. The City of London is blessed with many great parks, of which this is one, inviting tourists and residents alike to come for a stroll, or to relax on the grass - yes, that's allowed - provided you catch a warm and sunny day. The lawns and flower beds are tastefully kept and manicured. Lots of imposing trees offer shade when necessary - a peaceful oasis of relaxed tranquility and natural, albeit cultivated beauty, away from the hustle and bustle of the city, and yet right in it.

For a nice relexed afternoon. St. James's Park is one of the Parks I like the most because you can see on one Side the London Eye and on the other sde you see the Bukingham Palace and it is very Beautifull with all the Flowers
Beautiful park. I'm not sure if it is the smallest one in the city, but it is small, and cozy and I really like it.

Super park with plenty of squirrels and other animals!. Super park with plenty of squirrels and other animals. It`s worth to visit in nice weather. You can make good photos of park+London eye as background.
St James's Park. An oasis of tranquil green in a cosmopolitan London!

Lovely little park, great views. I'm not sure whether I'd make a specific trip to St James' Park, but if you've visited, say, Westminster Abbey or the Houses of Parliament, and you want to head off to Oxford Street for some shopping, this is probably a pretty place to start your route. It's very poorly lit after dark though, so make sure it's a daylight trip. Check out the bridge in the middle which has lovely views both towards Horseguards and the London Eye one way, and Buckingham Palace the other.
half term break. kids loved open space in central london freedom to run around
a complete circuit is easily 'doable'. Take some treats and feed the squirrels by hand. Keep an eye out for the pelicans and of course a certain royal residence
Marvelous park. The park is well maintained and is a quite spot during summertime.
Lots of Nature. Great Park, lots of wildlife birds and squirrels. Kids love it bring some bread to feed the Ducks.
A big surpise. An oasis, well one these in London. London is amazing for its parks. so nice to get away from all the rush and shopping, and even all the culture. Loved it
An oasis in London. St. James's Park is a wonderful, peaceful oasis close by the Houses of Parliament with lots of wildlife and an excellent cafe. Well worth a visit at any time of the year.
A lovely Oasis. Nice to be able to just sit and enjoy peace & quiet in a huge city. London has so many great gardens.
Super park. On a sunny day this is a great park to wonder through. guardsman parade, well kept flower beds.

Pelican Brief. The famous pelicans were originally brought to the park as part of Charles II's expansion of the Royal Aviary when the park was laid out in 1660. They are unfortunately inclined to cannibalism, taking baby ducklings and even pigeons, much to the horror of visitors. The park itself runs from Horse Guards Parade to Buckingham Palace and is mostly laid to grass with shrubbery and flowerbeds.
Somewhere to rest in.. Tranquil and beautiful oasis in the heart of the West End
My son's favourite park. My Son loves this park as it is full with birds and he enjoys feeding them. It's just in the middle of the centre so where ever we go we have to pass it
Lovely central place for a picnic or just a stroll.. Lovely central place for a picnic or just a stroll.
Fowl play!. Loved the peace and tranquility interspersed with the bustle of everyday life. Did not enjoy being attacked by a goose pecking at my legs. Funny afterwards!

Beautiful Suroundings. If you visit London St James`s Park is a must to visit as everything the Park has to offer is maintained to the highest level.There is a serenity that only a visit can describe and you will enjoy walking around this beautiful place.
RELAXING. a beautiful park to wander through on a summers day with pretty gardens and lakes

My favourite park in London. I went to many parks in London, but most time I spent in St James's. It's directly in the old town, but you can walk further enough to escape the usual noise of the center. Lots of young people go there to have lunch - either in one of the small restaurant or - if the weather is nice - just sitting on a bench and enjoying the sun. You can go sunbathing or feed the Royal ducks. I laid down for 2 hours reading a book - somehow you feel both as part of nature and part of the big city :)
A respite from the city. I always cut through the park it is a good short cut and recharges the batteries.

Quite nice but a bit disorganised. I went there last summer. Despite some effort it did still feel like a cafe in the park and there were alot of children running around and making a noise. The food was good. The staff seemed young and not knowing what they were doing.

Beautiful green space in the city. As a tourist you cannot beat the location. It has Buckingham Palace overlooking it and Horseguards the other side. You can see the Eye from the road. Feed the birds and admire the view as you stroll around the water edge. Even on a crisp day in February it was breath of fresh air.
beautiful. used to work in london and very early on a summer morning (5 am!) is the best time to see this park
Walk in the park. One of the most peaceful London parks - fairly small but don't miss it!

St James Park.. You can walk from Victoria Station along to Buckingham Palace ,passing the Royal Mews and the Queen's collection of paintings, walk through the park which runs along by the Mall, this area of London around St James is very charming, full of small streets and handsome houses.

Keep an eye out for the pelicans. Well kept gardens and nice for a wonder around but very busy with tourists on a nice day. If you don't like pigeons then avoid... they're everywhere. Keep an eye out for the pelicans than reside here, they're huge!
pleasant. we walked through on the way to our hotel and it was really nice and clean, no tramps or dodgy people lurking around, a good mix of people resting and playing

A nice walk. We walked through St James Park after our visit to Buckingham Palace with the kids. It was a nice place to sit and have afternoon tea and see the squirrels and birds. Very relaxing and pretty, it is a nicely designed area.

Wonderful place to relax for lunch. This was a beautiful park, my family (husband, daughters 18 & 22) enjoyed the time we spent here. Well worth a visit - make sure you pay for your deck chairs - they arent free!
Nice Park. Nice park to sit down and relax. There is a lot of things nearby to see so when you get tired just find a bench, sit down and just appreciate the surroundings.

Escape. Nestled between Horse Guards, the Mall, Birdcage Walk and Buckingham Palace, St James's Park provides a welcome escape from the bustle. The views in every direction are iconic - there is food and drink available, great place to chill out.
fabulous walk. this is linked to so many marvellous locations. Excellent in the summer but also lovely in winter
stunning. Plan to spend some time here. It is absolutely beautiful. Plenty of photo opportunities. Also nice chair provided to just lounge and take on the sights.

Walking Tour of London. Took a Walking tour of London that started at St. James Park and even though it was January, I still saw roses blooming, green grass and trees. Very clean and quite lovely to take a stroll, especially in the evening when the gas lamps are lit.

Lovely Royal Park. We had a grand time walking through this park and it was great as all the flowers were in bloom. People from all over the world were there walking about as well as some groups of children from Paris and Amsterdam on field trips. Some people were sitting and enjoying their afternoon on the grass while others were just passing through. You can get fantastic shots of the Eye of London as well as the Palace from this park. It's a great location to walk to the Palace as well as Westminster.

gorgeous park. London has some amazing parks, but this is my favourite. Why? Because it's full of colour, has lots and lots of wildfowl and is a wonderful place to unwind, after a big shop in the west end.

A perfect stop. Set in St James' Park the Cafe is excellent. Although we did not eat there, we have been many times for drinks. Very clean, and good. On observing the menu looked good just wrong time of day for us to eat. However, the hot toddy with amaretto added was excellent!!!

A lovely walk. An amazing walk past houses of parliament, big ben and westminster abbey. Through St James park and up to Buckingham palace. Squirrels everywhere! Lovely to sit and have lunch. Beautiful Place
A Great place to rest.!!!!. When in London do pop in to St James Park a great place to rest in London on a fine day, it must be scene to be enjoyed. Paul and Joan Bennett

Beautiful and Very Clean -- Plenty of Wildlife (surprisingly enough!). We stumbled upon this park by accident on the way to another excursion. We were pleasantly surprised when we found it and thoroughly enjoyed exploring. The park was home to many creatures so we had a great time snapping pictures of various birds/swans/etc. They would literally flock by the pond and just stay there until someone walked by. And I'm not talking about just one or two tiny pigeons. These birds/ducks/what not would come in hordes!!! Very entertaining!!All in all, a must see. There were so many great things about this park. Free lawn chairs to sit on, clean benches, etc.
Well kept. Well kept and peaceful if you are looking to just chill.
Love this park. This is such a beautiful old park, you must visit on your trip to London

Shortcut through wonderland. We walked through the park to get from Buckingham Palace to Churchill War Rooms and what a lovely surprise.
Loved all the animals, ravens squirrels swans ducks but the poor pelicans looked so cold and miserable.
Lovely!. Great location, even in winter. Plenty of wildlife in the centre of the city.
Our Favorite London Park. Great walk from Buckingham Palace to Whitehall, the Houses of Parliament and beyond. Loved the penguins! It's the one place we visit on just about every trip to London.

Lovely place to walk between Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar Sq. One of my favourite places to visit, walk and chillout, or to eat or watch the wild life on the lake take some lovely views of London's hotspots . From Victoria, if you are going to visit Trafalgar Sq and the National Gallery, it is almost as fast to walk it via Buckingham Palace and St James's Park than to get the tube or bus (and good exercise)

Nice Park. If your going from Buckingham Palace to Trafalgar Square or Parliament Square (or the other way around) , enjoy this park for a rest or to look at the squirrels (very friendly) and all the birds by the lake.

Feed squirrels and pelicans...!. This is my long standing, favourite park in London. Not only is it an escape from the hustle and bustle of trafalgar square but its a scenic route to Buckingham Palace where you also have the chance of squirrels running up your legs pinching your snack (this has happened to me several times now) and spotting the magnificent resident pelicans
Pretty wildlife walk. Lovely park - we visited in the snow and it was very pretty.We were suprised by the amount of wildlife too!
A place to reflect. A great place to take a brake from your tour of London.

The most beautiful park in London. St James' Park is my favourite park in London. Its very handy, surrounded by lovely architecture and is full of interest - the lakes, birds, squirrels and fountains make it a place you must visit.

A green space in the West End with class.. Well worth a diversion from Piccadilly shops and Westminst etc . just a short stroll behind Downing Street or across from Green Park tube into a Royal green park in the centre of London. Not huge but elegant and distinctive.
lovely little park. the squirrels running everywhere are lovely, its a nice way to walk up towards the palace too!
Ducks and birds everywhere. This is such a charming walk and offers great views of the city. And there are ducks and swans everywhere, which is really fun. There's a clean toilet as well.

Beautiful. Depending on where you are staying, it is definitely worth a short trip to get to. beautiful... We stayed locally and went for a stroll and it was great way to spend an hour on a sunny day in London!

Pretty but not as busy. One of my favourite parks in London. It is well kept, pretty and tends to attract fewer people than other parks such as Hyde Park. There is a well maintained play area for children and a restaurant/self-service for food.
relaxing paradise. Go and feed the squirrels and have a lovely stroll in a piece of paradise in London - love it my favourite place when i visit
St James' Park. Right at the heart of London, this is somewhere to some and relax after a hard morning's sight-seeing!
An Oasis in the hustle & bustle of the City. London is lovable and loud. St James's Park is the Oasis in the middle of the city with its green and calm environment.
A gem. What a beautiful tranquil location in the heart of the capital. Teeming with wonderful birds and squirrels a plenty!

Not one of London's best parks but worth a trip if you are nearby. I didn't feel as "wowed" as I strolled through here the other day. On the positive side, it's a park in London where you can get away a little bit but I couldn't really lose myself like I have in Hyde Park or Regent's Park.

Beauty in center of london. One of the beautiful parks of the central London.Even i visited in the mids of november its still green. Its across the Buckingham Palace and on the way to horse guards parade.Enjoy the lake and view
Great photos. Nice for a stroll and a picnic. Its abit crowded sometimes, but I love the plants. I got some great pictures in October last year, when it was unseasonably hot in London.
A pleasant stroll. If the weather is good then walking through St James's Park is a good way to walk to Buckingham Palace. There are different kinds of birds and ducks and some very cheeky squirrels.
Beautiful. Lovely park to go visit. You would enjoy it, however Hyde Park near Buckingham Palace is a lot bigger and offers more things to do.
amazing. What a beautiful place to visit anytime but in summer its a delight so big and the birds and sqirrels with plenty of places to stop and have a drink, rest and use the loo.
Beautiful nice for a quiet walk. pretty, green, lovely.. if you like parks you'll like it ;P

One of London's finest green spaces. Who can fail to dislike this park. Its has many things to delight with its floral arrangements, lake and different species of wildlife. The most upsetting thing is to catch a glimpse of a Pelican gulping down a duck or a pigeon but that's nature, isnt it?

Beautiful in all seasons!. I first went in the Summer - it is crowded but so exquisitely beautiful. I took a friend through there in Winter as a more scenic route from Buckingham Palace to get to Houses of Parliament, and, despite the lack of colour in the Winter, it is still gorgeous - and far quieter.

Gorgeous park. Right next to Buckingham Palace, St James's Park makes for a wonderful walk from the palace over to the Horse Guard Building or to Big Ben. There are hundreds of squirrels, ducks and geese in the park and the sunset over the lake is beautiful. One of my favorite parks in London.
So crowded - but great. It was difficult to find a spot to sit down on a very hot summer's day in London But it was great to see everyone enjoying the great outdoors.
Lovely. Take some bread and nuts with you. If you are not scared of squirrels climbing up your leg to get a nut - you will have fun:)
A lovely small park.. St. James's parke gets overlooked but try walking through it in Winter when it's frosty; a delightful amble.

Favorite park during a visit to London!. Spent two afternoon strolling through this park! Swans swimming in the lake, beautiful flowers along winding walkways, a brass band playing at the gazebo - a beautiful memory of my visit to London!
Pelican's and more. One of my favourite London Parks with excellent views of Buckingham Palace and full of flowers in the summer

Beautiful. I love this Park. All kinds of people spending the day or walking through, and it is a great spot to sit and watch and rest before more sight-seeing. I will make it a point to visit every time I'm in London.
Amazing. Till pelicanos you can see there, differents birds species, this park is that one what appears in the movies, you can walk, run jogging...
Beautiful Park. Really nice visit to the park on a lovely crisp day - lovely scenary!

my favorite London park. it's small, the gardens are well kept, with lovely shrubs and flowers and trees which flower with beauitful blossom. I love the view from the little bridge across the water, looking away towards royal horseguards, it's beautiful, and the Inn in the Park offers wine and drinks and lunch too.

A must see park. St James Park is an amazing place with things to see all around. We saw herrons, many squirels and even 3 pelicans. There are great views of buckingham palace and at the opposite and of the park there is horse guards parade which I would recomend a walk through.Tip - take some nuts for the squirels as they are very tame, but mind your fingers!
Very nice park in the middle of London. Great in the summer although sometimes gets a bit too packed.
Nice Park. nice place to take photos and relax after long walk, very close to Buckingham palace.
Walking round St. James's Park. Beatitful weather and lovely walk around this lovely park.
Nice walks, very friendly squirrels!!!. Old fashioned deck chairs to sit in. Nice to sit and people watch.

good, quiet place to rest after hours spent on tourism. That was one of my favourite places in London, when i lived there. Of course its crowdy, but theres always a place to take a sit on a fresh grass and read a book or just relax. Park isnt that big, but its still a good place to go and eat a lunch or so.

London's best kept secret. Londoners favourite park. tucked away hinden from main traffic roads, st james park is a perfect place to unwind if you live in the city. only few minutes walk from the hustle and buzz of victoria station (all the buses and busy shopper... btw this is an up and coming trendy area that has got everything from shops to resto and theatre). There is a nice cafe right at the middle of the park.Resonable price for meal. love the ful english breakfast. But be warned, alcohol drink is the most expensive in london.
Great park. I have been going to this park for many years as went to school locally. went again recentlly and still as good.
Green oasis in the centre.. We had never seen a squirrel before and now they came to eat out of our hands.... we counted over 40! It was like a mini-zoo!

Lovely walk!. St. James Park is a lovely diversion from the busy city. The birds on the water and singing in the trees as you stroll through is the right antidote. The view of the buildings through the trees is lovely as well.
Lucky with the weather for January. Was fine, but a bit grey [NO RAIN]. Will be back for spring flowers sometime.

Disappointing as most of the park is in a poor condition. The over abundance of bird life has led to a considerable deterioration in the quality of the park especially regarding the planted and grass areas. Too many people feeding too many birds can be bad for the environment!

A lovely park in the centre of the West End.. Stretching between Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace is this lovely park with its lake, wildfowl and plants. There are plenty of opportunities to picnic or buy a meal and drinks. The view from every angle is a photographer's delight
Very Pretty!. Part of Princess Diana memorial walk. Your kids can play in William and Harry's playground.
Large Park. very nice space in the middle of lots of buildings

What can be better?. My favourite place (the impression being shared by my wife and son). When in London, I always take a stroll all the way down St.James's Street to this park. I seem to see generations of proud and brave people passing by!

My personal favorite. Quiet and charming across from St James Palace on the way to many London sightseeing musts (War rooms, War Museum, Westminster etc). I love walking through and having breakfast at the restaurant in the park, enjoying the swans, dodging the runners when there are races and using it to go from the St. James area where I often stay to other parts of the city. Prefer it to the larger parks but i think everyone in London prefers the parks that they live near or use daily.It is a wonderful place to take a stroll no matter whom you are spending the day. Beautiful, pristine and not overwhelming.
A pleasant walk in the park. Great for wild birds and a walk away from traffic. Gets you away from the crowds outside Buckingham Palace
Love this park. Near the band room so often see musicians, adding character; small park with views to Buck palace.

Great place to relax!. I'm a regular visitor to this park and every time is enjoyable.especially in the summer!Love watching birds (big variaty including pelicans) or just reading on the bench!highly recommended!
Great green space in London. ... if you like green spaces! Spent half a day in Green Park with family and thousands of other people - and it was superb.

A lovely park in central London.. We took this park in as part of a walk round the sights and it was lovely, so green with ponds and wildlife. Next time we visit, we will be sure to spend more time here to soak up the atmosphere.

Relaxing and gorgeous!. We had such a wonderful time here - there is plenty to wander around and see - especially the wildlife. It is the perfect place to take a picnic and sit down and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. Definitely a place to go!

Gorgeous lake - lots to look at. Very underrated park in London. Have only ever "walked through" but actively divert my route to do so. The light in the evening is fabulous, and the lake at the bottom is just lovely. Loads of birds/squirrels to look at, and I seem to remember seeing pelicans last time...?!
Ignore the tourists. Very busy, but beautiful oasis of calm, with great views and bird life
Beautiful!. Definitely nice to go for a stroll around. Lovely!

Countryside in the heart of the city. What a charming park this is! It is almost like having the countryside in the heart of the city. Lots of grass,flowers (in season), trees and water. With the water come geese, ducks, gulls, terns, moorhens, coots, divers, grebes and many other seabirds and waterfowl. Not to be missed though often quite crowded in summer.

A beautiful park. St James's Park really is a beautiful park with its lake and wildlife (birds), it's a lovely place to spend a few hours. There's a nice cafe/restuarant in there with some tasty snacks and outside tables so that you can enjoy the view. The only downside is the toilet facilties in the park which could be cleaner and better serviced but the rest of the park is a joy to walk through.
A perfect place for a stroll. I love this quiet little park, it's a wonderful spot for a leisurely walk - we go every day when we're in London.
A good walk. A nice sized park for a walk after lunch......usual things and animals
Pretty park. Pretty park in central London with nice place to ear
my favorite park in the world. The views of major London landmarks and the environment in this park are stunning.

Beautiful. When we were there it was autumn, and being from a tropical country, it was interesting to me to see all the different colored leaves, squirrels, crows. There were many children and families in the park that day as we came during term break. It was nice.

Take some monkey nuts and feed the squirrels. This is for me the prettiest park in London - good for a stroll, nice stop for a coffee - close to Buckingham Palace and away from the bustle! Lots of tame squirrels so a good photo opportunity!

A beautiful park. This park is usually more quiet and sedate than other London parks and what better way to spend a sunny afternoon than in a deck chair with an ice cream overlooking Buck Palace and the iconic view of London which includes the London Eye.
Birthday afternoon celebration. Walked in park as light was going on 29th December. Children enjoyed running about, grown ups talking and walking. Free entertainment and exercise!
Such a great park. i loved everything about this, close to the palace,
St James' Park. More than a year living in London and this is my favorite park!
beaautiful !!!. so pleasant to walk thru on the way to Buckingham palace... lovely little patches of flowers and swathes of green.. the lake side is awesome.
One of the best.. Another wonderful London park, they are all marvellous.

Tranquil calm in the city. Took my children roller skating in this park on weekends. It has a lovely lake with lots of birds. There is a very good playground near Buckingham palace with a sandpit. The children's toilets have a supervisor so only parents can enter with the kids. There are various refreshment stalls around the park. Nice for a cup of tea or ice cream, but they are not the cheapest.

awesome park!. we were there on sunday and there were lots of people walking around with family etc enjoying the park. The best thing was the squarrel who didn't afraid of human, I even fed one! super cute!

Elegant Relaxation. A Haven for Wildlife...right in the middle of London!! The sights in this park are amazing. It is not possible to count the many different shades of green. The paths are wide and easy to walk on, a beautiful place for a picnic lunch.

When visiting Buckingham Palace don't miss it. When visiting Buckingham Palace don't miss a stroll in st. Jame's Park. It's small in comparision with Hyde Park or Regent's Park, but is pleasant and worthy a visit on a sunny day. Take a time for a lunch at the "Inn The Park", just close to the Horse Guards Parade.
Squirrel!. Kids loved the squirrels, sad but true. We saw the chaging of the Guard almost by accident. PCs were very helpful

in the summer... there are chairs to be borrowed for almost 1 pound and you can seat and relax. great green calm and quiet perfect for a walk to buckingham palace and to go to st james palace or to see the park itself that is amazing.

Fantastic.. Fantastic. Large park right in the centre of busy London and you wouldn't know it! The wildlife is all over the place; squirrels and birds and ducks. Squirrels were being hand fed by people, lovely sight to see. Well maintained, litter free and views of Buckingham Palace. Ideal place to go for a break form hustle and bustle of city. Perfect for anyone of any age as it is flat and spacious to get around.

Prettiest park in central London. Everybody loves this park when the first visit it. Very quaint green oasis in Central London. Lovely landscaped lake full of exotic birds with cafe located right next to it. Right next to Buckingham Palace and Trafalgar square.
beautiful. It was so lovely. Didn't expect it to be so nice beautiful flower beds. you could sit there all day.

Best park in central London. Hey! Pink pelicans 5 minutes from Picadilly? Floral arrangements are beautiful and walking around the lake the place feels an oasis of calm right in the center of the city. If I had to recommend one short visit to a park, this would be the one

By Far my Favourite London spot. This park is like a haven in the centre of the city. Within a stones throw of many sites including Westminister Abbey, Buckingham Palace, Picadilly circus and much more, it is a wonderful spot to waste some time sitting on the grass, watching the world go by. I love to go there with a book and a picnic. Heaven on a sunny day!
Family vacation. Beautiful and a place to relax and stroll by Queens home
Squirrel Attack. Lovely park, had a nice wander thru, kids loved the squirrels
Lovely Grounds. Lovely grounds near to Buckingham Palace. There is a lovely cafetria inside the ground for food and drinks

One of the most romantic parks in the world. Nothing beats a stroll - day or night - through St James Park. The wildlife, the friendly squirrels, the lakes, the duck cottage, Princess Diana's Walk - all amazing - with views through the trees of Big Ben, The London Eye and many other London sights. It is also so peaceful and tranquil - always make a point to take at least one leisurely stroll through st james, no matter the weather, on every trip to London.

A great walking link. If you are walking between The Palace of Westminster and Buckingham Palace this is the only wayy to go.You'll be surprised at the diversity of our feathery friends that reside in the City!

Amazing natural beauty ... and free!. While in London we visited St.James park - a very beautiful park near Buckingham Palace, Clarence House and the Army Barracks. This is a beautiful natural setting with gorgeous trees and flowers. There are lovely foot bridges with water fowl just below for you to enjoy. It's a great place to relax, stroll, take in some fresh air and take photos.

A place to relax and spend a few hours.. The park is peaceful and an oasis in a busy city. Surrounded by lovely architecture and with royal connections St James Park is worth a wander through just for the atmmosphere.

St James Park is beautiful. When you have had enough city life, retire to St. James Park and relax. If you are lucky, while you are there you will here and see the Royal Horse Guards on horseback as they travel on the Mall ( a street) beside the park from Admiralty Arch to Buckingham Palace which is just next door!
Lovely Xmas Day stroll. with no transit running on Xmas Day, a leisurely stroll through this park was lovely, even the weather co-operated. Princess Diana Memorial Walk undergoing renovations.
Another place to spend the entire day!. What a beautiful place for a picnic, a lovely walk through it. Unfortunately we were there in the Fall so the lake was under repair

Peace & Tranquility. We loved this park which leads up to Buckingham Palace. We loved the streams and ponds filled with ducks and swans and the chipmunks are just divine, we don't have them in Australia, we have possums. The park is very clean and lots of people walking and enjoying their lunch from the offices around. Great ice creams are sold which are not expensive and yummy. Well done London!

Beautiful setting in busy London. The little cottage that used to be lived in by the park keeper always inspires my imagination. What a wonderful place if you could live there now! The exotic water birds are fantastic to watch and if you walk past on a frosty morning they all look so cosy tucked in under their wings to protect from the cold. All in all, maybe not worth a special visit but certainly worth a slight detour to your route to make sure you pass through - ideal for getting to Whitehall, Houses of Parliament, Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace etc etc.
Plenty of feathered animals. If you are in London with kids, they will love seeing the wide variety of ducks, swans and other birds around the park.

Nice stroll in park. The park is located between Buckingham Palace and Parliament and the UK Government building. Th epark is well maintained. There are lots of birds in the ponds and the ponds are fenced to protected the many birds from the visitors. It was a very nice walk from the government complex to Buckingham palace. It would have ben better is the it wasn't so cold (we visited in Dec!)
Lovely walk. Went for a walk here on New years morning. We had just flown in from ireland to see the Lion King.Fantastic views of historic buildings. No traffic - which was great.

Beautiful royal park. I love St James' park and make of point of meeting friends there at least once every summer for a picnic. The bandstand entertainment is always great, food is expensive but tasty (as you'd expect from any of the food stands of the sort in central London), the toilets are clean and the park litter is kept under control making it a beautiful place to spend a warm afternoon.The only down side is the lack of places o seek refuge if you're caught in downpour, but that's most parks for you.

Amazing place with lot of yellow daffodils. It is one of the best parks I visited. One of the most romantic place in London. It was march and yet we saw a lot of yellow daffodils all over the park. spend some good time there. a well tendered oxygen bank in the centre of London. A must see place in London
Simply Beautiful. It was so beautiful. Very groomed. Birds and squirrels and wildlife everywhere. The trees were so huge.....just beautiful
Lovely for an afternoon stroll. It's a nice place to walk through in spring or summer to take you away from some of the London crowds. It's busy but more peaceful.
great to go for a stroll or run. one of the best parks in london , had a great picnic with friends in the park and you might see the prime minister running pass with his escourts

LOVELY!!!. Well worth a walk around, plenty to see.
Very clean and pleasent. Well looked after.

One my favourite spots in London. It is close to Trafalgar Square and it is a haven from the traffic and crowds in Central London. You can also walk through the park until you reach Buckingham Palace. I always go to this park when I want to sit to relax or read a book
Peace & quite in the heart of London. There are some renovation works going on. Otherwise, it's your normal quiet and calm strolling park
A nice walk to the palace. A nice route to walk fro Horse Guards to the palace
St. James's Park. Lovely park for walking, people watching, and some bird watching.
Cutest Park in London. It´s a cute park indeed. One of the Royal Parks in London, very near the Buckinham Palace, and a lovely place to go on a sunny day.

Chilly Walk. Despite it being a beautiful sunny London Saturday, by the time I was walking back through the park, a distinct chill was in the air and as I hurried back to my hotel, I wasn't able to fully appreciate the park as much as I'd like

Look out for the Pelicans. I use St. James Park regularly where I sometimes sit and have lunch. Geese will often come up to me hoping that they will get some of my leftovers. It is a great place to see the resident Pelicans and Herons can also be seen.The park can get very busy but is worth a visit as it is surrounded by some of London's best sights including Horseguards Parade, Buckingham Palace, Birdcage Walk and a short walk from Westminster Abbey.This is one of London's best parks and definately worth a visit.
Amazing park!!!. Love everything about it, amazing park to walk, sit and read a book! The lake, the trees, everything is so nice!

london's most romantic park. One of Londons most romantic parks. It'a a real joy and only a short walk from Picadilly or Trafalgar square. The restaurant beside the lake is great way to dine at lunch and take in the views

Amazing green place with lots of animals. Amazing how a green place like this with all kinds of animals, even squirrels(!), can exist in the centre of a city like London! We really enjoyed a walk in this park.

Pleasant Stroll. A warm autumn day a lazy stroll through the park, a seat on a bench people watching with my wife, taking in the lakes with their over fed wildlife, the birds the people pushing prams, couples holding hands talking as they go, older couples sitting eating sandwiches and flasks of tea. Buck house behind you The Mall to your left Horse Guards at the end, this is England in a nutshell (well the capital English city). I'm from Sussex, some may say Gods own county he may only have walk across those rolling green fields in Kent just to get to Sussex!
Expansive, Nice. The first haunt for us....expansive and endowed. It was autumn so it was a riot of colours. Great walk through the park!

London has great green spaces. The ability to walk out of hotels and walk into parks and gardens like St James Park was an early morning ritual.The gardens are minucured and well tendered. Trees are old and significant Carbon Banks. Congratulations to London Planners for revamping the great green spaces around the city and keeping old spectacular trees. I remember Jubilee celebrations in the 70S AND RECALL thinking the city was tired and run down. The Park is now re born.

Great for a run or walk with your pup. St James' park is not far from my work and it's always lovely to go for a walk especially in the summer. I've also taken my dog for a walk there a few times. He enjoys it so much.
Well maintained. Beautiful park that is so well maintained. A great variety of birds and squirrels that will take food from your hand

Lovely Christmas Day walk. My family and I joined a large number of other families to walk around St. James's Park on a seasonable Christmas Day. It was quite pleasant and we enjoyed walking through a well-tended park in the middle of the city.

The most beautiful park in London. I absolutley love St James's Park. I have visited it many times over the years and love the views, the squiriels and the pelicans. More recently I have gone there with my young son and he loves also loves the play area. Would strongly recommend that all visitors to London take some time out to visit, relax and enjoy this green oasis in the centre of London.
Lovely park. Lovely park with a lake. Nice way to walk from Trafalgar Square to the palace.

Well Worth It. I always enjoy this park when visiting London...it is easily accessible and a really lovely place to be....there are some concessions stands for a nibble and drink...many benches to rest an enjoy the scenery as well as a children's playground. For me the best part is the wildlife....ducks and geese and squirrels and birds abound....you can feed and enjoy them...so much fun!!! There is a lake and the bridge there gives you a great view of near by Buckingham Palace.....this is a great spot to slow down and relax during a trip to London.
My favorite place in London. This is why we go to London. The most beautiful park, and if you are patient, squirrels will eat out of your hands.

Great :). Amazing how it is so unpolluted right in the middle of the city.
Loooved the squirrels too *.*
Great natural park. Lots of animals and wildlife with a great view from the middle of the park bridge. Go see!
Best Royal Park. Smaller than other Royal Parks but has a large lake and flower beds. Good walk from Westminister to Trafalgar Square. A good cafe with outside covered terrace

Green lung - very busy in season. Strategically placed for visitors and office workers to enjoy, it is a remarkably separate place considering London is all around it. I/we like the bridge over the lake as part of a longer north-south walking route between Westminster and Green Park (tubes: walking between St James's station to Green Park station). Equally easily you can slip into it from the back of Whitehall, Trafalgar Square or at the other end, from Buckingham Palace and Victoria station areas. Summertime band concerts are worth seeking out. The in-park catering is less to write home about in my opinion but then everyone buys sandwiches/picnics from the shops that line Victoria St to the south or Trafalgar Sq areas to the north. Enjoy the bird life. Don't expect a park bench seat between 12-2 in the summer!
Quiet respite from Picadilly. The park is only open during certain hours, but it is a really quiet and peacful place to sit and watch the birds and flowers.
great for strolling. Great views between Buckingham Palace and Big Ben. Great bird sanctuary. The giant Pelican followed us for awhile. Great little cafe for breakfast or a light lunch.
Lovely Park!. I loved this park! It's full with adorable squirrels. You can cross the park to get to the Buckingham Palace and the walk is just perfect, with a beatiful sightseeing of the lake.

London's sweetest park. I love strolling through St James's. It's a lovely little park, with the obvious highlight of Buckingham Palace lurking at one end. But there's plenty more to cherish about it too -- it has a very good restaurant, Inn The Park, a gorgeous lake, and a huge variety of birds. But my favourite thing about coming here is feeding the squirrels. If you're a tourist, and come from a place where squirrels are not common, do yourself a favour and take a small bag of nuts along -- the squirrels will come right up to you and take the nuts from your hands. A magical experience!!
A beautiful Royal Park in the heart of London. One of London's fabulous Royal Parks. Just perfect for a jog or a nice walk in the heart of the city.

average. good but nothing so special to report. If you are in the area and fancy a place that will not disappoint you, go for it, if you are looking for the wow factor then think twice... sometimes staff is great and sometimes is boring, I notice a kind of turnover on that respect, that also mean I've been there a few time... would go back do, is a nice place after all...
Lots of wildlife. If you like squirells and lovely ducks you have come to the right place! A haven in the midst of the busy town.
Quite spot away from the crowds. The title says it all,wild life running free,well lots of squrills really,good for a photo.
Serene in the winter. St. James's Park is always a favourite spot and a walk through it on a crispy winter's day is soothing balm for the soul!
Very Pleasant. One of the more attractive Royal Parks, very plaesant to stroll around at any time of year.

A Fairy Tale Vision. This is my family's favorite park in the whole world. We have been taking them since youngsters. Now in their thirties,it's the first stop on our trip! Stroll through the fascinating park of beautiful foliage and remarkable selections of birds,ducks and swans. There is a small stand where you can pick up a cup of hot chocolate in the winter months. The piece de resistent is the sight of Buckingham Palace at the end of your journey.

A nice pause in ever busy London. Less crowded with tourists, although we were tourists too we were a bit fed up with crowds and queues and this turned out to be a very relaxing stroll. Very nice park.
Gorgeous. What a lovely stroll from our hotel to Buckingham Palace through St. James Park. You must spend some time taking in the surroundings here. Great place for little ones to burn off energy!

Nice park. We cut through the park while heading to Westminster Abbey after the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace. The Park was clean and had many floral areas that added visual interest during our walk.
To the zoo. On a sunny day certainly the best way to reach the London Zoo!
Lovely London park. This park is lovely and relaxing and beautuful and central

So Beautiful. St. James Park was one of my most favourite places in London. In spring especially it is so beautiful and peaceful. It is a place to escape the business that is London, and a great place to people watch.
Nice park. It is a very nice park with lots of squirrels and ducks walking beside you .Make sure you take some nuts with you for the squirrels

What a park. In the Summertime it is nice to relax and have your lunch with you from the nearby Pret a Manger on Piccadilly and enyou the flora and fauna of this lovely Park when you watch it all from a bench enyoing your Tuna sandwich
Beautiful!. I love London´s parks, and this one is just as great as most of them. Perfect for a walk on the sun, for a pic-nic or just to rest on the grass.
love the parks especially spring and Autumn. Peaceful, clean and lots of wildlife right in the middle of the Met !

Great park right in the center of London.. What a beautiful and pleasant park! I think it's amazing to have such a park in the center of a big citie like London. Much vegetation and a pond. Many birds and some squirrels.

Small green heaven, inhabited by many different birds. This small park is situated in a rather central part of the city, but it is so peaceful. We went there in late afternoon and although it was getting dark, hundreds of birds were around. It was quiet and enjoyable - spare some time to pass through it and enjoy the bird-warden cottage and the variety of species.I recommend a dawn-time visit - should be really romantic!
Lovely Park. Walking through this park I understood the connection between this and the beautiful Public Garden in Boston, MA
good place. walk through and enjoy lot to take in and signposted

Feels like a small neighborhood park. Beautiful flowers and landscaping. In the heart of london but feels like your in a small neighborhood park. The lake attracts plenty of interesting fowl for watching.

A right Royal Park. This is an elegant and interesting aprk. It is easy to access whilst visiting Central London and gives an oasis if calm in the middle of a city. You will find there is always something or someone of interest to watch as you while away some time on one of many of the park's benches.
Lovely location, very enjoyable.. Lovely walks and close to watch the changing of the guards on horesguards parade. Nice and relaxing, especially on a sunny day.
It's a park!. Not a great deal to say. See the wildlife. Walk through the park to get to Buckingham Palace on a more scenic route.
All London Parks are great. And St. James's Park is great for the birds you can watch there. I love pelicans seen there.
It was mind blowing for my daughter as this was her first UK visit. The good atmosphere and the place was spotless clean at time of visit, courtesy of the people/travellers.

Such a green oasis in the midst of the city. Loved the tranquility of the Park, although so close to the roads and traffic.enjoyed the opportunity of seeing the Horse Guards parade through the park - excellent!

Stunning park, beautiful vistas, and SQUIRRELS!. A little-known fact: there are NO squirrels in Australia. None. Zero. Zilch. So when my 17-year-old daughter discovered friendly squirrels she was beside herself with excitement. After ensuring there were no rabies-carrying-squirrels in the UK, she was thrilled. Thankfully, I was able to enjoy the beautiful parklands, swans, Duck-keepers Cottage, and gardens from a comfy bench which she squealed and took photos. We must have spent two hours wandering the park, crossing bridges, stumbling into movies scenes (The Sweeney re-make: that's why that park bench was free - d'oh - the movie people were very nice and polite; we were apologetic), and sitting in the beautiful autumn sunshine. A glorious park to visit in autumn.
Good resting point. In the centre of the city, minutes away from Sherlock Holmes's House, a fine park with a classic atmosphere.

Pleasant route from Buckingham Place to Horse Guards Parade. Apart from being a beautiful park in the centre of London it was great to see all the squirrels hunting for nuts. They are so tame they actually climbed up my trousers to see if I had some food for them.
Bring some bread. You'll want to bring some food to share with the overly friendly squirrels. They come right up to you. Beautiful setting near Buckingham Palace, and a great place for a walk.

A magical park. This is the most beautiful, magical park. Squirrels come right up to you to eat out of your hands and the birds have the loveliest faces. It is so calming and peaceful to just sit and enjoy this little bit of nature nestled so discreetly within London.

A great way to while way the day and eat your lunch. When we were recently there, as we rented an apartment, we frequented St James Park to eat our lunch and relax for awhile. As London is a walker's world (even with the great Tube), it is excellent to have a quiet spot within which to rest a spell.

great to wander around any time of year unlesws you dont like tourists. This park is a marvel of colour and wildlife no matter waht time of year and there are always tourists. It great to walk around in your lunchbreak, walking around the lakes seeing the different wildfowl and also the antics of the squirrels who are so tame they actually climb up onto you if you have their favourite monkey nuts, its fun sweeing them hunting in the flower beds for their stash. large cafe and also smaller kiosks dotted around. Horseguards at one end, BuckHouse at the other, or just sit back and relax.
Feed the squirrels in the park with almonds. Bring almonds to feet the squirrels in the park, they come real close and eat from your hand
Pecked by pelicans. Small but perfectly formed! Beautiful flower beds. If you're lucky you can be pecked by enormous pelicans on the bridge!
Lovely park!. Lovely park to walk through on the way to Buckingham palace. Stop to see the swans and squirrels throughout.
Lovely park to visit.. Loved the flowers and greenery everywhere. So tranquil and relaxing.

A tranquil oasis of calm in the big city. I love visiting the park for the wildlife. There's birds and squirrels. Everybody comes here from young families to busy professionals passing through. It's a welcome refuge from the busyness outside.
Beautiful. A beautiful place to relax, maybe after seeing the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace. It has beautiful flowers and shrubbery, and is definitely worth a walk around.
Respite in the middle of London. Very peaceful atmosphere. Nice place to bring a bag lunch.
This native's favoutite. A Londoner born and bred this is my favoutite London park. Surrounded by beautiful buildings and historic monuments it provides an oasis of calm just off the tourist trail.

Great Place for a Picnic!. I love to walk through St Jame's Park with a picnic. If it's not raining, it's wonderful to sit on a bench and enjoy the birds and the ponds and watch all the different people that happen by . . . like the man with "Monty" the Python!
A pleasant respite in busy London. Quintessential English park -- perfect for a stroll or as a walk through destination for other places.
Beautiful Park with a view of Buckingham Palace. This is one of the prettiest places in London lots of flowers and squirrels and a great photo of the palace!
A very pleasant stroll in teh centre of town. A small but beautiful garden in the centre, to rest from the hustle of the city. Full of squirrels , ducks, geese, pelicans...fun to feed them!

Beautiful all year round. St James Park is wonderful. A lovely peaceful escape from the city. In the spring it's covered in flowers. In the autumn the changing colour of the leaves is beautful. Picturesque lake and fountain. Nice views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge. One of the lovliest places in London.
queens park. lovely place to walk and sit in. watch the wild life, eg ducks, swans and squirrels

Beautiful park and so many bird species. We were in London in November when it should have been cool and rainy, instead it was sunny and warm. There are hundeds of different bird species in St. James Park and there are signs along the pathways describing them and giving information about their care. People in London love and respect their parks and make good use of them in nice weather. The parks are immaculate.

A great spot. St James's park is an amazing outdoor attraction - great for London visitors and Londoners themselves. It makes a really great stop (or a picnic spot) on a walk between the Houses of Parliament and Buckingham Palace. The lake is very pretty with ducks dotted around on it and the little bridge across the lake is one of the most scenic spots - you can look at either Horse Guard Parade building or the Buckingham Palace. The Duck Island cottage is also worth a look - it's resembles those cute gingerbread houses.
Parklife. When the weather is good the park is a lovely place to wander and also to spend thime peopla watching and generally relaxing.
Always relaxed regardless of many tourists. Beautiful lake, perfect for photographic experiment anytime of the year. There should be more soft drinks kiosks in the park.

Wonderful St James's Park. Quiet amongst the hustle and bustle of London is St James's Park, a place to relax after a day of sight seeing in central London. St James's, so convenient for Buckingham Palace and Wellington Barracks where you can watch the guard mounting for the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace.

Nice place to take a break from the hustle and bustle. Nice Park just off city centre. Lots of squirrels running about. Lots to see all around the perimiter of the Park eg. Buckingham Palace and Churchill Museum.
Good place to start your tour of London.

The best view in London.... ...in my view! I used to have to get to work at about 7am and crossing the small bridge in the centre of St James Park at 6.30am on a spring morning was an amazing way to cheer myself up - ever since then it's been my favourite view in London. One side you have Buckingham Palace and on the other you can see the Wheel peering above the Cabinet War roomsGorgeous park plus the bar/restaurant in the centre is quite nice also if a bit touristy!
greenery respite. nice park between Royal residences, Parliament, and Westminster Abbey. Ducks, geese, swans, pigeons, squirrels.

Lovely. This park is so peaceful and yet situated right in the centre of London. I use it as a refuge when I have enough of the busy city and relax simply wandering around the park. Even in the summer when the rest of London can be too much to bear the park with its lake offers a place to breathe freely again.
Beautiful and romantic. beautiful park , very romantic.Lots of squirrels!
Great walk. Nice walk through London, rent a lawnchair and crash for awhile. A great way to go between Buckingham and Westminster (Big Ben etc.) Lots of interesting ducks.

A good place for a walk. Of the four royal parks in central London, St James's Park offers the most interest per square metre. The views of Buckingham Palace, the Mall and the National Liberal Club are lovely.The lake is a joy to walk around and the cafe is a good place to stop and watch the world go by.

Tranquillity in Westminster. St James's Park is lovely to relax in away from the hustle and bustle of Westminster. The flower beds which are planted with annuals and changed regularly are beautiful, the perennial gardens are unusual and the pelicans are a suprise. The inn in the park is also quite good.
Well Maintained. Nice relaxing place in central London which offers a retreat from the mad shopping frenzy.
Grandchildren. Close to the hotel and a pleasant walk rthrough horseguards and onto Buckingham palace
The beautiful swans of the Queen. St. James's Park, as many other parks in London, is amazing. I saw many squirels, swans and ducks. It seems an oasis of peace.
A Walk in the Park. St James' Park - my favourite park in London. Glorious.

Nicely maintained park. We used the park as our walk to other attractions from our hotel. We were there at sunset one evening with the sun setting over Buckingham Palace. The gardens are well kept. Historic buildings all around.
A haven in the heart of London. OK, it is usually pretty crowded, but there is a beautiful duck pond and lots of stunning flower beds.
Little and fabulous park in the middle of London Centre. Too small, too precious, fabulous in spring and very noise in summer.
Brilliant. Great walk through St james park being entertained by the seemily hundreds of very friendly squirrels. Great photo opportunities!

nice :]. it's a very nice place both for families and single visitors. Lovely birds walking around (pelicans), nice pond with ducks... You may have a glass of wine or...coke on the grass and simply relax...
Often Missed Treasure. Worth a visit just to see the water fowl, particularly the pelicans and black swan
Beautiful. Despite the rain this park was lovely. Lots of greenery and wildlife and free toilets too!
autumn sunshine. lovely relaxed walk between B. Palace and Westminster
lovely walk!. Autumn leaves, wide footpaths, trees, peace in the heart of london.
favourite park n London. This a lovely park right by Buckingham Palace the wildlife and ducks are great !!

Classic and Graceful.. St. Jame's Park is my all time favorite park in London. When I sit there I can imagine nattily dressed men and women promenading down the shady paths while enjoying the lovely views.

Top place to visit in London. It's not possible to describe what a delight this park is. It has everything you would expect from English park: birds, squirrels, beautiful trees and overabundance of people. I will keep my walks with my daughter in a treasure trove of my memory! She was delighted with the whole thing and when a squirrel jumped on her lap she told me it was a highlight of her holiday. If your kid(s) like animals then it's a must!
A warm November weekend. Even though we visited London in mid-Nov, it felt very autumunal. With the leaves just beging to fall and many birds not quite flown. Beautiful as always.
A beautiful day out. A great place to make a stop, have a quick lunch, and admire one of London's beautiful parks

Gotta love the squirrels!. I love St. James Park!! It's so nice, just to sit there on the grass, reading, having a snack, or just relax.My favorite part though, is the animals! It's lovely to just watch them go by. And the squirrels!!! They,re so cute!! They are shameless little things that climb up your legs just to check for food! My favorite spot in London, hands down!

A classic park, great walk to Buckingham Palace. Lovely to stroll in this park. Some great flowers and plants, very pretty. Lots of cheeky squirrels running up your leg after food. Good facilities. Best on a clear daywith no rain. A good leadup to the Mall and Buckingham Palace before continuing into Green Park and the original Hard Rock Cafe on the otherside
Chilled time, enjoyable. really enjoyed chilling out at and in this location, very good.
A walk in a park. Peaceful, lots of wildlife, great cup of coffee and refreshments
Superb location. I love going to the theatre. We did find the restaurant to be very busy and decided to eat at a local eatery
Benches and birds. Great place to find a bench and just sit while on your way to Buckingham Palace. The waterfowl are quite entertaining. Some concessions if you want to have picnic snacks.
Beautiful!. We must have strolled through this park a dozen times! Situated in front of Buckingham Palace, it is centrally located near other sites as well.

It's a park full of tourists, better going somewhere else. St. James's Park is a beautiful park, good for picnics with friends, but not for relaxing or reading a book. It's full of tourists, everyday. Better going to bigger parks not so close to Buckingham Palace, such as: Regent's park or the astonishing Hampstead heat.

Amazing colours. The Autumn leaves were beatiful and being outside with such little noise felt like we were in the middle of nowhere. Even better was the changing of the guard that greeted us when we arrived at Buckingham Palace!

St. James Park is Gorgeous.. We toured St. James Park on foot during our visit in late August 2011. The grounds are meticulously kept, the flowering plants are spectacular and the vast array of water foul provide quite a show. All in all, these gardens provide a day's worth of photo opts and leisurely strolls. I really like the idea of having a lot of comfortable beach chairs placed around the grassy areas so that people can come and enjoy the day. It's a very peaceful and beautiful setting.
Peaceful park. A clean peaceful park with plenty walks on offer. Surrounding the park and nearby is Buckingham Palace and Hyde park to the rear also.
Nice walk in the park. Liked the serenity and a photo opportunity if you are into squirrels
fantastic. clean, well taken care of, you can feed the ducks, geese, swans and squirrels!! Make sure you buy a loaf of bread and some peanuts and bring your camera!!!

Lovely park, lovely squirrel. The park is very lovely. It is quite, natural and beautiful. There are many animals walking around, and the squirrel are the most lovely one. If you want to play with them, buy a bag of peanuts at supermarket before going to the park. They love peanuts very much and will climb on you to for it !

Beautiful park near Buckingham Palace.. This gorgeous park has amazing views of Buckingham Palace from the bridge. They also have some exotic birds plus the usual UK ducks, geese and swans. This park has the friendliest squirrels too!
An Autumn stroll. It was overcast but pleasantly warm. The squirrels and ducks put on a good show and the autumnal trees looked lovely.
Beautiful Park. A very nice walk around the lake is gorgeous! There are only bathrooms for children near here and there was an open food stand than was well priced and very good.

Cool!. Nice place to hangout post lunch. Near oxford street this bful park has lush green grasslands and trees sheltering bful birds...and the peace just mins away from the noisy streets...shouldn't miss this. You should never miss enjoying the silent beauty of london...- that is its parks!

A joy any time of the year. We frequently visit this park when we travel to London as its an easy walk from Victoria Coach Station to central London e.g. The Royal Academy and the National Gallery. Every season has its pluses and it always looks beautiful. There are places to eat or just have a coffee and its a perfect oasis to soak up the beauty in the middle of a generally traffic ladened city.Though not enormous it is definitely my favourite London park.
Great little bit of Greenery.. Good way to approach Buckingham Palace. Loved the birds and the extra friendly squirrels.
Calm. Excellent park in close proximity to The hotel.. Hard to believe you are in a busy city whilst walking in the park
Great outdoors. Lovely to walk through on way to Buckingham Palace!

Lovely...Tranquil. What a serene place to be!! I didn't realize i was in London while strolling through here. Its a superb park, very close to Buckimgham palace & Churchill war rooms. In fact, you get very nice views of the palace & the London eye from some spots.The views from 'The Blue Bridge' were fabulous, the pelicans are a major attraction in the park.Don't miss the Horseguard's parade nearby, get a view of the Royal London. Luckily there was a bright sunshine when I went so it was a marvellous day out...
Peaceful. A lovely walk. So peaceful. It certainly clears your mind especially if you are on holiday to get away from it all and forget home problems for a few days.
Must visit. Great place to feed the squirrels and and enjoy the sun
Here comes the guard!. St. James Park is bordered by the the two roads used during the changing of the guard, the Mall and Birdcage!

Fantastic. This restaurant has a self service cafe and an al a carte restaurant nestled inside. We ate in the restaurant part on a Sunday and had the best roast dinner we had ever had!! Even though you are within the self service cafe, it didn't feel like it at all. All food and drink was organic and it showed - delicious. The portions were generous and we were pleased we hadn't had a starter!
lovely in the summer. a peaceful getaway from the city - lovely gardens and play areas for the kids, close to Buckingham palace

Love this park. This is my favourite park in London. I prefer it to Hyde Park which I find too large. St James Park is pretty and cosy and friendly. I could easily spend a Sunday morning sittng on a bench in this park enjoying a good book. It is a very safe park for a woman alone.

Pretty, peaceful park.. Cant believe youre in the middle of london we sat in deck chairs and watched the wildlife for an hour before returning to the hustle and bustle of central London. Well worth a visit.

Wow - this was my favorite park in London. I was so impressed by all of the parks... but this was my favorite. Even in early November, there was so much to see with the gardens, interesting trees, water, etc. The pictures that include other London sites are just spectacular with the fall foliage
The weather made th walk so enjoyable. Beautiful park and wonderful days to walk around it.

Beautiful and manageable. This an oasis among the historic London sights. You can fit it in with Buckingham Palace, Horse Guards Parade, The Mall, Government Buildings, Victoria, New Scotland Yard, Westminster Parliament.It is particularly beautiful in Spring/Summer, but always of interest. There is a Parks Police department.In Summer weekdays many office workers use it to lunch/sunbathe. It is truly the best park in Central London!!
Just bliss.... The memory of an autumnal stroll on a beautiful morning through St. Jame's Park, watching people hand feeding the squirrels, will stay with me forever.

Nice place to relax or to stroll by en route to Buckingham. A nice place to stroll around and relax after admiring the Westminster area (Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, London Eye) before walking towards Buckingham Palace. It's really airy and have a lot of old trees and many small animals such as ducks, geese, and occasional squirrels - very nice sight and really lovely just to walk or sit by the ponds.

Centre of the Universe. Every time I come to London I visit St James Park. This time extra pleasureable as I had my eight year old French grandaughter with me. The Squirrels and birdlife gave lots of pleasure. The park is beautiful as it is not too large to cover,
Excellent park. Good walk around with a nice atmosphere, large area, clean and squirrels as well as other animals running around.
Walking through the leaves. It always amazes me that amid the total Chaos of London traffic, Parks such as this exist, where the traffic is reduced to a bad dream
Just beautiful. A lovely place to have a picnic or enjoy a coffee. If you lucky you may get a lovely day as we did and just sit and relax
Nice place. We had a picnic lunch there and was relaxing to eat with squirrels, pigeons and other birds playig around us

Quintessential London park. I never tire of visiting this park. No matter what the season there is always something to admire and gaze upon. It is kept beautifully and the setting surrounded by some of London's most iconic architecture makes it a special place to stroll and sit. I thank our forefathers for leaving such an inheritance.
beautiful walk. Don't plan on eating while at the park....but it would be great to find a place to site and eat
Park. A very nice and clean park. you see so many different people from all around the world, just walking around the park
Beautiful park next to Buckingham Palace. Great place for walking, very beautiful. Close to Buckingham Palace. A must-see
An afternoon's walk. Good place to relax and enjoy the view... lots of birds..
Autumn at its best. The colours were spectacular, there were deck chairs to hire, hundreds of squirrels that were very friendly, lovely lakes with wildlife,and we saw pelicans, a great space.

Friendly people & squirrels. Squirrels ate right out of your hand, a lovely place to walk around or relax with a picnic, or a flask and sandwiches on a bench on a old day. A lovely lake, many stalls selling hot/cold drinks, free entrane to toilets
Amazing park. Like all the parks in London, this one is just amazing. It's being taken care of 24/7 and it's... Just amazing

Autumn spectacle. The gardens are beautifully maintained and areas dug and ready for the next shock of colourful plants. Even though it was a showery day- this did not spoil the walk through the gardens to the palace and we enjoyed the changing leaf colours.

Small but nice: lots of bird species. Perfect for hornitologist, around the lake there are species descriptions and instead of walking the Mall (the main road from trafalgar arch to Buckingham palace) St.James is a good alternative.. for the squirrels, head to hyde park instead of Regent Park
Lovely place for lunch with squirrels. Lovely park, an oasis in the centre of London, sunshine and squirrels, lake was very pretty well worth a stroll
So relaxing. Take a walk through the park on route to Buckingham Palace, tranquil, spacious and it feels a million miles away from the Capital
lots of wildlife. really enjoyed all the wildlife there didnt know there were so many different birds and it was lovely and clean
beautiful. lovely park for the kids, lovely play area and squirels everywere, in lovely surroundings, take the kids.
Nice chill time. Really nice couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle.
Great to walk through with the little ones - a nice bit of tranquility. Great feeding the geese though be careful as they can get aggressive
