picnic. beautiful day, so a lovely spot to enjoy an autumn picnic
lovely on a dry day. Great park.Peaceful andnext to the Mall which is closed to traffic on a Sunday.Bliss!!
Beautiful. Smaller than the others...but beautifull! Don´t miss it.

Peace in the City. Beautiful park with amazing trees and lake, lots of squrrels. We walked through on the way to Buckingham Palace, stopped for a picnic lunch in the sunshine and a £1.60 ice-cream - bargain! Deck chairs were available for £1.50 per hour. Felt very calm & safe on a Sunday.
You can't beat the parks in London. Don't miss them in spring/summer/fall or when the snow flies :)
excellent. the park is absolutley wonderful so peaceful, so close to the palace it is such a dreamy place to visit plenty of trees, flowers and benches for a long rest after the long walks
Good walk. Nice walk with pretty gardens in central London, connecting Buckingham Palace with Trafalger square. T
A Beautiful park. The was stunning alot of greenery around lovely lakes but too many birds for my liking

It seems like this is the location they use for Paradise in films.... The place is amazing, especially if you get there in a sunny day, like we did.
take a nice walk, sit on a bench, eat a sandwich and enjoy the good life.
You'll forget you're in the middle of the city...
Great walk. We walked down Queen's Walk from Piccadilly to Buckingham Palace - passed the Canadian War Memorial.
Lungs of London. Wow....so clean and beautiful....makes you forget you are in a city
Autumn Glory. Fantastic autumn colours. A lovely stroll in the heart of the city. Flat and suitable for families and wheelchairs

Always a nice stroll. The park offers a variety of views and venues and is set between Horseguards Parade and Buckingham Palace. It is a great place for a long, quiet walk, alone or with someone and it is a wonderful place to sit and enjoy the beauty of the park and gardens.

Great for a walk, picnic, or just relaxing. There are a great deal of waterfowl and birds here. If you are an animal lover, its a must see place. They have mute swans, the occasional black swan, a large variety of birds including owls to see, if you're lucky, herons, and cranes. The lake is large and scenic. The park is enormous. At a leisurely pace, how you should enjoy this park, it takes about 2 hours to walk around the entirety of the lake and park. Take my advice: take some time to grab some food from a Tesco, take your significant other or your kids here after a long day of walking before, and just take a few hours to take it in. You and your feet will thank me later.
Such a peaceful park to take a stroll. My boyfriend and I very much enjoyed walking through this park!

What a park should look like. St James, Green Park and Kensington, the 3 interconnected parks in London, are the example of what parks should look like, neat, perfect, full of flowers and shrubs in bloom, a dream come true. Squirrels, ducks and swans wander happily along the lakeside and try to lure visitors to feed them, don't, please. Deck chairs are ready for you but at a price.

Gorgeous Park in the Centre of London. St James's Park is right in the heart of London, being right next to Buckingham Palace. Its a gorgeous park to visit, wonderful to wander through and take your time to relax and take it all in, rather than being stuck in all the crowds and general busy nature of London. There's plenty of wildlife to look at, and if you're lucky, you may even be able to feed or pat one of the many squirrels hopping around.A great place to visit, relax and take it all in.

So Beautiful. I could kick myself for not taking a camera with me the day I visited this beauitful park. Now when I tell friends how much it looked like something out of a dream they just have to take my word for it! Hopefully, I gave some of them the incentive to visit St James's and see it for themselves. The lush colors, the geese and pelicans, the gorgeous flowers, the cheeky (and chubby) squirrels who aren't shy at all about coming up to implore you for snacks....maybe it really is something you need to see for yourself to truly appreciate. In that I was a first-time visitor to London from Los Angeles, I can assure you we don't have anything like St James's Park in my city! Loved it...
Enjoyable. Beautiful park to walk around and enjoy the gardens. It's quite big and worth the time taken to wander around.

Oasis of relax in the middle of a busy town. This is absolutely my favourite park of all I've visited. Every time I am in London, I go there to catch a moment of relax, to watch birds and squirrels. I love it in spring, with all the daffodils anf trees in bloom, but it is nice alson in other seasons. In London, which is a town pulsing with energy, this is a real oasis, offering a moment of quiet and relax.

One of the Best Parks in the World!. St. James Park is one of the best city parks I have seen. It is like its right out of a magazine. Perfect central location, with plenty of places to sit an enjoy the area.There is a resturant in the park, as well as public toliets.Likely you will walk by the park on the way to one of the many London attractions, so take the time to walk through it and enjoy a great park!
you will love it. i loved it, especially the squirrels. i could stay there for hours just to take a picture with them.they were coming at you just to feed them

Bring nuts, bread and camera!. Walked in to this beautiful park on our way to the Westminster area. I was going crazy when I saw all the squirrels!!!! They are soooo cute!!! I went to the park later with nuts and bread for the birds LOL... I just wanted to experience feeding wild squirrels and they RAN to me, they went crazy the moment i start packing up the nuts.. LOL. Best moment for me.. I cant help it, im an animal lover! Remember follow the rules, don't overfeed the animals! And respect the nature, dont go over the fence on the water side. good TIP : take the bus or underground to Green Park or Buckingham Palace, then walk from the palace in to St. James Park, walk across the park and you are in City of Westminster where u can experience Big Ben and over the bridge; London Eye! That is a little walk of 20 min or so and a lot of sights!!!!
Loved the squirrels!!!. If you stand still long enough the squirrels will run up your leg - my 10 yr old loved it !!Very peaceful walking around and very clean - thoroughly enjoyed

Smaller, more manageable, and lovely park!. Surrounded by Buckingham Palace, The Mall, Birdcage Walk, and Horse Guards Road, St. James's Park is easily accessible by bus or subway. It's just too lovely to miss!
Outstanding. What a park, so clean and soooo big. Kids loved it lots of different birds to see, squirrels that eat out of your hand. Very impressed

Great. It's so nice and peaceful. Everything is green and so well maintained. If you are lucky to go there on a sunny day, you will feel terrific:relaxed, free and stress free. And there is a cafe with delicious desserts.
Beautiful place for a stroll. We spent a couple of hours just admiring the beauty.

Wonderful, Beautiful, Relaxing Park. St. James Park is a beautiful park situated just east of Buckingham Palace. It's a nice park for people watching, feeding the ducks, and watching people get amazingly close to the park squirrels. I didn't like the fact that London had put out sling chairs for the summer but they were for rent and a park employee comes by to make sure you've paid or else you have to get off the chairs. We didn't have our lunch with us so our hunger drove us to eat at the INN at the PARK outdoor grill area. We had their burger and though it was good, it wasn't really worth the price. Better to pick up your lunch at PRET A MANGER quick sandwich shop and bring it with you to the park for an impromptu picnic. Kids would love this park because they can be free to run around in all the green space. My 4 teenage girls loved it because we just relaxed after having traveled in to London from Paris that morning.
Amazing. Good day out make sure you wearing comfy footwear!!

Small but stunning park near the palace. It's a small park but has everything in it... shops, secluded spaces, waterside pathways, bridge over the stream and of course the view of the london eye... must visit for a picnic or just for relaxing... just exit the st james park tube exit and start walking into the park :)

Picturesque Park on The Mall. For anyone visiting London and intending to replicate the route taken during the Royal Wedding or anyone simply visiting Buckingham Palace, St. James Park lies along The Mall (the road that connects Piccadilly with Buckingham Palace). The Park is small but picturesque in nature and houses a host of wildlife including pelicans and squirrels. A lot of the wildlife is extremely friendly and the park is a great place to stop to enjoy a stroll or a sandwich or just to admire the flowers and the wildlife.

A really pretty park in London. St. James park is a lovely diversion when walking about the city. When you see clips in a movie of a London park this (aside from Hyde Park) is what you expect...the pond with the willows hanging down, green plants, vibrant flowers, and right at the doorsteps of Buckingham Palace. Locals and visitors alike are all around this park which lends to a really comfortable atmosphere.

Bring nuts for squirrels!. Lovely park and a great way to move from Big Ben/Westminster Abbey to Buckinham palace. Nice walk with several different kind of birds. And there are lots of squirrels that will eat from your hand! Some of them are so brave they will come and sit in you lap if you sit on the ground and offer them nuts.

So central and yet so removed.. Terrific park; easy to navigate; stunning views across lakes to Buckingham Palace and the towers of Whitehall and yet this is basically slap bang in the middle of London. Safe, walkable, flat, open, trees, nature, water. I can see why the Queen lives where she does, she gets to to open "one's curtains" and look out onto this every day. Nice to walk in the morning from Buckingham Palace through the park towards Whitehall, but remember to turn around every now and then to get the views back to the palace. the views towards the buildings on Whitehall (The Household Cavalry) are maybe even more stunning, which is why I would rather go this direction.Easy to access from the main Victoria station. Bit crazy when the Changing of the Guards is on at Buckingham Palace. But note there is the less visited Changing of the Guards at the Cavalry too; Horse Guards Parade.Worth going if this is your 1st visit or your 100th visit.
my favorite park!. I love St. Jame's Park it is right in the middle of everything yet still manages to be a beautiful relaxing place to spend an afternoon.

Just "wow"..so much nature in the most crowded area of London. Westminster Abbey, The Houses of Parliament, Downing Street, Household Cavalry, Buckingham Palace..all are "within walking distance" to this park.It is incredible just how good the park looks and how many animals and plants live there.I saw there are people actually playing with the squirrels, not only feeding them.If you ever get to visit any of the touristic attractions listed above..take a break at the Swiss Cottage's corner: that place might be the best landscape you've ever seen.
pretty. Was shocked to see so much wildlife right in the middle of london but it was so pretty ! Definitely a lovely place for a stroll

nice tour. had a great time at st.james park - cant remember her name (was it ann) - hope another review mentions her name - but she was brillant...very very funny indeed..more than happy to help with the photographs...showed us everything st. james park had to offer...had a great time (especially to hear the comments on sunderland :))

Lovely park full of water fowl. After the crowds of Trafalgar Square and Buckingham Palace walk through this lovely park between these two places for a change of scene. The big pond in the middle is full of water fowl of varied species, even a pelican. Take some bread with you, and nuts for the squirrels. Kids love it. They placed plenty of beach chairs in the middle of the park, free of use, so you can also rest or picnic there.

St. James's Park --Flora and Fauna Abound. I loved St. James Park so much that I went twice during my visit, and had time permitted I would have gone again. Not only is the park beautiful, but I had an experience there which reinforced to me the kindness and welcoming of Londoners. The park is simply spectacular with so much to see, and comfy benches to sit while relaxing or nice tracks for walking. One can see wildlife, flowers, and even views of The London Eye and Buckingham Palace. Even though it was raining, the beauty was majestic. The lake was partially frozen, and the birds were walking on the water --we called them "Jesus Birds" :=) On the second visit, the weather was wonderful--no rain! After walking the park again, we headed out over the bridge, and there was a local gentleman feeding the squirrels. I commented on it and took some photos, and the lovely man heard me. He motioned to me then smiled and pulled me over, handed me some peanuts and showed me how to feed the squirrels and the birds! I was a bit scared (silly, I know) so I said "nooo it's OK" but he wasn't having any of that. :=)I took the peanuts and decided to get over my fear of wild squirrels, lol. I was so nervous that I dropped the nuts, but he reassured me that they wouldn't bite me, and sure enough they didn't. They nibbled from my hands and one even "tapped" me on the leg as if to say "hey, I want some, too!" They weren't pestering at all; they knew just when to back off and were so adorable. It was easy to see that the gentleman was a frequent visitor, and had quite a rapport with the squirrels and birds. It was an amazing experience and I'll never forget his kindness. To me, it just added to the beauty of the park -- wilderness and nature in the middle of a city.

St. James Park-Loved it!. St. James Park was the ultimate city oasis! My London friend and I parked ourselves amongst the daffodils and green, green grass for an afternoon of wine tasting and picniciing. I spent hours relaxing on a blanket and watching the world go by, literally! People from every culture, country, walk of life, etc. visit this park, which in my opinion, is extremely cool! I am not a lay back and chill traveler. I like the flow of a busy city and I like to be on the move...however, once I entered this place, I instantly switched over to 'chill mode.' It was an unforgettable experience. And I personally reccommend taking a whole day, with a picnic basket.....it was well worth it!

St James Park. Have traveled to many parks around the world and this is one of the most beautiful. It is centrally located in London, with views of Buckingham Palace and many other sites. There are many types of wildlife located throughout the park. There are also many different types of flower displays throughout the park. Definitely a must see.

Like nowhere in the world.... I have travelled quite a lot and there is NO park as the ones in London, especially the st james one. I love my spring walks there, feeding the squirrels. I sometime miss it when I m abroad...The english garden, with no fence, and green landscapes is definitly the best

St James PARK. I'm off to London for two days this weekend, and no doubt about It , I will be visiting St James park. For the past 3 years, my husband and I have had a weekend in London in November, and each time Sunday morning is like this - Underground to Westminster, walk up to St James Park, walk through by the ponds, see the ducks, swans, squirrels, grab a hot chocolate and people watch. Got to stop for pictures on the bridge, London Eye in one direction, Buckingham Palace in the other. Finish your walk by ending up at Buckingham Palace for photos. Going back there this weekend....will we be there for a walk on Sunday...off course!!!!

Love the squirrels. St James' Park is a beautiful place. I work just around the corner from it and although the tame squirrels freak some people out, I think they're just lovely.
The park is well maintained and there is whole variety of birds that come and fish in the lake.
Well worth a visit if you come to London.

What a beautiful place - especially in Springtime.. Just returned from a trip to London where I spent much time in this lovely park. It is very central to Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square, Big Ben and others. I have been here so many times before but I forgot how beautiful this park becomes in the springtime. All the Cherry trees are in bloom and the place is awash with colour. I always feel safe wandering around too as it is usually very busy with people and all of it is fairly open plan. All the birds and ducks are out and about and this place really has something for everyone. I got great photographs and have now got some extra great memories too.

Beautiful in spring. I work very near to this park and recommend that any visitor to London should put this on their itinery. The main features are a lake which has a large collection of ducks and geese and others birds including pelicans. During spring and summer the flower beds are absolutely stunning with large swathes of colour. The parks also has a cafe where you can but food and drink or there are a number of smaller vendors which sell snacks. As I am a resident I have not used either of these facilities so I cannot help advice on price or quality. The parks is very near Buckingham Palace which means at lunch times you can also get to see the changing of the guards which normaly march past the park along The Mall.And finally, there are the squirrels. If you have a tasty nut and a bit of patience they will feed from your hand.

A classic. On my many visits to London, I've always enjoyed St James Park. A lovely place to have a strole any time of the year, with its British trees, statues and lake, it's definately London's best park and great place for views of Westminster and Buckingham Palace. A classic British setting.
